hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ שְׁבוּעוֹת – שְׁתַּיִם שֶׁהֵן אַרְבַּע.
human_translation: oaths two that are four
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "Shavuot - two that are four."

hebrew_text: יְדִיעוֹת הַטּוּמְאָה – שְׁתַּיִם שֶׁהֵן אַרְבַּע.
human_translation: awareness of the defiling two that are four.
llm_translation: Knowledge of impurity - two that are four.

hebrew_text: יְצִיאוֹת הַשַּׁבָּת – שְׁתַּיִם שֶׁהֵן אַרְבַּע.
human_translation: carrying out on Shabbat, two that are four.
llm_translation: Exits of the Sabbath - two that are four.

hebrew_text: מַרְאוֹת נְגָעִים – שְׁנַיִם שֶׁהֵן אַרְבָּעָה.
human_translation: shades of marks two that are four.
llm_translation: Sights of afflictions - two that are four.

hebrew_text: אֶת שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ יְדִיעָה בַּתְּחִלָּה וִידִיעָה בַּסּוֹף וְהֶעְלֵם בֵּינָתַיִם – הֲרֵי זֶה בְּעוֹלֶה וְיוֹרֵד.
human_translation: in which had awareness, at the beginning, and awareness at the end, but a lapse of awareness in between, this to a sliding-scale
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "et sheyesh bah yedi'ah bat'chilah viyedi'ah basof veha'elem beinataim – harei zeh be'oleh veyored." English translation: "that which has knowledge at the beginning and knowledge at the end and concealment in between – this is in ascent and descent."

hebrew_text: יֵשׁ בָּהּ יְדִיעָה בַּתְּחִלָּה וְאֵין בָּהּ יְדִיעָה בַּסּוֹף – שָׂעִיר הַנַּעֲשֶׂה בִּפְנִים וְיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים תּוֹלֶה, עַד שֶׁיִּוָּדַע לוֹ וְיָבִיא בְּעוֹלֶה וְיוֹרֵד.
human_translation: in which had awareness at the beginning, and had no awareness at the end, goat whose performed inside and Yom Kippur suspend until he becomes aware and he brings a sliding-scale
llm_translation: There is in it knowledge at the beginning and there is no knowledge in the end - the goat that is designated for the inner altar and the Day of Atonement depends, until it is known to him and he brings it as a burnt offering and descends.

hebrew_text: אֵין בָּהּ יְדִיעָה בַּתְּחִלָּה אֲבָל יֵשׁ בָּהּ יְדִיעָה בַּסּוֹף – שָׂעִיר הַנַּעֲשֶׂה בַּחוּץ וְיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים מְכַפֵּר. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מִלְּבַד חַטַּאת הַכִּפּוּרִים״ – עַל מַה שֶּׁזֶּה מְכַפֵּר, זֶה מְכַפֵּר; מַה הַפְּנִימִי אֵין מְכַפֵּר אֶלָּא עַל דָּבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ יְדִיעָה, אַף הַחִיצוֹן אֵין מְכַפֵּר אֶלָּא עַל דָּבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ יְדִיעָה.
human_translation: did not have awareness at the beginning but had awareness at the end, goat whose performed outside and Yom Kippur atone, as it is stated aside from the sin-offering of the atonements” for that which this atones, that atones. Just as the internal atones only for a case in which there was awareness so too, the external atones only for a case in which there was awareness
llm_translation: There is no knowledge in it at the beginning, but there is knowledge in it at the end - the goat that is done outside and Yom Kippur atones. As it is stated: "Besides the sin offering of atonement" - for what this atones, this atones; just as the inner altar atones only for something that has knowledge in it, so too the outer altar atones only for something that has knowledge in it.

hebrew_text: וְעַל שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ יְדִיעָה לֹא בַּתְּחִלָּה וְלֹא בַּסּוֹף – שְׂעִירֵי הָרְגָלִים וּשְׂעִירֵי רָאשֵׁי חֳדָשִׁים מְכַפְּרִין, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: שְׂעִירֵי הָרְגָלִים מְכַפְּרִין, אֲבָל לֹא שְׂעִירֵי רָאשֵׁי חֳדָשִׁים. וְעַל מַה שְּׂעִירֵי רָאשֵׁי חֳדָשִׁים מְכַפְּרִין?
human_translation: And for which did not have awareness, neither at the beginning nor at the end, goats of the Festivals and goats of New Moons atone. the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Shimon says: goats of the Festivals atone but goats of New Moons not. But for what do goats of New Moons atone?
llm_translation: And on that which does not have knowledge neither at the beginning nor at the end - the goats of the festivals and the goats of the new moons atone, the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Shimon says: the goats of the festivals atone, but not the goats of the new moons. And for what do the goats of the new moons atone?

hebrew_text: עַל הַטָּהוֹר שֶׁאָכַל אֶת הַטָּמֵא.
human_translation: for a ritually pure who partook of ritually impure
llm_translation: Regarding the pure one who ate the impure.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: כָּל הַשְׂעִירִין כַּפָּרָתָן שָׁוָה, עַל טוּמְאַת מִקְדָּשׁ וְקָדָשָׁיו.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir says: all the goats their atonement, is the same; for defiling of Temple or its sacrificial
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir says: all the he-goats their atonement is equal, for the impurity of the sanctuary and its holy things.

hebrew_text: הָיָה רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: שְׂעִירֵי רָאשֵׁי חֳדָשִׁים מְכַפְּרִים עַל הַטָּהוֹר שֶׁאָכַל אֶת הַטָּמֵא, וְשֶׁל רְגָלִים מְכַפְּרִין עַל שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ יְדִיעָה לֹא בַּתְּחִלָּה וְלֹא בַּסּוֹף, וְשֶׁל יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים מְכַפֵּר עַל שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ יְדִיעָה בַּתְּחִלָּה אֲבָל יֵשׁ בָּהּ יְדִיעָה בַּסּוֹף.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon would say, goats of New Moons atone for a ritually pure who partook of ritually impure And of Festivals atone for in which did not have awareness, neither at the beginning nor at the end, and of Yom Kippur atone for in which did not have awareness at the beginning but did have awareness at the end.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rabbi Shimon says: The goats of Rosh Chodesh atone for the pure one who ate the impure, and the goats of the festivals atone for one who had no knowledge neither at the beginning nor at the end, and the goat of Yom Kippur atones for one who had no knowledge at the beginning but had knowledge at the end.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ: מַהוּ שֶׁיִּקְרְבוּ זֶה בָּזֶה? אָמַר לָהֶן: יִקְרְבוּ. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: הוֹאִיל וְאֵין כַּפָּרָתָן שָׁוָה, הֵיאַךְ קְרֵבִין זֶה בְּזֶה? אָמַר לָהֶם: כּוּלָּן בָּאִין לְכַפֵּר עַל טוּמְאַת מִקְדָּשׁ וְקָדָשָׁיו.
human_translation: said to him: What is whether may be sacrificed, this in that said to them: They may be sacrificed. They said to him: Since, their atonement is not the same, how could they be sacrificed, this in that said to them: all of them come to atone for defiling of Temple or its sacrificial
llm_translation: They said to him: "Why should they come close to each other?" He said to them: "Let them come close." They said to him: "Since their atonements are not equal, how can they come close to each other?" He said to them: "All of them come to atone for the impurity of the Sanctuary and its holy things."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר מִשְּׁמוֹ: שְׂעִירֵי רָאשֵׁי חֳדָשִׁים – מְכַפְּרִין עַל הַטָּהוֹר שֶׁאָכַל אֶת הַטָּמֵא. מוֹסִיף עֲלֵיהֶן שֶׁל רְגָלִים – שֶׁמְּכַפְּרִין עַל טָהוֹר שֶׁאָכַל אֶת הַטָּמֵא, וְעַל שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ יְדִיעָה לֹא בַּתְּחִלָּה וְלֹא בַּסּוֹף.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda says in the name of goats of New Moons atone for a ritually pure who partook of ritually impure of Festivals exceed them, as they atone for a pure who partook of impure and for in which did not have awareness, neither at the beginning nor at the end.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda says in his name: "The sin offerings of the heads of the months - they atone for the pure one who ate from the impure one. Adding to them the sin offerings of the festivals - they atone for the pure one who ate from the impure one, and for one in which there is no knowledge, neither at the beginning nor at the end."

hebrew_text: מוֹסִיף עֲלֵיהֶן שֶׁל יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים – שֶׁהֵן מְכַפְּרִין עַל הַטָּהוֹר שֶׁאָכַל אֶת הַטָּמֵא, וְעַל שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ יְדִיעָה לֹא בַּתְּחִלָּה וְלֹא בַּסּוֹף, וְעַל שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ יְדִיעָה בַּתְּחִלָּה אֲבָל יֵשׁ בָּהּ יְדִיעָה בַּסּוֹף.
human_translation: of Yom Kippur exceed them, as they atone for a ritually pure who partook of ritually impure and for in which did not have awareness, neither at the beginning nor at the end; and for in which did not have awareness at the beginning but did have awareness at the end.
llm_translation: He adds to them of Yom Kippur - that they atone for the pure one who ate the impure, and for one that has no knowledge neither at the beginning nor at the end, and for one that has no knowledge at the beginning but has knowledge at the end.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ: מַהוּ שֶׁיִּקְרְבוּ זֶה בָּזֶה? אָמַר לָהֶם: הֵן. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אִם כֵּן, יִהְיוּ שֶׁל יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים קְרֵבִין בְּרָאשֵׁי חֳדָשִׁים; אֲבָל הֵיאַךְ שֶׁל רָאשֵׁי חֳדָשִׁים קְרֵבִין בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים – לְכַפֵּר כַּפָּרָה שֶׁאֵינָהּ שֶׁלָּהּ? אָמַר לָהֶם: כּוּלָּן בָּאִין לְכַפֵּר עַל טוּמְאַת מִקְדָּשׁ וְקָדָשָׁיו.
human_translation: said to him: What is whether may be sacrificed, this in that said to them: Yes, They said to him: If so, of Yom Kippur may be sacrificed on New Moons, but how could of New Moons be sacrificed on Yom Kippur to effect atonement that which they were not for? said to them: all of them come to atone for defiling of Temple or its sacrificial
llm_translation: They said to him: Why should these offerings be brought close to each other? He said to them: Yes. They said to him: If so, let the offerings of Yom Kippur be brought at the beginning of the months; but how can the offerings of the beginning of the months be brought on Yom Kippur – to atone for a sin that is not its own? He said to them: All of them come to atone for the impurity of the Sanctuary and its holy items.

hebrew_text: וְעַל זְדוֹן טוּמְאַת מִקְדָּשׁ וְקָדָשָׁיו – שָׂעִיר הַנַּעֲשֶׂה בִּפְנִים וְיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים מְכַפְּרִין.
human_translation: And for intentional defiling of Temple or its sacrificial goat whose performed inside and Yom Kippur atone.
llm_translation: And on intentional impurity of the sanctuary and its holy things - the goat that is made inside and the Day of Atonement atones.

hebrew_text: עַל שְׁאָר עֲבֵירוֹת שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה; הַקַּלּוֹת וְהַחֲמוּרוֹת, הַזְּדוֹנוֹת וְהַשְּׁגָגוֹת, הוֹדַע וְלֹא הוֹדַע, עֲשֵׂה וְלֹא תַעֲשֶׂה, כָּרֵיתוֹת וּמִיתוֹת בֵּית דִּין – שָׂעִיר הַמִּשְׁתַּלֵּחַ מְכַפֵּר.
human_translation: For other transgressions that are in the Torah, the minor or the major intentional or unwitting, one became aware or did not become aware a positive mitzva or a prohibition, excision from the World-to-Come [ karet ] or court death penalties, scapegoat atones.
llm_translation: Regarding the rest of the transgressions in the Torah; the light ones and the severe ones, the intentional and the unintentional, those known and those not known, actions and prohibitions, excisions and court-imposed deaths - the scapegoat atones.

hebrew_text: אֶחָד יִשְׂרְאֵלִים וְאֶחָד כֹּהֲנִים וְאֶחָד כֹּהֵן מָשׁוּחַ. מָה בֵּין יִשְׂרְאֵלִים לְכֹהֲנִים וּלְכֹהֵן מָשׁוּחַ? אֶלָּא שֶׁהַפָּר מְכַפֵּר עַל הַכֹּהֲנִים – עַל טוּמְאַת מִקְדָּשׁ וְקָדָשָׁיו.
human_translation: Israelites and priests and anointed priest, What between Israelites, priests, and anointed priest? only that the priests achieve atonement for defiling of Temple or its sacrificial the bull
llm_translation: One Israelite and one Kohen and one anointed Kohen. What is the difference between Israelites, Kohanim, and anointed Kohen? Rather, the bull atones for the Kohanim - for the impurity of the sanctuary and its holiness.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁדַּם הַשָּׂעִיר הַנַּעֲשֶׂה בִּפְנִים מְכַפֵּר עַל יִשְׂרָאֵל, כָּךְ דַּם הַפָּר מְכַפֵּר עַל הַכֹּהֲנִים; כְּשֵׁם שֶׁוִּידּוּיוֹ שֶׁל שָׂעִיר הַמִּשְׁתַּלֵּחַ מְכַפֵּר עַל יִשְׂרָאֵל, כָּךְ וִידּוּיוֹ שֶׁל פָּר מְכַפֵּר עַל הַכֹּהֲנִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: just as blood of the goat, whose performed inside atones for Israelites, so blood of the bull atones for the priests. just as confession over the scapegoat atones for Israelites, so confession over bull atones for the priests.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: Just as the blood of the goat that is done inside atones for the Israelites, so too the blood of the cow atones for the priests; just as the confession of the goat that is sent away atones for the Israelites, so too the confession of the cow atones for the priests.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מִכְּדֵי תַּנָּא מִמַּכּוֹת סָלֵיק, מַאי שְׁנָא דְּתָנֵי שְׁבוּעוֹת? מִשּׁוּם דְּתָנֵי: חַיָּיב עַל הָרֹאשׁ שְׁתַּיִם – אַחַת מִיכָּן וְאַחַת מִיכָּן,
human_translation: Now, the tanna is leaving Makkot , What is distinctive that he teaches Shevuot due to that he teaches For head liable two One from here, and one from there,
llm_translation: Gemara: From where does the Tanna derive that one ascends from blows? What is the difference that he teaches oaths? Because he teaches: "He is liable for two on the head - one from here and one from here."

hebrew_text: וְעַל הַזָּקָן שְׁתַּיִם מִיכָּן וּשְׁתַּיִם מִיכָּן וְאַחַת מִלְּמַטָּה;
human_translation: And for the beard two from here, and two from there, and one from below.
llm_translation: And on the elder, two from here and two from here, and one from below.

hebrew_text: חֲדָא דְּמִיחַיַּיב עֲלַהּ תַּרְתֵּי; תָּנֵא שְׁבוּעוֹת שְׁתַּיִם שֶׁהֵן אַרְבַּע.
human_translation: one for which one is liable two taught oaths two that are four
llm_translation: One that is liable for two; a Tanna taught: two oaths, which are four.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא הָכָא דְּתָנֵי לְהוּ לְכוּלְּהוּ, וּמַאי שְׁנָא גַּבֵּי יְצִיאוֹת שַׁבָּת וּמַרְאוֹת נְגָעִים, דְּלָא קָתָנֵי לְהוּ לְכוּלְּהוּ?
human_translation: What is different here, that teaches all and what is different with regard to carrying out on Shabbat, and And shades of marks, where does not teach all of them,
llm_translation: What is different here that it teaches for all of them, and what is different regarding the laws of Shabbat departures and sightings of afflictions, that it does not teach for all of them?

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: שָׁבוּעוֹת וִידִיעוֹת הַטּוּמְאָה דְּגַבֵּי הֲדָדֵי כְּתִיבָן, וְדָמְיָין אַהֲדָדֵי בְּקׇרְבַּן עוֹלֶה וְיוֹרֵד – תָּנֵי לְהוּ גַּבֵּי הֲדָדֵי; וְאַיְּידֵי דִּתְנָא תַּרְתֵּי – תְּנָא כּוּלְּהוּ.
human_translation: say oaths and awareness of the defiling are written together and they are similar to each other to a sliding-scale offering, taught them together And once it taught two taught all of them.
llm_translation: They said: Oaths and knowledge of impurity regarding the Hadadeans are written, and the Hadadeans are likened to the offering that ascends and descends - it was taught to them regarding the Hadadeans; and since it was taught by two, all of them were taught.

hebrew_text: פְּתַח בִּשְׁבוּעוֹת, וּמְפָרֵשׁ יְדִיעוֹת הַטּוּמְאָה! אַיְּידֵי דְּזוּטְרָן מִילַּיְיהוּ, פָּסֵיק שָׁרֵי לְהוּ; וַהֲדַר תָּנֵי שְׁבוּעוֹת דִּנְפִישָׁן מִילַּיְיהוּ.
human_translation: opens with oaths, but explain awareness of the defiling Since cases are few, addressed directly dispensed with them, and then teach oaths, which have numerous details.
llm_translation: He began with oaths, and he explains the laws of impurity! Through the words of the Sages, he concluded the matter; and then he taught the laws of oaths, which are more stringent.

hebrew_text: שְׁבוּעוֹת שְׁתַּיִם שֶׁהֵן אַרְבַּע: שְׁתַּיִם – ״שֶׁאוֹכַל״ וְ״שֶׁלֹּא אוֹכַל״; שֶׁהֵן אַרְבַּע – ״אָכַלְתִּי״ וְ״שֶׁלֹּא אָכַלְתִּי״.
human_translation: oaths two that are four two I will eat, and I will not eat. are four I ate, and I did not eat.
llm_translation: Oaths two that they are four: two - "that he ate" and "that he did not eat"; they are four - "I ate" and "I did not eat".

hebrew_text: יְדִיעוֹת הַטּוּמְאָה שְׁתַּיִם שֶׁהֵן אַרְבַּע: שְׁתַּיִם – יְדִיעַת טוּמְאַת קֹדֶשׁ וִידִיעַת טוּמְאַת מִקְדָּשׁ; שֶׁהֵן אַרְבַּע – קֹדֶשׁ וּמִקְדָּשׁ.
human_translation: awareness of the defiling two that are four. two awareness of ritually impure sacrificial and awareness ritually impure Temple. are four sacrificial or Temple.
llm_translation: Knowledge of impurity is two, which are four: two - knowledge of impurity of holy and knowledge of impurity of sanctuary; which are four - holy and sanctuary.

hebrew_text: יְצִיאוֹת שַׁבָּת שְׁתַּיִם שֶׁהֵן אַרְבַּע: שְׁתַּיִם – הוֹצָאָה דְעָנִי וְהוֹצָאָה דְּבַעַל הַבַּיִת; שֶׁהֵן אַרְבַּע – הַכְנָסָה דְעָנִי וְהַכְנָסָה דְּבַעַל הַבַּיִת.
human_translation: carrying out on Shabbat, two that are four. two carrying out by a poor person and carrying out by a homeowner are four bringing in by a poor person and bringing in by a homeowner
llm_translation: Exits of Shabbat two that they are four: two - carrying of the poor and carrying of the homeowner; that they are four - bringing in of the poor and bringing in of the homeowner.

hebrew_text: מַרְאוֹת נְגָעִים שְׁנַיִם שֶׁהֵן אַרְבָּעָה: שְׁנַיִם – שְׂאֵת וּבַהֶרֶת; שֶׁהֵן אַרְבָּעָה – שְׂאֵת וְתוֹלַדְתָּהּ, בַּהֶרֶת וְתוֹלַדְתָּהּ.
human_translation: shades of marks, two that are four. two a wool-white mark [ se’et ] and a snow-white mark [ baheret ]. are four a se’et and its secondary a baheret and its secondary
llm_translation: Sights of afflictions two that they are four: two - rising and scab; that they are four - rising and its offspring, scab and its offspring.

hebrew_text: מַנִּי מַתְנִיתִין? לֹא רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל וְלָא רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא! אִי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל – הָאָמַר: אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא עַל הֶעָתִיד לָבוֹא. אִי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא – הָאָמַר: עַל הֶעְלֵם טוּמְאָה הוּא חַיָּיב, וְאֵינוֹ חַיָּיב עַל הֶעְלֵם מִקְדָּשׁ.
human_translation: Whose the mishna? neither Rabbi Yishmael nor Rabbi Akiva. If Rabbi Yishmael, doesn’t he say One is liable only for the future, if Rabbi Akiva, doesn’t he say: For a lapse of awareness of ritually impure is liable but is not liable for a lapse of awareness of Temple?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Who is the Tanna of the Mishnah? Not Rabbi Yishmael and not Rabbi Akiva! If Rabbi Yishmael - who said: One is only liable for what is destined to come. If Rabbi Akiva - who said: One is liable for concealed impurity, but not liable for concealed sanctity.

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל – מֵהֶן לְחִיּוּב וּמֵהֶן לִפְטוּר. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא – מֵהֶן לְחִיּוּב וּמֵהֶן לִפְטוּר.
human_translation: If you wish, say Rabbi Yishmael, if you wish, say Rabbi Akiva. If you wish, say Rabbi Yishmael, among them for liability and among them for exemption And if you wish, say Rabbi Akiva, among them for liability and among them for exemption
llm_translation: If you will say it was taught by Rabbi Yishmael, if you will say it was taught by Rabbi Akiva. If you will say it was taught by Rabbi Yishmael - some are liable and some are exempt. And if you will say it was taught by Rabbi Akiva - some are liable and some are exempt.

hebrew_text: לִפְטוּר?!
human_translation: for exemption
llm_translation: To exempt?!

hebrew_text: הָא דּוּמְיָא דְּמַרְאוֹת נְגָעִים קָתָנֵי – מָה הָתָם כּוּלְּהוּ לְחִיּוּבָא, אַף הָכָא נָמֵי כּוּלְּהוּ לְחִיּוּבָא!
human_translation: But teaches similar to shades of marks, just as there, all of them for liability so too here, all of them for liability
llm_translation: This that is similar to the appearance of negaim is taught - just as there, all for obligation, so too here, all for obligation!

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל; וְכִי לָא מְחַיֵּיב רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל לְשֶׁעָבַר – קׇרְבָּן; אֲבָל מַלְקוֹת חַיּוֹבֵי מְחַיֵּיב.
human_translation: Actually, Rabbi Yishmael. And while Rabbi Yishmael does not deem one liable for pertaining to the past, an offering; but he does deem one liable lashes.
llm_translation: Always Rabbi Yishmael; and is not Rabbi Yishmael liable for the past - offering; but lashes, those liable he is liable.

hebrew_text: וְכִדְרָבָא – דְּאָמַר רָבָא: בְּפֵירוּשׁ רִיבְּתָה תּוֹרָה שְׁבוּעַת שֶׁקֶר דּוּמְיָא דִּשְׁבוּעַת שָׁוְא; מָה שָׁוְא לְשֶׁעָבַר, אַף שֶׁקֶר נָמֵי לְשֶׁעָבַר.
human_translation: And in accordance with of Rava, as Rava says: The Torah explicitly amplifies a false oath similar to an oath taken in vain, just as vain pertains to the past so too, a false pertains to the past
llm_translation: "And like Rava - for Rava said: In the explanation of the Torah, a false oath is similar to a vain oath; just as a vain oath is for the past, so too a false oath is also for the past."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא ״אָכַלְתִּי״ וְ״לֹא אָכַלְתִּי״ – כִּדְרָבָא; ״שֶׁלֹּא אוֹכַל״ וְאָכַל נָמֵי – לָאו שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה הוּא; אֶלָּא ״אוֹכַל״ וְלֹא אָכַל – אַמַּאי? לָאו שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה הוּא!
human_translation: Granted I ate, or I did not eat, in accordance with of Rava. also I will not eat, and he ate is a prohibition that involves an action, But I will eat, and he did not eat, why is a prohibition that does not involve an action.
llm_translation: In truth, "I ate" and "I did not eat" - like Rava; "that he does not eat" and he eats also - it is not a case of action; rather "he eats" and did not eat - why? It is not a case of action!

hebrew_text: קָסָבַר רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: לָאו שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה – לוֹקִין עָלָיו.
human_translation: Rabbi Yishmael holds one is flogged for a prohibition that does not involve an action.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yishmael holds: If it does not involve an action - one is liable.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, קַשְׁיָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אַדְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן!
human_translation: If so, a difficulty of Rabbi Yoḥanan and of Rabbi Yoḥanan.
llm_translation: If so, the question of Rabbi Yochanan to Rabbi Yochanan!

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הֲלָכָה כִּסְתַם מִשְׁנָה;
human_translation: As Rabbi Yoḥanan says: halakha in accordance with an unattributed mishna.
llm_translation: As Rabbi Yochanan said: the halacha follows the anonymous Mishnah.

hebrew_text: וְאִתְּמַר: ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁאוֹכַל כִּכָּר זוֹ הַיּוֹם״, וְעָבַר הַיּוֹם וְלֹא אֲכָלָהּ – רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: אֵינוֹ לוֹקֶה. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר אֵינוֹ לוֹקֶה – מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵה לָאו שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה, וְכׇל לָאו שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה אֵין לוֹקִין עָלָיו. וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר אֵינוֹ לוֹקֶה – הַתְרָאַת סָפֵק הִיא, וְהַתְרָאַת סָפֵק לֹא שְׁמָהּ הַתְרָאָה.
human_translation: And was stated oath I will eat this loaf today, and the day passed and he did not eat it. Rabbi Yoḥanan and Reish Lakish both say: He is not flogged Rabbi Yoḥanan says: He is not flogged due to that it is a prohibition that does not involve an action, and any prohibition that does not involve an action, one is not flogged for its And Reish Lakish says: He is not flogged it is an uncertain forewarning, and an uncertain forewarning is not characterized as forewarning.
llm_translation: And it was stated: "A vow that one will eat this loaf today," and the day passed and they did not eat it - Rabbi Yochanan and Reish Lakish both said: He is not liable. Rabbi Yochanan said he is not liable - because it is a negative commandment that does not involve an action, and for any negative commandment that does not involve an action, one is not liable. And Reish Lakish said he is not liable - it is a warning of doubt, and a warning of doubt is not considered a warning.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן סְתָמָא אַחֲרִינָא אַשְׁכַּח.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan found another unattributed
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan stama achreina ashkach.

hebrew_text: הֵי סְתָמָא? אִילֵּימָא הַאי סְתָמָא – דִּתְנַן: אֲבָל הַמּוֹתִיר בַּטָּהוֹר וְהַשּׁוֹבֵר בַּטָּמֵא – אֵינוֹ לוֹקֶה אֶת הָאַרְבָּעִים;
human_translation: Which unattributed If we say this unattributed as we learned But one who leaves over of a ritually pure and one who breaks of a ritually impure are not flogged the forty
llm_translation: Be it anonymous? Perhaps this anonymous one - as we learned: But one who permits the pure and one who prohibits the impure - he is not liable for the forty lashes.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא שׁוֹבֵר בַּטָּמֵא, דִּכְתִיב ״וְעֶצֶם לֹא תִשְׁבְּרוּ בּוֹ״ – בְּכָשֵׁר וְלֹא בְּפָסוּל. אֲבָל הַמּוֹתִיר בַּטָּהוֹר, מַאי טַעְמָא? לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵי לָאו שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה, וְכׇל לָאו שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה אֵין לוֹקִים עָלָיו?
human_translation: Granted breaking of a impure as it is written: “Nor shall you break a bone in it” to a valid but not to a disqualified But one who leaves over of a pure what is the reason Is it not because it is a prohibition that does not involve an action, and for any prohibition that does not involve an action one is not flogged?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: In truth, one may break a bone in an impure animal, as it is written, "And a bone you shall not break in it" - in a kosher animal and not in a non-kosher animal. But one who permits eating in a pure animal, what is the reason? Is it not because it is not a prohibition that involves an action, and any prohibition that does not involve an action is not punishable?

hebrew_text: וּמִמַּאי דְּרַבִּי יַעֲקֹב הִיא – דְּאָמַר לָאו שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה אֵין לוֹקִין עָלָיו? דִּלְמָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא – וּמִשּׁוּם דְּבָא הַכָּתוּב לִיתֵּן עֲשֵׂה אַחַר לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה; הָא לָאו הָכִי, לָקֵי!
human_translation: But from where is of Rabbi Ya’akov, who says a prohibition that does not involve an action, one is not flogged? Perhaps is Rabbi Yehuda, and due to that the verse comes to position positive mitzva after prohibition But were it not for this, one would be flogged,
llm_translation: And from where is it derived that which Rabbi Yaakov said - that if a mitzvah does not have an action, one does not receive lashes for it? Perhaps it is the opinion of Rabbi Yehuda - and because the verse comes to give a positive commandment after a negative one, is it not so, that one receives lashes?

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: ״לֹא תוֹתִירוּ מִמֶּנּוּ עַד בֹּקֶר, וְהַנֹּתָר מִמֶּנּוּ עַד בֹּקֶר בָּאֵשׁ תִּשְׂרֹפוּ״ – בָּא הַכָּתוּב לִיתֵּן עֲשֵׂה אַחַר לֹא תַּעֲשֶׂה, לוֹמַר שֶׁאֵין לוֹקִין עָלָיו; דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: לֹא מִן הַשֵּׁם הוּא זֶה, אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵה לָאו שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה, וְלָאו שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה אֵין לוֹקִים עָלָיו.
human_translation: As it is taught you shall let nothing of it remain until the morning, and that which remains of it until the morning you shall burn in fire” The verse comes to position positive mitzva after prohibition to say that one is not flogged for its the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Ya’akov says: This is not for reason; rather, due to that it is a prohibition that does not involve an action, and for a prohibition that does not involve an action one is not flogged.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "Do not leave any of it until morning, and what remains of it until morning you shall burn with fire" - the verse comes to establish a positive commandment after a negative one, to teach that one is not liable to receive lashes for it; these are the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yaakov says: It is not from the name itself, but because it is a case where there is no action, and in a case where there is no action, one is not liable to receive lashes.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הַאי סְתָמָא אַשְׁכַּח: ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁלֹּא אוֹכַל כִּכָּר זוֹ״, ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁלֹּא אוֹכְלֶנָּה״, וַאֲכָלָהּ –
human_translation: Rather, found this unattributed oath I will not eat this loaf, oath I will not eat it, and he ate it,
llm_translation: Rather, this anonymous individual found the following ruling: "An oath not to eat this loaf," "an oath not to eat it," and he ate it –

hebrew_text: אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אַחַת. זוֹ הִיא שְׁבוּעַת בִּיטּוּי, שֶׁחַיָּיבִין עַל זְדוֹנָהּ מַכּוֹת, וְעַל שִׁגְגָתָהּ קׇרְבַּן עוֹלֶה וְיוֹרֵד.
human_translation: he is liable only one This is an oath on an utterance which one is liable lashes for its intentional and a sliding-scale offering for its unwitting
llm_translation: He is liable only for one. This is the oath of testimony, for which one is liable to receive lashes for intentional violation, and for unintentional violation, one must bring a burnt offering and a sin offering.

hebrew_text: ״זוֹ הִיא דְּחַיָּיבִין עַל זְדוֹנָהּ מַכּוֹת״ – אֲבָל ״אוֹכַל״ וְלֹא אָכַל, לָא לָקֵי!
human_translation: is this which one is liable lashes for its intentional But I will eat, and he did not eat, he is not flogged.
llm_translation: "This is the case for which one is liable for lashes" - but "he ate" and did not eat, he is not liable!

hebrew_text: מִכְּדִי הַאי סְתָמָא וְהַאי סְתָמָא; מַאי חָזֵי דְּעָבֵיד כִּי הַאי סְתָמָא? לֶעְבֵּיד כִּי הַאי סְתָמָא!
human_translation: Now, this is unattributed and that is unattributed. What did see that he practiced in accordance with this unattributed Let him practice in accordance with that unattributed
llm_translation: From this anonymous one and that anonymous one; what do we see that he does like this anonymous one? He does like this anonymous one!

hebrew_text: וּלְטַעְמָיךְ – רַבִּי גּוּפֵיהּ, הֵיכִי סְתַם לַן הָכָא הָכִי וְהָכָא הָכִי?
human_translation: And according to your reasoning Rabbi himself, how could he teach us as unattributed this here and that there?
llm_translation: And according to your reasoning - Rabbi himself, how can we simply say here like this and here like this?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעִיקָּרָא סָבַר לָאו שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ מַעֲשֶׂה לוֹקִין עָלָיו, וְסַתְמַהּ, וַהֲדַר סָבַר אֵין לוֹקִין עָלָיו, וְסַתְמַהּ; וּמִשְׁנָה לֹא זָזָה מִמְּקוֹמָהּ.
human_translation: Rather, initially held for a prohibition that does not involve an action one is flogged, and he taught it an unattributed and he retracted held one is not flogged for and he taught an unattributed And a mishna does not move from its place,
llm_translation: Rather, initially he thought that if it has no action, they do not flog him, and it is a presumption. Then he thought they do flog him, and it is a presumption; and the Mishnah: she did not move from her place.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי אוֹקֵימְתָּא – כְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, וּלְמַלְקוֹת; מַרְאוֹת נְגָעִים – מַאי מַלְקוֹת אִיכָּא? בְּקוֹצֵץ בַּהַרְתּוֹ, וּכְרַבִּי אָבִין אָמַר רַבִּי אִילְעָא; דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אָבִין אָמַר רַבִּי אִילְעָא: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״הִשָּׁמֶר״, ״פֶּן״ וְ״אַל״ – אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: In accordance with which did you interpret In accordance with Rabbi Yishmael, and to lashes. shades of marks, what lashes is there? where one cuts off his snow-white mark [ baheret ], and in accordance with Rabbi Avin says Rabbi Ile’a as Rabbi Avin says Rabbi Ile’a says: Wherever it is stated: Observe, Lest, or: Do not, it is nothing other than a prohibition.
llm_translation: In what case is the law of establishing a boundary like Rabbi Yishmael, and the law of afflicting with tzara'at; what is the affliction referred to? In cutting the tzara'at on the skin, and like Rabbi Avin said Rabbi Ilai; for Rabbi Avin said Rabbi Ilai: Any place where it says "beware," "lest," and "do not" - it is only a prohibition of "do not do."

hebrew_text: יְצִיאוֹת שַׁבָּת, מַאי מַלְקוֹת אִיכָּא? לָאו שֶׁנִּיתַּן לְאַזְהָרַת מִיתַת בֵּית דִּין הוּא – וְכׇל לָאו שֶׁנִּיתַּן לְאַזְהָרַת מִיתַת בֵּית דִּין, אֵין לוֹקִין עָלָיו! מִשּׁוּם הָכִי קָא מוֹקֵימְנָא כְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, דְּאָמַר: לָאו שֶׁנִּיתַּן לְאַזְהָרַת מִיתַת בֵּית דִין – לוֹקִין עָלָיו.
human_translation: carrying out on Shabbat, what lashes is there? is a prohibition that serves as a mandate capital punishment, and any prohibition that serves as a mandate capital punishment, one is not flogged for its It is due to that we interpreted in accordance with Rabbi Yishmael, as he says a prohibition that serves as a mandate capital punishment, one is flogged for its
llm_translation: Tractate: Yetsiot Shabbat, what is the punishment? It is not a prohibition that carries the penalty of death by the court - and any prohibition that does not carry the penalty of death by the court, one does not receive lashes for it! Therefore, we establish it according to Rabbi Yishmael, who said: Any prohibition that does not carry the penalty of death by the court - one receives lashes for it.

hebrew_text: הָא לָאו הָכִי, קָיְימָא כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא?! קַשְׁיָא יְדִיעוֹת! לָאו אָמְרַתְּ: רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל הִיא – וּלְמַלְקוּת? רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא נָמֵי – וּלְמַלְקוּת.
human_translation: were it not for this interpreted in accordance with Rabbi Akiva, awareness a difficulty, Didn’t you say is Rabbi Yishmael and to lashes? also Rabbi Akiva and to lashes.
llm_translation: Here is the English translation of the Talmudic text: Is it not so, that it is in accordance with Rabbi Akiva?! Difficulties of knowledge! Did you not say: It is Rabbi Yishmael – and for disagreement? Rabbi Akiva also – and for disagreement.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, ״יְדִיעוֹת״?! ״הַתְרָאוֹת״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! הָא לָא קַשְׁיָא, תְּנִי ״יְדִיעוֹת דְּהַתְרָאוֹת״.
human_translation: If so, awareness, should have Forewarnings, This not difficult; teach awareness of forewarnings.
llm_translation: If so, "yedi'ot"?! It requires "hatar'ot"! This is not difficult, teach "yedi'ot dehatar'ot."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, ״שְׁתַּיִם שֶׁהֵן אַרְבַּע״?! תַּרְתֵּי הוּא דְּהָוְיָין! וְתוּ, ״אֶת שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ יְדִיעָה בַּתְּחִלָּה וִידִיעָה בַּסּוֹף וְהֶעְלֵם בֵּינָתַיִם״ – הַעֲלָמָה לְמַלְקוּת מַאי עֲבִידְתֵּיהּ? וְתוּ, ״הֲרֵי זֶה בְּעוֹלֶה וְיוֹרֵד״!
human_translation: If so, two that are four? There are two And furthermore, In which had awareness at the beginning and awareness at the end, but a lapse of awareness in between, What the relevance of lapses of awareness to lashes? And furthermore, This to a sliding-scale
llm_translation: So it is, "Two that are four"?! It is two that they are! And furthermore, "That which has knowledge at the beginning and knowledge at the end, with concealment in between" – what does concealment do for wisdom? And furthermore, "Behold, this one ascends and descends"!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: רַבִּי הִיא, וְנָסֵיב לַהּ אַלִּיבָּא דְתַנָּאֵי. בִּידִיעוֹת – נָסֵיב לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, בִּשְׁבוּעוֹת – נָסֵיב לַהּ כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Yosef said: is Rabbi and he formulates according to tanna’im , With regard to awareness he formulates it in accordance with Rabbi Yishmael, with regard to oaths, he formulates it in accordance with Rabbi Akiva.
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Yosef said: It is Rabbi, and he married her according to the opinion of the Tannaim. In matters of knowledge - he married her like Rabbi Yishmael, in matters of oaths - he married her like Rabbi Akiva.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: אַמְרִיתָא לִשְׁמַעְתָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב כָּהֲנָא, וְאָמַר לִי: לָא תֵּימָא רַבִּי נָסֵיב לַהּ אַלִּיבָּא דְתַנָּאֵי – וְלֵיהּ לָא סְבִירָא לֵיהּ;
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: I said statement before Rav Kahana, and he said to me: Do not say Rabbi formulates according to tanna’im but he himself does not hold accordingly.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: I said a teaching before Rav Kahana, and he said to me: Do not say that Rabbi married her according to the opinion of the Tannaim - and he does not agree with him.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא רַבִּי טַעְמֵיהּ דְּנַפְשֵׁיהּ מְפָרֵשׁ, דְּתַנְיָא: מִנַּיִן שֶׁאֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא עַל שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ יְדִיעָה בַּתְּחִלָּה וִידִיעָה בַּסּוֹף וְהֶעְלֵם בֵּינָתַיִם? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְנֶעְלַם״ ״וְנֶעְלַם״ שְׁנֵי פְּעָמִים, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא.
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi is explicating his own reasoning, as it is taught From where that one is liable only for in which had awareness at the beginning and awareness at the end and a lapse of awareness in between, The verses state “And it was concealed,” “and it was concealed” twice. the statement of Rabbi Akiva.
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi's reasoning is explained by himself, as it is taught: From where do we know that one is liable only if there is initial knowledge and final knowledge, and concealment in between? The verse teaches: "And it was concealed" "And it was concealed" - twice, the words of Rabbi Akiva.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ, הֲרֵי הוּא אוֹמֵר:
human_translation: Rabbi says: is not necessary, it says
llm_translation: Rabbi says: He does not need, behold he says:

hebrew_text: ״וְנֶעְלַם״ – מִכְּלָל דְּיָדַע, ״וְהוּא יָדַע״ – הֲרֵי כָּאן שְׁתֵּי יְדִיעוֹת. אִם כֵּן, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְנֶעְלַם״ ״וְנֶעְלַם״? לְחַיֵּיב עַל הֶעְלֵם טוּמְאָה וְעַל הֶעְלֵם מִקְדָּשׁ.
human_translation: “And it was concealed,” by inference, that he had been aware, “And he was aware” here two periods of awareness, if so, why the verses state: “And it was concealed,” “and it was concealed,” to render one liable for a lapse of awareness of ritually impure and for a lapse of awareness of Temple.
llm_translation: "And hidden" - from the inference of knowing, "and he knew" - here are two knowledges. If so, what is the Talmud teaching us to say: "And hidden" "And hidden"? To obligate for hidden impurity and for hidden sanctity.

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחַן בִּידִיעוֹת דְּאִית לֵיהּ טַעְמֵיהּ דְּנַפְשֵׁיהּ, שְׁבוּעוֹת דְּלֵית לֵיהּ טַעְמֵיהּ דְּנַפְשֵׁיהּ מְנָלַן? סְבָרָא הוּא.
human_translation: We have found with regard to awareness that has his own reasoning oaths, where he has not his own reasoning, from where do we is logical reasoning.
llm_translation: I have found in the teachings that he has his own reasons, where does he derive the oaths that do not have their own reasons? It is a logical deduction.

hebrew_text: לִישָּׁנָא אַחֲרִינָא: אַשְׁכְּחַן בִּידִיעוֹת דְּסָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, בִּשְׁבוּעוֹת דְּסָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא מְנָלַן? סְבָרָא הוּא,
human_translation: another formulation We have found with regard to awareness that he holds in accordance with Rabbi Yishmael. With regard to oaths, from where do we that he holds in accordance with Rabbi Akiva? is logical reasoning.
llm_translation: Another teaching: We found in the teachings of one who thought like Rabbi Yishmael, in the oaths of one who thought like Rabbi Akiva, from where? It is a thought.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא מַאי טַעְמָא קָא מְחַיֵּיב לְשֶׁעָבַר – דְּדָרֵישׁ רִיבּוּיֵי וּמִיעוּטֵי; רַבִּי נָמֵי דָּרֵישׁ רִיבּוּיֵי וּמִיעוּטֵי.
human_translation: What is the reason Rabbi Akiva deems liable pertaining to the past? that he expounds amplifications and restrictions Rabbi also expounds amplifications and restrictions,
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva: What is the reason that he is liable for past actions? Because he expounds on the inclusive and exclusive terms. Rabbi also expounds on the inclusive and exclusive terms.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: בַּכֹּל פּוֹדִין בְּכוֹר אָדָם, חוּץ מִן הַשְּׁטָרוֹת. וְרַבָּנַן אָמְרִי: בַּכֹּל פּוֹדִין בְּכוֹר אָדָם, חוּץ מֵעֲבָדִים וּשְׁטָרוֹת וְקַרְקָעוֹת.
human_translation: As it is taught Rabbi says one can redeem firstborn son with any except for notes. And the Rabbis say one can redeem firstborn son with any except for slaves, notes, and land.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi says: In all cases, one may redeem the firstborn son, except for slaves. And the Rabbis say: In all cases, one may redeem the firstborn son, except for slaves, documents, and real estate.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי? דָּרֵישׁ רִיבּוּיֵי וּמִיעוּטֵי: ״וּפְדוּיָו מִבֶּן חֹדֶשׁ״ – רִיבָּה, ״בְּעֶרְכְּךָ כֶּסֶף חֲמֵשֶׁת שְׁקָלִים״ – מִיעֵט, ״תִּפְדֶּה״ – חָזַר וְרִיבָּה.
human_translation: What is the reasoning of Rabbi He expounds amplifications and restrictions. “And its redemption from one month,” amplified “According to the valuation of five silver shekels,” restricted “Shall you redeem,” again amplified
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi's opinion? He expounds on inclusive and exclusive principles: "And his redemption from a month old" - inclusive, "according to your valuation, five shekels of silver" - exclusive, "you shall redeem" - he returned and expounded inclusively.

hebrew_text: רִיבָּה וּמִיעֵט וְרִיבָּה – רִיבָּה הַכֹּל; מַאי רִיבָּה – כׇּל מִילֵּי, וּמַאי מִיעֵט – מִיעֵט שְׁטָרוֹת.
human_translation: amplified and restricted and amplified, it amplified everything What it amplified? everything. And what it restricted? It restricted notes,
llm_translation: Dispute and diminish and dispute - dispute everything; what is dispute - all matters, and what is diminish - diminish documents.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן דָּרְשִׁי כְּלָלֵי וּפְרָטֵי: ״וּפְדוּיָו מִבֶּן חֹדֶשׁ״ – כָּלַל, ״בְּעֶרְכְּךָ כֶּסֶף חֲמֵשֶׁת שְׁקָלִים״ – פָּרַט, ״תִּפְדֶּה״ – חָזַר וְכָלַל.
human_translation: And the Rabbis expound generalizations and details. “And its redemption from one month,” a generalization “According to the valuation of five silver shekels,” a detail, “Shall you redeem,” again makes a generalization.
llm_translation: The sages expounded generalizations and specifics: "And his redemption from a month old" - generalization, "according to your valuation, five shekels of silver" - specification, "he shall redeem" - he repeated and generalized.

hebrew_text: כְּלָל וּפְרָט וּכְלָל – אִי אַתָּה דָן אֶלָּא כְּעֵין הַפְּרָט; מָה הַפְּרָט מְפוֹרָשׁ – דָּבָר הַמִּטַּלְטֵל וְגוּפוֹ מָמוֹן, אַף כׇּל דָּבָר הַמִּטַּלְטֵל וְגוּפוֹ מָמוֹן. יָצְאוּ קַרְקָעוֹת – שֶׁאֵינָן מִטַּלְטְלִין; יָצְאוּ עֲבָדִים – שֶׁהוּקְּשׁוּ לְקַרְקָעוֹת; יָצְאוּ שְׁטָרוֹת – אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁמִּטַּלְטְלִין, אֵין גּוּפָן מָמוֹן.
human_translation: a generalization and a detail and a generalization, you may deduce only similar to the detail; just as the detail, is explicitly something that is movable and has intrinsic monetary so too, anything that is movable and has intrinsic monetary excludes land, which is not movable property; excludes slaves, who are compared to land; excludes notes, even though they are movable property, they do not have intrinsic monetary
llm_translation: General and specific and general - if you judge only like the specific; just as the specific is explicit - an item that is movable and its essence is money, so too, any item that is movable and its essence is money. If stones came out - that are not movable; if slaves came out - that are attached to the stones; if documents came out - even though they are movable, their essence is not money.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְאַמֵּימָר: רַבִּי דָּרֵישׁ רִיבּוּיֵי וּמִיעוּטֵי?! וְהָא רַבִּי כְּלָלֵי וּפְרָטֵי דָּרֵישׁ!
human_translation: Ravina said to Ameimar: Rabbi expound amplifications and restrictions? But doesn’t Rabbi expound generalizations and details?
llm_translation: Ravina said to Ameimar: "Rabbi expounds inclusively and exclusively?! But Rabbi expounds general and specific!"

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: ״מַרְצֵעַ״ – אֵין לִי אֶלָּא מַרְצֵעַ, מִנַּיִן לְרַבּוֹת הַסּוֹל וְהַסִּירָה, הַמַּחַט וְהַמַּקְדֵּחַ וְהַמַּכְתֵּב? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְלָקַחְתָּ״ – כׇּל דָּבָר שֶׁנִּלְקָח בַּיָּד. דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: ״מַרְצֵעַ״ – מָה מַרְצֵעַ מְיוּחָד, שֶׁל מַתֶּכֶת; אַף כֹּל שֶׁל מַתֶּכֶת.
human_translation: as it is taught awl I have only an awl from where to include the thorn of a palm [ hasol ], and a thorn, a needle, and a gimlet, and a stylus The verse states: “And you shall take,” anything that can be taken by hand the statement of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi says: “awl,” just as an awl is distinct of metal, so too, anything of metal
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "Marzea" - I have only "Marzea," how do I know to include the shovel and the pitchfork, the needle, the awl, and the stylus? The verse teaches: "And you shall take" - anything that is taken by hand. These are the words of Rabbi Yosei, the son of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi says: "Marzea" - just as the Marzea is unique, made of metal; so too, everything must be made of metal.

hebrew_text: וְאָמְרִינַן: בְּמַאי קָא מִיפַּלְגִי? רַבִּי דָּרֵישׁ כְּלָלֵי וּפְרָטֵי, וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה דָּרֵישׁ
human_translation: And we say About what do they disagree? Rabbi expounds generalizations and details, and Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, expounds
llm_translation: And we say: With what do they disagree? Rabbi interprets general and specific, and Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, interprets.

hebrew_text: רִיבּוּיֵי וּמִיעוּטֵי.
human_translation: amplifications and restrictions.
llm_translation: Multiplications and diminishings.

hebrew_text: אִין, בְּעָלְמָא כְּלָלֵי וּפְרָטֵי דָּרֵישׁ; וְהָכָא הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא – כִּדְתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל.
human_translation: Yes, generally ex-pounds generalizations and details, but here, this is the reason in accordance with that which the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught.
llm_translation: There are no general principles and specific details in the world; and here is the reason - as it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael.

hebrew_text: דְּתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: ״בְּמַיִם״ ״בַּמַּיִם״ שְׁנֵי פְּעָמִים – אֵין זֶה כְּלָל וּפְרָט, אֶלָּא רִיבָּה וּמִיעֵט.
human_translation: As the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: “In the water,” “in the water,” twice, are not a generalization and a detail, rather an amplification and a restriction.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "D'tana d'bei Rabbi Yishmael: 'B'mayim' 'ba'mayim' shnei pe'amim - ein zeh k'lal u'f'rat, ela ribah u'mi'et." English translation: "It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: 'In water' 'in the water' twice - this is not general and specific, but rather amplification and limitation."

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן – אָמַר רָבִינָא, כִּדְאָמְרִי בְּמַעְרְבָא: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁאַתָּה מוֹצֵא שְׁתֵּי כְלָלוֹת הַסְּמוּכוֹת זֶה לָזֶה, הַטֵּל פְּרָט בֵּינֵיהֶן, וְדוּנֵם בִּכְלָל וּפְרָט.
human_translation: And the Rabbis, Ravina said: Like they say in the West, Wherever you find two generalizations juxtaposed to each other, place detail between and expound them as a generalization and a detail
llm_translation: The scholars - Ravina said, as they say in the West: wherever you find two adjacent general principles, insert a specific detail between them, and judge them as a general principle and a detail.

hebrew_text: הַשְׁתָּא דְּאָמְרַתְּ רַבִּי כְּלָלֵי וּפְרָטֵי דָּרֵישׁ, בְּעַל כּוּרְחֵיךְ קַשְׁיָא שָׁבוּעוֹת! אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבוּעוֹת נָסֵיב אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, וְלֵיהּ לָא סְבִירָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Now that you said Rabbi expounds generalizations and details, perforce oaths difficult, Rather, with regard to oaths, formulated in accordance with of Rabbi Akiva, but he himself does not hold accordingly.
llm_translation: The question that Rabbi K'lalei and Rabbi Pratei raised, with your permission, is difficult. Rather, in the week of Shavuot, I will go to the house of Rabbi Akiva, and he does not agree with him.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא – מִנַּיִן שֶׁאֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא עַל שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ יְדִיעָה בַּתְּחִלָּה וִידִיעָה בַּסּוֹף וְהֶעְלֵם בֵּינָתַיִם? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְנֶעְלַם״ ״וְנֶעְלַם״ שְׁנֵי פְּעָמִים. דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא.
human_translation: the itself. From where that one is liable only for in which had awareness at the beginning and awareness at the end, but a lapse of awareness in between, The verse states “And it was concealed,” “and it was concealed,” twice the statement of Rabbi Akiva.
llm_translation: Body - from where do we derive that one is only liable if there is knowledge at the beginning and knowledge at the end, and concealment in between? The verse teaches: "and it was concealed," "and it was concealed," repeated twice. These are the words of Rabbi Akiva.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ, הֲרֵי הוּא אוֹמֵר ״וְנֶעְלַם״ – מִכְּלָל שֶׁיָּדַע, ״וְהוּא יָדַע״ – הֲרֵי כָּאן שְׁתֵּי יְדִיעוֹת. אִם כֵּן, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְנֶעְלַם״? לְחַיֵּיב עַל הֶעְלֵם טוּמְאָה וְעַל הֶעְלֵם מִקְדָּשׁ.
human_translation: Rabbi says: is not necessary, it states “And it was concealed,” by inference, that he had been aware; “And he was aware.” here two awareness, if so, why the verse state: “And it was concealed,” to render one liable for a lapse of awareness of ritually impure and for a lapse of awareness of Temple.
llm_translation: Rabbi says: It is not necessary, as it says "and it is hidden" - indicating that He knows, "and He knows" - here are two knowledges. If so, what is the Talmud teaching by saying "and it is hidden"? To obligate for hidden impurity and for hidden sanctity.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: ״וְנֶעְלַם״ – מִכְּלָל שֶׁיָּדַע. מַאי מַשְׁמַע? אָמַר רָבָא: מִדְּלָא כְּתִיב ״וְהִיא עֲלוּמָה מִמֶּנּוּ״.
human_translation: The Master said “And it was concealed,” by inference, that he had been aware. From where inferred? Rava said: From that it is not written: And it is concealed from him,
llm_translation: Master said: "And it was hidden" - implying that he knew. What is the implication? Rava said: Because it is not written "and it was hidden from him."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, גַּבֵּי סוֹטָה דִּכְתִיב: ״וְנֶעְלַם מֵעֵינֵי אִישָׁהּ״ – מִכְּלַל דְּהָוֵי יָדַע מֵעִיקָּרָא?! אִי הֲוָה יָדַע, מִי בָּדְקוּ לַהּ מַיָּא?
human_translation: Abaye said to him: If that is so, with regard to a suspected adulteress [ sota ], as it is written and it was concealed from the eyes of her husband” by inference, that initially he had been aware If he was aware would the waters examine her?
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: Rather, from now on, regarding the case of the Sotah where it is written: "and it was hidden from the eyes of her husband" - does this not imply that he knew from the outset?! If he knew, who examined her with water?

hebrew_text: וְהָא תַּנְיָא: ״וְנִקָּה הָאִישׁ מֵעָוֹן וְהָאִשָּׁה הַהִוא תִּשָּׂא אֶת עֲוֹנָהּ״ – בִּזְמַן שֶׁהָאִישׁ מְנוּקֶּה מֵעָוֹן, הַמַּיִם בּוֹדְקִין אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ; אֵין הָאִישׁ מְנוּקֶּה מֵעָוֹן, אֵין הַמַּיִם בּוֹדְקִין אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ!
human_translation: But isn’t it taught “And the husband will be free of sin and the wife shall bear her sin” when the husband is free of sin, the water examines his wife, the husband is not free of sin, the water does not examine his wife.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And it was taught: 'And the man shall be clear from iniquity, and that woman shall bear her iniquity' - when the man is clear from iniquity, the water tests his wife; if the man is not clear from iniquity, the water does not test his wife!"

hebrew_text: וְתוּ, גַּבֵּי תוֹרָה דִּכְתִיב: ״וְנֶעֶלְמָה מֵעֵינֵי כׇל חָי וּמֵעוֹף הַשָּׁמַיִם נִסְתָּרָה״ – מִכְּלָל דְּאִיכָּא דַּהֲוָה יָדַע בֵּיהּ? וְהָכְתִיב: ״לֹא יָדַע אֱנוֹשׁ עֶרְכָּהּ״!
human_translation: And furthermore, with regard to Torah, as it is written: “And it was concealed from the eyes of all living creatures, and from those that soar in the heavens it was hidden” by inference, that there was who was aware of But isn’t it written: “No man knew its value,
llm_translation: And come, regarding Torah as it is written: "And it is hidden from the eyes of all living beings, and from the birds of the sky it is concealed" - from the inference that there is one who knows it? And it is written: "No man knows its value!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: קָסָבַר רַבִּי, יְדִיעַת בֵּית רַבּוֹ שְׁמָהּ יְדִיעָה.
human_translation: Rather, Abaye said: Rabbi holds knowledge from his school is considered awareness
llm_translation: Rather, Abaye said: Rabbi holds, knowledge of one's teacher's house is knowledge.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי: אֶלָּא דְּקָתָנֵי ״אֵין בָּהּ יְדִיעָה בַּתְּחִלָּה וְיֵשׁ בָּהּ יְדִיעָה בַּסּוֹף״ – מִי אִיכָּא דְּלֵית לֵיהּ יְדִיעַת בֵּית רַבּוֹ? אָמַר לֵיהּ: אִין, מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ בְּתִינוֹק שֶׁנִּשְׁבָּה לְבֵין הַגּוֹיִם.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Abaye: But that is taught he did not have awareness at the beginning but had awareness at the end? is there who does not have knowledge from his school? said to him: Yes, you find it in a child who was taken captive among gentiles,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Papa to Abbaye: Rather, it is taught, "It does not have knowledge at the beginning, but it has knowledge in the end" - is there anyone who does not have the knowledge of his teacher's house? He said to him: No, she remembers it from the child who was taken captive among the nations.

hebrew_text: יְצִיאוֹת שַׁבָּת שְׁתַּיִם שֶׁהֵן אַרְבַּע. תְּנַן הָתָם: יְצִיאוֹת שַׁבָּת – שְׁתַּיִם שֶׁהֵן אַרְבַּע בִּפְנִים, וּשְׁתַּיִם שֶׁהֵן אַרְבַּע בַּחוּץ. מַאי שְׁנָא הָכָא דִּתְנָא ״שְׁתַּיִם שֶׁהֵן אַרְבַּע״ וְתוּ לָא, וּמַאי שְׁנָא הָתָם דְּתָנֵי ״שְׁתַּיִם שֶׁהֵן אַרְבַּע בִּפְנִים וּשְׁתַּיִם שֶׁהֵן אַרְבַּע בַּחוּץ״?
human_translation: carrying out on Shabbat, two that are four. We learned there carrying out on Shabbat, two that are four inside, and two that are four outside, What is different here that teaches: two that are four, and nothing more; and what is different there, that teaches: two that are four inside, and two that are four outside,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Yetsiot Shabbat shetayim shehem arba. Tenan hatam: Yetsiot Shabbat - shetayim shehem arba bifnim, ushetayim shehem arba bachutz. Mai shna hacha ditna "shetayim shehem arba" vetu lo, umai shna hatam detanei "shetayim shehem arba bifnim ushetayim shehem arba bachutz"? English translation: Exits of Shabbat two that they are four. We learned there: Exits of Shabbat - two that they are four inside, and two that they are four outside. What is the difference here that it teaches "two that they are four" and not here, and what is the difference there that it teaches "two that they are four inside and two that they are four outside"?

hebrew_text: הָתָם דְּעִיקַּר שַׁבָּת הוּא, תָּנֵי אָבוֹת וְתוֹלָדוֹת. הָכָא דְּלָאו עִיקַּר שַׁבָּת הוּא – אָבוֹת תָּנֵי, וְתוֹלָדוֹת לָא תָּנֵי.
human_translation: There, which is the main of Shabbat teaches primary categories and subcategories here, which not the main of Shabbat, teaches the primary categories but does not teach the subcategories
llm_translation: There, where the main aspect is Shabbat, it teaches "ancestors and descendants." Here, where the main aspect is not Shabbat - it teaches "ancestors," and does not teach "descendants."

hebrew_text: אָבוֹת מַאי נִינְהוּ – יְצִיאוֹת; יְצִיאוֹת תַּרְתֵּי הָוְיָין!
human_translation: What are the primary categories carrying out carrying out are two
llm_translation: Fathers, what are they? - Exits; Exits are two kinds!

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: מֵהֶן לְחִיּוּב וּמֵהֶן לִפְטוּר; וְהָא דּוּמְיָא דְּמַרְאוֹת נְגָעִים קָתָנֵי – מָה הָתָם כּוּלְּהוּ לְחִיּוּבָא, אַף הָכָא כּוּלְּהוּ לְחִיּוּבָא!
human_translation: And if you would say among them for liability and among them for exemption, doesn’t teach similar to shades of marks? just as there, all of them for liability, so too here, all of them for liability.
llm_translation: And if you will say: from them for obligation and from them for exemption; and that which was taught in a Baraita of the appearance of afflictions is small - what is the comparison there? All of them for obligation, so too here all of them for obligation!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: הָתָם דְּעִיקַּר שַׁבָּת, תָּנֵי חִיּוּבֵי וּפְטוּרֵי; הָכָא, חִיּוּבֵי תָּנֵי וּפְטוּרֵי לָא תָּנֵי.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Pappa said There, which the main of Shabbat, teaches liability and exemption. here, teaches liability but does not teach exemption.
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Pappa said: There, where the essence of Shabbat is involved, it teaches obligations and exemptions; here, it teaches obligations but does not teach exemptions.

hebrew_text: חִיּוּבֵי מַאי נִינְהוּ – יְצִיאוֹת; יְצִיאוֹת תַּרְתֵּי הוּא דְּהָוְיָין! שְׁתַּיִם דְּהוֹצָאָה וּשְׁתַּיִם דְּהַכְנָסָה.
human_translation: What are liability? carrying out carrying out are two two of carrying out and two of bringing in
llm_translation: Obligations of what are they? - Exits; Exits are two that they are! Two for outgoing and two for incoming.

hebrew_text: וְהָא ״יְצִיאוֹת״ קָתָנֵי! אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: תַּנָּא, הַכְנָסָה נָמֵי ״הוֹצָאָה״ קָרֵי לַהּ. מִמַּאי?
human_translation: But teaches: carrying out. Rav Ashi said: The tanna also refers to bringing in as carrying out From where
llm_translation: The Gemara: And this, "yetsi'ot," it teaches! Rav Ashi said: It was taught, "hanachasah" is also called "hotza'ah." From where?

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: הַמּוֹצִיא מֵרְשׁוּת לִרְשׁוּת חַיָּיב. מִי לָא עָסְקִינַן דְּקָא מְעַיֵּיל עַיּוֹלֵי – וְקָא קָרֵי לֵיהּ ״הוֹצָאָה״?
human_translation: as we learned One who carries out from domain to domain liable. Are we not dealing where he is bringing in and refers to it carrying out?
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: One who transfers an object from one domain to another is liable. Who are we dealing with that he is carrying burdens - and it is called "carrying out"?

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא קָא מַפֵּיק מֵרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד לִרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים? אִם כֵּן, נִיתְנֵי ״הַמּוֹצִיא מֵרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד לִרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים״; מַאי ״מֵרְשׁוּת לִרְשׁוּת״? דַּאֲפִילּוּ מֵרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים לִרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד,
human_translation: But perhaps carrying out from a private domain to a public domain. If so, let it teach: One who carries out from a private domain to a public domain What From domain to domain? that even from a public domain to a private domain.
llm_translation: And perhaps he is taking out from a private domain to a public domain? If so, it should be stated, "One who carries from a private domain to a public domain." What is "from domain to domain"? Even from a public domain to a private domain.

hebrew_text: וְקָא קָרֵי לַהּ ״הוֹצָאָה״. וְטַעְמָא מַאי? תַּנָּא, כׇּל עֲקִירַת חֵפֶץ מִמְּקוֹמוֹ – ״הוֹצָאָה״ קָרֵי לַהּ.
human_translation: it refers to it as carrying out. What is the reason The tanna refers to any removal of an item from its place as carrying out.
llm_translation: And it is called to it "Hotsa'ah." And the reason is what? It was taught: Any uprooting of an object from its place - "Hotsa'ah" it is called.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא: מַתְנִיתִין נָמֵי דַּיְקָא, דְּקָתָנֵי: ״יְצִיאוֹת שַׁבָּת שְׁתַּיִם שֶׁהֵן אַרְבַּע בִּפְנִים וּשְׁתַּיִם שֶׁהֵן אַרְבַּע בַּחוּץ״, וְקָא מְפָרֵשׁ הַכְנָסָה. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Ravina said: the mishna is also precise as it teaches: carrying out [ yetziyyot ] on Shabbat, two that are four inside and two that are four outside, And it explicates bringing in Conclude from it
llm_translation: Ravina said: The Mishnah also supports this, as it teaches: "Two entrances on Shabbat, which are four inside and two outside," and it explains the concept of "bringing in." Learn from it.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: רְשׁוּיוֹת קָתָנֵי – רְשׁוּיוֹת שַׁבָּת שְׁתַּיִם.
human_translation: Rava said: it teaches domains. domains of Shabbat two
llm_translation: Rava said: "Reshuyot katanei - reshuyot Shabbat shetayim."

hebrew_text: מַרְאוֹת נְגָעִים שְׁנַיִם שֶׁהֵן אַרְבָּעָה. תְּנַן הָתָם: מַרְאוֹת נְגָעִים – שְׁנַיִם שֶׁהֵן אַרְבָּעָה: בַּהֶרֶת – עַזָּה כַּשֶּׁלֶג, שְׁנִיָּה לָהּ – כְּסִיד הַהֵיכָל,
human_translation: shades of marks, two that are four. We learned there shades of marks, two that are four: baheret , an intense like snow. Secondary to it, like lime of the Sanctuary
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Mar'ot nega'im shnayim shehem arba'ah. Tenan hatam: mar'ot nega'im - shnayim shehem arba'ah: baheret - azah kashaleg, shniya lah - kesid haheikhal." English translation: "The appearances of afflictions are two, which are four. We learned there: the appearances of afflictions - two, which are four: in leprosy - as white as snow, a second to it - like the plaster of the Temple."

hebrew_text: שְׂאֵת – כְּצֶמֶר לָבָן, שְׁנִיָּה לָהּ – כִּקְרוּם בֵּיצָה.
human_translation: se’et like white wool. Secondary to it like the membrane of an egg.
llm_translation: Lift - like wool white, second to it - like yolk egg.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מַאן תַּנָּא מַרְאוֹת נְגָעִים? דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. דְּאִי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר: זוֹ לְמַעְלָה מִזּוֹ וְזוֹ לְמַעְלָה מִזּוֹ, אִם כֵּן טִיהַרְתָּ סִיד הֵיכָל מִלְּצָרֵף.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina said: Who taught shades of leprous marks not in accordance with Rabbi Akiva. As if Rabbi Akiva Since says: this above this and that above that if so, you have rendered pure lime of the Sanctuary it cannot be combined
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina said: Who is the Tanna that teaches about the appearance of afflictions? Not like Rabbi Akiva. For if it were Rabbi Akiva, since he said: "This is above that, and this is above that," then have you purified the plaster of the Temple from the leprosy.

hebrew_text: בַּהֲדֵי מַאן לִיצָרְפֵיהּ? לִיצָרְפֵיהּ בַּהֲדֵי בַּהֶרֶת – אִיכָּא שְׂאֵת דַּעֲדִיפָא מִינֵּיהּ. לִיצָרְפֵיהּ בַּהֲדֵי שְׂאֵת – לָאו תּוֹלָדָה דִּידֵיהּ הוּא.
human_translation: With which could we combine Let us combine it together with baheret , there is se’et , which is a more than Let us combine it together with a se’et , is not its secondary
llm_translation: In whose presence does it burn? It burns in the presence of leprosy - there is a hair that is more preferred than it. It burns in the presence of hair - it is not its own offspring.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, קְרוּם בֵּיצָה נָמֵי – בַּהֲדֵי מַאן לִיצָרְפֵיהּ? לִיצָרְפֵיהּ בַּהֲדֵי שְׂאֵת – אִיכָּא סִיד דַּעֲדִיף מִינֵּיהּ, לִיצָרְפֵיהּ בַּהֲדֵי סִיד – לָאו בַּר מִינֵיהּ הוּא!
human_translation: If that is so, also membrane of an egg, with which could we combine it? Let us combine it together with se’et , there is a lime which is a more than Let us combine it together with a lime is not its type,
llm_translation: If so, a boiled egg is better - in whose presence will it be burned? It will be burned in the presence of one who can remove the shell - if there is lime that is better than it, it will be burned in the presence of lime - it is not its own kind!

hebrew_text: הַאי מַאי? בִּשְׁלָמָא בְּלָא סִיד הֵיכָל, קְרוּם בֵּיצָה לָא קַשְׁיָא – דְּאַף עַל גַּב דִּקְרוּם בֵּיצָה מִתַּתַּאי דִּשְׂאֵת, רַחֲמָנָא אָמַר ״וְלַשְׂאֵת וְלַסַּפַּחַת״ – סַפַּחַת טְפֵילָה לַשְּׂאֵת, אַף עַל גַּב דְּמִנַּחֲתָא מִינַּיהּ טוּבָא. אֶלָּא סִיד הֵיכָל – קַשְׁיָא, אֶלָּא מְחַוַּורְתָּא מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא.
human_translation: What is this Granted, were it not for lime of the Sanctuary an egg membrane– not difficult. As even though an egg membrane below of a se’et , the Merciful One states: “And for a se’et and for a sappaḥat ” a sappaḥat is secondary to a se’et even though is a much lower than it. But lime of the Sanctuary difficult. Rather, it is clear the mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi Akiva.
llm_translation: This what? In peace in without lime temple, crumb egg not difficult - because even though crumb egg from bottom of sack, Merciful One said "and for the scab and for the eruption" - eruption dependent on scab, even though it is better than it. Rather, lime temple - difficult, rather Mechavvarta Mishnah that not like Rabbi Akiva.

hebrew_text: וְהֵיכָא שָׁמְעִינַן לְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא זוֹ לְמַעְלָה מִזּוֹ?
human_translation: And where have we learned according to Rabbi Akiva this above that
llm_translation: And where do we hear this for Rabbi Akiva, is this above this?

hebrew_text: אִילֵּימָא מֵהָא – דְּתַנְיָא: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי, שָׁאַל יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא מֵרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: מִפְּנֵי מָה אָמְרוּ מַרְאוֹת נְגָעִים שְׁנַיִם שֶׁהֵן אַרְבָּעָה? אָמַר לוֹ: וְאִם לָאו, מָה יֹאמְרוּ? יֹאמְרוּ מִקְּרוּם בֵּיצָה וּלְמַעְלָה טָמֵא!
human_translation: If we say from that which is taught Rabbi Yosei said Yehoshua, son of Rabbi Akiva, asked of Rabbi Akiva: For what did say shades of marks are two that are four, said to him: But if not what could they say? Let them say from an egg membrane and above is ritually impure.
llm_translation: Firstly, it was stated: Rabbi Yosei said, Yehoshua, the son of Rabbi Akiva, asked Rabbi Akiva: "Why did they say that two appearances of skin afflictions are actually four?" He said to him: "And if not, what should they say? They should say, 'From the crown of the head and above is impure!'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ: לוֹמַר שֶׁמִּצְטָרְפִים זֶה עִם זֶה. אָמַר לוֹ, וְיֹאמְרוּ: ״מִקְּרוּם בֵּיצָה וּלְמַעְלָה טָמֵא, וּמִצְטָרְפִין זֶה עִם זֶה״! אָמַר לוֹ: לוֹמַר לָךְ, כׇּל כֹּהֵן שֶׁאֵינוֹ בָּקִי בָּהֶן וּבִשְׁמוֹתֵיהֶן, אֵינוֹ רוֹאֶה אֶת הַנְּגָעִים.
human_translation: said to him: to say that they combine with each other said to him: let them say: from egg membrane and above is ritually impure, and they combine with each other. said to him: to tell you: Any priest who is not an expert in them and their names is not inspect the marks
llm_translation: He said to him: To say that they combine with each other. He said to him, and they should say: "From their beginning and above they are impure, and they combine with each other"! He said to him: To say to you, any priest who is not proficient in them and their names, does not see the afflictions.

hebrew_text: וְאִילּוּ ״מִסִּיד הֵיכָל וּלְמַעְלָה״ – לָא קָאָמַר;
human_translation: but he did not say from lime of the Sanctuary and above
llm_translation: And if "from the foundation of the Temple and above" – not is saying.

hebrew_text: מִדְּלָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ דִּשְׁמִיעַ לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא דְּאָמַר: כּוּלְּהוּ לְבַהֲדֵי שְׂאֵת מִצְטָרְפִין.
human_translation: Conclude from that he did not say to that heard of Rabbi Akiva that he says: All combine with a se’et .
llm_translation: From the fact that he did not say to him, infer from it that he agrees with Rabbi Akiva who said: All of them, when combined together, are considered as one.

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא ״שְׂאֵת וְתוֹלַדְתָּהּ״, ״בַּהֶרֶת וְתוֹלַדְתָּהּ״?
human_translation: But perhaps a se’et and its secondary a baheret and its secondary
llm_translation: "And perhaps 'its offspring,' 'with leprosy and its offspring'?"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מִדְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא – דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מָשָׁל דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא לְמָה הַדָּבָר דּוֹמֶה? לְאַרְבָּעָה כּוֹסוֹת שֶׁל חָלָב, אֶחָד נָפְלוּ לְתוֹכוֹ שְׁתֵּי טִיפִּין שֶׁל דָּם, וְאֶחָד נָפְלוּ לְתוֹכוֹ אַרְבַּע טִיפִּין שֶׁל דָּם, וְאֶחָד נָפְלוּ לְתוֹכוֹ שְׁמוֹנֶה, וְאֶחָד נָפְלוּ לְתוֹכוֹ שְׁתֵּים עֶשְׂרֵה טִיפִּין – וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: שֵׁשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה טִיפִּין – שֶׁכּוּלָּן מַרְאוֹת לוֹבֶן הֵן, אֶלָּא שֶׁזֶּה לְמַעְלָה מִזֶּה וְזֶה לְמַעְלָה מִזֶּה.
human_translation: Rather, from that Rabbi Ḥanina as Rabbi Ḥanina says: an analogy of Rabbi Akiva: To what is this matter comparable? to four cups of milk, two drops of blood fell into one and four drops of blood fell into one and eight fell into one, and twelve drops fell into one. And some say sixteen drops as all of has shade of white, but as this above this and that above that
llm_translation: Rather from Rabbi Chanina - as Rabbi Chanina said: What is the parable of Rabbi Akiva similar to? To four cups of milk, one of which two drops of blood fell into it, and one of which four drops of blood fell into it, and one of which eight drops fell into it, and one of which twelve drops fell into it - and they said about it: sixteen drops - all of them appear white, but this one is above that one, and that one is above that one.

hebrew_text: אֵימוֹר דְּשָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא – בְּפָתוּךְ; בְּחָלוּק מִי שָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ?
human_translation: Say that you heard Rabbi Akiva with regard to mixed [ befatukh ] with regard to flawless have you heard
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Eimor d'sham'at leih l'Rabbi Akiva - b'fatuch; b'chaluk mi sham'at leih?" English translation: "Say it that you heard it from Rabbi Akiva - openly; in what case did you hear it from him?"

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא כִּי הֵיכִי דְּשָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ בְּפָתוּךְ, הָכִי שָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ בְּחָלוּק; וּבְפָתוּךְ גּוּפֵיהּ מִי שָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ? וְהָתַנְיָא, רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: אֲדַמְדַּם שֶׁבָּזֶה וְשֶׁבָּזֶה כְּיַיִן הַמָּזוּג בְּמַיִם; אֶלָּא שֶׁל בַּהֶרֶת עַזָּה כַּשֶּׁלֶג, וְשֶׁל סִיד דֵּיהָה הֵימֶנָּה.
human_translation: And if you would say just as you heard with regard to mixed so too, you have heard with regard to flawless And in the case of a mixed itself, did you hear him But isn’t it taught Rabbi Akiva says reddish of this and of that are like wine diluted in water, except of a baheret is intense like snow, but of lime is darker than it.
llm_translation: And if you will say, how did you hear it in a clear manner, thus you heard it in a divided manner; and in a clear manner, his body, who heard it? And it was taught, Rabbi Akiva says: The redness in this one and in that one is like wine mixed with water; except that of a bold leper is like snow, and that of a plasterer, its dye is from it.

hebrew_text: וְאִם אִיתָא, ״שֶׁל צֶמֶר דֵּיהָה הֵימֶנָּה״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: And if it is so he should have of a wool- is darker than it,
llm_translation: And if it is stated, "of wool her enough is from it," it requires it!

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: אִין הָכִי נָמֵי, וְהָתַנְיָא: רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר, לֹא שֶׁאָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא ״שֶׁל סִיד דֵּיהָה הֵימֶנָּה״, אֶלָּא ״שֶׁל צֶמֶר דֵּיהָה הֵימֶנָּה״.
human_translation: They said Yes, it is indeed so and it is taught Rabbi Natan says, not that Rabbi Akiva said: of lime is darker than it; rather, of a is darker than it.
llm_translation: They said: It is not so, and it was taught: Rabbi Natan says, not that Rabbi Akiva said, "of lime, its mortar is from it," but "of wool, its mortar is from it."

hebrew_text: וּמְנָלַן דְּבַהֶרֶת עַזָּה הִיא? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, אָמַר קְרָא: ״אִם בַּהֶרֶת לְבָנָה הִיא״ – הִיא לְבָנָה, וְאֵין אַחֶרֶת לְבָנָה.
human_translation: And from where do we that baheret is an intense Abaye said: The verse states: if it is a white baheret ” it is white and there is no other white
llm_translation: "And from where do we derive that a bright spot is strong? Abaye said, the verse says: 'If the bright spot is white' - it is white, and there is no other white."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״בַּהֶרֶת״ – עֲמוּקָּה, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וּמַרְאֶהָ עָמֹק מִן הָעוֹר״; כְּמַרְאֵה חַמָּה הָעֲמוּקָּה מִן הַצֵּל. ״שְׂאֵת״ – אֵין שְׂאֵת אֶלָּא גָּבוֹהַּ, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״עַל כׇּל הֶהָרִים הָרָמִים וְעַל כׇּל הַגְּבָעוֹת הַנִּשָּׂאוֹת״. ״סַפַּחַת״ – אֵין סַפַּחַת אֶלָּא טְפֵילָה, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וְאָמַר סְפָחֵנִי נָא״.
human_translation: The Sages taught a baheret deeper and so states: “And its appearance is deeper than the skin” like the appearance of sun, which deeper than the shade. a se’et se’et nothing other than raised, and so states: “Upon all the high mountains and upon all the raised up [ hanissaot ] hills” sappaḥat nothing other than secondary, and so states: “And he will say: Append me [ sefaḥeni ] please
llm_translation: The sages taught: "Baheret" - deep, as it says: "And the appearance of it is deeper than the skin"; just as the appearance of the sun is deeper than the shade. "Sa'et" - it means high, as it says: "Upon all the high mountains and upon all the lifted hills." "Sappachat" - it means plaster, as it says: "And he said, 'Plaster me, please.'"

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחַן טְפֵילָה לַשְּׂאֵת; טְפֵילָה לַבַּהֶרֶת מְנָלַן? אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: נֶאֶמְרָה ״לְבָנָה״ בַּשְּׂאֵת, וְנֶאֶמְרָה ״לְבָנָה״ בַּבַּהֶרֶת; מָה לְבָנָה הָאֲמוּרָה בַּשְּׂאֵת – יֵשׁ לָהּ טְפֵילָה, אַף לְבָנָה הָאֲמוּרָה בַּבַּהֶרֶת – יֵשׁ לָהּ טְפֵילָה.
human_translation: We found secondary to a se’et ; from where do we secondary to a baheret ? Rabbi Zeira said: “White” is stated with regard to a se’et and “white” is stated with regard to a baheret . just as white stated with regard to a se’et has a secondary so too, white stated with regard to a baheret has a secondary
llm_translation: I found a prayer for leprosy; where is the prayer for vitiligo? Rabbi Zeira said: It is stated "moon" regarding leprosy, and it is stated "moon" regarding vitiligo; just as the moon mentioned in leprosy has a prayer, so too the moon mentioned in vitiligo has a prayer.

hebrew_text: בְּמַתְנִיתָא תָּנָא: הֵטִיל הַכָּתוּב לַסַּפַּחַת בֵּין שְׂאֵת לַבַּהֶרֶת, לוֹמַר לָךְ: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁטְּפֵילָה לַשְּׂאֵת, כָּךְ טְפֵילָה לַבַּהֶרֶת.
human_translation: was taught in a baraita : The verse placed sappaḥat between se’et and baheret , to say to you: Just as secondary to a se’et , so too, secondary to a baheret .
llm_translation: In the Mishnah it was taught: The verse stated with regard to the leprous affliction between the hair and the bald spot, to tell you: Just as immersion is required for the bald spot, so too immersion is required for the leprous affliction.

hebrew_text: שְׂאֵת כְּצֶמֶר לָבָן. מַאי ״צֶמֶר לָבָן״? אָמַר רַב בִּיבִי אָמַר רַב אַסִּי: צֶמֶר נָקִי בֶּן יוֹמוֹ, שֶׁמְכַבְּנִין בּוֹ לְמֵילָת.
human_translation: A se’et like white wool. What white wool? Rav Beivai says Rav Asi says: clean wool that wrapped up [ mekhabnin ] one day old for a fine wool
llm_translation: "Raise like white wool." What is "white wool"? Rav Bibi said in the name of Rav Assi: Clean wool of its day, which is used for circumcision."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מָשָׁל דְּרַבָּנַן – לְמָה הַדָּבָר דּוֹמֶה? לִתְרֵי מַלְכֵי וְלִתְרֵי אִיפַּרְכֵי; מַלְכּוֹ שֶׁל זֶה לְמַעְלָה מִמַּלְכּוֹ שֶׁל זֶה, וְאִיפַּרְכוֹ שֶׁל זֶה לְמַעְלָה מֵאִיפַּרְכוֹ שֶׁל זֶה.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina says: an analogy of the Rabbis, To what is this matter comparable? To two kings and to two governors [ iparkhei ] the king of this is above the king of that and the governor of this is above the governor of that
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina said: A parable of the Sages - to what is the matter comparable? To two kings and two crowns; the crown of this one is higher than the crown of that one, and the crown of this one is higher than the crown of that one.

hebrew_text: הַאי זֶה לְמַעְלָה מִזֶּה וְזֶה לְמַעְלָה מִזֶּה הוּא!
human_translation: this this above this and that above that
llm_translation: This one is above this one, and this one is above this one, he is!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַלְכּוֹ שֶׁל זֶה לְמַעְלָה מֵאִיפַּרְכֵיהּ דְּנַפְשֵׁיהּ, וּמַלְכּוֹ שֶׁל זֶה לְמַעְלָה מֵאִיפַּרְכֵיהּ דְּנַפְשֵׁיהּ.
human_translation: Rather, the king of this above his own governor, and the king of that above his own governor.
llm_translation: Instead, the king of this one is above the back of his neck, and the king of this one is above the back of his neck.

hebrew_text: רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר: כְּגוֹן מַלְכָּא וְאַלְקַפְטָא, רוּפִילָא וְרֵישׁ גָּלוּתָא. הַאי זֶה לְמַעְלָה מִזֶּה הוּא! אֶלָּא כְּגוֹן מַלְכָּא וְרוּפִילָא, וְאַלְקַפְטָא וְרֵישׁ גָּלוּתָא.
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Abba said: For example: A king, and a chief officer [ alkafta ], the vizier [ rofila ], and the Exilarch; this this above that Rather, for example: A king and the vizier; and a chief officer and the Exilarch.
llm_translation: Rav Adda bar Abba said: Such as Malka and Alkapta, Rufila and Reish Galuta. This one is above that one! Rather, such as Malka and Rufila, and Alkapta and Reish Galuta.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: כְּגוֹן שַׁבּוּר מַלְכָּא וְקֵיסָר.
human_translation: Rava said: for example: King Shapur, and emperor
llm_translation: Rava said: For example, Shabur Malka and Keisar.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְרָבָא: הֵי מִינַּיְיהוּ עֲדִיף? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּחוּרְשַׁיָּא קָא אָכֵיל לֵיהּ. פּוֹק חֲזִי טִיבְעָא דְּמַאן סַגִּי בְּעָלְמָא – דִּכְתִיב: ״וְתֵאכֻל כׇּל אַרְעָא וּתְדוּשִׁנַּהּ וְתַדְּקִנַּהּ״. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: זוֹ רוֹמִי חַיֶּיבֶת, שֶׁטִּיבְעָהּ יָצָא בְּכׇל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Rava: Which of them is greater, said to him: Does he eat in the forest, Go out see whose coin circulates throughout the world, as it is written “It shall devour the whole earth and tread upon it and break it into pieces” Rabbi Yoḥanan says: This is the guilty Rome whose coin circulates throughout the entire world.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Papa to Rava: Is it preferable to feed them? He said to him: He is eating barley. Go and see the nature of who surpasses in the world - as it is written: "And all the earth shall eat and be satisfied and shall praise." Rabbi Yochanan said: This refers to a Roman woman, as her praise has gone forth throughout the entire world.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אָמַר: כְּגוֹן גְּלִימָא דַּעֲמַר וְשַׁחְקֵיהּ, סְדִינָא דְּכִיתָּנָא וְשַׁחְקֵיהּ.
human_translation: Ravina said: For example, woolen garment and a frayed linen sheet and a frayed one.
llm_translation: Ravina said: Such as the cloak of Amor and his laughter, the linen of Kitana and his laughter.

hebrew_text: אֶת שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ יְדִיעָה בַּתְּחִלָּה וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מִנַּיִן שֶׁאֵין הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר אֶלָּא בְּטוּמְאַת מִקְדָּשׁ וְקָדָשָׁיו?
human_translation: in which had awareness at the beginning The Sages taught From where that the verse speaks of nothing other than defiling of Temple or its sacrificial
llm_translation: The text reads: "That it has knowledge at the beginning, etc." The Rabbis taught: From where do we derive that the Scripture speaks only regarding the impurity of the Sanctuary and its holy items?

hebrew_text: וְדִין הוּא – הוֹאִיל וְהִזְהִיר וְעָנַשׁ עַל הַטּוּמְאָה, וְחַיָּיב קׇרְבָּן עַל הַטּוּמְאָה; מָה כְּשֶׁהִזְהִיר וְעָנַשׁ עַל הַטּוּמְאָה – לֹא הִזְהִיר וְעָנַשׁ אֶלָּא עַל טוּמְאַת מִקְדָּשׁ וְקָדָשָׁיו, אַף כְּשֶׁחִיֵּיב קׇרְבָּן עַל הַטּוּמְאָה – לֹא חִיֵּיב אֶלָּא עַל טוּמְאַת מִקְדָּשׁ וְקָדָשָׁיו.
human_translation: And it is a logical inference: Since prohibited and prescribed punishment for the defiling and has rendered one liable an offering for the defiling just as when it prohibited and prescribed punishment for the defiling it prohibited and prescribed punishment only for the defiling of Temple or its sacrificial so too, when it rendered one liable an offering for the defiling it rendered one liable only for the defiling of Temple or its sacrificial
llm_translation: "And it is a judgment - since he warned and punished for impurity, and obligated a sacrifice for impurity; just as when he warned and punished for impurity - he only warned and punished for the impurity of the sanctuary and its holy things, so too when he obligated a sacrifice for impurity - he only obligated for the impurity of the sanctuary and its holy things."

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא תְּרוּמָה – שֶׁהִזְהִיר וְעָנַשׁ! לָא אַשְׁכְּחַן עֲוֹן מִיתָה דְּחַיָּיב עָלֶיהָ קׇרְבָּן.
human_translation: But say the sacred portion of produce grown in Eretz Yisrael that is designated to be given to a priest [ teruma ], as has prohibited and prescribed punishment we do not find a sin death, which is liable an offering
llm_translation: "And why mention Terumah - to teach that one should be cautious and punished! For we do not find the sin of death penalty obligated upon it i.e., consuming Terumah as we find for Korban."

hebrew_text: אֵימָא: הָנֵי מִילֵּי קׇרְבָּן קָבוּעַ, אֲבָל
human_translation: say this statement a fixed offering, but
llm_translation: Concerning this matter: these matters of the fixed offering, however

hebrew_text: עוֹלֶה וְיוֹרֵד נַיְתֵי – מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַשְּׁמִיעַת קוֹל וְאַבִּיטּוּי שְׂפָתַיִם!
human_translation: one can bring a sliding-scale just as is for “hearing the voice” and for “utterance of lips”
llm_translation: Ascending and descending boats - since there is the hearing of a voice and the observation of lips!

hebrew_text: אָמַר קְרָא: ״בָּהּ״; ״בָּהּ״ – לְמַעוֹטֵי תְּרוּמָה.
human_translation: the verse states: through which “through which” to exclude teruma
llm_translation: The verse says: "bah"; "bah" - to exclude terumah.

hebrew_text: אֵימָא: ״בָּהּ״ – לְמַעוֹטֵי מִקְדָּשׁ; דְּלָא סַגִּי לֵיהּ בְּקׇרְבָּן עוֹלֶה וְיוֹרֵד עַד דְּמַיְיתֵי קׇרְבָּן קָבוּעַ!
human_translation: say “through which” to exclude Temple, that not sufficient for him with a sliding-scale offering; until he brings a fixed offering.
llm_translation: Mother: "In it" - to exclude the sanctuaries; for it does not suffice for it in the offering of a burnt offering, and it descends until the blood of a fixed offering!

hebrew_text: קָרֵי רָבָא עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי: דּוֹלֶה מַיִם מִבּוֹרוֹת עֲמוּקִּים.
human_translation: Rava read about Rabbi “One who draws water from deep wells”
llm_translation: Rava called out regarding it of Rabbi: One draws water from deep wells.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: אֶקְרָא אֲנִי ״חַיָּה״; ״בְּהֵמָה״ לָמָּה נֶאֶמְרָה? נֶאֱמַר כָּאן ״בְּהֵמָה טְמֵאָה״, וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן ״בְּהֵמָה טְמֵאָה״; מָה לְהַלָּן טוּמְאַת קוֹדֶשׁ, אַף כָּאן טוּמְאַת קוֹדֶשׁ.
