human_translation: as it is taught Rabbi says: I would read a ḥayya . Why a behema stated? stated here: “An impure domesticated animal,” and it is stated below “An impure domesticated animal” Just as below defiling of sacrificial so too here, defiling of sacrificial
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi says: I will read "chayah" (living creature); why is "behemah" mentioned? It is stated here "unclean animal," and it is stated there "unclean animal"; just as there, it is the impurity of holiness, so too here, it is the impurity of holiness.

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחַן טוּמְאַת קוֹדֶשׁ, טוּמְאַת מִקְדָּשׁ מְנָלַן? אָמַר קְרָא: ״בְּכׇל קֹדֶשׁ לֹא תִגָּע וְאֶל הַמִּקְדָּשׁ לֹא תָבֹא״ – אִיתַּקַּשׁ מִקְדָּשׁ לְקוֹדֶשׁ.
human_translation: We found defiling of sacrificial from where do we defiling of Temple The verse states “She may not touch any sacred item and she may not enter the Temple” juxtaposes the Temple to sacred
llm_translation: I found impurity of holiness, from where is impurity of sanctuary derived? The verse says: "In all holiness one shall not touch, and to the sanctuary one shall not come" - the sanctuary is connected to holiness.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, תְּרוּמָה נָמֵי – דְּאָמַר מָר: ״בְּכׇל קֹדֶשׁ לֹא תִגָּע״ – לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הַתְּרוּמָה!
human_translation: If so, also teruma as the Master said “She may not touch any sacred item,” to include teruma
llm_translation: So it is, the Terumah of money - as Mar said: "In any holy thing you shall not touch" - to include the Terumah!

hebrew_text: הָא מִיעֵט רַחֲמָנָא ״בָּהּ״. אֵימָא ״בָּהּ״ – לְמַעוֹטֵי מִקְדָּשׁ! מִסְתַּבְּרָא מִקְדָּשׁ לָא מְמַעֲטִינַן, שֶׁכֵּן בְּכָרֵת כְּמוֹתָהּ.
human_translation: The Merciful One excludes “through which” we say “through which” to exclude Temple? is reasonable we should not exclude Temple, as by karet , just like
llm_translation: The Merciful One limited "in it." Say "in it" - to exclude sanctuaries! It is logical that we do not limit the sanctuary, for it is like its death penalty.

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַבָּה, תְּרוּמָה לָא מְמַעֲטִינַן – שֶׁכֵּן אֲכִילָה כְּמוֹתָהּ!
human_translation: On the contrary, we should not exclude teruma as eating, similar to
llm_translation: Adrabah, terumah la mema'atinan - sheken achilah kemotah!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: שָׁלֹשׁ כָּרֵיתוֹת בִּשְׁלָמִים לָמָּה? אַחַת לִכְלָל, וְאַחַת לִפְרָט, וְאַחַת לְטוּמְאָה הַכְּתוּבָה בַּתּוֹרָה סְתָם. וְאֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ מָה הִיא,
human_translation: Rather, Rava said Why three karet with regard to peace-offerings One to general and one to specific and one to defiling that is written in the Torah without specifying and I do not know what is.
llm_translation: Rava said: "Why are there three mentions of 'korbanot' in the peace offerings? One for generalization, one for specification, and one for impurity that is written in the Torah without specification. And I do not know what it is."

hebrew_text: הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר: טוּמְאַת קוֹדֶשׁ. וְאִם אֵינוֹ עִנְיָן לְטוּמְאַת קוֹדֶשׁ – דְּנָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִדְּרַבִּי, תְּנֵהוּ עִנְיָן לְטוּמְאַת מִקְדָּשׁ.
human_translation: you must say defiling of sacrificial But if it is not matter of defiling sacrificial as that has been derived through of Rabbi apply it matter of defiling Temple.
llm_translation: Be it said: impurity of holiness. And if it is not relevant to impurity of holiness - it emerges from Rabbi, give it relevance to impurity of the sanctuary.

hebrew_text: וְהַאי מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ! דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: שָׁלֹשׁ כָּרֵיתוֹת בִּשְׁלָמִים לָמָּה? אַחַת לִכְלָל, וְאַחַת לִפְרָט, וְאַחַת לִדְבָרִים שֶׁאֵינָן נֶאֱכָלִין.
human_translation: But that is necessary to in accordance with of Rabbi Abbahu, as Rabbi Abbahu says: Why three karet with regard to peace-offerings One to general and one to specific and one to items that are not eaten,
llm_translation: And this is what he asks according to Rabbi Avahu! For Rabbi Avahu said: "Why are there three keritot in the peace offerings? One for the general, one for the specific, and one for things that are not eaten."

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן דְּאָמַר: דְּבָרִים שֶׁאֵינָן נֶאֱכָלִין אֵין חַיָּיבִין עֲלֵיהֶן כָּרֵת מִשּׁוּם טוּמְאָה; לְאֵיתוֹיֵי חַטָּאת הַפְּנִימִית. דְּסָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא, הוֹאִיל וְאָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: כֹּל שֶׁאֵינוֹ קָרֵב עַל מִזְבֵּחַ הַחִיצוֹן כִּשְׁלָמִים אֵין חַיָּיבִין עָלָיו מִשּׁוּם פִּיגּוּל, מִשּׁוּם טוּמְאָה נָמֵי לָא; קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּמִיחַיַּיב.
human_translation: And according to Rabbi Shimon, who says items that are not eaten one is not liable karet for them ritually impure, to include an internal sin as it could enter your mind to say since Rabbi Shimon says: For any that is not sacrificed on the external altar in the manner peace-offerings one cannot be liable for piggul , one is also not for it ritually impure; teaches us that one is liable.
llm_translation: And for Rabbi Shimon who said: things that are not edible are not liable for karet due to impurity; for the atonement of the inner sin-offering. Since your mind is made up, I say, since Rabbi Shimon said: anything that is not brought near the outer altar like peace offerings is not liable for pigul, nor for impurity; it is evident to us that he is liable.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמְרִי נְהַרְדָּעֵי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: שָׁלֹשׁ טוּמְאוֹת בִּשְׁלָמִים לָמָּה? אַחַת לִכְלָל, וְאַחַת לִפְרָט, וְאַחַת לְטוּמְאָה הַכְּתוּבָה בְּתוֹרָה סְתָם. וְאֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ מָה הִיא,
human_translation: Rather, of Neharde’a said in the name of Rava Why three ritually impure with regard to peace-offerings One for general and one for specific and one to defiling that is written in the Torah without specifying and I do not know what is.
llm_translation: Rather, the Nahardeans said in the name of Rava: Why are there three impurities in peace offerings? One for the general category, one for the specific case, and one for the impurity written in the Torah without specification. And I do not know what it is.

hebrew_text: הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר טוּמְאַת קוֹדֶשׁ; וְאִם אֵינוֹ עִנְיָן לְטוּמְאַת קוֹדֶשׁ – דְּנָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִדְּרַבִּי, תְּנֵהוּ עִנְיָן לְטוּמְאַת מִקְדָּשׁ.
human_translation: you must say defiling of sacrificial But if it is not matter of defiling sacrificial as that has been derived through of Rabbi apply it matter of defiling Temple.
llm_translation: Be it said, the impurity of holiness; and if it is not relevant to the impurity of holiness - it emerges from Rabbi, give it relevance to the impurity of the sanctuary.

hebrew_text: וְהַאי נָמֵי מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ – אַיְּידֵי דְּבָעֵי לְמִכְתַּב כָּרֵת לְכִדְרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ, כְּתַב נָמֵי טְמָאוֹת, דְּלָא סַגִּי לַהּ בְּלָאו הָכִי!
human_translation: But that is also necessary, since it is necessary to write karet to in accordance with of Rabbi Abbahu, it also write ritually impure, as it is not sufficient without
llm_translation: And this matter, he asks him - since he requires it for a written document, according to Rabbi Avahu, he wrote "namai" as impure, for it does not suffice for him without this!

hebrew_text: יֵשׁ בָּהּ יְדִיעָה בַּתְּחִלָּה וְאֵין בָּהּ יְדִיעָה בַּסּוֹף – שָׂעִיר הַנַּעֲשֶׂה בִּפְנִים וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְכִפֶּר עַל הַקֹּדֶשׁ מִטֻּמְאֹת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְגוֹ׳״ –

hebrew_text: יֵשׁ לִי בְּעִנְיָן זֶה לְהָבִיא שָׁלֹשׁ טְומָאוֹת: טוּמְאַת עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, וְטוּמְאַת גִּילּוּי עֲרָיוֹת, וְטוּמְאַת שְׁפִיכוּת דָּמִים.
human_translation: With regard to this matter, I can to amplify three impurities: The impurity of idol worship, and the impurity of forbidden sexual relations, and the impurity of bloodshed.
llm_translation: I have in this matter to bring three impurities: the impurity of foreign worship, the impurity of revealing nakedness, and the impurity of shedding blood.

hebrew_text: בַּעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״לְמַעַן טַמֵּא אֶת מִקְדָּשִׁי״; בְּגִילּוּי עֲרָיוֹת הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וּשְׁמַרְתֶּם אֶת מִשְׁמַרְתִּי לְבִלְתִּי עֲשׂוֹת מֵחֻקּוֹת הַתּוֹעֵבֹת וְגוֹ׳ וְלֹא תִטַּמְּאוּ בָּהֶם״; בִּשְׁפִיכוּת דָּמִים הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וְלֹא תְטַמֵּא אֶת הָאָרֶץ״. יָכוֹל עַל שָׁלֹשׁ טְומָאוֹת הַלָּלוּ יְהֵא שָׂעִיר מְכַפֵּר? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״מִטֻּמְאֹת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל״ – וְלֹא כׇּל טוּמְאוֹת.
human_translation: With regard to idol worship states: in order to render impure My Sanctuary” With regard to forbidden sexual relations states: “You shall safeguard My charge not to do any of the abominable traditions and not to render yourself impure through them” With regard to bloodshed states: you shall not render the land impure” might the goat would atone for these three impurities. the verse states: “From the impurities of the children of Israel” but not all impurities.
llm_translation: In foreign worship he says: "In order to defile my sanctuary"; in revealing nakedness he says: "And you shall keep my charge, not to do the statutes of abominations, etc., and do not defile yourselves with them"; in shedding blood he says: "And you shall not defile the land." Could it be that with these three impurities the scapegoat atones? The verse teaches: "From the impurities of the children of Israel" - and not all impurities.

hebrew_text: מָה מָצִינוּ שֶׁחִלֵּק הַכָּתוּב מִכְּלַל כׇּל טוּמְאוֹת – הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר טוּמְאַת מִקְדָּשׁ וְקָדָשָׁיו; אַף כָּאן – בְּטוּמְאַת מִקְדָּשׁ וְקָדָשָׁיו. דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: What do we find that the verse differentiates from all impurities? You must say defiling of Temple or its sacrificial So too here, for defiling of Temple or its sacrificial the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: What have we found that the Scripture distinguished from all impurities - one should say impurity of the sanctuary and its holiness; so too here - with the impurity of the sanctuary and its holiness. These are the words of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: מִמְּקוֹמוֹ הוּא מוּכְרָע; הֲרֵי הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וְכִפֶּר עַל הַקֹּדֶשׁ מִטֻּמְאֹת״ – מִטּוּמְאוֹת שֶׁל קוֹדֶשׁ.

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל עַל כׇּל טוּמְאָה שֶׁבַּקּוֹדֶשׁ יְהֵא שָׂעִיר זֶה מְכַפֵּר? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וּמִפִּשְׁעֵיהֶם לְכׇל חַטֹּאתָם״ – חֲטָאִים דּוּמְיָא דִּפְשָׁעִים; מָה פְּשָׁעִים שֶׁאֵינָם בְּנֵי קׇרְבָּן, אַף חֲטָאִים שֶׁאֵינָם בְּנֵי קׇרְבָּן.

hebrew_text: וּמִנַּיִן לְיֵשׁ בָּהּ יְדִיעָה בַּתְּחִלָּה וְאֵין בָּהּ יְדִיעָה בַּסּוֹף, שֶׁשָּׂעִיר זֶה תּוֹלֶה? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לְכׇל חַטֹּאתָם״ – חַיָּיבֵי חַטָּאוֹת בַּמַּשְׁמָע.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: יֵשׁ לִי בְּעִנְיָן זֶה לְהָבִיא שָׁלֹשׁ טוּמְאוֹת – טוּמְאַת עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, וְטוּמְאַת גִּילּוּי עֲרָיוֹת, וְטוּמְאַת שְׁפִיכוּת דָּמִים.
human_translation: The Master said: With regard to this matter, I can to amplify three impurities: The impurity of idol worship, and the impurity of forbidden sexual relations, and the impurity of bloodshed.

hebrew_text: בְּמֵזִיד – וְלָא אַתְרוֹ בֵּיהּ, בְּשׁוֹגֵג – וְלָא אִתְיְדַע לֵיהּ. אִי נָמֵי, בְּהָנָךְ דְּלָאו בְּנֵי גָלוּת נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: intentionally but did not forewarn him unwittingly, but he had not become aware of Alternatively, to those which is not subject to exile,
llm_translation: Intentional – and not found in it, unintentional – and not known to him. In truth, they are like the children of the exile who are not knowledgeable.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: יָכוֹל עַל שָׁלֹשׁ טְומָאוֹת הַלָּלוּ יְהֵא שָׂעִיר מְכַפֵּר? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״מִטֻּמְאוֹת״ – וְלֹא כׇּל טוּמְאוֹת; מָה מָצִינוּ שֶׁחָלַק הַכָּתוּב מִכְּלָל כׇּל הַטְּומָאוֹת – בְּטוּמְאַת מִקְדָּשׁ וְקָדָשָׁיו; אַף כָּאן – בְּטוּמְאַת מִקְדָּשׁ וְקָדָשָׁיו. דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: The Master said: might the goat would atone for these three impurities. the verse states: “From the impurities but not all impurities. What do we find that the verse differentiates from all impurities? with regard to defiling of Temple or its sacrificial So too here, for defiling of Temple or its sacrificial the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: Master said: Can the scapegoat atone for these three impurities? The verse teaches: "from impurities" - not all impurities; just as we found that the Scripture distinguished from all impurities - in the impurity of the Sanctuary and its holy items, so too here - in the impurity of the Sanctuary and its holy items. These are the words of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: מַאי חָלַק? דְּמַיְיתֵי בְּעוֹלֶה וְיוֹרֵד. אֵימָא עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, וּמַאי חָלַק –

hebrew_text: (סִימַן: עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, יוֹלֶדֶת, מְצוֹרָע, נָזִיר וְכוּ׳)
human_translation: a mnemonic Idol worship, a woman after childbirth, a leper, a nazirite, etc.
llm_translation: Tractate: Avodah Zarah, Yoledet, Metzora, Nazir, etc.

hebrew_text: דְּמַיְיתֵי שְׂעִירָה וְלֹא כִּשְׂבָּה!
human_translation: that he brings a she-goat and not an ewe,
llm_translation: It resembles a goat and not a sheep!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: אֲנַן חָלַק לְהָקֵל קָאָמְרִינַן, וְהַאי חָלַק לְהַחְמִיר הוּא.
human_translation: Rav Kahana said: We said differentiates to be lenient but this is differentiates to be stringent
llm_translation: Rav Kahana said: We are speaking of dividing to be lenient, while this one is dividing to be stringent.

hebrew_text: אֵימָא יוֹלֶדֶת – דְּחָלַק, דְּמַיְיתָא עוֹלֶה וְיוֹרֵד! אָמַר רַב הוֹשַׁעְיָא: ״לְכׇל חַטֹּאתָם״ – וְלֹא לְכׇל טוּמְאֹתָם.
human_translation: say a woman after childbirth, as differentiates that she brings a sliding-scale Rav Hoshaya said: “For all their sins” and not: For all their impurities.
llm_translation: Mother giving birth - that he divided, that similar goes up and comes down! Rav Hoshaya said: "For all their sins" - and not for all their impurities.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַאי דְּאָמַר יוֹלֶדֶת נָמֵי חוֹטֵאת הִיא, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר: מִמְּקוֹמוֹ הוּא מוּכְרָע.
human_translation: But according to Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai, who says: A woman after childbirth she is also a sinner, what is there to say? Rabbi Shimon to his reasoning, as he said From its own place, it determined
llm_translation: And for Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai who said: "A woman giving birth is considered as if she is a sinner." What is there to say? Rabbi Shimon according to his reasoning, for he said: "He is bent over from his place."

hebrew_text: אֵימָא מְצוֹרָע! אָמַר רַב הוֹשַׁעְיָא: ״לְכׇל חַטֹּאתָם״ – וְלֹא לְכׇל טוּמְאֹתָם.
human_translation: say a leper, Rav Hoshaya said: “For all their sins” and not: For all their impurities.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Eima Metzora! Amar Rav Hoshaya: 'Lekhol chatotam' - ve'lo lekhol tum'otam." English translation: "Say 'Metzora'! Rav Hoshaya said: 'For all their sins' - and not for all their impurities."

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי, דְּאָמַר: עַל שִׁבְעָה דְּבָרִים נְגָעִים בָּאִין – מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? הָתָם נִגְעֵיהּ דְּאִכַּפַּר לֵיהּ, וְקׇרְבָּן לְאִישְׁתְּרוֹיֵי בַּקָּהָל.
human_translation: But according to Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani, who says: marks come for seven matters, what is there to say? There, his mark that atones for and offering to permit him to the congregation,
llm_translation: For Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani, who said: On seven things afflictions come - what is there to say? There, its afflictions atone for it, and a sacrifice for those remaining in the congregation.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא נָזִיר טָמֵא – דְּחָלַק, דְּמַיְיתֵי תּוֹרִים וּבְנֵי יוֹנָה! אָמַר רַב הוֹשַׁעְיָא: ״לְכׇל חַטֹּאתָם״ – וְלֹא לְכׇל טוּמְאֹתָם.
human_translation: But say a nazirite ritually impure, as differentiates that he brings doves or young pigeons? Rav Hoshaya said: “For all their sins” and not: For all their impurities.
llm_translation: "And why is a Nazir who becomes impure - because he differentiates, as he brings sacrifices of doves and young pigeons! Rav Hoshaya said: 'For all their sins' - and not for all their impurities."

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר הַקַּפָּר, דְּאָמַר נָזִיר נָמֵי חוֹטֵא הוּא, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, דְּאָמַר: מִמְּקוֹמוֹ הוּא מוּכְרָע.
human_translation: But according to Rabbi Elazar HaKappar, who says: A nazirite is also a sinner what is there to say? He holds in accordance with Rabbi Shimon, who says From its own place, it determined
llm_translation: And to Rabbi Elazar HaKappar, for he said, "A Nazirite is considered a sinner." What is there to say? He holds like Rabbi Shimon, for he said: "He is uprooted from his place."

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: מִמְּקוֹמוֹ הוּא מוּכְרָע; הֲרֵי הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וְכִפֶּר עַל הַקֹּדֶשׁ מִטֻּמְאוֹת״ – מִטּוּמְאָתוֹ שֶׁל קוֹדֶשׁ כּוּ׳. שַׁפִּיר קָאָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן! וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אָמַר לָךְ: הַהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ – כִּי הֵיכִי דְּעָבֵיד לִפְנַי וְלִפְנִים, הָכִי נַעֲבֵיד בַּהֵיכָל.
human_translation: The Master said: Rabbi Shimon says: from its place, it determined, as it states: “And he shall effect atonement upon the Sanctuary [ hakodesh ] from the impurities for defiling of sacred [ kodesh ], Rabbi Shimon is saying well; Rabbi Yehuda said to you: That is necessary in the same that he performs in the innermost sanctum, that is how he shall perform in the Sanctuary.
llm_translation: Master said, Rabbi Shimon says: He is inclined from his place; behold he says: "And he shall make atonement for the sanctuary from the impurities" - from the impurity of the sanctuary. Beautifully Rabbi Shimon said! And Rabbi Yehuda said to him: That one requires you - in order to do before and inside, so shall we do in the sanctuary.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן – הַהוּא מִ״וְּכֵן יַעֲשֶׂה״ נָפְקָא. וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה – אִי מֵהַהִיא, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא נַיְתֵי פַּר וְשָׂעִיר אַחֲרִינֵי וְנַעֲבֵיד; קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן. וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, ״וְכֵן יַעֲשֶׂה לְאֹהֶל מוֹעֵד״ – מִינֵּיהּ מַשְׁמַע.
human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon That is derived from “And so shall he do And Rabbi Yehuda if from that I would say he should bring another bull and goat, and perform teaches us And Rabbi Shimon “And so shall he do to the Tent of Meeting,” indicates from
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon - "HaHu mi'ukhen ya'aseh" napka. And Rabbi Yehuda - If from that, would have said bring another bull and goat and we will do; he heard for us. And Rabbi Shimon, "And so he shall do for the Tent of Meeting" - from it he heard.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: יָכוֹל עַל כׇּל טוּמְאוֹת שֶׁבַּקּוֹדֶשׁ יְהֵא שָׂעִיר זֶה מְכַפֵּר? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״מִפִּשְׁעֵיהֶם לְכׇל חַטֹּאתָם וְגוֹ׳״. מַאי נִיהוּ – יֵשׁ בָּהּ יְדִיעָה בַּתְּחִלָּה וְיֵשׁ בָּהּ יְדִיעָה בַּסּוֹף; הַאי בַּר קׇרְבָּן הוּא!
human_translation: The Master said: might this goat would atone for all defiling of Temple, the verse states: “And from their acts of rebellion, for all their sins” What is had awareness at the beginning and had awareness at the end. that is subject to an offering.
llm_translation: Master said: Can this goat atone for all impurities in the Holy Temple? Scripture states: "From their iniquities for all their sins, etc." What is the difference? It has initial knowledge and final knowledge; this is a sin-offering!

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּאִתְיְדַע לֵיהּ סָמוּךְ לִשְׁקִיעַת הַחַמָּה. סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: אַדְּמַיְיתֵי
human_translation: No, necessary which he became aware close to sunset enter your mind to say until he brings
llm_translation: Not necessary, for it is known to him near the setting of the sun. If you ask my opinion, I would say: it is like.

hebrew_text: נִיתְלֵי לֵיהּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: would suspend teaches us
llm_translation: It was revealed to him, he is informing us.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: מִנַּיִן שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ יְדִיעָה בַּתְּחִלָּה וְאֵין בָּהּ יְדִיעָה בַּסּוֹף שֶׁשָּׂעִיר זֶה תּוֹלֶה? מִנַּיִן?! מַאי קָא קַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ?
human_translation: The Master said: From where had awareness at the beginning but did not have awareness at the end, that this goat suspends From where What is difficult
llm_translation: Master said: From where do we know that there is knowledge at the beginning and no knowledge at the end, that this goat is dependent? From where?! What is difficult for him?

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָא קַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ: הַשְׁתָּא דְּאָמְרַתְּ חֲטָאִים דּוּמְיָא דִּפְשָׁעִים – מָה פְּשָׁעִים דְּלָאו בְּנֵי קׇרְבָּן, אַף חַטָּאִים נָמֵי דְּלָאו בְּנֵי קׇרְבָּן; אֵימָא: מָה פְּשָׁעִים דְּלָאו בְּנֵי קׇרְבָּן לְעוֹלָם, אַף חַטָּאִים דְּלָאו בְּנֵי קׇרְבָּן לְעוֹלָם; וּמַאי נִינְהוּ – אִין בָּהּ יְדִיעָה בַּתְּחִלָּה וְיֵשׁ בָּהּ יְדִיעָה בַּסּוֹף; אֲבָל יֵשׁ בָּהּ יְדִיעָה בַּתְּחִלָּה וְאֵין בָּהּ יְדִיעָה בַּסּוֹף, כֵּיוָן דְּכִי מִתְיְדַע לֵיהּ בַּר קׇרְבָּן הוּא – אֵימָא לָא לִיתְלֵי!
human_translation: This is what difficult: Now that you have said sins similar to acts of rebellion, just as acts of rebellion that are not subject to an offering, so too, sins that are not subject to an offering, say: Just as acts of rebellion that are never subject to an offering, so too, sins that are never subject to an offering? And what are they? did not have awareness at the beginning but did have awareness at the end. But where he had awareness at the beginning but did not have awareness at the end, since when he becomes aware, he subject to an offering, say will not suspend
llm_translation: So difficult is the question for him: Now that you say sins are similar to transgressions - just as transgressions that are not related to sacrificial offerings, so too sins that are not related to sacrificial offerings; say: just as transgressions that are not related to sacrificial offerings are eternal, so too sins that are not related to sacrificial offerings are eternal; and what are they - it does not have initial knowledge and has final knowledge; but if it has initial knowledge and does not have final knowledge, since when he becomes aware that it is related to sacrificial offerings - say that it should not be left!

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵימָא: אֵין בָּהּ יְדִיעָה בַּתְּחִלָּה וְיֵשׁ בָּהּ יְדִיעָה בַּסּוֹף – שָׂעִיר הַנַּעֲשֶׂה בַּחוּץ וְיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים מְכַפֵּר;
human_translation: And if you would say did not have awareness at the beginning but did have awareness at the end, goat whose performed outside and Yom Kippur atone,
llm_translation: And if you will say: there is no knowledge in it at the beginning and there is knowledge in it at the end - the goat that is done outside and Yom Kippur atones.

hebrew_text: סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא נֵיפוֹךְ מֵיפָךְ, אָמַר קְרָא ״לְכׇל חַטֹּאתָם״ – מִכְּלָל דִּבְנֵי חַטָּאוֹת נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: enter your mind to say that we should reverse the verse states: “For all their sins,” by inference those who are liable to a sin-offering,
llm_translation: I will say that your opinion is incorrect, for the verse says, "For all their sins" - indicating that they are included in the category of sin offerings.

hebrew_text: וְנִתְכַּפַּר [וּנְכַפַּר] כַּפָּרָה גְּמוּרָה! אִי כְּתִיב ״מֵחַטֹּאתָם״ – כִּדְקָא אָמְרַתְּ, הַשְׁתָּא דִּכְתִיב ״לְכׇל חַטֹּאתָם״ – לְהָנָךְ דְּאָתוּ לִכְלַל חַטָּאת.
human_translation: But let achieve complete atonement, If it were written: From their sins, as you say, now that it is written: “For all their sins,” to those whose become subject to a sin-offering.
llm_translation: And atonement shall be made, complete atonement! If it is written "from their sin" - as you said, now that it is written "for all their sins" - to include those that come to include sin.

hebrew_text: וְכִי מֵאַחַר שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְכַפֵּר, לָמָּה תּוֹלֶה? אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: לוֹמַר שֶׁאִם מֵת – מֵת בְּלֹא עָוֹן. אָמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: אִם מֵת – מִיתָה מְמָרֶקֶת! אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: לְהָגֵן עָלָיו מִן הַיִּסּוּרִין.
human_translation: But once that does not effect atonement, to what does it suspend Rabbi Zeira said: to say that if he dies he dies without sin. Rava said to him: If he dies, death cleanses him Rather, Rava said to protect him from suffering
llm_translation: And when he does not atone, why does he hang? Rabbi Zeira said: To say that if he dies - he dies without sin. Rava said to him: If he dies - it is a death by strangulation! Rather, Rava said: To protect him from afflictions.

hebrew_text: אֵין בָּהּ יְדִיעָה בַּתְּחִלָּה וְיֵשׁ בָּהּ יְדִיעָה בַּסּוֹף – שָׂעִיר הַנַּעֲשֶׂה בַּחוּץ וְיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים מְכַפֵּר כּוּ׳.
human_translation: did not have awareness at the beginning but had awareness at the end, goat whose performed outside and Yom Kippur atone.
llm_translation: There is no knowledge in it at the beginning, and there is knowledge in it at the end - the scapegoat that is done outside, and Yom Kippur atones.

hebrew_text: מִכְּדֵי אִיתַּקּוֹשֵׁי אִיתַּקּוּשׁ לַהֲדָדֵי, וּנְכַפַּר פְּנִימִי אַדִּידֵיהּ וְאַדְּחִיצוֹן – וְנָפְקָא מִינַּהּ לְהֵיכָא דְּלָא עֲבַד חִיצוֹן! אָמַר קְרָא: ״אַחַת״ – כַּפָּרָה אַחַת מְכַפֵּר, וְאֵינוֹ מְכַפֵּר שְׁתֵּי כַּפָּרוֹת.
human_translation: Now, juxtaposes with each other But let the internal atone for itself, and for that which external and difference where, external was not performed. The verse states: once effects one atonement but cannot effect two atonements
llm_translation: From the fact that they were intertwined, they were intertwined for Hadadei, and the inner atonement was atoned for, and the outer atonement - and it emerged from her to where the outer atonement was not done! The verse says: "one" - one atonement atones, and it does not atone for two atonements.

hebrew_text: וּנְכַפַּר חִיצוֹן אַדִּידֵיהּ, וְאַמַּאי דְּעָבֵיד פְּנִימִי – נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ לְטוּמְאָה דְּאֵירְעָה בֵּין זֶה לְזֶה! אָמַר קְרָא: ״אַחַת בַּשָּׁנָה״ – כַּפָּרָה זוֹ לֹא תְּהֵא
human_translation: But let external atone for itself, and for that which internal does difference of defiling that occurred between this and that The verse states: once a year” this atonement, should be
llm_translation: And atones outer, its, and why inner does - goes out of it to impurity of it that occurred between this to this! Said scripture: "Once in the year" - atonement this not shall be.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אַחַת בַּשָּׁנָה.
human_translation: only once a year.
llm_translation: Rather, one in the year.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל דְּאָמַר אֵין בָּהּ יְדִיעָה בַּתְּחִלָּה וְיֵשׁ בָּהּ יְדִיעָה בַּסּוֹף בַּר קׇרְבָּן הוּא, שָׂעִיר הַנַּעֲשֶׂה בַּחוּץ אַמַּאי מְכַפֵּר? עַל שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ יְדִיעָה לֹא בַּתְּחִלָּה וְלֹא בַּסּוֹף.
human_translation: And according to Rabbi Yishmael, who says: in which did not have awareness at the beginning but did have awareness at the end, is liable to an offering, for what does goat whose performed outside atone? for in which did not have awareness, in the beginning, nor in the end.
llm_translation: To Rabbi Yishmael who said: There is no knowledge in it at the beginning, and there is knowledge in it at the end. Why is the he-goat that is done outside atonement? Because it has no knowledge neither at the beginning nor at the end.

hebrew_text: הַאי שְׂעִירֵי הָרְגָלִים וּשְׂעִירֵי רָאשֵׁי חֳדָשִׁים מְכַפְּרִין! סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר, דְּאָמַר: כׇּל הַשְּׂעִירִים כַּפָּרָתָן שָׁוָה – עַל טוּמְאַת מִקְדָּשׁ וְקָדָשָׁיו.
human_translation: that the goats of the Festivals and the goats of New Moons atone. He holds in accordance with Rabbi Meir, who says: atonement effected by all the goats is the same: for defiling of Temple or its sacrificial
llm_translation: These are the goats of the festivals and the goats of the new moons atone! He thought like Rabbi Meir, who said: All the goats, their atonement is equal - for the impurity of the Sanctuary and its holy things.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְמַאי הִלְכְתָא אִיתַּקַּשׁ חִיצוֹן לִפְנִימִי? מָה פְּנִימִי אֵינוֹ מְכַפֵּר בִּשְׁאָר עֲבֵירוֹת, אַף חִיצוֹן אֵינוֹ מְכַפֵּר בִּשְׁאָר עֲבֵירוֹת.
human_translation: But with regard to what halakha juxtapose internal with external just as internal does not atone for other transgressions, so too, external does not atone for other transgressions.
llm_translation: Instead, for what purpose is the outer altar connected to the inner? Just as the inner altar does not atone for other transgressions, so too the outer altar does not atone for other transgressions.

hebrew_text: עַל שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ יְדִיעָה בַּתְּחִלָּה וְלֹא בַּסּוֹף, שְׂעִירֵי רְגָלִים וּשְׂעִירֵי רָאשֵׁי חֳדָשִׁים מְכַפְּרִין. דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: For in which did not have awareness, at the beginning nor at the end, the goats of the Festivals and the goats of New Moons atone. the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: Regarding that which does not have knowledge at the beginning nor at the end, goats of the feet and goats of the heads of months atone. The words of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה? אָמַר קְרָא: ״וּשְׂעִיר עִזִּים אֶחָד לְחַטָּאת לַה׳״ – חֵטְא שֶׁאֵין מַכִּיר בּוֹ אֶלָּא ה׳, יְהֵא שָׂעִיר זֶה מְכַפֵּר.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: What is the reasoning of Rabbi Yehuda? The verse states “And one goat for a sin-offering to the Lord” this goat atones a sin of which only the Lord is aware,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: What is the reason for Rabbi Yehudah's opinion? The verse states: "And one he-goat for a sin-offering to the Lord" - a sin that only the Lord recognizes, let this goat atone.

hebrew_text: וְהַאי מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ – דְּאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: מָה נִשְׁתַּנָּה שָׂעִיר שֶׁל רֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר בּוֹ ״לַה׳״? אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: שָׂעִיר זֶה יְהֵא כַּפָּרָה עַל שֶׁמִּיעַטְתִּי אֶת הַיָּרֵחַ.
human_translation: But this is necessary to in accordance with of Reish Lakish, as Reish Lakish says: What is different goat of New Moon that is stated with regard to it: “To the Lord,” The Holy One, Blessed be He, says, This goat shall be an atonement for that I diminished the moon.
llm_translation: This is what he wanted to teach him according to Reish Lakish - as Reish Lakish said: How is the goat of Rosh Chodesh different, that it is said about it "to the Lord"? The Holy One, blessed be He, said: Let this goat be an atonement for that I have diminished the moon.

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן, לֵימָא קְרָא ״עַל ה׳״; מַאי ״לַה׳״? לִכְדַאֲמַרַן.
human_translation: If so, let the verse state for the Lord. what “To the Lord”? to in accordance with that which we have said,
llm_translation: If so, let us say the verse "upon Hashem"; what is "to Hashem"? As we have said.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא כּוּלֵּיהּ לְהָכִי הוּא דַּאֲתָא! אִם כֵּן, נֵימָא קְרָא: ״חַטָּאת ה׳״; מַאי ״לַה׳״? שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ תַּרְתֵּי.
human_translation: But say whole of comes to this If so, let the verse state: A sin-offering of the Lord. what “To the Lord”? You conclude two from it.
llm_translation: And why is it that he came in its entirety like this? If so, let us say the verse: "Sin offering to the Lord." What is "to the Lord"? You learn two from it.

hebrew_text: וּנְכַפַּר נָמֵי אֲפִילּוּ בִּשְׁאָר עֲבֵירוֹת! תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: הוֹאִיל וְזֶה בָּא בִּזְמַן קָבוּעַ וְזֶה בָּא בִּזְמַן קָבוּעַ; מָה זֶה אֵינוֹ מְכַפֵּר אֶלָּא עַל טוּמְאַת מִקְדָּשׁ וְקָדָשָׁיו, אַף זֶה אֵינוֹ מְכַפֵּר אֶלָּא עַל טוּמְאַת מִקְדָּשׁ וְקָדָשָׁיו.
human_translation: But let atone even for other transgressions of the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: Since this is brought at a fixed time, and that is brought at a fixed time, Just as that atones only for defiling of Temple or its sacrificial so too, this atones only for defiling of Temple or its sacrificial
llm_translation: And atones blood even in other sins! It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: Since this one comes at an appointed time, and this one comes at an appointed time; just as this one atones only for impurity of the sanctuary and its holy things, so too this one atones only for impurity of the sanctuary and its holy things.

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחַן שְׂעִירֵי רָאשֵׁי חֳדָשִׁים, שְׂעִירֵי הָרְגָלִים מְנָלַן? וְכִי תֵּימָא הָא נָמֵי כִּדְתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, אִיכָּא לְמִיפְרַךְ: אִי מִדְּרֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ – שֶׁכֵּן תָּדִיר, אִי מִדְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים – שֶׁכֵּן מְרוּבָּה כַּפָּרָתוֹ! וְכִי תֵּימָא
human_translation: We found goats of New Moons From where do we goats of the Festivals And if you would say this also in accordance with that of the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught, can be refuted If through of New Moon, as frequent if through of Yom Kippur, as has extensive atonement, And if you would say:
llm_translation: I found the goats of Rosh Chodesh, where are the goats of the festivals from? And if you will say, is it not as it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael, there is room to distinguish: if from the beginning of the month - for it is frequent, if from Yom Kippur - for its atonement is more abundant! And if you will say...

hebrew_text: הָא גָּמְרִינַן רֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ מִדְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים וְלָא פָּרְכִינַן; הָתָם – כַּפָּרָה מִיכְתָּב כְּתִיבָא, גַּלּוֹיֵי מִילְּתָא בְּעָלְמָא הוּא; אֲבָל הָכָא – אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר כּוּלַּהּ מִילְּתָא לָא גָּמְרִינַן!
human_translation: Don’t we derive New Moon through of Yom Kippur and we did not refute it There, atonement is written merely revealing a matter, But here, it is to say we do not derive the entire matter
llm_translation: Here we have learned that the head of the month is concluded from the day of Yom Kippur, and we do not interpose. There - atonement is explicitly written in the verse, it is a revealed matter in the world; but here - there is no need to say that we do not conclude the entire matter!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא כִּדְאָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: ״שְׂעִיר״–״וּשְׂעִיר״; הָכָא נָמֵי ״שְׂעִיר״–״וּשְׂעִיר״, וְאִיתַּקּוּשׁ שְׂעִירֵי רְגָלִים לִשְׂעִירֵי רָאשֵׁי חֳדָשִׁים; מַה שְׂעִירֵי רָאשֵׁי חֳדָשִׁים אֵינָן מְכַפְּרִין אֶלָּא עַל שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ יְדִיעָה לֹא בַּתְּחִלָּה וְלֹא בַּסּוֹף, אַף שְׂעִירֵי הָרְגָלִים אֵינָן מְכַפְּרִין אֶלָּא עַל שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ יְדִיעָה לֹא בַּתְּחִלָּה וְלֹא בַּסּוֹף.
human_translation: Rather, as Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says A goat, “And a goat.” Here too, A goat, “And a goat,” goats of Festivals are juxtaposed with goat of the New Moon, Just as goats of New Moon atone only for in which did not have awareness, neither at the beginning nor at the end, so too, goats of the Festivals atone only for in which did not have awareness, neither at the beginning nor at the end.
llm_translation: Rather, as Rabbi Ḥama son of Rabbi Ḥanina said: "Se'ir" - "and se'ir"; here it is stated "se'ir" - "and se'ir," and the atonement of the goats of the festivals is compared to the atonement of the goats of the New Moons. Just as the goats of the New Moons only atone for sins of unwitting transgression, both at the outset and at the end, so too the goats of the festivals only atone for sins of unwitting transgression, both at the outset and at the end.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: כִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה עַל שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ יְדִיעָה לֹא בַּתְּחִלָּה וְלֹא בַּסּוֹף – הָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּחֵטְא שֶׁאֵין סוֹפוֹ לִיוָּדַע, אֲבָל חֵטְא שֶׁסּוֹפוֹ לִיוָּדַע – כְּמִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ יְדִיעָה בַּסּוֹף דָּמֵי, וְשָׂעִיר הַנַּעֲשֶׂה בַּחוּץ וְיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים מְכַפֵּר; אוֹ דִלְמָא אֲפִילּוּ חֵטְא שֶׁסּוֹפוֹ לִיוָּדַע – הַשְׁתָּא מִיהָא, חֵטְא שֶׁאֵין מַכִּיר בּוֹ אֶלָּא ה׳ קָרֵינָא בֵּיהּ?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before When Rabbi Yehuda says for in which did not have awareness, neither at the beginning nor at the end, that statement to a sin that will never eventually become known, but a sin that will eventually become known, like one who has awareness at the end, and goat whose performed outside and Yom Kippur atone Or perhaps, even a sin that will eventually become known, now, at least, I can call it a sin of which only God is aware,
llm_translation: He asked them: When Rabbi Yehuda said regarding a sin offering that it lacks awareness neither at the beginning nor at the end - those words pertain to a sin that has no end to its awareness. But a sin that has an end to its awareness is comparable to one that has awareness at the end, and the scapegoat that is done outside and Yom Kippur atones; or perhaps even a sin that has an end to its awareness - now, a sin that only God recognizes is called by it?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּתַנְיָא: עַל שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ יְדִיעָה לֹא בַּתְּחִלָּה וְלֹא בַּסּוֹף, וְחֵטְא שֶׁסּוֹפוֹ לִיוָּדַע – שְׂעִירֵי הָרְגָלִים וּשְׂעִירֵי רָאשֵׁי חֳדָשִׁים מְכַפְּרִים. דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: Come hear as it is taught For in which did not have awareness, neither at the beginning nor at the end, and a sin that will eventually become known, goats of the Festivals and goats of New Moons atone. the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: Come and hear, as it was taught: For a sin offering that lacks awareness, neither at the beginning nor at the end, and a sin whose end is to be known - the goats of the Festivals and the goats of the New Moons atone. These are the words of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: שְׂעִירֵי הָרְגָלִים מְכַפְּרִין, אֲבָל לֹא שְׂעִירֵי רָאשֵׁי חֳדָשִׁים וְכוּ׳.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: goats of the Festivals atone but goats of New Moons not.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: The goats of the festivals atone, but not the goats of the new moons, and so on.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא: מַאי טַעְמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן? אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְאֹתָהּ נָתַן לָכֶם לָשֵׂאת אֶת עֲוֹן הָעֵדָה״, וְהַאי קְרָא בְּשָׂעִיר דְּרֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ כְּתִיב; וְיָלֵיף ״עָוֹן״–״עָוֹן״ מִצִּיץ – נֶאֱמַר כָּאן ״עֲוֹן״, וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן ״עֲוֹן״; מָה לְהַלָּן טוּמְאַת בָּשָׂר, אַף כָּאן טוּמְאַת בָּשָׂר.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says Rabbi Oshaya says: What is the reasoning of Rabbi Shimon? The verse states: “And He gave it to you to bear the sin of the congregation” and this verse is written with regard to goat of New Moon. And is derived from the frontplate “sin” “sin” It is stated here, “Sin,” and it is stated there, “Sin.” Just as there, ritual impurity of meat, so too here, ritual impurity of meat,
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said, Rabbi Oshaya said: What is the reason of Rabbi Shimon? The verse says, "And he gave it to you to bear the iniquity of the congregation." And this verse is written in the context of the he-goat of the new moon. And it is derived: "Iniquity" - "iniquity" is mentioned regarding the forehead plate - it is stated here as "iniquity," and it is stated there as "iniquity." Just as there it is the impurity of the flesh, so too here it is the impurity of the flesh.

hebrew_text: אִי מָה לְהַלָּן עוֹלִין, אַף כָּאן עוֹלִין?! ״עֲוֹן הָעֵדָה״ כְּתִיב.
human_translation: If Just as there, ascends so too here, ascends is written the sin of the congregation.”
llm_translation: Here is the English word-for-word translation of the Talmudic text: "If what there they go up, also here they go up?! 'The sin of the congregation' is written."

hebrew_text: מִכְּדֵי מִיגְמָר גָּמְרִי מֵהֲדָדֵי; נְכַפַּר דְּרֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ אַדִּידֵיהּ וְאַדְּצִיץ – נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ לְהֵיכָא דְּנִשְׁבַּר הַצִּיץ! אָמַר קְרָא: ״עֲוֹן״ – עָוֹן אֶחָד הוּא נוֹשֵׂא, וְאֵין נוֹשֵׂא שְׁנֵי עֲוֹנוֹת.
human_translation: Now, are derived from one another let of New Moon atone for itself, and for that which the frontplate difference where the frontplate was broken. The verse states the sin it bears, one sin, but does not bear two sins.
llm_translation: From the time that I have completed my study from Haddadai; the sin of the head of the month, its adornment and its flower - it emerged from it to the place where the flower was broken! The verse says: "sin" - it is one sin that it bears, and it does not bear two sins.

hebrew_text: וּנְכַפַּר צִיץ אַדִּידֵיהּ וְאַדְּרֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ – נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ לְטוּמְאָה דְּאֵירְעָה בֵּין זֶה לְזֶה! אָמַר קְרָא: ״אוֹתָהּ״ – אוֹתָהּ נוֹשֵׂא עָוֹן, וְאֵין אַחֶרֶת נוֹשֵׂא עָוֹן.
human_translation: But let frontplate atone for itself, and for of New Moon difference defiling that occurred between this and that The verse states it it bears, sin, but another does not bear sin.
llm_translation: "And atonement shall be made for the crown of the head and for the forehead of the month - it emerges from here to impurity that occurred between one and the other! The verse says: 'it' - it alone bears iniquity, and no other bears iniquity."

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: כְּתִיב הָכָא ״עֲוֹן הָעֵדָה״ – עֵדָה וְלֹא קָדָשִׁים, וְהָתָם כְּתִיב ״עֲוֹן הַקֳּדָשִׁים״ – קָדָשִׁים וְלֹא עֵדָה.
human_translation: Rav Ashi states It is stated here “The sin of the congregation,” congregation, but not the sacred offerings. And there, it is written: “The sin of the sacred offerings,” sacred offerings, but not congregation.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: It is written here "the sin of the congregation" - congregation and not holy things, and there it is written "the sin of the holy things" - holy things and not congregation.

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחַן שְׂעִירֵי רָאשֵׁי חֳדָשִׁים דִּמְכַפְּרִי עַל טָהוֹר שֶׁאָכַל אֶת הַטָּמֵא; שְׂעִירֵי רְגָלִים דִּמְכַפְּרִי עַל שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ יְדִיעָה לֹא בַּתְּחִלָּה וְלֹא בַּסּוֹף – מְנָלַן?
human_translation: We found goats of New Moons, that they atone for a ritually pure who partook of ritually impure From where do we goats of Festivals, that they atone for in which did not have awareness, neither at the beginning nor at the end?
llm_translation: I found the he-goats of the heads of the months, which atone for the pure one who ate from the impure; the he-goats of the festivals, which atone for one who had no knowledge, neither at the beginning nor at the end - from where do we derive this?

hebrew_text: כִּדְאָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: ״שְׂעִיר״–״וּשְׂעִיר״, הָכָא נָמֵי ״שְׂעִיר״–״וּשְׂעִיר״,
human_translation: as Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says, A goat, “And a goat,” Here too, A goat, “And a goat,”
llm_translation: As Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said: "Se'ir" - "and Se'ir," here it is stated "Se'ir" - "and Se'ir."

hebrew_text: וְאִיתַּקּוּשׁ שְׂעִירֵי הָרְגָלִים לִשְׂעִירֵי רָאשֵׁי חֳדָשִׁים; מָה שָׂעִיר דְּרֹאשׁ חוֹדֶשׁ בְּמִילְּתָא דְּקוֹדֶשׁ מְכַפְּרִי, אַף שְׂעִירֵי רְגָלִים בְּמִילְּתָא דְּקוֹדֶשׁ מְכַפְּרִי.
human_translation: And goats of Festivals are juxtaposed with goats of New Moons, just as goats of New Moons atone for a case involving sacrificial so too, goats of the Festivals atone for case involving sacrificial
llm_translation: And they tied the hairs of the scapegoats to the hairs of the new moon goats; just as the goat of the new moon atones in matters of holiness, so too the scapegoats atone in matters of holiness.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא נִיכַפְּרוּ אַדְּרֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ – הָא אָמְרִינַן: ״אוֹתָהּ״ – אוֹתָהּ נוֹשֵׂא עָוֹן, וְאֵין אַחֵר נוֹשֵׂא עָוֹן.
human_translation: And if you would say: Let atone for of New Moon Didn’t we say it it bears, sin but another does not bear sin?
llm_translation: And if you say, "Perhaps the New Moon of Adar has already been atoned for" - we say: "That one" - that one bears the iniquity, and no other bears the iniquity.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא נִיכַפְּרוּ אַדְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים – הָא אָמְרִינַן: ״אַחַת בַּשָּׁנָה״ – כַּפָּרָה זוֹ לֹא תְּהֵא אֶלָּא אַחַת בַּשָּׁנָה.
human_translation: And if you would say: Let atone for of Yom Kippur Didn’t we say once a year” this atonement should be only once a year.
llm_translation: And if you will say, "Perhaps the atonements of Yom Kippur were already atoned for," we say: "Once a year" - this atonement should only be once a year.

hebrew_text: אַמַּאי מְכַפְּרִי?
human_translation: for what could they atone?
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "mekapperi"?

hebrew_text: אִי עַל שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ יְדִיעָה בַּתְּחִלָּה וְיֵשׁ בָּהּ יְדִיעָה בַּסּוֹף – הַאי בַּר קׇרְבָּן הוּא! אִי עַל שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ יְדִיעָה בַּתְּחִלָּה וְאֵין בָּהּ יְדִיעָה בַּסּוֹף – הַאי שָׂעִיר הַנַּעֲשֶׂה בִּפְנִים וְיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים תּוֹלֶה! אִי עַל שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ יְדִיעָה בַּתְּחִלָּה אֲבָל יֵשׁ בָּהּ יְדִיעָה בַּסּוֹף – הַאי שָׂעִיר הַנַּעֲשֶׂה בַּחוּץ וְיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים מְכַפֵּר!
human_translation: If for in which had awareness at the beginning and had awareness at the end, that he is liable to an offering If for in which had awareness at the beginning but did not have awareness at the end, that goat whose performed inside and Yom Kippur suspend If for in which did not have awareness at the beginning but did have awareness at the end, that goat whose performed outside atones.
llm_translation: If it has knowledge at the beginning and has knowledge at the end - this is the Bar Korban! If it has knowledge at the beginning and does not have knowledge at the end - this is the goat that is offered inside and Yom Kippur depends on it! If it does not have knowledge at the beginning but has knowledge at the end - this is the goat that is offered outside and Yom Kippur atones!

hebrew_text: עַל כׇּרְחָךְ, אֵינוֹ מְכַפֵּר אֶלָּא עַל שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ יְדִיעָה לֹא בַּתְּחִלָּה וְלֹא בַּסּוֹף.
human_translation: Perforce, atone only for which did not have awareness, neither at the beginning nor at the end.
llm_translation: By force, he atones only for that which does not have knowledge neither at the beginning nor at the end.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: כׇּל הַשְּׂעִירִים כַּפָּרָתָן שָׁוָה כּוּ׳.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir says: atonement all the goats is the same.
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir says: all the goats their atonement equal.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בַּר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר? אָמַר קְרָא ״שְׂעִיר״–״וּשְׂעִיר״, הוּקְּשׁוּ כׇּל הַשְּׂעִירִים זֶה לָזֶה – וָי״ו מוֹסִיף עַל עִנְיָן רִאשׁוֹן.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥama bar Rabbi Ḥanina said: What is the reasoning of Rabbi Meir? the verse stated: A goat, “And a goat,” all the goats are juxtaposed, this with that “and” adds to the first matter,
llm_translation: Rabbi Ḥama son of Rabbi Ḥanina said: What is the reason for Rabbi Meir's opinion? The verse said "sa'ir" - "and sa'ir," all the sa'irim are juxtaposed to one another - and the "vav" adds to the first matter.

hebrew_text: קָסָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ כֹּל חַד וְחַד מֵחַבְרֵיהּ גָּמַר?! וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל הַתּוֹרָה כּוּלָּהּ לְמֵידִין לָמֵד מִלָּמֵד, חוּץ מִקֳּדָשִׁים שֶׁאֵין לְמֵידִין לָמֵד מִלָּמֵד!
human_translation: it enters your mind each and every one derived from adjacent to it, But doesn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say: the entire Torah, derives derived from derived except for consecrated where does not derive derived from derived
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Kaslaka of your mind, each and every one from his colleagues complete?! And Rabbi Yochanan said: The entire Torah is learned from a teacher, except for matters of holiness which are not learned from a teacher!"

hebrew_text: הָא לָא קַשְׁיָא, כּוּלְּהוּ מִקַּמָּא גָּמְרִי.
human_translation: This not difficult, all of is derived from the first
llm_translation: This is not difficult, all of them from the beginning finish.

hebrew_text: תִּינַח כֹּל דִּכְתִב בֵּיהּ ״וּשְׂעִיר״, עֲצֶרֶת וְיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים דְּלָא כְּתִב בֵּיהּ ״וּשְׂעִיר״ – מְנָלַן?
human_translation: works out well all with regard to which it is written: “And a goat,” from where do we Shavuot and Yom Kippur as with regard to them it is not written: And a goat,
llm_translation: "Let everything that is written in it 'and the goat,' Shavuot and Yom Kippur that do not have 'and the goat' written in them - from where?"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָה, אָמַר קְרָא: ״אֵלֶּה תַּעֲשׂוּ לַה׳ בְּמוֹעֲדֵיכֶם״ – הוּקְּשׁוּ כׇּל הַמּוֹעֲדִים כּוּלָּן זֶה לָזֶה. וְהָא רֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ לָאו מוֹעֵד הוּא!
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yona says: The verse states “These shall you offer to the Lord on your Festivals” all the Festivals are juxtaposed, this with that But New Moon is not a Festival.
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yonah said, the verse states: "These you shall offer to the Lord at your appointed feasts" - all the appointed feasts are interconnected. But isn't Rosh Chodesh not a festival!

hebrew_text: אִיבְרָא, רֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ נָמֵי אִיקְּרִי מוֹעֵד, כִּדְאָמַר אַבָּיֵי – דְּאָמַר אַבָּיֵי: תַּמּוּז דְּהַהִיא שַׁתָּא מַלּוֹיֵי מַלְּיוּהּוֹ, דִּכְתִיב: ״קָרָא עָלַי מוֹעֵד לִשְׁבֹּר בַּחוּרָי״.
human_translation: truth, New Moon is also called a Festival, in accordance with what Abaye says as Abaye says: Tammuz that year made it a full as it is written: “He proclaimed a festival to crush my young men”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Ivra, Rosh Chodesh namei ikri moed, kid'amr Abaye - d'amr Abaye: Tamuz deha'hi shata maloyei mal'yuhu, dikhtiv: "kara alai moed lishbor bachurai." English translation: Ivra, the new moon of the month, is also called a festival, as Abaye said - for Abaye said: In the month of Tamuz, the young men would fill it, as it is written: "He has called a solemn assembly against me to crush my young men."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: וּמוֹדֶה רַבִּי מֵאִיר בְּשָׂעִיר הַנַּעֲשֶׂה בִּפְנִים, שֶׁהוּא אֵינוֹ מְכַפֵּר כַּפָּרָתָן, וְהֵן אֵינָן מְכַפְּרִין כַּפָּרָתוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: And Rabbi Meir concedes with regard to goat whose performed inside that it does not atone their atonement, and they do not atone its atonement.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: And Rabbi Meir concedes regarding the goat that is made inside, that it does not atone for their atonement, and they do not atone for its atonement.

hebrew_text: הוּא אֵינוֹ מְכַפֵּר כַּפָּרָתָן – כַּפָּרָה אַחַת מְכַפֵּר, וְאֵינוֹ מְכַפֵּר שְׁתֵּי כַּפָּרוֹת. הֵן אֵינָן מְכַפְּרִין כַּפָּרָתוֹ – אָמַר קְרָא ״אַחַת בַּשָּׁנָה״, כַּפָּרָה זוֹ לֹא תְּהֵא אֶלָּא אַחַת בַּשָּׁנָה.
human_translation: It does not atone their atonement, effects one atonement but cannot effect two atonements they do not atone its atonement, the verse states: once a year.” this atonement should be only once a year.
llm_translation: He does not atone their atonement - one atonement atones, and he does not atone two atonements. They do not atone his atonement - the verse says "once a year," this atonement should only be once a year.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: עַל שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ יְדִיעָה לֹא בַּתְּחִלָּה וְלֹא בַּסּוֹף, וְעַל שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ יְדִיעָה בַּתְּחִלָּה אֲבָל יֵשׁ בָּהּ יְדִיעָה בַּסּוֹף, וְעַל טָהוֹר שֶׁאָכַל אֶת הַטָּמֵא – שְׂעִירֵי הָרְגָלִים וּשְׂעִירֵי רָאשֵׁי חֳדָשִׁים וְשָׂעִיר הַנַּעֲשֶׂה בַּחוּץ מְכַפְּרִין. דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: This is also taught For in which did not have awareness, neither at the beginning nor at the end, and for in which did not have awareness at the beginning but did have awareness at the end, and for a ritually pure person who partook of ritually impure goats of the Festivals and goats of New Moons and goat whose performed outside atone. the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: In a case where there is no knowledge of it neither at the beginning nor at the end, and in a case where there is no knowledge of it at the beginning but there is knowledge of it at the end, and regarding a pure person who ate from the impure offerings – the goats of the festivals, the goats of the New Moons, and the goat that was designated outside the Temple, they atone. These are the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: וְאִילּוּ שָׂעִיר הַנַּעֲשֶׂה בִּפְנִים שַׁיְּירֵהּ, (וכפרתן) [וְכַפָּרָתוֹ] נָמֵי שַׁיְּירַהּ.
human_translation: But omitted goat whose performed inside and their atonement, he also omitted it,
llm_translation: "And if a he-goat that was designated for inside the Temple becomes blemished, its atonement is valid."

hebrew_text: הָיָה רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: שְׂעִירֵי רָאשֵׁי חֳדָשִׁים מְכַפְּרִין עַל טָהוֹר שֶׁאָכַל אֶת הַטָּמֵא כּוּ׳.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon would say: goats of New Moons atone for a ritually pure who partook of ritually impure
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: "The goats of Rosh Chodesh atone for the pure one who ate from the impure one."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא דְּרָאשֵׁי חֳדָשִׁים לָא מְכַפְּרִי אַדִּרְגָלִים, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״עֲוֹן״ – עָוֹן אֶחָד הוּא נוֹשֵׂא, וְאֵינוֹ נוֹשֵׂא שְׁנֵי עֲוֹנוֹת. אֶלָּא דִּרְגָלִים נִיכַפְּרוּ אַדְּרָאשֵׁי חֳדָשִׁים! אָמַר קְרָא: ״אוֹתָהּ״ – אוֹתָהּ נוֹשֵׂא עָוֹן, וְאֵין אַחֵר נוֹשֵׂא עָוֹן.
human_translation: Granted, of New Moons do not atone for of Festivals as the verse states sin it bears, one sin but does not bear two sins. But let of Festivals atone for of New Moons atone. The verse states: it it bears sin, but no other bears sin.
llm_translation: In truth, the heads of the months do not atone for festivals, as the verse states: "sin" - it is one sin that it bears, and it does not bear two sins. Rather, festivals atone for the heads of the months! The verse states: "it" - it bears that sin, and no other bears that sin.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא דִּרְגָלִים לָא מְכַפְּרִין אַדְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים, דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״אַחַת בַּשָּׁנָה״ – כַּפָּרָה זוֹ לֹא תְּהֵא אֶלָּא אַחַת בַּשָּׁנָה. אֶלָּא דְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים נִיכַפְּרוּ אַדִּרְגָלִים! אָמַר קְרָא ״אַחַת״ – כַּפָּרָה אַחַת מְכַפֵּר, וְאֵינוֹ מְכַפֵּר שְׁתֵּי כַּפָּרוֹת.
human_translation: Granted, of Festivals do not atone for of Yom Kippur as the verse states once a year” this atonement, should be only once a year. But let of Yom Kippur atone for of Festivals The verse states: “Once effects one atonement but cannot effect two atonements
llm_translation: In the peace of the festivals, they do not atone like the Day of Atonement, as the verse says "once a year" - this atonement should only be once a year. Rather, the festivals atone on the Day of Atonement! The verse says "one" - one atonement atones, and it does not atone for two atonements.

hebrew_text: וְהָא כִּי כְּתִיב ״אַחַת״ – בְּשָׂעִיר הַנַּעֲשֶׂה בִּפְנִים הוּא דִּכְתִיב! אָמַר קְרָא: ״מִלְּבַד
human_translation: But when it states “once” it is with regard to goat whose performed inside that it is written, The verse states: aside from
llm_translation: And this, for it is written "one" - in regard to the goat that is done inside it is written! The verse says: "Apart from."

hebrew_text: חַטַּאת הַכִּפּוּרִים״, וְאִיתַּקּוּשׁ חִיצוֹן לִפְנִימִי.
human_translation: the sin-offering of the atonements” external is juxtaposed with internal
llm_translation: Sin offering of atonements, and holy of holies outside to inside.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר מִשְּׁמוֹ כּוּ׳.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda says in the name of
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda says from his name as follows:

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא דְּרָאשֵׁי חֳדָשִׁים דְּלָא מְכַפְּרִי אַדִּרְגָלִים – דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״עֲוֹן״, עָוֹן אֶחָד הוּא נוֹשֵׂא וְאֵינוֹ נוֹשֵׂא שְׁנֵי עֲוֹנוֹת; דִּרְגָלִים נָמֵי לָא נִיכַפְּרוּ אַדְּרָאשֵׁי חֳדָשִׁים – דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״אוֹתָהּ״, אוֹתָהּ הוּא נוֹשֵׂא עָוֹן וְאֵין אַחֵר נוֹשֵׂא עָוֹן! ״אוֹתָהּ״ לֹא מַשְׁמַע לֵיהּ.
human_translation: What is different of New Moons that they do not atone for that which of Festivals As the verse states the sin it bears, one sin but does not bear two sins. of Festivals should also not atone for that which of New Moons as verse states: it it bears, sin, but nothing bears sin. does not learn “it.”
llm_translation: What is the difference between the sin offerings of the New Moons that do not atone for Festivals? - For the verse says "sin," it is one sin that it carries and not two sins; the Festivals also, they do not atone for the New Moons - for the verse says "it," it carries that sin and no other sin! "It" does not include it.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא דִּרְגָלִים דְּלָא מְכַפְּרִי אַדְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים – דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״אַחַת בַּשָּׁנָה״, כַּפָּרָה זוֹ לֹא תְּהֵא אֶלָּא אַחַת בַּשָּׁנָה; אִי הָכִי, דְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים נָמֵי לָא נִיכַפְּרוּ אַדִּרְגָלִים – ״אַחַת״ כְּתִיב, כַּפָּרָה אַחַת מְכַפֵּר וְאֵינוֹ מְכַפֵּר שְׁתֵּי כַּפָּרוֹת! ״אַחַת״ לָא מַשְׁמַע לֵיהּ.
human_translation: What is different of Festivals that they do not atone for that which of Yom Kippur As the verse states “Once a year” this atonement should be only once a year, If so, of Yom Kippur should also not atone for that which of Festivals is written: “Once effect one atonement but cannot effect two atonements does not learn “once.”
llm_translation: What is the difference of the festivals that do not atone like Yom Kippur - as the verse says "once a year," this atonement should only be once a year; if not so, then the festivals also do not atone. "Once" is written, one atonement atones and does not atone for two atonements! "Once" does not imply to it.

hebrew_text: אַמַּאי? דְּכִי כְּתִיב ״אַחַת״ – בְּשָׂעִיר הַנַּעֲשֶׂה בִּפְנִים כְּתִיב. אִי הָכִי, דִּרְגָלִים נָמֵי נְכַפְּרוּ אַדְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים, דְּכִי כְּתִיב ״אַחַת״ – בְּשָׂעִיר הַנַּעֲשֶׂה בִּפְנִים כְּתִיב!
human_translation: Why because when “once” is written, is written with regard to goat whose performed inside If so, of Festivals also should atone for that which of Yom Kippur as when “once is written, is written with regard to goat whose performed inside
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Why? For it is written "one" - it is written regarding the goat that is done inside. If so, the feet also atone on the day of atonements, for it is written "one" - it is written regarding the goat that is done inside!

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם ״אַחַת״ מַשְׁמַע לֵיהּ; וְשָׁאנֵי הָכָא, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וְכִפֶּר אַהֲרֹן עַל קַרְנֹתָיו אַחַת בַּשָּׁנָה״ – קַרְנוֹתָיו דְּמִזְבֵּחַ הַפְּנִימִי הוּא דְּכַפָּרָה אַחַת מְכַפֵּר וְאֵינוֹ מְכַפֵּר שְׁתֵּי כַּפָּרוֹת, הָא דְּחִיצוֹן אֲפִילּוּ שְׁתֵּי כַּפָּרוֹת.
human_translation: Actually, he does learn “once,” But is different here, as the verse states: “And Aaron shall bring atonement upon its corners once a year” corners of the internal altar, that it effects one atonement but cannot effect two atonements but of the external even two atonements.
llm_translation: Forever "one" implies to him; and different here, as scripture says: "And Aaron shall make atonement upon its horns once a year" - its horns of the inner altar, which atones once and does not atone for two atonements, that of the outer altar even for two atonements.

hebrew_text: אָמַר עוּלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: תְּמִידִין שֶׁלֹּא הוּצְרְכוּ לַצִּבּוּר, נִפְדִּין תְּמִימִים.
human_translation: Ulla says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: daily offerings that were not needed by the public are redeemed, unblemished,
llm_translation: Ula said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: "Regular offerings that were not needed for the community are redeemed."

hebrew_text: יָתֵיב רַבָּה וְקָאָמַר לַהּ לְהָא שְׁמַעְתָּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב חִסְדָּא: מַאן צָיֵית לָךְ וּלְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן רַבָּךְ? וְכִי קְדוּשָּׁה שֶׁבָּהֶן לְהֵיכָן הָלְכָה?
human_translation: Rabba was sitting and reciting this halakha . Rav Ḥisda said to him: Who will listen to you and Rabbi Yoḥanan, your teacher, But sanctity that was in them, to where has it gone?
llm_translation: Rabba was sitting and saying to her, "To that you have heard." Rav Chisda said to her, "Who has given you and your teacher, Rabbi Yochanan, your master? And where is the Halacha in their sanctity?"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַתְּ לָא תִּסְבְּרַהּ דְּלָא אָמְרִינַן ״קְדוּשָּׁה שֶׁבָּהֶן לְהֵיכָן הָלְכָה״?! וְהָתְנַן: מוֹתַר הַקְּטוֹרֶת, מָה הָיוּ עוֹשִׂין בָּהּ? מַפְרִישִׁין מִמֶּנָּה שְׂכַר הָאוּמָּנִין, וּמְחַלְּלִין אוֹתָהּ עַל מְעוֹת הָאוּמָּנִין, וְנוֹתְנִין אוֹתָהּ לָאוּמָּנִין בִּשְׂכָרָן, וְחוֹזְרִין וְלוֹקְחִין אוֹתָהּ מִתְּרוּמָה חֲדָשָׁה.
human_translation: said to him: Don’t you hold that we do not say sanctity that was in them, to where has it gone, But didn’t we learn the surplus incense what would do with it separate from wages for the artisans And they would desacralize to money for the artisans. they would give to the artisans as their wages, and they would repurchase it from the new collection
llm_translation: He said to him: Do you not agree that we do not say, "Where is the Halakha of the Holy of Holies?" But didn't we learn: The leftover incense is permitted, what would they do with it? They would separate from it the wages of the craftsmen, and desecrate it with the craftsmen's coins, and give it to the craftsmen as their wages, and then they would take it back as a new contribution.

hebrew_text: וְאַמַּאי? נֵימָא: ״קְדוּשָּׁה שֶׁבָּהֶן לְהֵיכָן הָלְכָה״!
human_translation: But why Let us say: sanctity that was in to where has it gone?
llm_translation: And why? Say: "The holiness within them, to where is the halakha!"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: קְטוֹרֶת קָאָמְרַתְּ? שָׁאנֵי קְטוֹרֶת,
human_translation: said to him: Did you say incense? incense is different,
llm_translation: He said to him: "Is it regarding incense that you are saying?" It is different with incense.

hebrew_text: דִּקְדוּשַּׁת דָּמִים הוּא.
human_translation: as it sanctity value.
llm_translation: The sanctity of blood it is.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, לֹא תִּפָּסֵל בִּטְבוּל יוֹם! אַלְּמָה תַּנְיָא: נְתָנָהּ בְּמַכְתֶּשֶׁת – נִפְסֶלֶת בִּטְבוּל יוֹם?
human_translation: If that is so, it should not become disqualified through one who immersed that day Why, is it taught placed it in a mortar can be disqualified through one who immersed that day?
llm_translation: Rather, from now on, one shall not disqualify with a tevul yom! Why is it taught: If it was placed in a mortar - it becomes disqualified as a tevul yom?

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא כׇּל קְדוּשַּׁת דָּמִים מִיפַּסְלִי בִּטְבוּל יוֹם; וְהָתְנַן: הַמְּנָחוֹת, מוֹעֲלִין בָּהֶן מִשֶּׁהוּקְדְּשׁוּ; קָדְשׁוּ בִּכְלִי – הוּכְשְׁרוּ לִיפָּסֵל בִּטְבוּל יוֹם וּבִמְחוּסַּר כִּפּוּרִים וּבְלִינָה.
human_translation: And if you would say all sanctity value are disqualified through one who immersed that day, But didn’t we learn the meal-offerings, misusing them from when they are consecrated consecrated in vessel, they become fit to be disqualified through one who immersed that day, and through one who has not yet an atonement and through being left overnight.
llm_translation: And if you will say, all sanctity of blood disqualifies with immersion of the day; and we learned: the meal-offerings, one may benefit from them once they have been sanctified; if they were sanctified in a vessel – they are fit to disqualify with immersion of the day, and with lack of atonements, and with overnight.

hebrew_text: קָדְשׁוּ בִּכְלִי אִין, לֹא קָדְשׁוּ בִּכְלִי לָא!
human_translation: were consecrated in vessel, yes, they were not consecrated in vessel, not
llm_translation: They sanctified in a vessel, not they sanctified in a vessel no!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַאי – קְדוּשַּׁת הַגּוּף הִיא?! אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, תִּיפָּסֵל בְּלִינָה! אַלְּמָה תְּנַן: הַקּוֹמֶץ וְהַלְּבוֹנָה וְהַקְּטוֹרֶת וּמִנְחַת כֹּהֲנִים וּמִנְחַת כֹּהֵן מָשׁוּחַ וּמִנְחַת נְסָכִים – מוֹעֲלִים בָּהֶן מִשֶּׁהוּקְדְּשׁוּ, קָדְשׁוּ בִּכְלִי – הוּכְשְׁרוּ לִיפָּסֵל בִּטְבוּל יוֹם וּבִמְחוּסַּר כִּפּוּרִים וּבְלִינָה.
human_translation: Rather, what inherent sanctity? if that is so, it should be disqualified by being left overnight. Why, did we learn the handful the frankincense, the incense, the meal-offering of priests, the meal-offering of the anointed priest, and the meal-offering of libations, misusing them from when they are consecrated consecrated in vessel, they become fit to be disqualified through one who immersed that day, and through one who has not yet an atonement and through being left overnight.
llm_translation: Rather, what is the sanctity of the body?! Rather, from now on, it shall be disqualified by overnight waiting! Why do we learn: The handful, the frankincense, the incense, the meal offering of priests, the meal offering of an anointed priest, and the drink offering - they become disqualified if they were sanctified, sanctified in a vessel - they are fit to be disqualified by immersion on the day and by lack of atonement and by overnight waiting.

hebrew_text: קָדְשׁוּ בִּכְלִי – אִין, לֹא קָדְשׁוּ בִּכְלִי – לָא.
human_translation: were consecrated in vessel, yes, they were not consecrated in vessel, not
llm_translation: They sanctified in a vessel - yes, they did not sanctify in a vessel - no.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לִינָה קָאָמְרַתְּ? שָׁאנֵי קְטוֹרֶת, הוֹאִיל וְצוּרָתָהּ בְּכׇל הַשָּׁנָה כּוּלָּהּ.
human_translation: said to him: Did you say left overnight? incense is different, since its form throughout the entire year,
llm_translation: He said to him: Is she referring to lodging? It is different with the incense, since its form is the same throughout the entire year.

hebrew_text: מִכׇּל מָקוֹם קַשְׁיָא: וְכִי קְדוּשָּׁה שֶׁבָּהֶן לְהֵיכָן הָלְכָה? אָמַר רַבָּה: לֵב בֵּית דִּין מַתְנֶה עֲלֵיהֶן; אִם הוּצְרְכוּ הוּצְרְכוּ, וְאִם לָאו יִהְיוּ לִדְמֵיהֶן.
human_translation: In any case, difficult: But sanctity that was in them, to where has it gone? Rabba said: court tacitly stipulates concerning them If they are required they are required But if not they are for their value,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "From all places, a question: And is the sanctity in them for what purpose? Rabba said: The court's heart designates them; if they needed, they needed, and if not, they shall be like their value."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי, וְהָא מָר הוּא דְּאָמַר: הִקְדִּישׁ זָכָר לְדָמָיו – קָדוֹשׁ קְדוּשַּׁת הַגּוּף! לָא קַשְׁיָא; הָא דְּאָמַר ״לִדְמֵי עוֹלָה״, הָא דְּאָמַר ״לִדְמֵי נְסָכִים״.
human_translation: Abaye said to But wasn’t it Master, who said: one consecrated a male for its value, consecrated inherent sanctity? not difficult. This where says for value of a burnt-offering, that where he says for value of libations,
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye, and the Master is the one who said: "He consecrated a male to his blood" - holy holiness of the body! Not difficult; this is what he said "for the value of a burnt offering," this is what he said "for the value of libations."

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: פַּר וְשָׂעִיר שֶׁל יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים שֶׁאָבְדוּ וְהִפְרִישׁ אֲחֵרִים תַּחְתֵּיהֶם,
human_translation: Abaye raised an objection to bull and goat of Yom Kippur that were lost, and one separated others in their stead,
llm_translation: Abaye raised an objection: If the bull and the goat of Yom Kippur got lost and others were designated in their place,

hebrew_text: וְכֵן שְׂעִירֵי עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה שֶׁאָבְדוּ וְהִפְרִישׁ אֲחֵרִים תַּחְתֵּיהֶן – כּוּלָּן יָמוּתוּ. דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמְרִים: יִרְעוּ עַד שֶׁיִּסְתָּאֲבוּ, וְיִמָּכְרוּ וְיִפְּלוּ דְּמֵיהֶן לִנְדָבָה. שֶׁאֵין חַטַּאת צִבּוּר מֵתָה.
human_translation: and likewise, goats idol worship that were lost, and one separated others in their stead, all of shall be left to die. the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon say: They should graze until they become unfit and they are sold and their proceeds are allocated for gift because a communal sin-offering is not left to die.
llm_translation: And so too the he-goats of foreign worship that got lost and others were designated in their place - all of them shall die. The words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Shimon say: Let them graze until they become blemished, and then they shall be sold, and their value shall be contributed as a donation. For the communal sin-offering does not die.

hebrew_text: וְאַמַּאי? לֵימָא לֵב בֵּית דִּין מַתְנֶה עֲלֵיהֶן!
human_translation: But why Let us say court tacitly stipulates concerning them,
llm_translation: And why? Let us say, "Let the court establish them!"

hebrew_text: אֲבוּדִין קָאָמְרַתְּ? שָׁאנֵי אֲבוּדִין, דְּלָא שְׁכִיחִי.
human_translation: you say lost lost are different, because they are not common.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Are you saying "Avudin"? It is different Avudin, as they are not common.

hebrew_text: הֲרֵי פָּרָה, דְּלָא שְׁכִיחָא, וְתַנְיָא: פָּרָה נִפְדֵּית עַל כׇּל פְּסוּל שֶׁבָּהּ – מֵתָה תִּפָּדֶה, נִשְׁחֲטָה תִּפָּדֶה, מָצָא אַחֶרֶת נָאָה הֵימֶנָּה תִּפָּדֶה. שְׁחָטָהּ עַל גַּבֵּי מַעֲרַכְתָּהּ – אֵין לָהּ פְּדִיָּיה עוֹלָמִית! שָׁאנֵי פָּרָה, דְּקׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת הִיא.
human_translation: heifer, which is not common, and it is taught heifer may be redeemed for any disqualification to it. it died, it shall be redeemed; it was slaughtered it shall be redeemed; another was found choicer than it, it shall be redeemed. has slaughtered it on its arrangement it can no longer be redeemed. heifer is different, as it sanctity of Temple maintenance,
llm_translation: Behold, a cow, which is not common, and it was taught: A cow that was redeemed for any disqualification in it - if it dies, it is redeemed; if it was slaughtered, it is redeemed; if another suitable one is found in its place, it is redeemed. If it was slaughtered on its designated spot - it has no eternal redemption! This is different from a cow that is designated for the Temple courtyard.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, מֵתָה אוֹ נִשְׁחֲטָה תִּפָּדֶה?! הָא בָּעֵינַן הַעֲמָדָה וְהַעֲרָכָה! הָא מַנִּי – רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא, דְּאָמַר: קׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ הָיוּ בִּכְלַל הַעֲמָדָה וְהַעֲרָכָה, קׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת לָא הָיוּ בִּכְלַל הַעֲמָדָה וְהַעֲרָכָה.
human_translation: If so, it died or was slaughtered, can it be redeemed? don’t we require standing and valuation? whose is this? It Rabbi Shimon, who says: consecrated to altar were included in standing and appraising, sanctity of Temple maintenance, were not included in standing and appraising.
llm_translation: If so, is it redeemed if it died or was slaughtered?! We require standing and appraisal! This is the opinion of Rabbi Shimon, as he said: The holy items of the altar were included in standing and appraisal, but the holy items of the Temple floor were not included in standing and appraisal.

hebrew_text: אִי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, אֵימָא סֵיפָא: שְׁחָטָהּ עַל גַּבֵּי מַעֲרַכְתָּהּ, אֵין לָהּ פְּדִיָּיה עוֹלָמִית.
human_translation: If, Rabbi Shimon, say the latter clause, has slaughtered it on its arrangement it can no longer be redeemed.
llm_translation: If it is Rabbi Shimon, say the latter part: If she slaughtered it on her designated place, she does not have eternal redemption.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: פָּרָה מְטַמְּאָה טוּמְאַת אֳוכָלִין, הוֹאִיל וְהָיְתָה לָהּ שְׁעַת הַכּוֹשֶׁר; וְאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: אוֹמֵר הָיָה רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, פָּרָה נִפְדֵּית עַל גַּב מַעֲרַכְתָּהּ!
human_translation: And isn’t it taught Rabbi Shimon says heifer susceptible to becoming ritually impure the ritual impurity of food, since it had a time when it was fit And Reish Lakish says: Rabbi Shimon would say heifer may be redeemed upon its arrangement
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "And it was taught: Rabbi Shimon says: A cow renders food impure, since it was fit for offering; and Reish Lakish said: Rabbi Shimon would say, 'A cow was redeemed on account of its arrangement!'"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא שָׁאנֵי פָּרָה, הוֹאִיל וְדָמֶיהָ יְקָרִין.
human_translation: Rather, heifer is different, since it is of great monetary value.
llm_translation: Rather, the case of the cow is different, since its blood is precious.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: מֵתָה תִּפָּדֶה. וְכִי פּוֹדִין אֶת הַקֳּדָשִׁים לְהַאֲכִילָן לִכְלָבִים?! אָמַר רַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא: מִשּׁוּם עוֹרָהּ. וְקָיְימִי בֵּית דִּין וּמַתְנוּ אַדַּעְתָּא דְּעוֹרָהּ?! אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא, אָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: מִגַּמְלָא אוּנַּהּ.
human_translation: The Master said died, it shall be redeemed. But may one redeem consecrated in order to feed them to dogs? Rav Mesharshiyya said: for the sake of its hide. But does the court stand and stipulate with mind on the hide Rav Kahana said: people say From a camel, its ear.
llm_translation: Master said: "She shall be redeemed." Do we redeem consecrated items to feed them to dogs?! Rav Mesharshaya said: Because of her skin. Shall the court uphold and establish the opinion of her skin?! Rav Kahana said, people say: "From the camel its burden."

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: אָמְרוּ לוֹ לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, מַהוּ שֶׁיִּקְרְבוּ זֶה בָּזֶה? אָמַר לְהוּ: יִקְרְבוּ. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: הוֹאִיל וְאֵין כַּפָּרָתָן שָׁוָה, הֵיאַךְ הֵן קְרֵיבִין? אָמַר לָהֶן: כּוּלָּן בָּאִין לְכַפֵּר עַל טוּמְאַת מִקְדָּשׁ וְקָדָשָׁיו.
human_translation: raised an objection to said to Rabbi Shimon: What is whether may be sacrificed, this in that said to them: may be sacrificed. They said to Since, their atonement is not the same, how could they be sacrificed? said to them: all of them come to atone for defiling of Temple or its sacrificial
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him: They said to Rabbi Shimon, "What is the meaning that they should approach one another?" He said to them: "They should approach." They said to him: "Since their atonements are not equal, how can they approach?" He said to them: "All of them come to atone for the impurity of the Sanctuary and its holy things."

hebrew_text: וְאַמַּאי? לֵימָא לֵב בֵּית דִּין מַתְנֶה עֲלֵיהֶן! רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן קָאָמְרַתְּ? רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לֵית לֵיהּ לֵב בֵּית דִּין מַתְנֶה עֲלֵיהֶן. דְּאָמַר רַב אִידִי בַּר אָבִין, אָמַר רַב עַמְרָם, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: תְּמִידִין שֶׁלֹּא הוּצְרְכוּ לַצִּבּוּר, לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אֵין נִפְדִּין תְּמִימִים, לְדִבְרֵי חֲכָמִים נִפְדִּין תְּמִימִים.
human_translation: But why Let say court tacitly stipulates concerning them you say Rabbi Shimon? Rabbi Shimon does not court tacitly stipulates concerning them, as Rav Idi bar Avin says Rav Amram says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: daily offerings that were not needed by the public, according to the statement of Rabbi Shimon they are not redeemed unblemished; according to the statement of the Rabbis they are redeemed, unblemished.
llm_translation: And why? Let us say, the court should appoint guardians over them! Is this what Rabbi Shimon is saying? Rabbi Shimon does not hold that the court should appoint guardians over them. For Rav Idi bar Avin said in the name of Rav Amram, who said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: Animals that were never needed for communal use, according to the words of Rabbi Shimon, are not redeemed; according to the words of the Sages, they are redeemed.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן דִּפְלִיגִי עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן – מַאן נִינְהוּ? אִי נֵימָא רַבָּנַן דִּקְטוֹרֶת –
human_translation: And the Rabbis who disagree with Rabbi Shimon who are they? If we say the Sages with regard to incense
llm_translation: The sages who disputed with Rabbi Shimon - who are they? If you say the sages of the incense -

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי קְטוֹרֶת דְּלָא בַּר רְעִיָּה הִיא!
human_translation: incense is different, as it is not that can graze.
llm_translation: The matter of the incense is not like a neighbor!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא רַבָּנַן דְּפָרָה – דִּלְמָא שָׁאנֵי פָּרָה דְּדָמֶיהָ יְקָרִין!
human_translation: Rather, the Sages with regard to heifer Perhaps heifer is different, since it is of great monetary value.
llm_translation: Rather, the Rabbis of Pera - perhaps the cow of Pera is different, for its blood is precious!

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא רַבָּנַן דְּ״אָמְרוּ לוֹ״ –
human_translation: Rather, the Sages with They said to him,
llm_translation: And rather the Rabbis said to him -

hebrew_text: מִמַּאי דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא – וְהָכִי קָאָמַר לֵיהּ: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְדִידִי דְּאָמֵינָא לֵב בֵּית דִּין מַתְנֶה עֲלֵיהֶן – אַמְּטוּ לְהָכִי יִקְרְבוּ; אֶלָּא לְדִידָךְ דְּאָמְרַתְּ לָא – אַמַּאי יִקְרְבוּ?
human_translation: From where that is Rabbi Yehuda and this is saying to Granted, according to my that I say the court tacitly stipulates concerning it is due to this they can be sacrificed but according to your that you say not why can they be sacrificed
llm_translation: From what is the statement of Rabbi Yehuda derived? - And thus he said to him: According to my opinion, that the court imposes upon them a penalty, they will come close to fulfill the obligation; but according to your opinion that you said no - why should they come close?

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא – וְהָכִי קָאָמַר לֵיהּ: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְדִידִי, דְּאָמֵינָא כׇּל הַשְּׂעִירִים כַּפָּרָתָן שָׁוָה – מִשּׁוּם הָכִי יִקְרְבוּ; אֶלָּא לְדִידָךְ, אַמַּאי יִקְרְבוּ?
human_translation: But perhaps is Rabbi Meir, and this is saying to Granted, according to my that I say atonement the goats all is the same, it is due to this they can be sacrificed But according to your why can they be sacrificed
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And perhaps it is according to Rabbi Meir - and thus he says to him: 'Granted according to me, for I say all the he-goats are equal to their atonement - therefore they shall draw near; but according to you, why should they draw near?'" English translation:

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן גְּמָרָא גְּמִיר לַהּ: לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן – אֵין נִפְדִּין, לְדִבְרֵי חֲכָמִים – נִפְדִּין.
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yoḥanan learned it through a tradition according to the statement of Rabbi Shimon, cannot be redeemed according to the statement of the Rabbis, they may be redeemed,
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yochanan concludes the Gemara: According to the words of Rabbi Shimon - we do not redeem, according to the words of the Sages - we redeem.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן דְּלֵית לֵיהּ לֵב בֵּית דִּין מַתְנֶה עֲלֵיהֶן, מַאי עָבְדִין לְהוּ? אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מְקַיְּצִין בָּהֶן אֶת הַמִּזְבֵּחַ.
human_translation: And according to Rabbi Shimon, who does not the court tacitly stipulates concerning what is done with them? Rabbi Yitzḥak says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: One supplements the altar with them.
llm_translation: And for Rabbi Shimon who does not have a heart in the court, what do they do for him? Rabbi Yitzchak said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: They shorten the altar for him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר רַב יִצְחָק: וּמוֹדֶה רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בִּשְׂעִירֵי חַטָּאת, שֶׁאֵין מְקַיְּצִין בְּגוּפָן אֶלָּא בִּדְמֵיהֶן.
human_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Rav Yitzḥak says: And Rabbi Shimon concedes with regard to goats of sin-offerings that one does not supplement with themselves. Rather, with their value,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shmuel son of Rav Yitzchak said: And Rabbi Shimon concedes regarding the goats of sin-offerings, that they are not considered to be cut off in their bodies, but rather in their blood.

hebrew_text: הָכָא הוּא דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא עוֹלָה וְהַשְׁתָּא עוֹלָה; אֲבָל הָתָם דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא חַטָּאת וְהַשְׁתָּא עוֹלָה – גְּזֵירָה לְאַחַר כַּפָּרָה אַטּוּ לִפְנֵי כַפָּרָה.
human_translation: Here, where from the outset a burnt-offering, and now a burnt-offering, But there, where from the outset a sin-offering, and now a burnt-offering, decree after atonement due to before atonement
llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text: Here is where it is different: initially it is a burnt offering, and now it is a burnt offering; but there, initially it is a sin offering, and now it is a burnt offering - a decree for after atonement, they must be offered before atonement.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אַף אֲנַן נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: פַּר וְשָׂעִיר שֶׁל יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים שֶׁאָבְדוּ וְהִפְרִישׁ אֲחֵרִים תַּחְתֵּיהֶם, וְכֵן שְׂעִירֵי עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה שֶׁאָבְדוּ וְהִפְרִישׁ אֲחֵרִים תַּחְתֵּיהֶן – כּוּלָּן יָמוּתוּ. דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמְרִים: יִרְעוּ עַד שֶׁיִּסְתָּאֲבוּ, וְיִמָּכְרוּ וְיִפְּלוּ דְּמֵיהֶן לִנְדָבָה; שֶׁאֵין חַטַּאת צִבּוּר מֵתָה.
human_translation: Abaye said: We learn as well: bull and goat of Yom Kippur that were lost, and one separated others in their stead, and likewise, goats idol worship that were lost, and one separated others in their stead, all of should be left to die. the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon say: They should graze until they become unfit, and they are sold and their proceeds are allocated for gift because a communal sin-offering is not left to die.
llm_translation: Abaye said: We also learned: The bull and the goat of Yom Kippur that got lost, and others were designated in their place, and similarly, the goats of foreign worship that got lost, and others were designated in their place - all of them shall die. These are the words of Rabbi Yehuda.
