hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, אַבָּא שָׁאוּל אוֹמֵר: שְׁנֵי בִּיצְעִין הָיוּ בְּהַר הַמִּשְׁחָה, תַּחְתּוֹנָה וְעֶלְיוֹנָה. תַּחְתּוֹנָה – נִתְקַדְּשָׁה בְּכׇל אֵלּוּ; עֶלְיוֹנָה – לֹא נִתְקַדְּשָׁה בְּכׇל אֵלּוּ, אֶלָּא בְּעוֹלֵי גוֹלָה; שֶׁלֹּא בְּמֶלֶךְ וְשֶׁלֹּא בְּאוּרִים וְתוּמִּים.
human_translation: Come hear Abba Shaul says: There were two ponds [ bitzin ] on the Mount of Olives [ Har HaMishḥa ], a lower and an upper The lower was consecrated with all the upper was not consecrated with all these but by those who returned from the exile without a king and without Urim VeTummim .
llm_translation: Come and hear: Abba Shaul says: There were two lots on the Mount of Anointing, one below and one above. The lower one - was sanctified with all of these; the upper one - was not sanctified with all of these, except for those who are exiled. Not with a king, not with Urim and Thummim.

hebrew_text: תַּחְתּוֹנָה שֶׁהָיְתָה קְדוּשָּׁתָהּ גְּמוּרָה – עַמֵּי הָאָרֶץ נִכְנָסִין לְשָׁם, וְאוֹכְלִין שָׁם קָדָשִׁים קַלִּים אֲבָל לֹא מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי; וַחֲבֵרִים אוֹכְלִים שָׁם קָדָשִׁים קַלִּים וּמַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי.
human_translation: the lower whose consecration was complete, amei ha’aretz , would enter into there and partake of offerings of lesser sanctity there, but not second tithe And ḥaverim , would partake of offerings of lesser sanctity and second tithe there.
llm_translation: Below is the word-for-word English translation of the Talmudic text provided: "Tachtonah shehaytah kedushatah gemurah – amei haaretz nichnasin lesham, ve'ochlin sham kodashim kalim aval lo maaser sheni; vachaverim ochlin sham kodashim kalim u'maaser sheni."

hebrew_text: עֶלְיוֹנָה שֶׁלֹּא הָיְתָה קְדוּשָּׁתָהּ גְּמוּרָה – עַמֵּי הָאָרֶץ הָיוּ נִכְנָסִין שָׁם, וְאוֹכְלִין שָׁם קָדָשִׁים קַלִּים אֲבָל לֹא מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי; וַחֲבֵרִים אֵין אוֹכְלִין שָׁם לֹא קָדָשִׁים קַלִּים וְלֹא מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי. וּמִפְּנֵי מָה לֹא קִידְּשׁוּהָ? שֶׁאֵין מוֹסִיפִין עַל הָעִיר וְעַל הָעֲזָרוֹת אֶלָּא בְּמֶלֶךְ וְנָבִיא וְאוּרִים וְתוּמִּים, וּבְסַנְהֶדְרִין שֶׁל שִׁבְעִים וְאֶחָד, וּבִשְׁתֵּי תּוֹדוֹת וּבְשִׁיר.
human_translation: the upper whose consecration was incomplete, amei ha’aretz would enter into there and partake of offerings of lesser sanctity there, but not second tithe And ḥaverim would partake of neither offerings of lesser sanctity nor second tithe there. And for what did they not consecrate because additions can be made to the city or to the courtyards only by king, a prophet, the Urim VeTummim , and the Sanhedrin of seventy-one, and with two thanks-offerings and with song.
llm_translation: Supreme holiness was not complete - common people would enter there, and eat there light holy things but not second tithe; and associates do not eat there neither light holy things nor second tithe. And why was it not sanctified? Because they only add to the city and the courtyards by the king, the prophet, the Urim and Thummim, and the Sanhedrin of seventy-one, and by two testimonies and by song.

hebrew_text: וְלָמָּה קִידְּשׁוּהָ? לָמָּה קִידְּשׁוּהָ?! הָא אָמְרַתְּ לֹא קִידְּשׁוּהָ! אֶלָּא לָמָה הִכְנִיסוּהָ? מִפְּנֵי שֶׁתּוֹרְפָּהּ שֶׁל יְרוּשָׁלַיִם הָיְתָה, וְנוֹחָה הִיא לִיכָּבֵשׁ מִשָּׁם.
human_translation: But why did they consecrate Why did they consecrate it? Didn’t you say they did not consecrate it? Rather, why did they bring it within Because it was a weak point [ turpa ] of Jerusalem and it would have been easy to conquer from there,
llm_translation: And why did they sanctify it? Why did they sanctify it?! But you said they did not sanctify it! Rather, why did they bring it in? Because the gate of Jerusalem was burning, and it was fitting to extinguish it from there.

hebrew_text: תַּנָּאֵי הִיא; דְּתַנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: שָׁמַעְתִּי כְּשֶׁהָיוּ בּוֹנִין בַּהֵיכָל, עָשׂוּ קְלָעִים לַהֵיכָל וּקְלָעִים לָעֲזָרוֹת. אֶלָּא שֶׁבַּהֵיכָל בּוֹנִין מִבַּחוּץ, וּבָעֲזָרוֹת בּוֹנִין מִבִּפְנִים.
human_translation: is tanna’im As it is taught Rabbi Eliezer says: I heard when they were building the Sanctuary they fashioned curtains for the Sanctuary and curtains for the courtyards only that in the Sanctuary, built outside and in the courtyards, built within
llm_translation: It is taught in a Baraita; as it was taught: Rabbi Eliezer said: I heard that when they were building the Temple, they made curtains for the Temple and curtains for the courtyards. However, for the Temple, they built from the outside, and for the courtyards, they built from the inside.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: שָׁמַעְתִּי שֶׁמַּקְרִיבִין אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין בַּיִת, אוֹכְלִין קׇדְשֵׁי קָדָשִׁים אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין קְלָעִים, קָדָשִׁים קַלִּים וּמַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין חוֹמָה; מִפְּנֵי שֶׁקְּדוּשָּׁה רִאשׁוֹנָה קִידְּשָׁה לִשְׁעָתָהּ וְקִידְּשָׁה לֶעָתִיד לָבֹא. לָאו מִכְּלָל דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר סָבַר: לֹא קִידְּשָׁה לֶעָתִיד לָבֹא?
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: I heard that one sacrifices offerings even if there is no Temple, one partakes of offerings of the most sacred order even if there are no curtains, and offerings of lesser sanctity and second-tithe even if there is no wall due to that the initial consecration sanctified for their time and sanctified forever. not by inference Rabbi Eliezer maintains it did not sanctify forever?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua said: I heard that they bring sacrifices even though there is no Temple, they eat holy of holies even though there are no curtains, light holy items and second tithe even though there is no wall; because the original sanctity sanctified it for its time and sanctified it for the future. Is it not from the principle that Rabbi Eliezer holds: Did it not sanctify for the future?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: מִמַּאי? דִּלְמָא דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא קְדוּשָּׁה רִאשׁוֹנָה קִידְּשָׁה לִשְׁעָתָהּ וְקִידְּשָׁה לֶעָתִיד לָבֹא, וּמָר מַאי דִּשְׁמִיעַ לֵיהּ קָאָמַר, וּמָר מַאי דִּשְׁמִיעַ לֵיהּ קָאָמַר. וְכִי תֵּימָא: קְלָעִים לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר לְמָה לִי? לִצְנִיעוּתָא בְּעָלְמָא.
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: From where Perhaps everyone the initial consecration sanctified for their time and sanctified forever. And Sage, stated that which he heard and Sage, stated that which he heard And if you would say: Why do I curtains according to Rabbi Eliezer? merely for seclusion,
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: From what? Perhaps the entire world was sanctified initially for its time, and was sanctified for the future, and the Master, what is he saying, and the Master, what is he saying. And if you say: Why do I need curtains for Rabbi Eliezer? For modesty in the world.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָנֵי תַּנָּאֵי – דְּתַנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי: לָמָּה מָנוּ חֲכָמִים אֶת אֵלּוּ? שֶׁכְּשֶׁעָלוּ בְּנֵי הַגּוֹלָה, מָצְאוּ אֵלּוּ וְקִידְּשׁוּם. אֲבָל רִאשׁוֹנוֹת בָּטְלוּ מִשֶּׁבָּטְלָה הָאָרֶץ. אַלְמָא קָסָבַר: קְדוּשָּׁה רִאשׁוֹנָה קִידְּשָׁה לִשְׁעָתָהּ וְלֹא קִידְּשָׁה לֶעָתִיד לָבֹא.
human_translation: Rather, these tanna’im , as it is taught Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, said: Why did the Sages enumerate these that when the exiles ascended they found these and consecrated them but the first was nullified when Eretz was negated Apparently, maintains: The initial consecration sanctified for their time and did not sanctify forever.
llm_translation: Rather, these Tannaim - as it was taught: Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, said: Why did the sages count these items? Because when the exiles returned, they found these and sanctified them. But the first ones were nullified when the land was nullified. This implies that he holds: The initial sanctification was for its time and was not sanctified for the future.

hebrew_text: ורְמִינְהִי, אָמַר רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי: וְכִי אֵלּוּ בִּלְבַד הָיוּ?! וַהֲלֹא כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר: ״שִׁשִּׁים עִיר כׇּל חֶבֶל אַרְגֹּב מַמְלֶכֶת עוֹג בַּבָּשָׁן, כׇּל אֵלֶּה עָרִים בְּצֻרוֹת חוֹמָה גְבֹהָה״! אֶלָּא לָמָּה מָנוּ חֲכָמִים אֶת אֵלּוּ – שֶׁכְּשֶׁעָלוּ בְּנֵי הַגּוֹלָה מָצְאוּ אֵלּוּ וְקִידְּשׁוּם.
human_translation: And raises a contradiction Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, says: Were these the only But isn’t it already stated: “Sixty cities, all the region of Argob, the kingdom of Og, king of Bashan, all these were cities fortified with high walls, Rather, why did the Sages enumerate these that when the exiles ascended they found these and consecrated them
llm_translation: And they raised a dilemma: Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, said: Were these alone?! But has it not already been said: "Sixty cities, all the region of Argob, the kingdom of Og in Bashan, all these were fortified cities with high walls"! Rather, why did the sages count these - because when the exiles returned, they found these and sanctified them.

hebrew_text: קִידְּשׁוּם הַשְׁתָּא?! הָא אָמְרִינַן לְקַמַּן דְּלָא צְרִיכָא לְקַדּוֹשֵׁי! אֶלָּא מָצְאוּ אֵלּוּ וּמְנָאוּם.
human_translation: They consecrated them? Now, don’t we say later that it is not necessary to consecrate Rather, they found these and enumerated them.
llm_translation: "They sanctified them this year?! But didn't we say later that it is not necessary to sanctify them! Rather, they found these and counted them."

hebrew_text: וְלֹא אֵלּוּ בִּלְבַד, אֶלָּא כׇּל שֶׁתַּעֲלֶה בְּיָדְךָ מָסוֹרֶת מֵאֲבוֹתֶיךָ שֶׁמּוּקֶּפֶת חוֹמָה מִימוֹת יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בִּן נוּן – כׇּל מִצְוֹת אֵלּוּ נוֹהֲגוֹת בָּהּ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁקְּדוּשָּׁה רִאשׁוֹנָה קִידְּשָׁה לִשְׁעָתָהּ וְקִידְּשָׁה לֶעָתִיד לָבֹא. קַשְׁיָא דְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בַּר יוֹסֵי אַדְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בַּר יוֹסֵי!
human_translation: And not only these, but any which you receive a tradition from your ancestors that it was surrounded by a wall from the days of Joshua, son of Nun, all these mitzvot are observed in it, due to that the initial consecration sanctified for their time and sanctified forever. difficult, of Rabbi Yishmael bar Yosei and of Rabbi Yishmael bar Yosei.
llm_translation: And not these alone, but all that comes into your hand as a tradition from your fathers, which encircles a wall from the days of Joshua son of Nun - all these commandments are practiced in it, because the first sanctity sanctified it for its time and sanctified it for the future. A question of Rabbi Ishmael son of Yosei, the son of Yosei!

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: תְּרֵי תַּנָּאֵי אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בַּר יוֹסֵי; אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: חֲדָא מִינַּיְיהוּ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בַּר יוֹסֵי אַמְרַהּ. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בַּר יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: ״אֲשֶׁר לוֹא חֹמָה״ – אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין לוֹ עַכְשָׁיו וְהָיָה לוֹ קוֹדֶם לָכֵן.
human_translation: If you wish, say two tanna’im with regard to of Rabbi Yishmael bar Yosei. if you wish, say one of the was stated by Rabbi Elazar bar Yosei, As it is taught Rabbi Elazar bar Yosei says “Which has [ lo ] a wall” even if it does not presently have but it had previously,
llm_translation: If you wish, say: Two teachings in the school of Rabbi Yishmael, son of Yosei; if you wish, say: One of them Rabbi Elazar, son of Yosei, said. As it was taught, Rabbi Elazar, son of Yosei, says: "Who has no wall" - even though he does not have one now, he had one previously.

hebrew_text: נִטְמָא בָּעֲזָרָה וְנֶעֶלְמָה מִמֶּנּוּ טוּמְאָה וְכוּ׳. טוּמְאָה בַּעֲזָרָה מְנָלַן? אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, כָּתוּב אֶחָד אוֹמֵר: ״אֶת מִשְׁכַּן ה׳ טִמֵּא״, וְכָתוּב אֶחָד אוֹמֵר: ״כִּי אֶת מִקְדַּשׁ ה׳ טִמֵּא״; אִם אֵינוֹ עִנְיָן לְטוּמְאָה שֶׁבַּחוּץ, תְּנֵהוּ עִנְיָן לְטוּמְאָה שֶׁבִּפְנִים.
human_translation: who became impure in the courtyard, and impurity was hidden from him. From where do we impurity in the courtyard Rabbi Elazar says: One verse states: “He has defiled the Tabernacle of the Lord” and one verse states: “For he has defiled the Temple of the Lord” If is not matter of impurity outside apply it matter of impurity inside
llm_translation: He became impure in the Temple courtyard and she became hidden from him impure, etc. How does impurity come about in the Temple courtyard? Rabbi Elazar said, it is written, one verse says: "He defiled the tabernacle of the Lord," and another verse says: "For he defiled the sanctuary of the Lord." If it is not a matter for impurity outside, give it a matter for impurity inside.

hebrew_text: וּקְרָאֵי מְיַתְּרִי?! הָא מִיצְרָךְ צְרִיכִי! דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: אִם נֶאֱמַר ״מִשְׁכָּן״, לָמָּה נֶאֱמַר ״מִקְדָּשׁ״? וְאִם נֶאֱמַר ״מִקְדָּשׁ״, לָמָּה נֶאֱמַר ״מִשְׁכָּן״? אִילּוּ נֶאֱמַר ״מִשְׁכָּן״ וְלֹא נֶאֱמַר ״מִקְדָּשׁ״, הָיִיתִי אוֹמֵר: עַל מִשְׁכָּן יְהֵא חַיָּיב – שֶׁהֲרֵי מָשׁוּחַ בְּשֶׁמֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה, וְעַל מִקְדָּשׁ לֹא יְהֵא חַיָּיב. וְאִם נֶאֱמַר ״מִקְדָּשׁ״ וְלֹא נֶאֱמַר ״מִשְׁכָּן״, הָיִיתִי אוֹמֵר: עַל מִקְדָּשׁ יְהֵא חַיָּיב – שֶׁהֲרֵי קְדוּשָּׁתוֹ קְדוּשַּׁת עוֹלָם, וְעַל מִשְׁכָּן לֹא יְהֵא חַיָּיב. לְכָךְ נֶאֱמַר ״מִשְׁכָּן״, לְכָךְ נֶאֱמַר ״מִקְדָּשׁ״.
human_translation: But superfluous verses, Aren’t they necessary As it is taught Rabbi Elazar says: If it is stated: “Tabernacle,” why does it state: “Temple”? And if it is stated: “Temple,” why does it state: “Tabernacle”? Had stated “Tabernacle,” and not stated: “Temple,” I would have said liable for the Tabernacle since it was anointed with the anointing oil, but he is not liable for the Temple, And had stated “Temple,” and not stated: “Tabernacle,” I would have said liable for the Temple since its sanctity is an eternal sanctity, but he is not liable for the Tabernacle, For this reason, it is stated: “Tabernacle,” and for this reason, it is stated: “Temple.”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And why are the verses extra?! This is necessary for the difficulty! As it was taught, Rabbi Elazar says: If it says 'Tabernacle,' why does it also say 'Sanctuary'? And if it says 'Sanctuary,' why does it also say 'Tabernacle'? If it had only said 'Tabernacle' and not said 'Sanctuary,' I would say: He shall be liable for the Tabernacle - for it is anointed with the anointing oil, but not for the Sanctuary. And if it had said 'Sanctuary' and not said 'Tabernacle,' I would say: He shall be liable for the Sanctuary - for its holiness is eternal, but not for the Tabernacle. Therefore, it says 'Tabernacle,' therefore it says 'Sanctuary.'"

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר הָכִי קָא קַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ: מִכְּדִי מִשְׁכָּן אִיקְּרִי ״מִקְדָּשׁ״ וּמִקְדָּשׁ אִיקְּרִי ״מִשְׁכָּן״; נִכְתּוֹב אוֹ אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי ״מִקְדָּשׁ״, אוֹ אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי ״מִשְׁכָּן״! ״מִשְׁכָּן״ וּ״מִקְדָּשׁ״ לְמָה לִי? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ תַּרְתֵּי.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar This is what is difficult for him: Since the Tabernacle is called Temple and the Temple is called Tabernacle, then let write either both Temple, or both Tabernacle; why do I “Tabernacle” and “Temple”? Conclude two from it,
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar the Kehati raised a difficulty: Since the Tabernacle is called "Mikdash" and the Temple is called "Mishkan"; it is written both as "Mikdash" and as "Mishkan", or is it written as "Mikdash" and as "Mishkan"! Why do I need both "Mishkan" and "Mikdash"? Learn from it two.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא מִקְדָּשׁ אִיקְּרִי מִשְׁכָּן – דִּכְתִיב: ״וְנָתַתִּי מִשְׁכָּנִי בְּתוֹכְכֶם״; אֶלָּא מִשְׁכָּן דְּאִיקְּרִי מִקְדָּשׁ – מְנָלַן? אִילֵּימָא מִדִּכְתִיב: ״וְנָסְעוּ הַקְּהָתִים נֹשְׂאֵי הַמִּקְדָּשׁ״ – הָהוּא בְּאָרוֹן כְּתִיב! אֶלָּא מֵהָכָא: ״וְעָשׂוּ לִי מִקְדָּשׁ וְשָׁכַנְתִּי בְּתוֹכָם״, וּכְתִיב: ״כְּכֹל אֲשֶׁר אֲנִי מַרְאֶה אוֹתְךָ אֵת תַּבְנִית הַמִּשְׁכָּן״.
human_translation: Granted, the Temple is called Tabernacle, as it is written: “And I will set My Tabernacle among you” But from where do we that the Tabernacle is called Temple? If we say from that which is written: “And the Kehatites, the bearers of the Temple, set forward” that is written with regard to the Ark Rather, from here: “And let them make Me a Temple, that I may dwell among them” it is written: “According to all that I show you, the pattern of the Tabernacle”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: In truth, the Temple is called Mishkan - as it is written: "And I will place My Mishkan among you." But the Mishkan that is called Mikdash - from where? If you say from what is written: "And the Kohathites who carry the sanctuary shall set out" - that is written regarding the Ark! Rather, from here: "And they shall make a sanctuary for Me, and I will dwell among them," and it is written: "According to all that I show you, the pattern of the Mishkan." English translation:

hebrew_text: וְהִשְׁתַּחֲוָה אוֹ שֶׁשָּׁהָה כְּדֵי הִשְׁתַּחֲוָאָה. אָמַר רָבָא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁהִשְׁתַּחֲוָה כְּלַפֵּי פְנִים, אֲבָל הִשְׁתַּחֲוָה כְּלַפֵּי חוּץ – שָׁהָה אִין, לֹא שָׁהָה לָא.
human_translation: he bowed down, or he tarried long enough to bow down, Rava says: They taught only when he bowed down facing inward, But he bowed down facing outward, he tarried yes, he did not tarry not
llm_translation: And he prostrated himself or that he remained the time for prostration. Rava said: They only taught that he prostrated himself facing inward, but if he prostrated himself facing outward - he did not remain, he did not remain no.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּמַתְנֵי לַהּ אַסֵּיפָא: אוֹ שֶׁשָּׁהָה בִּכְדֵי הִשְׁתַּחֲוָאָה – מִכְּלַל דְּהִשְׁתַּחֲוָאָה גּוּפַהּ בָּעֲיָא שְׁהִיָּיה; אָמַר רָבָא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁהִשְׁתַּחֲוָה כְּלַפֵּי חוּץ, אֲבָל כְּלַפֵּי פְנִים – אַף עַל גַּב דְּלֹא שָׁהָה. וְהָכִי קָאָמַר: הִשְׁתַּחֲוָה כְּלַפֵּי פְנִים, אוֹ שֶׁשָּׁהָה כְּדֵי הִשְׁתַּחֲוָאָה בְּהָךְ הִשְׁתַּחֲוָאָה דִּכְלַפֵּי חוּץ – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: There are who teach with regard to the latter clause: Or he tarried long enough to bow down, by inference that bowing down itself entails tarrying, Rava says: They taught only when he bowed down facing outward. But facing inward even if he did not tarry And this is is saying: he bowed down facing inward, or tarried long enough to bow down while bowing down facing outward, liable.
llm_translation: There is one who teaches her in the latter part: Or if she remained bowed for the time it takes to bow – from the inference that bowing itself is required. Rava said: They only taught that she must bow facing outward, but facing inward – even though she did not remain. And this is what he is saying: If she bowed facing inward, or if she remained for the time it takes to bow in that bowing that is facing outward – she is liable.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי הִשְׁתַּחֲוָאָה דְּאִית בַּהּ שְׁהִיָּיה, וְהֵיכִי דָּמֵי הִשְׁתַּחֲוָאָה דְּלֵית בַּהּ שְׁהִיָּיה? דְּלֵית בַּהּ שְׁהִיָּיה – זוֹ כְּרִיעָה בְּעָלְמָא הִיא, דְּאִית בָּהּ שְׁהִיָּיה – פִּישּׁוּט יָדַיִם וְרַגְלַיִם.
human_translation: What are the circumstances of bowing in which there is tarrying, and what are the circumstances of bowing in which there is no tarrying? in which there is no tarrying, that is merely kneeling. in which there is tarrying, spreading arms and legs
llm_translation: How are the laws of prostration with regard to one that has a garment, and how are the laws of prostration with regard to one that does not have a garment? One that does not have a garment - this is a prostration in general, one that has a garment - the spreading out of hands and feet.

hebrew_text: וְכַמָּה שִׁיעוּר שְׁהִיָּיה? פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ רַבִּי יִצְחָק בַּר נַחְמָנִי וְחַד דְּעִימֵּיהּ, וּמַנּוּ – רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן פַּזִּי; וְאָמְרִי לַהּ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן פַּזִּי וְחַד דְּעִימֵּיהּ, וּמַנּוּ – רַבִּי יִצְחָק בַּר נַחְמָנִי, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בַּר נַחְמָנִי. חַד אָמַר: כְּמֵימְרֵיהּ דְּהַאי פְּסוּקָא, וְחַד אָמַר: כְּמִ״וַּיִכְרְעוּ״ לְסֵיפָא. ״וְכֹל בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל רֹאִים בְּרֶדֶת הָאֵשׁ וּכְבוֹד ה׳ עַל הַבָּיִת, וַיִּכְרְעוּ אַפַּיִם אַרְצָה עַל הָרִצְפָה, וַיִּשְׁתַּחֲווּ וְהוֹדוֹת לַה׳ כִּי טוֹב כִּי לְעוֹלָם חַסְדּוֹ״.
human_translation: And what is the measure of tarrying? Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Naḥmani and one who was with him disagree about this. And who is Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi. And some say Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi and one who was with him. And who is Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Naḥmani. And some say Rabbi Shimon bar Naḥmani. One says: as to recite this verse and one says: as from “and they bowed” until the end. “And when all the children of Israel saw how the fire came down, and the glory of the Lord upon the House, and they bowed with their faces to the ground upon the pavement, and prostrated themselves, and praised the Lord, saying: For He is good, for His steadfast love endures forever”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And how much is the measure of its height? Rabbi Yitzchak bar Nachmani and one of his colleagues disagree about it, and they count - Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi; and some say to him Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi and one of his colleagues, and they count - Rabbi Yitzchak bar Nachmani, and some say to him Rabbi Shimon ben Nachmani. One said: like the statement of this verse, and one said: like 'and they bowed' at the end. 'And all the children of Israel saw when the fire came down and the glory of the Lord was on the house, they bowed their faces to the ground on the pavement, and they prostrated themselves and gave thanks to the Lord, for He is good, for His kindness is eternal.'"

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: קִידָּה – עַל אַפַּיִם, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וַתִּקֹּד בַּת שֶׁבַע אַפַּיִם אֶרֶץ״. כְּרִיעָה – עַל בִּרְכַּיִם, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״מִכְּרֹעַ עַל בִּרְכָּיו״. הִשְׁתַּחֲוָאָה – זוֹ פִּישּׁוּט יָדַיִם וְרַגְלַיִם, וְכֵן אוֹמֵר: ״הֲבוֹא נָבוֹא אֲנִי וְאִמְּךָ וְאַחֶיךָ לְהִשְׁתַּחֲוֹת לְךָ אָרְצָה״.
human_translation: The Sages taught: kidda upon face, and so states: “Then Bathsheba bowed [ vatikkod ] with her face to the ground” Keria upon knees, and so states from kneeling [ mikero’a ] upon his knees” Hishtaḥava’a , this spreading  arms and legs and so states “Shall I and your mother and your brothers indeed come to bow down [ lehishtaḥavot ] to you to the ground”
llm_translation: The sages taught: "Kiddah" - upon the palms, as it says: "And the daughter of Sheva bowed with her face to the ground." "Keri'ah" - upon the knees, as it says: "He bowed upon his knees." "Hishtachava'ah" - this is prostration of hands and feet, as it says: "Shall I and your mother and your brothers indeed come to bow down to you to the ground?"

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רָבָא: צָרִיךְ שְׁהִיָּיה לְמַלְקוּת, אוֹ אֵין צָרִיךְ שְׁהִיָּיה לְמַלְקוּת? לְקׇרְבָּן גְּמִירִי שְׁהִיָּיה, לְמַלְקוּת לָא גְּמִירִי שְׁהִיָּיה;
human_translation: Rava raises a dilemma: tarrying necessary to lashes? Or tarrying not necessary to lashes, learned tarrying to an offering, not learned tarrying to lashes?
llm_translation: Rava asked: Does it require a period of time for Malkut (capital punishment), or does it not require a period of time for Malkut? For Korban (sacrifice), it is established that it requires a period of time, but for Malkut, it is not established that it requires a period of time.

hebrew_text: אוֹ דִלְמָא, בִּפְנִים גְּמִירִי שְׁהִיָּיה – לָא שְׁנָא לְקׇרְבָּן וְלָא שְׁנָא לְמַלְקוּת? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Or perhaps is learned tarrying within it is no different to an offering, and it is no different to lashes? shall stand
llm_translation: Or perhaps, internally it is learned that it does not matter for the offering and it does not matter for stoning? It remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רָבָא: תָּלָה עַצְמוֹ בַּאֲוִיר עֲזָרָה, מַהוּ? כִּי גְּמִירִי שְׁהִיָּיה – שְׁהִיָּיה דְּבַת הִשְׁתַּחֲוָאָה, דְּלָאו בַּת הִשְׁתַּחֲוָאָה לָא גְּמִירִי; אוֹ דִּלְמָא, בִּפְנִים שְׁהִיָּיה גְּמִירִי – לָא שְׁנָא דְּבַת הִשְׁתַּחֲוָאָה וְלָא שְׁנָא דְּלָאו בַּת הִשְׁתַּחֲוָאָה? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Rava raises dilemma: suspended himself in the airspace of courtyard what is When is learned tarrying tarrying that is suited for bowing; that is not suited for bowing, is not learned Or perhaps is learned tarrying within it is no different is suited for bowing, and it is no different is not suited for bowing. shall stand
llm_translation: Rava asked: If one suspends himself in the air of the courtyard, what is the ruling? Is it because it is assumed that he is bowing – if he is bowing, the daughter of bowing is not assumed; or perhaps, if he is inside, he is assumed to be bowing – is there a difference between the daughter of bowing and not the daughter of bowing? This matter remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַב אָשֵׁי: טִימֵּא עַצְמוֹ בְּמֵזִיד, מַהוּ? בְּאוֹנֶס גְּמִירִי שְׁהִיָּיה, בְּמֵזִיד לָא גְּמִירִי שְׁהִיָּיה; אוֹ דִּלְמָא, בִּפְנִים גְּמִירִי שְׁהִיָּיה – לָא שְׁנָא בְּאוֹנֶס וְלָא שְׁנָא בְּמֵזִיד? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi raises a dilemma intentionally rendered himself ritually impure what is learned tarrying in circumstances beyond his control, not learned tarrying intentionally? Or perhaps is learned tarrying within it is no different in circumstances beyond his control, and it is no different intentionally. shall stand
llm_translation: Inquiries of Rav Ashi: If one defiles himself intentionally, what is the law? In a case of coercion, it is certain that he remains defiled, but in a case of intention, it is not certain that he remains defiled; or perhaps, in the case of internal defilement, it is not different whether it was due to coercion or intention? This matter shall remain unresolved.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַב אָשֵׁי: נָזִיר בְּקֶבֶר, בָּעֵי שְׁהִיָּיה לְמַלְקוּת אוֹ אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ? בִּפְנִים גְּמִירִי שְׁהִיָּיה, בַּחוּץ לָא גְּמִירִי שְׁהִיָּיה; אוֹ דִלְמָא, בְּאוֹנֶס גְּמִירִי שְׁהִיָּיה – לָא שְׁנָא בִּפְנִים וְלָא שְׁנָא בַּחוּץ? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi raises dilemma: a nazirite, alongside a grave, is tarrying a necessary to lashes, or is not necessary, learned tarrying within not learned tarrying outside Or perhaps learned tarrying in circumstances beyond control, it is no different within and it is no different outside shall stand
llm_translation: Inquiry of Rav Ashe: A Nazirite in a grave, does he require shaving or not? Inside, it is certain that he requires shaving; outside, it is not certain that he requires shaving. Or perhaps, in a case of coercion, it is certain that he requires shaving – is there no difference between inside and outside? This matter shall remain unresolved.

hebrew_text: בָּא לוֹ בַּאֲרוּכָּה חַיָּיב, בִּקְצָרָה פָּטוּר וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רָבָא: קְצָרָה שֶׁאָמְרוּ – אֲפִילּוּ עָקֵב בְּצַד גּוּדָל, וַאֲפִילּוּ כׇּל הַיּוֹם כּוּלּוֹ.
human_translation: he went out a longer liable the shortest exempt. Rava says: short which said even heel to toe, and even all day long.
llm_translation: He came to him in length - liable, in short - exempt, and so on. Rava said: The shortness they spoke of - even if it is as long as the side of a large beam, and even the entire day entirely.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רָבָא: שְׁהִיּוֹת מַהוּ שֶׁיִּצְטָרְפוּ? וְתִיפְשׁוֹט לֵיהּ מִדִּידֵיהּ! הָתָם בִּדְלָא שְׁהָה.
human_translation: Rava raised a dilemma: What is combining periods of tarrying, Let resolve from his own There who did not tarry
llm_translation: Rava asked: What is the law when they become mixed together? And let him separate them from each other! There, it is when he did not pause.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ אַבָּיֵי מֵרַבָּה: בָּא לוֹ בַּאֲרוּכָּה שִׁיעוּר קְצָרָה, מַהוּ? שִׁיעוּר גְּמִירִי – וְכִי בָּא לוֹ בַּאֲרוּכָּה שִׁיעוּר קְצָרָה פָּטוּר, אוֹ דִּלְמָא דַּוְקָא גְּמִירִי: בַּאֲרוּכָּה – חַיָּיב, בִּקְצָרָה – פָּטוּר? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לֹא נִתְּנָה אֲרוּכָּה לְהִדָּחוֹת אֶצְלוֹ.
human_translation: Abaye raised a dilemma to Rabba went out the longer in the measure of time the shortest what is learned measure and if he went out the longer measure shortest exempt? Or perhaps learned specifically longer liable, shortest exempt. said to the longer was not given so that it would be overridden for him;
llm_translation: Abaye asked Rabbah: If one intended for a long measure and it turned out to be a short measure, what is the law? If it is a complete measure - and if one intended for a long measure and it turned out to be a short measure, is he exempt, or perhaps specifically a complete measure: in the case of a long measure - he is liable, in the case of a short measure - he is exempt? He said to him: The long measure was not given to be rejected by him.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַבִּי זֵירָא, אֶלָּא דְּקַיְימָא לַן: טָמֵא שֶׁשִּׁימֵּשׁ – בְּמִיתָה; הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ? אִי דְּלָא שְׁהָה – הֵיכִי עָבֵיד עֲבוֹדָה? אִי דִּשְׁהָה – בַּר כָּרֵת הוּא!
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira objects to this: But that we maintain, an impure who served to death how can you find these If he did not tarry how could he have performed service if he tarried he is liable karet ,
llm_translation: Rebbe Zeira objects to her, rather, it is established for us: One who is impure and serves - with death; how do you find her? If she did not stay - how does she perform the service? If she stayed - it is a violation of a negative commandment!

hebrew_text: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא שִׁיעוּרָא גְּמִירִי – מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ דְּאָנֵיס נַפְשֵׁיהּ בִּקְצָרָה וְעָבֵד עֲבוֹדָה.
human_translation: Granted, if you say learned measure you can find where he exerted himself shortest performed a service
llm_translation: If you say "in truth, the measure is learned," you forget that he forced himself in a short time and performed the work.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ דַּוְקָא גְּמִירִי, הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ?
human_translation: But if you say that learned specifically how can you find these
llm_translation: Rather, if you say specifically that it is learned, how do you find it?

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מַאי קוּשְׁיָא? מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ כְּגוֹן שֶׁבָּא בִּקְצָרָה וְהִפֵּךְ בְּצִינּוֹרָא, וְכִדְרַב הוּנָא – דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא: זָר שֶׁהִפֵּךְ בְּצִינּוֹרָא, חַיָּיב מִיתָה.
human_translation: Abaye said: What is the difficulty? You find it such as he went out shortest but he turned over with a fork [ betzinnora ]. and in accordance with of Rav Huna. As Rav Huna says: A non-priest who turns over with a fork is liable death
llm_translation: Abaye said: What is the difficulty? You find it in a case where one came into a field and turned around in a pipe, and like Rav Huna said: Rav Huna said: A non-Jew who turned around in a pipe is liable to the death penalty.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא – אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: זָר שֶׁהִפֵּךְ בְּצִינּוֹרָא, חַיָּיב מִיתָה. הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דְּלָא הַפֵּךְ לַהּ לָא מִיעַכְּלִי – פְּשִׁיטָא! וְאִי דְּלָא הַפֵּךְ בְּהוּ נָמֵי מִיעַכְּלִי – מַאי קָא עָבֵיד?
human_translation: the itself: Rav Huna says: A non-priest who turns over with a fork is liable death What are the circumstances If that he had not turned it over, would not have been consumed obvious And if that he had not turned it over, it would also have been consumed what did he perform?
llm_translation: Body - Rav Huna said: A non-Jew who turned over a pipe, is liable to death. How so? If he did not turn it over for its benefit - it is obvious! And if he turned it over for its benefit - what is he doing?

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא – דְּאִי לָא הַפֵּךְ בְּהוּ מִיעַכְּלִי בְּתַרְתֵּי שָׁעֵי, וְהַשְׁתָּא מִיעַכְּלִי בְּחַד שַׁעְתָּא; וְהָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: דְּכֹל קָרוֹבֵי עֲבוֹדָה – עֲבוֹדָה הִיא.
human_translation: No, necessary where, had not turned it over, it would have been consumed in two hours, but now it is consumed in one hour. And he teaches us this: That any that accelerates the service, is a service.
llm_translation: Not necessary - for if not turned in it is digested in two hours, and now it is digested in one hour; and this teaches us: all things close to the service - it is considered service.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא: בָּעֵינָא דְּאֵימָא מִילְּתָא, וּמִסְתְּפֵינָא מֵחַבְרַיָּא. הַנִּכְנָס לְבַיִת הַמְנוּגָּע דֶּרֶךְ אֲחוֹרָיו, וַאֲפִילּוּ כּוּלּוֹ חוּץ מֵחוֹטְמוֹ – טָהוֹר. דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהַבָּא אֶל הַבַּיִת״ – דֶּרֶךְ בִּיאָה אָסְרָה תּוֹרָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Oshaya, said: I wish to say something, but I am afraid of my colleagues, one who enters a house afflicted with leprosy, backward, even his entire except for his nose, pure, as it is written: “He that enters into the house the Torah prohibited, the normal manner of entering into
llm_translation: Rabbi Oshaya said: I want to say something, but I am afraid of my colleagues. One who enters a house afflicted with tzara'at from behind, even if only his nose is outside - he is pure. As it is written: "And the one who enters the house" - Torah prohibited entering.

hebrew_text: וּמִסְתְּפֵינָא מֵחַבְרַיָּא – אִי הָכִי כּוּלּוֹ נָמֵי! אָמַר רָבָא: כּוּלּוֹ – לָא גָּרַע מִכֵּלִים שֶׁבְּבַיִת, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְלֹא יִטְמָא כׇּל אֲשֶׁר בַּבָּיִת״.
human_translation: But I am afraid of my colleagues, If so, his entire also Rava said: his entire no worse than vessels that are in the house, as it is written: so that all that is in the house shall not be made impure”
llm_translation: We are in doubt from our colleagues - if so, all of them are trustworthy! Rava said: All of them - does not exclude any vessels in the house, as it is written: "And everything in the house shall not become unclean."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: גַּגִּין הַלָּלוּ – אֵין אוֹכְלִין שָׁם קׇדְשֵׁי קָדָשִׁים, וְאֵין שׁוֹחֲטִין שָׁם קָדָשִׁים קַלִּים; וְטָמֵא שֶׁנִּכְנָס דֶּרֶךְ גַּגִּין לַהֵיכָל – פָּטוּר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאֶל הַמִּקְדָּשׁ לֹא תָבֹא״ – דֶּרֶךְ בִּיאָה אָסְרָה תּוֹרָה.
human_translation: This is also taught those roofs offerings of the most sacred order may not be eaten there, and offerings of lesser sanctity may not be slaughtered there, And a ritually impure person who enters the Sanctuary via roofs is exempt, as it is stated “And she shall not enter into the Sanctuary” the Torah prohibited the normal manner of entering
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita: These roofs – one may not eat there holy of holies, and one may not slaughter there light holy offerings; and a ritually impure person who enters via the roofs to the sanctuary – is exempt, as it is stated: "And to the sanctuary you shall not come" – the Torah prohibited entry via the roofs.

hebrew_text: זוֹ הִיא מִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה שֶׁבַּמִּקְדָּשׁ שֶׁאֵין חַיָּיבִין עָלֶיהָ וְכוּ׳. הֵיכָא קָאֵי דְּקָאָמַר ״זוֹ הִיא״? הָתָם קָאֵי – אֵין חַיָּיבִין עַל עֲשֵׂה וְעַל לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁבַּמִּקְדָּשׁ,
human_translation: This is the positive mitzva concerning the Temple for which is not liable To what does refer when he says: This is He is referring to there is not liable with regard to a positive mitzva or prohibition concerning in the Temple,
llm_translation: This is the positive commandment in the Temple for which one is not obligated, etc. Where is it standing that it says "This is it"? It stands there - one is not obligated for a positive commandment and for a negative commandment in the Temple.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין מְבִיאִין אָשָׁם תָּלוּי עַל עֲשֵׂה וְעַל לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁבַּמִּקְדָּשׁ.
human_translation: And does not bring a provisional guilt-offering for a positive mitzva or prohibition concerning in the Temple,
llm_translation: And not bring guilt offering hanging on positive commandment and on negative commandment in the Temple.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל חַיָּיבִין עַל עֲשֵׂה וְעַל לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁבְּנִדָּה, וּמְבִיאִין אָשָׁם תָּלוּי עַל עֲשֵׂה וְעַל לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁבְּנִדָּה.
human_translation: But is liable with regard to a positive mitzva or prohibition concerning a menstruating woman. And brings a provisional guilt-offering for a positive mitzva or prohibition concerning a menstruating woman.
llm_translation: However, obligated on positive commandments and negative commandments that are in the category of impurity, and they bring a guilt offering dependent on positive commandments and negative commandments that are in the category of impurity.

hebrew_text: וְקָאָמַר: זוֹ הִיא מִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה שֶׁבַּמִּקְדָּשׁ שֶׁאֵין חַיָּיבִין עָלֶיהָ; וְאֵיזוֹ הִיא מִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה שֶׁבְּנִדָּה שֶׁחַיָּיבִין עָלֶיהָ? הָיָה מְשַׁמֵּשׁ עִם הַטְּהוֹרָה וְאָמְרָה לוֹ ״נִטְמֵאתִי״, וּפֵירַשׁ מִיָּד – חַיָּיב, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁיְּצִיאָתוֹ הֲנָאָה לוֹ כְּבִיאָתוֹ.
human_translation: And says: This is the positive mitzva concerning the Temple for which is not liable And which is the positive mitzva with regard to a menstruating woman for which liable was engaging in intercourse with a ritually pure woman, and she said to him: I have become impure, and he immediately withdrew liable because his withdrawal is as pleasant to him as his entry.
llm_translation: And he said: This is the positive commandment in the Temple for which one is not obligated; and which is the positive commandment in Niddah for which one is obligated? If he was engaging in relations with his wife and she said to him, "I have become impure," and he immediately separated – he is obligated, because his departure is as pleasurable to him as his arrival.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר, אַבָּיֵי אָמַר מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר רַב: חַיָּיב שְׁתַּיִם. וְכֵן אָמַר רָבָא, אָמַר רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר שֶׁבָּא, אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: חַיָּיב שְׁתַּיִם, חֲדָא אַכְּנִיסָה וַחֲדָא אַפְּרִישָׁה.
human_translation: It was stated Abaye says in the name of Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Rav: liable two And so Rava says Rav Shmuel bar Shaba says Rav Huna says: liable two one for entry and one for withdrawal.
llm_translation: It was stated: Abbaye said in the name of Rabbi Chiya bar Rav: One is obligated to bring two. And similarly, Rava said, in the name of Rav Shmuel bar Sheva, who said in the name of Rav Huna: One is obligated to bring two, one for entering and one for departing.

hebrew_text: הָוֵי בַּהּ רַבָּה: בְּמַאי? אִילֵימָא סָמוּךְ לְוִסְתָּהּ – וּבְמַאן? אִילֵּימָא בְּתַלְמִיד חָכָם – בִּשְׁלָמָא אַכְּנִיסָה לִיחַיַּיב, קָסָבַר יָכוֹלְנִי לִבְעוֹל; אֶלָּא אַפְּרִישָׁה אַמַּאי לִיחַיַּיב? מֵזִיד הוּא!
human_translation: Rabba discusses this About what If we say near her expected date With whom If we say with a Torah scholar, granted he will be liable for entry. he thought I can engage in intercourse But why will he be liable for withdrawal? intentional,
llm_translation: Be in it, Rabba: With what? If you say, adjacent to her – and with whom? If you say, with a Torah scholar – Granted, if he brought her in intentionally, he is liable, for he might come to sin; but if he separated, why is he liable? It is intentional!

hebrew_text: וְאִי בְּעַם הָאָרֶץ – אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי ״אָכַל שְׁנֵי זֵיתֵי חֵלֶב בְּהֶעְלֵם אֶחָד״ הוּא!
human_translation: And if with an am ha’aretz , this and that, is ate two olive- of fat in one lapse of awareness
llm_translation: And if he is among the common people - this means both this and that, "he ate two olives of fat in one hiding" it is!

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא בְּשֶׁאֵין סָמוּךְ לְוִסְתָּהּ? וּבְמַאן? אִילֵּימָא בְּתַלְמִיד חָכָם – וְלָא חֲדָא לָא מִיחַיַּיב; אַכְּנִיסָה – אָנוּס, אַפְּרִישָׁה – מֵזִיד! אִי בְּעַם הָאָרֶץ – חֲדָא הוּא דְּמִיחַיַּיב, אַפְּרִישָׁה!
human_translation: Rather, where it was not near her expected date And with whom If we say a Torah scholar, he should not be liable even one with regard to entry, a victim of circumstances beyond his control, with regard to withdrawal, intentional, if with an am ha’aretz , he should be liable one for withdrawal.
llm_translation: And rather, in what case is it not adjacent to its foundation? And by whom? If you say by a Torah scholar - but one alone does not obligate; if she was brought in - it is under duress, if she was divorced - intentionally! If it is by an am ha'aretz - one alone obligates, if she was divorced!

hebrew_text: הֲדַר אָמַר רָבָא: לְעוֹלָם בְּסָמוּךְ לְוִסְתָּהּ, וּבְתַלְמִיד חָכָם, וְתַלְמִיד חָכָם לְזוֹ וְאֵין תַּלְמִיד חָכָם לָזוֹ.
human_translation: Rava then said: Actually, near the expected date of and with a Torah scholar. But a Torah scholar with regard to this But not a Torah scholar with regard to that
llm_translation: Rava said: Always be close to the judge, and with a wise disciple, and a wise disciple to him, and there is no wise disciple to him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: וְתַרְוַיְיהוּ תְּנַנְהִי; כְּנִיסָה תְּנֵינָא, פְּרִישָׁה תְּנֵינָא. פְּרִישָׁה תְּנֵינָא – דְּקָתָנֵי: הָיָה מְשַׁמֵּשׁ עִם הַטְּהוֹרָה וְאָמְרָה לוֹ ״נִטְמֵאתִי״, וּפֵירַשׁ מִיָּד – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: Rava said: And we learn both of these we learn entry, we learn withdrawal. We learn withdrawal, as teaches: was engaging in intercourse with a ritually pure woman, and she said to him: I have become impure, and he immediately withdrew liable
llm_translation: Rava said: And both of them taught; regarding entering we teach, regarding separating we teach. Regarding separating we teach - as it was taught: If he was engaging in marital relations with his wife and she said to him, "I have become impure," and he immediately separated - he is liable.

hebrew_text: כְּנִיסָה תְּנֵינָא: נִמְצָא עַל שֶׁלּוֹ – טְמֵאִין וְחַיָּיבִין בְּקׇרְבָּן. מַאי, לָאו בְּסָמוּךְ לְוִסְתָּהּ – וְאַכְּנִיסָה?
human_translation: We learn entry is found on his are impure and are liable to offering What, is it not near the expected date of and for entry
llm_translation: Talmudic text: We learned in a Mishnah: If it is found on his, they are impure and obligated in a sacrifice. What, is it not if it is adjacent to his and he brings it in? English translation:

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַדָּא בַּר מַתְנָא לְרָבָא: לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לָךְ, בְּשֶׁלֹּא סָמוּךְ לְוִוסְתָּהּ – וְאַפְּרִישָׁה; וְכִי תֵּימָא: פְּרִישָׁה לְמָה לִי, הָא תְּנָא לֵיהּ; הָא אִיצְטְרִיךְ לְאַשְׁמוֹעִינַן: נִמְצָא עַל שֶׁלָּהּ – טְמֵאִים בְּסָפֵק, וּפְטוּרִין מִן הַקׇּרְבָּן; וְאַיְּידֵי דְּבָעֵי מִיתְנֵא נִמְצָא עַל שֶׁלָּהּ, תְּנָא נָמֵי נִמְצָא עַל שֶׁלּוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Mattana said to Rava: Actually, I say to you not near the expected date of and for withdrawal And if you would say: Why do I withdrawal? Didn’t teach this It was necessary to teach us this, is found on her they are impure because of an uncertainty, and they are exempt from offering. And since had to teach was found on her it also taught it was found on his
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Adda bar Matna said to Rava: Always say to her, if her separation is not adjacent - then separate; and if you say: why should I separate, you should say to her; because we need to hear: if it is found on hers - they are impure with doubt, and exempt from the sacrifice; and since he requires her separation, if it is found on hers, he should also say it is found on his.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אַדָּא: מִי מָצֵית לְאוֹקֹמַהּ לְהַהִיא בְּשֶׁלֹּא סָמוּךְ לְוִסְתָּהּ, וְאַפְּרִישָׁה?! וְהָא ״נִמְצָא״ קָתָנֵי, וְ״נִמְצָא״ לְבָתַר הָכִי מַשְׁמַע; וְאִי אַפְּרִישָׁה, מֵעִיקָּרָא כִּי פָּרֵישׁ לֵיהּ – מֵעִיקָּרָא הָוְיָא לֵיהּ יְדִיעָה!
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Adda: Can you interpret that where it was not near the expected date of and for withdrawal? But isn’t it taught is found And indicate was found afterward, And if for withdrawal, at the outset, when he withdrew from then that he had knowledge
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Adda: Who found the support for that beam without it being adjacent to its foundation, and he separated it?! But it is written "found," and "found" implies afterwards; and if he did not separate it, from the outset when he set it up - from the outset he would have knowledge!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: צָיֵית מַאי דְּקָאָמַר רַבָּךְ. הֵיכִי אֵצֵית? דְּתַנְיָא עֲלַהּ: זוֹ הִיא מִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה שֶׁבְּנִדָּה שֶׁחַיָּיבִין עָלֶיהָ, וְאִם אִיתָא – מִצְוַת לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה הִיא!
human_translation: Rava said to Listen to what your teacher, is saying, How can I As it is taught with regard to This is the positive mitzva with regard to a menstruating woman for which one is liable. And if it is so is a prohibition.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rava: "What is the meaning of what your master is saying?" How should I understand it? As it was taught in a Baraita: "This is the positive commandment in the case of a Niddah, for which one is obligated, and if it comes – it is a negative commandment!"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי תָּנֵיתָא – חַסַּר וּתְנִי הָכִי: זוֹ הִיא מִצְוַת לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁבְּנִדָּה שֶׁחַיָּיבִין עָלֶיהָ. הָיָה מְשַׁמֵּשׁ עִם הַטְּהוֹרָה וְאָמְרָה לוֹ ״נִטְמֵאתִי״, וּפֵירַשׁ מִיָּד – חַיָּיב, זוֹ הִיא מִצְוַת עֲשֵׂה שֶׁבְּנִדָּה כּוּ׳.
human_translation: said to him: If you learned it is missing and you should teach like this: this is the prohibition with regard to a menstruating woman for which one is liable. was engaging in intercourse with a ritually pure woman, and she said to him: I have become impure, and he immediately withdrew liable this is the positive mitzva with regard to a menstruating woman.
llm_translation: He said to him: If you have not taught - omit and teach thus: This is the negative commandment of Niddah for which one is liable. If he was engaging in marital relations with his wife who is pure and she says to him, "I have become impure," and he immediately separates from her - he is liable. This is the positive commandment of Niddah, etc.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: פֵּירַשׁ מִיָּד – חַיָּיב. הֵיכִי עָבֵיד? אָמַר רַב הוּנָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: נוֹעֵץ עֶשֶׂר צִפׇּרְנָיו בַּקַּרְקַע עַד שֶׁיָּמוּת, וְטוּבֵיהּ.
human_translation: The Master said he immediately withdrew liable What should do Rav Huna said in the name of Rava: press his ten fingernails into the ground, until becomes flaccid, and it is good for him
llm_translation: Master said: He explained immediately - liable. How does he do it? Rav Huna said in the name of Rava: He should plant ten of its horns in the ground until it dies, and its hide.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: זֹאת אוֹמֶרֶת, הַמְשַׁמֵּשׁ מֵת בַּעֲרָיוֹת – פָּטוּר. דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ חַיָּיב, הָכָא מַאי טַעְמָא פָּטוּר? מִשּׁוּם דְּאָנוּס הוּא. אִי אָנוּס הוּא, כִּי פֵּירַשׁ מִיָּד נָמֵי נִיפְּטַר – אָנוּס הוּא!
human_translation: Rava said: That is to say, one who engages in intercourse, with a flaccid with those with whom relations are forbidden exempt. As if it enters your mind liable, here, what is the reason exempt it is because he is a victim of circumstances beyond his control if he is a victim of circumstances beyond his control, if he withdraws immediately, he should also be exempt, he is a victim of circumstances beyond his control.
llm_translation: Rava said: This means, one who is forced to engage in forbidden relations is exempt. For if you were to say he is liable, what is the reason he is exempt here? Because he is coerced. If he is coerced, when he separates immediately he is exempt – he is coerced!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לָךְ, הַמְשַׁמֵּשׁ מֵת בַּעֲרָיוֹת חַיָּיב; וְהָכָא מַאי טַעְמָא פָּטוּר – מִשּׁוּם דְּאָנוּס הוּא. וְהָא דְּאָמְרַתְּ: כִּי פָרֵישׁ מִיָּד אַמַּאי חַיָּיב? שֶׁהָיָה לוֹ לִפְרוֹשׁ בַּהֲנָאָה מוּעֶטֶת, וּפֵירַשׁ בַּהֲנָאָה מְרוּבָּה.
human_translation: Abaye said to Actually, I say to you one who engages in intercourse, with a flaccid with those with whom relations are forbidden is liable. And here, what is the reason exempt? because he is a victim of circumstances beyond his control. And that which you said: Why, liable if he withdrew immediately, he should have withdrawn with little pleasure, but he withdrew with great pleasure.
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: Always say to you, one who derives benefit from forbidden relationships is liable; and here, what is the reason he is exempt - because it is under duress. And that which you said: when he separates immediately, why is he liable? Because he could have separated with minimal benefit, and he separated with significant benefit.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבָּה בַּר חָנָן לְאַבָּיֵי: אִם כֵּן מָצִינוּ אֲרוּכָּה וּקְצָרָה בְּנִדָּה,
human_translation: Rabba bar Ḥanan said to Abaye: If so, we find a long and a short with regard to a menstruating woman.
llm_translation: Rabba bar Hanan said to Abbaye: If so, we have found a long and short period in Niddah.

hebrew_text: וַאֲנַן בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ תְּנַן! אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא דָּמֵי; אֲרוּכָּה דְּהָכָא – קְצָרָה דְּהָתָם, וַאֲרוּכָּה דְּהָתָם – קְצָרָה דְּהָכָא.
human_translation: And we learned with regard to the Temple. Rather, because are not similar long here, shortest there, And long there, shortest here,
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah in the Temple! Rather, because it is not similar; the long one here is short there, and the long one there is short here.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב נָתָן: מִי אָמַר אַבָּיֵי אָנוּס הוּא – אַלְמָא בְּשֶׁלֹּא סָמוּךְ לְוִסְתָּהּ קָאָמְרִינַן?! וְהָא אַבַּיֵּי דְּאָמַר חַיָּיב שְׁתַּיִם – אַלְמָא בְּסָמוּךְ לְוִסְתָּהּ עָסְקִינַן!
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Natan, objects to Did Abaye say he is a victim of circumstances beyond his control? Apparently, we are speaking not near the expected date of But Abaye who says liable two Apparently, we are dealing with near the expected date of
llm_translation: Challenges her Rav Huna son of Rav Natan: Who said Abaye is coerced - if not near her we are saying?! But Abaye who said obligated two - if near her we are dealing!

hebrew_text: כִּי אִיתְּמַר דְּאַבָּיֵי – בְּעָלְמָא אִיתְּמַר.
human_translation: When of Abaye was stated, was stated in general.
llm_translation: It was stated: "Ki itmar d'Abaye - be'alma itmar."

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן בֶּן יוֹסֵי בֶּן לָקוֹנְיָא מֵרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹסֵי בֶּן לָקוֹנְיָא: אַזְהָרָה לְבוֹעֵל נִדָּה, מִנַּיִן מִן הַתּוֹרָה? שְׁקַל קָלָא פְּתַק בֵּיהּ: אַזְהָרָה לְבוֹעֵל נִדָּה?! ״וְאֶל אִשָּׁה בְּנִדַּת טֻמְאָתָהּ לֹא תִקְרַב״!
human_translation: Rabbi Yonatan ben Yosei ben Lakonya asked Rabbi Shimon ben Yosei ben Lakonya: From where in the Torah prohibition concerning one who engages in intercourse with a menstruating woman [ nidda ] took a clod [ kala ] and threw at him prohibition concerning one who engages in intercourse with a menstruating woman? “And a woman who is impure by her uncleanness [ nidda ] you shall not approach,
llm_translation: Requested by Rabbi Yonatan ben Yosei ben Lakonya from Rabbi Shimon ben Yosei ben Lakonya: Is there a warning for one who has relations with a menstruating woman in the Torah? He took a light reed and broke it: Is there a warning for one who has relations with a menstruating woman?! "And to a woman in the impurity of her menstruation you shall not approach"!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אַזְהָרָה לִמְשַׁמֵּשׁ עִם הַטְּהוֹרָה וְאָמְרָה לוֹ ״נִטְמֵאתִי״, דְּלָא נִיפְרוֹשׁ מִיָּד – מְנָלַן? אָמַר חִזְקִיָּה, אָמַר קְרָא: ״וּתְהִי נִדָּתָהּ עָלָיו״ – אֲפִילּוּ בִּשְׁעַת נִדָּתָהּ תְּהֵא עָלָיו.
human_translation: Rather, from where do we prohibition with regard to was engaging in intercourse with a ritually pure woman, and she said to him: I have become impure, that he must not withdraw immediately? Ḥizkiyya said: The verse states: and her menstrual flow shall be upon him” even when she is menstruating, shall be upon him;
llm_translation: Rather, a warning to engage in marital relations with the pure woman, and she says to him, "I have become impure," so that he does not immediately separate from her - from where? Hezekiah said, Scripture says, "And her impurity shall be upon him" - even at the time of her impurity, it shall be upon him.

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחַן עֲשֵׂה, לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה מְנָלַן? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא, אָמַר קְרָא: ״לֹא תִקְרַב״; ״לֹא תִקְרַב״ נָמֵי לָא תִּפְרוֹשׁ הוּא, דִּכְתִיב: ״הָאֹמְרִים קְרַב אֵלֶיךָ אַל תִּגַּשׁ בִּי כִּי קְדַשְׁתִּיךָ״.
human_translation: We found a positive mitzva from where do we a prohibition? Rav Pappa said: The verse states: you shall not approach, “You shall not approach [ tikrav ]” also You shall not withdraw, as it is written: “Those who say: Withdraw [ kerav ] to yourself, come not near to me, for I am holier than you”
llm_translation: I found "do," do not do from where? Rav Papa said, Scripture says: "Do not come near"; "Do not come near" also means do not spread out, as it is written: "Those who say, 'Come close to you, do not come near me, for I have sanctified you.'"

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְהִזַּרְתֶּם אֶת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל מִטֻּמְאָתָם״ – אָמַר רַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה: מִיכָּן אַזְהָרָה לִבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁיִּפְרְשׁוּ מִנְּשׁוֹתֵיהֶן סָמוּךְ לְוִסְתָּן. וְכַמָּה? אָמַר רַבָּה: עוֹנָה.
human_translation: the Sages taught: “And shall you separate the children of Israel from their uncleanness” Rabbi Yoshiya says: From here a prohibition to the children of Israel that they must separate from their wives near the expected date of And how long Rabba says: A set interval of time
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "And you shall separate the children of Israel from their impurity" - Rabbi Yoshiyah said: From here there is a warning to the children of Israel that they should separate from their wives close to their menstruation. And how close? Rabba said: One hour.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַאי: כֹּל שֶׁאֵינוֹ פּוֹרֵשׁ מֵאִשְׁתּוֹ סָמוּךְ לְוִסְתָּהּ, אֲפִילּוּ הוֹיִין לוֹ בָּנִים כִּבְנֵי אַהֲרֹן – מֵתִים; דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהִזַּרְתֶּם אֶת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל מִטֻּמְאָתָם וְהַדָּוָה בְּנִדָּתָהּ״, וּסְמִיךְ לֵיהּ: ״אַחֲרֵי מוֹת״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: anyone who does not separate from his wife near the expected date of even he has sons like the sons of Aaron, will die as it is written: “And shall you separate the children of Israel from their uncleanness… of her that is sick with her menstrual flow” and near it: “After the death of
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: Anyone who does not separate from his wife is close to witchcraft, even if they have children like the sons of Aaron - they die; as it is written: "And you shall separate the children of Israel from their impurity, so that they do not die in their impurity," and adjacent to it: "after death."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל הַפּוֹרֵשׁ מֵאִשְׁתּוֹ סָמוּךְ לְוִסְתָּהּ – הוֹיִין לוֹ בָּנִים זְכָרִים, דִּכְתִיב: ״לְהַבְדִּיל בֵּין הַטָּמֵא וּבֵין הַטָּהֹר״, וּסְמִיךְ לֵיהּ: ״אִשָּׁה כִּי תַזְרִיעַ וְיָלְדָה זָכָר״. רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי אָמַר: הוֹיִין לוֹ בָּנִים רְאוּיִין לְהוֹרָאָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״לְהַבְדִּיל... וּלְהוֹרוֹת״.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Anyone who separates himself from his wife near the expected date of will have male children, as it is written: “To distinguish between the impure and the pure” and near it: “If a woman conceive and bear a male child” Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: He will have sons who are worthy of teaching as it is written: “To distinguish… and to teach
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said Rabbi Yochanan: Anyone who separates from his wife, close to her - he will have male children, as it is written: "To distinguish between the unclean and the clean," and adjacent to it: "When a woman conceives and gives birth to a male." Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: He will have children fit for teaching, as it is written: "To distinguish... and to teach."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל הַמַּבְדִּיל עַל הַיַּיִן בְּמוֹצָאֵי שַׁבָּתוֹת – הוֹיִין לוֹ בָּנִים זְכָרִים; דִּכְתִיב: ״לְהַבְדִּיל בֵּין הַקֹּדֶשׁ וּבֵין הַחוֹל״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״לְהַבְדִּיל בֵּין הַטָּמֵא וּבֵין הַטָּהוֹר״, וּסְמִיךְ לֵיהּ: ״אִשָּׁה כִּי תַזְרִיעַ״. רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי אָמַר: בָּנִים רְאוּיִן לְהוֹרָאָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״לְהַבְדִּיל... וּלְהוֹרוֹת״.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Anyone who recites havdala over wine at the conclusion of Shabbatot , will have male children, as it is written: “To distinguish between the holy and the unholy, and it is written there “To distinguish between the impure and the pure” and near it: “If a woman conceive Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: will have sons who are worthy of teaching as it is written: “To distinguish and to teach”
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Chiya bar Abba, said Rabbi Yochanan: Anyone who separates over the wine on the eve of Shabbatot - sons are given to him male; as it is written: "to distinguish between the holy and the profane," and it is written there: "to distinguish between the unclean and the clean," and adjacent to it: "when a woman conceives." Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Sons are fit for teaching, as it is written: "to distinguish... and to teach."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי בִּנְיָמִין בַּר יֶפֶת, אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: כׇּל הַמְקַדֵּשׁ אֶת עַצְמוֹ בִּשְׁעַת תַּשְׁמִישׁ – הוֹיִין לוֹ בָּנִים זְכָרִים; שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהִתְקַדִּשְׁתֶּם וִהְיִיתֶם קְדֹשִׁים״, וּסְמִיךְ לֵיהּ: ״אִשָּׁה כִּי תַזְרִיעַ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Binyamin bar Yefet says Rabbi Elazar says: Anyone who sanctifies himself while engaging in sexual intercourse will have male children, as it is stated: “You shall sanctify yourselves, and you shall be holy” and near it: “If a woman conceive
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Benjamin bar Yefet, said Rabbi Elazar: Anyone who sanctifies himself during marital relations - they will have male children; as it is stated: "And you shall sanctify yourselves and be holy," and juxtaposed to it: "When a woman conceives."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: ״הַשֶּׁרֶץ וְנֶעְלַם מִמֶּנּוּ״ כּוּ׳. מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ?
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: creeping animal, and it is hidden from him, what is between them?
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: "The creeping thing that is hidden from him." What is the difference between them?

hebrew_text: אָמַר חִזְקִיָּה: שֶׁרֶץ וּנְבֵלָה אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ – רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר סָבַר: בָּעֵינַן עַד דְּיָדַע אִי בְּשֶׁרֶץ אִיטַּמִּי אִי בִּנְבֵלָה אִיטַּמִּי; וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סָבַר: לָא בָּעֵינַן עַד דְּיָדַע, דְּכֵיוָן דְּיָדַע (דְּאִיטַּמָּא) [דְּאִיטַּמִּי] בָּעוֹלָם, לָא צְרִיךְ אִי בְּשֶׁרֶץ אִיטַּמִּי אִי בִּנְבֵלָה אִיטַּמִּי.
human_translation: Ḥizkiyya says: There is between them a creeping animal or the carcass of an unslaughtered animal. Rabbi Eliezer holds we require that he know whether he contracted impurity from a creeping animal or he contracted impurity from an unslaughtered animal carcass, And Rabbi Akiva holds we do not require that he know since he knows in general that he contracted impurity, not necessary whether he contracted the impurity from a creeping animal or he contracted the impurity from an unslaughtered animal carcass.
llm_translation: Hizkiyah said: If there is a sheretz (creeping thing) and a nevelah (carcass) together - Rabbi Eliezer holds: We require until one knows whether it is with a sheretz that it became tamei or with a nevelah that it became tamei; and Rabbi Akiva holds: We do not require until one knows, for since one knows (that it became tamei) in the world, it is not necessary to know whether it became tamei with a sheretz or with a nevelah.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן אָמַר עוּלָּא: שֶׁרֶץ וּנְבֵלָה אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ. דְּעוּלָּא רָמֵי דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אַדְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, וּמְשַׁנֵּי – מִי אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בָּעֵינַן עַד דְּיָדַע אִי בְּשֶׁרֶץ אִיטַּמִּי אִי בִּנְבֵלָה אִיטַּמִּי?!
human_translation: And Ulla also says: There is between them a creeping animal or the carcass of an unslaughtered animal. Ulla raises a contradiction of Rabbi Eliezer and of Rabbi Eliezer, and resolves Does Rabbi Eliezer say we require that know whether he contracted impurity from a creeping animal or he contracted impurity from an unslaughtered animal carcass?
llm_translation: And so said Ula: "There is a difference between a sheretz (creeping thing) and a nevelah (carcass)." For Ula raised a contradiction of Rabbi Eliezer to Rabbi Eliezer, and he answered: Who did Rabbi Eliezer say we require knowledge until one knows whether it is a sheretz or a nevelah?!

hebrew_text: ורְמִינְהִי, אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: מָה נַפְשָׁךְ? חֵלֶב אָכַל – חַיָּיב; נוֹתָר אָכַל – חַיָּיב; שַׁבָּת חִילֵּל – חַיָּיב; יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים חִילֵּל – חַיָּיב; אִשְׁתּוֹ נִדָּה בָּעַל – חַיָּיב; אֲחוֹתוֹ בָּעַל – חַיָּיב!
human_translation: And he raises a contradiction Rabbi Eliezer says: Whichever way you ate forbidden fat liable; ate notar liable. desecrated Shabbat liable; desecrated Yom Kippur liable. he engaged in intercourse with his menstruating wife, liable; he engaged in intercourse with his sister, liable.
llm_translation: The Gemara asked: Rabbi Eliezer said: What is your opinion? If one ate forbidden fat - liable; if one ate leftover food - liable; if one desecrated the Sabbath - liable; if one desecrated Yom Kippur - liable; if one had relations with his menstruating wife - liable; if one had relations with his sister - liable!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, הֲרֵי הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״אוֹ הוֹדַע אֵלָיו חַטָּאתוֹ אֲשֶׁר חָטָא בָּהּ״ – עַד שֶׁיִּוָּדַע לָךְ בַּמֶּה חָטָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua said to states “Or if his sin, in which he sinned, became known to him” until it becomes known to in which he sinned.
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Yehoshua, behold he says: "Or if his sin that he sinned in it is made known to him" - until it is known to you in what he sinned.

hebrew_text: וּמְשַׁנֵּי: הָתָם, ״אֲשֶׁר חָטָא וְהֵבִיא״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא – חֵטְא כׇּל שֶׁהוּא. הָכָא, מִכְּדֵי כְּתִיב ״בְּכׇל דָּבָר טָמֵא״; ״אוֹ בְּנִבְלַת שֶׁרֶץ טָמֵא״ לְמָה לִי? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: בָּעֵינַן עַד דְּיָדַע אִי בְּשֶׁרֶץ אִיטַּמִּי אִי בִּנְבֵלָה אִיטַּמִּי.
human_translation: And resolves There, the Merciful One states: in which he sinned, he shall bring some sin. Here, since it is written any impure thing” why do I “Or the carcass of a non-kosher creeping animal”? Conclude from it we require that he know whether he contracted impurity from a creeping animal or he contracted impurity from an unslaughtered animal carcass,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And from where do we derive this? There, "if he sinned and brought" - the Merciful One said: he sinned in any way. Here, because it is written "in any unclean thing"; "or in the carcass of a creeping thing that is unclean" - why do I need it? Learn from it: we require until one knows whether it is with a creeping thing that it becomes unclean or with a carcass that it becomes unclean.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא – אַיְּידֵי
human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva, since
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva - witness.

hebrew_text: דְּבָעֵי לְמִיכְתַּב בְּהֵמָה וְחַיָּה לְכִדְרַבִּי, כָּתֵיב נָמֵי שֶׁרֶץ. כִּדְתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: כָּל פָּרָשָׁה שֶׁנֶּאֶמְרָה וְנִשְׁנֵית, לֹא נִשְׁנֵית אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבִיל דָּבָר שֶׁנִּתְחַדֵּשׁ בָּהּ.
human_translation: needs to write “domesticated animal” and “undomesticated animal” to that Rabbi “creeping animal” is also written, in accordance with what was taught the school of Rabbi Yishmael: Every passage that was stated and repeated was repeated only for the novel element introduced therein.
llm_translation: The text reads: "Regarding writing a marriage contract for an animal or a wild beast according to Rabbi, it is also written 'sheretz.' As it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: Every portion that was said and repeated, it was repeated only for a matter that was newly introduced in it."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, הַאי ״בָּהּ״ מַאי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ? פְּרָט לַמִּתְעַסֵּק.
human_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer, what does he do with “in which to the exclusion of one who acts unawares
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer, this "bah," what does he do with it? To exclude one who is engaged.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: מַשְׁמָעוּת דּוֹרְשִׁין אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ. וְכֵן אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת מַשְׁמָעוּת דּוֹרְשִׁין אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ – דְּרַב שֵׁשֶׁת מַחְלֵיף דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר לְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא וּדְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: between them the interpretation of the meaning And similarly, Rav Sheshet says: between them the interpretation of the meaning as Rav Sheshet would switch of Rabbi Eliezer for Rabbi Akiva and of Rabbi Akiva for Rabbi Eliezer.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: The tradition they interpret, there is a difference between them. And so said Rav Sheshet: The tradition they interpret, there is a difference between them - for Rav Sheshet interchanges with Rabbi Eliezer to Rabbi Akiva, and Rabbi Akiva to Rabbi Eliezer.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רָבָא מֵרַב נַחְמָן: הֶעְלֵם זֶה וְזֶה בְּיָדוֹ, מַהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הֲרֵי הֶעְלֵם טוּמְאָה בְּיָדוֹ, וְחַיָּיב. אַדְּרַבָּה – הֲרֵי הֶעְלֵם מִקְדָּשׁ בְּיָדוֹ, וּפָטוּר!
human_translation: Rava asked Rav Naḥman: one had a lapse of awareness of this and that, what is said to him: He has a lapse of awareness about impurity, liable. On the contrary, he has a lapse of awareness about the Temple, and exempt.
llm_translation: Rava asked a question of Rav Nachman: If one conceals both this and that in his hand, what is the ruling? He said to him: If he conceals impurity in his hand, he is liable. But with regard to consecrated items, if he conceals them in his hand, he is exempt!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: חָזֵינַן; אִי מִטּוּמְאָה קָא פָרֵישׁ – הֲרֵי הֶעְלֵם טוּמְאָה בְּיָדוֹ, וְחַיָּיב. אִי מִמִּקְדָּשׁ קָא פָרֵישׁ – הֲרֵי הֶעְלֵם מִקְדָּשׁ בְּיָדוֹ, וּפָטוּר. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: כְּלוּם פֵּרֵישׁ מִמִּקְדָּשׁ – אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם טוּמְאָה; כְּלוּם פֵּרֵישׁ מִטּוּמְאָה – אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם מִקְדָּשׁ! אֶלָּא לָא שְׁנָא.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: We observe If he leaves because of the impurity, the lapse of awareness he had is about the impurity, and liable. if he leaves because of the Temple, the lapse of awareness he had is about the Temple, and exempt. Ravina said to Rav Ashi: didn’t he leave because Temple only because of the impurity? didn’t he leave because impurity only because Temple? Rather, there is no difference,
llm_translation: Rav Ashei said: We have seen; if he separated due to impurity - behold, he has hidden impurity in his hand, and is liable. If he separated from the sanctuary - behold, he has hidden the sanctuary in his hand, and is exempt. Ravina said to Rav Ashei: If he separated not from the sanctuary - but due to impurity; if he separated not from impurity - but due to the sanctuary! Rather, it is not different.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שְׁנֵי שְׁבִילִין, אֶחָד טָמֵא וְאֶחָד טָהוֹר; וְהָלַךְ בָּרִאשׁוֹן וְלֹא נִכְנַס, בַּשֵּׁנִי וְנִכְנַס – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: The Sages taught two paths one impure, and one pure, and walked on the first and did not enter on the second and entered liable
llm_translation: The sages taught: Two paths, one impure and one pure; if one walked on the first and did not enter, and then entered the second - he is liable.

hebrew_text: הָלַךְ בָּרִאשׁוֹן וְנִכְנַס, הִזָּה וְשָׁנָה וְטָבַל, וְאַחַר כָּךְ הָלַךְ בַּשֵּׁנִי וְנִכְנַס – חַיָּיב. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן פּוֹטֵר. וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יְהוּדָה פּוֹטֵר בְּכוּלָּן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן.
human_translation: he walked on the first and entered sprinkled and again, and he immersed and afterward he walked on the second and entered liable Rabbi Shimon deems him exempt And Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda, in the name of Rabbi Shimon, deems him exempt in all of
llm_translation: He who walked first and entered, sprinkled, changed clothes, and immersed, and afterwards walked second and entered - is liable. Rabbi Shimon exempts. And Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda exempts all of them because of Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: בְּכוּלָּן –
human_translation: in all of
llm_translation: In all of them -

hebrew_text: וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּקַמַּיְיתָא?! מִמָּה נַפְשָׁךְ טָמֵא הוּא! אָמַר רָבָא: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – כְּגוֹן שֶׁהָלַךְ בָּרִאשׁוֹן, וּבְשָׁעָה שֶׁהָלַךְ בַּשֵּׁנִי שָׁכַח שֶׁהָלַךְ בָּרִאשׁוֹן; דְּהָוְיָא לֵיהּ מִקְצָת יְדִיעָה.
human_translation: even in the first whichever you he is impure, Rava said: What are we dealing with here? where he walked on the first and when he was walking on the second he forgot that he had walked on the first so that was partial awareness.
llm_translation: And even in Kamayta?! From what is your soul impure! Rava said: Here we are dealing with what - for example, one who went first, and at the time he went second, he forgot that he had gone first; he would have some knowledge.

hebrew_text: וּבְהָא קָא מִיפַּלְגִי – תַּנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר: אָמְרִינַן מִקְצָת יְדִיעָה כְּכׇל יְדִיעָה; וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן סָבַר: לָא אָמְרִינַן מִקְצָת יְדִיעָה כְּכׇל יְדִיעָה.
human_translation: And disagree with regard to this The first tanna , maintains we say partial awareness is as complete awareness. And Rabbi Shimon maintains we do not say partial awareness is as complete awareness.
llm_translation: In this case, they are in disagreement - the first Tanna holds: we say some knowledge is like all knowledge; and Rabbi Shimon holds: we do not say some knowledge is like all knowledge.

hebrew_text: הָלַךְ בָּרִאשׁוֹן וְנִכְנַס, הִזָּה וְשָׁנָה וְטָבַל, חָזַר וְהָלַךְ בַּשֵּׁנִי וְנִכְנַס – חַיָּיב, וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן פּוֹטֵר. וְאַמַּאי חַיָּיב? סְפֵק יְדִיעָה הוּא!
human_translation: he walked on the first and entered sprinkled and again, and he immersed and he walked on the second and entered liable and Rabbi Shimon deems him exempt But why liable it was awareness uncertain
llm_translation: He walked in first and entered, urinated, changed clothes, and immersed, then returned and walked in second and entered - he is liable, and Rabbi Shimon exempts. And why is he liable? It is a case of doubtful knowledge!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כָּאן עָשׂוּ סְפֵק יְדִיעָה כִּידִיעָה. וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: הָא מַנִּי – רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל הִיא, דְּאָמַר: לָא בָּעֵינַן יְדִיעָה בַּתְּחִלָּה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Here, they made awareness uncertain like awareness definite And Reish Lakish says: whose is this? It is Rabbi Yishmael, who says: We do not require awareness at the beginning,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Here they made a doubt like certainty. And Reish Lakish said: This is the teaching of Rabbi Yishmael, as he said: We do not require knowledge at the outset.

hebrew_text: וּרְמִי דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אַדְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, וּרְמִי דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אַדְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ. דְּתַנְיָא: אָכַל סָפֵק חֵלֶב וְנוֹדַע, סְפֵק חֵלֶב וְנוֹדַע – רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁמֵּבִיא חַטָּאת עַל כׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד, כָּךְ מֵבִיא אָשָׁם תָּלוּי עַל כׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד.
human_translation: And raises a contradiction of Rabbi Yoḥanan and of Rabbi Yoḥanan; and raises a contradiction of Reish Lakish and of Reish Lakish. As it is taught ate uncertainty forbidden fat, and became aware uncertainty forbidden fat, and became aware Rabbi says: Just as he would bring a sin-offering for each and every one so he brings a provisional guilt-offering, for each and every one
llm_translation: And a teaching of Rabbi Yochanan in the name of Rabbi Yochanan, and a teaching of Reish Lakish in the name of Reish Lakish. As it was taught: If one ate a doubtful forbidden fat and it became known, a doubtful forbidden fat and it became known - Rabbi says: Just as one brings a sin offering for each and every individual, so too one brings a guilt offering dependent on each and every individual.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יְהוּדָה וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אָמְרוּ מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: אֵינוֹ מֵבִיא אֶלָּא אָשָׁם תָּלוּי אֶחָד, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״עַל שִׁגְגָתוֹ אֲשֶׁר שָׁגָג״ – הַתּוֹרָה רִיבְּתָה שְׁגָגוֹת הַרְבֵּה וְאָשָׁם תָּלוּי אֶחָד.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda and Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, said in the name of Rabbi Shimon: He brings only one provisional guilt-offering, as it is stated concerning his unwitting transgression wherein he unwittingly transgressed the Torah included many instances of unwitting in one provisional guilt-offering.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda and Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, said in the name of Rabbi Shimon: He only brings a suspended guilt-offering, as it is stated: "For his unintentional sin that he committed" - the Torah multiplied unintentional sins and suspended guilt-offering is one.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: כָּאן שָׁנָה רַבִּי, יְדִיעוֹת סְפֵיקוֹת מִתְחַלְּקוֹת לְחַטָּאוֹת.
human_translation: And Reish Lakish says: Here Rabbi taught awareness uncertain separates with regard to sin-offerings.
llm_translation: And Reish Lakish said: Here Rabbi changed his mind, uncertain knowledge is divided for sins.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁיְּדִיעוֹת וַדַּאי בְּעָלְמָא מִתְחַלְּקוֹת לְחַטָּאוֹת, כָּךְ יְדִיעוֹת סָפֵק מִתְחַלְּקוֹת לַאֲשָׁמוֹת.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Just as definite awareness in general separates with regard to sin-offerings, so awareness uncertain separates with regard to provisional guilt-offerings.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Just as certain knowledge certainly leads to sins in the world, so too uncertain knowledge leads to guilt offerings.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אַדְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לָא קַשְׁיָא – כָּאן עָשׂוּ, וְלֹא בְּכׇל הַתּוֹרָה כּוּלָּהּ עָשׂוּ. הָכָא הוּא דְּלָא כְּתִיבָא יְדִיעָה בְּהֶדְיָא, מִ״וְּנֶעְלַם״ הוּא דְּקָא אָתֵי; וְלֹא בְּכׇל הַתּוֹרָה כּוּלָּהּ עָשׂוּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״אוֹ הוֹדַע אֵלָיו״ – יְדִיעָה מְעַלַּיְיתָא בָּעֵינַן.
human_translation: Granted, of Rabbi Yoḥanan and of Rabbi Yoḥanan not difficult, Here, they made but they did not do everywhere in the entire Torah. here, awareness is not written explicitly it is derived from: “And it is hidden But they did not make everywhere in the entire Torah, as it is written: “Or becomes known to him” we require full-fledged awareness
llm_translation: In the case of Rabbi Yochanan, according to Rabbi Yochanan, it is not difficult - here they did, and not in the entire Torah did they do. Here is where it is not explicitly written with certainty, "and it is hidden" is what comes; and not in the entire Torah did they do, as it is written: "Or has been informed by him" - we require a higher level of certainty.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ – אַדְּמוֹקֵים לֵיהּ כְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, נוֹקְמַהּ כְּרַבִּי! הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן – דְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל לָא בָּעֵי יְדִיעָה בַּתְּחִלָּה.
human_translation: But Reish Lakish, rather than interpreting in accordance with Rabbi Yishmael, let him interpret it in accordance with Rabbi teaches us this: That Rabbi Yishmael does not require awareness at the beginning.
llm_translation: Rather, to Reish Lakish - they compare him to Rabbi Yishmael, vengeance like Rabbi! This is what we hear - that Rabbi Yishmael does not require knowledge at the outset.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא דְּלָא בָּעֵי – מִדְּלָא מְיַיתְּרִי לֵיהּ קְרָאֵי; ״וְנֶעְלַם״ – דְּמִיחַיַּיב עַל הֶעְלֵם מִקְדָּשׁ! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: כִּי לֵית לֵיהּ – מִקְּרָאֵי, אֲבָל מִגְּמָרָא אִית לֵיהּ; קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: obvious that does not require since he has no superfluous verses “And it is hidden that one is liable for a lapse of awareness the Temple. Lest you say: When does not accept from a verse, but he accepts as a tradition; teaches us
llm_translation: The straightforward interpretation is that it does not require – since additional verses are not brought; "and it is hidden" – for he is liable for the concealment of the sanctuary! What might you say: if it does not have – verses, but it has from tradition; he is teaching us.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ יְדִיעוֹת הַטּוּמְאָה שְׁתַּיִם שֶׁהֵן אַרְבַּע: נִטְמָא וְיָדַע, וְנֶעֶלְמָה מִמֶּנּוּ הַטּוּמְאָה וְזָכוּר אֶת הַקֹּדֶשׁ;
llm_translation: It was taught: The impurity of knowledge is two, which are four: one becomes impure and knows, and the impurity is hidden from him, and he remembers the holy.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ שְׁבוּעוֹת שְׁתַּיִם שֶׁהֵן אַרְבַּע: ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁאוֹכַל״ וְ״שֶׁלֹּא אוֹכַל״, ״שֶׁאָכַלְתִּי״ וְ״שֶׁלֹּא אָכַלְתִּי״.
human_translation: oaths two that are four oath I will eat, or: I will not eat. I ate, or: I did not eat.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "Two oaths that are four: 'an oath that one ate' and 'an oath that one did not eat,' 'an oath that I ate' and 'an oath that I did not eat.'"

hebrew_text: ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁלֹּא אוֹכַל״, וְאָכַל כׇּל שֶׁהוּא – חַיָּיב. דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. אָמְרוּ לוֹ לְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: הֵיכָן מָצִינוּ בְּאוֹכֵל כָּל שֶׁהוּא שֶׁהוּא חַיָּיב – שֶׁזֶּה חַיָּיב? אָמַר לָהֶם רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: וְכִי הֵיכָן מָצִינוּ בִּמְדַבֵּר וּמֵבִיא קׇרְבָּן – שֶׁזֶּה מְדַבֵּר וּמֵבִיא קׇרְבָּן?
human_translation: oath I will not eat, and he ate any amount, liable; the statement of Rabbi Akiva. said to Rabbi Akiva: Where do we find that eats any amount is liable, that this liable? Rabbi Akiva said to them: And where do we find one who speaks and bring an offering as this speaks, and brings an offering
llm_translation: "An oath of not eating," and he ate anything – liable. The words of Rabbi Akiva. They said to Rabbi Akiva: Where do we find that in eating anything one is liable – that this one is liable? Rabbi Akiva said to them: And where do we find in the desert that one speaks and brings an offering – that this one speaks and brings an offering?

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ לְמֵימְרָא דְּ״שֶׁאוֹכַל״ – דְּאָכֵילְנָא מַשְׁמַע?! וּרְמִינְהִי: ״שְׁבוּעָה לֹא אוֹכַל לָךְ״, ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁאוֹכַל לָךְ״, ״לֹא שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁלֹּא אוֹכַל לָךְ״ – אָסוּר.
human_translation: to say that I will eat, means that I will eat? raises a contradiction oath I will not eat of yours, oath I will eat of yours, Not oath I will not eat of yours, forbidden.
llm_translation: Gemara: Regarding the statement "that he eats" - does it imply that we actually eat?! And raise a contradiction: "A vow that you shall not eat," "a vow that you shall eat," "not a vow that you shall not eat" - it is prohibited.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לְעוֹלָם דְּאָכֵילְנָא מַשְׁמַע; לָא קַשְׁיָא, כָּאן בִּמְסָרְבִין בּוֹ לֶאֱכוֹל, כָּאן בְּשֶׁאֵין
human_translation: Abaye said: Actually, means that I will eat. not difficult, Here, in are importuning him to eat, There, where are not
llm_translation: Abaye said: Always we eat while hearing; it is not difficult, here we are eating with it being mixed in, here where there is none.

hebrew_text: מְסָרְבִין בּוֹ לֶאֱכוֹל.
human_translation: importuning [ mesarevin ] him to eat.
llm_translation: They mix in it to eat.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִיתִין – בְּשֶׁאֵין מְסָרְבִין בּוֹ לֶאֱכוֹל; בָּרַיְיתָא – בִּמְסָרְבִין בּוֹ לֶאֱכוֹל, וְקָאָמַר ״לָא אָכֵילְנָא״ וְ״לָא אָכֵילְנָא״, דְּכִי קָא מִשְׁתְּבַע הָכִי קָאָמַר: ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁלֹּא אוֹכַל״.
human_translation: The mishna where are not importuning him to eat; external where are importuning him to eat and he is saying: I will not eat, I will not eat. when he takes an oath, this is saying: oath I will not eat.
llm_translation: Mishnah - when not mixed in it to eat; Baraita - when mixed in it to eat, and it says "I will not eat" and "I will not eat," for when he is satisfied, he says: "An oath that I will not eat."

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: תְּנִי ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁאִי אוֹכַל לָךְ״. אִי הָכִי, מַאי לְמֵימְרָא? מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: לִישָּׁנֵיהּ (דאיתקילא) [אִיתְּקִילא] לֵיהּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Rav Ashi, says: Teach, oath I will not [ she’i ] eat of yours, If so, what of stating Lest you say a slip of his tongue teaches us
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: It was taught, "A week that is not good for you." If so, what is the meaning to say? What you might say: to its neighbor (that it is light) it is light for him, it is implied to us.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״מִבְטָא״ – שְׁבוּעָה. ״אִיסָּר״ – שְׁבוּעָה. אִיסּוּר אִיסָּר: אִם אַתָּה אוֹמֵר ״אִיסָּר״ – שְׁבוּעָה, חַיָּיב; וְאִם לָאו, פָּטוּר. ״אִם אַתָּה אוֹמֵר אִיסָּר שְׁבוּעָה״?! וְהָא אָמְרַתְּ: אִיסָּר – שְׁבוּעָה הוּא!
human_translation: The Sages taught: clear utterance an oath, “A bond an oath. the prohibition “bond,” if you say a bond is an oath, liable, but if not, exempt. If you say a bond is an oath? But you said a bond is an oath.
