human_translation: Why do I to teach oath I will not eat oath I will not eat it?
llm_translation: Gemara: Why do I need to learn the Mishnah of "an oath not to eat," "an oath not to eat it"?

hebrew_text: הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: טַעְמָא דְּאָמַר ״שֶׁלֹּא אוֹכַל״ וַהֲדַר אָמַר ״שֶׁלֹּא אוֹכְלֶנָּה״ – דְּלָא מִיחַיַּיב אֶלָּא חֲדָא; אֲבָל אָמַר ״שֶׁלֹּא אוֹכְלֶנָּה״ וַהֲדַר אָמַר ״שֶׁלֹּא אוֹכַל״ – מִיחַיַּיב תַּרְתֵּי.
human_translation: This teaches us the reason that he is liable only once that he said: I will not eat and then said: I will not eat it. But said: I will not eat it, and then had said: I will not eat he would be liable twice.
llm_translation: This is what we can infer: The reason for saying "that I will not eat" and then saying "that I will not eat it" - is that one is only liable for one; but if one says "that I will not eat it" and then says "that I will not eat" - one is liable for two.

hebrew_text: כִּדְרָבָא – דְּאָמַר רָבָא: ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁלֹּא אוֹכַל כִּכָּר זוֹ״, כֵּיוָן שֶׁאָכַל מִמֶּנָּה כְּזַיִת – חַיָּיב. ״שֶׁלֹּא אוֹכְלֶנָּה״ – אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב עַד שֶׁיֹּאכַל אֶת כּוּלָּהּ.
human_translation: in accordance with of Rava, as Rava says: oath I will not eat this loaf, once he has eaten an olive-bulk of it liable, I will not eat it, he is not liable unless he eats the whole
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Like Rava - for Rava said: "A vow not to eat this loaf," once he ate from it the size of an olive - he is liable. "Not eating it" - he is not liable until he eats all of it.

hebrew_text: ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁלֹּא אוֹכְלֶנָּה״, וַאֲכָלָהּ – אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אַחַת כּוּ׳. הָא תּוּ לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: oath I will not eat it, and he ate it, he is liable only once. Why do I this additional,
llm_translation: "An oath not to eat it," and he ate it - he is liable only one offering. But why do I need it?

hebrew_text: הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: חִיּוּבָא הוּא דְּלֵיכָּא – הָא שְׁבוּעָה אִיכָּא; דְּאִי מַשְׁכַּחַת רַוְוחָא – חָיְילָא.
human_translation: This teaches us there is no liability but there is an oath; that if you find room, it goes into effect.
llm_translation: This is what we can infer: it is an obligation that cannot be avoided - here there is an oath; for if you forget the wind - there is a penalty.

hebrew_text: לְמַאי הִלְכְתָא? לְכִדְרָבָא – דְּאָמַר רָבָא: שֶׁאִם נִשְׁאַל עַל הָרִאשׁוֹנָה – עָלְתָה לוֹ שְׁנִיָּה תַּחְתֶּיהָ.
human_translation: For what halakha for of Rava, as Rava says that if one requested of to the first oath, the second one counts for him in its place
llm_translation: Regarding what halakha? According to Ravah - for Ravah said: If one was asked about the first one, the second one has risen for him beneath it.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא מְסַיְּיעָא לֵיהּ: מִי שֶׁנָּדַר שְׁתֵּי נְזִירוֹת, וּמָנָה רִאשׁוֹנָה וְהִפְרִישׁ עָלֶיהָ קׇרְבָּן, וְאַחַר כָּךְ נִשְׁאַל עַל הָרִאשׁוֹנָה – עָלְתָה לוֹ שְׁנִיָּה בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה.
human_translation: Let us say supports his one who took two vows of naziriteship, and counted the first separated an offering for it, and afterward requested of the first the second was counted for him in the first
llm_translation: Let us say it supports him: One who vowed two Nazirites, and appointed the first one and separated a sacrifice for her, and then asked about the first one - the second one ascends upon the first one.

hebrew_text: הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא?! הָתָם נְזִירוּת מִיהָא אִיתַאּ, דְּכִי מָנֵי לְרִאשׁוֹנָה, בָּעֵי מִיהְדָּר מִימְנָא לִשְׁנִיָּה בְּלָא שְׁאֵלָה. הָכָא, שְׁבוּעָה שְׁנִיָּה מִי אִיתַאּ כְּלָל?!
human_translation: How can be compared? There, naziriteship is there in any event, as once he counts the first he needs to return count the second no request Here, is there a second oath at all?
llm_translation: So now?! There, regarding the vow of a Nazirite, it is found, for when he sets aside for his initial offering, he requires to return from his second without inquiry. Here, is there a second oath found at all?!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: נִשְׁבַּע עַל כִּכָּר וַאֲכָלָהּ – אִם שִׁיֵּיר מִמֶּנָּה כְּזַיִת, נִשְׁאַל עָלֶיהָ; אֲכָלָהּ כּוּלָּהּ, אֵין נִשְׁאָל עָלֶיהָ.
human_translation: Rava says: took an oath about a loaf and ate it, if left an olive-bulk of it, may request about he ate the whole he may no longer request about it
llm_translation: Rava said: One who swears regarding a loaf and eats it - if he leaves over from it the size of an olive, he is liable for it; if he eats the entire loaf, he is not liable for it.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דְּאָמַר ״שֶׁלֹּא אוֹכַל״ – מִכְּזַיִת קַמָּא עַבְדֵּיהּ לְאִיסּוּרֵיהּ! אִי דְּאָמַר ״שֶׁלֹּא אוֹכְלֶנָּה״ – מַאי אִירְיָא כְּזַיִת?
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: What are the circumstances? If where he said: I will not eat with the first olive-bulk he committed his transgression. If where he said: I will not eat it, why specifically olive-bulk?
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Acha, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: How is it comparable? If he said, "I will not eat" - he has performed his prohibition with his olive. If he said, "I will not eat it" - what is the comparison to an olive?

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ כָּל שֶׁהוּא נָמֵי!
human_translation: Even any amount also
llm_translation: Even all that is standing!

hebrew_text: אִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא ״שֶׁלֹּא אוֹכַל״, אִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא ״שֶׁלֹּא אוֹכְלֶנָּה״. אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא ״שֶׁלֹּא אוֹכַל״ – מִיגּוֹ דְּמַהְנְיָא לֵיהּ שְׁאֵלָה אַכְּזַיִת בָּתְרָא, מַהְנְיָא לֵיהּ שְׁאֵלָה נָמֵי אַכְּזַיִת קַמָּא.
human_translation: If you wish, say I will not eat if you wish, say I will not eat it. If you wish, say I will not eat Since a request is effective for the last olive-bulk it is effective also for the first olive-bulk.
llm_translation: If you want, say "he does not eat," if you want, say "she does not eat." If you want, say "he does not eat" - from where do we derive that a question is more effective after the second refusal than before it? From where do we derive that a question is also effective before the first refusal?

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא ״שֶׁלֹּא אוֹכְלֶנָּה״ – אִי שַׁיַּיר כְּזַיִת, חֲשִׁיב לְאִיתְּשׁוֹלֵי עֲלֵיהּ; וְאִי לָא, לָא חֲשִׁיב לְאִיתְּשׁוֹלֵי עֲלֵיהּ.
human_translation: And if you wish, say I will not eat it. If he left an olive-bulk, significant for which to request But if not not significant for which to request
llm_translation: If you want, say, "I will not eat it" - if he left it like an olive, it is considered that he stumbled over it; and if not, it is not considered that he stumbled over it.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: מִי שֶׁנָּדַר שְׁתֵּי נְזִירוֹת, וּמָנָה רִאשׁוֹנָה וְהִפְרִישׁ עָלֶיהָ קׇרְבָּן, וְאַחַר כָּךְ נִשְׁאַל עַל הָרִאשׁוֹנָה – עָלְתָה לוֹ שְׁנִיָּה בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה!
human_translation: raises an objection one who took two vows of naziriteship, and counted the first separated an offering for it, and afterward requested of the first the second was counted for him in the first
llm_translation: Challenger: One who vowed two Nazirites, and appointed the first one and separated a sacrifice for it, and then inquired about the first one - the second one ascended upon the first one!

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – בְּשֶׁלֹּא כִּיפֵּר.
human_translation: What are we dealing with here? where he has not atoned,
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with - without atonement.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: כִּיפֵּר! בְּשֶׁלֹּא גִּלַּח – וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הִיא, דְּאָמַר תִּגְלַחַת מְעַכְּבָא.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught he has atoned? where he has not shaved and Rabbi Eliezer, who says: Shaving is indispensable
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: And it was taught: "Kippur! If he did not shave - and Rabbi Eliezer is the one who said that the shaving delays."

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: גִּלַּח! אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: נְזִירוֹת קָא רָמֵית? מִי גָּרַם לַשְּׁנִיָּה שֶׁלֹּא תָּחוּל – רִאשׁוֹנָה; וְאֵינָהּ.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught he has shaved? Rav Ashi said: Are you comparing naziriteship What caused the second to not take effect the first and it is no
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught: "He shall shave!" Rav Ashe said: "Is she a Nazirite that you are causing her hair not to grow - the first time; but not the second."

hebrew_text: אַמֵּימָר אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ אֲכָלָהּ כּוּלָּהּ, נִשְׁאָל עָלֶיהָ; אִי בְּשׁוֹגֵג – מְחוּסָּר קׇרְבָּן, אִי בְּמֵזִיד – מְחוּסָּר מַלְקוּת. אֲבָל כְּפָתוּהוּ עַל הָעַמּוּד – לָא; כְּדִשְׁמוּאֵל, דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כְּפָתוּהוּ עַל הָעַמּוּד וְרָץ מִבֵּית דִּין – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: Ameimar said, Even he ate the entire he may still request If unwittingly, has not yet offering If intentionally, has not yet lashes. But if he was tied to the stake no in accordance with of Shmuel. As Shmuel says: had been tied to the stake and ran from the court exempt
llm_translation: Ammar: Even if she ate it all, she is asked about it; whether unintentionally - lacking a sacrifice, or intentionally - lacking lashes. But if they forced him against the pillar - no; as Shmuel said: If they forced him against the pillar and he ran from the court - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: וְלָא הִיא; הָתָם רָץ, הָכָא לָא רָץ.
human_translation: And is not so. There, he ran Here, he did not run,
llm_translation: And not it is; there ran, there not ran.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁלֹּא אוֹכַל כִּכָּר זוֹ אִם אוֹכַל זוֹ״, וְאָכַל אֶת הָרִאשׁוֹנָה בְּשׁוֹגֵג וְהַשְּׁנִיָּה בְּמֵזִיד – פָּטוּר. רִאשׁוֹנָה בְּמֵזִיד וּשְׁנִיָּה בְּשׁוֹגֵג – חַיָּיב. שְׁתֵּיהֶן בְּשׁוֹגֵג – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: Rava says: oath I will not eat that loaf if I eat this one, and he ate the first unwittingly, and the second intentionally, exempt. first intentionally, and second unwittingly, liable both unwittingly exempt,
llm_translation: Rava said: "If one takes an oath not to eat loaf A and then eats loaf B, and he ate the first one unintentionally and the second one intentionally - he is exempt. If he ate the first one intentionally and the second one unintentionally - he is liable. If he ate both unintentionally - he is exempt."

hebrew_text: שְׁתֵּיהֶן בְּמֵזִיד – אַכְלֵיהּ לִתְנָאֵיהּ וַהֲדַר אַכְלֵיהּ לְאִיסּוּרֵיהּ, מִיחַיַּיב; אַכְלֵיהּ לְאִיסּוּרֵיהּ וַהֲדַר אַכְלֵיהּ לִתְנָאֵיהּ, פְּלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ – לְמַאן דְּאָמַר הַתְרָאַת סָפֵק שְׁמָהּ הַתְרָאָה, חַיָּיב; לְמַאן דְּאָמַר לָאו שְׁמָהּ הַתְרָאָה, פָּטוּר.
human_translation: both of them intentionally, ate his condition and then ate the forbidden he is liable ate the forbidden and then ate his condition, a dispute between Rabbi Yoḥanan and Reish Lakish. According to the one who says that an uncertain forewarning is deemed forewarning, liable According to the one who says is not deemed forewarning, exempt.
llm_translation: Both of them intentionally - he ate it according to his opinion and then he ate it according to its prohibition, he is liable; he ate it according to its prohibition and then he ate it according to his opinion, it is a dispute of Rabbi Yochanan and Reish Lakish - according to the one who says a warning for a doubt is a warning, he is liable; according to the one who says a warning is not for a doubt, he is exempt.

hebrew_text: תְּלָאָן זוֹ בָּזוֹ – ״לֹא אוֹכַל זוֹ אִם אוֹכַל זוֹ״, ״לֹא אוֹכַל זוֹ אִם אוֹכַל זוֹ״; וְאָכַל זוֹ בִּזְדוֹן עַצְמָהּ וּבְשִׁגְגַת חֲבֶירְתָּהּ, וְזוֹ בִּזְדוֹן עַצְמָהּ וּבְשִׁגְגַת חֲבֶירְתָּהּ – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: rendered them interdependent, this on that I will not eat that if I eat this, I will not eat this if I eat that, and he ate this one intentionally itself, but unwittingly the other, and that one intentionally itself but unwittingly the other, exempt,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Telan zo bazo - 'Lo okhal zo im okhal zo,' 'Lo okhal zo im okhal zo'; ve'akhal zo bizdon atzmah u'bishgagat chaveretah, ve'zo bizdon atzmah u'bishgagat chaveretah - patur." English translation: "This one with that one - 'She does not eat if she eats,' 'She does not eat if she eats'; and she ate intentionally her own and unintentionally her friend's, and this one intentionally her own and unintentionally her friend's - she is exempt."

hebrew_text: זוֹ בְּשִׁגְגַת עַצְמָהּ וּבְזָדוֹן חֲבֶירְתָּהּ, וְזוֹ בְּשִׁגְגַת עַצְמָהּ וּבִזְדוֹן חֲבֶירְתָּהּ – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: this unwittingly itself, but intentionally the other, and that unwittingly itself but intentionally the other, liable
llm_translation: This is in her own inadvertent sin and in her friend's intentional sin, and this is in her own inadvertent sin and in her friend's inadvertent sin - liable.

hebrew_text: שְׁתֵּיהֶן בְּשׁוֹגֵג – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: both of them unwittingly exempt,
llm_translation: Both of them unintentionally - exempt.

hebrew_text: שְׁתֵּיהֶן בְּמֵזִיד – אַשְּׁנִיָּה מִיחַיַּיב, אַרִאשׁוֹנָה פְּלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ.
human_translation: both of them intentionally, he is liable for the second for the first dispute between Rabbi Yoḥanan and Reish Lakish
llm_translation: Both of them intentionally - the second one is liable, the first one is a dispute of Rabbi Yochanan and Reish Lakish.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב מָרִי, אַף אֲנַן נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: אַרְבָּעָה נְדָרִים הִתִּירוּ חֲכָמִים – נִדְרֵי זֵרוּזִין, נִדְרֵי הֲבַאי, נִדְרֵי שְׁגָגוֹת, נִדְרֵי אֳונָסִין.
human_translation: Rav Mari said: We learn as well The Sages dissolved four vows Vows of exhortation, vows of exaggeration, unwitting vows, and vows circumstances beyond control.
llm_translation: Rav Mari said, "We also learned: The sages permitted four types of vows - vows of zeal, vows of obligation, vows of inadvertence, and vows of coercion."

hebrew_text: נִדְרֵי שְׁגָגוֹת כֵּיצַד? ״קוּנָּם אִם אָכַלְתִּי וְאִם שָׁתִיתִי״, וְנִזְכַּר שֶׁאָכַל וְשָׁתָה; ״שֶׁאֵינִי אוֹכֵל שֶׁאֵינִי שׁוֹתֶה״, שָׁכַח וְאָכַל וְשָׁתָה – מוּתָּר. וְתָנֵי עֲלַהּ: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁנִּדְרֵי שְׁגָגוֹת מוּתָּרִין, כָּךְ שְׁבוּעוֹת שְׁגָגוֹת מוּתָּרוֹת.
human_translation: Unwitting vows, how so? forbidden like an offering [ konam ] if I ate or if I drank, and remembers that he ate or drank, I eat or I drink, and he forgets and eats or drinks, is permitted. And it is taught with regard to Just as unwitting vows are dissolved, so are unwitting oaths dissolved,
llm_translation: Vows of inadvertence, how so? "If I eat and if I drink," and he remembered that he ate and drank; "that I do not eat and that I do not drink," he forgot and ate and drank - permissible. And it was taught in a Braita: Just as vows of inadvertence are permissible, so too oaths of inadvertence are permissible.

hebrew_text: שְׁבוּעוֹת שְׁגָגוֹת הֵיכִי דָּמֵי – לָאו כִּי הַאי גַּוְונָא? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: What are the circumstances unwitting oaths? Is it not a case like this, Conclude from
llm_translation: Oaths accidental how are their monetary - not like this case? Hear from it.

hebrew_text: עֵיפָא תָּנֵי שְׁבוּעוֹת בֵּי רַבָּה. פְּגַע בֵּיהּ אֲבִימִי אֲחוּהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁלֹּא אָכַלְתִּי״ ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁלֹּא אָכַלְתִּי״, מַהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אַחַת. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִישְׁתַּבַּשְׁתְּ, הֲרֵי יָצְאָה שְׁבוּעָה לַשֶּׁקֶר!
human_translation: Eifa learned Shevuot in the academy of Rabba. His brother Avimi met him said to him: oath I did not eat, oath I did not eat, what is said to him: He is liable only once said to him: You have confused a false oath was issued,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Eifa taught the laws of oaths in the study hall of Rabba. His brother Avimi encountered him and said to him: 'I have taken an oath that I have not eaten.' 'I have taken an oath that I have not eaten.' What is the ruling? He said to him: He is only liable for one oath. He said to him: 'You have become entangled, for the false oath has already been uttered!'"

hebrew_text: ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁלֹּא אוֹכַל תֵּשַׁע וְעֶשֶׂר״, מַהוּ? חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִישְׁתַּבַּשְׁתְּ, אִי תֵּשַׁע לָא אָכֵיל, עֶשֶׂר לָא אָכֵיל!
human_translation: oath I will not eat nine and ten, what is He is liable for each and every one said to him: You have confused If he may not eat nine, he may not eat ten.
llm_translation: "An oath of 'I will not eat nine and ten,' what is it? One is liable for each one. He said to him: 'If you will not eat nine, do not eat ten!'"

hebrew_text: ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁלֹּא אוֹכַל עֶשֶׂר וָתֵשַׁע״, מַהוּ? אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אַחַת. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִישְׁתַּבַּשְׁתְּ, עֶשֶׂר הוּא דְּלָא אָכֵיל, הָא תֵּשַׁע מִיהָא אָכֵיל!
human_translation: oath I will not eat ten and nine, what is He is liable only one said to him: You have confused is ten that he may not eat, but he may still eat nine,
llm_translation: "An oath of 'I will not eat nine and ten,' what is it? He is only liable for one. He said to him: 'You are mistaken, nine is what he does not eat, but ten he does eat!'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: זִימְנִין דְּמַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ לְהָא דְּעֵיפָא, כִּדְמָר. דְּאָמַר רַבָּה: ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁלֹּא אוֹכַל תְּאֵנִים וַעֲנָבִים״, וְחָזַר וְאָמַר: ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁלֹּא אוֹכַל תְּאֵנִים״;
human_translation: Abaye said: times when you find that of Eifa as the Master. As Rabba says: oath I will not eat figs and grapes and then says: oath I will not eat figs,
llm_translation: Abaye said: Sometimes she forgets to him to that of Eifa, as Mar. For Rabba said: "An oath not to eat figs and grapes," and he went back and said: "An oath not to eat figs."

hebrew_text: וְאָכַל תְּאֵנִים וְהִפְרִישׁ קׇרְבָּן, וְאַחַר כָּךְ אָכַל עֲנָבִים לְחוֹדַיְיהוּ – הָוְיָא לְהוּ עֲנָבִים חֲצִי שִׁיעוּר, וְאַחֲצִי שִׁיעוּר לָא מִיחַיַּיב קׇרְבָּן. הָכָא נָמֵי, כְּגוֹן דְּאָמַר: ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁלֹּא אוֹכַל עֶשֶׂר״, וְחָזַר וְאָמַר: ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁלֹּא אוֹכַל תֵּשַׁע״, וְאָכַל תֵּשַׁע וְהִפְרִישׁ קׇרְבָּן, וְאַחַר כָּךְ אָכַל עֲשִׂירִית; הָוְיָא לַהּ עֲשִׂירִית חֲצִי שִׁיעוּר, וְאַחֲצִי שִׁיעוּר לָא מִיחַיַּיב.
human_translation: and he ate figs and set aside an offering and afterward he ate grapes alone, The grapes are a half-measure and one is not liable an offering for a half-measure. Here also, where he said: oath I will not eat ten, and then said: oath I will not eat nine, and he ate nine and set aside an offering and later he ate tenth, tenth is a half-measure and one is not liable for a half-measure.
llm_translation: And he ate figs and separated an offering, and afterwards he ate grapes for dessert - he should have grapes as half a measure, and half a measure does not obligate an offering. Here too, for example, if he said: "I swear not to eat ten," and then he retracted and said: "I swear not to eat nine," and he ate nine and separated an offering, and afterwards he ate a tenth; he should have a tenth as half a measure, and half a measure does not obligate an offering.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵיזוֹ הִיא שְׁבוּעַת שָׁוְא? נִשְׁבַּע לְשַׁנּוֹת אֶת הַיָּדוּעַ לָאָדָם – אָמַר עַל הָעַמּוּד שֶׁל אֶבֶן שֶׁהוּא שֶׁל זָהָב, וְעַל הָאִישׁ שֶׁהוּא אִשָּׁה, וְעַל הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁהִיא אִישׁ;
human_translation: Which is an oath in vain, takes an oath to deny that which is known to people says about a stone column that it is of gold, or about a man that he is a woman, or about a woman that she is a man.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: What is an oath in vain? One swears to change what is known to people - he says about a pillar of stone that it is made of gold, or about a man that he is a woman, or about a woman that she is a man.

hebrew_text: נִשְׁבַּע עַל דָּבָר שֶׁאִי אֶפְשָׁר לוֹ – ״אִם לֹא רָאִיתִי גָּמָל שֶׁפּוֹרֵחַ בָּאֲוִיר״ וְ״אִם לֹא רָאִיתִי נָחָשׁ כְּקוֹרַת בֵּית הַבַּד״;
human_translation: takes an oath about a matter that is impossible, If I did not see a camel flying through the air, or: If I did not see a snake as the beam of the olive press.
llm_translation: He swore regarding something that is impossible for him - "If I did not see a camel flying in the air" and "If I did not see a snake like a beam in the house of study."

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְעֵדִים: ״בּוֹאוּ וְהַעִידוּנִי״, ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁלֹּא נְעִידֶךָ״; נִשְׁבַּע לְבַטֵּל אֶת הַמִּצְוָה – שֶׁלֹּא לַעֲשׂוֹת סוּכָּה וְשֶׁלֹּא לִיטּוֹל לוּלָב וְשֶׁלֹּא לְהַנִּיחַ תְּפִילִּין; זוֹ הִיא שְׁבוּעַת שָׁוְא, שֶׁחַיָּיבִין עַל זְדוֹנָהּ מַכּוֹת וְעַל שִׁגְגָתָהּ פָּטוּר.
human_translation: said to witnesses: Come and testify for me, oath we will not testify for you, taking an oath to refrain from a mitzva. not to build a sukka , or not to take a lulav , or not to don phylacteries. This is an oath taken in vain, for liable lashes intentionally, and for exempt unwittingly.
llm_translation: He said to witnesses: "Come and testify for me," "An oath that we will not testify against you"; he swore to annul the commandment - not to make a sukkah, not to take a lulav, and not to wear tefillin; this is a false oath, for which one is liable to receive lashes for intentional violation and exempt for unintentional violation.

hebrew_text: ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁאוֹכַל כִּכָּר זוֹ״, ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁלֹּא אוֹכְלֶנָּה״ – הָרִאשׁוֹנָה שְׁבוּעַת בִּיטּוּי, וְהַשְּׁנִיָּה שְׁבוּעַת שָׁוְא.
human_translation: oath I will eat this loaf, oath I will not eat it, the first an oath on an utterance, and the second an oath in vain,
llm_translation: "An oath that one eats a loaf," "an oath that one does not eat it" - the first is an oath of expression, and the second is an oath of vanity.

hebrew_text: אֲכָלָהּ – עָבַר עַל שְׁבוּעַת שָׁוְא. לֹא אֲכָלָהּ – עָבַר עַל שְׁבוּעַת בִּיטּוּי.
human_translation: he ate it, he violated an oath in vain. he did not eat it, he violated an oath on an utterance.
llm_translation: She ate - she violated the oath of emptiness. She did not eat - she violated the oath of confirmation.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר עוּלָּא: וְהוּא שֶׁנִּיכָּר לִשְׁלֹשָׁה בְּנֵי אָדָם.
human_translation: Ulla says: it is that is known to three people.
llm_translation: Gemara said Ulla: And he that is recognized to three men.

hebrew_text: נִשְׁבַּע עַל דָּבָר שֶׁאִי אֶפְשָׁר לוֹ – ״אִם לֹא רָאִיתִי גָּמָל פּוֹרֵחַ בָּאֲוִיר״. ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁרָאִיתִי״ לָא קָאָמַר, מַאי ״אִם לֹא רָאִיתִי״? אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: תָּנֵי ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁרָאִיתִי״. רָבָא אָמַר: בְּאוֹמֵר ״יֵאָסְרוּ כׇּל פֵּירוֹת שֶׁבְּעוֹלָם עָלַי, אִם לֹא רָאִיתִי גָּמָל פּוֹרֵחַ בָּאֲוִיר״.
human_translation: takes an oath about a matter that is impossible, If I did not see a camel flying through the air. did not say: oath I saw. What If I did not see? Abaye said: teach: oath I saw. Rava said: where one says: Let all the produce in the world be prohibited for me if I did not see a camel flying through the air.
llm_translation: He swore regarding something that is impossible for him - "If I have not seen a camel flying in the air." He did not say, "I swear that I have seen," so what is "If I have not seen"? Abbaye said: Teach that he swore, "I have seen." Rava said: By saying, "All fruits in the world shall be forbidden to me if I have not seen a camel flying in the air."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: וְדִלְמָא הַאי גַּבְרָא צִיפּוֹרָא רַבָּא חֲזִי, וְאַסֵּיק לֵיהּ שְׁמָא ״גַּמְלָא״, וְכִי קָא מִשְׁתְּבַע – אַדַּעְתֵּיהּ דִּידֵיהּ אִישְׁתְּבַע?
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: Perhaps this man saw a great bird and named it Camel, and when he took the oath, he took the oath according to his own understanding.
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: Perhaps this man saw a large bird, and mistakenly thought it was a camel, and when he swore – did he swear based on his own knowledge or based on what he saw?

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: בָּתַר פּוּמֵּיהּ אָזְלִינַן, וְלָא אָזְלִינַן בָּתַר דַּעְתֵּיהּ – וְהָא תַּנְיָא: כְּשֶׁמַּשְׁבִּיעִין אוֹתוֹ אוֹמְרִים לוֹ: ״הֱוֵי יוֹדֵעַ, שֶׁלֹּא עַל דַּעְתְּךָ אָנוּ מַשְׁבִּיעִין אוֹתְךָ, אֶלָּא עַל דַּעְתֵּנוּ וְעַל דַּעַת בֵּית דִּין״. מַאי טַעְמָא? לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּאָמְרִינַן: דִּלְמָא אִיסְקוּנְדְּרֵי יְהַיב לֵיהּ וְאַסֵּיק לְהוּ ״זוּזֵי״, דְּכִי קָא מִשְׁתְּבַע – אַדַּעְתֵּיהּ דִּידֵיהּ קָא מִשְׁתְּבַע?
human_translation: And if you would say we follow his mouth, and we do not follow his understanding, but isn’t it taught When they administer an oath to him say to him: Know that not according to your understanding we administer oath to you, but according to our understanding and according to the understanding of the court? What is the reason Is it not because we say: Perhaps he gave tokens [ iskunderei ] but he calls them Dinars, that when he takes the oath, it is according to his own understanding that he takes the oath.
llm_translation: And if you will say: After he has left, we go after his opinion, and we do not go after his opinion - but it was taught: When they swear him, they say to him: "Be aware that we are not swearing you based on your opinion, but based on our opinion and the opinion of the court." What is the reason? Not because we say: Perhaps he will give him a bribe and cause him to err, for when he swears - he is swearing based on his own opinion?

hebrew_text: לָא, הָתָם מִשּׁוּם קַנְיָא דְּרָבָא.
human_translation: No, There, due to the reed Rava’s
llm_translation: Not there, because of the acquisition of Rava.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: וְכֵן מָצִינוּ כְּשֶׁהִשְׁבִּיעַ מֹשֶׁה אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל, אָמַר לָהֶן: ״דְּעוּ שֶׁלֹּא עַל דַּעְתְּכֶם אֲנִי מַשְׁבִּיעַ אֶתְכֶם, אֶלָּא עַל דַּעַת הַמָּקוֹם וְעַל דַּעְתִּי״. וְאַמַּאי? לֵימָא לְהוּ: ״קַיִּימוּ מַאי דַּאֲמַר אֱלוֹהַּ״! לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּמַסְּקִי אַדַּעְתַּיְיהוּ עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה?
human_translation: Come hear And so we found when Moses administered an oath to Israel he said to them: Know that I am not administering this oath according to your understanding but according to the understanding of the Omnipresent and according to my understanding. And why let him say to them: Keep that which God said? Is it not because they direct in their minds idolatry,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Come and hear: And so we find that when Moses made the Israelites take an oath, he said to them: "Know that it is not upon your own understanding that I make you take this oath, but rather upon the understanding of the Omnipresent and upon my own understanding." And why? Let us say to them: "Fulfill what the Lord has said!" Is it not because they had mixed in their understanding foreign worship?

hebrew_text: לָא; מִשּׁוּם דַּעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה נָמֵי אִיקְּרִי ״אֱלוֹהַּ״, דִּכְתִיב: ״אֱלֹהֵי כֶסֶף וֵאלֹהֵי זָהָב״.
human_translation: No, because idolatry is also referred to God, as it is written: gods of silver or gods of gold”
llm_translation: Not; because of foreign worship also called "God," as it is written: "God of silver and God of gold."

hebrew_text: וְלֵימָא לְהוּ: ״קַיִּימוּ תּוֹרָה״! חֲדָא תּוֹרָה. וְלֵימָא: ״קַיִּימוּ שְׁתֵּי תּוֹרוֹת״! ״תּוֹרַת חַטָּאת״ ״תּוֹרַת אָשָׁם״. ״קַיִּימוּ כׇּל הַתּוֹרָה כּוּלָּהּ״! עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, דְּאָמַר מָר: חֲמוּרָה עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, שֶׁכׇּל הַכּוֹפֵר בָּהּ כְּמוֹדֶה בְּכׇל הַתּוֹרָה כּוּלָּהּ.
human_translation: let Moses say to them: Keep the Torah. one Torah, And let him say: Keep two Torahs. the law of [ torat ] the sin-offering the law of [ torat ] the guilt-offering. keep the entire Torah. idolatry, as the Master says: idolatry is severe that one who denies it is as if he affirms the entire Torah.
llm_translation: And say to them: "fulfilled Torah"! one Torah. And say: "fulfilled two Torahs"! "Torah of sin offering" "Torah of guilt offering". "fulfilled all the Torah in its entirety"! Foreign worship, as Mar said: Severe is foreign worship, for anyone who denies it is like one who admits to the entire Torah in its entirety.

hebrew_text: וְלֵימָא לְהוּ: ״קַיִּימוּ מִצְוָה״! חֲדָא מִצְוָה. ״קַיִּימוּ מִצְוֹת!״ תַּרְתֵּי. ״כׇּל הַמִּצְוֹת כּוּלָּן״! מִצְוַת צִיצִית, דְּאָמַר מָר: שְׁקוּלָה מִצְוַת צִיצִית כְּנֶגֶד כׇּל הַמִּצְוֹת כּוּלָּן.
human_translation: And let him say to them: Keep mitzva, one mitzva. Keep mitzvot, two All the mitzvot in their entirety. the mitzva of ritual fringes, as the Master says: The mitzva of ritual fringes is equivalent to all the mitzvot.
llm_translation: And say to them: "fulfilled commandment"! One commandment. "fulfilled commandments!" Two. "All the commandments"! The commandment of tzitzit, as the Master said: The commandment of tzitzit is equivalent to all the commandments.

hebrew_text: וְלֵימָא לְהוּ: ״קַיִּימוּ שֵׁשׁ מֵאוֹת וּשְׁלֹשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה מִצְוֹת״! וּלְטַעֲמֵיךְ, לֵימָא לְהוּ: ״עַל דַּעְתִּי״; ״עַל דַּעַת הַמָּקוֹם״ לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: And let him say to them: Keep 613 mitzvot. And according to your reasoning, let him say: according to my understanding. Why do I According to the understanding of the Omnipresent?
llm_translation: And say to them: "Observe six hundred and thirteen commandments!" And according to your reasoning, say to them: "According to my opinion"; "According to the opinion of the place," why do I need it?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא תִּהְוֵי הֲפָרָה לִשְׁבוּעֲתַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Rather, so that there would not be nullification of their oath.
llm_translation: Rather, how so that not will be a cow for their oaths.

hebrew_text: וְ״אִם לֹא רָאִיתִי נָחָשׁ כְּקוֹרַת בֵּית הַבַּד״. וְלָא?! וְהָא הַהוּא דַּהֲוָה בִּשְׁנֵי שַׁבּוּר מַלְכָּא, הֲוָה חַד דְּאַחְזֵיק תְּלֵיסַר אוּרָוָותָא תִּיבְנָא!
human_translation: If I did not see a snake as the beam of the olive press. And no But wasn’t there a certain during the years of King Shapur, one that contain, thirteen stables of straw?
llm_translation: "And 'if I did not see a snake as thick as the beam of a house,' really?! But wasn't there that one who was in the service of two kings, who held thirteen beams of a house at once!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: בְּטָרוּף. כּוּלְּהוּ נָמֵי מִיטְרָף טְרִיפִין! בְּשֶׁגַּבּוֹ טָרוּף.
human_translation: Shmuel said: to flat [ taruf ] Aren’t they all flat? to whose back is flat.
llm_translation: Shmuel said: with a mixture. All of them are considered as if they were mixed together. In the case of its back, it is considered as if it were torn.

hebrew_text: ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁאוֹכַל כִּכָּר זוֹ״, ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁלֹּא אוֹכְלֶנָּה״ כּוּ׳. הַשְׁתָּא מִשּׁוּם שְׁבוּעַת בִּיטּוּי מִיחַיַּיב, מִשּׁוּם שְׁבוּעַת שָׁוְא לָא מִיחַיַּיב?! הֲרֵי יָצְתָה שְׁבוּעָה לַשָּׁוְא!
human_translation: oath I will eat this loaf, oath I will not eat it, Now, he is liable because oath on an utterance. Is he not liable for an oath in vain? An oath was issued in vain
llm_translation: "An oath that one eats a loaf of bread," "an oath that one does not eat it," etc. Now, because of an oath of clarification, one is liable, but because of an oath of vanity, one is not liable?! Behold, an oath has emerged for vanity!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה, תָּנֵי: אַף עַל שְׁבוּעַת בִּיטּוּי.
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said: Teach also against an oath on an utterance.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said, it was taught: Even though it is a week of inspection.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ שְׁבוּעַת בִּיטּוּי נוֹהֶגֶת בַּאֲנָשִׁים וּבְנָשִׁים, בִּקְרוֹבִים וּבִרְחוֹקִים, בִּכְשֵׁרִין וּבִפְסוּלִין, בִּפְנֵי בֵּית דִּין וְשֶׁלֹּא בִּפְנֵי בֵּית דִּין – מִפִּי עַצְמוֹ. וְחַיָּיבִין עַל זְדוֹנָהּ מַכּוֹת, וְעַל שִׁגְגָתָהּ קׇרְבָּן עוֹלֶה וְיוֹרֵד.
human_translation: an oath on an utterance apply to men and to women, to relatives and to non-relatives, to those who are fit and to those who are disqualified, in the presence of a court or not in the presence of a court, on his own, And for intentionally liable lashes, and for unwittingly a sliding-scale offering.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: The oath of clarification is administered to both men and women, to those near and far, to those who are fit and those who are unfit, whether in front of a court or not in front of a court - by their own admission. And they are liable for intentional violation with lashes, and for unintentional violation with a sin offering, whether it involves an elevation offering or a sin offering.

hebrew_text: שְׁבוּעַת שָׁוְא נוֹהֶגֶת בַּאֲנָשִׁים וּבְנָשִׁים, בִּרְחוֹקִים וּבִקְרוֹבִים, בִּכְשֵׁרִין וּבִפְסוּלִין, בִּפְנֵי בֵּית דִּין וְשֶׁלֹּא בִּפְנֵי בֵּית דִּין – וּמִפִּי עַצְמוֹ. וְחַיָּיבִין עַל זְדוֹנָהּ מַכּוֹת, וְעַל שִׁגְגָתָהּ פָּטוּר.
human_translation: an oath in vain applies to men and to women, to relatives and to non-relatives, to those who are fit and to those who are disqualified, in the presence of a court or not in the presence of a court, and on his own. And for intentionally liable lashes, and for unwittingly exempt.
llm_translation: Oath of falsehood is practiced by men and women, by those far and near, by those qualified and disqualified, in the presence of the court and not in the presence of the court - and from his own mouth. And they are liable for intentional perjury to receive lashes, and for unintentional perjury they are exempt.

hebrew_text: אַחַת זוֹ וְאַחַת זוֹ, הַמּוּשְׁבָּע מִפִּי אֲחֵרִים חַיָּיב – ״אִם לֹא אָכַלְתִּי הַיּוֹם״ וְ״לֹא הִנַּחְתִּי תְּפִלִּין הַיּוֹם״; ״מַשְׁבִּיעֲךָ אֲנִי״, וְאָמַר ״אָמֵן״ – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: both this, and that, he is administered the oath by others, liable. If I did not eat today, or: I did not don phylacteries today, I administer an oath to you and said: Amen, liable
llm_translation: One this and one this, one who swears from the mouth of others is liable - "If I have not eaten today" and "I have not put on tefillin today"; "I adjure you" and he said "Amen" - he is liable.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כׇּל הָעוֹנֶה ״אָמֵן״ אַחַר שְׁבוּעָה – כְּמוֹצִיא שְׁבוּעָה בְּפִיו דָּמֵי, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְאָמְרָה הָאִשָּׁה אָמֵן אָמֵן״.
human_translation: Shmuel says: Anyone who answers amen after an oath is like one who expresses an oath with his mouth, as it is written “And the woman shall say: Amen, amen”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara said Shmuel: Anyone who responds "Amen" after seven blessings - it is as if he has brought forth seven blessings with his mouth, as it is written: "And the woman shall say, Amen, Amen."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: מַתְנִיתִין וּבָרָיְיתָא נָמֵי דַּיְקָא, דְּקָתָנֵי: שְׁבוּעַת הָעֵדוּת נוֹהֶגֶת בַּאֲנָשִׁים וְלֹא בְּנָשִׁים, בִּרְחוֹקִים וְלֹא בִּקְרוֹבִים, בִּכְשֵׁרִין וְלֹא בִּפְסוּלִין; וְאֵינָהּ נוֹהֶגֶת אֶלָּא בִּרְאוּיִן לְהָעִיד, וּבִפְנֵי בֵּית דִּין וְשֶׁלֹּא בִּפְנֵי בֵּית דִּין – מִפִּי עַצְמוֹ; וּמִפִּי אֲחֵרִים אֵינָן חַיָּיבִין, עַד שֶׁיִּכְפְּרוּ בָּהֶן בְּבֵית דִּין. דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said in the name of Rava: the mishna and a baraita also precisely, as it is taught The oath of testimony is practiced with regard to men but not with regard to women; with regard to non-relatives but not with regard to relatives; with regard to fit but not with regard to unfit And is practiced only with regard to fit to testify. And in the presence of a court and not in the presence of a court, on his own But by others, they are not liable until they deny in court the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said in the name of Rava: Mishna and Baraita are precise, as it is taught: The oath of testimony is administered with men and not with women, with distant relatives and not with close relatives, with those who are eligible and not with those who are ineligible; and it is administered only with those fit to testify, in the presence of the court and not outside the court - from their own mouths; and they are not obligated by the words of others until they are atoned for in court. These are the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: וְתַנְיָא בְּבָרַיְיתָא: שְׁבוּעַת הָעֵדוּת כֵּיצַד? אָמַר לְעֵדִים: ״בּוֹאוּ וְהַעִידוּנִי״; ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁאֵין אָנוּ יוֹדְעִין לְךָ עֵדוּת״, אוֹ שֶׁאָמְרוּ: ״אֵין אָנוּ יוֹדְעִין לָךְ עֵדוּת״; ״מַשְׁבִּיעַ אֲנִי עֲלֵיכֶם״, וְאָמְרוּ (לוֹ) ״אָמֵן״ – בֵּין בִּפְנֵי בֵּית דִּין בֵּין שֶׁלֹּא בִּפְנֵי בֵּית דִּין, בֵּין מִפִּי עַצְמוֹ בֵּין מִפִּי אֲחֵרִים, כֵּיוָן שֶׁכָּפְרוּ בָּהֶם – חַיָּיבִין. דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: And is taught in a baraita : an oath of testimony, how said to witnesses: Come and testify for me. oath we do not know any testimony that concerns you, Alternatively, they said: We do not know any testimony that concerns you, I administer an oath to you, and they said to him: Amen. Whether in the presence of a court whether not in the presence of a court, whether by himself whether by others, once they denied are liable; the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught in a baraita: How is the oath of testimony administered? He said to the witnesses, "Come and testify for me"; "An oath that we do not know your testimony," or they said, "We do not know your testimony"; "I adjure you," and they said to him, "Amen" - whether in front of the court or not in front of the court, whether from his own mouth or from the mouth of others, once they have denied it - they are liable. These are the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: קַשְׁיָין אַהֲדָדֵי! אֶלָּא לָאו שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: הָא דְּעָנָה ״אָמֵן״, הָא דְּלָא עָנָה ״אָמֵן״? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: difficult, each other? Rather, isn’t it conclude from it this who answered amen That who did not answer amen Conclude from it
llm_translation: Difficulties of Hadadei! Rather, it is not a valid deduction: this one who answered "Amen," and this one who did not answer "Amen"? It is a valid deduction.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: מַתְנִיתִין דְּהָכָא נָמֵי דַּיְקָא – דְּקָא תָּנֵי: ״שְׁבוּעַת בִּיטּוּי נוֹהֶגֶת בַּאֲנָשִׁים וּבְנָשִׁים, בִּרְחוֹקִים וּבִקְרוֹבִים, בִּכְשֵׁרִין וּבִפְסוּלִין, בִּפְנֵי בֵּית דִּין וְשֶׁלֹּא בִּפְנֵי בֵּית דִּין – מִפִּי עַצְמוֹ אִין, מִפִּי אֲחֵרִים לָא; וְקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: ״זֶה וָזֶה מוּשְׁבָּע מִפִּי אֲחֵרִים – חַיָּיב״.
human_translation: Ravina said in the name of Rava: The mishna that is here also precisely As it is taught an oath on an utterance apply to men and to women, to relatives and to non-relatives, to those who are fit and to those who are disqualified, in the presence of a court or not in the presence of a court, on his own, yes, by others, no. And taught the last clause this, and that, he is administered the oath by others, liable.
llm_translation: Ravina said in the name of Rava: The Mishnah here is precise in what it teaches: "An oath of testimony is administered to both men and women, to those far and near, to those who are fit and those who are unfit, in the presence of a court and not in the presence of a court - from their own mouths, yes; from the mouths of others, no." And the latter clause teaches: "Both this one and that one who are administered an oath by the mouths of others - are liable."

hebrew_text: קַשְׁיָין אַהֲדָדֵי! אֶלָּא לָאו שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: הָא דְּעָנָה ״אָמֵן״, הָא דְּלָא עָנָה ״אָמֵן״?
human_translation: difficult, each other. Rather, isn’t it conclude from it this who answered amen That who did not answer amen
llm_translation: Difficulties of Adadei! Rather, it is not a valid deduction: this one who answered "Amen," and this one who did not answer "Amen"?

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא שְׁמוּאֵל – מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? דּוּקְיָא דְּמַתְנִיתִין קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: But what is Shmuel teaching us? He is teaching us the precise of the mishna.
llm_translation: And rather, Shmuel - what is he teaching us? The mishnaic statement is teaching us.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ שְׁבוּעוֹת שְׁתַּיִם
llm_translation: We will return to you, two weeks.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ שְׁבוּעַת הָעֵדוּת נוֹהֶגֶת בַּאֲנָשִׁים וְלֹא בְּנָשִׁים, בִּרְחוֹקִין וְלֹא בִּקְרוֹבִין, בִּכְשֵׁרִין וְלֹא בִּפְסוּלִין; וְאֵינָהּ נוֹהֶגֶת אֶלָּא בִּרְאוּיִן לְהָעִיד.
human_translation: The oath of testimony is practiced with regard to men but not with regard to women, with regard to non-relatives but not with regard to relatives, with regard to fit but not with regard to unfit And is practiced only with regard to fit to testify.
llm_translation: It was taught: The oath of testimony is administered to men and not to women, to those who are far and not to those who are near, to those who are qualified and not to those who are disqualified; and it is only administered to those fit to testify.

hebrew_text: בִּפְנֵי בֵּית דִּין וְשֶׁלֹּא בִּפְנֵי בֵּית דִּין – מִפִּי עַצְמוֹ, וּמִפִּי אֲחֵרִים אֵין חַיָּיבִין עַד שֶׁיִּכְפְּרוּ בָּהֶן בְּבֵית דִּין. דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: בֵּין מִפִּי עַצְמוֹ וּבֵין מִפִּי אֲחֵרִים – אֵינָן חַיָּיבִין עַד שֶׁיִּכְפְּרוּ בָּהֶן בְּבֵית דִּין.
human_translation: in the presence of a court and not in the presence of a court, on his own. But by others they are not liable until they deny in court. the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: Whether on his own or whether by others, are not liable until they deny in court.
llm_translation: Before a court and not before a court - from his own mouth, and from the mouth of others they are not liable until they are atoned for in court. The words of Rabbi Meir. And the sages say: Whether from his own mouth or from the mouth of others - they are not liable until they are atoned for in court.

hebrew_text: וְחַיָּיבִין עַל זְדוֹן הַשְּׁבוּעָה, וְעַל שִׁגְגָתָהּ עִם זְדוֹן הָעֵדוּת, וְאֵינָן חַיָּיבִין עַל שִׁגְגָתָהּ. וּמָה הֵן חַיָּיבִין עַל זְדוֹן הַשְּׁבוּעָה? קׇרְבַּן עוֹלֶה וְיוֹרֵד.
human_translation: And one is liable for oath with intent and for an unwitting with intent the testimony, But are not liable for unwitting And what are they liable for oath with intent? a sliding-scale offering.
llm_translation: "And they are liable for intentional violation of an oath, and for its inadvertent transgression together with intentional violation of testimony, but they are not liable for its inadvertent transgression. And what are they liable for intentional violation of an oath? A burnt offering and a sin offering."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְעָמְדוּ שְׁנֵי הָאֲנָשִׁים״ – בְּעֵדִים הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר.
human_translation: From where is this matter, as the Sages taught then the two men shall stand” with regard to witnesses the verse is speaking.
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the meaning of "gemar menahanei milei"? The Rabbis taught: "And the two men shall stand" - the Scripture speaks in the presence of witnesses.

hebrew_text: אַתָּה אוֹמֵר בְּעֵדִים, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא בְּבַעֲלֵי דִינִין? כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר ״אֲשֶׁר לָהֶם הָרִיב״ – הֲרֵי בַּעֲלֵי דִינִין אָמוּר; הָא מָה אֲנִי מְקַיֵּים ״וְעָמְדוּ שְׁנֵי הָאֲנָשִׁים״? בְּעֵדִים הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר. וְאִם נַפְשְׁךָ לוֹמַר: נֶאֱמַר כָּאן ״שְׁנֵי״ וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן ״שְׁנֵי״; מָה לְהַלָּן בְּעֵדִים, אַף כָּאן בְּעֵדִים.
human_translation: Do you say with regard to witnesses, or only with regard to litigants When it states: “Between whom the controversy is” the litigants are stated How do I realize “then the two men shall stand”? with regard to witnesses the verse is speaking. And if it is your wish to say It is stated here: two and it is stated there: two just as there, with regard to witnesses so too here, with regard to witnesses
llm_translation: You say with witnesses, or is it only with litigants? When he says "which they have the dispute" - behold, it is said with litigants; but how do I fulfill "and the two men shall stand"? With witnesses the Scripture speaks. And if you wish to say: it is stated here "two" and it is stated there "two"; just as there with witnesses, so too here with witnesses.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״אִם נַפְשְׁךָ לוֹמַר״? וְכִי תֵּימָא: מִדְּלָא כְּתִב ״וַאֲשֶׁר לָהֶם הָרִיב״– כּוּלֵּיהּ קְרָא בְּבַעֲלֵי דִינִין מִשְׁתַּעֵי; נֶאֱמַר כָּאן ״שְׁנֵי״ וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן ״שְׁנֵי״, מָה לְהַלָּן בְּעֵדִים אַף כָּאן בְּעֵדִים.
human_translation: What if it is your wish to say? And if you would say from that did not write: and those between whom the controversy is the entire verse with regard to litigants it is speaking. It is stated here: two and it is stated there: two just as there, with regard to witnesses so too here, with regard to witnesses
llm_translation: What is "if your soul desires to say"? And if you were to say: since it did not write "and they shall have the dispute" - the entire verse is disputed by the litigants; it is stated here "two" and it is stated there "two," just as there with witnesses, so too here with witnesses.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: ״וְעָמְדוּ שְׁנֵי הָאֲנָשִׁים״ – בְּעֵדִים הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר. אַתָּה אוֹמֵר בְּעֵדִים, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא בְּבַעֲלֵי דִינִין? אָמְרַתְּ: וְכִי שְׁנַיִם בָּאִים לְדִין, שְׁלֹשָׁה אֵין בָּאִין לָדִין?! וְאִם נַפְשְׁךָ לוֹמַר: נֶאֱמַר כָּאן ״שְׁנֵי״ וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן ״שְׁנֵי״, מָה לְהַלָּן בְּעֵדִים, אַף כָּאן בְּעֵדִים.
human_translation: It is taught another “Then the two men shall stand,” with regard to witnesses the verse is speaking. Do you say with regard to witnesses, or only with regard to litigants you say Do two come for judgment three do not come for judgment? And if it is your wish to say It is stated here: two and it is stated there: two just as there, with regard to witnesses so too here, with regard to witnesses
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "And the two men shall stand" - the Scripture speaks of witnesses. Do you say with witnesses, or is it only with litigants? You say: If two come to judgment, do three not come to judgment?! And if you wish to say: It is stated here "two" and it is stated there "two," just as there it is with witnesses, so too here with witnesses.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״אִם נַפְשְׁךָ לוֹמַר״? וְכִי תֵּימָא: בְּתוֹבֵעַ וְנִתְבָּע קָא מִשְׁתַּעֵי קְרָא; נֶאֱמַר כָּאן ״שְׁנֵי״ וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן ״שְׁנֵי״, מָה לְהַלָּן בְּעֵדִים אַף כָּאן בְּעֵדִים.
human_translation: What if it is your wish to say? And if you would say with regard to a plaintiff and a defendant the verse is speaking. It is stated here: two and it is stated there: two just as there, with regard to witnesses so too here, with regard to witnesses
llm_translation: What is "If your soul desires to say"? And if you say: In a case of a plaintiff and a defendant, the verse is coming to be interpreted; it is stated here "two" and it is stated there "two," just as there it is with witnesses, so too here it is with witnesses.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: ״וְעָמְדוּ שְׁנֵי הָאֲנָשִׁים״ – בְּעֵדִים הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר. אַתָּה אוֹמֵר בְּעֵדִים, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא בְּבַעֲלֵי דִינִין? אָמְרַתְּ: וְכִי אֲנָשִׁים בָּאִין לַדִּין, נָשִׁים אֵין בָּאוֹת לַדִּין?! וְאִם נַפְשְׁךָ לוֹמַר: נֶאֱמַר כָּאן ״שְׁנֵי״ וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן ״שְׁנֵי״, מָה לְהַלָּן בְּעֵדִים אַף כָּאן בְּעֵדִים.
human_translation: It is taught another “Then the two men shall stand,” with regard to witnesses the verse is speaking. Do you say with regard to witnesses, or only with regard to litigants you say men come for judgment women do not come for judgment? And if it is your wish to say It is stated here: two and it is stated there: two just as there, with regard to witnesses so too here, with regard to witnesses
llm_translation: It was taught in another Baraita: "And the two men shall stand" - the Scripture speaks of witnesses. Do you say with witnesses, or is it only with litigants? You say: Do men come to judgment, and women do not come to judgment?! And if you wish to say: It is stated here "two" and it is stated there "two," just as there with witnesses, so too here with witnesses.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״אִם נַפְשְׁךָ לוֹמַר״? וְכִי תֵּימָא: אִשָּׁה לָאו אוֹרְחַהּ, מִשּׁוּם ״כׇּל כְּבוּדָּה בַת מֶלֶךְ פְּנִימָה״; נֶאֱמַר כָּאן ״שְׁנֵי״ וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן ״שְׁנֵי״, מָה לְהַלָּן בְּעֵדִים אַף כָּאן בְּעֵדִים.
human_translation: What if it is your wish to say? And if you would say a woman, it is not conduct her due to “All the glory of the king’s daughter is within” It is stated here: two and it is stated there: two just as there, with regard to witnesses so too here, with regard to witnesses
llm_translation: What is meant by "if your soul desires"? And if you were to say: A woman is not like a traveler, because of "all the glory of the king's daughter is within"; it is stated here "two" and it is stated there "two," just as there with witnesses, so too here with witnesses.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְעָמְדוּ שְׁנֵי הָאֲנָשִׁים״ – מִצְוָה לְבַעֲלֵי דִינִין שֶׁיַּעַמְדוּ. אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: שָׁמַעְתִּי שֶׁאִם רָצוּ לְהוֹשִׁיב אֶת שְׁנֵיהֶם – מוֹשִׁיבִין; אֵיזֶהוּ אָסוּר? שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא אֶחָד עוֹמֵד וְאֶחָד יוֹשֵׁב, אֶחָד מְדַבֵּר כׇּל צָרְכּוֹ וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר לוֹ ״קַצֵּר דְּבָרֶיךָ״.
human_translation: The Sages taught: “Then the two men shall stand”; a mitzva for the litigants to stand Rabbi Yehuda said: I heard that if wished to seat both they may seat What, is prohibited that there will not be one is standing and one is sitting, one says everything he needs and one says to him: Curtail your statement.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "And the two men shall stand" - it is a commandment for the judges to stand. Rabbi Yehuda said: I heard that if they wanted to seat both of them - they may seat them; which case is prohibited? That one should not be standing while the other is sitting, one speaking all his needs and the other saying to him, "Shorten your words."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״בְּצֶדֶק תִּשְׁפֹּט עֲמִיתֶךָ״ – שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא אֶחָד יוֹשֵׁב וְאֶחָד עוֹמֵד, אֶחָד מְדַבֵּר כׇּל צָרְכּוֹ וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר לוֹ: ״קַצֵּר דְּבָרֶיךָ״. דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״בְּצֶדֶק תִּשְׁפֹּט עֲמִיתֶךָ״ – הֱוֵי דָּן אֶת חֲבֵירְךָ לְכַף זְכוּת.
human_translation: The Sages taught: “But in righteousness shall you judge your colleague” that there will not be one is sitting and one is standing, one says everything he needs and one says to him: Curtail your statement. Alternatively, “But in righteousness shall you judge your colleague,” should judge another favorably,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "With righteousness you shall judge your fellow" - that one should not have one sitting and one standing, one speaking all his needs and one saying to him: "Shorten your words." Another explanation: "With righteousness you shall judge your fellow" - judge your fellow favorably.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי רַב יוֹסֵף: ״בְּצֶדֶק תִּשְׁפֹּט עֲמִיתֶךָ״ – עִם שֶׁאִתְּךָ בְּתוֹרָה וּבְמִצְוֹת, הִשְׁתַּדֵּל לְדוּנוֹ יָפֶה.
human_translation: Rav Yosef teaches “But in righteousness shall you judge your colleague [ amitekha ],” With who is with you [ im she’itekha ] in Torah and in mitzvot, try to judge him favorably,
llm_translation: Tana Rabbi Yosef: "Betzedek tishpot amitecha" - im she'itecha beTorah uveMitzvot, hishtadel leduno yafeh.

hebrew_text: רַב עוּלָּא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב עִילַּאי הֲוָה לֵיהּ דִּינָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן. שְׁלַח לֵיהּ רַב יוֹסֵף: עוּלָּא חֲבֵרֵנוּ עָמִית בְּתוֹרָה וּבְמִצְוֹת. אָמַר: לְמַאי שְׁלַח לִי? לְחַנּוֹפֵי לֵיהּ?! הֲדַר אָמַר: לְמִישְׁרֵא בְּתִיגְרֵיהּ,
human_translation: Rav Ulla, son of Rav Ilai, had a trial before Rav Naḥman. Rav Yosef sent to Ulla our friend a colleague in Torah and mitzvot, said: For what did he send to me? to grant him preferential then said: to open with dispute
llm_translation: Rav Ula son of Rav Ilai had a legal matter before Rav Nachman. Rav Yosef sent him a message: "Ula, our colleague, is knowledgeable in Torah and commandments." He said: "Why did he send me? To flatter him?!" Later he said: "To straighten out his dispute."

hebrew_text: אִי נָמֵי לְשׁוּדָא דְּדַיָּינֵי.
human_translation: Alternatively, with regard to the discretion of the judges,
llm_translation: If you wish, to the market of the judges.

hebrew_text: אָמַר עוּלָּא: מַחְלוֹקֶת בְּבַעֲלֵי דִינִין; אֲבָל בְּעֵדִים – דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל בַּעֲמִידָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְעָמְדוּ שְׁנֵי הָאֲנָשִׁים״. אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: מַחְלוֹקֶת בִּשְׁעַת מַשָּׂא וּמַתָּן; אֲבָל בִּשְׁעַת גְּמַר דִּין – דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל דַּיָּינִין בִּישִׁיבָה וּבַעֲלֵי דִינִין בַּעֲמִידָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיָּשֶׁב מֹשֶׁה לִשְׁפֹּט אֶת הָעָם וַיַּעֲמֹד הָעָם״.
human_translation: Ulla says: dispute with regard to the litigants; but with regard to the witnesses, everyone agrees while standing, as it is written: “Then the two men shall stand” Rav Huna says: dispute at the time of the deliberation, but at the time of the verdict, everyone agrees judges while sitting and the litigants while standing, as it is written: “And Moses sat to judge the people and the people stood”
llm_translation: Ula said: Dispute regarding judges; but regarding witnesses – everyone agrees standing, as it is written: "And the two men shall stand." Rav Huna said: Dispute during negotiation; but during final judgment – everyone agrees judges seated and litigants standing, as it is written: "And Moses sat to judge the people, and the people stood."

hebrew_text: לִישָּׁנָא אַחֲרִינָא: מַחְלוֹקֶת בִּשְׁעַת מַשָּׂא וּמַתָּן, אֲבָל בִּשְׁעַת גְּמַר דִּין – דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל דַּיָּינִין בִּישִׁיבָה וּבַעֲלֵי דִינִין בַּעֲמִידָה; דְּהָא עֵדִים כִּגְמַר דִּין דָּמוּ, וּכְתִיב בְּהוּ: ״וְעָמְדוּ שְׁנֵי הָאֲנָשִׁים״.
human_translation: an alternative version dispute at the time of the deliberation, but at the time of the verdict, everyone agrees judges while sitting and the litigants while standing, as witnesses, like the verdict, and it is written concerning them: “Then the two men shall stand.”
llm_translation: Another teaching: Dispute during the deliberation and negotiation, but during the final judgment - everyone agrees that the judges sit and the litigants stand; for witnesses are like the final judgment, as it is written: "And the two men shall stand."

hebrew_text: דְּבֵיתְהוּ דְּרַב הוּנָא הֲוָה לַהּ דִּינָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן, אֲמַר: הֵיכִי נַעֲבֵיד? אִי אֵיקוּם מִקַּמַּהּ – מִסְתַּתְּמָן טַעֲנָתֵיהּ דְּבַעַל דִּינָא. לָא אֵיקוּם מִקַּמַּהּ – אֵשֶׁת חָבֵר הֲרֵי הִיא כְּחָבֵר. אֲמַר לֵיהּ לְשַׁמָּעֵיהּ: צֵא וְאַפְרַח עֲלַי בַּר אֲוָוזָא וּשְׁדִי עִלָּוַואי, וְאֵיקוּם.
human_translation: The wife of Rav Huna had a trial before Rav Naḥman. said: What should we do? If I will arise before her the claims of the litigant suppressed, I will not arise before her, wife of a ḥaver is like a ḥaver , said to his attendant: Go outside and cause a duck to fly and cast it onto me, and I will arise
llm_translation: The household of Rav Huna had a legal matter before Rav Nachman. He said: How shall we proceed? If they establish from her - her husband's claim is dismissed. If they do not establish from her - she is like her husband's wife. He said to his attendant: Go and spread a cloth for me on the son of Avuza and sit on my garments, and establish.

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר מָר: מַחְלוֹקֶת בִּשְׁעַת מַשָּׂא וּמַתָּן, אֲבָל בִּשְׁעַת גְּמַר דִּין – דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל דַּיָּינִים בִּישִׁיבָה וּבַעֲלֵי דִינִין בַּעֲמִידָה! דְּיָתֵיב כְּמַאן דְּשָׁרֵי מְסָאנֵיהּ, וְאָמַר: ״אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי אַתָּה זַכַּאי״, ״אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי אַתָּה חַיָּיב״.
human_translation: But doesn’t the Master, say: dispute at the time of the deliberation, but at the time of the verdict, everyone agrees judges while sitting and the litigants while standing? where he sits like one who unties his shoe, and says So-and-so, you are innocent, so-and-so, you are guilty.
llm_translation: The Master said: Dispute during negotiation is permissible, but during final judgment - everyone is fit to sit, and the judges to stand! Whoever is able to persuade his opponent, and says: "You are entitled, so-and-so," "You are liable, so-and-so."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא: הַאי צוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן וְעַם הָאָרֶץ דְּאִית לְהוּ דִּינָא בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי – מוֹתְבִינַן לֵיהּ לְצוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן, וּלְעַם הָאָרֶץ נָמֵי אָמְרִינַן לֵיהּ ״תִּיב״; וְאִי קָאֵי – לֵית לַן בַּהּ.
human_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna says: this a Torah scholar [ letzurva merabbanan ] and an am ha’aretz have a court case with one another, we seat the Torah scholar, and to the am ha’aretz we also say: Sit. And if he stand we have no with it.
llm_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna said: This dispute between the Sages and the common people, where there is a legal matter between them – we establish it for the Sages, and for the common people we say to them, "Sit"; and if it is standing – we have no concern with it.

hebrew_text: רַב בַּר שֵׁרֵבְיָא הֲוָה לֵיהּ דִּינָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב פָּפָּא, אוֹתְבֵיהּ וְאוֹתֵיב נָמֵי לְבַעַל דִּינֵיהּ. אֲתָא שְׁלִיחָא דְּבֵי דִינָא, בְּטַשׁ בֵּיהּ וְאוֹקְמֵיהּ לְעַם הָאָרֶץ, וְלָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא ״תִּיב״. הֵיכִי עָבֵיד הָכִי? וְהָא מִסְתַּתְּמָן טַעֲנָתֵיהּ! אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: מֵימָר אָמַר, אִיהוּ הָא אוֹתְבַן, שְׁלִיחָא הוּא דְּלָא מִפַּיַּיס מִינַּאי.
human_translation: Rav bar Sherevya had a trial before Rav Pappa. seated him and also seated his litigant An agent of the court came kicked and stood the am ha’aretz on his feet and Rav Pappa did not say to him: Sit. How did act that But aren’t claims suppressed Rav Pappa said he says: seated me; is the agent who is displeased with me
llm_translation: Rav bar She'revya had a legal case before Rav Papa, he sat and placed himself in front of the judge of his case. A messenger from the court came, pushed him and stood him up among the common people, and did not say to him, "Sit." How did he act in this way? And his claim was concealed! Rav Papa said: A saying says, "This one is sitting, he is a messenger who does not appease from the face of the people."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא: הַאי צוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן וְעַם הָאָרֶץ דְּאִית לְהוּ דִּינָא בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי, לָא לִיקְדּוֹם צוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן וְלִיתֵּיב, מִשּׁוּם דְּמִיחֲזֵי כְּמַאן דְּסָדַר לֵיהּ לְדִינֵיהּ. וְלָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּלָא קְבִיעַ לֵיהּ עִידָּנֵיהּ, אֲבָל קְבִיעַ לֵיהּ עִידָּנֵיהּ – לֵית לַן בַּהּ; מֵימָר אָמַר: בְּעִידָּנֵיהּ טְרִיד.
human_translation: And Rabba bar Rav Huna says: this a Torah scholar and an am ha’aretz have a court case with one another, let the Torah scholar not early and sit due to that he appears as one who is to arrange his legal And we said only where there is not a fixed time for but there is a fixed time for him we have no with it, will say: He is occupied with his time,
llm_translation: Rabah bar Rav Huna said: This student of the sages and an am ha'aretz who has a legal matter between them, if the student of the sages does not precede and sit down, because it appears as if he is arranging his case. And we only said that he should not establish his times, but if he establishes his times - we have nothing against him; as the saying goes: "In his times he will be successful."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא: הַאי צוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן דְּיָדַע בְּסָהֲדוּתָא, וְזִילָא בֵּיהּ מִילְּתָא לְמֵיזַל לְבֵי דַיָּינָא דְּזוּטַר מִינֵּיהּ לְאַסְהוֹדֵי קַמֵּיהּ – לָא לֵיזִיל. אָמַר רַב שִׁישָׁא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי, אַף אֲנַן נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: מָצָא שַׂק אוֹ קוּפָּה וְאֵין דַּרְכּוֹ לִיטּוֹל – הֲרֵי זֶה לֹא יִטּוֹל.
human_translation: And Rabba bar Rav Huna says: a certain Torah scholar who knows testimony but a demeaning matter for him to go to the court of a judge who is less than he to testify before him, let him not go Rav Sheisha, son of Rav Idi, said: We learn as well: one found a sack or a basket, and it is not his manner to take he not take
llm_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna said: This student who is knowledgeable in testimony, let him go and bring the matter to the court of Zutara, so that they may testify before him – he should not go. Rav Shisha, son of Rav Idi, said: We also learned: If one finds a sack or a basket and it is not his usual practice to take it – he should not take it.

hebrew_text: הָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּמָמוֹנָא, אֲבָל בְּאִיסּוּרָא – ״אֵין חׇכְמָה וְאֵין תְּבוּנָה וְאֵין עֵצָה לְנֶגֶד ה׳״; כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ חִלּוּל ה׳ – אֵין חוֹלְקִין כָּבוֹד לְרַב.
human_translation: This matter with regard to monetary matters; but in ritual matters, “There is neither wisdom nor understanding nor counsel against the Lord” Wherever there is desecration of the name of the Lord, one does not show deference to the teacher.
llm_translation: These are matters of monetary law, but in matters of prohibition - "There is no wisdom, no understanding, and no counsel against the Lord"; wherever there is desecration of the Lord's name - we do not give honor to the teacher.

hebrew_text: רַב יֵימַר הֲוָה יָדַע לֵיהּ סָהֲדוּתָא לְמָר זוּטְרָא. אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּאַמֵּימָר, אוֹתְבִינְהוּ לְכוּלְּהוּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אָשֵׁי לְאַמֵּימָר, וְהָאָמַר עוּלָּא: מַחְלוֹקֶת בְּבַעֲלֵי דִינִין, אֲבָל בְּעֵדִים – דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל בַּעֲמִידָה! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַאי עֲשֵׂה וְהַאי עֲשֵׂה, וַעֲשֵׂה דִּכְבוֹד תּוֹרָה עָדִיף.
human_translation: Rav Yeimar knew testimony to Mar Zutra. He came before Ameimar, seated all Rav Ashi said to Ameimar: But doesn’t Ulla say dispute with regard to the litigants, but with regard to the witnesses, everyone agrees while standing? said to him: This, a positive mitzva, and that, a positive mitzva, and the positive mitzva of deference to the Torah takes precedence.
llm_translation: Rav Yeimar knew the testimony for Mar Zutra. He came before Amemar, they all sat. Rav Ashei said to Amemar, and he said a quote: "Dispute among judges, but with witnesses - everyone agrees standing!" He said to him: This one do and this one do, and doing for the honor of the Torah is preferable.

hebrew_text: (סִימָן: סָנֵיגָרוֹן, בּוּר, גְּזֵלַת, מִרְמָה)
human_translation: a mnemonic Advocacy, ignoramus, robbery, fraud.
llm_translation: Section: Sanegaron, Bur, Gezelat, Mirmah

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מִנַּיִן לַדַּיָּין שֶׁלֹּא יַעֲשֶׂה סָנִיגָרוֹן לִדְבָרָיו? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״מִדְּבַר שֶׁקֶר תִּרְחָק״. וּמִנַּיִן לַדַּיָּין שֶׁלֹּא יֵשֵׁב תַּלְמִיד בּוּר לְפָנָיו? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״מִדְּבַר שֶׁקֶר תִּרְחָק״.
human_translation: The Sages taught: From where a judge should not engage in advocacy [ saneigeron ] for his statements the verse states: “Distance yourself from a false matter” And from where with regard to a judge that a student an ignoramus should not sit before him the verse states: “Distance yourself from a false matter.”
llm_translation: The sages taught: From where do we derive that a judge should not make a colored glass partition for his words? The verse teaches: "Keep far from a false matter." And from where do we derive that a judge should not have a deceitful student before him? The verse teaches: "Keep far from a false matter."

hebrew_text: מִנַּיִן לַדַּיָּין שֶׁיּוֹדֵעַ לַחֲבֵירוֹ שֶׁהוּא גַּזְלָן, וְכֵן עֵד שֶׁיּוֹדֵעַ בַּחֲבֵירוֹ שֶׁהוּא גַּזְלָן – מִנַּיִן שֶׁלֹּא יִצְטָרֵף עִמּוֹ? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״מִדְּבַר שֶׁקֶר תִּרְחָק״.
human_translation: From where a judge who knows that another is a robber and likewise, a witness who knows that another is a robber from where that he should not join him the verse states: “Distance yourself from a false matter.”
llm_translation: From where do we know for the judge that he knows about his fellow that he is a thief, and similarly for a witness that he knows about his fellow that he is a thief - from where do we know that he should not join with him? The verse teaches: "Keep far from a false matter" (Exodus 23:7).

hebrew_text: מִנַּיִן לַדַּיָּין שֶׁיּוֹדֵעַ בַּדִּין שֶׁהוּא מְרוּמֶּה, שֶׁלֹּא יֹאמַר: הוֹאִיל וְהָעֵדִים מְעִידִין – אֶחְתְּכֶנּוּ, וִיהֵא
human_translation: From where a judge who knows with regard to the verdict that it is fraudulent, that he should not say: Since the witnesses are testifying I will decide and let
llm_translation: From where do we derive that a judge who is knowledgeable in the law and is esteemed should not say, "Since the witnesses testify, I will cut short the case"? Let him be...

hebrew_text: קוֹלָר תָּלוּי בְּצַוַּאר עֵדִים? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״מִדְּבַר שֶׁקֶר תִּרְחַק״.
human_translation: the chain [ kolar ] be around the neck of the witnesses? the verse states: “Distance yourself from a false matter.”
llm_translation: Collar hanging on the neck of witnesses? The Talmud teaches: "Keep far from a false matter."

hebrew_text: (סִימָן: תְּלָתָא תַּלְמִיד, וּתְלָת בַּעֲלֵי חוֹב, סְמַרְטוּט שׁוֹמֵעַ וּמַטְעִים)
human_translation: a mnemonic Three a student; and three creditors; Rags, hears, and explain.
llm_translation: Section: Three students, and three creditors, a deaf person who hears and a mute person who speaks.

hebrew_text: מִנַּיִן לְתַלְמִיד שֶׁיּוֹשֵׁב לִפְנֵי רַבּוֹ וְרוֹאֶה זְכוּת לֶעָנִי וְחוֹב לֶעָשִׁיר – מִנַּיִן שֶׁלֹּא יִשְׁתּוֹק? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״מִדְּבַר שֶׁקֶר תִּרְחָק״.
human_translation: From where a student who is sitting before his teacher and sees advantage for a poor and disadvantage for a wealthy that he shall not remain silent? the verse states: “Distance yourself from a false matter.”
llm_translation: From where do we know for a student that he should sit before his teacher and see the merit of the poor and the liability of the rich - from where do we know that he should not be silent? The Talmud teaches: "Keep far from a false matter."

hebrew_text: מִנַּיִן לְתַלְמִיד שֶׁרוֹאֶה אֶת רַבּוֹ שֶׁטּוֹעֶה בַּדִּין, שֶׁלֹּא יֹאמַר: אַמְתִּין לוֹ עַד שֶׁיִּגְמְרֶנּוּ; וְאֶסְתְּרֶנּוּ וְאֶבְנֶנּוּ מִשֶּׁלִּי, כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּקָּרֵא הַדִּין עַל שְׁמִי? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״מִדְּבַר שֶׁקֶר תִּרְחָק״.
human_translation: From where a student who sees his teacher who is erring in judgment that he shall not say: I will wait for until he concludes and I will contradict him and construct of my own so that the verdict will be attributed to my name? the verse states: “Distance yourself from a false matter.”
llm_translation: From where do we know for a student who sees his teacher making a mistake in judgment, that he should not say, "I will wait until he finishes it, and I will then reveal it and build it from my own understanding, so that the judgment will be called by my name?" The Talmud teaches us: "Keep far from a false matter."

hebrew_text: מִנַּיִן לְתַלְמִיד שֶׁאָמַר לוֹ רַבּוֹ: יוֹדֵעַ אַתָּה בִּי שֶׁאִם נוֹתְנִין לִי מֵאָה מָנֶה אֵינִי מְבַדֶּה; מָנֶה יֵשׁ לִי אֵצֶל פְּלוֹנִי, וְאֵין לִי עָלָיו אֶלָּא עֵד אֶחָד – מִנַּיִן שֶׁלֹּא יִצְטָרֵף עִמּוֹ? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״מִדְּבַר שֶׁקֶר תִּרְחָק״.
human_translation: From where a student whose teacher said to him: You know concerning me that if give me one hundred one hundred dinars, I would not fabricate I have one hundred dinars in the possession of so-and-so, but I have only one witness about from where that shall not join with as the verse states: “Distance yourself from a false matter”
llm_translation: From where do we know for a student disciple that his teacher said to him: "You know about me that if they give me a hundred mana, I will not consent; I have a mana by so-and-so, and I have only one witness against him - from where do we know that he the student should not join with him the teacher? The Talmud teaches us: "Keep far from a false matter" Exodus 23:7.

hebrew_text: הַאי מִ״דְּבַר שֶׁקֶר תִּרְחָק״ נָפְקָא?! הָא וַדַּאי שַׁקּוֹרֵי קָא מְשַׁקֵּר, וְרַחֲמָנָא אָמַר: ״לֹא תַעֲנֶה בְרֵעֲךָ עֵד שָׁקֶר״! אֶלָּא כְּגוֹן דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: וַדַּאי חַד סָהֲדָא אִית לִי, וְתָא אַתָּה קוּם הָתָם וְלָא תֵּימָא וְלָא מִידֵּי, דְּהָא לָא מַפְּקַתְּ מִפּוּמָּךְ שִׁקְרָא – אֲפִילּוּ הָכִי אָסוּר, מִשּׁוּם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מִדְּבַר שֶׁקֶר תִּרְחָק״.
human_translation: “Distance yourself from a false matter” that this is derived? But he certainly lying and the Merciful One states: “You shall not bear false witness against your neighbor” Rather, where said to him: certain I have one witness, and you come stand there and do not say anything, as you do not express a lie from your mouth. Even so, prohibited due to that is stated: “Distance yourself from a false matter.”
llm_translation: This matter of "distance yourself from a false matter" - how does it come out? Indeed, the liars are lying, and the Merciful One said: "Do not bear false witness against your neighbor"! Rather, for example, if one says to him: "I certainly have one witness, and you come there and do not say anything, for you do not remove falsehood from your lips" - even so, it is forbidden, as it is said: "Distance yourself from a false matter."

hebrew_text: מִנַּיִן לַנּוֹשֶׁה בַּחֲבֵירוֹ מָנֶה, שֶׁלֹּא יֹאמַר: אֶטְעָנֶנּוּ בְּמָאתַיִם – כְּדֵי שֶׁיּוֹדֶה לִי בְּמָנֶה, וְיִתְחַיֵּיב לִי שְׁבוּעָה, וַאֲגַלְגֵּל עָלָיו שְׁבוּעָה מִמָּקוֹם אַחֵר? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״מִדְּבַר שֶׁקֶר תִּרְחָק״.
human_translation: From where one who is seeking from another one hundred dinars, that he shall not say: I will claim he two hundred so that he will admit me one hundred dinars, and he will become liable an oath to me, and I will extend him an oath from another place? the verse states: “Distance yourself from a false matter.”
llm_translation: From where do we derive that if one appoints his friend as a trustee, he should not say, "I will load him with a hundred," so that he will admit to me with a hundred, and be obligated to me with an oath, and I will transfer the oath from him to another place? The Talmud teaches us: "Keep far from a false matter."

hebrew_text: מִנַּיִן לַנּוֹשֶׁה בַּחֲבֵירוֹ מָנֶה וּטְעָנוֹ מָאתַיִם, שֶׁלֹּא יֹאמַר: אֶכְפְּרֶנּוּ בְּבֵית דִּין וְאוֹדֶה לוֹ חוּץ לְבֵית דִּין, כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא אֶתְחַיֵּיב לוֹ שְׁבוּעָה וְלֹא יְגַלְגֵּל עָלַי שְׁבוּעָה מִמָּקוֹם אַחֵר? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״מִדְּבַר שֶׁקֶר תִּרְחָק״.
human_translation: From where one who is seeking from another one hundred dinars and claims him two hundred that shall not say: I will deny his in court, and I will admit to him outside court so that I will not become liable an oath to him and he will not extend me an oath from another place? as the verse states: “Distance yourself from a false matter.”
llm_translation: From where do we derive that if one admits to owing his fellow a hundred and claims two hundred, he should not say, "I will atone for him in court and confess to him outside of court, so that I will not be obligated to him by oath, and he will not roll an oath upon me from another place?" The Talmud teaches: "Keep far from a false matter" (Exodus 23:7).

hebrew_text: מִנַּיִן לִשְׁלֹשָׁה שֶׁנּוֹשִׁין מָנֶה בְּאֶחָד, שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא אֶחָד בַּעַל דִּין וּשְׁנַיִם עֵדִים, כְּדֵי שֶׁיּוֹצִיאוּ מָנֶה וְיַחְלוֹקוּ? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״מִדְּבַר שֶׁקֶר תִּרְחָק״.
human_translation: From where three who are seeking from one one hundred dinars, that one should not assume the role of litigant and two witnesses so that they will exact one hundred dinars and divide as the verse states: “Distance yourself from a false matter.”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: From where do we derive that three people can impose a fine on one individual, so that there is not one judge and two witnesses, in order to collect the fine and divide it? The Talmud teaches: "Keep far from a false matter."

hebrew_text: מִנַּיִן לִשְׁנַיִם שֶׁבָּאוּ לַדִּין, אֶחָד לָבוּשׁ סְמַרְטוּטִין וְאֶחָד לָבוּשׁ אִיצְטְלִית בַּת מֵאָה מָנֶה, שֶׁאוֹמְרִין לוֹ: לְבוֹשׁ כְּמוֹתוֹ אוֹ הַלְבִּישֵׁהוּ כְּמוֹתְךָ? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״מִדְּבַר שֶׁקֶר תִּרְחָק״. כִּי הֲווֹ אָתוּ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא בַּר רַב הוּנָא, אֲמַר לְהוּ: שְׁלוּפוּ פּוּזְמוּקַיְיכוּ וְחוּתוּ לְדִינָא.
human_translation: From where two who came to judgment, one dressed in rags and one dressed in a garment worth one hundred one hundred dinars, that say to Dress like or dress like yours? the verse states: “Distance yourself from a false matter.” When would come before Rava bar Rav Huna he say to them: Remove your fine shoes [ puzmukaikhu ] and descend for judgment,
llm_translation: From where do we know regarding two who come to judgment, one wearing woolen garments and one wearing linen garments worth one hundred mana, that we say to him: "Clothe him like yourself or clothe him like you?" The Talmud teaches: "Keep far from a false matter." When they came before Rava son of Rav Huna, he said to them: "Strip off your embroidered garments and go to judgment."

hebrew_text: מִנַּיִן לְדַיָּין שֶׁלֹּא יִשְׁמַע דִּבְרֵי בַּעַל דִּין (חֲבֵירוֹ) קוֹדֶם שֶׁיָּבֹא בַּעַל דִּין חֲבֵירוֹ? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״מִדְּבַר שֶׁקֶר תִּרְחָק״.
human_translation: From where that a judge should not hear the statement of litigant before the other litigant comes as the verse states: “Distance yourself from a false matter.”
llm_translation: From where do we derive that a judge should not listen to the words of one litigant (his fellow) before the other litigant comes? The Talmud teaches: "Keep far from a false matter."

hebrew_text: מִנַּיִן לְבַעַל דִּין שֶׁלֹּא יַטְעִים דְּבָרָיו לַדַּיָּין קוֹדֶם שֶׁיָּבֹא בַּעַל דִּין חֲבֵירוֹ? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״מִדְּבַר שֶׁקֶר תִּרְחָק״. רַב כָּהֲנָא מַתְנֵי מִ״לֹּא תִשָּׂא״ – ״לֹא תַשִּׂיא״.
human_translation: From where a litigant shall not explain his statements to the judge before the other litigant comes the verse states: “Distance yourself from a false matter.” Rav Kahana teaches from “You shall not accept [ lo tissa ] You shall not cause
llm_translation: From where do we derive that a judge should not incline his words towards the judge before his colleague comes? The Talmud teaches: "Keep far from a false matter." Rav Kahana teaches: From "you shall not bear" - "you shall not bear."

hebrew_text: ״וַאֲשֶׁר לֹא טוֹב עָשָׂה בְּתוֹךְ עַמָּיו״ – רַב אָמַר: זֶה הַבָּא בְּהַרְשָׁאָה, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: זֶה הַלּוֹקֵחַ שָׂדֶה שֶׁיֵּשׁ עָלֶיהָ עֲסִיקִין.
human_translation: “And did that which is not good among his people” Rav says: This one who comes with authorization And Shmuel says: This one who purchases a field there are those who contest of it,
llm_translation: "And that which is not good he has done among his people" - Rav said: This refers to one who acts with permission, and Shmuel said: This refers to one who acquires a field that has encumbrances upon it.

hebrew_text: אֵינָהּ נוֹהֶגֶת אֶלָּא בִּרְאוּיִן לְהָעִיד כּוּ׳. לְאַפּוֹקֵי מַאי? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: לְאַפּוֹקֵי מֶלֶךְ. וְרַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב אָמַר: לְאַפּוֹקֵי מְשַׂחֵק בְּקוּבְיָא.
human_translation: is practiced only with regard to fit to testify. to exclude what Rav Pappa said: to exclude a king And Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said: to exclude one who plays with dice,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "It is only fitting for her to testify." What is the reason? Rav Papa said: "To testify for the king." And Rav Acha bar Yaakov said: "To testify in a court case."

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּאָמַר מְשַׂחֵק בְּקוּבְיָא – כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן מֶלֶךְ; וּמַאן דְּאָמַר מֶלֶךְ – אֲבָל מְשַׂחֵק בְּקוּבְיָא, מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא מִחְזָא חֲזֵי, וְרַבָּנַן הוּא דְּפַסְלוּהוּ.
human_translation: the one who says one who plays with dice all the more so a king And the one who says a king but one who plays with dice by Torah law he is fit and it is the Sages who disqualified him.
llm_translation: One who says "playing with a ball is certainly fitting for a king," and one who says "a king, but playing with a ball is forbidden by the Torah, see and observe," and it is the Rabbis who have prohibited it.

hebrew_text: בִּפְנֵי בֵּית דִּין וְשֶׁלֹּא בִּפְנֵי בֵּית דִּין כּוּ׳. בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי?
human_translation: in the presence of court and not in the presence of court, With regard to what do they disagree?
llm_translation: Before a court and not before a court, so it is. With what do they disagree?

hebrew_text: אַמְרוּהָ רַבָּנַן קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב פָּפָּא: בְּדוּן מִינַּהּ וּמִינַּהּ – בְּדוּן מִינַּהּ וְאוֹקֵי בְאַתְרַהּ קָא מִיפַּלְגִי.
human_translation: The Sages said before Rav Pappa: They disagree with regard to infer from and from infer from it but interpret to its place?
llm_translation: The sages said before Rav Papa: In judging each one and each one - in judging each one and uprooting in its place they are divided.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר: דּוּן מִינַּהּ וּמִינַּהּ מִפִּקָּדוֹן; מָה פִּקָּדוֹן – מוּשְׁבָּע מִפִּי עַצְמוֹ חַיָּיב, אַף עֵדוּת – מוּשְׁבָּע מִפִּי עַצְמוֹ חַיָּיב, וּמִינַּהּ, מָה פִּקָּדוֹן – בֵּין בְּבֵית דִּין וּבֵין שֶׁלֹּא בְּבֵית דִּין, אַף עֵדוּת – בֵּין בְּבֵית דִּין וּבֵין שֶׁלֹּא בְּבֵית דִּין.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir holds: Infer from it and from it. from a deposit: Just as a deposit, takes the oath on his own liable, so too testimony, takes the oath on his own liable. And from it: Just as a deposit whether in court or not in court, so too testimony, whether in court or not in court.
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir holds: Evaluate each one separately; just as evaluation – if it is sworn from his own mouth he is liable, so too testimony – if it is sworn from his own mouth he is liable. And evaluation, just as it is whether in court or not in court, so too testimony – whether in court or not in court.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: דּוּן מִינַּהּ וְאוֹקֵי בְּאַתְרַהּ; מָה פִּקָּדוֹן – מוּשְׁבָּע מִפִּי עַצְמוֹ חַיָּיב, אַף עֵדוּת – מוּשְׁבָּע מִפִּי עַצְמוֹ חַיָּיב. וְאוֹקֵי בְּאַתְרַהּ: מָה מוּשְׁבָּע מִפִּי אֲחֵרִים – בְּבֵית דִּין אִין, שֶׁלֹּא בְּבֵית דִּין לָא; אַף מוּשְׁבָּע מִפִּי עַצְמוֹ – בְּבֵית דִּין אִין, שֶׁלֹּא בְּבֵית דִּין לָא.
human_translation: And the Rabbis hold: Infer from it but interpret to its place. Just as a deposit, takes the oath on his own liable, so too testimony, who takes the oath on his own liable. But interpret to its place Just as one who was administered an oath by others, in court, yes, not in court, no, so too, one who took the oath on his own, in court, yes, not in court, no,
llm_translation: The sages hold: one who judges her and uproots in her; what is the law of a deposit - if he swore from his own mouth he is liable, so too testimony - if he swore from his own mouth he is liable. And uproots in her: what is sworn from the mouth of others - in a court is not, but not in a court is. So too sworn from his own mouth - in a court is not, but not in a court is.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב פָּפָּא: אִי מִפִּקָּדוֹן גָּמְרִי לַהּ רַבָּנַן, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּדוּן מִינַּהּ וּמִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to If the Rabbis derive from a deposit, everyone agrees: Infer from it and from it,
llm_translation: He said to them, Rav Papa: If from the time of her betrothal the Rabbis have concluded for her, the entire world does not disagree that each one is judged separately.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דְּרַבָּנַן – דְּמַיְיתוּ לַהּ בְּקַל וָחוֹמֶר: וּמָה מִפִּי אֲחֵרִים חַיָּיב, מִפִּי עַצְמוֹ לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן?!
human_translation: Rather, this is the reason that the Rabbis that They derive it by a fortiori And if by others liable, on his own, not all the more so
llm_translation: Rather, this is the reason of the Sages - they compared it to a light and heavy matter: And if one is liable based on the words of others, how much more so based on his own words?!

hebrew_text: וּמִדְּמַיְיתוּ לַהּ מִקַּל וָחוֹמֶר – דַּיּוֹ לַבָּא מִן הַדִּין לִהְיוֹת כַּנִּדּוֹן: מָה מוּשְׁבָּע מִפִּי אֲחֵרִים – בְּבֵית דִּין אִין, שֶׁלֹּא בְּבֵית דִּין לָא; אַף מוּשְׁבָּע מִפִּי עַצְמוֹ – בִּפְנֵי בֵּית דִּין אִין, שֶׁלֹּא בִּפְנֵי בֵּית דִּין לָא.
human_translation: And from that they derived by an a fortiori It is sufficient for the emerges from inference to be like source. just as one who is administered an oath by others, in court, yes, not in court, no, so too, one who took the oath on his own, before a court, yes, not before a court, no,
llm_translation: And from her admission of a kal vachomer - it is sufficient for the ba to be like a nidon: Just as one who swears by the words of others - in a court he is not, but outside of a court he is; so too, one who swears by his own words - in front of a court he is not, but outside of a court he is.

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן לְרַב פָּפָּא: מִי מָצֵית אָמְרַתְּ דְּלָאו בְּדוּן מִינַּהּ וּמִינַּהּ פְּלִיגִי?! וְהָתְנַן גַּבֵּי פִּקָּדוֹן: שְׁבוּעַת הַפִּקָּדוֹן נוֹהֶגֶת בַּאֲנָשִׁים וּבְנָשִׁים, בִּרְחוֹקִין וּבִקְרוֹבִין, בִּכְשֵׁרִין וּבִפְסוּלִין, בִּפְנֵי בֵּית דִּין וְשֶׁלֹּא בִּפְנֵי בֵּית דִּין – מִפִּי עַצְמוֹ; וּמִפִּי אֲחֵרִים אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב עַד שֶׁיִּכְפּוֹר בּוֹ בְּבֵית דִּין. דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: בֵּין מִפִּי עַצְמוֹ וּבֵין מִפִּי אֲחֵרִים – כֵּיוָן שֶׁכָּפַר בּוֹ חַיָּיב.
