human_translation: The Rabbis said to Rav Pappa: How can you say it is not with regard to Infer from it and from it, they disagree? But didn’t we learn with regard to a deposit: The oath on a deposit is practiced with regard to men and with regard to women, with regard to non-relatives and with regard to relatives, with regard to fit and with regard to unfit in the presence of court and not in the presence of court, on his own. And by others, he is not liable until he denies in court. the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: Whether on his own or whether by others, once he denied liable.
llm_translation: The sages said to Rav Papa: Who found you saying that they do not judge each one separately and they disagree?! And we learned in regards to a deposit: The oath of the depositor is administered to men and women, to those far and near, to those who are fit and those who are unfit, whether in front of a court or not in front of a court – from his own mouth; but from the mouth of others, he is not liable until they compel him in court. These are the words of Rabbi Meir. And the sages say: Whether from his own mouth or from the mouth of others – once he is compelled by it, he is liable.

hebrew_text: מוּשְׁבָּע מִפִּי אֲחֵרִים בְּפִקָּדוֹן מְנָא לְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן דְּחַיָּיב? לָאו דְּגָמְרִי לַהּ מֵעֵדוּת – וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ בְּדוּן מִינַּהּ וּמִינַּהּ פְּלִיגִי?
human_translation: From where the Rabbis that one who is administered an oath on a deposit by others liable, Is it not that they derive it from testimony? And conclude from it with regard to Infer from it and from it, they disagree?
llm_translation: Swearing from the mouth of others in a deposit, how do the Rabbis establish liability? Is it not that they do not learn from its testimony - and infer from it in one case and in another case they differentiate?

hebrew_text: מֵהַהִיא – אִין; מֵהָא – לֵיכָּא לְמִשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: From that yes, no to be learned from this
llm_translation: From there - no; from here - it is not necessary to infer from it.

hebrew_text: וְחַיָּיבִין עַל זְדוֹן הַשְּׁבוּעָה. מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: בְּכוּלָּן נֶאֱמַר בָּהֶן ״וְנֶעְלַם״, וְכָאן לֹא נֶאֱמַר בָּהּ ״וְנֶעְלַם״; לְחַיֵּיב עַל הַמֵּזִיד כַּשּׁוֹגֵג.
human_translation: And one is liable for oath with intent. From where is this matter as the Sages taught: In all of it is stated: “And it is hidden”; but here, is not stated: And it is hidden, to render liable intentionally as unwittingly.
llm_translation: "And they are liable for intentional violation of an oath. What are the circumstances? For the Rabbis taught: In all of them it is stated 'and it was concealed,' and here it is not stated 'and it was concealed'; to obligate for intentional like unintentional."

hebrew_text: וְעַל שִׁגְגָתָהּ עִם זְדוֹן הָעֵדוּת. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי שִׁגְגָתָהּ עִם זְדוֹן הָעֵדוּת? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: בְּאוֹמֵר ״יוֹדֵעַ אֲנִי שֶׁשְּׁבוּעָה זוֹ אֲסוּרָה, אֲבָל אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ אִם חַיָּיבִין עָלֶיהָ קׇרְבָּן אִם לֹא״.
human_translation: And for an unwitting with intent the testimony. What are the circumstances an unwitting with intent the testimony? Rav Yehuda says Rav says in one who says: I know that this oath prohibited, but I do not know whether or not one is liable an offering for
llm_translation: And for her unintentional transgression with deliberate testimony. How are the consequences of her unintentional transgression with deliberate testimony? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: By saying, "I know that this oath is forbidden, but I do not know if one is liable to bring a sacrifice for it or not."

hebrew_text: וְאֵין חַיָּיבִין עַל שִׁגְגָתָהּ גְּרֵידְתָּא. לֵימָא תְּנֵינָא לִדְרַב כָּהֲנָא וּדְרַב אַסִּי?
human_translation: But they are not liable for unwitting alone. Shall we say we learn that which of Rav Kahana and Rav Asi?
llm_translation: And not liable on its unintentional act a blade. Let us say we learned for Rav Kahana and Rav Assi?

hebrew_text: לָא; אַף עַל גַּב דִּתְנַן, אִיצְטְרִיךְ; סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: הָכָא הוּא דְּלָא כְּתִיב ״וְנֶעְלַם״ דְּבָעֵינַן שׁוֹגֵג דּוּמְיָא דְּמֵזִיד; אֲבָל הָתָם דִּכְתִיב ״וְנֶעְלַם״, אֲפִילּוּ שִׁגְגָתָהּ כֹּל דְּהוּ; קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: No, even though we learned was necessary. enter your mind to say: It is here, as: And it is hidden, is not written that we require unwitting similar to an intentional But there, where it is written: “And it is hidden,” even entirely unwitting, teaches us
llm_translation: Not; even though we learned, it is necessary; the conclusion of your mind I say: here is where it is not written "and it was hidden" which we require an unintentional act similar to an intentional act; but there, where it is written "and it was hidden," even if it was entirely unintentional; it is evident to us.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ שְׁבוּעַת הָעֵדוּת כֵּיצַד? אָמַר לִשְׁנַיִם: ״בּוֹאוּ וְהַעִידוּנִי״; ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁאֵין אָנוּ יוֹדְעִין לְךָ עֵדוּת״, אוֹ שֶׁאָמְרוּ לוֹ ״אֵין אָנוּ יוֹדְעִין לְךָ עֵדוּת״; ״מַשְׁבִּיעַ אֲנִי עֲלֵיכֶם״, וְאָמְרוּ: ״אָמֵן״ – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ חַיָּיבִין.
human_translation: oath of testimony, how so? said to two Come and testify my oath we do not know any testimony on your or they said to him: We do not know testimony on your I administer an oath to you, and they said: Amen; these are liable.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "A Shvu'at Ha'edut (oath of testimony), how so? He said to two witnesses: 'Come and testify for me.' 'An oath that we do not know your testimony,' or if they said to him, 'We do not know your testimony.' 'I adjure you,' and they said, 'Amen' - behold, these are liable."

hebrew_text: הִשְׁבִּיעַ עֲלֵיהֶם חָמֵשׁ פְּעָמִים חוּץ לְבֵית דִּין, וּבָאוּ לְבֵית דִּין וְהוֹדוּ – פְּטוּרִין. כָּפְרוּ – חַיָּיבִין עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת. הִשְׁבִּיעַ עֲלֵיהֶן חָמֵשׁ פְּעָמִים בִּפְנֵי בֵּית דִּין וְכָפְרוּ – אֵינָן חַיָּיבִין אֶלָּא אַחַת. אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: מָה טַעַם? הוֹאִיל וְאֵינָם יְכוֹלִין לַחְזוֹר וּלְהוֹדוֹת.
human_translation: he administered an oath to them five times outside the court, and they came to court and admitted exempt. they denied liable for each and every one he administered an oath to them five times before the court, and they denied they are liable only one Rabbi Shimon said: What is the reason Since they can no retract and admit
llm_translation: They were adjured five times outside the court, and they came to the court and admitted - they are exempt. If they denied - they are liable for each one. They were adjured five times in front of the court and they denied - they are only liable for one. Rabbi Shimon said: What is the reason? Since they are unable to retract and admit.

hebrew_text: כָּפְרוּ שְׁנֵיהֶן כְּאֶחָד – שְׁנֵיהֶן חַיָּיבִין. בְּזֶה אַחַר זֶה – הָרִאשׁוֹן חַיָּיב וְהַשֵּׁנִי פָּטוּר. כָּפַר אֶחָד וְהוֹדָה אֶחָד – הַכּוֹפֵר חַיָּיב.
human_translation: both of denied together, both of them are liable. one after the other, the first liable, and the second exempt, one denied and one admitted the one who denies liable.
llm_translation: They both atoned as one - both are obligated. One after the other - the first is obligated and the second is exempt. One atoned and one confessed - the atoner is obligated.

hebrew_text: הָיוּ שְׁתֵּי כִּיתֵּי עֵדִים, כָּפְרָה הָרִאשׁוֹנָה וְאַחַר כָּךְ כָּפְרָה הַשְּׁנִיָּה – שְׁתֵּיהֶן חַיָּיבוֹת, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהָעֵדוּת יְכוֹלָה לְהִתְקַיֵּים בִּשְׁתֵּיהֶן.
human_translation: there were two sets of witnesses the first denied and then the second denied both of are liable, because the testimony can exist with either of them,
llm_translation: There were two groups of witnesses, the first group retracted, and then the second group retracted - both are liable, because the testimony can be upheld by both.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: רָאוּהוּ שֶׁרָץ אַחֲרֵיהֶן, אָמְרוּ לוֹ: ״מָה אַתָּה רָץ אַחֲרֵינוּ? שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁאֵין אָנוּ יוֹדְעִין לָךְ עֵדוּת״ – פְּטוּרִין, עַד שֶׁיִּשְׁמְעוּ מִפִּיו. מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? תְּנֵינָא: שִׁילַּח בְּיַד עַבְדּוֹ, אוֹ שֶׁאָמַר לָהֶן הַנִּתְבָּע: ״מַשְׁבִּיעַ אֲנִי עֲלֵיכֶם, שֶׁאִם אַתֶּם יוֹדְעִין לוֹ עֵדוּת – שֶׁתָּבוֹאוּ וּתְעִידוּהוּ״ – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ פְּטוּרִים,
human_translation: Shmuel says: saw pursuing them, they said to him: what are you pursuing us? oath we do not know testimony on your exempt, until they will hear from his mouth. What is teaching us? We learn sent with his servant, or the respondent said to I administer an oath to you that if you know testimony on behalf of you will come and testify on his behalf, they are exempt,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara said Shmuel: they saw a creeping creature after them, they said to him: "why are you running after us? An oath that we do not know your testimony" - they are exempt, until they hear from his mouth. What is he implying to us? We learned: he sent with his servant, or he said to them the plaintiff: "I adjure you, that if you know his testimony - that you come and testify" - these are exempt.

hebrew_text: עַד שֶׁיִּשְׁמְעוּ מִפִּי הַתּוֹבֵעַ!
human_translation: until they hear from the mouth of the plaintiff.
llm_translation: Until they hear from the mouth of the claimant!

hebrew_text: רָץ אַחֲרֵיהֶן אִיצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ; סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: כֵּיוָן דְּרָץ אַחֲרֵיהֶן – כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר לְהוּ דָּמֵי; קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: pursuing them was necessary for enter your mind to say: Since is pursuing them, like one who says to them teaches us
llm_translation: He ran after them; he needed it. Your mind has changed, I say: since he ran after them - it is as if he said to them; he is informing us.

hebrew_text: וְהָא נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: שְׁבוּעַת הָעֵדוּת כֵּיצַד? אָמַר לְעֵדִים ״בּוֹאוּ וְהַעִידוּנִי״, ״שְׁבוּעָה״ כּוּ׳ – אָמַר אִין, לָא אָמַר לָא!
human_translation: But this too, we learn oath of testimony, how so? said to witnesses: Come and testify my oath, etc., said yes, did not say no,
llm_translation: And here is what we learned: The oath of testimony, how so? He said to the witnesses, "Come and testify for me," "an oath" - he said, "no," he did not say "no"!

hebrew_text: ״אָמַר״ לָאו דַּוְקָא.
human_translation: said, not specifically
llm_translation: "He said" is not specifically.

hebrew_text: דְּאִי לָא תֵּימָא הָכִי, גַּבֵּי פִּקָּדוֹן דְּקָתָנֵי: שְׁבוּעַת הַפִּקָּדוֹן כֵּיצַד? אָמַר לוֹ: ״תֵּן לִי פִּקָּדוֹן שֶׁיֵּשׁ לִי בְּיָדְךָ״ ; הָכָא נָמֵי – אָמַר אִין, לָא אָמַר לָא?! הָא ״וְכִחֶשׁ בַּעֲמִיתוֹ״ כֹּל דְּהוּ!
human_translation: As, if you do not say so which teaches with regard to a deposit: oath on a deposit, how so? said to Give me deposit that belongs to me in your possession, also, said yes, did not say no, But “And deals falsely with his colleague at all,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If you do not say so, regarding the matter of a deposit as it is taught: How is the oath of the deposit taken? He said to him: "Give me the deposit that I have in your possession." Here it is stated - he said, did he not say no?! But "and he denies his fellow" - all is the same!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא ״אָמַר״ לָאו דַּוְקָא; הָכָא נָמֵי לָאו דַּוְקָא.
human_translation: Rather, said not specifically Here too, not specifically
llm_translation: Rather, "he said" is not specifically; here too, it is not specifically.

hebrew_text: הַאי מַאי? אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא ״אָמַר״ דְּהָכָא דַּוְקָא – תְּנָא הָתָם אַטּוּ הָכָא. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ לָא ״אָמַר״ דְּהָתָם דַּוְקָא וְלָא ״אָמַר״ דְּהָכָא דַּוְקָא – ״אָמַר״ ״אָמַר״ לְמָה לִי לְמִיתְנְיַיהּ?
human_translation: What is this Granted, if you say that here, said specifically taught there, due to here But if you say neither there specifically said, nor here specifically said, why do I to teach: Said, said,
llm_translation: This what? If you say, "said," specifically here - a Tanna taught there, they also taught here. Rather, if you say, not "said" specifically there and not "said" specifically here - "said," "said," why do I need to teach it?

hebrew_text: דִּלְמָא אוֹרְחָא דְּמִילְּתָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Perhaps is teaching us the matter the manner in which
llm_translation: Perhaps the way of the matter is being heard by us.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּוָותֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל: רָאוּהוּ שֶׁבָּא אַחֲרֵיהֶן, אָמְרוּ לוֹ: ״מָה אַתָּה בָּא אַחֲרֵינוּ? שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁאֵין אָנוּ יוֹדְעִין לָךְ עֵדוּת״ – פְּטוּרִין. וְאִם בְּפִקָּדוֹן – חַיָּיבִים.
human_translation: it is taught in accordance with of Shmuel: saw that was pursuing them, they said to him: what are you pursuing us; oath we do not know testimony on your they are exempt. And if with regard to a deposit, are liable,
llm_translation: It was taught in accordance with the opinion of Shmuel: If he saw them coming after him, they said to him, "Why are you coming after us? Take an oath that we do not know your testimony" - they are exempt. But if it is regarding a deposit - they are liable.

hebrew_text: הִשְׁבִּיעַ עֲלֵיהֶן חֲמִשָּׁה פְּעָמִים כּוּ׳.
human_translation: he administered an oath to them five times
llm_translation: He swore to them five times.

hebrew_text: מְנָלַן דְּאַכְּפִירָה בְּבֵית דִּין הוּא דִּמְחַיְּיבִי, אַחוּץ לְבֵית דִּין לָא מִחַיְּיבִי?
human_translation: From where do we that it is for denial in court that they are liable, they are not liable for outside court?
llm_translation: From where do we derive that when one denies in court, he is liable, but outside of court he is not liable?

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, אָמַר קְרָא: ״אִם לוֹא יַגִּיד וְנָשָׂא עֲוֹנוֹ״ – לֹא אָמַרְתִּי לְךָ אֶלָּא בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁאִילּוּ מַגִּיד זֶה, מִתְחַיֵּיב זֶה מָמוֹן.
human_translation: Abaye said: the verse states “If he does not utter it, he shall bear his iniquity” I said to you only in a place where, were this to utter that becomes liable a monetary
llm_translation: Abaye said, the verse says: "If he does not tell, then he shall bear his iniquity" - I only said to you in a place where if this one tells, this one incurs a financial liability.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי: אִי הָכִי, אֵימָא שְׁבוּעָה גּוּפַאּ – בְּבֵית דִּין אֵין, וְשֶׁלֹּא בְּבֵית דִּין לָא!
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Abaye: If so, say the oath itself; in court, yes, and that not in court, no,
llm_translation: Rav Papa said to Abbaye: If so, say it is the actual oath - in a court it is not, and outside of a court it is not!

hebrew_text: לָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ, דְּתַנְיָא: ״לְאַחַת״ – לְחַיֵּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ בְּבֵית דִּין, מִי מְחַיֵּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת?! וְהָתְנַן: הִשְׁבִּיעַ עֲלֵיהֶן חֲמִשָּׁה פְּעָמִים בִּפְנֵי בֵּית דִּין וְכָפְרוּ – אֵין חַיָּיבִין אֶלָּא אַחַת. אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: מָה טַעַם? הוֹאִיל וְאֵינָם יְכוֹלִין לַחְזוֹר וּלְהוֹדוֹת. אֶלָּא לָאו שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: שְׁבוּעָה – חוּץ לְבֵית דִּין, כְּפִירָה – בְּבֵית דִּין?
human_translation: not enter your mind, as it is taught of any one to render liable for each and every And if it enters your mind in court, is one liable for each and every But didn’t we learn he administered an oath to them five times before the court, and they denied they are liable only one Rabbi Shimon said: What is the reason Since they can no retract and admit Rather, not conclude from it oath outside court; denial in court?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Lā sālqā daʿtāḵ, dətan'yā: 'lə'aḥaṯ' – ləḥayyēḇ ʿal kol aḥaṯ vəaḥaṯ. Və'i sālqā daʿtāḵ bəvēiṯ dīn, mi məḥayyēḇ ʿal kol aḥaṯ vəaḥaṯ?! Vəhatənan: hišbiʿa ʿalēhēn ḥamiššāh pəʿāmīm bifnēi bēiṯ dīn vəḵāfərū – ʾēn ḥayyāḇīn ʾellā ʾaḥaṯ. ʾāmar rabbī šimʿōn: mā ṭaʿam? hōʾīl vəʾēnām yəḵōlīn laḥzōr ūləhōḏōṯ. ʾellā lāʾū šəmaʿ minnah: šəbūʿāh – ḥūṣ ləvēiṯ dīn, kəfīrāh – bəvēiṯ dīn?" English translation: "It did not enter your mind, as it was taught: 'to one' – to obligate for each and every one. And if it entered your mind in the court, who would obligate for each and every one?! And we learned: if they were adjured five times before the court and they confessed – they are only liable once. Rabbi Shimon said: What is the reason? Since they are unable to retract and confess again. Rather, is it not derived from it: an oath – outside the court, atonement – in the court?"

hebrew_text: כָּפְרוּ שְׁנֵיהֶן כְּאַחַת – חַיָּיבִין. הָא אִי אֶפְשָׁר לְצַמְצֵם?
human_translation: both of denied together, are liable. But impossible to coincide precisely?
llm_translation: They both atoned together - liable. But is it impossible to narrow down?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: הָא מַנִּי – רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי הִיא, דְּאָמַר אֶפְשָׁר לְצַמְצֵם.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: whose is this It is Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, who says: possible to coincide precisely.
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: This is a teaching of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, as he said, "It is possible to contract."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבָּנַן, כְּגוֹן שֶׁכָּפְרוּ שְׁנֵיהֶן בְּתוֹךְ כְּדֵי דִיבּוּר – וְתוֹךְ כְּדֵי דִיבּוּר כְּדִיבּוּר דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Even you say the Rabbis where both of them denied within for speaking and within for speaking is like speech.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Even if you were to say they are scholars, for example, if they both simultaneously at the same time denied the accusation – and simultaneously at the same time is considered as if they denied.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא מִדִּיפְתִּי לְרָבִינָא: מִכְּדִי תּוֹךְ כְּדֵי דִיבּוּר כַּמָּה הָוֵי – כְּדֵי שְׁאֵילַת תַּלְמִיד לָרַב, אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: כְּדֵי שְׁאֵילַת הָרַב לַתַּלְמִיד; עַד דְּאָמְרִי ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁאֵין אָנוּ יוֹדְעִין לָךְ עֵדוּת״, טוּבָא הָוֵי! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד תּוֹךְ דִּיבּוּרוֹ שֶׁל חֲבֵירוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa of Difti said to Ravina: After all, how long is Within for speaking equivalent to the greeting of a student to teacher: Some say equivalent to the greeting of a teacher to student: until say: oath we do not know testimony for you, it is greater said to each and every within for speaking, of the other.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Acha, from Difti to Ravina: From the time it takes to speak, how long is it? - The time it takes for a student to ask the teacher. Some say: The time it takes for the teacher to ask the student. Until they say, "We do not know your testimony," it is good! He said to him: Each and every one within the speech of his fellow.

hebrew_text: בְּזֶה אַחַר זֶה – הָרִאשׁוֹן חַיָּיב וְהַשֵּׁנִי פָּטוּר. מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כִּי הַאי תַּנָּא – דְּתַנְיָא: מַשְׁבִּיעַ עֵד אֶחָד – פָּטוּר, וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מְחַיֵּיב.
human_translation: one after the other, the first liable, and the second exempt, The mishna is not in accordance with this tanna , as it is taught one who administers an oath to one witness, exempt and Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, deems liable
llm_translation: In this case, one after the other - the first is liable and the second is exempt. The Mishnah teaches: This is not as that Tanna, for it was taught in a Baraita: If one swears one witness - he is exempt, and Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon obligates.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי – דְּמָר סָבַר: עֵד אֶחָד כִּי אָתֵא – לִשְׁבוּעָה הוּא דְּקָא אָתֵא; וּמָר סָבַר: עֵד אֶחָד כִּי אֲתָא – לְמָמוֹנָא קָא אָתֵא?
human_translation: Let us say they disagree about this: Sage, holds: When one witness comes it is to an oath, that he is coming, And Sage, holds: When one witness comes it is to a monetary he is coming.
llm_translation: Let us say in this case he disagrees - for Mar holds: when one witness comes - it is for an oath that he comes; and Mar holds: when one witness comes - is he coming for monetary matters?

hebrew_text: וְתִיסְבְּרָא?! הָאָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הַכֹּל מוֹדִים בְּעֵד סוֹטָה, וְהַכֹּל מוֹדִים בְּעֵדֵי סוֹטָה, וּמַחְלוֹקֶת בְּעֵדֵי סוֹטָה; הַכֹּל מוֹדִים בְּעֵד אֶחָד, וְהַכֹּל מוֹדִים בְּעֵד שֶׁכְּנֶגְדּוֹ חָשׁוּד עַל הַשְּׁבוּעָה.
human_translation: And you understand Doesn’t Abaye say: All with regard to a witness of a sota and all concede with regard to witnesses of a sota ; and a dispute with regard to witnesses of a sota . All concede with regard to one witness and all concede with regard to a witness when his counterpart, is suspect about the oath.
llm_translation: And should it be reasoned?! Did Abaye say: Everyone agrees regarding the testimony of a Sotah, and everyone agrees regarding the witnesses of a Sotah, and the dispute is regarding the witnesses of a Sotah; everyone agrees regarding one witness, and everyone agrees regarding a witness who is suspected of violating the oath.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא עֵד אֶחָד כִּי אָתֵי – לִשְׁבוּעָה קָא אָתֵי; וְהָכָא בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי: מָר סָבַר דָּבָר הַגּוֹרֵם לְמָמוֹן – כְּמָמוֹן דָּמֵי, וּמָר סָבַר לָאו כְּמָמוֹן דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Rather, all concede when one witness comes to an oath, he is coming. And here they disagree about this: Sage, holds: A matter that causes financial is considered monetary And Sage, holds: is not considered monetary
llm_translation: Rather, in all the world, there is one witness when it comes - he is coming to swear; and here, in this case, they disagree: one Master holds that a matter causing monetary loss is like actual monetary loss, and the other Master holds that it is not like actual monetary loss.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא – אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הַכֹּל מוֹדִים בְּעֵד סוֹטָה, וְהַכֹּל מוֹדִים בְּעֵדֵי סוֹטָה, וּמַחְלוֹקֶת בְּעֵדֵי סוֹטָה; הַכֹּל מוֹדִים בְּעֵד אֶחָד, וְהַכֹּל מוֹדִים בְּעֵד שֶׁכְּנֶגְדּוֹ חָשׁוּד עַל הַשְּׁבוּעָה.
human_translation: the itself, Abaye says: All concede with regard to a witness of a sota and all concede with regard to witnesses of a sota ; and a dispute with regard to witnesses of a sota . All concede with regard to one witness, and all concede with regard to a witness when his counterpart is suspect about the oath.
llm_translation: Body - Abaye said: Everyone agrees regarding the testimony of a sotah, and everyone agrees regarding the witnesses of a sotah, and there is a dispute regarding the witnesses of a sotah; everyone agrees regarding one witness, and everyone agrees regarding a witness who is suspected of violating the oath.

hebrew_text: הַכֹּל מוֹדִים בְּעֵד סוֹטָה – שֶׁחַיָּיב, בְּעֵד טוּמְאָה; דְּרַחֲמָנָא הֵימְנֵיהּ, דִּכְתִיב ״וְעֵד אֵין בָּהּ״ – כֹּל שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ.
human_translation: All concede with regard to a witness of a sota that liable in a witness of impurity. as the Merciful One accorded credibility to as it is written “And there is no witness against her” any that there is against her
llm_translation: All agree regarding the testimony of a suspected adulteress - that he is liable, regarding the testimony of impurity; for the Merciful One trusted it, as it is written "and there is no witness against her" - anyone who has something in it.

hebrew_text: וְהַכֹּל מוֹדִים בְּעֵדֵי סוֹטָה – שֶׁפָּטוּר, בְּעֵדֵי קִינּוּי; דְּהָוֵה גּוֹרֵם דְּגוֹרֵם.
human_translation: And all concede with regard to witnesses of a sota that exempt to witnesses of warning, as is cause of a cause
llm_translation: "And all agree regarding witnesses in the case of a Sotah - that he is exempt, in the case of Kinuy witnesses; for he causes that which causes."

hebrew_text: וּמַחְלוֹקֶת בְּעֵדֵי סוֹטָה – בְּעֵדֵי סְתִירָה; מָר סָבַר: דָּבָר הַגּוֹרֵם לְמָמוֹן כְּמָמוֹן דָּמֵי – וְחַיָּיב, וּמָר סָבַר: לָאו כְּמָמוֹן דָּמֵי – וּפָטוּר.
human_translation: And a dispute with regard to witnesses of a sota ; to witnesses of seclusion Sage, holds a matter that causes financial is considered monetary and liable And Sage, hold is not considered monetary and he is exempt.
llm_translation: Dispute in the case of a suspected adulteress - in the case of contradiction; Master holds: a matter that causes monetary loss like actual monetary loss - and liable, and Master holds: not like actual monetary loss - and exempt.

hebrew_text: הַכֹּל מוֹדִים בְּשֶׁכְּנֶגְדּוֹ חָשׁוּד עַל הַשְּׁבוּעָה, הַכֹּל מוֹדִים בְּעֵד אֶחָד דְּרַבִּי אַבָּא.
human_translation: All concede with regard to when his counterpart is suspect about the oath. All concede in one witness, with Rabbi Abba.
llm_translation: All agree that when there is a contradiction against him regarding the oath, all agree with one witness, Rabbi Abba.

hebrew_text: הַכֹּל מוֹדִים בְּשֶׁכְּנֶגְדּוֹ חָשׁוּד עַל הַשְּׁבוּעָה – דַּחֲשִׁיד מַאן? אִילֵימָא דַּחֲשִׁיד לֹוֶה, דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ מַלְוֶה: אִי אֲתֵית אַסְהֵדְתְּ לִי, הֲוָה מִשְׁתְּבַעְנָא וְשָׁקֵילְנָא; וְלֵימָא לֵיהּ: מִי יֵימַר דְּמִשְׁתְּבַעְתְּ?
human_translation: All concede with regard to when his counterpart is suspect about the oath. where who is suspect? If we say that the borrower is suspect, where the lender says to If you came testified on my I would have taken an oath and taken Let say to Who say that you taken an oath?
llm_translation: All agree that when there is a claim against him regarding the oath - who is the one suspected? If you say the borrower is suspected, for he said to him, "If you bring witnesses to me, I will admit and pay," and he said to him, "Who can say that you admitted?"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא כְּגוֹן שֶׁשְּׁנֵיהֶן חֲשׁוּדֵין, דְּאָמַר מָר: חָזְרָה שְׁבוּעָה לַמְחוּיָּב לָהּ, וּמִתּוֹךְ שֶׁאֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לִישָּׁבַע – מְשַׁלֵּם.
human_translation: Rather, where both are suspect, as the Master says: oath reverts to the one who is obligated to take it, and since he is unable to take the oath he pays
llm_translation: Rather, for example, when both of them are suspected, as Mar said: If a week has passed and the obligated party cannot swear, he must pay.

hebrew_text: הַכֹּל מוֹדִים בְּעֵד אֶחָד דְּרַבִּי אַבָּא – דְּהָהוּא גַּבְרָא דַּחֲטַף נְסָכָא מֵחַבְרֵיהּ. אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַמֵּי, הֲוָה יָתֵיב רַבִּי אַבָּא קַמֵּיהּ; אֲזַל אַיְיתִי חַד סָהֲדָא דְּמִיחְטָף חַטְפַהּ מִינֵּיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״אִין, חֲטַפִי – וְדִידִי חֲטַפִי״.
human_translation: All concede in one witness, with Rabbi Abba. As a certain man who snatched ingot from another. came before Rabbi Ami Rabbi Abba was sitting before him, went brought one witness that snatched it from him. said to him: Yes, I snatched but I snatched mine.
llm_translation: All agree regarding one witness, concerning Rabbi Abba - that certain man who snatched a cup from his colleague. He came before Rabbi Ammi, while Rabbi Abba was sitting before him; he brought a certain witness who saw him snatch it from him. He said to him: "No, you snatched - and I also snatched."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי: הֵיכִי (לִדַיְּינֵי) [לִידַיְּינוּהּ] דַּיָּינֵי לְהַאי דִּינָא? לִישַׁלֵּם – לֵיכָּא תְּרֵי סָהֲדִי! לִיפְטְרֵיהּ – הָא אִיכָּא חַד סָהֲדָא דְּמִחְטָף חֲטַף! לִישְׁתְּבַע – כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר ״אֵין, חֲטַפִי – וְדִידִי חֲטַפִי״, הָוֵה לֵיהּ כְּגַזְלָן! אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי אַבָּא: הָוֵה לֵיהּ מְחוּיָּב שְׁבוּעָה וְאֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לִישָּׁבַע, וְכׇל הַמְחוּיָּב שְׁבוּעָה וְאֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לִישָּׁבַע – מְשַׁלֵּם.
human_translation: Rabbi Ami said: How shall judges rule in this case? Let pay. there are not two witnesses Let exempt him But there is one witness that he snatched let take an oath once he said: Yes, I snatched but I snatched mine, is like a robber, Rabbi Abba said to him: He is obligated an oath but is unable to take an oath, and anyone who is obligated an oath but is unable to take an oath pay.
llm_translation: Rabbi Ammi said: How can the judges judge this case? If they make him pay - there are two witnesses! If they exempt him - there is one witness who snatches and runs! If they make him swear - since he says, "No, I snatched and ran," he becomes like a robber! Rabbi Abba said to him: He is obligated to take an oath and cannot swear, and anyone who is obligated to take an oath and cannot swear - must pay.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: הַכֹּל מוֹדִים בְּעֵד מִיתָה שֶׁהוּא חַיָּיב, וְהַכֹּל מוֹדִים בְּעֵד מִיתָה שֶׁהוּא פָּטוּר.
human_translation: Rav Pappa says: All concede with regard to witness of a death that he is liable and all concede with regard to witness of a death that he is exempt
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Everyone agrees regarding a case of capital punishment that he is liable, and everyone agrees regarding a case of capital punishment that he is exempt.

hebrew_text: הַכֹּל מוֹדִים בְּעֵד מִיתָה שֶׁהוּא פָּטוּר – דַּאֲמַר לַהּ לְדִידַהּ וְלָא אֲמַר לְהוּ לְבֵית דִּין, דִּתְנַן: הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁאָמְרָה ״מֵת בַּעְלִי״ – תִּנָּשֵׂא, ״מֵת בַּעְלִי״ – תִּתְיַבֵּם.
human_translation: All concede with regard to witness of a death that he is exempt where he said to herself but he did not tell to the court, as we learned The woman who said: My husband died, shall remarry My husband died, she shall enter into levirate marriage
llm_translation: All agree regarding testimony of death that one is exempt - for he said to her privately and did not say to them publicly, as we learned: "A woman who said 'my husband is dead' - she may marry, 'my husband is dead' - she may be betrothed."

hebrew_text: הַכֹּל מוֹדִים בְּעֵד מִיתָה שֶׁהוּא חַיָּיב – דְּלָא אָמַר לְדִידַהּ וְלָא אֲמַר לְהוּ לְבֵית דִּין.
human_translation: All concede with regard to witness of a death that he is liable where he did not say to herself nor did he say to the court.
llm_translation: All agree regarding a case of capital punishment that he is liable - for he did not say it to me and he did not say it to the court.

hebrew_text: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: מַשְׁבִּיעַ עֵדֵי קַרְקַע חַיָּיב? דִּלְמָא דִּתְפִישָׂא מִטַּלְטְלֵי.
human_translation: conclude from one who administers an oath to witnesses land, liable perhaps where she seizes movable property
llm_translation: Listen to the conclusion: One who swears by the witnesses of the ground is liable? Perhaps it is because it is considered as if he is moving movable property.

hebrew_text: כָּפַר אֶחָד וְהוֹדָה אֶחָד כּוּ׳. הַשְׁתָּא בְּזֶה אַחַר זֶה, דְּתַרְוַיְיהוּ קָא כָפְרִי – אָמְרַתְּ הָרִאשׁוֹן חַיָּיב וְהַשֵּׁנִי פָּטוּר; כָּפַר אֶחָד וְהוֹדָה אֶחָד מִיבַּעְיָא?!
human_translation: one denied and one admitted the one who denies liable. Now both one after the other, you said: The first is liable and the second is exempt, one denied and one admitted is necessary
llm_translation: One atonement and one confession - how so? Here, one after the other, as both are necessary - you say the first is obligated and the second is exempt; one atonement and one confession are needed?!

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא, כְּגוֹן שֶׁכָּפְרוּ שְׁנֵיהֶן, וְחָזַר אֶחָד מֵהֶן וְהוֹדָה בְּתוֹךְ כְּדֵי דִיבּוּר; וְהָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן – דְּתוֹךְ כְּדֵי דִיבּוּר כְּדִיבּוּר דָּמֵי.
human_translation: No, necessary where both of them denied and one of them retracted and admitted within for speaking And this teaches us that within for speaking is like speech.
llm_translation: Not necessary, such as they both atoned, and one of them returned and confessed within the time of speech; and this is what we infer - that within the time of speech is considered as if it were actual speech.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַב חִסְדָּא, דְּמוֹקֵי לַהּ לְהָהוּא כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי – רֵישָׁא אֶפְשָׁר לְצַמְצֵם, וְסֵיפָא אִיצְטְרִיךְ לְאַשְׁמוֹעִינַן דְּתוֹךְ כְּדֵי דִיבּוּר כְּדִיבּוּר דָּמֵי. אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן – רֵישָׁא תּוֹךְ כְּדֵי דִיבּוּר, סֵיפָא תּוֹךְ כְּדֵי דִיבּוּר! תַּרְתֵּי לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: Granted, according to Rav Ḥisda, who interprets in accordance with Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, the first clause possible to coincide precisely, and the latter clause was necessary to teach us that within for speaking is like speech. But according to Rabbi Yoḥanan, Within for speaking the first clause, Within for speaking the latter clause. Why do I two
llm_translation: In truth, according to Rav Ḥisdah, who equates her to that of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean - the beginning is possible to shorten, and the end is necessary to hear, as it is like continuous speech. But according to Rabbi Yoḥanan - both the beginning and the end are like continuous speech! Why do I need both?

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: הָנֵי מִילֵּי כְּפִירָה וּכְפִירָה, אֲבָל כְּפִירָה וְהוֹדָאָה – אֵימָא לָא; קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Lest you say this statement: a denial and a denial; but a denial and an admission, say no, teaches us
llm_translation: What is the reasoning? These matters are like denial and denial, but denial and admission - say no; it is evident to us.

hebrew_text: הָיוּ שְׁתֵּי כִּיתֵּי עֵדִים, כָּפְרָה הָרִאשׁוֹנָה וְאַחַר כָּךְ כָּפְרָה הַשְּׁנִיָּה. בִּשְׁלָמָא שְׁנִיָּה תִּתְחַיֵּיב – דְּכָפְרָה לַהּ רִאשׁוֹנָה; אֶלָּא רִאשׁוֹנָה אַמַּאי?
human_translation: there were two sets of witnesses the first denied and thereafter, the second denied Granted, second will be held liable, as the first denied But why first
llm_translation: If there were two sets of witnesses, the first set retracted, and then the second set retracted. It is understandable that the second set is liable - for they are retracting from the first set's testimony. But why is the first set liable?

hebrew_text: הָא קָיְימָא שְׁנִיָּה!
human_translation: But second stands
llm_translation: This is the way it stands!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – כְּגוֹן שֶׁהָיְתָה שְׁנִיָּה בִּשְׁעַת כְּפִירַת רִאשׁוֹנָה קְרוֹבִין בִּנְשׁוֹתֵיהֶן, וּנְשׁוֹתֵיהֶן גּוֹסְסוֹת; מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: רוֹב גּוֹסְסִים לְמִיתָה, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: הַשְׁתָּא מִיהָא לָא שְׁכֵיב.
human_translation: Ravina said: What are we dealing with here? where second were relatives through their wives at the time of the denial of the first And wives were moribund. Lest you say majority moribund will die teaches us now in any event, had not died,
llm_translation: Ravina said: Here we are dealing with what? For example, if a woman was second during the first period, her relatives are close to her, and her relatives are mourning; what might you say? Most mourners are destined to die, but now she has not died.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ ״מַשְׁבִּיעַ אֲנִי עֲלֵיכֶם, אִם לֹא תָבוֹאוּ וּתְעִידוּנִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לִי בְּיַד פְּלוֹנִי פִּקָּדוֹן וּתְשׂוּמֶת יָד וְגָזֵל וַאֲבֵידָה״; ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁאֵין אָנוּ יוֹדְעִין לָךְ עֵדוּת״ – אֵין חַיָּיבִין אֶלָּא אַחַת.
human_translation: I administer an oath to you if you do not come and testify on my behalf that I have in the possession of so-and-so a deposit, and loan, and a stolen item, and a lost item, oath we do not know testimony on your behalf, they are liable only one
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "I adjure you, if you do not come and testify to me that I have in my possession a certain person's deposit, and a loan, and a stolen item"; "An oath that we do not know your testimony" - one is only liable for one.

hebrew_text: ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁאֵין אָנוּ יוֹדְעִין שֶׁיֵּשׁ לְךָ בְּיַד פְּלוֹנִי פִּקָּדוֹן וּתְשׂוּמֶת יָד וְגָזֵל וַאֲבֵידָה״ – חַיָּיבִין עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת.
human_translation: oath we do not know that you have in the possession of so-and-so a deposit, and loan, and a stolen item, and a lost item, they are liable for each and every one
llm_translation: "An oath that we do not know that you have in your possession a deposit, a trust, theft, or lost item" - one is liable for each and every one.

hebrew_text: ״מַשְׁבִּיעַ אֲנִי עֲלֵיכֶם, אִם לֹא תָבוֹאוּ וְתָעִידוּ שֶׁיֵּשׁ לִי בְּיַד פְּלוֹנִי פִּקָּדוֹן חִטִּין וּשְׂעוֹרִין וְכוּסְּמִין״; ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁאֵין אָנוּ יוֹדְעִין לְךָ עֵדוּת״ – אֵין חַיָּיבִין אֶלָּא אַחַת.
human_translation: I administer an oath to you if you do not come and testify that I have in the possession of so-and-so a deposit of wheat, and barley, and spelt, oath we do not know testimony on your they are liable only one
llm_translation: "I adjure you, if you do not come and testify that I have in my possession a certain person's deposit of wheat, barley, and sesame"; "An oath that we do not know your testimony" - only one is obligated.

hebrew_text: ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁאֵין אָנוּ יוֹדְעִין לְךָ עֵדוּת שֶׁיֵּשׁ לְךָ בְּיַד פְּלוֹנִי חִטִּין וּשְׂעוֹרִין וְכוּסְּמִין״ – חַיָּיבִין עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת.
human_translation: oath we do not know testimony on your that you have in the possession of so-and-so wheat, and barley, and spelt, they are liable for each and every one
llm_translation: "An oath that we do not know your testimony that you have in your possession, Ploni, wheat, barley, and sesame" - obligated for each and every one.

hebrew_text: ״מַשְׁבִּיעַ אֲנִי עֲלֵיכֶם, אִם לֹא תָבוֹאוּ וּתְעִידוּנִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לִי בְּיַד פְּלוֹנִי נֶזֶק, וַחֲצִי נֶזֶק, תַּשְׁלוּמֵי כֶּפֶל, וְתַשְׁלוּמֵי אַרְבָּעָה וַחֲמִשָּׁה, וְשֶׁאָנַס אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי אֶת בִּתִּי, וּפִתָּה אֶת בִּתִּי, וְשֶׁהִכַּנִי בְּנִי, וְשֶׁחָבַל בִּי חֲבֵירִי, וְשֶׁהִדְלִיק אֶת גְּדִישִׁי בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים״ – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ חַיָּיבִין.
human_translation: I administer an oath to you if you do not come and testify on my behalf that I have in the possession of so-and-so damage; or half the damage, or payment of double or payment of four or five or that so-and-so raped my daughter; or, he seduced my daughter; or, that my son struck me; or, that another injured me; or, that he set my stack of grain on fire on Yom Kippur; these are liable
llm_translation: "I adjure you, if you do not come and testify for me that I have in my possession a certain person's damage, and half damage, double payments, and four or fivefold payments, and if a man raped my daughter, or seduced my daughter, or caused my son to marry, or injured me, or set my sheaf on fire on Yom Kippur" - behold, these are liable.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: מַשְׁבִּיעַ עֵדֵי קְנָס, מַהוּ?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before one administers an oath to witnesses concerning a fine what is
llm_translation: Gemara: He asked them: "If one swears witnesses for a penalty, what is the law?"

hebrew_text: אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן – לָא תִּיבְּעֵי לָךְ, דְּאָמַר: יָבוֹאוּ עֵדִים וְיָעִידוּ.
human_translation: According to of Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, do not raise the dilemma, as he says the witnesses shall come and testify
llm_translation: In the school of Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon - it is not necessary for you, as it says: "Let witnesses come forward and testify."

hebrew_text: כִּי תִּיבְּעֵי לָךְ – אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבָּנַן, דְּאָמְרִי: מוֹדֶה בִּקְנָס וְאַחַר כָּךְ בָּאוּ עֵדִים – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: When should you raise the dilemma? according to the Rabbis as they say: admits to a fine is exempt, afterward witnesses came
llm_translation: When you claim - according to the opinion of the Rabbis, who say: one admits to a penalty, and afterwards witnesses come - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן דְּהָתָם, כְּמַאן סְבִירָא לְהוּ? אִילֵּימָא כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן דְּהָכָא, הָא קָאָמַר: דָּבָר הַגּוֹרֵם לְמָמוֹן כְּמָמוֹן דָּמֵי!
human_translation: And the Rabbis, there in accordance with whose do they hold? If we say in accordance with Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, here doesn’t he say: A matter that causes financial is considered monetary
llm_translation: The sages there, according to whom do they hold? If you wish, according to Rabbi Eliezer the son of Rabbi Shimon here, for here it says: "A matter that causes financial loss is like actual financial loss!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא כְּרַבָּנַן דְּהָכָא, דְּאָמְרִי: דָּבָר הַגּוֹרֵם לְמָמוֹן לָאו כְּמָמוֹן דָּמֵי. מַאי? כֵּיוָן דְּאִילּוּ מוֹדֶה מִיפְּטַר – לָאו מָמוֹנָא קָא כָפַר לֵיהּ; אוֹ דִלְמָא, הַשְׁתָּא מִיהָא לָא אוֹדִי?
human_translation: Rather, in accordance with the Rabbis here, who say: A matter that causes financial is not considered monetary What Since if the admits he is exempt is not denying a monetary Or perhaps now, in any event, he has not admitted
llm_translation: Rather like the Rabbanan of this place, who say: A matter that causes a financial loss is not like actual money. What is the reason? Since if one admits, he is exempt - he is not atoning with money; or perhaps, is it not the case that now he does not admit?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״מַשְׁבִּיעַ אֲנִי עֲלֵיכֶם, אִם לֹא תָבוֹאוּ וּתְעִידוּנִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לִי בְּיַד פְּלוֹנִי נֶזֶק וַחֲצִי נֶזֶק״. וְהָא חֲצִי נֶזֶק קְנָסָא הוּא! כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר פַּלְגָא נִזְקָא מָמוֹנָא.
human_translation: Come hear I administer an oath to you if you do not come and testify on my behalf that I have in the possession of so-and-so damage; and half the damage. But isn’t half the damage a fine? in accordance with the one who says half the damage is monetary restitution
llm_translation: "Come and hear: 'I adjure you, if you do not come and testify to me that I have in my possession a certain person's damage and half-damage.' But isn't half-damage a penalty? Like the one who says, 'Half of the damage is monetary.'"

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר פַּלְגָא נִזְקָא מָמוֹנָא; אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר קְנָסָא, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? בַּחֲצִי נֶזֶק צְרוֹרוֹת, דְּהִלְכְתָא גְּמִירִי לַהּ דְּמָמוֹנָא הוּא.
human_translation: This works out well according to the one who says half the damage is monetary restitution. But according to the one who says a fine, what can be said? with regard to half the damage pebbles as they learned this halakha through tradition that is monetary restitution,
llm_translation: He left it for the one who says "half damages are monetary liability"; rather, for the one who says "penalty," what can be said? In the case of half-damages of bundles, for it is a known law that it is monetary liability.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״תַּשְׁלוּמֵי כֶפֶל״! מִשּׁוּם קַרְנָא.
human_translation: Come hear payment of double due to the principal,
llm_translation: Come and hear: "Payment of double"! Because of a horn.

hebrew_text: ״וְתַשְׁלוּמֵי אַרְבָּעָה וַחֲמִשָּׁה״! מִשּׁוּם קַרְנָא.
human_translation: payment of four or five due to the principal,
llm_translation: "And the payment of four and five!" on account of a horn.

hebrew_text: ״שֶׁאָנַס אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי וּפִתָּה אֶת בִּתִּי״! מִשּׁוּם בּוֹשֶׁת וּפְגָם.
human_translation: that so-and-so raped my daughter; or, he seduced my daughter. due to humiliation and degradation
llm_translation: "‘If a certain man raped my daughter!’ – due to shame and disgrace."

hebrew_text: מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? כּוּלַּהּ מָמוֹנָא הוּא! רֵישָׁא חֲדָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, סֵיפָא חֲדָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן; רֵישָׁא חֲדָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן – דַּחֲצִי נֶזֶק צְרוֹרוֹת מָמוֹנָא הוּא.
human_translation: what is teaching us All monetary restitution. the first clause, teaches us one the latter clause, teaches us one the first clause, teaches us one that half the damage pebbles is monetary restitution,
llm_translation: What is it teaching us? It is all about money! The first part is teaching us one thing, the last part is teaching us one thing; the first part is teaching us – that half of the damage of bundles is money.

hebrew_text: סֵיפָא חֲדָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן – ״וְשֶׁהִדְלִיק אֶת גְּדִישִׁי בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים״. לְאַפּוֹקֵי מַאי? לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרַבִּי נְחוּנְיָא בֶּן הַקָּנָה – דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי נְחוּנְיָא בֶּן הַקָּנָה הָיָה עוֹשֶׂה יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים כַּשַּׁבָּת לְתַשְׁלוּמִין, מָה שַׁבָּת כּוּ׳.
human_translation: the latter clause, teaches us one that he set my stack of grain on fire on Yom Kippur. What to exclude? to exclude of Rabbi Neḥunya ben HaKana, as it is taught Rabbi Neḥunya ben HaKana would deem Yom Kippur like Shabbat with regard to payment Just as Shabbat,
llm_translation: The latter clause teaches us: "And he kindled my heap on Yom Kippur." What is the purpose? To exclude what Rabbi Neḥunia ben HaKana taught: Rabbi Neḥunia ben HaKana used to treat Yom Kippur like Shabbat in terms of restitution, just as Shabbat.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״מַשְׁבִּיעַ אֲנִי עֲלֵיכֶם, אִם לֹא תָבוֹאוּ וּתְעִידוּנִי
human_translation: Come hear I administer an oath to you if you do not come and testify on my
llm_translation: Come and hear: "I adjure you, if you do not come and testify for me."

hebrew_text: שֶׁהוֹצִיא אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי שֵׁם רַע עַל בִּתִּי״ – חַיָּיבִין. הוֹדָה מִפִּי עַצְמוֹ – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: that so-and-so slandered my daughter. liable admitted on his own exempt
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "If a man utters an evil name concerning my daughter" - liable. If he confesses of his own accord - exempt.

hebrew_text: הָא מַנִּי – רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא, דְּאָמַר: יָבוֹאוּ עֵדִים וְיָעִידוּ.
human_translation: whose is this It is Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, who says: the witnesses shall come and testify
llm_translation: The text: "Ha mani - Rabbi Elazar bar Rabbi Shimon hi, de'amar: Yavo'u edim veyaidu." The translation: "This is a dispute - Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: Let witnesses come and testify."

hebrew_text: אֵימָא סֵיפָא: הוֹדָה מֵעַצְמוֹ – פָּטוּר, אֲתָאן לְרַבָּנַן!
human_translation: Say the latter clause admitted on his own exempt we arrive at the Rabbis,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Eima seifa: hodah me'atzmo - patur, atan l'rabbana!" English translation: "Say the latter clause: if one admits of his own accord - he is exempt, we come to the Rabbis!"

hebrew_text: כּוּלָּהּ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא, וְהָכִי קָאָמַר: לָא מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ הוֹדָה מִפִּי עַצְמוֹ דְּפָטוּר, אֶלָּא הֵיכָא דְּלֵיכָּא עֵדִים כְּלָל וְהוֹדָה מֵעַצְמוֹ.
human_translation: its entirety is Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, and this is saying You find admitted on his own that exempt only where there are no witnesses at all and he admitted on his own.
llm_translation: The entire statement is attributed to Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon, and thus he said: "She does not forget to admit the truth from her own mouth that she is exempt, but this applies where there are no witnesses at all, and she admits the truth from her own mouth."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ ״מַשְׁבִּיעַ אֲנִי עֲלֵיכֶם, אִם לֹא תָבוֹאוּ וְתָעִידוּ שֶׁאֲנִי כֹּהֵן, שֶׁאֲנִי לֵוִי, שֶׁאֵינִי בֶּן גְּרוּשָׁה, שֶׁאֵינִי בֶּן חֲלוּצָה, שֶׁאִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי כֹּהֵן, שֶׁאִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי לֵוִי, שֶׁאֵינוֹ בֶּן גְּרוּשָׁה, שֶׁאֵינוֹ בֶּן חֲלוּצָה,
human_translation: I administer an oath to you if you do not come and testify that I am a priest, that I am a Levite, that I am not the son of a divorced woman, that I am not the son of a ḥalutza , that so-and-so is a priest, that so-and-so is a Levite, that he is not the son of a divorced woman, that he is not the son of a ḥalutza ;
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "I adjure you, if you do not come and testify that I am a Kohen, that I am a Levi, that I am not a son of a divorcee, that I am not a son of a halutzah, that so-and-so is a Kohen, that so-and-so is a Levi, that he is not a son of a divorcee, that he is not a son of a halutzah."

hebrew_text: שֶׁאָנַס אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי אֶת בִּתּוֹ, וּפִתָּה אֶת בִּתּוֹ, וְשֶׁחָבַל בִּי בְּנִי, וְשֶׁחָבַל בִּי חֲבֵירִי, שֶׁהִדְלִיק גְּדִישִׁי בְּשַׁבָּת״ – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ פְּטוּרִין.
human_translation: that so-and-so raped his daughter, or he seduced his daughter, or that my son injured me, or that another wounded me that he set my stack of grain on fire on Shabbat; these are exempt,
llm_translation: If a man raped his daughter, and seduced his daughter, and caused damage to my son, and caused damage to my friend, that he kindled my stack on Shabbat - these are exempt.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ טַעְמָא דְּאִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי כֹּהֵן, דְּאִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי לֵוִי; הָא ״מָנֶה לִפְלוֹנִי בְּיַד פְּלוֹנִי״ – חַיָּיבִין; הָא קָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: עַד שֶׁיִּשְׁמְעוּ מִפִּי הַתּוֹבֵעַ!
human_translation: The reason that so-and-so is a priest that so-and-so is a Levite, but one hundred dinars to so-and-so are in the possession of so-and-so, liable. But isn’t it taught the latter clause until they hear from the mouth of the plaintiff,
llm_translation: The taste of a certain man, a Kohen, of a certain man, a Levi; this is what it means "designate for the certain one into the hand of the certain one" – they are obligated; this is what the latter clause teaches: until they hear from the mouth of the claimant!

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: בְּבָא בְּהַרְשָׁאָה. וְהָאָמְרִי נְהַרְדָּעֵי: לָא כָּתְבִינַן אוֹרַכְתָּא אַמִּטַּלְטְלִי! הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּכַפְרֵיהּ, אֲבָל לָא כַּפְרֵיהּ – כָּתְבִינַן.
human_translation: Shmuel says: where comes with authorization But didn’t of Neharde’a say: We do not write an authorization document concerning movable property? This statement where denied But did not deny we write
llm_translation: Samuel said: In the town of Harsha'ah. And the people of Nehardea said: Do not write a document of divorce for a woman who is pregnant! These are the words spoken where he the husband is appeased, but where he is not appeased - write the document.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מִנַּיִן שֶׁאֵין הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר אֶלָּא בִּתְבִיעַת מָמוֹן? רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: נֶאֱמַר כָּאן ״אוֹאִין״, וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן ״אוֹאִין״; מָה לְהַלָּן אֵינוֹ מְדַבֵּר אֶלָּא בִּתְבִיעַת מָמוֹן, אַף כָּאן אֵינוֹ מְדַבֵּר אֶלָּא בִּתְבִיעַת מָמוֹן.
human_translation: The Sages taught: From where that the verse is speaking only about a monetary claim? Rabbi Eliezer says: “or” are stated here, and “or” are stated there, just as there, is speaking only about a monetary claim, so too here, is speaking only about a monetary claim.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: From where do we derive that the Scripture speaks only in matters of monetary claims? Rabbi Eliezer says: It is stated here "o'in," and it is stated there "o'in"; just as there it speaks only in matters of monetary claims, so too here it speaks only in matters of monetary claims.

hebrew_text: ״אוֹאִין״ דְּרוֹצֵחַ יוֹכִיחוּ – שֶׁהֵן ״אוֹאִין״, וּמְדַבְּרִים שֶׁלֹּא בִּתְבִיעַת מָמוֹן!
human_translation: “or” that a murderer: will prove as are “or” that are not speaking about a monetary claim.
llm_translation: "Oin" of a murderer will convict - for they are "oin," and speaking not in a monetary claim!

hebrew_text: דָּנִין ״אוֹאִין״ שֶׁיֵּשׁ עִמָּהֶן שְׁבוּעָה מֵ״אוֹאִין״ שֶׁיֵּשׁ עִמָּהֶן שְׁבוּעָה, וְאַל יוֹכִיחוּ ״אוֹאִין״ דְּרוֹצֵחַ – שֶׁאֵין עִמָּהֶן שְׁבוּעָה.
human_translation: One infers “or” with which there is an oath from “or” with which there is an oath and “or” that a murderer will not prove as there is no oath in their
llm_translation: We judge "oin" that has with them an oath from "oin" that has with them an oath, and they should not prove "oin" of a murderer - for they do not have an oath with them.

hebrew_text: ״אוֹאִין״ דְּסוֹטָה יוֹכִיחוּ – שֶׁהֵן ״אוֹאִין״, וְיֵשׁ עִמָּהֶן שְׁבוּעָה, וּמְדַבְּרִים שֶׁלֹּא בִּתְבִיעַת מָמוֹן!
human_translation: “or” that a sota will prove as are “or,” and there is an oath in their and is speaking about not a monetary claim.
llm_translation: "O'in" of Sotah will prove - that they are "O'in", and there is with them an oath, and they speak not in a monetary claim!

hebrew_text: דָּנִין ״אוֹאִין״ שֶׁיֵּשׁ עִמָּהֶן שְׁבוּעָה וְאֵין עִמָּהֶן כֹּהֵן, מֵ״אוֹאִין״ שֶׁיֵּשׁ עִמָּהֶן שְׁבוּעָה וְאֵין עִמָּהֶן כֹּהֵן; וְאַל יוֹכִיחוּ ״אוֹאִין״ דְּרוֹצֵחַ – שֶׁאֵין עִמָּהֶן שְׁבוּעָה; וְאַל יוֹכִיחוּ ״אוֹאִין״ דְּסוֹטָה – שֶׁאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁיֵּשׁ עִמָּהֶן שְׁבוּעָה, יֵשׁ עִמָּהֶן כֹּהֵן.
human_translation: One infers “or” with which there is an oath and with which there is no priest from “or” with which there is an oath and with which there is no priest and “or” that a murderer will not prove as there is no oath in their and “or” that a sota will not prove as even though there is an oath in their there is a priest in their
llm_translation: We evaluate "O'in" that has with them an oath and does not have with them a Kohen, from "O'in" that has with them an oath and does not have with them a Kohen; and they should not establish "O'in" for a murderer - for they do not have with them an oath; and they should not establish "O'in" for a Sotah - for even though there is with them an oath, there is with them a Kohen.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: ״וְהָיָה כִּי יֶאְשַׁם לְאַחַת מֵאֵלֶּה״ – יֵשׁ מֵאֵלֶּה שֶׁהוּא חַיָּיב, וְיֵשׁ מֵאֵלֶּה שֶׁהוּא פָּטוּר. הָא כֵּיצַד? תְּבָעוֹ מָמוֹן – חַיָּיב, דָּבָר אַחֵר – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says “And it shall be when he will be guilty of one of these” There are of these which he is liable and there are of these which he is exempt. How so? demanded a monetary liable another matter, exempt.
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: "And if he is guilty of one of these" - there are some of these for which he is liable, and there are some of these for which he is exempt. How so? If he demanded money - he is liable, but if it is another matter - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי אוֹמֵר: הֲרֵי הוּא אוֹמֵר ״וְהוּא עֵד אוֹ רָאָה אוֹ יָדָע״ – בְּעֵדוּת הַמִּתְקַיֶּימֶת בִּרְאִיָּה בְּלֹא יְדִיעָה וּבִידִיעָה בְּלֹא רְאָיָה הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei HaGelili says: states “And he is a witness or he saw or he knew” with regard to testimony that is founded on sight, without knowledge or by means of knowledge without sight the verse is speaking.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei the Galilean says: Behold, it says "and he is a witness, or saw, or knew" - with testimony that is upheld in seeing without knowing, and in knowing without seeing, the Scripture speaks.

hebrew_text: רְאִיָּה בְּלֹא יְדִיעָה – כֵּיצַד? ״מָנֶה מָנִיתִי לְךָ בִּפְנֵי פְּלוֹנִי וּפְלוֹנִי״, ״יָבוֹאוּ פְּלוֹנִי וּפְלוֹנִי וְיָעִידוּ״ – זוֹ הִיא רְאִיָּה בְּלֹא יְדִיעָה.
human_translation: Sight without knowledge, how so? I counted one hundred dinars for you before so-and-so and so-and-so, Let so-and-so and so-and-so come and testify. This is sight without knowledge,
llm_translation: Observation without knowledge - how so? "I have appointed witnesses for you before so-and-so," "Let so-and-so and so-and-so come and testify" - this is observation without knowledge.

hebrew_text: יְדִיעָה בְּלֹא רְאִיָּה – כֵּיצַד? ״מָנֶה הוֹדֵיתָה לִי בִּפְנֵי פְּלוֹנִי וּפְלוֹנִי״, ״יָבוֹאוּ פְּלוֹנִי וּפְלוֹנִי וְיָעִידוּ״ – זוֹ הִיא יְדִיעָה בְּלֹא רְאִיָּה.
human_translation: Knowledge without sight, how so? You admitted to me one hundred dinars before so-and-so and so-and-so, Let so-and-so and so-and-so come and testify. This is knowledge without sight
llm_translation: Knowledge without seeing - how so? "You have appointed witnesses for me in the presence of so-and-so and so-and-so," "Let so-and-so and so-and-so come and testify" - this is knowledge without seeing.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: חִיֵּיב כָּאן וְחִיֵּיב בְּפִקָּדוֹן; מָה לְהַלָּן אֵינוֹ מְדַבֵּר אֶלָּא בִּתְבִיעַת מָמוֹן, אַף כָּאן אֵינוֹ מְדַבֵּר אֶלָּא בִּתְבִיעַת מָמוֹן.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: liable here and liable with regard to a deposit; just as there, is speaking only in a monetary claim, so too here, is speaking only in a monetary claim.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: "Obligated here and obligated in the deposit; just as there he speaks only of a monetary claim, so too here he speaks only of a monetary claim."

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד – קַל וָחוֹמֶר: מָה פִּקָּדוֹן – שֶׁעָשָׂה בּוֹ נָשִׁים כַּאֲנָשִׁים, קְרוֹבִים כִּרְחוֹקִים, פְּסוּלִים כִּכְשֵׁרִים; וְחַיָּיב עַל
human_translation: And furthermore, an a fortiori If a deposit, with regard to which rendered of women like men, relatives like non-relatives, unfit like fit and liable for
llm_translation: And furthermore - a fortiori: Just as the redemption - that women can perform it like men, relatives can perform it like non-relatives, disqualified individuals can perform it like qualified individuals; and one is obligated for

hebrew_text: כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת, בִּפְנֵי בֵּית דִּין וְשֶׁלֹּא בִּפְנֵי בֵּית דִּין – אֵינוֹ מְדַבֵּר אֶלָּא בִּתְבִיעַת מָמוֹן; עֵדוּת שֶׁלֹּא עָשָׂה בָּהּ נָשִׁים כַּאֲנָשִׁים, קְרוֹבִים כִּרְחוֹקִים, פְּסוּלִין כִּכְשֵׁרִים; וְאֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אַחַת בִּפְנֵי בֵּית דִּין – אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא מְדַבֵּר אֶלָּא בִּתְבִיעַת מָמוֹן?!
human_translation: each and every before a court or not before a court, is speaking only in a monetary claim, testimony with regard to which did not render women like men, relatives like non-relatives, unfit like fit and he is liable only one in the presence of a court, is it not right that is speaking only in a monetary claim?
llm_translation: Every single one, in front of a court and not in front of a court - he speaks only regarding a monetary claim; testimony that women did not perform like men, relatives like strangers, invalid like valid; and he is liable only for one in front of a court - is it not the law that he should speak only regarding a monetary claim?!

hebrew_text: מָה לְפִקָּדוֹן – שֶׁכֵּן לֹא עָשָׂה בּוֹ מוּשְׁבָּע כַּנִּשְׁבָּע וּמֵזִיד כַּשּׁוֹגֵג; תֹּאמַר בְּעֵדוּת – שֶׁכֵּן עָשָׂה בָּהּ מוּשְׁבָּע כַּנִּשְׁבָּע וּמֵזִיד כַּשּׁוֹגֵג?!
human_translation: What about a deposit? that with regard to did not render one to whom an oath was administered like one who took an oath, and an intentional like an unwitting Will you say with regard to testimony, as in rendered one to whom an oath was administered like one who took an oath; and an intentional like an unwitting
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "What is the case of Pekadon - that he did not make in it an oath like a deliberate oath and intentionally like unintentional; you will say in testimony - that he did make in it an oath like a deliberate oath and intentionally like unintentional?!"

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״תֶּחֱטָא״–״תֶּחֱטָא״ לִגְזֵירָה שָׁוָה – נֶאֱמַר כָּאן ״תֶּחֱטָא״, וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן ״תֶּחֱטָא״; מָה לְהַלָּן אֵינוֹ מְדַבֵּר אֶלָּא בִּתְבִיעַת מָמוֹן, אַף כָּאן אֵינוֹ מְדַבֵּר אֶלָּא בִּתְבִיעַת מָמוֹן.
human_translation: the verse states “shall sin” “shall sin” to a verbal analogy. Here, it is stated “Shall sin” and there, it is stated “Shall sin” Just as there, is speaking only with regard to a monetary claim, so too here, is speaking only with regard to a monetary claim.
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "You shall sin" - "You shall sin" is a comparison for a decree. It is stated here "You shall sin," and it is stated elsewhere "You shall sin." Just as there, it is speaking only about a monetary claim, so too here it is speaking only about a monetary claim.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַבָּה בַּר עוּלָּא: ״אוֹ״ ״אוֹ״ בִּיטּוּי יוֹכִיחוּ – שֶׁהֵן ״אוֹאִין״, וְיֵשׁ עִמָּהֶן שְׁבוּעָה, וְאֵין עִמָּהֶן כֹּהֵן – וּמְדַבְּרִים שֶׁלֹּא בִּתְבִיעַת מָמוֹן!
human_translation: Rabba bar Ulla objects to this: “Or or an utterance, will prove as they are “or,” and there is an oath in their and there is no priest in their and they are not speaking with regard to a monetary claim.
llm_translation: Rabah bar Ulla objects to her: "Or" "Or" the expression will prove - that they are "Orphans", and there is an oath with them, and there is no Kohen with them - and they are speaking not in a monetary claim!

hebrew_text: מִסְתַּבְּרָא מִפִּקָּדוֹן הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמֵילַף, שֶׁכֵּן ״תֶּחֱטָא״ מִ״תֶּחֱטָא״.
human_translation: It stands to reason he should have derived from a deposit due to “shall sin” “shall sin.”
llm_translation: He was considered from the treasury, for so "you shall sin" from "you shall sin."

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַבָּה – מִבִּיטּוּי הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמֵילַף, שֶׁכֵּן חַטָּאת מֵחַטָּאת!
human_translation: On the contrary, he should have derived from an utterance, as a sin-offering from a sin-offering
llm_translation: Adrabah - mibituy hava leih lemila, sheken chatat mechatat!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מִסְתַּבְּרָא מִפִּקָּדוֹן הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמֵילַף – שֶׁכֵּן חֵטְא; בְּמֵזִיד; תַּבְעֵיהּ וְכַפְרֵיהּ; וְעַבְרֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rather, it stands to reason he should have derived from a deposit, as Sin, intentionally, claimed him, denied his and his past.
llm_translation: Rather, it is logical that it was from the deposit, for so he sinned; intentionally; he demanded it and atoned for it; and transgressed.

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַבָּה, מִבִּיטּוּי הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמֵילַף, שֶׁכֵּן חַטָּאת שֶׁיָּרְדָה לְחוֹמֶשׁ! הָנָךְ נְפִישָׁן.
human_translation: On the contrary, he should have derived from an utterance, as Sin offering, that descended, to one-fifth. These numerous
llm_translation: אַדְּרַבָּה, מִבִּיטּוּי הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמֵילַף, שֶׁכֵּן חַטָּאת שֶׁיָּרְדָה לְחוֹמֶשׁ! הָנָךְ נְפִישָׁן. Adrabba, from the expression was to him to learn, for so the sin offering that descended to a fifth! This is significant.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: ״וְהָיָה כִי יֶאְשַׁם לְאַחַת מֵאֵלֶּה״ – יֵשׁ מֵאֵלֶּה שֶׁהוּא חַיָּיב, וְיֵשׁ מֵאֵלֶּה שֶׁהוּא פָּטוּר. הָא כֵּיצַד? תְּבָעוֹ מָמוֹן – חַיָּיב, תְּבָעוֹ דָּבָר אַחֵר – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says “And it shall be when he will be guilty of one of these” There are of these which he is liable and there are of these which he is exempt. How so? demanded a monetary liable demanded another matter, exempt.
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: "And if he confesses that he has sinned in any of these" - there are some of these for which he is liable, and there are some of these for which he is exempt. How so? If he demands money - he is liable, if he demands something else - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: אֵיפוֹךְ אֲנָא!
human_translation: I will reverse
llm_translation: The opposite, I say!

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אַ״אוֹאִין״ דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר סְמִיךְ.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva relies on “or,” by Rabbi Eliezer,
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva said: "א״אוֹאִין" of Rabbi Eliezer is adjacent.

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ בֵּין רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר וּבֵין רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא?
human_translation: What is between Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Akiva?
llm_translation: What is the difference between Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Akiva?

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ מַשְׁבִּיעַ עֵדֵי קַרְקַע – לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר חַיָּיבִין, לְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא פְּטוּרִין.
human_translation: between their one who administers an oath to witnesses land. According to Rabbi Eliezer, they are liable According to Rabbi Akiva they are exempt
llm_translation: There is a difference between them: one who swears regarding land - according to Rabbi Eliezer they are liable, according to Rabbi Akiva they are exempt.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, דְּאָמַר הָתָם: מַשְׁבִּיעַ עֵדֵי קַרְקַע אֲפִילּוּ לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר פְּטוּרִין – הָכָא מַאי אִיכָּא בֵּין רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר לְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא?
human_translation: And according to Rabbi Yoḥanan, who says there one who administers an oath to witnesses land, are exempt even according to Rabbi Eliezer, what is there between Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Akiva?
llm_translation: And for Rabbi Yochanan, as he said there: One who administers an oath to witnesses of land, even according to Rabbi Eliezer they are exempt - what is the difference here between Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Akiva?

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ עֵדֵי קְנָס.
human_translation: between their witnesses a fine.
llm_translation: There is a difference between them, witnesses of a penalty.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי אוֹמֵר: ״וְהוּא עֵד אוֹ רָאָה אוֹ יָדָע״ – בְּעֵדוּת הַמִּתְקַיֶּימֶת בִּרְאִיָּה בְּלֹא יְדִיעָה וּבִידִיעָה בְּלֹא רְאִיָּה הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei HaGelili says: “And he is a witness or he saw or he knew” with regard to testimony that is founded on sight without knowledge or by means of knowledge without sight, the verse is speaking.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei HaGalili says: "And he is a witness or saw or knew" - with testimony that is upheld in seeing without knowing, and in knowing without seeing, the Scripture speaks.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי: לֵימָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי לֵית לֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַחָא? דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אַחָא אוֹמֵר: גָּמָל הָאוֹחֵר בֵּין הַגְּמַלִּים וְנִמְצָא גָּמָל הָרוּג בְּצִידּוֹ – בְּיָדוּעַ שֶׁזֶּה הֲרָגוֹ. דְּאִי אִית לֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַחָא, בְּדִינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת נָמֵי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ – כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן שָׁטַח!
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Abaye: Shall we say Rabbi Yosei HaGelili does not accept of Rabbi Aḥa? As it is taught Rabbi Aḥa says: a rutting camel [ gamal haoḥer ] among camels and a camel was found killed at its side, it is evident that this killed it, As, if he is of of Rabbi Aḥa in capital law too, you find as Rabbi Shimon ben Shataḥ.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said to Abbaye: Let us say that Rabbi Yosei the Galilean does not have the teaching of Rabbi Ahah? For it was taught: Rabbi Ahah says: If a camel is found late among the camels, and a dead camel is found beside it, it is known that this one killed it. And if Rabbi Ahah has it, in matters of life and death, you must rely on him - like Rabbi Shimon ben Shatach!

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן שָׁטַח: אֶרְאֶה בְּנֶחָמָה אִם לֹא רָאִיתִי אֶחָד שֶׁרָץ אַחַר חֲבֵירוֹ לְחוּרְבָּה, וְרַצְתִּי אַחֲרָיו, וּמָצָאתִי סַיִיף בְּיָדוֹ וְדָם מְטַפְטֵף וְהָרוּג מְפַרְפֵּר; אָמַרְתִּי לוֹ: רָשָׁע! מִי הֲרָגוֹ לָזֶה? אוֹ אֲנִי, אוֹ אַתָּה!
human_translation: As it is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Shataḥ said I will see the consolation if I did not see one who was running after another into a ruin, and I ran after him and found a sword in his hand and blood dripping and the slain convulsing. I said to him: Wicked who killed this either me or you,
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Shimon ben Shatach said: I will see with consolation if I did not see one who was creeping after his fellow to the ruin, and I ran after him, and I found a sword in his hand and blood dripping, and the slain was disintegrating; I said to him: Wicked one! Who killed this one? Was it me, or was it you!

hebrew_text: אֲבָל מָה אֶעֱשֶׂה, שֶׁאֵין דָּמְךָ מָסוּר בְּיָדִי, שֶׁהֲרֵי אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה: ״עַל פִּי שְׁנַיִם עֵדִים אוֹ שְׁלֹשָׁה עֵדִים יוּמַת הַמֵּת״. אֶלָּא הַמָּקוֹם יִפָּרַע מִמְּךָ. אָמְרוּ: לֹא זָזוּ מִשָּׁם עַד שֶׁנְּשָׁכוֹ נָחָשׁ וָמֵת.
human_translation: But what can I do, as your blood is not given to my control as the Torah says: “On the basis of two witnesses or three witnesses shall he that is to die be put to death” Rather, the Omnipresent will exact retribution from you. said: They did not move from there until a snake came and bit and he died.
llm_translation: But what shall I do, that your blood is not in my hands, for the Torah said: "By the mouth of two witnesses or three witnesses shall the one deserving of death be put to death." Rather, the Omnipresent will exact payment from you. They said: They did not move from there until a snake bit him and he died.

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא אִית לֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַחָא; בִּשְׁלָמָא יְדִיעָה בְּלֹא רְאִיָּה – מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ; אֶלָּא רְאִיָּה בְּלֹא יְדִיעָה – הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ? מִי לָא בָּעֵי מִידָּע אִם גּוֹי הָרַג אוֹ יִשְׂרָאֵל הָרַג, אִם אָדָם טְרֵפָה הָרַג אוֹ שָׁלֵם הָרַג?
human_translation: Even you say is of of Rabbi Aḥa Granted, you find knowledge without sight, but how can you find sight without knowledge? Don’t need to know if killed a gentile or he killed a Jew, if he killed one who has a wound that would have caused him to die within twelve months [ tereifa ] or he killed intact?
llm_translation: Even if you say that there is the opinion of Rabbi Ahah; Granted, knowledge without seeing - you forget it; But seeing without knowledge - how do you forget it? Who does not want to know whether a gentile was killed or an Israelite was killed, whether a fatally injured person was killed or a healthy person was killed?

hebrew_text: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ, קָסָבַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי: מַשְׁבִּיעַ עֵדֵי קְנָס – פָּטוּר; דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ חַיָּיב, נְהִי דִּידִיעָה בְּלֹא רְאִיָּה – אַשְׁכְּחַן לַהּ; רְאִיָּה בְּלֹא יְדִיעָה – מִי לָא בָּעֵי מִידָּע גּוֹיָה בָּעַל בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל בָּעַל, בְּתוּלָה בָּעַל בְּעוּלָה בָּעַל?
human_translation: Conclude from it Rabbi Yosei HaGelili holds one administers an oath to witnesses a fine, exempt As if it enters your mind liable, although you find knowledge without sight, sight without knowledge, don’t need to know if engaged in intercourse with a gentile woman he engaged in intercourse with a Jewish woman, he engaged in intercourse with a virgin he engaged in intercourse with a non-virgin?
llm_translation: Listen from it, infer, Rabbi Yosei the Galilean holds: one who swears witnesses of a penalty - exempt; for if your mind is convinced, even though knowledge without seeing - we find it; seeing without knowledge - who does not want to know, a non-Jew who has relations with a Jewish woman, is considered as having relations with a married woman, a virgin as a married woman, a married woman as a married woman?

hebrew_text: יָתֵיב רַב הַמְנוּנָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה, וְיָתֵיב רַב יְהוּדָה וְקָא מִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ: ״מָנֶה מְנִיתִיךְ בִּפְנֵי פְּלוֹנִי וּפְלוֹנִי״,
human_translation: Rav Hamnuna was sitting before Rav Yehuda, and Rav Yehuda was sitting and he was raising a dilemma: I counted for you one hundred dinars in the presence of so-and-so and so-and-so,
llm_translation: Sat Rav Hamnuna before Rav Yehuda, and sat Rav Yehuda and was asking him: "Appoint me as a judge before so-and-so and so-and-so."

hebrew_text: וְעֵדִים רוֹאִין אוֹתוֹ מִבַּחוּץ, מַאי?
human_translation: and witnesses see him from outside, what
llm_translation: And witnesses see it from outside, what?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב הַמְנוּנָא: וְהַלָּה מָה טוֹעֵן? אִי אָמַר: ״לֹא הָיוּ דְבָרִים מֵעוֹלָם״ – הוּחְזַק כַּפְרָן! אִי אָמַר: ״אִין, שְׁקַלִי – וְדִידִי שְׁקַלִי״ – כִּי אָתוּ עֵדִים מַאי הָוֵי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַמְנוּנָא אַתְּ? עוּל תָּא.
human_translation: Rav Hamnuna said to And what does the other claim If he says: matters never happened, he assumes the presumptive status of a denier If he says: Yes, I took but my I took, when witnesses come what of it? said to him: Are you Hamnuna? Enter come
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Hamnuna: And the Halakhah, what does it hold? If he said, "They were never words" - he is established as a liar! If he said, "No, weigh it - and my judgment weigh" - when witnesses come, what will be? He said to him: Are you Hamnuna? Go up.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ לְחַבְרֵיהּ: ״מָנֶה מָנִיתִי לְךָ בְּצַד עַמּוּד זֶה״, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״לֹא עָבַרְתִּי בְּצַד עַמּוּד זֶה״. אֲתוֹ תְּרֵי סָהֲדִי, אַסְהִידוּ בֵּיהּ דְּהִשְׁתִּין מַיִם בְּצַד עַמּוּד זֶה. אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: הוּחְזַק כַּפְרָן.
human_translation: a certain who said to another: I counted for you one hundred dinars alongside this column. said to him I did not pass alongside this column. Two witnesses came and testified about him that he urinated alongside this column. Reish Lakish said: He assumes the presumptive status of a denier
llm_translation: That one who said to his friend: "I have designated for you on the side of this pillar," he said to him: "I did not pass by the side of this pillar." Two witnesses came, and they testified that he urinated on the side of this pillar. Reish Lakish said: He is established as a liar.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב נַחְמָן: הַאי דִּינָא פָּרְסָאָה הוּא! מִי קָאָמַר ״מֵעוֹלָם״?! בְּעֵסֶק זֶה קָאָמַר לֵיהּ!
human_translation: Rav Naḥman objects to this: That is a ruling a Persian Did say never in this matter he said to him
llm_translation: Challenges her Rav Nachman: This matter is a Persian law! Who said "from forever"?! In this context, he said it to her!

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, הָהוּא דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ לְחַבְרֵיהּ: ״מָנֶה מָנִיתִי לְךָ בְּצַד עַמּוּד זֶה״, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״לֹא עָבַרְתִּי בְּצַד עַמּוּד זֶה מֵעוֹלָם״. נְפַקוּ בֵּיהּ סָהֲדִי דְּהִשְׁתִּין מַיִם בְּצַד עַמּוּד זֶה. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: הוּחְזַק כַּפְרָן.
human_translation: There are who say a certain who said to another: I counted for you one hundred dinars alongside this column. said to him I never passed alongside this column. Witnesses emerged concerning him that he urinated alongside this column. Rav Naḥman said: He assumes the presumptive status of a denier
llm_translation: There is one who said, that one who said to his friend: "I have counted for you by this pillar," he said to him: "I have never passed by this pillar." Witnesses came out against him that he urinated by this pillar. Rav Nachman said: He is established as a liar.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב נַחְמָן: כֹּל מִילְּתָא דְּלָא רַמְיָא עֲלֵיהּ דְּאִינִישׁ, עָבֵיד לַהּ וְלָאו אַדַּעְתֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Rava said to Rav Naḥman: any matter that is not incumbent upon a person he performs it and it is not on his mind.
llm_translation: Rava said to Rav Nachman: "Any matter that a person does not raise as an issue, he does it without his knowledge."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: חִיֵּיב כָּאן וְחִיֵּיב בְּפִקָּדוֹן כּוּ׳.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: rendered liable here, and rendered liable with regard to a deposit;
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: "Obligated here and obligated in the assessment, as it is said."

hebrew_text: מַחֲכוּ עֲלַהּ בְּמַעְרְבָא. מַאי חוּכָא?
human_translation: They mocked in the West, What mockery
llm_translation: Wait for it in the west. What is the waiting for?

hebrew_text: דְּקָתָנֵי: מָה לְפִקָּדוֹן, שֶׁכֵּן לֹא עָשָׂה בּוֹ מוּשְׁבָּע כַּנִּשְׁבָּע, מֵזִיד כַּשּׁוֹגֵג.
human_translation: that teaches What about a deposit? that with regard to did not render one to whom an oath was administered like one who took an oath, an intentional like an unwitting
llm_translation: The text states: What is the case of a deposit, that if one did not make a sworn statement regarding it, it is considered intentional like unintentional.

hebrew_text: מִכְּדֵי מוּשְׁבָּע מִפִּי עַצְמוֹ בְּעֵדוּת, לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מְנָא לֵיהּ – דִּגְמַר מִפִּקָּדוֹן; פִּקָּדוֹן נָמֵי – מוּשְׁבָּע מִפִּי אֲחֵרִים, נִגְמַר מֵעֵדוּת!
human_translation: Now, one who administered an oath to himself in testimony, from where according to Rabbi Shimon? derives from a deposit. a deposit too, let us derive from testimony oath was administered by others.
llm_translation: From the mouth of the accused himself, in testimony, according to Rabbi Shimon, he is believed - for he is established from his own admission; the admission of another is like testimony - he is established!

hebrew_text: וּמַאי חוּכָא? דִּלְמָא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בְּקַל וָחוֹמֶר מַיְיתֵי לַהּ: מִפִּי אֲחֵרִים חַיָּיב – מִפִּי עַצְמוֹ לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן?!
human_translation: And what mockery Perhaps Rabbi Shimon he derives it by means of an a fortiori one is liable administered by others, is it not all the more so on his own?
llm_translation: And what is the reasoning? Perhaps Rabbi Shimon brings a fortiori argument to her: If one is liable based on the testimony of others, all the more so based on one's own testimony?!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא חוּכָא אַמֵּזִיד כַּשּׁוֹגֵג – דְּקָתָנֵי: מָה לְפִקָּדוֹן – שֶׁכֵּן לֹא עָשָׂה בּוֹ מוּשְׁבָּע כַּנִּשְׁבָּע, מֵזִיד כַּשּׁוֹגֵג.
human_translation: Rather, the mockery is with regard to an intentional like an unwitting as it teaches What about a deposit? that with regard to did not render one to whom an oath was administered like one who took an oath, an intentional like an unwitting
llm_translation: Rather, the hukha amezid is like the shogeg - as it is taught: "What for the deposit?" - because he did not make in it an oath like the one who swears, intentional like the unintentional.

hebrew_text: מִכְּדֵי מֵזִיד גַּבֵּי עֵדוּת מְנָא לֵיהּ – דְּלָא כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ ״וְנֶעֱלַם״; הָכָא נָמֵי לָא כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ ״וְנֶעֱלַם״!
human_translation: Now, from where does he an intentional testimony as it is not written in And it is hidden. Here too, it is not written in And it is hidden.
llm_translation: From the intentional aspect regarding testimony, how do we establish it? - Because it is not written in it "and hidden"; here too, it is not written in it "and hidden"!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב הוּנָא: וּמַאי חוּכָא? דִּלְמָא מֵזִיד דְּלָאו כַּשּׁוֹגֵג בְּפִקָּדוֹן, מִמְּעִילָה רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן גָּמַר לַהּ!
human_translation: Rav Huna said to And what mockery Perhaps that an intentional is not like an unwitting in a deposit, from misuse Rabbi Shimon derived it.
llm_translation: He said to them, Rav Huna: And what is the law? Perhaps it is intentional, not like an unwitting error in a deposit, from the outset Rabbi Shimon has concluded for it!

hebrew_text: וְהַיְינוּ חוּכָא – אַדְּגָמַר לַהּ מִמְּעִילָה, נִגְמַר לַהּ מֵעֵדוּת!
human_translation: And that is mockery. Instead of deriving from misuse let him derive from testimony.
llm_translation: And this is the meaning - Adgamar to her from the coat, it is concluded for her from testimony!

hebrew_text: מִסְתַּבְּרָא מִמְּעִילָה הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמֵילַף, שֶׁכֵּן מְעִילָה מִמְּעִילָה.
human_translation: It stands to reason he should have derived from misuse as misuse from misuse
llm_translation: He was considered from the cloak, for so is a cloak from a cloak.

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַבָּה – מֵעֵדוּת הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמֵילַף, שֶׁכֵּן ״תֶּחֱטָא״ מִ״תֶּחֱטָא״!
human_translation: On the contrary, he should have derived from testimony, as “shall sin” from “shall sin”
llm_translation: Adrabah - testimony was to him to say, so "you shall sin" from "you shall sin"!

hebrew_text: מִסְתַּבְּרָא מִמְּעִילָה הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמֵילַף, שֶׁכֵּן מְעִילָה; בַּכֹּל; נֶהֱנֶה; בְּקָבוּעַ; חוֹמֶשׁ; וְאָשָׁם.
human_translation: It stands to reason from misuse he should have derived as Misuse, with regard to all, derive benefit, with fixed, one-fifth, and guilt-offering.
llm_translation: He was considered as if he had a cloak, for such is a cloak; in everything; he benefits; with certainty; he tithes; and brings a guilt offering.

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַבָּה – מֵעֵדוּת הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמֵילַף, שֶׁכֵּן חֵטְא; הֶדְיוֹט; בִּשְׁבוּעָה; תַּבְעֵיהּ וְכַפְרֵיהּ; וְ״אוֹאִין״! הָנָךְ נְפִישִׁין.
human_translation: On the contrary, he should have derived from testimony, as Sin, ordinary hedyot with an oath, claimed him, denied his and “or.” These numerous
llm_translation: Adrabah - testimony was to him to say, so he sinned; layman; in a week; his claim and his denial; and "Orin"! Here are the important matters.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַאי חוּכָא?
human_translation: Rather, What mockery
llm_translation: Rather, what is the meaning of "chukha"?

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רַב פָּפָּא וְרַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ מִבֵּי רַב, אָמְרִי: הַיְינוּ חוּכָא – מִכְּדֵי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן גְּזֵירָה שָׁוָה גְּמִיר, לְמָה לֵיהּ דְּפָרֵיךְ: מָה לְפִקָּדוֹן שֶׁכֵּן לֹא עָשָׂה בּוֹ מוּשְׁבָּע כַּנִּשְׁבָּע, מֵזִיד כַּשּׁוֹגֵג?
human_translation: When Rav Pappa and Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, came from the study hall of teacher, they said: This is mockery: Now, Rabbi Shimon derives a verbal analogy why that he refutes What about a deposit? that with regard to did not render one to whom an oath was administered like one who took an oath, an intentional like an unwitting
llm_translation: When Rav Papa and Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, came from the house of Rav, they said: This is the meaning of the verse, "From the days of Rabbi Shimon, a decree was established." Why did he ask: What about a deposit, that he did not make an oath regarding it, is it considered intentional like unintentional?

hebrew_text: וּמַאי חוּכָא? דִּלְמָא כִּי פָּרֵיךְ – מִקַּמֵּי דְּתֵיקוּם לֵיהּ גְּזֵירָה שָׁוָה; בָּתַר דְּקָמָא לֵיהּ גְּזֵירָה שָׁוָה לָא פָּרֵיךְ!
human_translation: And what mockery Perhaps when refuted prior to the verbal analogy being established for him, After the verbal analogy was established for him, he does not refute
llm_translation: And what is the meaning of "chuka"? Perhaps when he asks - before they establish a similar decree; after they establish a similar decree, he does not ask!

hebrew_text: וְלָא?! וְהָאָמַר לְהוּ רָבָא בַּר אִיתַּי לְרַבָּנַן: מַאן תָּנָא שְׁבוּעַת הַפִּקָּדוֹן לֹא נִיתַּן זְדוֹנָהּ לְכַפָּרָה – רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא!
human_translation: And not But didn’t Rava bar Ittai say to the Sages: Who taught an oath on a deposit atonement is not possible an intentional It is Rabbi Shimon.
llm_translation: And not?! And he said to them Rava son of Ittai to the Rabbis: Who is the Tanna that the oath of the deposit is not given for its atonement? - It is Rabbi Shimon!
