hebrew_text: דִּלְמָא מֵזִיד כַּשּׁוֹגֵג פָּרֵיךְ, דְּגָמַר לַהּ מִמְּעִילָה, דְּהָנָךְ נְפִישִׁין; אֲבָל מוּשְׁבָּע כַּנִּשְׁבָּע לָא פָּרֵיךְ.
human_translation: Perhaps an intentional like an unwitting refutes as he derives from misuse as those numerous But he does not refute one to whom an oath was administered like one who took an oath.
llm_translation: Perhaps intentional like unintentional liable, that he learned from the robe, that there are significant; but one who swears like one who does not swear not liable.

hebrew_text: וְתֶהְדַּר עֵדוּת וְתִגְמֵר לַהּ מִפִּקָּדוֹן, מֵזִיד דְּלָאו כַּשּׁוֹגֵג – מָה פִּקָּדוֹן, שׁוֹגֵג אִין מֵזִיד לָא; אַף עֵדוּת, שׁוֹגֵג אִין מֵזִיד לָא – כִּי הֵיכִי דְּיָלֵיף פִּקָּדוֹן מִמְּעִילָה!
human_translation: let testimony return and derive it from a deposit that an intentional is not like an unwitting Just as a deposit, an unwitting yes, an intentional no, so too, testimony, an unwitting yes, an intentional no, just as he derives a deposit from misuse
llm_translation: "And the testimony shall be established, and it shall be completed for her from the deposit, intentionally, not unintentionally - just as the deposit, unintentional is not intentional; so too testimony, unintentional is not intentional - in order that the deposit may be distinguished from the robe!"

hebrew_text: לְהָכִי כַּתְבַהּ רַחֲמָנָא לְעֵדוּת גַּבֵּי שְׁבוּעַת בִּיטּוּי וְגַבֵּי טוּמְאַת מִקְדָּשׁ וְקָדָשָׁיו – דִּבְכוּלָּן נֶאֱמַר בָּהֶן ״וְנֶעְלַם״, וְכָאן לֹא נֶאֱמַר בָּהֶן ״וְנֶעְלַם״; לְחַיֵּיב עַל הַמֵּזִיד כַּשּׁוֹגֵג.
human_translation: For that the Merciful One writes testimony near an oath on an utterance and near the defiling of Temple or its sacrificial as in all of it is stated concerning them: “And it is hidden,” and here, it is not stated concerning them: And it is hidden. to deem liable an intentional like an unwitting
llm_translation: Therefore, the Merciful One wrote regarding testimony of an oath of denial and regarding impurity of the sanctuary and its holy items - for all of them it is stated "and it was hidden," and here it is not stated "and it was hidden"; to obligate intentional transgression like unintentional transgression.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ ״מַשְׁבִּיעַ אֲנִי עֲלֵיכֶם, אִם לֹא תָבוֹאוּ וּתְעִידוּנִי שֶׁאָמַר אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי לִיתֵּן לִי מָאתַיִם זוּז וְלֹא נָתַן״ – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ פְּטוּרִים, שֶׁאֵין חַיָּיבִין אֶלָּא עַל תְּבִיעַת מָמוֹן כְּפִקָּדוֹן.
human_translation: I administer an oath to you if you do not come and testify on my behalf that so-and-so said to give me two hundred dinars and he did not give they are exempt as one is liable only a monetary claim like a deposit
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "I adjure you, if you do not come and testify that so-and-so said to me, 'Give me two hundred zuz,' and he did not give," - these are exempt, for they are only liable for a monetary claim like a deposit.

hebrew_text: ״מַשְׁבִּיעַ אֲנִי עֲלֵיכֶם כְּשֶׁתֵּדְעוּ לִי עֵדוּת שֶׁתָּבוֹאוּ וּתְעִידוּנִי״ – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ פְּטוּרִים, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁקָּדְמָה שְׁבוּעָה לְעֵדוּת.
human_translation: I administer an oath to you that when you will know testimony to me you will come and testify on my behalf, these are exempt due to that the oath preceded testimony.
llm_translation: "I adjure you when you know testimony that you should come and testify." - These are exempt, because the oath preceded the testimony.

hebrew_text: עָמַד בְּבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת וְאָמַר: ״מַשְׁבִּיעַ אֲנִי עֲלֵיכֶם, שֶׁאִם אַתֶּם יוֹדְעִין לִי עֵדוּת שֶׁתָּבוֹאוּ וּתְעִידוּנִי״ – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ פְּטוּרִין, עַד שֶׁיְּהֵא מִתְכַּוֵּין לָהֶם.
human_translation: stood in the synagogue and said I administer an oath to you that if you know testimony to me you will come and testify on my behalf, these are exempt until he directs to
llm_translation: He stood in the synagogue and said: "I adjure you, that if you know testimony that you should come and testify for me" - these are exempt until he intends for them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לִשְׁנַיִם: ״מַשְׁבִּיעַ אֲנִי עֲלֵיכֶם אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי וּפְלוֹנִי, שֶׁאִם אַתֶּם יוֹדְעִין לִי עֵדוּת שֶׁתָּבוֹאוּ וּתְעִידוּנִי״, ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁאֵין אָנוּ יוֹדְעִין לָךְ עֵדוּת״; וְהֵם יוֹדְעִין לוֹ עֵדוּת עֵד מִפִּי עֵד, אוֹ שֶׁהָיָה אֶחָד מֵהֶן קָרוֹב אוֹ פָּסוּל – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ פְּטוּרִין.
human_translation: one said to two I administer an oath to you, so-and-so and so-and-so, that if you know testimony to me you will come and testify on my behalf, oath we do not know testimony to you, and they know testimony to him, hearsay testimony, or one of is found a relative or disqualified, these are exempt
llm_translation: He said to two: "I adjure you by the life of so-and-so and so-and-so, that if you know testimony for me to come and testify for me." "An oath that we do not know testimony for you"; and they know testimony for him, testimony from the mouth of a witness, or if one of them was close or disqualified - these are exempt.

hebrew_text: שִׁלַּח בְּיַד עַבְדּוֹ, אוֹ שֶׁאָמַר לָהֶן הַנִּתְבָּע: ״מַשְׁבִּיעַ אֲנִי עֲלֵיכֶם, שֶׁאִם אַתֶּם יוֹדְעִין לוֹ עֵדוּת שֶׁתָּבוֹאוּ וּתְעִידוּהוּ״ – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ פְּטוּרִין, עַד שֶׁיִּשְׁמְעוּ מִפִּי הַתּוֹבֵעַ.
human_translation: sent by means of his slave, or where the defendant said to I administer an oath to you that if you know testimony to that you will come and testify on his behalf, these are exempt until they will hear from the mouth of the plaintiff.
llm_translation: He sent by the hand of his servant, or if he said to them, the defendants: "I adjure you, that if you know testimony that you can come and testify for him" - these are exempt until they hear from the mouth of the plaintiff.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״מַשְׁבִּיעַנִי עֲלֵיכֶם אִם לֹא תָבוֹאוּ וּתְעִידוּנִי שֶׁאָמַר אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי לִיתֵּן לִי מָאתַיִם זוּז וְלֹא נָתַן״ – יָכוֹל יְהוּ חַיָּיבִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״תֶּחֱטָא״–״תֶּחֱטָא״ לִגְזֵירָה שָׁוָה.
human_translation: The Sages taught: I administer an oath to you if you do not come and testify on my behalf that so-and-so said to give me two hundred dinars and he did not give might they would be liable. the verse states “shall sin” “shall sin” to a verbal analogy.
llm_translation: The sages taught: "He adjures me upon you, if you do not come and testify to me that so-and-so said to me, 'Give me two hundred zuz,' and he did not give." - Could it be that they are liable? The verse teaches: "He shall surely testify" - "He shall surely testify" is an equal decree.

hebrew_text: נֶאֱמַר כָּאן ״תֶּחֱטָא״, וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן ״תֶּחֱטָא״; מָה לְהַלָּן בִּתְבִיעַת מָמוֹן – וְיֵשׁ לוֹ, אַף כָּאן בִּתְבִיעַת מָמוֹן – וְיֵשׁ לוֹ.
human_translation: Here, it is stated “shall sin” and there, it is stated “shall sin” Just as there, with regard to a monetary claim and has so too here, with regard to a monetary claim and has
llm_translation: It is stated here "techat" and it is stated there "techat"; just as there he has a claim for monetary compensation - and he has, so too here he has a claim for monetary compensation - and he has.

hebrew_text: ״מַשְׁבִּיעַ אֲנִי עֲלֵיכֶם כְּשֶׁתֵּדְעוּ לִי עֵדוּת״ כּוּ׳.
human_translation: I administer an oath to you that when you will know testimony to me
llm_translation: "I adjure you by the Lord, that you bear witness." - Job 42:5.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״מַשְׁבִּיעַ אֲנִי עֲלֵיכֶם כְּשֶׁתֵּדְעוּ לִי עֵדוּת שֶׁתָּבוֹאוּ וּתְעִידוּנִי״ – יָכוֹל יְהוּ חַיָּיבִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְשָׁמְעָה קוֹל אָלָה וְהוּא עֵד אוֹ רָאָה אוֹ יָדַע״ – מִי שֶׁקָּדְמָה עֵדוּת לִשְׁבוּעָה, וְלֹא שֶׁקָּדְמָה שְׁבוּעָה לְעֵדוּת.
human_translation: The Sages taught: I administer an oath to you that when you will know testimony to me you will come and testify on my behalf; might they would be liable. the verse states: “And he heard the voice of an oath and he is a witness or he saw or he knew” where testimony preceded the oath, and not where the oath preceded testimony.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "I adjure you by the testimony that you will come and testify for me" - Could it be that they are obligated? The Talmud teaches: "And he heard the voice of an oath, and he is a witness, whether he saw or knew" - One who precedes testimony with an oath, and not one who precedes an oath with testimony.

hebrew_text: עָמַד בְּבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת וְאָמַר ״מַשְׁבִּיעַנִי עֲלֵיכֶם״. אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֲפִילּוּ עֵדָיו בֵּינֵיהֶן.
human_translation: stood in the synagogue and said I administer an oath to you Shmuel says: even his witnesses among the
llm_translation: He stood in the synagogue and said, "You have adjured me." Samuel said: Even if his witnesses are among them.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא! לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּקָאֵי עִילָּוַיְהוּ; מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר לְהוּ דָּמֵי, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: obvious? No, necessary where he is standing next to Lest you say he is comparable to one who spoke to them teaches us
llm_translation: It is obvious! It is not necessary, for it stands to their advantage; what could you say: like the one who says to them "blood," he is informing us.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: רָאָה סִיעָה שֶׁל בְּנֵי אָדָם עוֹמְדִין, וְעֵדָיו בֵּינֵיהֶן, וְאָמַר לָהֶן: ״מַשְׁבִּיעַנִי עֲלֵיכֶם אִם אַתֶּם יוֹדְעִין לִי עֵדוּת שֶׁתָּבוֹאוּ וּתְעִידוּנִי״ – יָכוֹל יְהוּ חַיָּיבִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְהוּא עֵד״ – וַהֲרֵי לֹא יִיחֵד עֵדָיו. יָכוֹל אֲפִילּוּ אָמַר ״כׇּל הָעוֹמְדִין כָּאן״? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְהוּא עֵד״ – וַהֲרֵי יִיחֵד עֵדָיו.
human_translation: This is also taught one saw a group of people standing, and his witnesses among them, and he said to I administer an oath to you that if you know testimony to me you will come and testify on my behalf, might they would be liable. The verse states: “And he is a witness” and he did not specify his witnesses; might even he said: everyone who is standing here The verse states: “And he is a witness” and he specified his witnesses;
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita in the name of the School of Hillel: If one sees a group of people standing, and his witnesses are among them, and he says to them, "I adjure you by the Lord, if you know testimony that you can come and testify for me" - can they be obligated? The Talmud teaches: "And he is a witness" - yet he did not specify his witnesses. Can it be even if he said, "all those standing here"? The Talmud teaches: "And he is a witness" - yet he specified his witnesses.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לִשְׁנַיִם: ״מַשְׁבִּיעַ אֲנִי עֲלֵיכֶם״. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן, אָמַר לִשְׁנַיִם: ״מַשְׁבִּיעַ אֲנִי עֲלֵיכֶם פְּלוֹנִי וּפְלוֹנִי, אִם אַתֶּם יוֹדְעִין לִי עֵדוּת שֶׁתָּבוֹאוּ וּתְעִידוּנִי״; וְהֵן יוֹדְעִין לוֹ עֵדוּת עֵד מִפִּי עֵד, אוֹ שֶׁהָיָה אֶחָד מֵהֶן קָרוֹב אוֹ פָּסוּל – יָכוֹל יְהוּ חַיָּיבִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אִם לוֹא יַגִּיד וְנָשָׂא עֲוֹנוֹ״ – בִּרְאוּיִן לְהַגָּדָה הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר.
human_translation: one said to two I administer an oath to you, the Sages taught: one said to two I administer an oath to you, so-and-so and so-and-so, if you know testimony to me you will come and testify on my behalf, and they know testimony to him hearsay testimony, or one of a relative or disqualified, might they would be liable. The verse states: “If he does not state it, then he shall bear his iniquity” with regard to eligible for statement the verse is speaking,
llm_translation: He said to two: "I adjure you." The Rabbis taught: He said to two: "I adjure you by Ploni and Almoni, if you know testimony that you can come and testify for me"; and they know testimony from a witness, whether one of them was close or disqualified - can they be liable? The Talmud teaches: "If he does not tell, he shall bear his iniquity" - fit for the telling that the Scripture speaks of.

hebrew_text: שִׁלַּח בְּיַד עַבְדּוֹ וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שִׁלַּח בְּיַד עַבְדּוֹ, אוֹ שֶׁאָמַר לָהֶן הַנִּתְבָּע: ״מַשְׁבִּיעַנִי עֲלֵיכֶם שֶׁאִם אַתֶּם יוֹדְעִין לוֹ עֵדוּת שֶׁתָּבוֹאוּ וּתְעִידוּהוּ״ – יָכוֹל יְהוּ חַיָּיבִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אִם לֹא יַגִּיד וְנָשָׂא עֲוֹנוֹ״.
human_translation: sent by means of his slave, etc. The Sages taught: sent by means of his slave, or where the defendant said to I administer an oath to you that if you know testimony to that you will come and testify on his behalf, might they would be liable? The verse states: “If he does not state it, then he shall bear his iniquity”
llm_translation: He sent by the hand of his servant, etc. The Rabbis taught: He sent by the hand of his servant, or if the defendant said to them, "You must swear to me that if you know of any testimony, you will come and testify," could they possibly be obligated? The verse teaches: "If he does not tell, then he shall bear his iniquity."

hebrew_text: מַאי תַּלְמוּדָא? אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: ״אִם לוֹא יַגִּיד״ כְּתִיב; אִם לוֹ לֹא יַגִּיד – וְנָשָׂא עֲוֹנוֹ, וְאִם לְאַחֵר לֹא יַגִּיד – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: What is the derivation Rabbi Elazar said: is written: Im lo yaggid . If does not state to he shall bear his iniquity, but if he does not state to another, exempt.
llm_translation: What is Talmud? Rabbi Elazar said: "If he does not tell" is written; if he does not tell - he bears his guilt, and if he does not tell to another - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ ״מַשְׁבִּיעַנִי (אֲנִי) עֲלֵיכֶם״; ״מְצַוֶּה אֲנִי עֲלֵיכֶם״; ״אוֹסֶרְכֶם אֲנִי״ – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ חַיָּיבִין.
human_translation: I administer an oath to you I command you, I bind you, these are liable
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "I adjure you by the Lord"; "I command you by the Lord"; "I prohibit you by the Lord" - these are cases where one is obligated.

hebrew_text: ״בַּשָּׁמַיִם וּבָאָרֶץ״ – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ פְּטוּרִין. ״בְּאָלֶף דָּלֶת״; ״בְּיוֹד הֵי״; ״בְּשַׁדַּי״; ״בִּצְבָאוֹת״; ״בְּחַנּוּן וְרַחוּם״; ״בְּאֶרֶךְ אַפַּיִם״; ״בְּרַב חֶסֶד״; וּבְכָל הַכִּנּוּיִין – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ חַיָּיבִין.
human_translation: in the heaven and in the earth, these exempt in alef dalet , in yod heh , in Almighty [ Shaddai ]; in Hosts [ Tzevaot ]; in Gracious and Compassionate in Slow to Anger; in Abounding in Loving-kindness; or in any of the appellations these liable
llm_translation: "In the heavens and on the earth" - these are exempt. "In the Aleph of Daled"; "in the Yod of Hei"; "in Shaddai"; "in hosts"; "in gracious and merciful"; "in long-suffering"; "in abundant kindness"; and in all designations - these are obligated.

hebrew_text: הַמְקַלֵּל בְּכוּלָּן – חַיָּיב; דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים פּוֹטְרִין.
human_translation: One who curses employing any of liable the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis deem exempt,
llm_translation: One who curses them all - liable; the words of Rabbi Meir. And the Sages exempt.

hebrew_text: הַמְקַלֵּל אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ בְּכוּלָּן – חַיָּיב; דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים פּוֹטְרִין.
human_translation: One who curses his father or his mother employing any of liable the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis deem exempt,
llm_translation: The one who curses his father and mother - is liable; the words of Rabbi Meir. And the sages exempt him.

hebrew_text: הַמְקַלֵּל עַצְמוֹ וַחֲבֵירוֹ בְּכוּלָּן – עוֹבֵר בְּלֹא תַעֲשֶׂה. ״יַכְּכָה ה׳ אֱלֹהִים״, וְכֵן ״יַכְּכָה אֱלֹהִים״ – זוֹ הִיא אָלָה הַכְּתוּבָה בַּתּוֹרָה.
human_translation: One who curses himself or another employing any of violates a prohibition. The Lord God shall strike you and likewise God shall strike you that is a curse that is written in the Torah,
llm_translation: The one who curses himself and his fellow together - transgresses a negative commandment. "God will surely punish," and likewise "God will surely punish" - this is the curse written in the Torah.

hebrew_text: ״אַל יַכְּךָ״, וִ״יבָרֶכְךָ״ וְ״יֵיטִיב לָךְ״ – רַבִּי מֵאִיר מְחַיֵּיב, וַחֲכָמִים פּוֹטְרִין.
human_translation: shall not strike you, or: shall bless you, or: shall benefit you Rabbi Meir deems liable, And the Rabbis deem exempt
llm_translation: "Do not strike you," and "He will bless you," and "He will do good to you" - Rabbi Meir obligates, and the sages exempt.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ ״מַשְׁבִּיעַנִי עֲלֵיכֶם״ – מַאי קָאָמַר? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה, הָכִי קָאָמַר: ״מַשְׁבִּיעַ אֲנִי עֲלֵיכֶם בִּשְׁבוּעָה הָאֲמוּרָה בַּתּוֹרָה״; ״מְצַוֶּה אֲנִי עֲלֵיכֶם בְּצַוָּואָה הָאֲמוּרָה בַּתּוֹרָה״; ״אוֹסֶרְכֶם אֲנִי בְּאִיסּוּר הָאָמוּר בַּתּוֹרָה״.
human_translation: I administer an oath to you, What is saying? Rav Yehuda said: This is saying: I administer an oath to you with the oath mentioned in the Torah, I command you with the command mentioned in the Torah, I bind you with the bond mentioned in the Torah,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara: 'Mashbi'anee aleichem' - mai ka'amar? Amar Rav Yehudah, hachi ka'amar: 'Mashbi'anee aleichem bishvu'ah ha'amurah bat Torah'; 'Mitzaveh anee aleichem betzavu'ah ha'amurah bat Torah'; 'Oserchem anee be'issur ha'amur bat Torah'."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי, אֶלָּא הָא דְתָנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: ״כּוֹבֶלְכֶם אֲנִי״ – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ חַיָּיבִין; כּוֹבֵל בְּאוֹרָיְיתָא מִי כְּתִיב?!
human_translation: Abaye said to But that which Rabbi Ḥiyya teaches, I chain you, these liable is chaining written in the Torah?
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye, rather this that Rabbi Chiya teaches: "I am your guarantor" - behold these are obligated; where is it written "guarantor" in the Torah?!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, הָכִי קָאָמַר: ״מַשְׁבִּיעַ אֲנִי עֲלֵיכֶם בִּשְׁבוּעָה״; ״מְצַוֶּה אֲנִי עֲלֵיכֶם בִּשְׁבוּעָה״; ״אוֹסֶרְכֶם אֲנִי בִּשְׁבוּעָה״; ״כּוֹבֶלְכֶם אֲנִי בִּשְׁבוּעָה״.
human_translation: Rather, Abaye said this is saying: I administer an oath to you with an oath, I command you with an oath, I bind you with an oath, I chain you with an oath.
llm_translation: Rather, Abaye said, thus he said: "I adjure you by oath"; "I command you by oath"; "I prohibit you by oath"; "I bind you by oath."

hebrew_text: ״בְּאָלֶף דָּלֶת״; ״בְּיוֹד הֵי״; ״בְּשַׁדַּי״; ״בִּצְבָאוֹת״; ״בְּחַנּוּן וְרַחוּם״; ״בְּאֶרֶךְ אַפַּיִם״; ״בְּרַב חֶסֶד״.
human_translation: in alef dalet , in yod heh , in Almighty [ Shaddai ], in Hosts [ Tzevaot ], in Gracious and Compassionate in Slow to Anger, in Abounding in Loving-kindness,
llm_translation: "In the thousand of Dalat"; "In the hand of Hei"; "In Shaddai"; "In hosts"; "In gracious and compassionate"; "In long-suffering"; "In abundant kindness."

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דְּחַנּוּן וְרַחוּם שֵׁמוֹת נִינְהוּ?! וּרְמִינְהִי: יֵשׁ שֵׁמוֹת שֶׁנִּמְחָקִין, וְיֵשׁ שֵׁמוֹת שֶׁאֵין נִמְחָקִין – אֵלּוּ הֵן שֵׁמוֹת שֶׁאֵין נִמְחָקִין: כְּגוֹן ״אֵל״, ״אֱלֹהֶיךָ״, ״אֱלֹהִים״, ״אֱלֹהֵיכֶם״, ״אֶהְיֶה אֲשֶׁר אֶהְיֶה״, ״אָלֶף דָּלֶת״ וְ״יוֹד הֵי״, ״שַׁדַּי״, ״צְבָאוֹת״ – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ אֵין נִמְחָקִין.
human_translation: to say that gracious and compassionate are names? raises a contradiction There are names that may be erased and there are names that may not be erased These are names that may not be erased: For example, El , Elohekha Elohim , Eloheikhem I Shall Be As I Shall Be, alef dalet , yod heh , Almighty [ Shaddai ], Hosts [ Tzevaot ], these may not be erased.
llm_translation: In the matter of Chanun and Rachum, are those their names?! And it was asked: There are names that are erased, and there are names that are not erased - these are the names that are not erased: such as "El," "Elohecha," "Elohim," "Eloheichem," "Ehyeh Asher Ehyeh," "Aleph Dalet" and "Yod Hei," "Shaddai," "Tzevaot" - these are names that are not erased.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל ״הַגָּדוֹל״, ״הַגִּבּוֹר״, ״הַנּוֹרָא״, ״הָאַדִּיר״ וְ״הֶחָזָק״ וְ״הָאַמִּיץ״, ״הָעִזּוּז״, ״חַנּוּן וְרַחוּם״, ״אֶרֶךְ אַפַּיִם״ וְ״רַב חֶסֶד״ – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ נִמְחָקִין.
human_translation: But the Great, the Mighty, the Awesome, the Prodigious, the Powerful, the Courageous, the Strong, gracious, compassionate, slow to anger, or abounding in loving-kindness; these may be erased.
llm_translation: But "the great," "the mighty," "the awesome," "the majestic," and "the strong," and "the mighty," "the compassionate and gracious," "slow to anger" and "abundant in kindness" - these have been erased.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מַתְנִיתִין ״בְּמִי שֶׁהוּא חַנּוּן״
human_translation: Abaye said: the mishna, in He Who is Gracious,
llm_translation: Abbaye said: The Mishnah states, "In one who is gracious."

hebrew_text: ״בְּמִי שֶׁהוּא רַחוּם״ קָאָמַר.
human_translation: in He Who is compassionate, is stating
llm_translation: "In the one who is merciful" is what he said.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: אִי הָכִי, ״בַּשָּׁמַיִם וּבָאָרֶץ״ נָמֵי – ״בְּמִי שֶׁהַשָּׁמַיִם וְהָאָרֶץ שֶׁלּוֹ״ קָאָמַר!
human_translation: Rava said to If so, in the heaven and in the earth as well, in He for Whom the heaven and the earth are His is stating
llm_translation: He said to him Rava: If so, "in the heavens and on the earth" also means - "by the One to whom the heavens and the earth belong" he is saying!

hebrew_text: הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא?! הָתָם, כֵּיוָן דְּלֵיכָּא מִידֵּי אַחֲרִינָא דְּאִיקְּרִי רַחוּם וְחַנּוּן – וַדַּאי ״בְּמִי שֶׁהוּא חַנּוּן״, וַדַּאי ״בְּמִי שֶׁהוּא רַחוּם״ קָאָמַר. הָכָא, כֵּיוָן דְּאִיכָּא שָׁמַיִם וָאָרֶץ – ״בַּשָּׁמַיִם וּבָאָרֶץ״ קָאָמַר.
human_translation: How can be compared? There, since there is no other entity that is called gracious and compassionate, certainly in He Who is gracious, certainly in He Who is compassionate is speaking. here, since there are heaven and earth in the heaven and in the earth he is speaking,
llm_translation: So now?! There, since there is no other entity that is called "merciful and gracious" – certainly "with the one who is gracious," and certainly "with the one who is merciful" he is saying. Here, since there are heavens and earth – "in the heavens and on the earth" he is saying.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כָּתַב אָלֶף לָמֶד מֵ״אֱלֹהִים״, ״יָהּ״ מֵ״יְיָ״ – הֲרֵי זֶה אֵינוֹ נִמְחָק. שִׁין דָּלֶת מִ״שַּׁדַּי״, אָלֶף דָּלֶת מֵ״אֲדֹנָי״, צָדִי בֵּית מִ״צְּבָאוֹת״ – הֲרֵי זֶה נִמְחָק.
human_translation: The Sages taught: one wrote alef lamed from Elohim , yod heh from the Tetragrammaton, this may not be erased. shin dalet from Shaddai , alef dalet from Adonai , tzadi beit from Tzevaot , this may be erased.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: If one writes aleph lamed from "Elohim," yod he from "YHVH" - this is not erased. Shin dalet from "Shaddai," aleph dalet from "Adonai," tzadi beit from "Tzevaot" - this is erased.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: ״צְבָאוֹת״ כּוּלּוֹ נִמְחָק – שֶׁלֹּא נִקְרָא צְבָאוֹת אֶלָּא עַל שֵׁם יִשְׂרָאֵל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהוֹצֵאתִי אֶת צִבְאֹתַי אֶת עַמִּי בְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל מֵאֶרֶץ מִצְרַיִם״. אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֵין הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: tzevaot may be erased its entirety, as is called Tzevaot only in the context of Israel, as it is stated: “And I shall bring forth My hosts [ tzivotai ], My people the children of Israel, out of the land of Egypt” Shmuel says: halakha not in accordance with Rabbi Yosei.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: "Tzevaot" entirely was erased - for it was not called Tzevaot except after the name of Israel, as it is said: "And I brought out My hosts, My people the children of Israel, from the land of Egypt." Shmuel said: The halakha is not like Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כׇּל הַטָּפֵל לַשֵּׁם, בֵּין מִלְּפָנָיו וּבֵין מִלְּאַחֲרָיו – הֲרֵי זֶה נִמְחָק. לְפָנָיו כֵּיצַד? ״לַייָ׳״ – ל׳ נִמְחָק; ״בַּייָ׳״ – ב׳ נִמְחָק; ״וַייָ׳״ – ו׳ נִמְחָק; ״מֵיְיָ׳״ – מ׳ נִמְחָק; ״שֶׁיְיָ׳״ – ש׳ נִמְחָק; ״הַיְיָ׳״ – ה׳ נִמְחָק; ״כַּייָ׳״ – כ׳ נִמְחָק.
human_translation: The Sages taught: Any ancillary to the name whether preceding or succeeding this may be erased. Preceding it, how so? Tetragrammaton lamed , lamed may be erased; Tetragrammaton beit , beit may be erased; Tetragrammaton vav , vav may be erased; Tetragrammaton mem , mem may be erased; Tetragrammaton shin , shin may be erased; Tetragrammaton heh , heh may be erased; Tetragrammaton kaf , kaf may be erased.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Anyone who adds to the Name, whether before or after it - this one is erased. Before it, how so? "LORD" - L is erased; "BY THE LORD" - B is erased; "AND THE LORD" - V is erased; "FROM THE LORD" - M is erased; "THAT THE LORD" - SH is erased; "THE LORD" - H is erased; "LIKE THE LORD" - K is erased.

hebrew_text: לְאַחֲרָיו כֵּיצַד? ״אֱלֹהֵינוּ״ – נוּ נִמְחָק, ״אֱלֹהֵיהֶם״ – הֶם נִמְחָק, ״אֱלֹהֵיכֶם״ – כֶם נִמְחָק. אֲחֵרִים אוֹמְרִים: לְאַחֲרָיו אֵינוֹ נִמְחָק, שֶׁכְּבָר קִדְּשׁוֹ הַשֵּׁם. אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: הֲלָכָה כַּאֲחֵרִים.
human_translation: Succeeding it, how so? Eloheinu , nun vav may be erased; Eloheihem , heh mem may be erased; Eloheikhem , kaf mem may be erased. Aḥerim say: succeeding may not be erased as the name already sanctified it Rav Huna says: halakha in accordance with Aḥerim .
llm_translation: Following him, how so? "Our God" - we are erased, "their gods" - they are erased, "your gods" - you are erased. Others say: Following him is not erased, for the name has already been sanctified. Rav Huna said: The halakha is like the others.

hebrew_text: (אַבְרָהָם, דְּלָטְיָא, לְנָבוֹת, בְּגִבְעַת בִּנְיָמִן, שְׁלֹמֹה, דָּנִיאֵל – סִימָן)
human_translation: Abraham; who cursed Naboth; in Gibeah of Benjamin; Solomon; Daniel; a mnemonic
llm_translation: Abraham, of Delatya, to Naboth, in Gibeah of Benjamin, Solomon, Daniel - sign.

hebrew_text: כׇּל שֵׁמוֹת הָאֲמוּרִים בַּתּוֹרָה בְּאַבְרָהָם – קֹדֶשׁ; חוּץ מִזֶּה שֶׁהוּא חוֹל – שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאמַר, אֲדֹנָי אִם נָא מָצָאתִי חֵן בְּעֵינֶיךָ״.
human_translation: All names that are stated in the Torah with regard to Abraham sacred except for this which is non-sacred, as it is stated: “My lords, if I have found favor in your eyes”
llm_translation: All the names mentioned in the Torah regarding Abraham - holy; except for this one which is mundane - as it is stated: "And he said, 'O Lord, if I have found favor in Your eyes.'"

hebrew_text: חֲנִינָא בֶּן אֲחִי רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר הַמּוֹדָעִי אָמְרוּ: אַף זֶה קֹדֶשׁ. כְּמַאן אָזְלָא הָא דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: גְּדוֹלָה הַכְנָסַת אוֹרְחִין יוֹתֵר מֵהַקְבָּלַת פְּנֵי שְׁכִינָה – כְּמַאן? כְּאוֹתוֹ הַזּוּג.
human_translation: Ḥanina, son of the brother of Rabbi Yehoshua, and Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya in the name of Rabbi Elazar HaModa’i, say: This too sacred. In accordance with whose is that which Rabbi Yehuda says Rav says: Hospitality guests is greater than receiving the Divine Presence? In accordance with whose in accordance with that pair
llm_translation: Hanina son of Ahijah, Rabbi Yehoshua, and Rabbi Elazar son of Azariah in the name of Rabbi Elazar HaModa'i said: "This too is holy." To whom does this statement correspond? To the one that Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: "Hospitality is greater than receiving the presence of the Divine Presence." To whom does it correspond? To that same pair.

hebrew_text: כָּל שֵׁמוֹת הָאֲמוּרִים בְּלוֹט – חוֹל; חוּץ מִזֶּה שֶׁהוּא קֹדֶשׁ – שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאמֶר לוֹט אֲלֵהֶם, אַל נָא אֲדֹנָי, הִנֵּה נָא מָצָא עַבְדְּךָ חֵן בְּעֵינֶיךָ וְגוֹ׳״ – מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ בְּיָדוֹ לְהָמִית וּלְהַחֲיוֹת, זֶה הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא.
human_translation: All names that are stated with regard to Lot non-sacred except for this which is sacred, as it is stated: “And Lot said to them: Please, not so Adonai . Behold your servant has found favor in your eyes, He Who has the capacity to kill and to vivify; that is the Holy One, Blessed be He.
llm_translation: All the names mentioned in Lot - mundane; except for this one which is holy - as it is said: "And Lot said to them, 'Please, my lords, behold now, your servant has found favor in your eyes, etc.'" - One who has the power to kill and to bring to life, this is the Holy One, blessed be He.

hebrew_text: כָּל שֵׁמוֹת הָאֲמוּרִים בְּנָבוֹת – קֹדֶשׁ, בְּמִיכָה – חוֹל. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: בְּנָבוֹת – קֹדֶשׁ, בְּמִיכָה – יֵשׁ מֵהֶן חוֹל וְיֵשׁ מֵהֶן קֹדֶשׁ. אָלֶף לָמֶד – חוֹל, יוֹד הֵי – קֹדֶשׁ; חוּץ מִזֶּה, שֶׁאָלֶף לָמֶד וְהוּא קֹדֶשׁ: ״כׇּל יְמֵי הֱיוֹת בֵּית הָאֱלֹהִים בְּשִׁילֹה״.
human_translation: All names that are stated with regard to Naboth sacred, with regard to Micah non-sacred Rabbi Eliezer says: with regard to Naboth sacred; with regard to Micah, some of them are non-sacred and some of them are sacred. alef lamed , non-sacred, yod heh , sacred, except for this alef lamed and it is sacred: “All the time that the house of Elohim was in Shiloh”
llm_translation: All the names mentioned in the Prophets - holy, in Micah - mundane. Rabbi Eliezer says: in the Prophets - holy, in Micah - some of them are mundane and some of them are holy. Aleph Lamed - mundane, Yod Hei - holy; except for this, that Aleph Lamed teaches and it is holy: "all the days of being in the house of God in Shiloh."

hebrew_text: כָּל שֵׁמוֹת הָאֲמוּרִים בְּגִבְעַת בִּנְיָמִין – רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: חוֹל, רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: קֹדֶשׁ.
human_translation: All names that are stated in Gibeah of Benjamin, Rabbi Eliezer says: non-sacred, Rabbi Yehoshua says: sacred.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "All the names mentioned in Gibeah of Benjamin - Rabbi Eliezer says: secular, Rabbi Yehoshua says: holy."

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: וְכִי מַבְטִיחַ וְאֵינוֹ עוֹשֶׂה?!
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer said to Does promise and not fulfill
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Eliezer: And is one who promises but does not fulfill?!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: מַה שֶּׁהִבְטִיחַ עָשָׂה; וְהֵם לֹא בִּיחֲנוּ אִם לִנְצוֹחַ אִם לִנָּצֵחַ. בָּאַחֲרוֹנָה שֶׁבִּיחֲנוּ – הִסְכִּימוּ עַל יָדָן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּפִנְחָס בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן אַהֲרֹן (הַכֹּהֵן) עֹמֵד לְפָנָיו בַּיָּמִים הָהֵם לֵאמֹר, הַאוֹסִף עוֹד לָצֵאת לַמִּלְחָמָה עִם [בְּנֵי] בִנְיָמִן אָחִי אִם אֶחְדָּל וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua said to That which promised, He fulfilled. but they did not seek to ascertain if to triumph if to be defeated. In the last where they sought to ascertain they consented to their as it is stated: “And Pinehas, son of Elazar, son of Aaron was standing before it in those days, saying: Shall I yet again go out to battle against the children of Benjamin my brother, or shall I cease?
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Yehoshua: What he promised he fulfilled; and they did not test him whether to conquer or to be conquered. In the last group that they tested - they agreed with them, as it is stated: "And Phinehas son of Eleazar son of Aaron the priest stood before him in those days, saying, 'Should I still go out to battle against the descendants of Benjamin my brother or should I desist, etc.'"

hebrew_text: כׇּל ״שְׁלֹמֹה״ הָאֲמוּרִין בְּשִׁיר הַשִּׁירִים – קֹדֶשׁ, שִׁיר לְמִי שֶׁהַשָּׁלוֹם שֶׁלּוֹ; חוּץ מִזֶּה: ״כַּרְמִי שֶׁלִּי לְפָנָי הָאֶלֶף לְךָ שְׁלֹמֹה״ – שְׁלֹמֹה לְדִידֵיהּ, ״וּמָאתַיִם לְנֹטְרִים אֶת פִּרְיוֹ״ – רַבָּנַן. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים, אַף זֶה חוֹל: ״הִנֵּה מִטָּתוֹ שֶׁלִּשְׁלֹמֹה שִׁשִּׁים״.
human_translation: All Shlomo that are stated in the Song of Songs, sacred, a song to One for Whom peace [ shehashalom ] is His, except for this “My vineyard, which is mine, is before me; you, Solomon shall have the one thousand,” for Solomon himself; “and two hundred for those who guard its fruit” the Sages. And some say: This too is non-sacred: “Behold, the bed of Solomon; sixty
llm_translation: All "Shlomo" mentioned in the Song of Songs - holy, a song for one whose peace is his; except for this: "My vineyard, which is mine, is before me; you, Shlomo, have peace" - Shlomo for his beloved, "and two hundred to those who keep its fruit" - the sages. And some say, this too is secular: "Behold, his bed, which is Shlomo's, sixty."

hebrew_text: אַף זֶה – וְלָא מִיבְּעֵי הַאיְךְ?! אֶלָּא הָא דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מַלְכוּתָא דְּקָטְלָא חַד מִשִּׁיתָּא בְּעָלְמָא לָא מִיעַנְשָׁא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כַּרְמִי שֶׁלִּי לְפָנָי הָאֶלֶף לְךָ שְׁלֹמֹה״ – לְמַלְכוּתָא דִרְקִיעָא, ״וּמָאתַיִם לְנֹטְרִים אֶת פִּרְיוֹ״ – לְמַלְכוּתָא דְּאַרְעָא; שְׁמוּאֵל לָא כְּתַנָּא קַמָּא וְלָא כְּיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים?!
human_translation: This too and it is not necessary But that which Shmuel says: A monarchy that kills one of six in the world is not punished as it is stated: “My vineyard, which is mine, is before me; you, Shlomo shall have the one thousand,” to the monarchy of Heaven; “and two hundred for those who guard its fruit,” to the monarchy of earth. Shmuel, neither in accordance with the first tanna nor in accordance with Some say.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Even this - and not from where this?! Rather this that Samuel said: A kingdom that killed one from six in the world is not punished, as it is stated: "My vineyard, which is mine, is before me; the thousand are for you, Solomon" - for the kingdom of the heavens, "and two hundred for those who keep its fruit" - for the kingdom of the earth; Samuel did not say like the first Tanna and not like Yesh Omrim?!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָכִי קָאָמַר, וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: זֶה – קֹדֶשׁ; וְזֶה הוּא חוֹל – דְּמִטָּתוֹ. וּשְׁמוּאֵל דְּאָמַר כְּיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים.
human_translation: Rather, this it is saying. And some say: This sacred, and that with regard to the bed of is non-sacred, and Shmuel who states in accordance with Some say.
llm_translation: Rather, thus he said, and some say: this - holy; and this is secular - as his bed. And Samuel said as some say.

hebrew_text: כָּל מַלְכַיָּא הָאֲמוּרִים בְּדָנִיֵּאל – חוֹל; חוּץ מִזֶּה שֶׁהוּא קֹדֶשׁ: ״אַנְתְּ מַלְכָּא [מֶלֶךְ] מַלְכַיָּא דִּי אֱלָהּ שְׁמַיָּא, מַלְכוּתָא חִסְנָא וְתׇקְפָּא וִיקָרָא יְהַב לָךְ״.
human_translation: All kings that are stated with regard to Daniel non-sacred, except for this which is sacred: “You, O king, king of kings, unto whom the God of heaven has given you the kingdom, the power, and the strength, and the glory”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: All the kings mentioned in Daniel - secular; except for this one, which is holy: "You, O king, the king of kings, to whom the God of heaven has given the kingdom, the power, the might, and the glory."

hebrew_text: וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: אַף זֶה קֹדֶשׁ – שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מָרִי חֶלְמָא לְשָׂנְאָךְ וּפִשְׁרֵהּ לְעָרָךְ״ – לְמַאן קָאָמַר? אִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ לִנְבוּכַדְ נֶצַּר קָאָמַר לֵיהּ, שָׂנְאוֹתֵיהּ מַאי נִינְהוּ – יִשְׂרָאֵל; מֵילָט קָא לָיֵיט לְהוּ לְיִשְׂרָאֵל?!
human_translation: And some say: This too sacred, as it is stated: “My Lord, the dream shall be for your enemy and its interpretation for your foe” To whom is saying If it enters your mind to Nebuchadnezzar he is saying it, his enemy, who are they? Jewish people. Would curse the Jewish people?
llm_translation: And some say: Even this is holy - as it is stated: "Marī ḥel'mā l'san'āḵ ū'pish'reh l'arāḵ" - to whom is this statement attributed? If your mind inclines to Nebuchadnezzar, he said it to him, what are his hatreds - Israel; what benefit does he seek for Israel?!

hebrew_text: וְתַנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר: שׂוֹנְאֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אִיכָּא, שׂוֹנְאֵי גוֹיִם לֵיכָּא?!
human_translation: And the first tanna , holds: Are there Jewish enemies there are no gentile enemies
llm_translation: And it was taught in the first Tanna: "Those who hate Israel, is there such a thing, those who hate the nations?!"

hebrew_text: וּבְכָל כִּנּוּיִין – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ חַיָּיבִין כּוּ׳.
human_translation: Or in any of the appellations these liable
llm_translation: "And in all designations - behold, these are obligated as well."

hebrew_text: וּרְמִינְהִי: ״יִתֵּן ה׳ אוֹתָךְ לְאָלָה וְלִשְׁבֻעָה״ – מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר? וַהֲלֹא כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר: ״וְהִשְׁבִּיעַ הַכֹּהֵן אֶת הָאִשָּׁה בִּשְׁבֻעַת הָאָלָה״! לְפִי שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְשָׁמְעָה קוֹל אָלָה״ – נֶאֱמַר כָּאן ״אָלָה״ וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן ״אָלָה״; מָה לְהַלָּן שְׁבוּעָה, אַף כָּאן שְׁבוּעָה; מָה לְהַלָּן בַּשֵּׁם, אַף כָּאן בַּשֵּׁם.
human_translation: And raises a contradiction “The Lord shall render you as a curse and as an oath” Why the verse state Isn’t it already stated “And the priest shall administer to the woman with the oath of cursing”? Due to that it is stated “And he heard the voice of an ala ” Ala is stated here and ala is stated there just as there, an oath, so too here, an oath. just as there, in name so too here, in name
llm_translation: And they raised a dilemma: "May the Lord make you a curse and an oath" - what is the Talmud to say? But hasn't it already been stated: "And the priest shall make the woman swear with the oath of the curse"! Because it is stated: "And the curse shall come upon her" - it is stated here "curse" and it is stated there "curse"; just as there it is an oath, so too here it is an oath; just as there it is in the name, so too here it is in the name.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לָא קַשְׁיָא; הָא רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר אִידִי, הָא רַבָּנַן. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר אִידִי אוֹמֵר: הוֹאִיל וְאָמְרָה תּוֹרָה ״הִשָּׁבַע״ וְ״אַל תִּשָּׁבַע״, ״קַלֵּל״ וְ״אַל תְּקַלֵּל״ – מָה ״הִשָּׁבַע״ בַּשֵּׁם, אַף ״לֹא תִּשָּׁבַע״ בַּשֵּׁם; מָה ״קַלֵּל״ בַּשֵּׁם, אַף ״לֹא תְּקַלֵּל״ בַּשֵּׁם.
human_translation: Abaye said: not difficult. This Rabbi Ḥanina bar Idi, that the Rabbis, as it is taught Rabbi Ḥanina bar Idi says: Since the Torah says Take an oath, and Do not take an oath; Curse, and Do not curse, just as Take an oath, in name so too, Do not take an oath, in the name just as Curse, in name so too, Do not curse, in name
llm_translation: Abaye said: It is not difficult. This is Rabbi Chanina bar Idi, and these are the Rabbis. As it was taught: Rabbi Chanina bar Idi says: Since the Torah said, "You shall swear" and "You shall not swear," "You shall curse" and "You shall not curse" - just as "You shall swear" is in the name of God, so too "You shall not swear" is in the name of God; just as "You shall curse" is in the name of God, so too "You shall not curse" is in the name of God.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן, אִי גְּמִירִי גְּזֵירָה שָׁוָה – נִיבְעֵי שֵׁם הַמְיוּחָד! אִי לָא גְּמִירִי גְּזֵירָה שָׁוָה – ״אָלָה״ דִּשְׁבוּעָה הִיא מְנָא לְהוּ?
human_translation: And the Rabbis If they derive a verbal analogy, let us require the ineffable name If they do not derive a verbal analogy, from where do they that ala that is an oath?
llm_translation: The Sages, if they establish a decree that is fitting - the Name of the Unique is spoken! But if they do not establish a decree that is fitting - how do they derive the oath of the week?

hebrew_text: נָפְקָא לְהוּ מִדְּתַנְיָא: ״אָלָה״ – אֵין ״אָלָה״ אֶלָּא לְשׁוֹן שְׁבוּעָה, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וְהִשְׁבִּיעַ הַכֹּהֵן אֶת הָאִשָּׁה בִּשְׁבוּעַת הָאָלָה״.
human_translation: They derive it from that which is taught an ala ” ala is nothing other than an expression oath. And likewise it says: “And the priest shall administer to the woman with the oath of cursing [ ha’ala ]”
llm_translation: He went out to them from the dispute: "Oath" - "Oath" is only a language of swearing, as it also says: "And the priest shall make the woman swear with the oath of the curse."

hebrew_text: הָתָם ״שְׁבוּעַת הָאָלָה״ כְּתִיב! הָכִי קָאָמַר: ״אָלָה״ – אֵין ״אָלָה״ אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבוּעָה, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וְהִשְׁבִּיעַ הַכֹּהֵן אֶת הָאִשָּׁה בִּשְׁבֻעַת הָאָלָה״.
human_translation: the oath of an ala is written there. this is saying: an ala ”; ala is only by an oath. And likewise it says: “And the priest shall administer to the woman with the oath of cursing.”
llm_translation: There, "oath of the curse" is written! This is what it means: "curse" - there is no "curse" except in an oath, and so it says: "and the priest shall make the woman swear with the oath of the curse."

hebrew_text: וּמִנַּיִן לַעֲשׂוֹת אָלָה שֶׁאֵין עִמָּהּ שְׁבוּעָה כְּאָלָה שֶׁיֵּשׁ עִמָּהּ שְׁבוּעָה, וּשְׁבוּעָה שֶׁאֵין עִמָּהּ אָלָה כִּשְׁבוּעָה שֶׁיֵּשׁ עִמָּהּ אָלָה? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְשָׁמְעָה קוֹל אָלָה״ – וְשָׁמְעָה אָלָה, וְשָׁמְעָה קוֹל.
human_translation: And from where to render an ala with which oath is not like an ala with which oath is and an oath with which ala is not like an oath with which ala is The verse states: “And he hears the voice of an ala ” And he heard an ala and he heard a voice.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And from where do we derive to impose a curse that does not have an accompanying oath like a curse that does have an accompanying oath, and an oath that does not have a curse like an oath that does have a curse? The Talmud teaches: "And she shall hear the voice of a curse" - she shall hear a curse, and she shall hear a voice.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: מִנַּיִן לְ״אָלָה״ שֶׁהִיא שְׁבוּעָה? שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיָּבֹא אִתּוֹ בְּאָלָה וְגוֹ׳״; וּכְתִיב: ״וְגַם בַּמֶּלֶךְ נְבוּכַדְנֶצַּר מָרָד אֲשֶׁר הִשְׁבִּיעוֹ בֵּאלֹהִים״.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu says: From where with regard to ala that it is an oath? as it is stated: and brought it into an ala ” and it is stated “And he also rebelled against Nebuchadnezzar who had administered an oath to him by God”
llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu said: From where do we derive that an "oath" is a week? As it is stated: "And he brought him into the oath," and it is also written: "And also King Nebuchadnezzar made him swear by God."

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: ״אָרוּר״ – בּוֹ נִידּוּי, בּוֹ קְלָלָה, בּוֹ שְׁבוּעָה.
human_translation: taught arur : ostracism within it, curse within it, oath within it.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "Arur" - in it is excommunication, in it is a curse, in it is an oath.

hebrew_text: בּוֹ נִידּוּי – דִּכְתִיב: ״אוֹרוּ מֵרוֹז אָמַר מַלְאַךְ ה׳, אֹרוּ אָרוֹר יֹשְׁבֶיהָ״, וְאָמַר עוּלָּא: בְּאַרְבַּע מְאָה שִׁיפּוּרֵי שַׁמְּתֵיהּ בָּרָק לְמֵרוֹז.
human_translation: ostracism within it, as it is written “Curse [ oru ] Meroz, said the angel of God; cursed with a curse [ oru aror ] are its inhabitants” And Ulla says: With four hundred shofarot , Barak ostracized Meroz,
llm_translation: In it is excommunication - as it is written: "The angel of the Lord said, 'Curse its inhabitants thoroughly.'" And Ulah said: With four hundred measures of sulfur he placed it in a censer for Meron.

hebrew_text: בּוֹ קְלָלָה – דִּכְתִיב: ״וְאֵלֶּה יַעַמְדוּ עַל הַקְּלָלָה״, וּכְתִיב: ״אָרוּר הָאִישׁ אֲשֶׁר יַעֲשֶׂה פֶסֶל וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: curse within it, as it is written “And these shall stand for the curse” and it is written: “Cursed [ arur ] be the man who fashions a graven image,
llm_translation: In it is a curse - as it is written: "And these shall stand for the curse," and it is written: "Cursed be the man who makes a graven or molten image, etc."

hebrew_text: בּוֹ שְׁבוּעָה – דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּשְׁבַּע יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בָּעֵת הַהִיא לֵאמֹר, אָרוּר הָאִישׁ לִפְנֵי ה׳ וְגוֹ׳״. וְדִלְמָא תַּרְתֵּי עֲבַד לְהוּ – אַשְׁבְּעִינְהוּ וְלַיְיטִינְהוֹ?
human_translation: oath within it, as it is written: “And Joshua administered an oath at that time saying: Arur be the man before God But perhaps performed two to he administered an oath to them and he cursed them,
llm_translation: In it a week - as it is written: "And Joshua swore at that time, saying, Cursed be the man before the Lord, etc." And perhaps two servants to him - should I swear to them and give them?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵהָכָא: ״וְאִישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵל נִגַּשׂ בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא, וַיֹּאֶל שָׁאוּל אֶת הָעָם לֵאמֹר, אָרוּר הָאִישׁ אֲשֶׁר יֹאכַל וְגוֹ׳״, וּכְתִיב: ״וִיהוֹנָתָן לֹא שָׁמַע בְּהַשְׁבִּיעַ אָבִיו אֶת הָעָם״. וְדִלְמָא הָכָא נָמֵי תַּרְתֵּי עֲבַד לְהוּ – אַשְׁבְּעִינְהוּ וְלַיְיטִינְהוֹ?
human_translation: Rather, from here: “And the men of Israel were distressed on that day, and Saul administered an oath [ vayyoel ] to the people, saying: Arur is the man who eats And it is written: “But Jonathan did not hear when his father administered the oath to the people” But perhaps, here too, performed two to he administered an oath to them and he cursed them.
llm_translation: Rather, from here: "And the men of Israel were distressed on that day, for Saul had adjured the people, saying, 'Cursed be the man who eats...'" But it is written: "But Jonathan had not heard when his father charged the people with the oath." And perhaps here too, there are two servants – let us adjure them and let them taste?

hebrew_text: מִי כְּתִיב ״וְאָרוּר״?! הַשְׁתָּא דְּאָתֵית לְהָכִי, הָתָם נָמֵי לָא כְּתִיב ״וְאָרוּר״.
human_translation: Is it written ve’arur , Now that you have arrived at this there too, ve’arur is not written,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Who is it written "and cursed"?! Now that you have come to say this, there it is not written "and cursed."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: ״אָמֵן״ – בּוֹ שְׁבוּעָה, בּוֹ קַבָּלַת דְּבָרִים, בּוֹ הַאֲמָנַת דְּבָרִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says amen: oath within it, acceptance of the statement within it, confirmation of the statement, within it.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, said: "Amen" - in it is an oath, in it is acceptance of words, in it is belief in words.

hebrew_text: בּוֹ שְׁבוּעָה – דִּכְתִיב: ״וְאָמְרָה הָאִשָּׁה אָמֵן אָמֵן״.
human_translation: oath within it, as it is written: and the woman shall say: Amen, amen”
llm_translation: In it a week - as it is written: "And the woman shall say, Amen, Amen."

hebrew_text: בּוֹ קַבָּלַת דְּבָרִים – דִּכְתִיב: ״אָרוּר אֲשֶׁר לֹא יָקִים אֶת דִּבְרֵי הַתּוֹרָה הַזֹּאת לַעֲשׂוֹת אוֹתָם, וְאָמַר כׇּל הָעָם אָמֵן״.
human_translation: acceptance of the statement within it, as it is written: “Cursed is he who shall not confirm the matters of this Torah to perform them; and all the people shall say: Amen”
llm_translation: In it acceptance of matters - as it is written: "Cursed be he who does not confirm the words of this Torah to do them, and all the people shall say, Amen."

hebrew_text: בּוֹ הַאֲמָנַת דְּבָרִים – דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיֹּאמֶר יִרְמְיָה [הַנָּבִיא] (אֶל חֲנַנְיָהוּ), אָמֵן כֵּן יַעֲשֶׂה ה׳, יָקֵם ה׳ אֶת דְּבָרֶיךָ״.
human_translation: confirmation of the statement within it, as it is written: “And Jeremiah the prophet said: Amen, may the Lord do so; may the Lord uphold your statement”
llm_translation: In it the trust of matters - as it is written: "And Jeremiah the prophet said (to Hananiah), Amen, so may the Lord do; may the Lord establish your words."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: ״לָאו״ – שְׁבוּעָה, ״הֵן״ – שְׁבוּעָה. בִּשְׁלָמָא ״לָאו״ שְׁבוּעָה – דִּכְתִיב: ״וְלֹא יִהְיֶה עוֹד הַמַּיִם לְמַבּוּל״, וּכְתִיב: ״כִּי מֵי נֹחַ זֹאת לִי אֲשֶׁר נִשְׁבַּעְתִּי״. אֶלָּא ״הֵן״ שְׁבוּעָה – מְנָא לַן? סְבָרָא הוּא – מִדְּ״לָאו״ שְׁבוּעָה, ״הֵן״ נָמֵי שְׁבוּעָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: No, an oath, yes, an oath. Granted no an oath, as it is written: “And the waters shall no more become a flood” And it is written “As this is as the waters of Noah unto Me; as I have taken an oath But from where do we yes an oath? It is logical reasoning; from that no an oath, yes too an oath.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: "Lo" - an oath, "Hen" - an oath. Now, "Lo" as an oath is understandable, as it is written: "And the waters shall no more become a flood," and it is also written: "For this is as the waters of Noah unto Me." But how do we know that "Hen" is also an oath? It is a logical deduction: just as "Lo" is an oath, so too "Hen" is an oath.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: וְהוּא דְּאָמַר ״לָאו״ ״לָאו״ תְּרֵי זִימְנֵי, וְהוּא דְּאָמַר ״הֵן״ ״הֵן״ תְּרֵי זִימְנֵי; דִּכְתִיב: ״וְלֹא יִכָּרֵת כׇּל בָּשָׂר עוֹד מִמֵּי הַמַּבּוּל״, ״וְלֹא יִהְיֶה עוֹד הַמַּיִם לְמַבּוּל״; וּמִדְּ״לָאו״ תְּרֵי זִימְנֵי, ״הֵן״ נָמֵי תְּרֵי זִימְנֵי.
human_translation: Rava said: And is where one said no, no, two times, or where one said yes, yes, two times, as it is written: “All flesh shall not be excised any more by floodwaters” “And the waters shall no more become a flood” And from that no two times, yes, too, two times.
llm_translation: Rava said: And he who said "no" "no" two times, and he who said "yes" "yes" two times; as it is written: "And all flesh shall not be cut off anymore by the waters of the flood," "and the waters shall no more become a flood"; and from "no" two times, "yes" also two times.

hebrew_text: הַמְקַלֵּל בְּכוּלָּן – חַיָּיב, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר, וַחֲכָמִים פּוֹטְרִין.
human_translation: One who curses employing any of liable the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis deem exempt.
llm_translation: One who curses them all - liable, the words of Rabbi Meir, and the sages exempt.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״אִישׁ [אִישׁ] כִּי יְקַלֵּל אֱלֹהָיו וְנָשָׂא חֶטְאוֹ״ – מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר? וַהֲלֹא כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר: ״וְנֹקֵב שֵׁם ה׳ מוֹת יוּמָת״! יָכוֹל לֹא יְהֵא חַיָּיב אֶלָּא עַל שֵׁם הַמְיוּחָד בִּלְבַד, מִנַּיִן לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הַכִּינּוּיִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אִישׁ אִישׁ כִּי יְקַלֵּל אֱלֹהָיו וְגוֹ׳״ – מִכׇּל מָקוֹם. דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: עַל שֵׁם מְיוּחָד בְּמִיתָה, וְעַל הַכִּינּוּיִין בְּאַזְהָרָה.
human_translation: The Sages taught “Each and every man who shall curse his God shall bear his sin” Why the verse state Wasn’t it already stated: “And he who blasphemes the name of the Lord shall be put to death” might one would be liable only for the ineffable name alone. From where to include the appellations the verse states: “Each and every man who shall curse his God,” in any case, the statement of Rabbi Meir. The Rabbis say: For the ineffable name with death And for appellations for a prohibition,
llm_translation: The sages taught: "When a man man curses his God, he shall bear his sin" - What is the Talmud coming to teach? Has it not already been said: "And one who blasphemes the name of the Lord shall surely be put to death"! One might have thought that he is liable only for the unique name alone, how do we know to include epithets? The Talmud comes to say: "When a man man curses his God, etc." - from any context. These are the words of Rabbi Meir. And the sages say: For the unique name, it is with death, and for epithets, it is with warning.

hebrew_text: וְהַמְקַלֵּל אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ וְכוּ׳. מַאן חֲכָמִים?
human_translation: And one who curses his father and his mother Who are the Rabbis
llm_translation: And one who curses his father and mother, etc. Who are the Sages?

hebrew_text: רַבִּי מְנַחֵם בַּר יוֹסֵי. דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי מְנַחֵם בַּר יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: ״בְּנׇקְבוֹ שֵׁם יוּמָת״ – מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״שֵׁם״? לִימֵּד עַל הַמְקַלֵּל אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ, שֶׁאֵינוֹ חַיָּיב עַד שֶׁיְּקַלְּלֵם בַּשֵּׁם.
human_translation: Rabbi Menaḥem bar Yosei, as it is taught Rabbi Menaḥem bar Yosei says: “When he blasphemes a name, he shall be put to death” Why the verse state “a name,” taught with regard to one who curses his father or his mother that he is not liable until he curses them in the name
llm_translation: Rabbi Menachem bar Yosei. As it was taught: Rabbi Menachem bar Yosei says: "With a hole in his name he shall surely be put to death" - What does the Scripture teach by saying "name"? It teaches about one who curses his father and mother, that he is not liable until he curses them using the name.

hebrew_text: וְהַמְקַלֵּל עַצְמוֹ וַחֲבֵירוֹ כּוּ׳. אָמַר רַבִּי יַנַּאי: וְדִבְרֵי הַכֹּל.
human_translation: One who curses himself or another Rabbi Yannai says: And everyone agrees
llm_translation: The one who curses himself and his fellow, etc. Rabbi Yannai said: And the words of all.

hebrew_text: עַצְמוֹ – דִּכְתִיב: ״רַק הִשָּׁמֶר לְךָ וּשְׁמֹר נַפְשְׁךָ מְאֹד״ – כִּדְרַבִּי אָבִין אָמַר רַבִּי אִילְעָא, דְּאָמַר: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״הִשָּׁמֶר״, ״פֶּן״ וְ״אַל״ – אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה. וַחֲבֵירוֹ – דִּכְתִיב: ״לֹא תְקַלֵּל חֵרֵשׁ״.
human_translation: oneself as it is written: “Only observe for yourself, and keep your soul diligently” in accordance with which Rabbi Avin says that Rabbi Ile’a says: Everywhere that observe, lest, or do not are stated, it is nothing other than a prohibition. And another as it is written: “Do not curse the deaf”
llm_translation: Bone - as it is written: "Only take heed to yourself and keep your soul diligently" - like Rabbi Avin said Rabbi Ilai, who said: Any place where it says "take heed", "lest", and "do not" - it means do not do. And his fellow - as it is written: "You shall not curse a deaf man."

hebrew_text: ״יַכְּךָ ה׳ אֱלֹהִים״, וְכֵן ״יַכְּכָה אֱלֹהִים״ – זוֹ הִיא אָלָה הַכְּתוּבָה בַּתּוֹרָה. יָתֵיב רַב כָּהֲנָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה, וְיָתֵיב וְקָאָמַר הָא מַתְנִיתִין כְּדִתְנַן. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כַּנֵּה.
human_translation: The Lord God shall strike you and likewise God shall strike you that is a curse that is written in the Torah. Rav Kahana sat before Rav Yehuda, and he sat and stated the mishna as we learned said to him: Employ a euphemism
llm_translation: "May God strike you," and likewise "May God strike her" - this is the curse written in the Torah. Rav Kahana sat before Rav Yehudah, and he sat and said: This is the Mishnah as we learned. He said to him: Acquire it.

hebrew_text: יָתֵיב הָהוּא מֵרַבָּנַן קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב כָּהֲנָא, וְיָתֵיב וְקָאָמַר: ״גַּם אֵל יִתׇּצְךָ לָנֶצַח, יַחְתְּךָ וְיִסָּחֲךָ מֵאֹהֶל, וְשֵׁרֶשְׁךָ מֵאֶרֶץ חַיִּים סֶלָה״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כַּנֵּה.
human_translation: A certain one of the Sages sat before Rav Kahana, and he sat and said “God will likewise break you forever; He will take you up and pluck you from the tent, and uproot you from the land of the living, Selah” said to him: Employ a euphemism
llm_translation: The individual, a scholar, was sitting before Rav Kahana, and he was sitting and saying: "Even God will cut you off forever; He will pluck you out and remove you from your tent, and uproot you from the land of the living, Selah." He said to him: "Reed."

hebrew_text: תַּרְתֵּי לְמָה לִי? מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: הָנֵי מִילֵּי מַתְנִיתִין, אֲבָל בִּקְרָאֵי אֵימָא לָא מְכַנֵּינַן; קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Why do I two Lest you say this statement the mishna, but with regard to verses say we do not employ a euphemism. teaches us
llm_translation: Two, why do I need them? What might you say: those matters of Mishna, but in the Scriptures we do not say; he teaches us.

hebrew_text: ״אַל יַכְּךָ״, וִ״יבָרֶכְךָ״, וְ״יֵיטִיב לָךְ״ – רַבִּי מֵאִיר מְחַיֵּיב, וַחֲכָמִים פּוֹטְרִין.
human_translation: shall not strike you, or: shall bless you, or: shall benefit you Rabbi Meir deems liable, And the Rabbis deem exempt
llm_translation: "Do not strike you," and "He will bless you," and "He will do good to you" - Rabbi Meir obligates, and the Sages exempt.

hebrew_text: וְהָא לֵית לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר מִכְּלָל לָאו אַתָּה שׁוֹמֵעַ הֵן! אֵיפוֹךְ.
human_translation: But isn’t Rabbi Meir does not accept From a negative you infer a positive Reverse
llm_translation: And this is not according to Rabbi Meir from the principle "you do not hear yes!" Rather, the opposite.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רַבִּי יִצְחָק, תְּנָא כְּדִתְנַן. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: הַשְׁתָּא דַּאֲנַן תְּנַן הָכִי, וְכִי אֲתָא רַבִּי יִצְחָק תָּנֵי הָכִי, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ דַּוְקָא תְּנַן.
human_translation: When Rabbi Yitzḥak came he taught as we learned Rav Yosef said: Now that we have learned this and when he came, Rabbi Yitzḥak taught this conclude from it we learned specifically
llm_translation: When Rabbi Yitzchak came, a Tanna taught as follows. Rav Yosef said: Now that we have taught this way, when Rabbi Yitzchak comes and teaches this way, we can infer that this is indeed the correct teaching.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא קַשְׁיָא! כִּי לֵית לֵיהּ – בְּמָמוֹנָא; אֲבָל בְּאִיסּוּרָא אִית לֵיהּ.
human_translation: But difficult, When does not accept in monetary matters; but in ritual matters, he accepts
llm_translation: Rather, it is difficult! For he does not have - in money; but in prohibition, he does have.

hebrew_text: הֲרֵי סוֹטָה – דְּאִיסּוּרָא הוּא,
human_translation: But sota is ritual, matters,
llm_translation: Behold, Sotah - for it is a prohibition.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי תַּנְחוּם בַּר חֲכִינַאי: ״הִנָּקִי״ כְּתִיב; טַעְמָא דִּכְתִיב ״הִנָּקִי״, הָא לָאו הָכִי – מִכְּלַל לָאו אַתָּה שׁוֹמֵעַ הֵן לָא אָמְרִינַן!
human_translation: And Rabbi Tanḥum bar Ḥakhinai says Hinnaki is written, The reason that hinnaki is written but that not we do not say: From a negative you infer a positive
llm_translation: And Rabbi Tanhum bar Hakina said: "Clean" is written; the reason it is written "clean," is not this so - from the fact that it is not so, do you not hear that we do not say yes!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אֵיפוֹךְ – אֲפִילּוּ בְּאִיסּוּרָא לֵית לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rather, reverse even in ritual matters, does not accept
llm_translation: Rather, the opposite - even in a case of prohibition, it does not have it.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לֵיהּ רָבִינָא: וּבְאִיסּוּרָא לֵית לֵיהּ?! אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, שְׁתוּיֵי יַיִן וּפְרוּעֵי רֹאשׁ – דִּבְמִיתָה; הָכִי נָמֵי דְּלֵית לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר?! וְהָתְנַן: אֵלּוּ שֶׁבְּמִיתָה – שְׁתוּיֵי יַיִן וּפְרוּעֵי רֹאשׁ!
human_translation: Ravina objects to this: And in ritual matters, not accept But if that is so, intoxicated with wine, and overgrown head, who, death so too does Rabbi Meir not accept But didn’t we learn And these who to death intoxicated with wine and overgrown head,
llm_translation: Rabina objects to him: And in the case of prohibition, does he not have it?! Rather, from now on, the drinking of wine and the loosening of the head covering - this is the case; is it also not the case for Rabbi Meir?! And we learned in a Mishnah: These are the ones in the case of prohibition - the drinking of wine and the loosening of the head covering!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְעוֹלָם תֵּיפוֹךְ; כִּי לֵית לֵיהּ – בְּמָמוֹנָא, בְּאִיסּוּרָא אִית לֵיהּ; וְשָׁאנֵי סוֹטָה דְּאִיסּוּרָא דְּאִית בֵּיהּ מָמוֹנָא הוּא.
human_translation: Rather, actually reverse When does not accept in monetary matters; but in ritual matters, he accepts And sota is different because it is a ritual matter in which there are monetary matters,
llm_translation: Rather, always reverse; for he does not have - in money, he has; and different is the case of a Sotah where there is money in it.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ שְׁבוּעַת הָעֵדוּת
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Hadaran alach shvu'at ha'edut.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ שְׁבוּעַת הַפִּקָּדוֹן נוֹהֶגֶת בַּאֲנָשִׁים וּבְנָשִׁים, בִּרְחוֹקִים וּבִקְרוֹבִים, בִּכְשֵׁרִים וּבִפְסוּלִים;
human_translation: an oath on a deposit apply to men and to women, to non-relatives and to relatives, to fit and to disqualified
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: The oath of deposit is administered to men and women, to distant and close relatives, to those who are qualified and those who are disqualified.

hebrew_text: בִּפְנֵי בֵּית דִּין וְשֶׁלֹּא בִּפְנֵי בֵּית דִּין – מִפִּי עַצְמוֹ; וּמִפִּי אֲחֵרִים – אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב עַד שֶׁיִּכְפְּרֶנּוּ בְּבֵית דִּין. דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: in the presence of a court and not in the presence of a court, on his own, But by others, not liable unless he denies in court; the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: Before a court and not before a court - from his own mouth; and from others - he is not liable until they impose it on him in court. The words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: בֵּין מִפִּי עַצְמוֹ בֵּין מִפִּי אֲחֵרִים – כֵּיוָן שֶׁכָּפַר בּוֹ חַיָּיב.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: Both on his own and by others, once denied liable
llm_translation: The sages say: Whether from his own mouth or from the mouth of others - once he has denied, he is liable.

hebrew_text: וְחַיָּיב עַל זְדוֹן הַשְּׁבוּעָה, וְעַל שִׁגְגָתָהּ עִם זְדוֹן הַפִּקָּדוֹן; וְאֵינוֹ חַיָּיב עַל שִׁגְגָתָהּ גְּרֵידְתָּא. וּמָה חַיָּיב עַל זְדוֹנָהּ? אָשָׁם בְּכֶסֶף שְׁקָלִים.
human_translation: And liable for intentionally oath and for unwittingly intentional the deposit, But he is not liable for unwittingly by itself, And what is he liable for intentionally a guilt-offering worth silver shekels.
llm_translation: "And liable for intentional violation of an oath, and for its unintentional transgression together with the intentional violation of a deposit; and not liable for its unintentional transgression independently. And what is one liable for its intentional violation? A guilt offering of silver shekels."

hebrew_text: שְׁבוּעַת הַפִּקָּדוֹן כֵּיצַד? אָמַר לוֹ: ״תֵּן לִי פִּקְדוֹנִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לִי בְּיָדְךָ״, ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁאֵין לְךָ בְּיָדִי״; אוֹ שֶׁאָמַר לוֹ: ״אֵין לְךָ בְּיָדִי״, ״מַשְׁבִּיעֲךָ אֲנִי״, וְאָמַר ״אָמֵן״ – הֲרֵי זֶה חַיָּיב.
human_translation: What an oath on a deposit? said to Give me my deposit, which is in your possession, oath nothing yours in my possession; or said to him: Nothing yours in my possession, I administer an oath to you, and said: Amen. this liable
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Shvu'at haPikadon keitzad? Amar lo: 'Ten li pikdoni sheyesh li beyadcha', 'shvu'ah she'ein lecha beyadi'; o she'amar lo: 'Ein lecha beyadi', 'mashbi'acha ani', ve'amar 'Amen' – harei zeh chayav." English translation: "How is the oath of the deposit taken? He said to him: 'Give me my deposit that is in your possession', 'an oath that you do not have it in your possession'; or if he said to him: 'You do not have it in your possession', 'I swear to you', and he said 'Amen' – this one is liable."

hebrew_text: הִשְׁבִּיעַ עָלָיו חָמֵשׁ פְּעָמִים, בֵּין בִּפְנֵי בֵּית דִּין וּבֵין שֶׁלֹּא בִּפְנֵי בֵּית דִּין, וְכָפַר – חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת. אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: מָה טַעַם? מִפְּנֵי שֶׁיָּכוֹל לַחֲזוֹר וּלְהוֹדוֹת.
human_translation: administered an oath to him five times, whether in the presence of a court or not in the presence of a court, and denied liable for each and every Rabbi Shimon said: What is the reason? due to that he is able to retract and confess
llm_translation: He swore upon him five times, whether in front of the court or not in front of the court, and he repented - he is liable for each and every one. Rabbi Shimon said: What is the reason? Because he can go back and admit.

hebrew_text: הָיוּ חֲמִשָּׁה תּוֹבְעִים אוֹתוֹ – אָמְרוּ לוֹ: ״תֵּן לָנוּ פִּקָּדוֹן שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָנוּ בְּיָדְךָ״; ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁאֵין לָכֶם בְּיָדִי״ – אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אַחַת. ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁאֵין לְךָ בְּיָדִי, וְלֹא לְךָ וְלֹא לָךְ״ – חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: עַד שֶׁיֹּאמַר שְׁבוּעָה בָּאַחֲרוֹנָה. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: עַד שֶׁיֹּאמַר שְׁבוּעָה לְכׇל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד.
human_translation: five were suing him they said to him: Give us our deposit that is in your possession, oath nothing yours in my possession, liable only one oath nothing yours in my possession, and nothing yours, and nothing yours, liable for each and every Rabbi Eliezer says: unless he says: oath, at the end Rabbi Shimon says: unless he says: oath, to each and every
llm_translation: There were five who demanded from him - they said to him: "Give us a deposit that we have in your possession"; "an oath that you do not have in my possession" - he is liable only once. "An oath that you do not have in your possession, not yours and not yours" - he is liable for each and every one. Rabbi Eliezer says: Until he says the last oath. Rabbi Shimon says: Until he says an oath to each and every one.

hebrew_text: ״תֵּן לִי פִּקָּדוֹן וּתְשׂוּמֶת יָד גָּזֵל וַאֲבֵידָה שֶׁיֵּשׁ לִי בְּיָדְךָ״; ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁאֵין לְךָ בְּיָדִי״ – אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אַחַת, ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁאֵין לְךָ בְּיָדִי פִּקָּדוֹן וּתְשׂוּמֶת יָד וְגָזֵל וַאֲבֵידָה״ – חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת.
human_translation: Give me my deposit, and pledge, stolen item, and lost item that are in your possession, oath nothing yours in my possession, liable only one oath I do not have in my possession your deposit, or pledge, stolen item, or lost item, liable for each and every
llm_translation: "Give me a deposit and a stolen item and a lost item that I have in your possession"; "an oath that you do not have in my possession" - one is liable only for one, "an oath that you do not have in my possession, a deposit and a stolen item and a lost item" - one is liable for each and every one.

hebrew_text: ״תֵּן לִי חִטִּין וּשְׂעוֹרִין וְכוּסְּמִין שֶׁיֵּשׁ לִי בְּיָדְךָ״; ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁאֵין לְךָ בְּיָדִי״ – אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אַחַת, ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁאֵין לְךָ בְּיָדִי חִטִּין וּשְׂעוֹרִין וְכוּסְּמִין״ – חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת. רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ אָמַר ״חִטָּה וּשְׂעוֹרָה וְכוּסֶּמֶת״ – חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת.
human_translation: Give me my wheat, and barley, and spelt that are in your possession, oath nothing of yours in my possession, liable only one oath I do not have in my possession your wheat, barley, or spelt, liable for each and every Rabbi Meir says: Even says: grain of wheat, or grain of barley, or grain of spelt, liable for each and every
llm_translation: "Give me wheat, barley, and spelt that I have in your possession"; "an oath that you do not have in my possession" - one is only liable for one, "an oath that you do not have in my possession wheat, barley, and spelt" - one is liable for each and every one. Rabbi Meir says: Even if he said "wheat, barley, and spelt" - one is liable for each and every one.

hebrew_text: ״אָנַסְתָּ וּפִיתִּיתָ אֶת בִּתִּי״, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר: ״לֹא אָנַסְתִּי וְלֹא פִּיתִּיתִי״; ״מַשְׁבִּיעֲךָ אֲנִי״, וְאָמַר: ״אָמֵן״ – חַיָּיב. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן פּוֹטֵר, שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְשַׁלֵּם קְנָס עַל פִּי עַצְמוֹ. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְשַׁלֵּם קְנָס עַל פִּי עַצְמוֹ, מְשַׁלֵּם בּשֶׁת וּפְגָם עַל פִּי עַצְמוֹ.
human_translation: You raped or you seduced my daughter, and says: I did not rape and I did not seduce I administer an oath to you, and said: Amen, liable Rabbi Shimon deems exempt, since one does not pay a fine based on his own said to him: Even though he does not pay fine based on his own he does pay humiliation and degradation based on his own
llm_translation: "If you have violated and lain with my daughter," and he says, "I did not violate her, nor did I lie with her"; "I adjure you," and he says, "Amen" - he is liable. Rabbi Shimon exempts him, for he does not impose a penalty upon himself. They said to him: Even though he does not impose a penalty upon himself, he must pay for disgrace and blemish upon himself.

hebrew_text: ״גָּנַבְתָּ אֶת שׁוֹרִי״, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר ״לֹא גָּנַבְתִּי״; ״מַשְׁבִּיעֲךָ אֲנִי״, וְאָמַר ״אָמֵן״ – חַיָּיב. ״גָּנַבְתִּי, אֲבָל לֹא טָבַחְתִּי וְלֹא מָכַרְתִּי״; ״מַשְׁבִּיעֲךָ אֲנִי״, וְאָמַר ״אָמֵן״ – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: You stole my ox, and the says: I did not steal I administer an oath to you, and said: Amen, liable I stole but I did not slaughter or sell I administer an oath to you, and he said: Amen, exempt
llm_translation: "‘You stole my ox,’ and he says, ‘I did not steal.’ ‘I adjure you,’ and he says, ‘Amen’ – he is liable. ‘I stole, but I did not slaughter or sell,’ ‘I adjure you,’ and he says, ‘Amen’ – he is exempt."

hebrew_text: ״הֵמִית שׁוֹרְךָ אֶת שׁוֹרִי״, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר ״לֹא הֵמִית״; ״מַשְׁבִּיעֲךָ אֲנִי״, וְאָמַר ״אָמֵן״ – חַיָּיב. ״הֵמִית שׁוֹרְךָ אֶת עַבְדִּי״, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר ״לֹא הֵמִית״; ״מַשְׁבִּיעֲךָ אֲנִי״, וְאָמַר ״אָמֵן״ – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: Your ox killed my ox, and says: It did not kill I administer an oath to you, and he said: Amen, liable Your ox killed my slave and he says: did not kill I administer an oath to you, and he said: Amen, exempt,
llm_translation: "The ox of yours killed my ox," and he says, "I did not kill it"; "I adjure you," and he said, "Amen" - he is liable. "The ox of yours killed my slave," and he says, "I did not kill him"; "I adjure you," and he said, "Amen" - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ: ״חָבַלְתָּ בִּי וְעָשִׂיתָ בִּי חַבּוּרָה״, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר: ״לֹא חָבַלְתִּי וְלֹא עָשִׂיתִי בְּךָ חַבּוּרָה״; ״מַשְׁבִּיעֲךָ אֲנִי״, וְאָמַר ״אָמֵן״ – חַיָּיב. אָמַר לוֹ עַבְדּוֹ: ״הִפַּלְתָּ אֶת שִׁינִּי וְסִימִּיתָ אֶת עֵינִי״, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר: ״לֹא הִפַּלְתִּי וְלֹא סִימִּיתִי״; ״מַשְׁבִּיעֲךָ אֲנִי״, וְאָמַר ״אָמֵן״ – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: said to him: You injured me and caused me a wound, and says: I did not injure and I did not cause you a wound, I administer an oath to you, and he said: Amen, liable. one’s slave said to him: You knocked out my tooth, or: You blinded my eye, and he says: I did not knock out or: I did not blind I administer an oath to you, and he said: Amen, exempt
llm_translation: He said to him: "You have injured me and caused me harm," and he says: "I have not injured you nor caused you harm"; "I adjure you," and he said "Amen" - he is liable. He said to his servant: "You knocked out my tooth and blinded my eye," and he says: "I did not knock out your tooth nor blind your eye"; "I adjure you," and he said "Amen" - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: זֶה הַכְּלָל: כׇּל הַמְשַׁלֵּם עַל פִּי עַצְמוֹ – חַיָּיב, וְשֶׁאֵינוֹ מְשַׁלֵּם עַל פִּי עַצְמוֹ – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: This is the principle: any pay based on his own liable And that not pay based on his own exempt
llm_translation: This is the principle: Anyone who pays by himself - is obligated, and one who does not pay by himself - is exempt.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ רַב אַחָא בַּר הוּנָא וְרַב שְׁמוּאֵל בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה וְרַב יִצְחָק בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה, תְּנוֹ שְׁבוּעוֹת בֵּי רַבָּה. פְּגַע בְּהוּ רַב כָּהֲנָא, אָמַר
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Huna and Rav Shmuel, son of Rabba bar bar Ḥana, and Rav Yitzḥak, son of Rav Yehuda, studied Shevuot the study hall of Rabba. Rav Kahana encountered them said
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Aḥa bar Huna and Rav Shemu'el son of Rabba bar Bar Ḥana and Rav Yitzḥak son of Rav Yehuda said: They taught oaths in the study hall of Rabba. Rab Kahana encountered them and said:

hebrew_text: לְהוּ: הֵזִיד בִּשְׁבוּעַת הַפִּקָּדוֹן וְהִתְרוּ בּוֹ, מַהוּ? כֵּיוָן דְּחִידּוּשׁ הוּא – דִּבְכׇל הַתּוֹרָה לָא אַשְׁכְּחַן מֵזִיד דְּמַיְיתֵי קׇרְבָּן, וְהָכָא מַיְיתֵי קׇרְבָּן – לָא שְׁנָא אַתְרוֹ בֵּיהּ וְלָא שְׁנָא לָא אַתְרוֹ בֵּיהּ? אוֹ דִּלְמָא, הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּלָא אַתְרוֹ בֵּיהּ; אֲבָל הֵיכָא דְּאַתְרוֹ בֵּיהּ – מִילְקָא לָקֵי, קׇרְבָּן לָא מַיְיתֵי; אוֹ דִלְמָא, הָא וְהָא עָבְדִינַן.
human_translation: to them: intentionally oath on a deposit and forewarned him, what is since is a novelty, as in the entire Torah we do not find intentionally brings an offering but here bring an offering is no difference forewarned him and is no difference they did not forewarn him, Or perhaps, that matter when they did not forewarn him; but when they forewarned him, flogged, not bring an offering. Or perhaps, we impose both
llm_translation: To him: intentionally in the oath of deposit and permitted in it, what? since it is a novelty - for in the entire Torah we do not find intentional sin that brings a sacrifice, and here in this case it brings a sacrifice - is it not the same whether it was found in it or not found in it? Or perhaps, these matters are different where it was not found in it; but where it was found in it - he receives lashes, but does not bring a sacrifice; or perhaps, we do apply the same rule here and there.

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ, תְּנֵינָא: חֲמוּרָה הֵימֶנָּה שְׁבוּעַת הַפִּקָּדוֹן, שֶׁחַיָּיבִין עַל זְדוֹנָהּ מַכּוֹת וְעַל שִׁגְגָתָהּ אָשָׁם בְּכֶסֶף שְׁקָלִים. מִדְּקָאָמַר לֵיהּ עַל זְדוֹנָהּ מַכּוֹת – מִכְּלָל דְּאַתְרוֹ בֵּיהּ; וְקָאָמַר מַכּוֹת אִין, קׇרְבָּן לָא.
human_translation: They said to We learn oath on a deposit are more stringent than as liable lashes for intentionally and for unwittingly a guilt-offering worth silver shekels; From that states for intentionally is liable lashes, by inference forewarned him, and it is stating: Yes, lashes, not an offering.
llm_translation: They said to him, we learn: A donkey is liable for the oath of deposit, that one is obligated for its intentional act with lashes and for its unintentional act with a guilt offering of shekels. From what it says about its intentional act with lashes - this includes everything; and it says lashes no, not a sacrifice.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי חוּמְרָא? דְּנִיחָא לֵיהּ לְאִינִישׁ דְּמַיְיתֵי קׇרְבָּן וְלָא לִילְקֵי.
human_translation: And what is the stringency a person prefers to bring an offering rather than receive lashes.
llm_translation: And what is the stringency? That it is preferable for a person to die than to transgress the prohibition of idolatry.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ רָבָא בַּר אִיתַּי: מַאן תָּנָא זְדוֹן שְׁבוּעַת הַפִּקָּדוֹן לֹא נִיתַּן לְכַפָּרָה – רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן; אֲבָל לְרַבָּנַן – קׇרְבָּן נָמֵי מַיְיתֵי.
human_translation: Rava bar Itai said to who taught intentionally a false oath on a deposit is not subject to atonement? Rabbi Shimon. But to the Rabbis, bring offering, as well
llm_translation: He said to them, Rava son of Ittai: Who is the Tanna that taught that a presumptuous oath of a deposit is not given for atonement? - Rabbi Shimon; but according to the Rabbis, a guilt-offering is brought.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב כָּהֲנָא: בַּר מִינַּהּ דְּהַהִיא; דַּאֲנָא תָּנֵינָא לַהּ – וְהָכִי תָּנֵינָא לַהּ: אֶחָד זְדוֹנָהּ וְאֶחָד שִׁגְגָתָהּ, אָשָׁם בְּכֶסֶף שְׁקָלִים. וּמַאי חוּמְרָא? דְּאִילּוּ הָתָם חַטָּאת בַּת דַּנְקָא, וְהָכָא אָשָׁם בְּכֶסֶף שְׁקָלִים.
human_translation: Rav Kahana said to Apart from this, as I teaches and this I teach it: either intentionally or unwittingly a guilt-offering worth silver shekels. And what the stringency that there, a sin-offering worth one-sixth and here, guilt-offering worth silver shekels.
llm_translation: He said to them, Rav Kahana: in the case of that daughter of hers; for we have taught her - and thus we have taught her: one intentionally and one unintentionally, a guilt offering of silver shekels. And what is the stringency? That even there it is a sin offering of a young animal, and here it is a guilt offering of silver shekels.

hebrew_text: וְלִיגְמַר מִינַּהּ! דִּלְמָא דְּלָא אַתְרוֹ בֵּיהּ.
human_translation: And let him derive from Perhaps where they did not forewarn him;
llm_translation: And to conclude its type! Perhaps it is not found in it.

hebrew_text: לִישָּׁנָא אַחֲרִינָא, תָּא שְׁמַע: אֵין חַיָּיבִין עַל שִׁגְגָתָהּ. מָה הֵן חַיָּיבִין עַל זְדוֹנָהּ? אָשָׁם בְּכֶסֶף שְׁקָלִים. מַאי, לָאו בִּדְאַתְרוֹ בֵּיהּ? הָכָא נָמֵי דְּלָא אַתְרוֹ בֵּיהּ.
human_translation: a different version Come hear One is not liable for unwittingly. what is he liable for intentionally A guilt-offering worth silver shekels. What, is it not where forewarned him, Here, too, where did not forewarn him.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Another teaching: One is not liable for her unintentional act. What is one liable for her intentional act? A guilt offering of silver shekels. What, is it not in its place? Here too, it is not in its place.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: לֹא; אִם אָמַרְתָּ בְּנָזִיר טָמֵא – שֶׁכֵּן לוֹקֶה; תֹּאמַר בִּשְׁבוּעַת הַפִּקָּדוֹן – שֶׁאֵינוֹ לוֹקֶה?! מִדְּקָאָמַר לוֹקֶה – מִכְּלָל דְּאַתְרוֹ בֵּיהּ; וְקָאָמַר תֹּאמַר בִּשְׁבוּעַת הַפִּקָּדוֹן שֶׁאֵינוֹ לוֹקֶה – אֲבָל קׇרְבָּן מַיְיתֵי!
human_translation: Come hear No, if you said with regard to an impure nazirite, who is indeed flogged shall you say with regard to an oath on a deposit, who is not flogged? from that states is flogged, by inference where forewarned him, and states: Shall you say with regard to an oath on a deposit, who is not flogged? But bring offering.
llm_translation: Come and hear: No; if you say regarding a nazirite who is impure - that he is liable; will you say regarding a pledge of deposit - that he is not liable?! From the fact that it says he is liable - this is included in it; and it says will you say regarding a pledge of deposit that he is not liable - but a sacrifice is brought!

hebrew_text: מַאי אֵינוֹ לוֹקֶה – דְּאֵינוֹ נִפְטָר בְּמַלְקוֹת. מִכְּלָל דְּנָזִיר טָמֵא נִפְטָר בְּמַלְקוֹת?! הָא ״קׇרְבָּן״ כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ! הָתָם דְּמַיְיתֵי קׇרְבָּן כִּי הֵיכִי דְּתֵיחוּל עֲלֵיהּ נְזִירוּת בְּטׇהֳרָה.
human_translation: What he is not flogged? that not exempted through lashes By inference, that an impure nazirite is exempted through lashes Isn’t it written with regard to him an offering? there, brings an offering in order that his naziriteship can go into effect in purity.
llm_translation: What is the reason he is not lashed? - Because he is not exempt through lashes. From the general principle that a Nazirite who is impure is exempt through lashes?! But "offering" is written in it! There, it is because he compares the offering, so that the Nazirite status may be prolonged in purity.

hebrew_text: אַמְרוּהָ רַבָּנַן קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבָּה. אֲמַר לְהוּ: מִכְּלָל דְּכִי לָא אַתְרוֹ בֵּיהּ וְאִיכָּא עֵדִים – מִיחַיַּיב?! כְּפִירַת דְּבָרִים בְּעָלְמָא הוּא! אַלְמָא קָסָבַר רַבָּה: הַכּוֹפֵר בְּמָמוֹן שֶׁיֵּשׁ עָלָיו עֵדִים – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: The Sages said before Rabba, said to them: by inference that when they did not warn him but there are witnesses he is liable merely a verbal denial Evidently, Rabba holds one who denies a monetary to which there are witnesses exempt
llm_translation: The sages said before Rabba. He said to them: From the fact that if there are no witnesses found with him, is he liable?! It is merely a denial of words! This implies that Rabba holds: One who denies a monetary claim when there are witnesses against him is exempt.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב חֲנִינָא לְרַבָּה, תַּנְיָא דִּמְסַיַּיע לָךְ: ״וְכִחֵשׁ בָּהּ״ – פְּרָט לְמוֹדֶה לְאֶחָד מִן הָאַחִין אוֹ לְאֶחָד מִן הַשּׁוּתָּפִין. ״וְנִשְׁבַּע עַל שָׁקֶר״ – פְּרָט לְלֹוֶה בִּשְׁטָר וּלְלֹוֶה בְּעֵדִים.
human_translation: Rav Ḥanina said to Rabba: is taught that supports your “And deal falsely therein” exclude one who admits to one of brothers or to one of partners, “And swear to a lie,” exclude one who borrows with note or one who borrows in witnesses.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Chanina to Rabba, a teaching that supports you: "And deny it" - excluding admitting to one of the brothers or to one of the partners. "And swear falsely" - excluding a lender with a document and a lender with witnesses.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי מִשּׁוּם הָא – לָא תְּסַיְּיעַן; בְּאוֹמֵר ״לָוִיתִי, וְלֹא לָוִיתִי בְּעֵדִים״, ״לָוִיתִי, וְלֹא לָוִיתִי בִּשְׁטָר״.
human_translation: said to him: If because of that you have not supported us, where says: I borrowed, but I did not borrow in witnesses, I borrowed, but I did not borrow with note.
llm_translation: He said to him: If it is because of this - you will not assist; by saying "I have lent, and I did not lend with witnesses", "I have lent, and I did not lend with a contract".

hebrew_text: מִמַּאי? מִדְּקָתָנֵי ״וְכִחֵשׁ בָּהּ״ – פְּרָט לְמוֹדֶה לְאֶחָד מִן הָאַחִין אוֹ לְאֶחָד מִן הַשּׁוּתָּפִין. הַאי לְאֶחָד מִן הָאַחִין הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵּימָא דְּאוֹדִי לֵיהּ בְּפַלְגָא דִּידֵיהּ – הָא אִיכָּא כְּפִירָה דְּאִידַּךְ! אֶלָּא לָאו דְּאָמְרִי לֵיהּ: מִתַּרְוֵינַן יְזַפְתְּ; וַאֲמַר לְהוּ: לָא, מֵחַד מִינַּיְיכוּ יְזַפִי – דְּהָוְיָא לֵיהּ כְּפִירַת דְּבָרִים בְּעָלְמָא? וּמִדְּרֵישָׁא כְּפִירַת דְּבָרִים – סֵיפָא נָמֵי כְּפִירַת דְּבָרִים.
human_translation: From where From that it teaches “and deal falsely therein” exclude one who admits to one of the brothers or to one of the partners. What are the circumstances of that to one of the brothers? If we say that he admitted the portion to that Isn’t there the denial of the other Rather, is it not that said to him: You borrowed from both of us, and he said to them: No, I borrowed from one of you, which is merely a verbal denial, And since the first clause a verbal denial, the last clause also a verbal denial.
llm_translation: From what? From where do we derive "and he denies it" - to exclude admitting to one of the brothers or to one of the partners. How is it similar to admitting to one of the brothers? If you say that he admits to him partially - there is a contradiction in his statement! Rather, if they say to him: "You may refine your words," and he says to them: "No, refine from one of your types" - this would be considered a refinement of words in general? And from the beginning, a refinement of words - the end is also a refinement of words.

hebrew_text: (סִימָן – חוֹבָה; כִּיתּוֹת; דְּבַעַל הַבַּיִת; חוֹמֶר; נְזִירָא) תָּא שְׁמַע: אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב עַל שִׁגְגָתָהּ. וּמַהוּ חַיָּיב עַל זְדוֹנָהּ? אָשָׁם בְּכֶסֶף שְׁקָלִים. מַאי, לָאו זְדוֹן עֵדִים? לָא, זְדוֹן עַצְמוֹ.
