human_translation: a mnemonic Liability, sets, of the homeowner, stringent, nazirite. Come hear He is not liable for unwittingly And what is he liable for intentionally a guilt-offering worth silver shekels. What, is it not intentionally witnesses, No, on his own intentionally
llm_translation: Topic - Obligation; Categories; Of the homeowner; Stringency; Nazirite Come and hear: One is not liable for its unintentional act. And what is one liable for its intentional act? A guilt offering with silver shekels. What, is it not intentional without witnesses? No, it is intentional by itself.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הָיוּ שְׁתֵּי כִּתֵּי עֵדִים, כָּפְרָה הָרִאשׁוֹנָה וְאַחַר כָּךְ כָּפְרָה הַשְּׁנִיָּה – שְׁתֵּיהֶן חַיָּיבוֹת, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁיְּכוֹלָה עֵדוּת לְהִתְקַיֵּים בִּשְׁתֵּיהֶן. בִּשְׁלָמָא שְׁנִיָּה תִּחַיַּיב – דְּהָא כָּפְרָה לָהּ כַּת רִאשׁוֹנָה; אֶלָּא רִאשׁוֹנָה אַמַּאי מִיחַיְּיבָא?
human_translation: Come hear there were two sets of witnesses the first denied and then the second denied both are liable, because the testimony can exist with either of them. Granted, the second should be liable, since the first set denied But why is first liable?
llm_translation: Come and hear: If there were two sets of witnesses, the first set atoned and then the second set atoned - both are liable, because the testimony can be upheld by both. It is understandable that the second set is liable - since the atonement for her is like the first; but why is the first liable?

hebrew_text: הָא קָיְימָא שְׁנִיָּה!
human_translation: Doesn’t the second stand
llm_translation: This is the way it stands!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – כְּגוֹן שֶׁהָיְתָה שְׁנִיָּה בִּשְׁעַת כְּפִירַת הָרִאשׁוֹנָה קְרוֹבִין בִּנְשׁוֹתֵיהֶן, וּנְשׁוֹתֵיהֶן גּוֹסְסוֹת. מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: רוֹב גּוֹסְסִין לְמִיתָה; קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: הַשְׁתָּא מִיהַת חָיֵי נִינְהוּ וְלָא שְׁכִיבֵי.
human_translation: Ravina said: Here we are dealing with where at the time of the denial by the first the second were related through their wives, and their wives were moribund. Lest you say: Most moribund people die teaches us in any event they are currently alive and have not died.
llm_translation: Ravina said: Here we are dealing with what? For example, if a woman was second during the first period of menstruation, their husbands are close to them, and their wives are repulsive. What is the reason? Lest you say: Most repulsive ones are for death; it teaches us: Now they are alive and not dead.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: בַּעַל הַבַּיִת שֶׁטָּעַן טַעֲנַת גַּנָּב בְּפִקָּדוֹן, וְנִשְׁבַּע, וְהוֹדָה, וּבָאוּ עֵדִים; אִם עַד שֶׁלֹּא בָּאוּ עֵדִים הוֹדָה – מְשַׁלֵּם קֶרֶן וָחוֹמֶשׁ וְאָשָׁם. אִם מִשֶּׁבָּאוּ עֵדִים הוֹדָה – מְשַׁלֵּם תַּשְׁלוּמֵי כֶפֶל וְאָשָׁם!
human_translation: Come hear a homeowner who claimed a thief a deposit and took an oath and admitted and witnesses came If he admitted before witnesses came pays principal and one-fifth and a guilt-offering If he admitted after witnesses came he pays double payment and a guilt-offering.
llm_translation: Come and hear: A homeowner who loaded a stolen load in his deposit, and he swore, and admitted, and witnesses came; if before witnesses came he admitted - he pays principal, and a fifth, and guilt offering. If after witnesses came he admitted - he pays double payment and guilt offering!

hebrew_text: הָכָא נָמֵי, כִּדְרָבִינָא.
human_translation: Here, too, as Ravina
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Here it is stated, as in the teaching of Ravina.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי, תָּא שְׁמַע: חֲמוּרָה מִמֶּנָּה שְׁבוּעַת הַפִּקָּדוֹן – שֶׁחַיָּיבִין עַל זְדוֹנָהּ מַכּוֹת, וְעַל שִׁגְגָתָהּ אָשָׁם בְּכֶסֶף שְׁקָלִים. מִדְּקָאָמַר לוֹקֶה – מִכְּלָל דְּאִיכָּא עֵדִים; וְקָאָמַר: עַל שִׁגְגָתָהּ אָשָׁם בְּכֶסֶף שְׁקָלִים!
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: Come hear an oath on a deposit are more stringent than as liable lashes for intentionally and a guilt-offering worth silver shekels for unwittingly. From that states is flogged, by inference where there are witnesses and states: a guilt-offering worth silver shekels for unwittingly.
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi, "Come and hear: More severe than it, the oath of deposit - for intentional violation, one is liable for lashes, and for unintentional violation, a guilt offering of silver shekels. From the fact that it says 'he shall be punished' - this implies the presence of witnesses; and it says: for unintentional violation, a guilt offering of silver shekels!"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב מָרְדֳּכַי: בַּר מִינַּהּ דְּהַהִיא; דְּהָאָמַר לְהוּ רַב כָּהֲנָא: אֲנָא תְּנֵינָא לַהּ – וְהָכִי תְּנֵינָא לַהּ: אֶחָד זְדוֹנָהּ וְאֶחָד שִׁגְגָתָהּ, אָשָׁם בְּכֶסֶף שְׁקָלִים.
human_translation: Rav Mordekhai said to them: Apart from this, As, didn’t Rav Kahana already say to I teaches and this I teach it: either intentionally or unwittingly a guilt-offering worth silver shekels.
llm_translation: He said to them, Rav Mordechai: "Son of that one; for he said to them, Rav Kahana: 'I will teach her' - and thus he taught her: 'One intentional and one unintentional, a guilt offering of silver shekels.'

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: לֹא; אִם אָמַרְתָּ בְּנָזִיר טָמֵא – שֶׁכֵּן לוֹקֶה; תֹּאמַר בִּשְׁבוּעַת הַפִּקָּדוֹן – שֶׁאֵינוֹ לוֹקֶה?! הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דְּלֵיכָּא עֵדִים – אַמַּאי לוֹקֶה? אֶלָּא פְּשִׁיטָא דְּאִיכָּא עֵדִים; וְקָתָנֵי: תֹּאמַר בִּשְׁבוּעַת הַפִּקָּדוֹן שֶׁאֵינוֹ לוֹקֶה; מִלְקָא הוּא דְּלָא לָקֵי – אֲבָל קׇרְבָּן מַיְיתֵי; תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרַבָּה! תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: Come hear No, if you said with regard to an impure nazirite, who is indeed flogged shall you say with regard to an oath on a deposit, who is not flogged? What are the circumstances If where there were no witnesses, why is flogged? Rather, obvious that there are witnesses, and teaches: Shall you say with regard to an oath on a deposit, who is not flogged? he does not receive lashes but bring an offering, The refutation of Rabba a conclusive refutation.
llm_translation: Come and hear: No; if you say regarding a Nazirite who is impure – that he is liable; will you say regarding a Pekidah oath – that he is not liable?! How so? If there are no witnesses – why is he liable? Rather, it is obvious that there are witnesses; and it is taught: If you say regarding a Pekidah oath that he is not liable; it is because he is not liable – but he brings a sacrifice; a refutation of Rabah! A refutation.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: הַכּוֹפֵר בְּמָמוֹן שֶׁיֵּשׁ עָלָיו עֵדִים – חַיָּיב. בִּשְׁטָר – פָּטוּר. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: מַאי טַעְמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן? עֵדִים – עֲבִידִי דְּמָיְיתִי, שְׁטָר – הָא מַנַּח.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: One who denies a monetary to which there are witnesses liable concerning note, exempt. Rav Pappa said: What is the reasoning of Rabbi Yoḥanan? occurs that witnesses die, note remains
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: One who denies a monetary claim when there are witnesses against him - is liable. In a document - he is exempt. Rav Papa said: What is the reasoning of Rabbi Yochanan? Witnesses - are actions of resemblance, a document - is left aside.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ לְרַב פָּפָּא: שְׁטָרָא נָמֵי עֲבִיד דְּמִרְכַס! אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: הַיְינוּ טַעְמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן – מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵה שְׁטָר שִׁעְבּוּד קַרְקָעוֹת, וְאֵין מְבִיאִין קׇרְבָּן עַל כְּפִירַת שִׁעְבּוּד קַרְקָעוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said to Rav Pappa: also occurs that a promissory note becomes lost. Rather, Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: This is the reasoning of Rabbi Yoḥanan: because note a lien on land, and one does not bring an offering for denying a lien on land,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Huna son of Rav Yehoshua said to Rav Papa: A document is also made of merchandise! Rather, Rav Huna son of Rav Yehoshua said: This is the reason of Rabbi Yochanan - because it is a document of servitude of lands, and one does not bring an offering on the denial of servitude of lands.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: מַשְׁבִּיעַ עֵדֵי קַרְקַע – פְּלִיגִי רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר; חַד אָמַר חַיָּיב, וְחַד אָמַר פָּטוּר. תִּסְתַּיַּים דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן דְּאָמַר פָּטוּר – מִדְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הַכּוֹפֵר בְּמָמוֹן שֶׁיֵּשׁ עָלָיו עֵדִים – חַיָּיב, שְׁטָר – פָּטוּר; וְכִדְרַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ. תִּסְתַּיַּים.
human_translation: was stated: administers an oath to witnesses of land Rabbi Yoḥanan and Rabbi Elazar disagree: One says liable and one says exempt. It may be concluded that Rabbi Yoḥanan who says exempt. from that Rabbi Yoḥanan says: One who denies a monetary to which there are witnesses liable, note exempt. And in accordance with of Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, it may be concluded.
llm_translation: It was stated: One who swears regarding land - Rabbi Yochanan and Rabbi Elazar disagree; one says liable, and one says exempt. The matter is concluded according to Rabbi Yochanan who says exempt - as Rabbi Yochanan said: One who denies a monetary claim with witnesses against him is liable, but with a document he is exempt; and so did Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua. The matter is concluded.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה לְרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: לֵימָא רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בִּפְלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר וְרַבָּנַן קָא מִיפַּלְגִי? דִּתְנַן: הַגּוֹזֵל שָׂדֶה מֵחֲבֵירוֹ וּשְׁטָפָהּ נָהָר – חַיָּיב לְהַעֲמִיד לוֹ שָׂדֶה. דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אוֹמֵר לוֹ ״הֲרֵי שֶׁלְּךָ לְפָנֶיךָ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said to Rabbi Abbahu: Shall we say Rabbi Yoḥanan and Rabbi Elazar disagree with regard to the dispute of Rabbi Eliezer and the Rabbis? As we learned one who robbed another of a field and a river flooded it, liable to provide a different field, the statement of Rabbi Eliezer. And the Rabbis say: he say to That which is yours is before you.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Yirmiyah to Rabbi Avahu: Let us say, did Rabbi Yochanan and Rabbi Elazar disagree in the case of Rabbi Eliezer and the sages? For we learned: One who steals a field from his fellow and irrigates it with a river - he is obligated to establish a field for him. These are the words of Rabbi Eliezer. And the sages say: He says to him, "Here is yours before you."

hebrew_text: וְאָמְרִינַן: בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר דָּרֵישׁ רִבּוּיֵי וּמִיעוּטֵי, וְרַבָּנַן דָּרְשִׁי כְּלָלֵי וּפְרָטֵי.
human_translation: And we say: With regard to what do they disagree? Rabbi Eliezer interprets amplifications and restrictions, and the Rabbis interpret generalizations and details.
llm_translation: And we say: With what do they disagree? Rabbi Eliezer expounds on inclusives and exclusives, and the Rabbis expound on generalizations and specifications.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר דָּרֵישׁ רִבּוּיֵי וּמִיעוּטֵי: ״וְכִחֵשׁ בַּעֲמִיתוֹ״ – רִיבָּה, ״בְּפִקָּדוֹן אוֹ בִתְשׂוּמֶת יָד״ – מִיעֵט, ״אוֹ מִכֹּל אֲשֶׁר יִשָּׁבַע״ – חָזַר וְרִיבָּה.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer interprets amplifications and restrictions. and deal falsely with his neighbor” amplified “In a matter of deposit or of pledge,” restricted “Or of anything about which he has sworn falsely, it then amplified
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer expounded: "And he denies with his fellow" - this is an increase; "whether it is a deposit or a loan" - this is a decrease; "or with anything about which he swears" - he retracts and increases.

hebrew_text: רִיבָּה וּמִיעֵט וְרִיבָּה – רִיבָּה הַכֹּל. מַאי רִיבָּה? רִיבָּה כֹּל מִילֵּי; וּמַאי מִיעֵט? מִיעֵט שְׁטָרוֹת.
human_translation: amplified and restricted and amplified amplified everything What has amplified has amplified everything And what restricted It restricted documents,
llm_translation: Dispute and diminish and dispute - dispute encompasses everything. What is dispute? Dispute includes all matters; and what is diminish? Diminish pertains to documents.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן דָּרְשִׁי כְּלָלֵי וּפְרָטֵי: ״וְכִחֵשׁ בַּעֲמִיתוֹ״ – כְּלָל, ״בְּפִקָּדוֹן אוֹ בִתְשׂוּמֶת יָד אוֹ בְגָזֵל״ – פְּרָט, ״אוֹ מִכֹּל אֲשֶׁר יִשָּׁבַע עָלָיו״ – חָזַר וְכָלַל. כְּלָל וּפְרָט וּכְלָל – אִי אַתָּה דָן אֶלָּא כְּעֵין הַפְּרָט.
human_translation: And the Rabbis interpreted generalizations and details. “and deal falsely with his neighbor” a generalization, “in a matter of deposit or of pledge, or of robbery,” a detail. “Or of anything about which he has sworn it then generalized a generalization, and a detail, and a generalization, you may deduce only similar to the detail.
llm_translation: The sages expounded generalizations and specifics: "And he denies his fellow" - generalization, "whether in a deposit or in a loan or in theft" - specification, "or in anything about which he might swear falsely" - he went back and generalized. Generalization, specification, and generalization - you can only judge based on the nature of the specification.

hebrew_text: מָה הַפְּרָט מְפוֹרָשׁ – דָּבָר הַמִּטַּלְטֵל וְגוּפוֹ מָמוֹן; אַף כׇּל דָּבָר הַמִּטַּלְטֵל וְגוּפוֹ מָמוֹן. יָצְאוּ קַרְקָעוֹת – שֶׁאֵין (מטלטל) [מִטַּלְטְלִין]; יָצְאוּ עֲבָדִים – שֶׁהוּקְּשׁוּ לְקַרְקָעוֹת; יָצְאוּ שְׁטָרוֹת – שֶׁאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁמִּטַּלְטְלִין, אֵין גּוּפָן מָמוֹן.
human_translation: just as the detail, is explicitly movable property and intrinsic monetary so too, anything that is movable property and intrinsic monetary land has been excluded, as it is not movable property. slaves have been excluded, as they are compared to land documents have been excluded because although they movable property, they do not intrinsic monetary
llm_translation: The specific explicit detail - something that is movable and its essence is money; so too, anything that is movable and its essence is money. If the floor tiles were removed - they are not considered movable; if the slaves were removed - because they are attached to the floor tiles; if the documents were removed - even though they are movable, their essence is not money.

hebrew_text: מַאן דִּמְחַיֵּיב – כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, וּמַאן דְּפָטַר – כְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: one who deems liable in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer, and the one who deems exempt, in accordance with the Rabbis,
llm_translation: One who obligates - like Rabbi Eliezer, and one who exempts - like the Sages.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא; מַאן דִּמְחַיֵּיב – כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר; וּמַאן דְּפָטַר אָמַר לָךְ: בְּהָא אֲפִילּוּ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר מוֹדֶה, דְּרַחֲמָנָא אָמַר ״מִכֹּל״ – וְלֹא הַכֹּל.
human_translation: said to No, one who deems liable in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer. But the one who deems exempt said to you: In this even Rabbi Eliezer concedes as the Merciful One states: “Of anything and not: Everything
llm_translation: He said to him: No; whoever is liable - like Rabbi Eliezer; and whoever is exempt, he said to you: in this even Rabbi Eliezer agrees, for the Merciful One said "from all" - and not all.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: מַתְנִיתִין נָמֵי דַּיְקָא, דְּקָתָנֵי: ״גָּנַבְתָּ אֶת שׁוֹרִי״, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר: ״לֹא גָּנַבְתִּי״; ״מַשְׁבִּיעֲךָ אֲנִי״, וְאָמַר: ״אָמֵן״ – חַיָּיב. וְאִילּוּ ״גָּנַבְתָּ אֶת עַבְדִּי״ – לָא קָתָנֵי; מַאי טַעְמָא? לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּעֶבֶד אִיתַּקַּשׁ לְקַרְקָעוֹת, וְאֵין מְבִיאִין קׇרְבָּן עַל כְּפִירַת שִׁעְבּוּד קַרְקָעוֹת?
human_translation: Rav Pappa said in the name of Rava: The mishna is also precisely as it teaches: You stole my ox, and says: I did not steal I administer an oath to you, and said: Amen, liable. whereas does not teach You stole my slave. What is the reason? Is it not due to the fact that slave is compared to land, and one is not liable to bring an offering for a denial a lien on land?
llm_translation: Rav Papa said in the name of Rava: The Mishnah in the precise language teaches: "You stole my ox," and he says, "I did not steal it"; "I adjure you," and he says, "Amen" – he is liable. But if it were "You stole my slave," it does not teach. What is the reason? Not because a slave is attached to the ground, and one does not bring an offering for the denial of the service of the ground?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פַּפֵּי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: אֵימָא סֵיפָא, זֶה הַכְּלָל: כׇּל הַמְשַׁלֵּם עַל פִּי עַצְמוֹ – חַיָּיב, וְשֶׁאֵינוֹ מְשַׁלֵּם עַל פִּי עַצְמוֹ – פָּטוּר. ״זֶה הַכְּלָל״ לְאֵתוֹיֵי מַאי? לָאו לְאֵתוֹיֵי ״גָּנַבְתָּ אֶת עַבְדִּי״?
human_translation: Rav Pappi said in the name of Rava: say the last clause This is the principle: any that pay based on his own liable. And not pay based on his own exempt, What is added This is the principle? Is it not to include You stole my slave,
llm_translation: Rav Pappa said in the name of Rava: Say the latter part, this is the principle: anyone who pays according to his own admission - is liable, and one who does not pay according to his own admission - is exempt. "This is the principle" - to include what? Not to include "You have stolen my servant"?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵהָא לֵיכָּא לְמִשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Rather, no to be learned from
llm_translation: Rather, from here it is possible to infer it.

hebrew_text: שְׁבוּעַת הַפִּקָּדוֹן כֵּיצַד? ״תֵּן לִי פִּקָּדוֹן שֶׁיֵּשׁ לִי בְּיָדְךָ״ כּוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כְּלָל – אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אַחַת. פְּרָט – חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת. דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: ״שְׁבוּעָה לֹא לְךָ וְלֹא לְךָ וְלֹא לָךְ״ – חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת.
human_translation: What is the case of an oath on a deposit? said to Give me my deposit, which is in your possession, the Sages taught included he is liable only one specified he is liable for each and every the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says oath nothing yours and nothing yours, and nothing yours, liable for each and every
llm_translation: The oath of deposit, how so? "Give me a deposit that I have in your possession." So it was taught by the sages: General - one is liable only for one. Specific - one is liable for each and every one. These are the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: "An oath 'not yours, not yours, not yours' - one is liable for each and every one."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: ״לֹא לְךָ וְלֹא לְךָ וְלֹא לְךָ, שְׁבוּעָה״ – חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: עַד שֶׁיֹּאמַר שְׁבוּעָה לְכׇל אַחַת וְאַחַת.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says Nothing yours and nothing yours, and nothing yours, oath, liable for each and every Rabbi Shimon says: unless he says: oath, to each and every
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: "Not yours, not yours, not yours, an oath" - obligated for each and every one. Rabbi Shimon says: Until he says an oath to each and every one.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כְּלָלוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי מֵאִיר – פְּרָטוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יְהוּדָה; כְּלָלוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יְהוּדָה – פְּרָטוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: by Rabbi Meir a general by Rabbi Yehuda a specific by Rabbi Yehuda a general by Rabbi Meir a specific
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: The general principle of Rabbi Meir is the specific detail of Rabbi Yehudah; the general principle of Rabbi Yehudah is the specific detail of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: הַכֹּל מוֹדִים בִּ״וְלֹא לָךְ״ – שֶׁהוּא פְּרָט; לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ אֶלָּא בְּ״לֹא לָךְ״ – שֶׁרַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר פְּרָט, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר כְּלָל. וְאֵיזֶהוּ כְּלָלוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי מֵאִיר? ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁאֵין לָכֶם בְּיָדִי״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: All concede in And nothing yours, that it is specific They disagree only with regard to Nothing of yours, As Rabbi Meir says: specific, and Rabbi Yehuda says: general. And what is a general to Rabbi Meir, oath nothing yours in my possession.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Everyone agrees on "and not to you" - that it is a detail; they only disagreed on "not to you" - that Rabbi Meir says it is a detail, and Rabbi Yehuda says it is a general principle. And what is the general principle of Rabbi Meir? "An oath that is not in my hand."

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? שְׁמוּאֵל דָּיֵיק מִבָּרַיְיתָא, וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן דָּיֵיק מִמַּתְנִיתִין. שְׁמוּאֵל דָּיֵיק מִבָּרַיְיתָא: מִדְּקָאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה ״וְלֹא לָךְ״ פְּרָטָא הָוֵי – מִכְּלָל דְּשַׁמְעֵיהּ לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר דְּאָמַר כְּלָלָא הָוֵי, וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: פְּרָטָא הָוֵי.
human_translation: With regard to what do they disagree Shmuel inferred from the baraita , and Rabbi Yoḥanan inferred from the mishna. Shmuel inferred from the baraita From that Rabbi Yehuda says And nothing yours, is a specific by inference that understood that Rabbi Meir said it is a general and Rabbi Yehuda said to him: it is a specific
llm_translation: With what do they disagree? Shmuel's reasoning is derived from a baraita, and Rabbi Yohanan's reasoning is derived from mishnaic teachings. Shmuel's reasoning is derived from a baraita: since Rabbi Yehuda said, "And not for you," it is a specific exclusion - from the general principle that Rabbi Meir holds, who says it is a general principle. And Rabbi Yehuda said to him: it is a specific exclusion.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: תַּרְוַיְיהוּ לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר פְּרָטָא הָוֵי; וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: בִּ״וְלֹא לָךְ״ מוֹדֵינָא לָךְ, בְּ״לֹא לָךְ״ פְּלִיגְנָא עֲלָךְ. וּשְׁמוּאֵל – עַד דְּאוֹדִי לֵיהּ אוֹדוֹיֵי, לִפְלוֹג עֲלֵיהּ אִיפְּלוֹגֵי!
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan says Both are specific by Rabbi Meir; and Rabbi Yehuda said to him: With regard to: And nothing yours, I concede to you with regard to: Nothing yours, I disagree with you And Shmuel Instead of conceding, let him disagree
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Both to Rabbi Meir specifics be; and said to him Rabbi Yehuda: "With 'not for you' we agree for you, with 'not for you' we argue against you." And Shmuel - until he admits, let him admit, to argue against him let us argue!

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן דָּיֵיק מִמַּתְנִיתִין – מִדְּקָאָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר: ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁאֵין לָכֶם בְּיָדִי״ – כְּלָלָא הָוֵי, מִכְּלָל דִּ״וְלֹא לָךְ״ – פְּרָטָא הָוֵי; דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ ״וְלֹא לָךְ״ כְּלָלָא הָוֵי – אַדְּמַשְׁמַע לַן ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁאֵין לָכֶם בְּיָדִי״, נַשְׁמְעִינַן ״שְׁבוּעָה לֹא לָךְ וְלֹא לָךְ וְלֹא לָךְ״, כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁאֵין לָכֶם בְּיָדִי״!
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan inferred from the mishna From that Rabbi Meir, says: oath nothing yours in my possession, it is a general by inference that And nothing yours, is specific. As if it would enter your mind And nothing yours, a general instead of teaching us oath nothing yours in my possession, let him teach us oath nothing yours and nothing yours, and nothing yours, all the more so oath nothing yours in my possession,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan precisely deduces from the Mishnah - as Rabbi Meir said: "An oath that is not in your hand" - is a generalization, from the generalization of "and not to you" - is a specification; for if it were not for your opinion that "and not to you" is a generalization - we would think that "an oath that is not in your hand" applies to us, we would infer "an oath that is not for you and not for you and not for you," all the more so "an oath that is not in your hand"!

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: כׇּל הָאוֹמֵר ״וְלֹא לָךְ״, כְּאוֹמֵר ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁאֵין לָכֶם בְּיָדִי״ דָּמֵי.
human_translation: And Shmuel says Anyone who says: And nothing yours, is as though he says oath nothing yours in my possession.
llm_translation: Samuel said: Anyone who says "and not to you," it is like saying "an oath that you have no power in my hand" is similar.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: ״לֹא לָךְ וְלֹא לָךְ וְלֹא לָךְ״! תְּנִי: ״לֹא לָךְ״.
human_translation: We learned nothing of yours and nothing yours, and nothing yours, teach: Nothing yours,
llm_translation: We have learned: "Not for you, and not for you, and not for you!" Teach: "Not for you."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״תֵּן לִי פִּקָּדוֹן וּתְשׂוּמֶת יָד וְגָזֵל וַאֲבֵידָה״! תְּנִי: ״תְּשׂוּמֶת יָד גָּזֵל אֲבֵידָה״.
human_translation: Come hear Give me my deposit, and pledge, and stolen item, and lost item teach: a pledge, a stolen item, a lost item,
llm_translation: "Come and hear: 'Give me a deposit, and a pledge, and theft, and lost property!' Teach: 'A pledge, theft, lost property.'"

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״תֵּן לִי חִטִּין וּשְׂעוֹרִין וְכוּסְּמִין״! תְּנִי: ״שְׂעוֹרִין כּוּסְּמִין״.
human_translation: Come hear Give me wheat, and barley, and spelt teach: barley, spelt,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ta shma: 'ten li chitim u'se'orin ve'kusemin'!" Teni: "se'orin kusemin." English translation: "Come and hear: 'Give me wheat, barley, and spelt!' Teach: 'Barley and spelt.'"

hebrew_text: וְהַאי תַּנָּא כֹּל הָכִי שָׁבֵישׁ תָּנֵי וְאָזֵיל?! אֶלָּא הָא מַנִּי – רַבִּי הִיא, דְּאָמַר: לָא שְׁנָא ״כְּזַיִת, כְּזַיִת״, וְלָא שְׁנָא ״כְּזַיִת וּכְזַיִת״ – פְּרָטָא הָוֵי.
human_translation: But this tanna errs so much as he teaches Rather, whose is this It is Rabbi who says: is no difference An olive-bulk an olive-bulk, is no difference An olive-bulk and an olive-bulk; are specific
llm_translation: This Tanna is so stubborn, he teaches and goes away?! Rather, this is the explanation - it is Rabbi Hiya, who said: It does not matter "like an olive, like an olive," and it does not matter "like an olive and like an olive" - it is a specific detail.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע מִדִּידֵיהּ: רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר, אֲפִילּוּ ״חִטָּה וּשְׂעוֹרָה וְכוּסֶּמֶת״ – חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת. תְּנִי: ״חִטָּה שְׂעוֹרָה כּוּסֶּמֶת״.
human_translation: Come hear from own Rabbi Meir says: Even grain of wheat, or grain of barley, or grain of spelt, liable for each and every teach: a grain of wheat, a grain of barley, a grain of spelt
llm_translation: Come and hear from his words: Rabbi Meir says, even "wheat, barley, and spelt" - one is obligated for each and every one. It was taught: "wheat, barley, spelt."

hebrew_text: מַאי ״אֲפִילּוּ״? אָמַר רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִיקָא: אֲפִילּוּ חִטָּה בִּכְלַל חִטִּין, וּשְׂעוֹרָה בִּכְלַל שְׂעוֹרִין, וְכוּסֶּמֶת בִּכְלַל כּוּסְּמִין.
human_translation: What Even? Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Ika, said: Even wheat includes wheat, and barley includes barley, and spelt includes spelt,
llm_translation: What is "even"? Rav Acha, son of Rav Ika, said: Even wheat is included in the category of grains, and barley in the category of barley, and spelt in the category of spelt.

hebrew_text: ״תֵּן לִי פִּקָּדוֹן וּתְשׂוּמֶת יָד גָּזֵל וַאֲבֵידָה שֶׁיֵּשׁ לִי בְּיָדְךָ״ כּוּ׳. ״תֵּן לִי חִטִּין וּשְׂעוֹרִין״ – אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: פְּרוּטָה מִכּוּלָּם מִצְטָרֶפֶת.
human_translation: Give me my deposit, and pledge, stolen item, and lost item that are in your possession, etc. Give me wheat and barley, Rabbi Yoḥanan says: all of the peruta , combines
llm_translation: "Give me a deposit and the placement of stolen property and lost property that I have in your possession." - Leviticus 5:23. "Give me wheat and barley." - Rabbi Yochanan said: A small coin joins all of them.

hebrew_text: פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ רַב אַחָא וְרָבִינָא – חַד אָמַר: אַפְּרָטֵי מִיחַיַּיב, אַכְּלָלֵי לָא מִיחַיַּיב; וְחַד אָמַר: אַכְּלָלֵי נָמֵי מִיחַיַּיב.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa and Ravina disagree with regard to One says he is liable for specific he is not liable for general And one says he is liable also for the general
llm_translation: They disputed it: Rav Acha and Ravina - one said: specific cases are liable, general cases are not liable; and one said: even general cases are liable.

hebrew_text: וְהָתָנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: הֲרֵי כָּאן חֲמֵשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה חַטָּאוֹת; וְאִם אִיתָא – עֶשְׂרִים הָוְיָין! הַאי תַּנָּא – דִּפְרָטֵי קָא חָשֵׁיב, דִּכְלָלֵי לָא קָא חָשֵׁיב.
human_translation: But didn’t Rabbi Ḥiyya teach there are fifteen sin-offerings here And if it is so there would be twenty That tanna calculated the specific he did not calculate the general
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: And it was taught by Rabbi Chiya: Here are fifteen sins; and if it is so - they are twenty! This Tanna - for specific cases is considered, for general cases is not considered.

hebrew_text: וְהָא תָּנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: ״הֲרֵי כָּאן עֶשְׂרִים חַטָּאוֹת״! הָהִיא אַפִּקָּדוֹן וּתְשׂוּמֶת יָד וְגָזֵל וַאֲבֵידָה.
human_translation: But didn’t Rabbi Ḥiyya teach There are twenty sin-offerings here? That to a deposit and a pledge and a stolen item and a lost item.
llm_translation: And here it was taught by Rabbi Chiya: "Behold here are twenty sins!" That deposit, setting aside, theft, and lost item.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רָבָא מֵרַב נַחְמָן: הָיוּ חֲמִשָּׁה תּוֹבְעִין אוֹתוֹ, וְאָמְרוּ לוֹ: ״תֵּן לָנוּ פִּקָּדוֹן תְּשׂוּמֶת יָד וְגָזֵל וַאֲבֵידָה שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָנוּ בְּיָדְךָ״; אָמַר לְאֶחָד מֵהֶן: ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁאֵין לְךָ בְּיָדִי פִּקָּדוֹן תְּשׂוּמֶת יָד גָּזֵל וַאֲבֵידָה, וְלֹא לָךְ וְלֹא לָךְ וְלֹא לָךְ וְלֹא לָךְ״ – מַהוּ? אַחֲדָא מִיחַיַּיב,
human_translation: Rava raised a dilemma before Rav Naḥman: five were suing and they said to him: Give us back our deposit, pledge, and stolen item, and lost item that are in your possession, said to one of them: oath your deposit, pledge, stolen item, and lost item not in my possession, and neither yours, and neither yours, and neither yours, and neither yours, what is he liable for one
llm_translation: Rava asked a question from Rav Nachman: There were five people who were suing him, and they said to him: "Give us a deposit that you have in your possession, a pledge, a stolen item, and a lost item that we have in your possession." He said to one of them: "I swear that you do not have in my possession a deposit, a pledge, a stolen item, or a lost item, not for you, not for you, not for you, not for you" - what is the law? One of them is liable.

hebrew_text: אוֹ דִלְמָא אַכׇּל חֲדָא וַחֲדָא מִיחַיַּיב?
human_translation: Or perhaps he is liable for each and every
llm_translation: Or perhaps one might say, if one ate each one separately, is he liable?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּתָנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: הֲרֵי כָּאן עֶשְׂרִים חַטָּאוֹת. הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דְּפָרֵישׁ – רַבִּי חִיָּיא מִנְיָנָא אֲתָא לְאַשְׁמוֹעִינַן? אֶלָּא לָאו דְּלָא פָּרֵישׁ – וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ פְּרָטָא הָוֵי?
human_translation: Come hear that Rabbi Ḥiyya taught There are twenty sin-offerings here What are the circumstances If specified Rabbi Ḥiyya come to teach us a number? Rather, is it not where he did not specify And conclude from is specific.
llm_translation: Come and hear, as taught by Rabbi Chiya: Here are twenty sins. How so? If he separated - Rabbi Chiya, from where does he come to inform us? Rather, if he did not separate - and learn from it that it is a specific detail?

hebrew_text: אָנַסְתָּ וּפִתִּיתָ אֶת בִּתִּי כּוּ׳. אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן? הוֹאִיל וְעִיקַּר קְנָס הוּא תּוֹבֵעַ.
human_translation: You raped or you seduced my daughter, Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: What is the reasoning of Rabbi Shimon? since is primarily claiming the fine
llm_translation: You were forced and you seduced my daughter. So said Rabbi Chiya bar Abba, in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: What is the reason for Rabbi Shimon's opinion? Because the main penalty is the one who demands it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מָשָׁל דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, לְמָה הַדָּבָר דּוֹמֶה? לְאָדָם שֶׁאָמַר לַחֲבֵירוֹ: ״תֵּן לִי חִטִּין וּשְׂעוֹרִין וְכוּסְּמִין שֶׁיֵּשׁ לִי בְּיָדְךָ״, אָמַר לוֹ: ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁאֵין לְךָ בְּיָדִי חִטִּין״; וְאִשְׁתְּכַח דְּחִטִּין הוּא דְּלֵית לֵיהּ, הָא שְׂעוֹרִין וְכוּסְּמִין אִית לֵיהּ – דְּפָטוּר; דְּכִי אִשְׁתְּבַע אַחִטִּין – אַקּוּשְׁטָא מִשְׁתְּבַע.
human_translation: Rava says: To what of Rabbi Shimon compared? to where a person said to another: Give me my wheat and barley and spelt that are in your possession, said to him: oath your wheat not in my possession; and it was discovered that it wheat that he did not have, but he did have barley and spelt. that he is exempt as when he took an oath with regard to the wheat, he took a truthful oath.
llm_translation: Rava said: A parable of Rabbi Shimon, to what is the matter similar? To a person who said to his friend: "Give me wheat, barley, and spelt that I have in your possession." He said to him: "I swear that you do not have wheat in my possession"; and it was found that he indeed did not have wheat, then he is exempt. For if he demanded barley or spelt – he is liable; because if he demands wheat – the oath is taken from him.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: מִי דָּמֵי?! הָתָם – בְּחִטִּין קָא כָפַר לֵיהּ, בִּשְׂעוֹרִין וְכוּסְּמִין לָא קָא כָפַר לֵיהּ. הָכָא – בְּכוּלַּהּ מִילְּתָא הוּא דְּקָא כָפַר לֵיהּ! הָא לָא דָּמְיָא אֶלָּא לְאוֹמֵר לַחֲבֵירוֹ: ״תֵּן לִי חִטִּין וּשְׂעוֹרִין וְכוּסְּמִין שֶׁיֵּשׁ לִי בְּיָדְךָ״, ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁאֵין לְךָ בְּיָדִי כְּלָל״; וְאִשְׁתְּכַח חִטִּין הוּא דְּלֵית לֵיהּ, הָא שְׂעוֹרִין וְכוּסְּמִין אִית לֵיהּ – דְּמִיחַיַּיב!
human_translation: Abaye said to Are comparable? There, denies wheat, does not deny his barley and spelt. Here, denies the entire matter, this is comparable only to said to another: Give me my wheat and barley and spelt that are in your possession, oath nothing yours in my possession at all, and it was discovered wheat that he did not have, but he did have barley and spelt. that he is liable
llm_translation: He said to him, Abaye: Who is similar?! There - with wheat he atones for it, with barley and sesame he does not atone for it. Here - in all of it is the matter that he atones for it! This is not similar except to saying to his friend: "Give me wheat and barley and sesame that I have in your possession," "An oath that you have nothing at all in my possession"; and it was found that there is no wheat, but there is barley and sesame - for he is liable!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לְדִבְרֵי רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן – קְנָס הוּא תּוֹבֵעַ, וְלֹא בּוֹשֶׁת וּפְגָם; לְדִבְרֵי חֲכָמִים – אַף בּוֹשֶׁת וּפְגָם הוּא תּוֹבֵעַ. בְּמַאי קָא מִיפַּלְגִי? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן סָבַר: לָא שָׁבֵיק אִינִישׁ מִידֵּי דְּקִיץ, וְתָבַע מִידֵּי דְּלָא קִיץ. וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: לָא שָׁבֵיק מִידֵּי דְּכִי מוֹדֵה בֵּיהּ לָא מִיפְּטַר, וְתָבַע מִידֵּי דְּכִי מוֹדֵה בֵּיהּ מִיפְּטַר.
human_translation: Rather, when Ravin came Rabbi Yoḥanan said: to the statement of Rabban Shimon, is claiming fine and not humiliation and degradation to the statement of the Rabbis, he is also claiming humiliation and degradation With regard to what do they disagree? Rav Pappa said: Rabbi Shimon holds: A person does not forgo something with a fixed and claim something whose not fixed And the Rabbis hold not forgo something that is not exempt if he admits and claim something that is exempt if he admits
llm_translation: Rather, when Ravin came, Rabbi Yochanan said: According to the words of Rabban Shimon - he demands a penalty, not embarrassment and blemish; according to the words of the Sages - he also demands embarrassment and blemish. What are they disagreeing about? Rav Papa said, Rabban Shimon holds: A person does not relinquish his claim from that which is obvious, and he demands from that which is not obvious. And the Sages hold: A person does not relinquish from that which he admits to, he is not exempt, and he demands from that which he admits to, he is exempt.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ שְׁבוּעַת הַפִּקָּדוֹן
llm_translation: The pledge of redemption will be with you.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ שְׁבוּעַת הַדַּיָּינִין – הַטַּעֲנָה שְׁתֵּי כֶּסֶף, וְהַהוֹדָאָה בְּשָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה. וְאִם אֵין הַהוֹדָאָה מִמִּין הַטַּעֲנָה – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: oath by the judges the claim is two silver and the admission is the value of one peruta . And if the admission is not of type the claim, exempt
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: The oath of the litigants - the claim is two silver coins, and the admission is equivalent to a perutah. And if the admission is not of the same kind as the claim - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד? ״שְׁתֵּי כֶּסֶף לִי בְּיָדְךָ״, ״אֵין לְךָ בְּיָדִי אֶלָּא פְּרוּטָה״ – פָּטוּר. ״שְׁתֵּי כֶּסֶף וּפְרוּטָה לִי בְּיָדְךָ״, ״אֵין לְךָ בְּיָדִי אֶלָּא פְּרוּטָה״ – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: How so? I have two silver in your possession, You have only one peruta , in my possession, exempt I have two silver and one peruta in your possession, You have only one peruta in my possession, liable
llm_translation: "How so? 'Two silver coins are in your hand,' 'You only have a penny in your hand' - exempt. 'Two silver coins and a penny are in your hand,' 'You only have a penny in your hand' - liable."

hebrew_text: ״מָנֶה לִי בְּיָדְךָ״, ״אֵין לְךָ בְּיָדִי״ – פָּטוּר. ״מָנֶה לִי בְּיָדְךָ״, ״אֵין לְךָ בְּיָדִי אֶלָּא חֲמִשִּׁים דִּינָר״ – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: I have one hundred dinars in your possession, Nothing yours in my possession, exempt, I have one hundred dinars in your possession, You have only fifty dinars in my possession, liable
llm_translation: "Maneh to me in your hand," "You do not have in my hand" - exempt. "Maneh to me in your hand," "You do not have in my hand except fifty dinars" - liable.

hebrew_text: ״מָנָה לְאַבָּא בְּיָדְךָ״, ״אֵין לְךָ בְּיָדִי אֶלָּא חֲמִישִּׁים דִּינָר״ – פָּטוּר, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא כְּמֵשִׁיב אֲבֵידָה.
human_translation: father had one hundred dinars in your possession, You have only fifty dinars in my possession, exempt as he is like one returning a lost item,
llm_translation: "Manah to Abba in your hand," "You have in my hand only fifty dinars" - exempt, because he is like one who returns a lost object.

hebrew_text: ״מָנֶה לִי בְּיָדְךָ״, אָמַר לוֹ ״הֵן״; לְמָחָר אָמַר לוֹ: ״תְּנֵהוּ לִי״, ״נְתַתִּיו לָךְ״ – פָּטוּר. ״אֵין לְךָ בְּיָדִי״ – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: I have one hundred dinars in your possession, said to him: Yes, the next day said to him: Give to me, I gave it to you, exempt. Nothing yours in my possession, liable
llm_translation: "Maneh to me in your hand," he said to him, "Yes"; the next day he said to him: "Give it to me," "I have given it to you" - exempt. "You do not have in my hand" - liable.

hebrew_text: ״מָנֶה לִי בְּיָדְךָ״, אָמַר לוֹ ״הֵן״; ״אַל תִּתְּנֵהוּ לִי אֶלָּא בְּעֵדִים״, לְמָחָר אָמַר לוֹ ״תְּנֵהוּ לִי״, ״נְתַתִּיו לָךְ״ – חַיָּיב, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁצָּרִיךְ לִיתְּנוֹ בְּעֵדִים.
human_translation: I have one hundred dinars in your possession, said to him: Yes, Give to me only in witnesses, the next day said to him: Give to me, I gave it to you, liable as required to give it in witnesses,
llm_translation: "Maneh to me in your hand," he said to him, "Yes"; "Do not give it to me except with witnesses," the next day he said to him, "Give it to me," "I have given it to you" - he is liable, because he needed to give it with witnesses.

hebrew_text: ״לִיטְרָא זָהָב יֵשׁ לִי בְּיָדְךָ״, ״אֵין לְךָ בְּיָדִי אֶלָּא לִיטְרָא כֶּסֶף״ – פָּטוּר. ״דִּינַר זָהָב יֵשׁ לִי בְּיָדְךָ״, ״אֵין לְךָ בְּיָדִי אֶלָּא דִּינָר כֶּסֶף וּטְרֵיסִית וּפוּנְדָּיוֹת וּפְרוּטָה״ – חַיָּיב, שֶׁהַכֹּל מִין מַטְבֵּעַ אַחַת.
human_translation: I have a litra , of gold in your possession, You have only a litra of silver in my possession, exempt I have a gold dinar in your possession, You have only a silver dinar, or a tereisit , or a pundeyon , or a peruta in my possession, liable as all one type; coins.
llm_translation: "The litra of gold I have in your possession," "You only have in my possession a litra of silver" - exempt. "The dinar of gold I have in your possession," "You only have in my possession a dinar of silver, and a trisit and pundayot and prutah" - liable, because all are of the same currency."

hebrew_text: ״כּוֹר תְּבוּאָה לִי בְּיָדְךָ״, ״אֵין לְךָ בְּיָדִי אֶלָּא לֶתֶךְ קִטְנִית״ – פָּטוּר. ״כּוֹר פֵּירוֹת לִי בְּיָדְךָ״, ״אֵין לְךָ בְּיָדִי אֶלָּא לֶתֶךְ קִטְנִית״ – חַיָּיב, שֶׁהַקִּטְנִית בִּכְלַל פֵּירוֹת.
human_translation: I have a kor of grain in your possession, You have only a half- kor of legumes in my possession, exempt. I have a kor of produce in your possession, You have only a half- kor of legumes in my possession, liable, as legumes are included in produce.
llm_translation: "‘A heap of produce is in your hand,’ ‘You only have a small basket in your hand’ – exempt. ‘A heap of fruits is in your hand,’ ‘You only have a small basket in your hand’ – liable, because the small basket is included in fruits."

hebrew_text: טְעָנוֹ חִטִּין, וְהוֹדָה לוֹ בִּשְׂעוֹרִין – פָּטוּר. וְרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל מְחַיֵּיב.
human_translation: claimed him wheat, and admitted to him barley, exempt; and Rabban Gamliel deems liable
llm_translation: He claims wheat, and admits to barley - exempt. And Rabban Gamliel obligates.

hebrew_text: הַטּוֹעֵן לַחֲבֵירוֹ בְּכַדֵּי שֶׁמֶן, וְהוֹדָה לוֹ בְּקַנְקַנִּים – אַדְמוֹן אוֹמֵר: הוֹאִיל וְהוֹדָה לוֹ מִקְצָת מִמִּין הַטַּעֲנָה, יִשָּׁבַע. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵין הַהוֹדָאָה מִמִּין הַטַּעֲנָה. אָמַר רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: רוֹאֶה אֲנִי אֶת דִּבְרֵי אַדְמוֹן.
human_translation: one who claims another jugs of oil, and admitted him pitchers, Admon says: Since he admitted to him a part of the type the claim, he must take an oath. And the Rabbis say: The admission is not of type the claim, Rabban Gamliel said: I see the statement of Admon
llm_translation: The one who loads onto his friend with a pitcher of oil, and he admits to him with jugs - Admon says: Since he admitted to him partially from the type of loading, he should swear. And the sages say: The admission is not from the type of loading. Rabban Gamliel said: I see the words of Admon.

hebrew_text: טְעָנוֹ כֵּלִים וְקַרְקָעוֹת; וְהוֹדָה בַּכֵּלִים וְכָפַר בַּקַּרְקָעוֹת, בַּקַּרְקָעוֹת וְכָפַר בַּכֵּלִים – פָּטוּר. הוֹדָה בְּמִקְצָת הַקַּרְקָעוֹת – פָּטוּר. בְּמִקְצָת הַכֵּלִים – חַיָּיב, שֶׁהַנְּכָסִים שֶׁאֵין לָהֶן אַחְרָיוּת זוֹקְקִין אֶת הַנְּכָסִים שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהֶן אַחְרָיוּת לִישָּׁבַע עֲלֵיהֶן.
human_translation: claimed him vessels and land, and admitted to vessels but denied land, to land but denied vessels, exempt he admitted to part the land, exempt. to part the vessels, liable as property that does not serve as a guarantee, binds the property that serves as a guarantee, to take an oath concerning
llm_translation: He loaded vessels and floors; and admitted regarding the vessels and atoned regarding the floors, atoned regarding the floors and admitted regarding the vessels - exempt. If he admitted regarding some of the floors - exempt. If he admitted regarding some of the vessels - liable, because properties that do not have succession are established by the properties that have succession to swear upon them.

hebrew_text: אֵין נִשְׁבָּעִין עַל טַעֲנַת חֵרֵשׁ שׁוֹטֶה וְקָטָן, וְאֵין מַשְׁבִּיעִין אֶת הַקָּטָן; אֲבָל נִשְׁבָּעִין לַקָּטָן וְלַהֶקְדֵּשׁ.
human_translation: One does not take an oath concerning the claim of a deaf-mute, an imbecile, or a minor. And does not administer an oath to a minor. But one does take an oath to a minor, or to the Temple
llm_translation: Swearing is not imposed on the claim of a deaf-mute, an imbecile, or a minor, and one does not impose an oath on a minor; but oaths are imposed on a minor and on a proselyte.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הֵיכִי מַשְׁבְּעִינַן לֵיהּ? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: מַשְׁבִּיעִין אוֹתוֹ בִּשְׁבוּעָה הָאֲמוּרָה בְּתוֹרָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְאַשְׁבִּיעֲךָ בַּה׳ אֱלֹהֵי הַשָּׁמַיִם״.
human_translation: How administer an oath to Rav Yehuda says Rav says: administers to him the oath stated in the Torah, as it is written “And I will make you swear by the Lord, the God of heaven”
llm_translation: Gemara: How do we administer an oath to him? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: We administer the oath to him with the prescribed week mentioned in the Torah, as it is written: "And I shall adjure you by the Lord, the God of heaven."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: כְּמַאן – כְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר אִידִי, דְּאָמַר: בָּעֵינַן שֵׁם הַמְיוּחָד?
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: In accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi Ḥanina bar Idi, who says we require the ineffable name
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: According to whom - like Rabbi Chanina bar Idi, who said: Do we require the unique name?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבָּנַן, דְּאָמְרִי בְּכִינּוּי; וְנָפְקָא מִינַּהּ צְרִיךְ לְאַתְפּוֹשֵׂי חֶפְצָא בִּידֵיהּ.
human_translation: said to him: You even say the Rabbis, who say using an appellation And ramification one must grasp item in his hand
llm_translation: He said to him: Even if you say they are scholars, who speak in a derogatory manner; and it emerged from her, one must grab the object in her hand.

hebrew_text: וְכִדְרָבָא – דְּאָמַר רָבָא: הַאי דַּיָּינָא דְּאַשְׁבַּע ״בַּה׳ אֱלֹהֵי הַשָּׁמַיִם״ – נַעֲשָׂה כְּמִי שֶׁטָּעָה בִּדְבַר מִשְׁנָה, וְחוֹזֵר. וְאָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: הַאי דַּיָּינָא דְּאַשְׁבַּע בִּתְפִלִּין – נַעֲשָׂה כְּמִי שֶׁטָּעָה בִּדְבַר מִשְׁנָה, וְחוֹזֵר.
human_translation: And in accordance with of Rava; as Rava said: This judge who administers an oath “by the Lord, the God of heaven,” is considered like one who made a mistake with regard to a matter Mishna; revoked, And Rav Pappa said: This judge who administers an oath in phylacteries, is considered like one who made a mistake with regard to a matter Mishna; revoked,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And like Rava - as Rava said: This wine that I swore "by the Lord, the God of heaven" - it becomes like one who erred in a matter of Mishnah, and returns. And Rav Papa said: This wine that I swore by the tefillin - it becomes like one who erred in a matter of Mishnah, and returns.

hebrew_text: וְהִלְכְתָא כְּוָותֵיהּ דְּרָבָא, וְלֵית הִלְכְתָא כְּוָותֵיהּ דְּרַב פָּפָּא. הִלְכְתָא כְּוָותֵיהּ דְּרָבָא – דְּהָא לָא נָקֵיט חֶפְצָא בִּידֵיהּ; וְלֵית הִלְכְתָא כְּוָותֵיהּ דְּרַב פָּפָּא – דְּהָא נָקֵיט חֶפְצָא בִּידֵיהּ.
human_translation: And the halakha in accordance with of Rava, but the halakha not in accordance with of Rav Pappa. The halakha in accordance with of Rava as he was not grasping item in his hand; but the halakha is not in accordance with of Rav Pappa, as he was grasping item in his hand,
llm_translation: The halakha follows the opinion of Rava, and the halakha does not follow the opinion of Rav Papa. The halakha follows the opinion of Rava - because he does not take the object in his hand; and the halakha does not follow the opinion of Rav Papa - because he takes the object in his hand.

hebrew_text: שְׁבוּעָה מְעוּמָּד; תַּלְמִיד חָכָם – מְיוּשָּׁב. שְׁבוּעָה בְּסֵפֶר תּוֹרָה; תַּלְמִיד חָכָם – לְכַתְּחִלָּה בִּתְפִלִּין.
human_translation: an oath while standing, a Torah scholar while sitting. an oath a Torah scroll a Torah scholar phylacteries ab initio .
llm_translation: Oath standing; Torah scholar - sitting. Oath in the book of Torah; Torah scholar - initially with tefillin.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שְׁבוּעַת הַדַּיָּינִין, אַף הִיא בִּלְשׁוֹנָהּ נֶאֶמְרָה.
human_translation: The Sages taught An oath by the judges may also recited in its language,
llm_translation: The Sages taught: The oath of the litigants, it too was stated in its language.

hebrew_text: אוֹמְרִים לוֹ: הֱוֵי יוֹדֵעַ,
human_translation: say to him: Be aware
llm_translation: They say to him: Be aware,

hebrew_text: שֶׁכׇּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ נִזְדַּעְזַע בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁאָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא בְּסִינַי ״לֹא תִשָּׂא אֶת שֵׁם ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ לַשָּׁוְא״.
human_translation: that the entire world trembled when the Holy One, Blessed be He, said at Sinai: “You shall not take the name of the Lord, your God, in vain,
llm_translation: The entire world was shaken at the moment when the Holy One, blessed be He, said at Sinai, "You shall not take the name of the Lord your God in vain."

hebrew_text: וְכׇל עֲבֵירוֹת שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה נֶאֱמַר בָּהֶן ״וְנַקֵּה״, וְכָאן נֶאֱמַר ״לֹא יְנַקֶּה״. וְכׇל עֲבֵירוֹת שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה נִפְרָעִין מִמֶּנּוּ, וְכָאן מִמֶּנּוּ וּמִמִּשְׁפַּחְתּוֹ; שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אַל תִּתֵּן אֶת פִּיךָ לַחֲטִיא אֶת בְּשָׂרֶךָ״ – וְאֵין בְּשָׂרוֹ אֶלָּא קְרוֹבוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּמִבְּשָׂרְךָ לֹא תִּתְעַלָּם״.
human_translation: And with regard to all of the transgressions in the Torah it is stated: “And will…clear the guilty [ venakkeh ]” whereas here, it is stated: “Will not hold guiltless [ lo yenakkeh ].” And all of the transgressions in the Torah, punishment is exacted from here, from him and from his family, as it is stated: “Do not allow your mouth to bring your flesh into guilt” and one’s flesh is nothing other than his relative, as it is stated: “And that you not hide yourself from your own flesh”
llm_translation: And all transgressions in the Torah it is stated regarding them "and he shall be acquitted," and here it is stated "he shall not be acquitted." And all transgressions in the Torah are punished by Him, and here by Him and by his family; as it is said: "Do not give your mouth to cause your flesh to sin" - and his flesh is nothing but his relative, as it is said: "And from your flesh do not hide."

hebrew_text: וְכׇל עֲבֵירוֹת שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה נִפְרָעִין מִמֶּנּוּ, וְכָאן מִמֶּנּוּ וּמִכׇּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ; שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אָלֹה וְכַחֵשׁ״.
human_translation: And all of the transgressions in the Torah, punishment is exacted from here, from him and from the entire world, as it is stated: “Swearing, and lying,
llm_translation: And all sins in the Torah are punished from it, and here from it and from all the world entirely; as it is said: "God is true."

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא עַד דְּעָבֵיד לְהוּ לְכוּלְּהוּ! לָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ; דִּכְתִיב: ״מִפְּנֵי אָלָה אָבְלָה הָאָרֶץ״, וּכְתִיב: ״עַל כֵּן תֶּאֱבַל הָאָרֶץ וְאֻמְלַל כׇּל יוֹשֵׁב בָּהּ״.
human_translation: And say unless he commits all of not enter your mind, as it is written: “Because of swearing the land mourns” And it is written “Therefore, the land mourns, and everyone who dwells therein languishes.”
llm_translation: And why not do it for all of them! Your opinion is not valid; as it is written: "Because of this, the land mourns," and it is also written: "Therefore the land shall mourn, and everyone who dwells in it shall languish."

hebrew_text: וְכׇל עֲבֵירוֹת שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה – אִם יֵשׁ לוֹ זְכוּת, תּוֹלִין לוֹ שְׁנַיִם וּשְׁלֹשָׁה דּוֹרוֹת; וְכָאן נִפְרָעִין מִמֶּנּוּ לְאַלְתַּר – שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הוֹצֵאתִיהָ נְאֻם ה׳ צְבָאוֹת, וּבָאָה אֶל בֵּית הַגַּנָּב וְאֶל בֵּית הַנִּשְׁבָּע בִּשְׁמִי לַשָּׁקֶר, וְלָנֶה בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ וְכִלַּתּוּ וְאֶת עֵצָיו וְאֶת אֲבָנָיו״.
human_translation: And all the transgressions in the Torah, if has merit, suspends his two or three generations, here, punishment is exacted from him immediately, as it is stated: I cause it to go forth, says the Lord of hosts, and it shall enter into the house of the thief, and into the house of he who swears falsely by My name; and it shall abide in the midst of his house and shall consume it, with its timber and its stones”
llm_translation: "And all sins in the Torah - if he has merit, they suspend for him two or three generations; and here we exact from him immediately - as it is stated: 'I have spoken - declares the Lord of hosts - and it will come to the house of the thief and to the house of one who swears falsely by My name; and it will lodge in the midst of his house and consume it, with its timber and stones.'"

hebrew_text: ״הוֹצֵאתִיהָ״ – לְאַלְתַּר. ״וּבָאָה אֶל בֵּית הַגַּנָּב״ – זֶה הַגּוֹנֵב דַּעַת הַבְּרִיּוֹת; שֶׁאֵין לוֹ מָמוֹן אֵצֶל חֲבֵירוֹ, וְטוֹעֲנוֹ וּמַשְׁבִּיעוֹ. ״וְאֶל בֵּית הַנִּשְׁבָּע בִּשְׁמִי לַשָּׁקֶר״ – כְּמַשְׁמָעוֹ. ״וְלָנֶה בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ וְכִלַּתּוּ וְאֶת עֵצָיו וְאֶת אֲבָנָיו״ – הָא לָמַדְתָּ, דְּבָרִים שֶׁאֵין אֵשׁ וּמַיִם מְכַלִּין אוֹתָן, שְׁבוּעַת שֶׁקֶר מְכַלָּה אוֹתָן.
human_translation: “I cause it to go forth” immediately. “And it shall enter into the house of the thief”; this one who deceives people, who has no money in the possession of another, but claims him and administers an oath to him “And into the house of he who swears falsely by My name” as it indicates, “And it shall abide in the midst of his house and shall consume it, with its timber and its stones,” you have therefore learned a false oath consumes things that fire and water do not consume,
llm_translation: I have brought her out - immediately. "And she comes to the house of the thief" - this is one who steals the mind of people; he has no money with his friend, yet he denies and swears. "And swears falsely in My name" - as it sounds. "And consumes within his house and its stones and its timber" - you have learned that things that fire and water do not consume, a false oath consumes them.

hebrew_text: אִם אָמַר: ״אֵינִי נִשְׁבָּע״ – פּוֹטְרִין אוֹתוֹ מִיָּד. וְאִם אָמַר: ״הֲרֵינִי נִשְׁבָּע״ – הָעוֹמְדִין שָׁם אוֹמְרִים זֶה לָזֶה: ״סוּרוּ נָא מֵעַל אׇהֳלֵי הָאֲנָשִׁים הָרְשָׁעִים הָאֵלֶּה וְגוֹ׳״. וּכְשֶׁמַּשְׁבִּיעִין אוֹתוֹ אוֹמְרִים לוֹ: הֱוֵי יוֹדֵעַ, שֶׁלֹּא עַל דַּעְתְּךָ אָנוּ מַשְׁבִּיעִין אוֹתְךָ, אֶלָּא עַל דַּעַת הַמָּקוֹם וְעַל דַּעַת בֵּית דִּין.
human_translation: If says I will not take an oath, dismisses him immediately, And if he says: I will take an oath, the standing there say to each other: “Depart, I pray you, from the tents of these wicked men, And when administer the oath to him, they say to him: Be aware that we administer an oath to you not according to your understanding but according to the understanding of the Omnipresent and according to the understanding of the court,
llm_translation: If he said, "I do not swear," they exempt him immediately. But if he said, "Behold, I swear," those standing there say to each other, "Please depart from the tents of these wicked men, etc." And when they make him swear, they say to him: Be aware that we are making you swear not based on your knowledge, but based on the knowledge of the Omnipresent and the knowledge of the court.

hebrew_text: שֶׁכֵּן מָצִינוּ בְּמֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ, כְּשֶׁהִשְׁבִּיעַ אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל, אָמַר לָהֶן: דְּעוּ, שֶׁלֹּא עַל דַּעְתְּכֶם אֲנִי מַשְׁבִּיעַ אֶתְכֶם, אֶלָּא עַל דַּעַת הַמָּקוֹם וְעַל דַּעְתִּי; שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְלֹא אִתְּכֶם לְבַדְּכֶם וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: as we found with regard to Moses, our teacher. When he administered an oath to the Jewish people he said to them: Know that not according to your understanding that I administer an oath to you, but according to the understanding of the Omnipresent and according to my understanding. As it is stated: “Neither with you only
llm_translation: Talmudic text: So we found in Moses our teacher, when he swore to the Israelites, he said to them: Know that not by your own understanding am I swearing you, but by the understanding of the Omnipresent and by my own understanding; as it is said: "And not with you alone, etc." English translation:

hebrew_text: ״כִּי אֶת אֲשֶׁר יֶשְׁנוֹ פֹּה״ – אֵין לִי אֶלָּא אוֹתָן הָעוֹמְדִין עַל הַר סִינַי; דּוֹרוֹת הַבָּאִים וְגֵרִים הָעֲתִידִין לְהִתְגַּיֵּיר – מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְאֵת אֲשֶׁר אֵינֶנּוּ״.
human_translation: “But with he who stands here I have only those who stood at Mount Sinai From where the subsequent generations, and the converts who will convert in the future, The verse states: “And also with he who is not here
llm_translation: "״כִּי אֶת אֲשֶׁר יֶשְׁנוֹ פֹּה״ – I have only those who stood at Mount Sinai; future generations and converts – from where? The Talmud teaches: 'And those who are not here.'"

hebrew_text: וְאֵין לִי אֶלָּא מִצְוָה שֶׁקִּיבְּלוּ עֲלֵיהֶם מֵהַר סִינַי; מִצְוֹת הָעֲתִידוֹת לְהִתְחַדֵּשׁ, כְּגוֹן מִקְרָא מְגִילָּה – מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״קִיְּמוּ וְקִבְּלוּ״ – קִיְּימוּ מַה שֶּׁקִּבְּלוּ כְּבָר.
human_translation: And I have only mitzvot that accepted upon themselves at Mount Sinai From where mitzvot that were to be initiated in the future, for example, the reading of the Megilla, The verse states: ordained and took They ordained, that they had already accepted
llm_translation: "And I have only a commandment that they accepted upon themselves from Mount Sinai; future commandments to be renewed, such as the reading of the Megillah - from where? The Talmud teaches: 'They established and accepted' - they established what they had already accepted."

hebrew_text: מַאי ״אַף הִיא בִּלְשׁוֹנָהּ נֶאֶמְרָה״?
human_translation: What may also recited in its language?
llm_translation: What is "she too in her own language was spoken"?

hebrew_text: כְּדִתְנַן: אֵלּוּ נֶאֱמָרִין בְּכׇל לְשׁוֹן – פָּרָשַׁת סוֹטָה, וִידּוּי מַעֲשֵׂר, קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע, וּתְפִלָּה, וּבִרְכַּת הַמָּזוֹן, וּשְׁבוּעַת הָעֵדוּת, וּשְׁבוּעַת הַפִּקָּדוֹן. וְקָאָמַר נָמֵי: שְׁבוּעַת הַדַּיָּינִין – אַף הִיא בִּלְשׁוֹנָהּ נֶאֶמְרָה.
human_translation: as we learned These are recited in any language The portion of a woman suspected by her husband of having been unfaithful [ sota ]; the declaration of tithes, the recitation of Shema ; and prayer; and Grace after Meals; and the oath of testimony, and the oath on a deposit, And also states, an oath by the judges may also recited in its language,
llm_translation: As we have learned: These are the matters that are stated in every language - the portion of the Sotah, confession of tithes, recitation of the Shema, prayer, grace after meals, oath of testimony, and oath of deposit. And it was stated by Nami: The oath of litigants - it too was stated in its own language.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר, אוֹמְרִין לוֹ: הֱוֵי יוֹדֵעַ, שֶׁכׇּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ נִזְדַּעְזַע בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁאָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: ״לֹא תִשָּׂא אֶת שֵׁם ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ לַשָּׁוְא״. מַאי טַעְמָא? אִילֵּימָא מִשּׁוּם דְּאִתְיְהֵב בְּסִינַי – עֶשֶׂר דִּבְּרוֹת נָמֵי אִתְיְהֵב!
human_translation: The Master said say to him: Be aware that the entire world trembled when the Holy One, Blessed be He, said: “You shall not take the name of the Lord, your God, in vain.” What is the reason If we say because was given at Sinai, Ten Commandments were also given
llm_translation: Master said, they say to him: Be aware, that the entire world was shaken at the moment the Holy One, blessed be He, said: "You shall not take the name of the Lord your God in vain." What is the reason? If you say because it was given at Sinai - the Ten Commandments were also given there!

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם דַּחֲמִירָא – וּמִי חֲמִירָא?! וְהָתְנַן: אֵלּוּ הֵן קַלּוֹת – עֲשֵׂה וְלֹא תַעֲשֶׂה, חוּץ מִ״לֹּא תִשָּׂא״. חֲמוּרוֹת – זוֹ כָּרֵיתוֹת וּמִיתוֹת בֵּית דִּין, וְ״לֹא תִשָּׂא״ עִמָּהֶן!
human_translation: And rather due to that severe, is it severe But didn’t we learn These are minor positive and negative except for: “You shall not take major excision from the World-to-Come [ karet ] or a court death and “You shall not take among them.
llm_translation: And rather because of the strictness - But who is the strict one?! And we learned in a Mishnah: These are the light prohibitions - positive and negative commandments, except for "do not bear false witness." The severe prohibitions - these are excisions and court-imposed death penalties, and "do not bear false witness" is included with them!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא כִּדְקָתָנֵי טַעְמָא – וְכׇל עֲבֵירוֹת שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה נֶאֱמַר בָּהֶן ״וְנַקֵּה״, וְכָאן נֶאֱמַר ״לֹא יְנַקֶּה״.
human_translation: Rather, the reason as it is taught And with regard to all of the transgressions in the Torah it is stated: “And will…clear the guilty,” whereas here, it is stated: “Will not hold guiltless.”
llm_translation: Rather as it is taught in the Mishnah: And all transgressions in the Torah it is stated regarding them "and he shall be acquitted," but here it is stated "he shall not be acquitted."

hebrew_text: וְכׇל עֲבֵירוֹת שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה לֹא נֶאֱמַר בָּהֶן ״לֹא יְנַקֶּה״?! וְהָכְתִיב: ״וְנַקֵּה לֹא יְנַקֶּה״!
human_translation: And is it not stated with regard to all of the transgressions in the Torah “will not hold guiltless [ lo yenakkeh ]” But isn’t it written: “And Who will by no means clear the guilty [ venakkeh lo yenakkeh ]”
llm_translation: And all transgressions in the Torah it is not stated in them "shall not be acquitted"?! And it is written: "But the one who is acquitted shall not be acquitted"!

hebrew_text: הָהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר – דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: אִי אֶפְשָׁר לוֹמַר ״וְנַקֵּה״ – שֶׁכְּבָר נֶאֱמַר ״לֹא יְנַקֶּה״; אִי אֶפְשָׁר לוֹמַר ״לֹא יְנַקֶּה״ – שֶׁכְּבָר נֶאֱמַר ״וְנַקֵּה״. הָא כֵּיצַד? מְנַקֶּה הוּא לַשָּׁבִים, וְאֵינוֹ מְנַקֶּה לְשֶׁאֵינָן שָׁבִים.
human_translation: That necessary for of Rabbi Elazar, as it is taught Rabbi Elazar says: It is not possible to say: And will clear the guilty [ venakkeh ], since: Will not clear the guilty [ lo yenakkeh ], is already stated. it is not possible to say: Will not clear the guilty [ lo yenakkeh ], since: And will clear the guilty [ venakkeh ], is already stated. How these He, clears those who repent and does not clear those who do not repent.
llm_translation: That one asked him according to Rabbi Elazar - as it was taught, Rabbi Elazar says: If one cannot say "and he shall be acquitted" - because it already says "he shall not be acquitted"; if one cannot say "he shall not be acquitted" - because it already says "and he shall be acquitted." How so? He acquits the repentant, but does not acquit those who are not repentant.

hebrew_text: כׇּל עֲבֵירוֹת שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה נִפְרָעִין מִמֶּנּוּ, וְכָאן מִמֶּנּוּ וּמִמִּשְׁפַּחְתּוֹ. וְכׇל עֲבֵירוֹת שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה מִמִּשְׁפַּחְתּוֹ לָא?!
human_translation: all of the transgressions in the Torah, punishment is exacted from here, from him and from his family. And not from family all of the transgressions in the Torah?
llm_translation: All sins in the Torah are punished by Him, and here from Him and from his family. And all sins in the Torah from his family not?!

hebrew_text: וְהָכְתִיב: ״וְשַׂמְתִּי אֲנִי אֶת פָּנַי בָּאִישׁ הַהוּא וּבְמִשְׁפַּחְתּוֹ״; וְתַנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: אִם הוּא חָטָא, מִשְׁפַּחְתּוֹ מָה חָטָאת? לוֹמַר לְךָ: אֵין לְךָ מִשְׁפָּחָה שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ מוֹכֵס – שֶׁאֵין כּוּלָּהּ מוֹכְסִין; וְשֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ לִסְטִים – שֶׁאֵין כּוּלָּהּ לִסְטִים; מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמְּחַפִּין עָלָיו!
human_translation: But isn’t it written “Then I will set My face against that man, and against his family, And it is taught Rabbi Shimon said: If he sinned, how did his family sin? to tell you there is no family that has tax collector among them which all of are not tax collectors, and that has a bandit [ listim ] among them which all of are not bandits. because they cover for him.
llm_translation: "And it is written: 'And I will set My face against that man and against his family'; and it was taught: Rabbi Shimon said: If he sinned, what sin did his family commit? To tell you: You do not have a family in which there are no tax collectors - for not all of them are tax collectors; and in which there are no scoffers - for not all of them are scoffers; because they cover for him!"

hebrew_text: הָתָם בְּדִינָא אַחֲרִינָא, הָכָא בְּדִינָא דִּידֵיהּ; כִּדְתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: ״וְהִכְרַתִּי אוֹתוֹ״ – מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר? לְפִי שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְשַׂמְתִּי אֲנִי אֶת פָּנַי״ – יָכוֹל כׇּל הַמִּשְׁפָּחָה כּוּלָּהּ בְּהִיכָּרֵת? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אוֹתוֹ״ – אוֹתוֹ בְּהִיכָּרֵת, וְלֹא כׇּל הַמִּשְׁפָּחָה כּוּלָּהּ בְּהִיכָּרֵת.
human_translation: There, with another punishment, here, with his punishment. As it is taught Rabbi says: Why the verse state “And I will cut him off”? Since it is stated “Then I will set My face might the entire family to karet . the verse states: him he to karet , his entire family is not to karet .
llm_translation: There, in a different case; here, in its own case; as it was taught: Rabbi says: "And I will cut him off" - what does the Torah teach us? Because it is stated: "And I will set My face" - could the entire family be cut off? The Torah teaches us: "him" - him for cutting off, and not the entire family for cutting off.

hebrew_text: וְכׇל עֲבֵירוֹת שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה נִפְרָעִין מִמֶּנּוּ, וְכָאן מִמֶּנּוּ וּמִכׇּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ; שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אָלֹה וְכַחֵשׁ״, וּכְתִיב: ״עַל כֵּן תֶּאֱבַל הָאָרֶץ״. וְאֵימָא עַד דְּעָבֵיד לְהוּ לְכוּלְּהוּ! לָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ, דִּכְתִיב: ״מִפְּנֵי אָלָה אָבְלָה הָאָרֶץ״.
human_translation: And all of the transgressions in the Torah, punishment is exacted from him, here, from him and from the entire world, as it is stated: “Swearing and lying, and it is written: “Therefore, the land mourns.” And say unless he commits all not enter your mind, as it is written: “Because of swearing the land mourns”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And all sins in the Torah are punished by Him, and here from Him and from all the world entirely; as it is said: "God and falsehood," and it is written: "Therefore the land mourns." And why not let Him do for all of them! It is not according to your opinion, as it is written: "Because of God, the land mourns."

hebrew_text: וְכׇל עֲבֵירוֹת שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה – מִכׇּל הָעוֹלָם לָא?! וְהָכְתִיב: ״וְכָשְׁלוּ אִישׁ בְּאָחִיו״ – אִישׁ בַּעֲוֹן אָחִיו; מְלַמֵּד שֶׁכׇּל יִשְׂרָאֵל עֲרֵבִים זֶה בָּזֶה!
human_translation: And all of the transgressions in the Torah, not from the entire world? But isn’t it written: “And they shall stumble one upon another” one due to the iniquity of another, teaches that the entire Jewish people are guarantors for one another.
llm_translation: "And all sins in the Torah - from all the world not?! And it is written: 'And a man will stumble over his brother' - a man in the sin of his brother; teaching that all of Israel are responsible for one another!"

hebrew_text: הָתָם שֶׁיֵּשׁ בְּיָדָם לְמַחוֹת, וְלֹא מִיחוּ.
human_translation: There, where had the ability to protest and they did not protest.
llm_translation: There, that there is in their hand to erase, and they do not erase.

hebrew_text: מַאי אִיכָּא בֵּין רְשָׁעִים דְּמִשְׁפַּחְתּוֹ לָרְשָׁעִים דְּעָלְמָא; בֵּין צַדִּיקִים דְּמִשְׁפַּחְתּוֹ לְצַדִּיקִים דְּעָלְמָא?
human_translation: What is there between the wicked in family and wicked of the world, between righteous in his family and righteous of the world?
llm_translation: What is the difference between the wicked whose family is wicked and the wicked of the world; between the righteous whose family is righteous and the righteous of the world?

hebrew_text: הוּא בִּשְׁאָר עֲבֵירוֹת – בְּדִינֵיהּ; וּרְשָׁעִים דְּמִשְׁפָּחָה – בְּדִין חָמוּר; וּרְשָׁעִים דְּעָלְמָא – בְּדִין הַקַּל; צַדִּיקֵי דְּהָכָא וְהָכָא – פְּטִירִי.
human_translation: With regard to other transgressions, himself with his punishment, And wicked of family, with severe punishment, and wicked of the world, with a light punishment. righteous here and here, exempt
llm_translation: He in other sins - in its laws; and wicked ones of the family - in severe judgment; and wicked ones of the world - in lenient judgment; the righteous ones of here and there - exempt.

hebrew_text: גַּבֵּי שְׁבוּעָה, הוּא וּרְשָׁעִים דְּמִשְׁפָּחָה – כְּדִינֵיהּ; וּרְשָׁעִים דְּעָלְמָא – בְּדִין חָמוּר; וְצַדִּיקֵי דְּהָכָא וְהָכָא – בְּדִין הַקַּל.
human_translation: With regard to oath, he and wicked of family with his punishment, And wicked of the world, with a severe punishment, and righteous here, and here, with a light punishment,
llm_translation: Regarding an oath, he and wicked individuals from the same family - according to its law; and wicked individuals of the world - with strict judgment; and righteous individuals from here and there - with lenient judgment.

hebrew_text: אִם אָמַר ״אֵינִי נִשְׁבָּע״ – פּוֹטְרִין אוֹתוֹ מִיָּד, וְאִם אָמַר ״הֲרֵינִי נִשְׁבָּע״ – הָעוֹמְדִים שָׁם אוֹמְרִים זֶה לָזֶה: ״סוּרוּ נָא מֵעַל אׇהֳלֵי הָאֲנָשִׁים הָרְשָׁעִים הָאֵלֶּה״. בִּשְׁלָמָא הָהוּא דְּקָא מִשְׁתְּבַע – קָאֵי בְּאִיסּוּרָא; אֶלָּא הָהוּא דְּקָא מַשְׁבַּע לֵיהּ – אַמַּאי?
human_translation: If says: I will not take an oath, dismisses him immediately, And if he says: I will take an oath, the standing there say to each other: “Depart, I pray you, from the tents of these wicked men.” Granted that one who is taking the oath stands to the prohibition but why is the one administering the oath to him,
llm_translation: If he said, "I do not swear," they exempt him immediately. But if he said, "Behold, I swear," those standing there say to each other, "Please depart from the tents of these wicked men." But the one who is swearing, why?

hebrew_text: הָהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְתַנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן טַרְפוֹן אוֹמֵר: ״שְׁבֻעַת ה׳ תִּהְיֶה בֵּין שְׁנֵיהֶם״ – מְלַמֵּד שֶׁחָלָה שְׁבוּעָה עַל שְׁנֵיהֶם.
human_translation: That necessary for that which is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Tarfon says “The oath of the Lord shall be between them both” teaches that oath applies to both
llm_translation: That one asked him according to the teaching, Rabbi Shimon ben Tarfon says: "The oath of the Lord shall be between the two of them" - teaching that an oath is imposed upon both of them.

hebrew_text: וּכְשֶׁמַּשְׁבִּיעִין אוֹתוֹ, אוֹמְרִים לוֹ: הֱוֵי יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁלֹּא עַל דַּעְתְּךָ וְכוּ׳. לְמָה לִי לְמֵימְרָא לֵיהּ הָכִי? מִשּׁוּם קַנְיָא דְּרָבָא.
human_translation: And when administer the oath to him, they say to him: Be aware that we administer an oath to you not according to your understanding, Why does to say this to him? due to of the reed in Rava’s
llm_translation: And when they satiate him, they say to him: Be aware that it is not according to your knowledge, etc. Why do I need to say it to him like this? Because of Rava's jealousy.

hebrew_text: הַטַּעֲנָה שְׁתֵּי כֶּסֶף. אָמַר רַב: כְּפִירַת טַעֲנָה שְׁתֵּי כֶּסֶף. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: טַעֲנָה עַצְמָהּ שְׁתֵּי כֶּסֶף; אֲפִילּוּ לֹא כָּפַר אֶלָּא בִּפְרוּטָה, וְלֹא הוֹדָה אֶלָּא בִּפְרוּטָה – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: the claim is two silver Rav says the denial of claim two silver And Shmuel says claim itself two silver even denied only one peruta or he admitted to only one peruta liable
llm_translation: The loading two silver. Said Rav: like a loading two silver. And Shmuel said: loading itself two silver; even did not atone except in detail, and did not confess except in detail - liable.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: דַּיְקָא מַתְנִיתִין כְּוָתֵיהּ דְּרַב, וּקְרָאֵי כְּוָתֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל. דַּיְקָא מַתְנִיתִין כְּוָתֵיהּ דְּרַב – דְּקָתָנֵי הַטַּעֲנָה שְׁתֵּי כֶּסֶף וְהַהוֹדָאָה שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה, וְאִילּוּ כְּפִירַת טַעֲנָה פְּרוּטָה לָא קָתָנֵי. וּתְנַן נָמֵי הַהוֹדָאָה בִּפְרוּטָה, וְאִילּוּ כְּפִירָה בִּפְרוּטָה לָא קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: Rava said: the mishna is precise in accordance with of Rav, and the verses are in accordance with of Shmuel. the mishna is precise in accordance with of Rav, as it teaches: The claim two silver and the admission the value of one peruta , whereas it does not teach the denial of claim one peruta , And also, we learned the admission of one peruta , whereas does not teach denial of one peruta .
llm_translation: Rava said: The Mishnah is precise according to the opinion of Rav, and the verses are precise according to the opinion of Shmuel. The Mishnah is precise according to the opinion of Rav - for it teaches that the liability for loading is two silver coins, and the liability for admission is a prutah, while the liability for unloading is not taught as a prutah. And we also learned that admission is with a prutah, and the liability for breaking is not taught as a prutah.

hebrew_text: וּקְרָאֵי כְּוָתֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל – דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי יִתֵּן אִישׁ אֶל רֵעֵהוּ כֶּסֶף אוֹ כֵלִים לִשְׁמוֹר״ – מָה ״כֵּלִים״ שְׁנַיִם, אַף ״כֶּסֶף״ שְׁנַיִם; מָה כֶּסֶף דָּבָר חָשׁוּב, אַף כׇּל דָּבָר חָשׁוּב; וְקָאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: ״כִּי הוּא זֶה״.
human_translation: And the verses are in accordance with of Shmuel, as it is written “If a man delivers to his neighbor silver or vessels to safeguard” just as “vessels,” two, so too, “silver” two just as silver is an item of substantial value, so too, any item of substantial value And the Merciful One states This is it”
llm_translation: The verse of Samuel's like - as it is written: "When a man gives his neighbor money or objects to guard" - just as "objects" are two, so too "money" is two; just as money is a significant matter, so too is any significant matter; and the Merciful One says: "For he is the one."

hebrew_text: וְרַב – הָהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְהוֹדָאָה בְּמִקְצָת הַטַּעֲנָה. וּשְׁמוּאֵל – כְּתִיב ״הוּא״ וּכְתִיב ״זֶה״, דְּאִי כְּפַר בְּמִקְצָת וְאוֹדִי בְּמִקְצָת – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: And Rav that is necessary to admission to a part of the claim, And Shmuel It is written: “This is,” and it is written: “It.” that if denied part and admitted to part, liable
llm_translation: Rav - that one asked him to admit partially to the claim. And Shmuel - it is written "he" and it is written "this," for if he denies part and admits part - he is liable.

hebrew_text: וְרַב – חַד לְהוֹדָאָה בְּמִקְצָת הַטַּעֲנָה, וְחַד לְהוֹדָאָה מִמִּין הַטַּעֲנָה. וּשְׁמוּאֵל – לָאו מִמֵּילָא שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינֵּיהּ דְּחָסְרָה לַהּ טַעֲנָה?
human_translation: And Rav One to admission of a part of the claim, and one to admission of the type of the claim. And Shmuel don’t you derive from this by itself that reduces the claim?
llm_translation: Rav - one for admission in part of the claim, and one for admission from the type of claim. And Shmuel - did you not hear from its type that it lacks a claim?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר לְךָ רַב: ״כֶּסֶף״ כִּי אֲתָא מֵעִיקָּרָא – לִכְפִירָה הוּא דַּאֲתָא; דְּאִם כֵּן, לִכְתּוֹב רַחֲמָנָא: ״כִּי יִתֵּן אִישׁ אֶל רֵעֵהוּ כֵּלִים לִשְׁמוֹר״ – וַאֲנָא אָמֵינָא: מָה כֵּלִים שְׁנַיִם, אַף כֹּל שְׁנַיִם; ״כֶּסֶף״ דִּכְתַב רַחֲמָנָא לְמָה לִי? אִם אֵינוֹ עִנְיָן לְטַעֲנָה, תְּנֵהוּ עִנְיָן לִכְפִירָה.
human_translation: Rather, Rav said to you when “silver” came initially, it came for denial, as if so, let the Merciful One write If a man delivers to his neighbor vessels to safeguard, and I say just as vessels are two, so too, two any why do I “silver” that the Merciful One wrote? if is not matter of claim, apply it matter of denial,
llm_translation: Rather, Rav said to you: "Silver" when it comes from the outset - it is for atonement that it comes; for if not, let the Merciful One write: "When a man gives his neighbor vessels to guard" - and I say: Just as "vessels" are two, so too all are two; why do I need the "silver" that the Merciful One wrote? If it is not for the purpose of atonement, give it for the purpose of atonement.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר לָךְ: אִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״כֵּלִים״ וְלָא כְּתַב ״כֶּסֶף״, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: מַאי כֵּלִים שְׁנַיִם, אַף כֹּל שְׁנַיִם – אֲבָל דָּבָר חָשׁוּב לָא בָּעֵינַן; קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: And Shmuel said to you if the Merciful One had written “vessels” and not written “silver” I would say just as vessels are two, so too, two any but we do not need an item of substantial value. teaches us
llm_translation: Samuel said to you: If the Merciful One wrote "keilim" and did not write "kesef," I would say: What are two keilim? Even all are two - but we do not require something significant; he is informing us.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: ״שְׁתֵּי כֶּסֶף יֵשׁ לִי בְּיָדְךָ״, ״אֵין לְךָ בְּיָדִי אֶלָּא פְּרוּטָה״ – פָּטוּר. מַאי טַעְמָא? לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּחָסְרָה לָהּ טַעֲנָה – וּתְיוּבְתָּא דִּשְׁמוּאֵל?
human_translation: We learned I have two silver in your possession, You have only one peruta in my possession, exempt What is the reason? not because claim was lacking, And a conclusive refutation of Shmuel.
llm_translation: We learned: "I have two silver coins in your hand," "You only have a penny in my hand" - exempt. What is the reason? Not because she lacked a claim - and the response of Shmuel?

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְךָ שְׁמוּאֵל: מִי סָבְרַתְּ שָׁוֶה קָתָנֵי?! דַּוְקָא קָתָנֵי – מַה שֶּׁטְּעָנוֹ לֹא הוֹדָה לוֹ, וּמַה שֶּׁהוֹדָה לוֹ לֹא טְעָנוֹ.
human_translation: Shmuel said to you: Do you maintain is taught value is taught specifically that which he claimed from him, he did not admit to and that which he admitted to, he had not claimed from him.
llm_translation: He said to you, Samuel: Who thinks that the Mishnah is equal?! Specifically, it is equal - what he claims he did not admit, and what he admitted he did not claim.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אֵימָא סֵיפָא: ״שְׁתֵּי כֶּסֶף וּפְרוּטָה יֵשׁ לִי בְּיָדְךָ״, ״אֵין לְךָ בְּיָדִי אֶלָּא פְּרוּטָה״ – חַיָּיב. אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא שָׁוֶה – מִשּׁוּם הָכִי חַיָּיב; אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ דַּוְקָא – אַמַּאי חַיָּיב? מַה שֶּׁטְּעָנוֹ לֹא הוֹדָה לוֹ, וּמָה שֶׁהוֹדָה לוֹ לֹא טְעָנוֹ!
human_translation: If so, say the latter clause: I have two silver and one peruta in your possession, You have only one peruta in my possession, liable Granted, if you say value due to that liable But if you say specifically why liable that which he claimed from him, he did not admit to and that which he admitted to, he had not claimed from him.
llm_translation: If so, say the latter part: "I have two silver coins and a prutah in your possession," "You only have a prutah in my possession" - liable. If you say it is because it is considered equivalent - therefore liable; but if you say specifically - why liable? Whatever he claims, he did not admit to him, and whatever he admitted to him, he did not claim!

hebrew_text: מִידֵּי הוּא טַעְמָא – אֶלָּא לִשְׁמוּאֵל; הָאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן, אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: טְעָנוֹ חִטִּין וּשְׂעוֹרִין וְהוֹדָה לוֹ בְּאֶחָד מֵהֶן – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: Isn’t this discussion only according to Shmuel? doesn’t Rav Naḥman say Shmuel says claimed him wheat and barley, and admitted to him one of them, liable
llm_translation: From him is the reason - rather, according to Shmuel; for Rav Nachman said, Shmuel said: If one loaded wheat and barley and admitted to one of them - he is liable.

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא – מִדְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: ״לִיטְרָא זָהָב יֵשׁ לִי בְּיָדְךָ״, ״אֵין לְךָ בְּיָדִי אֶלָּא לִיטְרָא כֶּסֶף״ – פָּטוּר. אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא דַּוְקָא קָתָנֵי – מִשּׁוּם הָכִי פָּטוּר; אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ שָׁוֶה – אַמַּאי פָּטוּר? לִיטְרָא טוּבָא הָוֵי!
human_translation: This, too, stands to reason, from that the latter clause teaches I have a litra of gold in your possession, You have only a litra of silver in my possession, exempt. Granted, if you say is teaching specifically due to that exempt, But if you say value why exempt? A litra is a large
llm_translation: Thus it was taught in the latter part: "I have a golden dinar in my hand," "You have nothing in your hand except a silver dinar" - he is exempt. If you say that specifically the latter part was taught, it is exempt for this reason; but if you say that it is equal - why is he exempt? A large dinar it is!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מִדְּסֵיפָא דַּוְקָא, רֵישָׁא נָמֵי דַּוְקָא.
human_translation: Rather, from that the latter clause, specifically also the former clause, specifically
llm_translation: Rather, from the end specifically, the beginning is specifically mentioned.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא תֶּיהְוֵי תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרַב? אָמַר לְךָ רַב: כּוּלַּהּ מַתְנִיתִין – שָׁוֶה, וְלִיטְרָא זָהָב שָׁאנֵי.
human_translation: shall we say is a conclusive refutation of Rav? Rav said to you the entire mishna value but a litra of gold is different.
llm_translation: Let us say, should it be the preference of Rav? Rav said to you: The entire Mishnah - equal, and a pound of gold is different.

hebrew_text: תֵּדַע, דְּקָא תָנֵי סֵיפָא: ״דִּינַר זָהָב לִי בְּיָדֶךָ״, ״אֵין לְךָ בְּיָדִי אֶלָּא דִּינָר כֶּסֶף וּטְרֵיסִית וּפוּנְדְּיוֹן וּפְרוּטָה״ – חַיָּיב, שֶׁהַכֹּל מִין מַטְבֵּעַ [אַחַת] הֵן. אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא שָׁוֶה – מִשּׁוּם הָכִי חַיָּיב; אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ דַּוְקָא – אַמַּאי חַיָּיב?
human_translation: Know as it teaches the latter clause I have a gold dinar in your possession, You have only a silver dinar, or a tereisit , or a pundeyon , or a peruta in my possession, liable as they are all one type; coins. Granted, if you say value due to that liable But if you say specifically why liable?
