llm_translation: You should know, that it teaches in the latter part: "A gold dinar is in your hand," "You only have in my hand a silver dinar, a trisit, a pundeyon, and a pruta" - he is liable, because all of them are of the same currency. If you say that they are equal - for this reason he is liable; but if you say specifically - why is he liable?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: בְּשֶׁטְּעָנוֹ בְּדִינָר מַטְבְּעוֹת, וְקָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דִּפְרוּטָה בִּכְלַל מַטְבֵּעַ אִיתָא. דַּיְקָא נָמֵי, דְּקָתָנֵי: שֶׁהַכֹּל מִין מַטְבֵּעַ אַחַת.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: to where claimed him a dinar of coins, And teaches us that a peruta is included in a coin. is also precise, as it teaches: as all one type [ min ]; coins.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: When one claims a dinar of coins, and it is implied to us that a specific coin is included in the general category of coins, it is indeed explicitly stated, as it was taught: "that all are of one coinage."

hebrew_text: וְרַב – שֶׁהַכֹּל דִּין מַטְבֵּעַ אַחַת.
human_translation: And Rav, because all one halakha [ din ]; coins,
llm_translation: And Rav - for all judgment one coin.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר – לֵימָא מִדְּסֵיפָא כִּשְׁמוּאֵל מְתָרֵץ, רֵישָׁא נָמֵי כִּשְׁמוּאֵל סְבִירָא לֵיהּ?
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar, shall we say since he explains the latter clause in accordance with Shmuel, also the former clause, he holds in accordance with Shmuel,
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar - let us say from the conclusion, like Shmuel explains, is the beginning also according to Shmuel's opinion?

hebrew_text: לָא; סֵיפָא דַּוְקָא, דְּקָתָנֵי ״שֶׁהַכֹּל מִין מַטְבֵּעַ אַחַת״; וְרֵישָׁא – כְּרַב אוֹ כִּשְׁמוּאֵל.
human_translation: No, the latter clause specifically as it teaches As all one type; coins. But the former clause in accordance with Rav or in accordance with Shmuel.
llm_translation: Not; the end specifically, that it teaches "that everything is of one kind"; and the beginning - like Rav or like Shmuel.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״דִּינַר זָהָב זָהוּב לִי בְּיָדֶךָ״, ״אֵין לְךָ בְּיָדִי אֶלָּא דִּינַר כֶּסֶף״ – חַיָּיב. טַעְמָא דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ ״זָהָב זָהוּב״, הָא סְתָמָא – שָׁוֶה קָאָמַר לֵיהּ!
human_translation: Come hear I have a coined gold dinar in your possession, You have only a silver dinar in my possession, liable The reason that says to him: a coined gold but an unspecified is saying to him value
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Come and hear: 'A gold dinar is in your hand,' 'You only have a silver dinar in your hand' - liable. The reason he said to him 'gold dinar,' is that he meant to say 'equivalent' to him!" English translation:

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי, הָכִי קָאָמַר: כׇּל הָאוֹמֵר ״דִּינַר זָהָב״, כְּאוֹמֵר ״דִּינַר זָהָב זָהוּב״ דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said this is saying: Anyone who says: A gold dinar, is like one who says: A coined gold dinar;
llm_translation: Rav Ashei said, thus he is saying: Anyone who says "a gold dinar," it is like saying "a gold gold dinar," the value.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא לְסַיּוֹעֵיהּ לְרַב: ״סֶלַע לִי בְּיָדֶךָ״, ״אֵין לְךָ בְּיָדִי אֶלָּא סֶלַע חָסֵר שְׁתֵּי כֶּסֶף״ – חַיָּיב, ״חָסֵר מָעָה״ – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya teaches in support of Rav: I have a sela in your possession, You have only a sela minus two silver in my possession, liable minus one ma’a , exempt.
llm_translation: Rebbe Chiya taught his assistants to Rav: "A rock in your hand," "You have nothing in my hand except a rock worth two silver coins" - liable, "lacking a coin" - exempt.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בְּטַעֲנַת מַלְוֶה וְהוֹדָאַת לֹוֶה; אֲבָל טַעֲנַת מַלְוֶה וְהַעֲדָאַת עֵד אֶחָד, אֲפִילּוּ לֹא טְעָנוֹ אֶלָּא בִּפְרוּטָה – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak says Shmuel says: taught only with regard to claim of creditor and admission of debtor. But claim of creditor and testimony of one witness even claimed from him only one peruta , liable
llm_translation: Rav Nachman son of Yitzchak said in the name of Shmuel: They only taught this regarding the claim of the lender and the admission of the borrower; but in the case of the claim of the lender and the testimony of one witness, even if they only claimed in general terms - he is liable.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? דִּכְתִיב: ״לֹא יָקוּם עֵד אֶחָד בְּאִישׁ לְכׇל עָוֹן וּלְכׇל חַטָּאת״ – לְכׇל עָוֹן וּלְכׇל חַטָּאת הוּא דְּאֵינוֹ קָם, אֲבָל קָם הוּא לִשְׁבוּעָה. וְתַנְיָא: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁשְּׁנַיִם מְחַיְּיבִין אוֹתוֹ מָמוֹן, עֵד אֶחָד מְחַיְּיבוֹ שְׁבוּעָה.
human_translation: What is the reason As it is written: “One witness shall not rise up against a man for any iniquity, or for any sin” it is for any iniquity or for any sin that he may not rise up, but he may rise up to an oath. And it is taught any place where two render liable money, one witness renders him liable an oath.
llm_translation: What is the reason? As it is written: "A single witness shall not rise up against a man for any iniquity or for any sin" - for any iniquity and for any sin, he does not rise up, but he does rise up for an oath. And it was taught: Any place where two obligate him to pay money, a single witness obligates him to take an oath.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: טְעָנוֹ חִטִּין וּשְׂעוֹרִין, וְהוֹדָה לוֹ בְּאֶחָד מֵהֶן – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: And Rav Naḥman says Shmuel says: claimed him wheat and barley, and admitted to him one of liable
llm_translation: And said Rav Nachman said Shmuel: If one loaded wheat and barley, and he admitted to one of them - he is liable.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יִצְחָק: יִישַׁר, וְכֵן אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן. מִכְּלָל דִּפְלִיג עֲלֵיהּ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ? אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: מִישְׁהָא הֲוָה שָׁהֵי לֵיהּ וְשָׁתֵיק לֵיהּ, אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי: מִישְׁתָּא הֲוָה שָׁתֵי לֵיהּ וּשְׁתֵיק לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak said to him: well, and so said Rabbi Yoḥanan. By inference, that Reish Lakish disagrees with There are who say he was tarrying and remaining silent, there are who say was drinking and he remained silent
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Yitzchak: straight, and so said Rabbi Yochanan. From the fact that Reish Lakish argued with him? There are those who say: he would let him speak and remain silent, there are those who say: he would speak and remain silent.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ: טְעָנוֹ חִטִּין וְהוֹדָה לוֹ בִּשְׂעוֹרִין – פָּטוּר. וְרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל מְחַיֵּיב. טַעְמָא דִּטְעָנוֹ חִטִּין וְהוֹדָה לוֹ בִּשְׂעוֹרִין, הָא חִטִּין וּשְׂעוֹרִין וְהוֹדָה לוֹ בְּאֶחָד מֵהֶן – חַיָּיב!
human_translation: Let us say supports claimed him wheat, and admitted to him barley, exempt; and Rabban Gamliel deems liable The reason is that he claimed him wheat and admitted to him barley; but wheat and barley, and admitted to him one of them, liable
llm_translation: Let us say it assists him: if one loads wheat and admits to him regarding barley - he is exempt. And Rabban Gamliel obligates. The reason for loading wheat and admitting to him regarding barley, because wheat and barley and admits to him regarding one of them - he is liable!

hebrew_text: לָא; הוּא הַדִּין דַּאֲפִילּוּ חִטִּין וּשְׂעוֹרִין נָמֵי פָּטוּר; וְהַאי דְּקָמִיפַּלְגִי בְּחִטִּין – לְהוֹדִיעֲךָ כֹּחוֹ דְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל.
human_translation: No, the same is true, that even wheat and barley exempt. And that that disagree with regard to wheat to convey to you the far-reaching nature of Rabban Gamliel,
llm_translation: Not; he the same that even wheat and barley like exempt; and this that he argues in wheat - to inform you the power of Rabban Gamliel.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: טְעָנוֹ כֵּלִים וְקַרְקָעוֹת; הוֹדָה בַּכֵּלִים וְכָפַר בַּקַּרְקָעוֹת, בְּקַרְקָעוֹת וְכָפַר בַּכֵּלִים – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: Come hear claimed him vessels and land, admitted to vessels but denied land, to land but denied vessels, exempt
llm_translation: Come and hear: If one designated vessels and floors; he admitted regarding the vessels and atoned regarding the floors, regarding the floors and atoned regarding the vessels - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: הוֹדָה בְּמִקְצָת קַרְקָעוֹת – פָּטוּר. בְּמִקְצָת כֵּלִים – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: he admitted to part of land, exempt. to part vessels, liable
llm_translation: Acknowledgment in some of the earth - exempt. In some of the vessels - obligated.

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא דְּכֵלִים וְקַרְקָעוֹת – דְּקַרְקַע לָאו בַּת שְׁבוּעָה הִיא; הָא כֵּלִים וְכֵלִים דּוּמְיָא דְּכֵלִים וְקַרְקָעוֹת – חַיָּיב!
human_translation: The reason that vessels and land, as land is not subject to an oath; but vessels and vessels similar to vessels and land liable
llm_translation: Reason of vessels and floors - of floor not in the category of a week; this, vessels and vessels similar to vessels and floors - liable!

hebrew_text: הוּא הַדִּין דַּאֲפִילּוּ כֵּלִים וְכֵלִים נָמֵי פָּטוּר; וְהָא דְּקָתָנֵי כֵּלִים וְקַרְקָעוֹת – קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּכִי הוֹדָה בְּמִקְצָת כֵּלִים, חַיָּיב אַף עַל הַקַּרְקָעוֹת.
human_translation: the same is true, that even vessels and vessels exempt. And that teaches vessels and land teaches us that where admitted to a part of vessels, liable concerning the land as well.
llm_translation: The same law applies even to utensils and utensils are also exempt; and that which was taught regarding utensils and earthenware vessels – it indicates to us that when one admits to some of the utensils, he is liable even for the earthenware vessels.

hebrew_text: מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? זוֹקְקִין?! תְּנֵינָא: ״זוֹקְקִין אֶת הַנְּכָסִים שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהֶן אַחְרָיוּת לִישָּׁבַע עֲלֵיהֶן״!
human_translation: What is teaching us? binds We learn binds the property that serves as a guarantee, to take an oath concerning it
llm_translation: What is it teaching us? Zokkin?! We learned: "Zokkin et hanekhasim sheyesh lahen akhrayut l'yishava alehen"!

hebrew_text: הָא עִיקָּר, הָהִיא אַגַּב גְּרָרָא נַסְבַהּ.
human_translation: This primary that cites it incidentally,
llm_translation: This is the main point: that one, because of the drag.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: טְעָנוֹ חִטִּין וּשְׂעוֹרִין, וְהוֹדָה לוֹ בְּאַחַת מֵהֶן – פָּטוּר. וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: יִישַׁר, וְכֵן אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן! אָמוֹרָאֵי נִינְהוּ אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן.
human_translation: And Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: claimed him wheat and barley, and admitted to him one of them, exempt But doesn’t Rabbi Yitzḥak say well and so said Rabbi Yoḥanan? They are amora’im , with regard to of Rabbi Yoḥanan.
llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said Rabbi Yochanan: If one loaded wheat and barley, and he admitted to one of them - he is exempt. And didn't Rabbi Yitzchak say: Right, and so said Rabbi Yochanan! They are Amoraim in the school of Rabbi Yochanan.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: טְעָנוֹ חִטִּין וְהוֹדָה לוֹ בִּשְׂעוֹרִין – פָּטוּר, וְרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל מְחַיֵּיב. טַעְמָא דִּטְעָנוֹ חִטִּין וְהוֹדָה לוֹ בִּשְׂעוֹרִין; הָא חִטִּין וּשְׂעוֹרִין וְהוֹדָה לוֹ בְּאֶחָד מֵהֶן – חַיָּיב!
human_translation: Come hear claimed him wheat, and admitted to him barley, exempt; and Rabban Gamliel deems liable The reason is that he claimed him wheat and admitted to him barley; but wheat and barley, and admitted to him one of them, liable
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Come and hear: If one loaded with wheat and admitted to him with barley - exempt, and Rabban Gamliel obligates. The reason for loading with wheat and admitting to him with barley; because if one loaded with wheat and barley and admitted to him with one of them - liable!

hebrew_text: הוּא הַדִּין דַּאֲפִילּוּ חִטִּין וּשְׂעוֹרִין נָמֵי פָּטוּר, וְהַאי דְּקָתָנֵי הָכִי – לְהוֹדִיעֲךָ כֹּחוֹ דְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל.
human_translation: the same is true, that even wheat and barley exempt. And that teaches this to convey to you the far-reaching nature of Rabban Gamliel,
llm_translation: It is the same that even wheat and barley are exempt, and this that it teaches thus - to inform you the power of Rabban Gamliel.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: טְעָנוֹ כֵּלִים וְקַרְקָעוֹת; וְהוֹדָה בַּכֵּלִים וְכָפַר בַּקַּרְקָעוֹת, בְּקַרְקָעוֹת וְכָפַר בַּכֵּלִים – פָּטוּר. הוֹדָה בְּמִקְצָת קַרְקַע – פָּטוּר. בְּמִקְצָת כֵּלִים – חַיָּיב. טַעְמָא דְּכֵלִים וְקַרְקָעוֹת – דְּקַרְקַע לָאו בַּת שְׁבוּעָה הִיא; הָא כֵּלִים וְכֵלִים דּוּמְיָא דְּכֵלִים וְקַרְקָעוֹת – חַיָּיב!
human_translation: Come hear claimed him vessels and land, and admitted to vessels but denied land, to land but denied vessels, exempt he admitted to part land, exempt. to part vessels, liable The reason that vessels and land, as land is not subject to an oath; but vessels and vessels similar to vessels and land liable
llm_translation: Come and hear: If one loaded vessels and earthware, and admitted liability regarding the vessels and denied liability regarding the earthware, or admitted liability regarding the earthware and denied liability regarding the vessels - he is exempt. If he admitted liability for some of the earthware - he is exempt. If he admitted liability for some of the vessels - he is liable. The reason for vessels and earthware - because earthware is not subject to the law of the week; whereas vessels and vessels, which are similar to vessels and earthware - he is liable!

hebrew_text: הוּא הַדִּין דַּאֲפִילּוּ כֵּלִים וְכֵלִים נָמֵי פָּטוּר; וְהָא קָמַשְׁמַע לַן – דְּהוֹדָה בְּמִקְצָת כֵּלִים, חַיָּיב אַף עַל הַקַּרְקָעוֹת. מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? זוֹקְקִין?! תְּנֵינָא: זוֹקְקִין אֶת הַנְּכָסִים שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהֶן אַחְרָיוּת, לִישָּׁבַע עֲלֵיהֶן! הָא עִיקָּר, הָהִיא אַגַּב גְּרָרָא נַסְבַהּ.
human_translation: the same is true, that even vessels and vessels exempt. And this teaches us that admitted to a part of vessels, liable concerning the land as well. What is teaching us? binds We learn binds the property that serves as a guarantee, to take an oath concerning it This primary that cites it incidentally.
llm_translation: The same law applies even to vessels and vessels, he is exempt; and this is what we heard - that if one admits to some vessels, he is liable even for the earthenware shards. What does this teach us? Plumbers?! We learned: Plumbers who have succession to the properties, they must take an oath regarding them! The main point is that, in that case, it was due to the drag chain.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר מֶמֶל לְרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא: טְעָנוֹ שׁוֹר וְהוֹדָה לוֹ בְּשֶׂה, שֶׂה וְהוֹדָה לוֹ בְּשׁוֹר – פָּטוּר. טְעָנוֹ בְּשׁוֹר וָשֶׂה וְהוֹדָה לוֹ בְּאֶחָד מֵהֶן – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba bar Memel raised an objection to Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba claimed him an ox, and admitted to him a sheep, a sheep and admitted to him an ox, exempt claimed him an ox and a sheep, and admitted to him one of them, liable
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him, Rabbi Abba bar Memel to Rabbi Chiya bar Abba: If one claims an ox and the other admits to him regarding a sheep, or a sheep and the other admits to him regarding an ox - he is exempt. If one claims an ox and a sheep and the other admits to him regarding one of them - he is liable.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָא מַנִּי – רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל הִיא. אִי רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, אֲפִילּוּ רֵישָׁא נָמֵי!
human_translation: said to him whose is this It is Rabban Gamliel, If Rabban Gamliel, even the first clause
llm_translation: He said to him: "This is Mani - Rabban Gamliel it is. If Rabban Gamliel, even the beginning also is!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָא מַנִּי – אַדְמוֹן הִיא; וְלָא דַּחוֹיֵי מְדַחֵינָא לָךְ, אֶלָּא תַּלְמוּד עָרוּךְ הוּא בְּפִיו שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הָא מַנִּי – אַדְמוֹן הִיא.
human_translation: Rather, whose is this? It is Admon, And I am not dismissing your rather, it is a set tradition in the mouth of Rabbi Yoḥanan, whose is this It is Admon.
llm_translation: Rather, this is a mnemonic - it is Admon; and not that I am rejecting you, but it is an organized teaching in the mouth of Rabbi Yochanan: "This is a mnemonic - it is Admon."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב עָנָן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: טְעָנוֹ חִטִּין, וְקָדַם וְהוֹדָה לוֹ בִּשְׂעוֹרִין – אִם כְּמַעֲרִים, חַיָּיב. אִם בְּמִתְכַּוֵּין, פָּטוּר.
human_translation: Rav Anan says Shmuel says: claimed him wheat, and first admitted him barley, if as one who employs artifice, liable if as one who intends exempt.
llm_translation: Rav Anan said, Shmuel said: If one loads wheat and precedes and acknowledges him with barley - if like Arim, liable. If with intent, exempt.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב עָנָן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: טְעָנוֹ שְׁתֵּי מְחָטִין וְהוֹדָה לוֹ בְּאַחַת מֵהֶן – חַיָּיב; לְפִיכָךְ יָצְאוּ כֵּלִים לְמָה שֶׁהֵן.
human_translation: And Rav Anan says Shmuel says: claimed him two needles, and admitted to him one of them, liable for this reason vessels were singled out to any value.
llm_translation: And Rav Anan said in the name of Shmuel: If one loads two needles and admits to loading one of them - he is liable; therefore, utensils have gone out for what purpose are they.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: טְעָנוֹ כֵּלִים וּפְרוּטָה, וְהוֹדָה בַּכֵּלִים וְכָפַר בַּפְּרוּטָה – פָּטוּר. הוֹדָה בַּפְּרוּטָה וְכָפַר בַּכֵּלִים – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: Rav Pappa says: claimed him vessels and one peruta , and admitted to him vessels but denied peruta , exempt admitted one peruta but denied vessels, liable
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: If one admits to the principal amount and denies the interest, he is exempt. If he admits to the interest and denies the principal amount, he is liable.

hebrew_text: חֲדָא כְּרַב, וַחֲדָא כִּשְׁמוּאֵל. חֲדָא כְּרַב – דְּאָמַר: כְּפִירַת טַעֲנָה שְׁתֵּי כֶּסֶף. חֲדָא כִּשְׁמוּאֵל – דְּאָמַר: טְעָנוֹ חִטִּין וּשְׂעוֹרִין וְהוֹדָה לוֹ בְּאַחַת מֵהֶן – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: One is in accordance with Rav, and one is in accordance with Shmuel. one, is in accordance with Rav, who says the denial of a claim two silver one, is in accordance with Shmuel, who says claimed him wheat and barley, and admitted to him one of them, liable
llm_translation: One opinion like Rav, and one opinion like Shmuel. One like Rav - who said: The value of the load is two silver coins. One like Shmuel - who said: If one loaded wheat and barley, and admitted to one of them - he is liable.

hebrew_text: ״מָנֶה לִי בְּיָדֶךָ״, ״אֵין לְךָ בְּיָדִי״ – פָּטוּר. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: וּמַשְׁבִּיעִין אוֹתוֹ שְׁבוּעַת הֶיסֵּת. מַאי טַעְמָא? חֲזָקָה אֵין אָדָם תּוֹבֵעַ, אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן יֵשׁ לוֹ עָלָיו.
human_translation: I have one hundred dinars in your possession, Nothing yours in my possession, exempt. Rav Naḥman says: And administers an oath of inducement [ heisset ], to him. What is the reason? a presumption one does not make a claim unless he has against
llm_translation: "An item entrusted to you," "you do not have it in your possession" – exempt. Rav Nachman said: And they make him swear the oath of denial. What is the reason? It is a presumption that a person does not claim unless he has something against him.

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַבָּה, חֲזָקָה אֵין אָדָם מֵעִיז פָּנָיו בִּפְנֵי בַּעַל חוֹבוֹ! אִשְׁתְּמוֹטֵי הוּא דְּקָא מִשְׁתְּמִיט לֵיהּ, סָבַר: עַד דְּהָוֵי לִי וּפָרַעְנָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: On the contrary; a presumption a person does not exhibit insolence in the presence of his creditor avoiding him. rationalizes until that I have and I will repay him.
llm_translation: אַדְּרַבָּה, חֲזָקָה - ADRABBAH, strong; אֵין - there is no; אָדָם - man; מֵעִיז - dares; פָּנָיו - his face; בִּפְנֵי - in the presence of; בַּעַל חוֹבוֹ - his creditor! אִשְׁתְּמוֹטֵי - he is mistaken; הוּא - he; דְּקָא - that; מִשְׁתְּמִיט - he is avoiding; לֵיהּ - him, his creditor; סָבַר - he thinks: עַד - until; דְּהָוֵי - it will be; לִי - for me; וּפָרַעְנָא - and I will pay; לֵיהּ - him.

hebrew_text: תִּדַּע, דְּאָמַר רַב אִידִי בַּר אָבִין אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: הַכּוֹפֵר בְּמִלְוֶה – כָּשֵׁר לְעֵדוּת. בְּפִקָּדוֹן – פָּסוּל לְעֵדוּת.
human_translation: Know as Rav Idi bar Avin says Rav Ḥisda says: One who denies with regard to a loan is fit to bear witness with regard to a deposit is disqualified from bearing witness.
llm_translation: You should know, that Rav Idi bar Avin said in the name of Rav Hisda: One who denies a loan - valid for testimony. In the case of a deposit - invalid for testimony.

hebrew_text: רַב חֲבִיבָא מַתְנֵי אַסֵּיפָא – ״מָנֶה לִי בְּיָדֶךָ״, אָמַר לוֹ ״הֵן״; לְמָחָר אָמַר לוֹ ״תְּנֵהוּ לִי״, ״נְתַתִּיו לָךְ״ – פָּטוּר. וְאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: מַשְׁבִּיעִין אוֹתוֹ שְׁבוּעַת הֶיסֵּת.
human_translation: Rav Ḥaviva teaches to the latter clause I have one hundred dinars in your possession, said to him: Yes, the next day said to him: Give to me, I gave it to you, exempt. And Rav Naḥman says: administers an oath of inducement to him.
llm_translation: Rav Chaviva teaches in the latter part: "He entrusts to me in your hand," he said to him, "Yes"; the next day he said to him, "Give it to me," "I have given it to you" - he is exempt. And Rav Nachman said: We administer to him the oath of heset.

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּמַתְנֵי אַרֵישָׁא – כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן אַסֵּיפָא;
human_translation: the one who teaches to the former clause, all the more so in the latter clause,
llm_translation: The one who teaches in the beginning - all the more so in the conclusion.

hebrew_text: וּמַאן דְּמַתְנֵי לַהּ אַסֵּיפָא – הָכָא הוּא דְּאִיכָּא דְּרָרָא דְמָמוֹנָא, אֲבָל הָתָם דְּלֵיכָּא דְּרָרָא דְמָמוֹנָא – לָא.
human_translation: But the one who teaches it to the latter clause here, as there is financial association but there, there is no financial association not
llm_translation: "And one who teaches her the latter part - here is where there is freedom of money, but there, where there is no freedom of money - no."

hebrew_text: מַאי אִיכָּא בֵּין שְׁבוּעָה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא לִשְׁבוּעָה דְּרַבָּנַן? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ מֵיפָךְ שְׁבוּעָה – בִּדְאוֹרָיְיתָא לָא מַפְּכִינַן שְׁבוּעָה, בִּדְרַבָּנַן מַפְּכִינַן.
human_translation: what is there between an oath by Torah law and an oath by rabbinic between them is transfer of an oath by Torah law, we do not transfer oath by rabbinic law, we transfer
llm_translation: What is the difference between an oath of biblical origin and an oath of rabbinic origin? The difference between them is that an oath of biblical origin we do not nullify, but an oath of rabbinic origin we nullify.

hebrew_text: וּלְמָר בַּר רַב אָשֵׁי, דְּאָמַר בִּדְאוֹרָיְיתָא נָמֵי מַפְּכִינַן שְׁבוּעָה – מַאי אִיכָּא בֵּין דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא לִדְרַבָּנַן? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ מֵיחַת לְנִכְסֵיהּ – בִּדְאוֹרָיְיתָא נָחֲתִינַן לְנִכְסֵיהּ, בִּדְרַבָּנַן לָא נָחֲתִינַן לְנִכְסֵיהּ.
human_translation: And according to Mar bar Rav Ashi, who says we transfer an oath by Torah law as well, what is there between by Torah law and by rabbinic law? between them is enters the property of With regard to by Torah law, we enter his property, with regard to by rabbinic law, we do not enter his property.
llm_translation: And to Mar bar Rav Ashi, who said in the Torah, "We are particular about an oath" - What is the difference between the Torah and the Rabbis? The difference between them is in regard to his property - in the Torah, we are particular about his property, but according to the Rabbis, we are not particular about his property.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, דְּאָמַר בִּדְרַבָּנַן נָמֵי נָחֲתִינַן לְנִכְסֵיהּ?
human_translation: And according to Rabbi Yosei, who says even with regard to by rabbinic law, we enter the property of
llm_translation: And for Rabbi Yosei, who said in the name of the Sages, "Should we be content with his property?"

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: מְצִיאַת חֵרֵשׁ שׁוֹטֶה וְקָטָן, יֵשׁ בָּהֶם גָּזֵל מִפְּנֵי דַּרְכֵי שָׁלוֹם. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: גָּזֵל גָּמוּר. וְאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: גָּזֵל גָּמוּר – מִדִּבְרֵיהֶם. לְמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ? לְהוֹצִיאוֹ בְּדַיָּינִין. מַאי אִיכָּא בֵּין דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא לִדְרַבָּנַן?
human_translation: As we learned A lost item found a deaf-mute, an imbecile, or a minor is considered robbery on account of the ways of peace. Rabbi Yosei says: full-fledged robbery. And Rav Ḥisda says full-fledged robbery by rabbinic what is the difference it is appropriated by the judges what is there between by Torah and by rabbinic
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: The finding of a deaf-mute, an imbecile, or a minor, there is in them theft due to ways of peace. Rabbi Yosei says: It is complete theft. And Rav Ḥisda said: It is complete theft – from their words. What practical difference does it make? To bring him to judgment. What is the difference between a matter of Torah law and a matter of rabbinic law?

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ שֶׁכְּנֶגְדּוֹ חָשׁוּד עַל הַשְּׁבוּעָה; בִּדְאוֹרָיְיתָא – שֶׁכְּנֶגְדּוֹ חָשׁוּד עַל הַשְּׁבוּעָה, אָפְכִינַן לֵיהּ שְׁבוּעָה (וְשָׂמוּ) אַאִידַּךְ; בִּדְרַבָּנַן – תַּקַּנְתָּא הִיא, וְתַקַּנְתָּא לְתַקַּנְתָּא לָא עָבְדִינַן.
human_translation: between them is where the one opposing is suspected with regard to oaths. With regard to by Torah law, the one opposing is suspected with regard to oaths, we transfer an oath and impose it on the other With regard to by rabbinic is ordinance, and we do not institute ordinance upon ordinance.
llm_translation: There is a difference between them: according to the Torah - if there is a contradiction against the oath, we reverse the oath (and impose) the other; according to the Rabbis - it is a decree, and we do not make a decree for the sake of another decree.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבָּנַן דִּפְלִיגִי עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, דְּאָמְרוּ בִּדְרַבָּנַן לָא נָחֲתִינַן לְנִכְסֵיהּ – מַאי עָבְדִינַן לֵיהּ? מְשַׁמְּתִינַן לֵיהּ.
human_translation: And according to the Rabbis who disagree with Rabbi Yosei, as they say with regard to by rabbinic law, we do not enter his property what do we do to We excommunicate him
llm_translation: And for the Rabbis who disagreed with Rabbi Yosei, for they said in the name of the Rabbis, "We do not agree with his reasoning - what shall we do with his property? We leave it alone."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: הַאי נָקְטֵיהּ בְּכוּבְסֵיהּ דְּנִשְׁבְּקֵיהּ לִגְלִימֵיהּ הוּא! אֶלָּא מַאי עָבְדִינַן לֵיהּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מְשַׁמְּתִינַן לֵיהּ עַד דְּמָטֵי זְמַן נִגְדֵּיהּ, וְנָגְדִינַן לֵיהּ וְשָׁבְקִינַן לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: This is grabbing him by his testicles [ bekhuveseih ] he surrenders his cloak. Rather, what do we do to him? said to him: We excommunicate him until the time to flog him comes, and we flog him and leave him
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: This one has been taken in his laundry that was attached to his garments! Rather, what should we do with him? He said to him: We will keep him until the time is up, and then we will confront him and release him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: הַאי מַאן דְּאַפֵּיק שְׁטָרָא עַל חַבְרֵיהּ, וְאָמַר לֵיהּ: שְׁטָרָא פְּרִיעַ הוּא – אָמְרִינַן לֵיהּ: לָאו כֹּל כְּמִינָּךְ, זִיל שַׁלֵּים. וְאִם אָמַר: לִשְׁתְּבַע לִי, אָמְרִינַן לֵיהּ: אִשְׁתְּבַע לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: one who produced note against another and said to him: the note is repaid, we say to It is not in your power go pay. But if said: Let him take an oath to me we say to Take an oath to him.
llm_translation: Rav Pappa said: One who produces a document against his colleagues and says to him: "This document is valid," we say to him: "Not everyone is like you, go and pay." But if he says: "Litigate with me," we say to him: "Litigate with him."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: וּמָה בֵּין זֶה לְפוֹגֵם אֶת שְׁטָרוֹ?
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: But what is between this and one who vitiates his note
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Acha son of Rava said to Rav Ashi: And what is the difference between this and one who invalidates his document?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָתָם, אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא טָעֵין אִיהוּ – טָעֲנִינַן לֵיהּ אֲנַן; הָכָא, אָמְרִינַן לֵיהּ: זִיל שַׁלֵּים לֵיהּ, וְאִי טָעֵין וְאָמַר אִשְׁתְּבַע לִי – אָמְרִינַן לֵיהּ: זִיל אִשְׁתְּבַע לֵיהּ. וְאִי צוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן הוּא – לָא מַשְׁבְּעִינַן לֵיהּ.
human_translation: said to him: There, even if does not himself make a claim we, make a claim on his Here, we say to Go pay him but if demands saying: Take an oath to me, we say to Go take an oath to him. And if he is a Torah scholar [ tzurva merabbanan ], we do not administer an oath to him.
llm_translation: He said to him: There, even though he did not taste it - we taste it for him; here, we say to him: Go taste it, and if he tastes it and says "I swear to me" - we say to him: Go swear to him. And if he is a Torah scholar - we do not make him swear.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב יֵימַר לְרַב אָשֵׁי: צוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן מַשְׁלַח גְּלִימָא דְּאִינָשֵׁי?! אֶלָּא לָא מִזְדַּקְקִינַן לֵיהּ לְדִינֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Yeimar said to Rav Ashi: Can a Torah scholar uncloak people? Rather, we do not attend to his case.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Yeimar to Rav Ashi: "Is a student sending the cloak of people?! Rather, we do not dress him for his judgment."

hebrew_text: ״מָנֶה לִי בְּיָדְךָ״ כּוּ׳. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב אַסִּי: הַמַּלְוֶה אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ בְּעֵדִים – צָרִיךְ לְפוֹרְעוֹ בְּעֵדִים. כִּי אַמְרִיתַהּ קַמֵּיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל, אָמַר לִי, יָכוֹל לוֹמַר לוֹ: ״פְּרַעְתִּיךָ בִּפְנֵי פְּלוֹנִי וּפְלוֹנִי, וְהָלְכוּ לָהֶם לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם״.
human_translation: I have one hundred dinars in your possession, Rav Yehuda says Rav Asi says: one who lends another in witnesses, required to repay him in witnesses. When I said this in the presence of Shmuel, he said to me can say to I repaid you in the presence of so-and-so and so-and-so, and they went overseas.
llm_translation: "Maneh li b'yadkha" (Job 17:3). Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav Assi: One who lends to his fellow with witnesses - must collect with witnesses. For when Shmuel said it before me, he said to me, he could say to him: "I have repaid you in the presence of so-and-so and so-and-so, and they have gone to the country of the sea."

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: ״מָנֶה לִי בְּיָדְךָ״, אָמַר לוֹ ״הֵן״; לְמָחָר אָמַר לוֹ: ״תְּנֵהוּ לִי״, ״נְתַתִּיו לָךְ״ – פָּטוּר. וְהָא הָכָא, כֵּיוָן דְּתַבְעֵיהּ בְּעֵדִים – כְּמַאן דְּאוֹזְפֵיהּ בְּעֵדִים דָּמֵי, וְקָתָנֵי פָּטוּר!
human_translation: We learned I have one hundred dinars in your possession, said to him: Yes, the next day said to him: Give to me, I gave it to you, exempt. And here, since claimed in witnesses, he is similar to one who lent him in witnesses, and teaches exempt.
llm_translation: We learned: "He said to him, 'Put it in your hand,' and he replied, 'Yes.' The next day he said to him, 'Give it to me,' and he said, 'I gave it to you' - he is exempt." And here, since he demanded it with witnesses - it is as if he entrusted it to him with witnesses, and the Mishnah teaches: he is exempt!

hebrew_text: תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרַב אַסִּי!
human_translation: a conclusive refutation of Rav Asi.
llm_translation: The goodness of Rav Assi!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְךָ רַב אַסִּי: אֲנָא כִּי אָמְרִי – הֵיכָא דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא אוֹזְפֵיהּ בְּעֵדִים, דְּלָא לְדִידֵיהּ הֵימְנֵיהּ; הָכָא – הָא הֵימְנֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Asi said to you: When I said where lent him in witnesses at the outset, as he did not trust him. here, he trusted him
llm_translation: He said to you, Rav Assi: I, when I said - where initially he added witnesses, not for his benefit; here - for his benefit.

hebrew_text: רַב יוֹסֵף מַתְנִי הָכִי – אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה, אָמַר רַב אַסִּי: הַמַּלְוֶה אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ בְּעֵדִים – אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לְפוֹרְעוֹ בְּעֵדִים. וְאִם אָמַר: ״אַל תִּפְרָעֵנִי אֶלָּא בְּעֵדִים״ – צָרִיךְ לְפוֹרְעוֹ בְּעֵדִים. כִּי אַמְרִיתַהּ קַמֵּיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל, אָמַר לִי: יָכוֹל לוֹמַר לוֹ: ״פְּרַעְתִּיךָ בִּפְנֵי פְּלוֹנִי וּפְלוֹנִי, וְהָלְכוּ לָהֶם לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם״.
human_translation: Rav Yosef teaches like this: Rav Yehuda says Rav Asi says: one who lends another in witnesses, need not repay him in witnesses. But if said: Repay me only in witnesses, required to repay him in witnesses. When I said this in the presence of Shmuel, he said to me can say to I repaid you in the presence of so-and-so and so-and-so, and they went overseas.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef taught thus - Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav Assi: One who lends to his fellow with witnesses - he does not need to repay with witnesses. But if he said, "Do not repay me except with witnesses" - he must repay with witnesses. For she said before Shmuel, he said to me: Can he say to him, "I have repaid you in the presence of so-and-so and so-and-so, and they went to the province by the sea."

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: ״מָנֶה לִי בְּיָדְךָ״, אָמַר לוֹ ״הֵן״; אָמַר לוֹ: ״אַל תִּתְּנֵהוּ לִי אֶלָּא בִּפְנֵי עֵדִים״; לְמָחָר אָמַר לוֹ ״תְּנֵהוּ לִי״, ״נְתַתִּיו לָךְ״ – חַיָּיב, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁצָּרִיךְ לִיתֵּן לוֹ בְּעֵדִים. תְּיוּבְתָּא דִּשְׁמוּאֵל!
human_translation: We learned I have one hundred dinars in your possession, said to him: Yes, said to him: Give to me only in witnesses, the next day said to him: Give to me, I gave it to you, liable as required to give to him in witnesses. a conclusive refutation of Shmuel.
llm_translation: We learned: "Appoint for me in your hand," he said to him "Yes"; he said to him: "Do not appoint it to me except in the presence of witnesses"; the next day he said to him "Appoint it to me," "I have appointed it to you" - he is liable, because he needed to appoint it to him in the presence of witnesses. The excellence of Shmuel!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְךָ שְׁמוּאֵל: תַּנָּאֵי הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: ״בְּעֵדִים הִלְוִיתִיךָ, בְּעֵדִים פְּרַע לִי״ – אוֹ יִתֵּן, אוֹ יָבִיא רְאָיָה שֶׁנָּתַן. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתִירָא אוֹמֵר, יָכוֹל לוֹמַר לוֹ: ״פְּרַעְתִּיךָ בִּפְנֵי פְּלוֹנִי וּפְלוֹנִי, וְהָלְכוּ לָהֶם לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם״.
human_translation: Shmuel said to you is tanna’im , as it is taught I lent you in witnesses repay me in witnesses, either give or bring proof that gave Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira says he can say to him: I repaid you in the presence of so-and-so and so-and-so, and they went overseas.
llm_translation: He said to you, Samuel: It is a teaching, as it was taught: "With witnesses I lent to you, with witnesses repay me" - either he should give, or bring proof that he gave. Rabbi Yehuda ben Betera says, he could say to him: "I repaid you in the presence of so-and-so and so-and-so, and they went to the province of the sea."

hebrew_text: פָּרֵיךְ רַב אַחָא: מִמַּאי דְּבִשְׁעַת הַלְוָאָה קָאֵי? דִּלְמָא בִּשְׁעַת תְּבִיעָה קָאֵי – וְהָכִי קָאָמַר לֵיהּ: ״לָאו בְּעֵדִים הִלְוִיתִיךָ? בְּעֵדִים הָיָה לְךָ לְפוֹרְעֵנִי!״ אֲבָל בִּשְׁעַת הַלְוָאָה – דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל חַיָּיב.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa refutes From where that is referring to at the time of the loan? Perhaps is referring to at the time of the claim, and this he says to him: Didn’t I lend you in witnesses? You should have repaid me in witnesses. But at the time of the loan, all agree liable.
llm_translation: Rav Acha posed a question: From what does the case of a loan stand? Perhaps it stands in the case of a claim - and thus he says to him: "Did I not lend you with witnesses? With witnesses you had to repay me!" But in the case of a loan - the words of everyone agree that one is obligated.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פַּפֵּי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא, הִלְכְתָא: הַמַּלְוֶה אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ בְּעֵדִים – צָרִיךְ לְפוֹרְעוֹ בְּעֵדִים. וְרַב פָּפָּא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא אָמַר: הַמַּלְוֶה אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ בְּעֵדִים – אֵין צָרִיךְ לְפוֹרְעוֹ בְּעֵדִים, וְאִם אָמַר ״אַל תִּפְרָעֵנִי אֶלָּא בְּעֵדִים״ – צָרִיךְ לְפוֹרְעוֹ בְּעֵדִים; וְאִם אָמַר לוֹ: ״פְּרַעְתִּיךָ בִּפְנֵי פְּלוֹנִי וּפְלוֹנִי, וְהָלְכוּ לָהֶם לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם״ – נֶאֱמָן.
human_translation: Rav Pappi says in the name of Rava: The halakha lends another in witnesses, required to repay him in witnesses. And Rav Pappa says in the name of Rava: one who lends another in witnesses, not required to repay him in witnesses. But if says: Repay me only in witnesses, required to repay him in witnesses. And if he said to him: I repaid you in the presence of so-and-so and so-and-so, and they went overseas, deemed credible.
llm_translation: Rav Pappa said in the name of Rava: The halakha is that one who lends to his fellow with witnesses - must repay him with witnesses. And Rav Papa said in the name of Rava: One who lends to his fellow with witnesses - does not need to repay him with witnesses, but if he said, "Do not repay me except with witnesses" - he must repay him with witnesses; and if he said to him, "I have repaid you in the presence of so-and-so and so-and-so, and they have gone to the province of the sea" - he is believed.

hebrew_text: סִימָן – רְאוּבֵן וְשִׁמְעוֹן, דְּתָנוּ הִלְכְתָא, יָזְפִי וּפָרַע, פְּלוֹנִי וּפְלוֹנִי, עַפְצֵי סִטְרָאֵי, בְּהֵימָנוּתָא כְּבֵי תְרֵי.
human_translation: mnemonic Reuven and Shimon, who learned halakha , borrowed, and repaid so-and-so and so-and-so gallnuts a different deeming them credible like two
llm_translation: Section - Reuben and Shimon, as it was taught: Yozfi and Para, Ploni and Ploni, Afzei Sitrabei, in trust like two houses.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ לְחַבְרֵיהּ: ״כִּי (פָּרְעַתַּן) [פָּרְעַתְּ לִי], פִּרְעַן (לִי) בְּאַפֵּי רְאוּבֵן וְשִׁמְעוֹן״. אֲזַל וּפַרְעֵיהּ בְּאַפֵּי תְרֵי מֵעָלְמָא. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: בְּאַפֵּי בֵּי תְרֵי אֲמַר לֵיהּ, בְּאַפֵּי בֵּי תְרֵי פַּרְעֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: לְהָכִי קָאָמַר לֵיהּ ״בְּאַפֵּי רְאוּבֵן וְשִׁמְעוֹן״ – כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא נִדְחֲיֵיהּ!
human_translation: a certain who said to When you repay me, repay me in the presence of Reuven and Shimon. went and repaid him in the presence of two from the general public. Abaye said: said to in the presence of two he repaid him in the presence of two Rava said to him: for this said to him in the presence of Reuven and Shimon: So that he will not dismiss him
llm_translation: That one who said to his companions: "When (Par'atan) Par'at'ni, he appeased me in the anger of Reuven and Shimon." He went and appeased him in the anger of two worlds. Abbaye said: In the anger of two houses he said to him, in the anger of two houses appease him. Rava said to him: This is what he meant when he said to him "in the anger of Reuven and Shimon" - so that he would not be rejected!

hebrew_text: הָהוּא דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ לְחַבְרֵיהּ: ״כִּי פָּרְעַתְּ לִי, פִּרְעַן (לִי) בְּאַפֵּי בֵּי תְרֵי דְּתָנוּ הִלְכְתָא״. אֲזַל פַּרְעֵיהּ בֵּין דִּילֵיהּ לְדִילֵיהּ, אִיתְּנִיסוּ הָנָךְ זוּזֵי.
human_translation: a certain who said to When you repay me, repay me in the presence of two who learned halakha . went repaid him between the two of them, Those dinars were circumstances beyond his control.
llm_translation: That one who said to his companions: "When you have paid me, pay (me) with anger, for two teachings have been given to me." He went to collect his debts from one to another, and there the coins were found.

hebrew_text: אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״אִין, קַבּוֹלֵי קַבֵּלְתִּינְהוּ מִינֵּיהּ – דֶּרֶךְ פִּקָּדוֹן; וְאָמֵינָא לֶיהֱוֵי גַּבַּאי פִּקָּדוֹן, עַד דְּמִתְרְמוּ בֵּי תְרֵי דְּתָנוּ הִלְכְתָא וּמְקַיֵּים תְּנָאֵיהּ״.
human_translation: came before Rav Naḥman said to him: Yes, I received from him; as a deposit. and said Let it be with me as a deposit until two who learned halakha happen and will fulfill his condition.
llm_translation: He came before Rav Nachman, he said to him: "No, I have received from him - the way of deposit; and I say let it be a deposit until two houses agree upon the law and fulfill its conditions."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כֵּיוָן דְּקָא מוֹדֵית דְּוַדַּאי שְׁקַלְתִּינְהוּ מִינֵּיהּ – פֵּרָעוֹן מְעַלְּיָא הָוֵי; אִי אָמְרַתְּ לְקַיּוֹמֵי תְּנָאֵיהּ – זִיל אַיְיתִינְהוּ. דְּהָא אֲנָא וְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת, דִּתְנֵינָא הִלְכְתָא וְסִפְרָא וְסִפְרֵי וְתוֹסֶפְתָּא וְכוֹלָּא תַּלְמוּדָא.
human_translation: said to him: Since you admit that you certainly took from him, it is a proper repayment. If you say to fulfill his condition, go bring as Rav Sheshet and I learned halakha , and Sifra , and Sifrei , and Tosefta , and the entire Talmud.
llm_translation: He said to him: Since you admit that I definitely took them from you - the responsibility is on me; if you say to fulfill his words - go bring them. For I and Rav Sheshet, as we have learned the Halakha, and the Tosefta, and the Sifra, and the Sifrei, and all the Talmud.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ לְחַבְרֵיהּ: ״הַב לִי מְאָה זוּזֵי דְּאוֹזֵיפְתָּךְ״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״לֹא הָיוּ דְבָרִים מֵעוֹלָם״. אֲזַל אַיְיתִי סָהֲדִי דְּאוֹזְפֵיהּ וּפַרְעֵיהּ. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מַאי נִיעְבּוּד? אִינְהוּ אָמְרִי אוֹזְפֵיהּ, אִינְהוּ אָמְרִי פַּרְעֵיהּ. רָבָא אָמַר: כׇּל הָאוֹמֵר ״לֹא לָוִיתִי״ – כְּאוֹמֵר ״לֹא פָּרַעְתִּי״ דָּמֵי.
human_translation: a certain who said to another: Give me hundred dinars that I lent you. said to him: matter never happened; went brought witnesses who he lent him and repaid him. Abaye said: What do they said lent him they said repaid him. Rava said: Anyone who says: I did not borrow, is like says: I did not repay.
llm_translation: That one who said to his companions: "Bring me one hundred zuz that I lent you." He said to him: "They were never words." He went and brought witnesses who testified that he had lent and repaid him. Abbaye said: What is the difference? One said he lent him, and one said he repaid him. Rava said: Anyone who says, "I did not lend" - it is like saying, "I did not repay."

hebrew_text: הָהוּא דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ לְחַבְרֵיהּ: ״הַב לִי מְאָה זוּזֵי דְּמַסֵּיקְנָא בָּךְ״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״לֹא פְּרַעְתִּיךָ בִּפְנֵי פְּלוֹנִי וּפְלוֹנִי?״ אֲתוֹ פְּלוֹנִי וּפְלוֹנִי אָמְרִי: ״לֹא הָיוּ דְבָרִים מֵעוֹלָם״. סָבַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת לְמֵימַר: הוּחְזַק כַּפְרָן, אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: כֹּל מִילְּתָא דְלָא רַמְיָא עֲלֵיהּ דְּאִינָשׁ – לָאו אַדַּעְתֵּיהּ.
human_translation: a certain who said to another: Give me hundred dinars that I claim from you. said to him: Didn’t I repay you in the presence of so-and-so and so-and-so? so-and-so and so-and-so, came said: matter never happened. Rav Sheshet thought to say assumes the presumptive status of one who denies Rava said to him: Anything that is not incumbent upon a person is not on his mind,
llm_translation: That one who said to his companions: "Give me one hundred zuz that I may rely on you." He said to him: "Have I not paid you in the presence of so-and-so and so-and-so?" So-and-so and so-and-so came and said: "These matters never happened." Rav Sheshet thought to say: He is considered like a guarantor, Rava said to him: Any matter that people do not rely upon him - I do not know.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ לְחַבְרֵיהּ: ״הַב לִי שֵׁית מְאָה זוּזֵי דְּמַסֵּיקְנָא בָּךְ״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״וְלָא פְּרַעְתָּיךָ מְאָה קַבֵּי
human_translation: a certain who said to another: Give me six hundred dinars that I claim from you. said to him: But didn’t I repay you one hundred kav
llm_translation: That one who said to his companions: "Give me one hundred zuz that I may invest with you." He said to him: "But have I not already paid you one hundred kavim?"

hebrew_text: עַפְצֵי דְּקָיְימִי בְּשִׁיתָּא שִׁיתָּא?״ אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״לָאו בְּאַרְבְּעָה אַרְבָּעָה הֲווֹ קָיְימִי?״ אֲתוֹ תְּרֵי סָהֲדִי וַאֲמַרוּ: ״אִין, בְּאַרְבְּעָה אַרְבָּעָה הֲווֹ קָיְימִי״. אָמַר רָבָא: הוּחְזַק כַּפְרָן. אֲמַר רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: הָא אָמְרַתְּ כֹּל מִילְּתָא דְּלָא רַמְיָא עֲלֵיהּ דְּאִינִישׁ לָאו אַדַּעְתֵּיהּ! אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: קִצּוּתָא דְּתַרְעָא מִידְכָּר דְּכִירִי אִינָשֵׁי.
human_translation: gallnuts [ aftzei ] that were six each said to him: Weren’t they four each Two witnesses came and said: Yes, they were four Rava said assumes the presumptive status of one who denies Rami bar Ḥama said: But didn’t you say anything that is not incumbent upon a person is not on his mind? Rava said to him: People remember the set price.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Afzei dekayemi beshitta shitta?" Amar lei: "Lav b'arba'a arba'a havo kayemi?" Ato trei sahadi va'amaru: "Ein, b'arba'a arba'a havo kayemi." Amar Rava: Huchzak kafaran. Amar Ramei bar Ḥama: Ha amarta kol milta de'la ramya aleih de'enish lav ada'tei! Amar lei Rava: Kitzuta d'tar'a midkara de'khiri inashei. English translation:

hebrew_text: הָהוּא דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ לְחַבְרֵיהּ: ״הַב לִי מְאָה זוּזֵי דְּמַסֵּיקְנָא בָּךְ, וְהָא שְׁטָרָא״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״פְּרַעְתִּיךָ״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״הָנְהוּ סִיטְרָאֵי נִינְהוּ״. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: אִיתְּרַע שְׁטָרָא. רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: לָא אִיתְּרַע שְׁטָרָא.
human_translation: a certain who said to another: Give me hundred dinars that I claim from you, and this is the note said to him: I repaid you. said to him: That was a different Rav Naḥman said the note is undermined Rav Pappa said the note is not undermined.
llm_translation: That one who said to his companions: "Bring me a hundred zuz that I may invest with you, and here is the document." He said to him: "I have paid you." He said to him: "These are the witnesses." Rav Nachman said: The document is valid. Rav Papa said: The document is not valid.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַב פָּפָּא – מַאי שְׁנָא מֵהָהוּא דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ לְחַבְרֵיהּ: ״הַב לִי מְאָה זוּזֵי דְּמַסֵּיקְנָא בָּךְ, וְהָא שְׁטָרָא״; אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״לָאו אַתּוֹרֵי יְהַבְתְּ לִי, וַאֲתֵית וְאִיתֵּיבְתְּ אַמְּסַחְתָּא – וְקַבֵּילְתְּ זוּזָךְ?״ וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״הָנְהוּ סִיטְרָאֵי נִינְהוּ״; וַאֲמַר רַב פָּפָּא: אִיתְּרַע שְׁטָרָא.
human_translation: But according to Rav Pappa, what is different from a certain said to another: Give me hundred dinars that I claim from you, and this is the note. said to him: Didn’t you give me for oxen And you came and sat in the slaughterhouse and received your money, And said to him: That was a different And Rav Pappa said the note is undermined.
llm_translation: To Rav Papa - What is different from the one who said to his colleagues: "Give me a hundred zuz that I may invest with you, and here is the document"; he said to him: "You did not give me the money, and you came and presented the document - and you expect to receive your money?" And he said to him: "Those are merely promissory notes"; and Rav Papa said: The document is invalid.

hebrew_text: הָתָם, כֵּיוָן דְּקָאָמַר ״אַתּוֹרֵי יְהַבְתְּ לִי וּמִתּוֹרֵי שָׁקְלַתְּ״ – אִיתְּרַע שְׁטָרָא; הָכָא, אֵימוֹר סִיטְרָאֵי נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: There, since said: You gave me for oxen and you took from oxen, the note is undermined Here, say was a different
llm_translation: There, since he said, "You gave me my wages and you took yours," a document is needed; here, they are considered like witnesses.

hebrew_text: מַאי הָוֵי עֲלַהּ? רַב פַּפֵּי אָמַר: לָא אִיתְּרַע שְׁטָרָא. רַב שֵׁשֶׁת בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי אָמַר: אִיתְּרַע שְׁטָרָא. וְהִלְכְתָא: אִיתְּרַע שְׁטָרָא.
human_translation: What was about Rav Pappi said: The note is not undermined, Rav Sheshet, son of Rav Idi, said: The note is undermined. And the halakha the note is undermined.
llm_translation: What is the ruling? Rav Pappi said: The document is not valid. Rav Sheshet, son of Rav Idi, said: The document is valid. And the halakha follows: The document is valid.

hebrew_text: וְהָנֵי מִילֵּי, דְּפַרְעֵיהּ בְּאַפֵּי סָהֲדִי וְלָא אִידְּכַר לֵיהּ שְׁטָרָא; אֲבָל פַּרְעֵיהּ בֵּין דִּידֵיהּ לְדִידֵיהּ – מִיגּוֹ דְּיָכוֹל לְמֵימַר ״לֹא הָיוּ דְבָרִים מֵעוֹלָם״, יָכוֹל נָמֵי לְמֵימַר ״סִיטְרָאֵי נִינְהוּ״, וּכְדַאֲבִימִי בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ.
human_translation: And this statement where he repaid him in the presence of witnesses and did not mention the note to but he repaid him between the two of them, since [ miggo ] can say to him: matter never happened, he can also say this a different And like Avimi, son of Rabbi Abbahu,
llm_translation: And these matters, that his face was red in the presence of the witnesses and the document was not recognized by him; but his face was red whether in his own presence or in the presence of others - from where can one say "they were never words," one can also say "they are scribes," as Abimi, son of Rabbi Abahu said.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ לְחַבְרֵיהּ: ״מְהֵימְנַתְּ לִי כֹּל אֵימַת דְּאָמְרַתְּ לִי לָא פָּרַעְנָא״. אֲזַל פַּרְעֵיהּ בְּאַפֵּי סָהֲדִי. אַבָּיֵי וְרָבָא דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: הָא הֵימְנֵיהּ. מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב פָּפָּא: נְהִי דְּהֵימְנֵיהּ טְפֵי מִנַּפְשֵׁיהּ, טְפֵי מִסָּהֲדֵי מִי הֵימְנֵיהּ?!
human_translation: a certain who said to another I deem you credible whenever you say to me I did not repay went repaid in the presence of witnesses, Abaye and Rava both say deemed him credible Rav Pappa objects to this Although he deemed him more credible than himself did he deem him more credible than witnesses?
llm_translation: That one who said to his companions: "You believe me in everything, except when I say 'I did not pay'." He went and paid in the presence of witnesses. Abbaye and Rava both said: "He has made her believe him." Rav Papa objected to them: "Even though he made her believe him more than himself, did he make her believe more than the witnesses?!"

hebrew_text: הָהוּא דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ לְחַבְרֵיהּ: ״מְהֵימְנַתְּ לִי כְּבֵי תְרֵי, כׇּל אֵימַת דְּאָמְרַתְּ לָא פָּרַעְנָא״. אֲזַל פַּרְעֵיהּ בְּאַפֵּי תְּלָתָא. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: כְּבֵי תְרֵי הֵימְנֵיהּ, כְּבֵי תְלָתָא לָא הֵימְנֵיהּ.
human_translation: a certain who said to another I deem you credible like two whenever you say I did not repay He went repaid in the presence of three Rav Pappa said deemed him credible like two he did not deem him credible like three
llm_translation: That one who said to his companions: "You trust me like the house of two, whenever you say 'I will not break'." He broke it in anger three times. Rav Papa said: If you trust him like the house of two, he will not break it like the house of three.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ לְרַב פָּפָּא: אֵימוֹר דְּאָמְרִי רַבָּנַן דְּאָזְלִינַן בָּתַר רוֹב דֵּעוֹת – הָנֵי מִילֵּי לְעִנְיַן אוּמְדָּנָא, דְּכַמָּה דִּנְפִישִׁי בְּקִיאִי טְפֵי; אֲבָל לְעִנְיַן עֵדוּת – מְאָה כִּתְרֵי, וּתְרֵי כִּמְאָה!
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said to Rav Pappa: Say the Sages say that we follow the majority of opinions, this statement with regard to assessing as the more the more knowledgeable they are. But with regard to testimony, one hundred are like two, and two are like one hundred.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Huna son of Rav Yehoshua said to Rav Papa: "Say that which the Rabbis say, that we go after the majority of opinions - those matters for the purpose of estimation, as much as the knowledgeable ones are numerous; but for matters of testimony - one hundred are like two hundred, and two are like one hundred!"

hebrew_text: לִישָּׁנָא אַחֲרִינָא, הָהוּא דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ לְחַבְרֵיהּ: ״מְהֵימְנַתְּ לִי כְּבֵי תְרֵי, כֹּל אֵימַת דְּאָמְרַתְּ לָא פָּרַעְנָא״. אֲזַל וּפַרְעֵיהּ בְּאַפֵּי תְּלָתָא. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: כְּבֵי תְרֵי הֵימְנֵיהּ, כְּבֵי תְלָתָא לָא הֵימְנֵיהּ.
human_translation: another version A certain said to another I deem you credible like two whenever you say I did not repay. He went and repaid in the presence of three Rav Pappa said deemed him credible like two he did not deem him credible like three
llm_translation: The other student, that one who said to his colleagues: "Believe me like the house of two, whenever you say 'we will not separate'." He went and separated from them after three days. Rav Papa said: They believed him like the house of two, they did not believe him like the house of three.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: תְּרֵי כִּמְאָה, וּמְאָה כִּתְרֵי! וְאִי אֲמַר לֵיהּ ״כְּבֵי תְלָתָא״, וַאֲזַל פַּרְעֵיהּ בְּאַפֵּי בֵּי אַרְבְּעָה – כֵּיוָן דִּנְחֵית לְדֵעוֹת, נְחֵית לְדֵעוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, objects to this: Two are like one hundred, and one hundred are like two. But if said to like three and went repaid him in the presence of four, once he entered, opinions, he has entered opinions,
llm_translation: Rav Huna son of Rav Yehoshua objected to her: Two like one hundred, and one hundred like two! And if he says to her "like the size of three," and she goes and breaks it into the size of four - once she has come to a decision, she has come to a decision.

hebrew_text: אֵין נִשְׁבָּעִין עַל טַעֲנַת חֵרֵשׁ שׁוֹטֶה וְקָטָן, וְאֵין מַשְׁבִּיעִין אֶת הַקָּטָן. מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר קְרָא: ״כִּי יִתֵּן אִישׁ אֶל רֵעֵהוּ כֶּסֶף אוֹ כֵלִים לִשְׁמוֹר״, וְאֵין נְתִינַת קָטָן כְּלוּם.
human_translation: One does not take an oath concerning the claim of a deaf-mute, an imbecile, or a minor, and does not administer an oath to a minor. What is the reason? the verse states: “If a man delivers to his neighbor silver or vessels to safeguard” delivery by a minor is nothing,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: One may not take an oath regarding the claim of a deaf-mute, an imbecile, or a minor, and one may not administer an oath to a minor. What is the reason? The verse states: "When a man gives his neighbor money or objects to safeguard" (Exodus 22:6), and the giving of a minor is nothing.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל נִשְׁבָּעִין לְקָטָן וּלְהֶקְדֵּשׁ. וְהָא אָמְרַתְּ רֵישָׁא: אֵין נִשְׁבָּעִין עַל טַעֲנַת שׁוֹטֶה וְקָטָן!
human_translation: But one does take an oath to a minor, or to the Temple But didn’t you say the first clause one does not take an oath concerning the claim of an imbecile, or a minor?
llm_translation: But they swear to a minor and to consecrate. But didn't you say at the beginning: We do not swear on the claim of a fool and a minor!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: בְּבָא בְּטַעֲנַת אָבִיו, וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב הִיא; דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: פְּעָמִים שֶׁאָדָם נִשְׁבָּע עַל טַעֲנַת עַצְמוֹ. כֵּיצַד? אָמַר לוֹ: ״מָנֶה לְאָבִיךָ בְּיָדִי וְהֶאֱכַלְתִּיו פְּרָס״ – הֲרֵי זֶה נִשְׁבָּע, וְזֶהוּ שֶׁנִּשְׁבָּע עַל טַעֲנַת עַצְמוֹ. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא כְּמֵשִׁיב אֲבֵידָה, וּפָטוּר.
human_translation: Rav said: with regard to comes with a claim to his father, and it is Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov, as it is taught Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: times when person takes an oath on his own claim. How said to Your father had one hundred dinars in my possession, but I provided him half take an oath and that is who takes an oath on his own claim. And the Rabbis say: he is only like one returning a lost item, and exempt
llm_translation: Rav said: In the case of a claim against his father, and Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov agrees; as it was taught: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: Sometimes a person swears on his own claim. How so? If he says to him, "I have counted your father's money and eaten it in Persia" - this is considered a valid oath, and this is when one swears on his own claim. And the Sages say: It is only like returning a lost object, and he is exempt.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב – לֵית לֵיהּ מֵשִׁיב אֲבֵידָה פָּטוּר?! אָמַר רַב: בְּשֶׁטְּעָנוֹ קָטָן.
human_translation: But is Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov not of one who returns a lost item exempt Rav said: where a minor advanced a claim him.
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov - does he not have the liability of returning a lost item exempt?! Rav said: when he is a minor.

hebrew_text: קָטָן?! וְהָאָמְרַתְּ: אֵין נִשְׁבָּעִין עַל טַעֲנַת חֵרֵשׁ שׁוֹטֶה וְקָטָן! לְעוֹלָם גָּדוֹל, וְאַמַּאי קָרוּ לֵיהּ קָטָן? דִּלְגַבֵּי מִילֵּי דַּאֲבוּהּ – קָטָן הוּא.
human_translation: a minor? But didn’t you say one does not take an oath concerning the claim of a deaf-mute, an imbecile, or a minor? Actually, an adult and why did call him a minor? that with regard to his father’s matters, is a minor,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Katan?! Veha'amratt: Ein nishbain al ta'anat cheresh shotah ve'katan! Le'olam gadol, ve'amamai karu leih katan? Dilgabei milei d'abuh – katan hu." English translation: "A minor?! But didn't you say: We do not administer oaths regarding the claim of a deaf-mute or a minor! Always he is considered an adult, so why do they call him a minor? In matters concerning his father – he is a minor."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, ״טַעֲנַת עַצְמוֹ״?! טַעֲנַת אֲחֵרִים הִיא! טַעֲנַת אֲחֵרִים, וְהוֹדָאַת עַצְמוֹ.
human_translation: If so, his own claim? it is the claim of others. the claim of others, and his own admission.
llm_translation: If so, "he accused himself"?! It is accusing others! Accusing others, and admitting his own guilt.

hebrew_text: כּוּלְּהוּ נָמֵי טַעֲנַת אֲחֵרִים וְהוֹדָאַת עַצְמוֹ נִינְהוּ!
human_translation: All also a claim of others and his own admission.
llm_translation: All of them are considered as the opinion of others, and the acknowledgment of oneself is included!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא בִּדְרַבָּה קָמִיפַּלְגִי – דְּאָמַר רַבָּה: מִפְּנֵי מָה אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה מוֹדֶה מִקְצָת הַטַּעֲנָה יִשָּׁבַע? חֲזָקָה אֵין אָדָם מֵעִיז פָּנָיו בִּפְנֵי בַּעַל חוֹבוֹ. וְהַאי – בְּכוּלֵּיהּ בָּעֵי דְּלִיכְפְּרֵיהּ, וְהַאי דְּלָא כַּפְרֵיהּ – מִשּׁוּם דְּאֵינוֹ מֵעִיז פָּנָיו בִּפְנֵי בַּעַל חוֹבוֹ;
human_translation: Rather, disagree with regard to of Rabba, as Rabba says: For what did the Torah say admits to a part of the claim must take an oath? a presumption a person does not exhibit insolence in the presence of his creditor, And this wants to deny all of and this that he does not deny it, because a person does not exhibit insolence in the presence of his creditor.
llm_translation: Rather, in the case of Rabba, he argues - for Rabba said: Why did the Torah state that one who admits to part of the claim must take an oath? It is a presumption that a person does not brazenly confront his creditor. And this one - since he wants to atone for himself entirely, and this one who does not want to atone - it is because he does not brazenly confront his creditor.

hebrew_text: וּבְכוּלֵּיהּ בָּעֵי דְּלוֹדֵי לֵיהּ, וְהַאי דְּלָא אוֹדִי לֵיהּ – אִישְׁתְּמוֹטֵי הוּא דְּקָא מִשְׁתְּמִיט מִינֵּיהּ, סָבַר: עַד דְּהָוֵי לִי זוּזֵי וּפָרַעְנָא לֵיהּ; וְרַחֲמָנָא אָמַר רְמִי שְׁבוּעָה עִילָּוֵיהּ, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלוֹדֵי לֵיהּ בְּכוּלֵּיהּ.
human_translation: And wants to admit to with regard to all of and this that he did not admit to him, avoiding him. rationalizes until that I have money, and I will repay him. And the Merciful One says Impose an oath on him in order to admit the entire to him.
llm_translation: And in all of it, he requires that he should lodge with him, and this one who does not lodge with him - he is unreliable, for he is unreliable in his dealings, he thinks: until I have his money and his produce; but the Merciful One said, "He shall swear concerning it," so that he should lodge with him in all of it.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב סָבַר: לָא שְׁנָא בּוֹ וְלָא שְׁנָא בִּבְנוֹ – אֵינוֹ מֵעֵיז, וְהִלְכָּךְ לָאו מֵשִׁיב אֲבֵידָה הוּא. וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: בְּפָנָיו הוּא דְּאֵינוֹ מֵעֵיז, אֲבָל בִּפְנֵי בְּנוֹ מֵעֵיז; וּמִדְּלֹא מֵעֵיז – מֵשִׁיב אֲבֵידָה הוּא.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov maintains: is no different with regard to himself, and is no different with regard to his son; would not exhibit insolence And therefore, he is not one returning a lost item And the Rabbis maintain: It is in the presence of that would not exhibit insolence; but in the presence of his son, exhibit insolence And since is not exhibiting insolence, he is one returning a lost item,
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov holds: If one does not protest against a wrongdoing committed by himself or by his son, he is not considered bold. Therefore, he does not return a lost object. And the Sages hold: In his own presence, if he does not protest, he is not considered bold, but in the presence of his son, he is considered bold; and since he is not bold, he returns a lost object.

hebrew_text: מִי מָצֵית מוֹקְמַתְּ לַהּ כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב?! הָא קָתָנֵי רֵישָׁא: ״מָנֶה לְאַבָּא בְּיָדְךָ״, ״אֵין לְךָ בְּיָדִי אֶלָּא חֲמִשִּׁים דִּינָר״ – פָּטוּר, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמֵּשִׁיב אֲבֵידָה הוּא! הָתָם דְּלָא אָמַר ״בָּרִי לִי״, הָכָא דְּאָמַר ״בָּרִי לִי״.
human_translation: Can you interpret in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov? Isn’t it taught the former clause father had one hundred dinars in your possession, You have only fifty dinars in my possession, exempt as he is one returning a lost item? There, where did not say: I am certain Here, where he said: I am certain
llm_translation: Who found a support for her like Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov?! Here it is taught in the beginning: "You have appointed to my father in your hand," "You have nothing in your hand except fifty dinars" - he is exempt, because he is returning a lost item! There, where he did not say "it is clear to me," here, where he said "it is clear to me."

hebrew_text: שְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: ״לְקָטָן״ – לִיפָּרַע מִנִּכְסֵי קָטָן, ״לַהֶקְדֵּשׁ״ – לִיפָּרַע מִנִּכְסֵי הֶקְדֵּשׁ.
human_translation: Shmuel said to a minor, to collect from minor’s property. to the Temple to collect from the consecrated property.
llm_translation: Shmuel said: "Lekatan" - to pay back from the property of a minor, "Lahekadesh" - to pay back from the property of consecrated items.

hebrew_text: לְקָטָן לִיפָּרַע מִנִּכְסֵי קָטָן – תְּנֵינָא: מִנִּכְסֵי יְתוֹמִים לֹא יִפָּרַע אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבוּעָה! תַּרְתֵּי לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: to a minor to collect from a minor’s property we learn from the property of orphans collects only by means of an oath. Why do I two
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "For a minor to collect from the property of a minor - we learned: From the property of orphans, one may only collect after a week! Why do I need two?" English translation:

hebrew_text: הָא קָמַשְׁמַע לַן – כִּדְאַבָּיֵי קַשִּׁישָׁא; דְּתָנֵי אַבָּיֵי קַשִּׁישָׁא: יְתוֹמִין שֶׁאָמְרוּ – גְּדוֹלִים, וְאֵין צָרִיךְ לוֹמַר קְטַנִּים; בֵּין לִשְׁבוּעָה בֵּין לְזִיבּוּרִית.
human_translation: teaches us this: in accordance with of Abaye the Elder; as Abaye the Elder taught: orphans of which spoke adult and needless to say, minor with regard to both an oath, and to inferior-quality
llm_translation: This is what we heard - as Abaye the Elder said; for Abaye the Elder taught: Orphans, of whom it was said - they are adults, and needless to say minors; whether for an oath or for financial matters.

hebrew_text: לְהֶקְדֵּשׁ לִיפָּרַע מִנִּכְסֵי הֶקְדֵּשׁ – תְּנֵינָא: מִנְּכָסִים מְשׁוּעְבָּדִים לֹא יִפָּרְעוּ אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבוּעָה; וּמָה לִי מְשׁוּעְבָּדִים לְהֶדְיוֹט, וּמָה לִי מְשׁוּעְבָּדִים לְגָבוֹהַּ?
human_translation: to the Temple to collect from consecrated property, We learn From liened property collects only by means of an oath. And what to me liened to an ordinary and what to me liened to the Most High,
llm_translation: To sanctify to atone from property of the sanctuary - we learned: From consecrated properties, slaves may only be redeemed after a week; but why do I need slaves for a commoner, and why do I need slaves for a high priest?

hebrew_text: אִיצְטְרִיךְ; סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: הֶדְיוֹט הוּא דְּאָדָם עוֹשֶׂה קְנוּנְיָא עַל הֶדְיוֹט; אֲבָל הֶקְדֵּשׁ, דְּאֵין אָדָם עוֹשֶׂה קְנוּנְיָא עַל הֶקְדֵּשׁ – קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: was necessary enter your mind to say it is an ordinary as a person collude against an ordinary But Temple as a person does not collude against Temple teaches us
llm_translation: It is necessary; the reason for your opinion: A layman is one who imposes restrictions on a layman; but with regard to consecrated items, since a person does not impose restrictions on consecrated items - this implies to us.

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר רַב הוּנָא: שְׁכִיב מְרַע שֶׁהִקְדִּישׁ כׇּל נְכָסָיו, וְאָמַר: ״מָנֶה לִפְלוֹנִי בְּיָדִי״ – נֶאֱמָן, חֲזָקָה אֵין אָדָם עוֹשֶׂה קְנוּנְיָא עַל הֶקְדֵּשׁ! אָמְרִי: הָנֵי מִילֵּי שְׁכִיב מְרַע, דְּאֵין אָדָם חוֹטֵא וְלֹא לוֹ; אֲבָל גַּבֵּי בָּרִיא, וַדַּאי חָיְישִׁינַן.
human_translation: But doesn’t Rav Huna say a person on his deathbed who consecrated all of his property, and said: So-and-so has one hundred dinars in my possession, deemed credible, presumption a person does not collude against Temple said That statement a person on his deathbed, as a person sins only for his own But with regard to a healthy person, we are certainly concerned
llm_translation: And it was said by Rav Huna: A dying person who consecrated all his possessions, and said, "Appoint so-and-so in my place" - he is believed, for it is not common for a person to make a stipulation regarding consecration! They said: These matters apply to a dying person, for a person does not sin and it does not affect him; but regarding a healthy person, we certainly take precautions.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ וְאֵלּוּ דְּבָרִים שֶׁאֵין נִשְׁבָּעִין עֲלֵיהֶן: הָעֲבָדִים וְהַשְּׁטָרוֹת וְהַקַּרְקָעוֹת וְהַהֶקְדֵּשׁוֹת. אֵין בָּהֶן תַּשְׁלוּמֵי כֶפֶל וְלֹא תַּשְׁלוּמֵי אַרְבָּעָה וַחֲמִשָּׁה, שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם אֵינוֹ נִשְׁבָּע, נוֹשֵׂא שָׂכָר אֵינוֹ מְשַׁלֵּם.
human_translation: And these are items concerning which one does not take an oath slaves, and documents, and land, and consecrated In these there is no payment of double nor is there payment of four or five An unpaid bailee does not take an oath a paid bailee does not pay
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: And these are the matters for which one does not take an oath: for slaves, documents, landed property, and consecrated items. They do not involve double payment or payment of four or five times the value. A gratuitous watchman does not take an oath, and a paid watchman does not make restitution.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: קֳדָשִׁים שֶׁחַיָּיב בְּאַחְרָיוּתָן – נִשְׁבָּעִין עֲלֵיהֶן, וְשֶׁאֵינוֹ חַיָּיב בְּאַחְרָיוּתָן – אֵין נִשְׁבָּעִין עֲלֵיהֶן.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says consecrated for which bears responsibility of their one takes an oath concerning them, But for which does not bear responsibility for their one does not take an oath concerning them.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: Holy items that are obligated in their succession - one swears regarding them, and those that are not obligated in their succession - one does not swear regarding them.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: יֵשׁ דְּבָרִים שֶׁהֵן בְּקַרְקַע וְאֵינָן כְּקַרְקַע; וְאֵין חֲכָמִים מוֹדִים לוֹ. כֵּיצַד? ״עֶשֶׂר גְּפָנִים טְעוּנוֹת מָסַרְתִּי לָךְ״, וְהַלָּה אוֹמֵר: ״אֵינָן אֶלָּא חָמֵשׁ״. רַבִּי מֵאִיר מְחַיֵּיב שְׁבוּעָה, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: כׇּל הַמְחוּבָּר לְקַרְקַע – הֲרֵי הוּא כְּקַרְקַע.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir says: There are items that are on the land but are not like land and the Rabbis do not concede to him How so? I assigned you ten grapevines laden and the other one says: They are only five Rabbi Meir deems liable an oath, And the Rabbis say: anything that is attached to the land is like the land
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir says: There are things that are in the ground but are not like the ground, and the sages do not agree with him. How so? "Ten grapevines I have given you," and the Halacha says: "They are only five." Rabbi Meir obligates an oath, and the sages say: Anyone attached to the ground is considered like the ground.

hebrew_text: אֵין נִשְׁבָּעִין אֶלָּא עַל דָּבָר שֶׁבְּמִדָּה וְשֶׁבְּמִשְׁקָל וְשֶׁבְּמִנְיָן. כֵּיצַד? ״בַּיִת מָלֵא מָסַרְתִּי לָךְ״ וְ״כִיס מָלֵא מָסַרְתִּי לָךְ״, וְהַלָּה אוֹמֵר: ״אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ, אֶלָּא מָה שֶׁהִנַּחְתָּ אַתָּה נוֹטֵל״ – פָּטוּר. זֶה אוֹמֵר ״עַד הַזִּיז״ וְזֶה אוֹמֵר ״עַד הַחַלּוֹן״ – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: One takes an oath only concerning an item that is by size, by weight, or by number. How so? I transferred to you a house full or: I transferred to you a pouch full and the other says: I do not know but what you left you may take, exempt this says up to the ledge, and that says up to the window, liable
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Swearing is only on a matter of measure, weight, or count. How so? "I have entrusted to you a house full" and "I have entrusted to you a purse full," and the borrower says, "I do not know, but whatever you left, I take" - he is exempt. One says "up to the beam" and the other says "up to the window" - he is liable.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תַּשְׁלוּמֵי כֶפֶל מְנָלַן? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״עַל כׇּל דְּבַר פֶּשַׁע״ – כְּלָל; ״עַל שׁוֹר״ וְ״עַל חֲמוֹר״ וְ״עַל שֶׂה״ וְ״עַל שַׂלְמָה״ – פְּרָט; ״עַל כׇּל אֲבֵדָה״ – חָזַר וְכָלַל.
human_translation: From where do we payment of double as the Sages taught “for every matter of trespass” is a generalization; “whether it be for an ox, for a donkey, for a sheep, for clothing” is a detail; “Or for any manner of lost thing,” it then generalized again.
llm_translation: Gemara: From where do we derive the payment of double restitution? For the Rabbis taught: "For any breach of trust" - this is a general principle; "for an ox" and "for a donkey" and "for a sheep" and "for a garment" - these are specific cases; "for any lost item" - it repeated and included.

hebrew_text: כְּלָל וּפְרָט וּכְלָל – אִי אַתָּה דָן אֶלָּא כְּעֵין הַפְּרָט; מָה הַפְּרָט מְפוֹרָשׁ – דָּבָר הַמִּטַּלְטֵל וְגוּפוֹ מָמוֹן, אַף כׇּל דָּבָר הַמִּטַּלְטֵל וְגוּפוֹ מָמוֹן.
human_translation: a generalization, and a detail, and a generalization, you may deduce only similar to the detail. just as detail defined as an item that is movable and has intrinsic monetary so too, anything that is movable and has intrinsic monetary
llm_translation: General and specific and general - if you judge only like the specific; just as the specific is explicit - something movable and its essence is monetary, so too every movable thing and its essence is monetary.

hebrew_text: יָצְאוּ קַרְקָעוֹת – שֶׁאֵין מְטַלְטְלִין; יָצְאוּ עֲבָדִים – שֶׁהוּקְּשׁוּ לְקַרְקָעוֹת; יָצְאוּ שְׁטָרוֹת – שֶׁאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁהֵן מִטַּלְטְלִין, אֵין גּוּפָן מָמוֹן; הֶקְדֵּשׁ – ״רֵעֵהוּ״ כְּתִיב.
human_translation: Land is excluded, as it is not movable property. slaves are excluded, as they are compared to land documents are excluded, since although they are movable property, they do not have intrinsic monetary consecrated is written his neighbor,”
llm_translation: The earthworms went out - that they are not movable; the slaves went out - that they are attached to the earthworms; the documents went out - that even though they are movable, their essence is money; the consecrated item - "his neighbor" is written.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא תַּשְׁלוּמֵי כֶפֶל וְלֹא אַרְבָּעָה וַחֲמִשָּׁה. מַאי טַעְמָא? תַּשְׁלוּמֵי אַרְבָּעָה וַחֲמִשָּׁה אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא, וְלֹא תַּשְׁלוּמֵי שְׁלֹשָׁה וְאַרְבָּעָה.
human_translation: And there is no payment of double nor four or five What is the reason the Merciful One states fourfold or fivefold payment, and not threefold or fourfold payment,
llm_translation: And not the repayment of double and not four and five. What is the reason? The repayment of four and five, the Merciful One said, and not the repayment of three and four.

hebrew_text: שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם אֵינוֹ נִשְׁבָּע. מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן:
human_translation: An unpaid bailee does not take an oath. From where are these matters as the Sages taught
llm_translation: Guardian for free not swears. From where these matters? For the Sages taught:

hebrew_text: ״כִּי יִתֵּן אִישׁ אֶל רֵעֵהוּ״ – כְּלָל, ״כֶּסֶף אוֹ כֵּלִים״ – פְּרָט, ״לִשְׁמֹר״ – חָזַר וְכָלַל. כְּלָל וּפְרָט וּכְלָל – אִי אַתָּה דָן אֶלָּא כְּעֵין הַפְּרָט; מָה הַפְּרָט מְפוֹרָשׁ – דָּבָר הַמִּטַּלְטֵל וְגוּפוֹ מָמוֹן, אַף כׇּל דָּבָר הַמִּטַּלְטֵל וְגוּפוֹ מָמוֹן.
human_translation: “if a man delivers to his neighbor” is a generalization, “silver or vessels” is a detail, “To safeguard,” it then generalized a generalization and a detail and a generalization, you may deduce only similar to the detail. just as detail defined as an item that is movable and has intrinsic monetary so too, anything that is movable and has intrinsic monetary
llm_translation: "When a man gives to his neighbor" - this is a general principle, "silver or utensils" - this is a specification, "to guard" - it repeated and included. General, specification, and general - you do not judge except according to the nature of the specification; just as the specification is explicit - something that is movable and its essence is monetary, so too, anything that is movable and its essence is monetary.

hebrew_text: יָצְאוּ קַרְקָעוֹת – שֶׁאֵין מְטַלְטְלִין; יָצְאוּ עֲבָדִים – שֶׁהוּקְּשׁוּ לְקַרְקָעוֹת; יָצְאוּ שְׁטָרוֹת – שֶׁאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁמִּטַּלְטְלִין, אֵין גּוּפָן מָמוֹן; הֶקְדֵּשׁ – ״רֵעֵהוּ״ כְּתִיב.
human_translation: Land is excluded, as it is not movable property. slaves are excluded, as they are compared to land documents are excluded, since although they are movable property, they do not have intrinsic monetary Consecrated is written his neighbor.”
llm_translation: The earthworms went out - that they are not movable; the slaves went out - that they are attached to the earthworms; the promissory notes went out - that even though they are movable, their essence is money; "his fellow" is written regarding consecration.

hebrew_text: נוֹשֵׂא שָׂכָר אֵינוֹ מְשַׁלֵּם. מְנָלַן? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״כִּי יִתֵּן אִישׁ אֶל רֵעֵהוּ״ – כְּלָל, ״חֲמוֹר אוֹ שׁוֹר אוֹ שֶׂה״ – פְּרָט, ״וְכׇל בְּהֵמָה לִשְׁמֹר״ – חָזַר וְכָלַל. כְּלָל וּפְרָט וּכְלָל כּוּ׳, עַד הֶקְדֵּשׁ – ״רֵעֵהוּ״ כְּתִיב.
human_translation: a paid bailee does not pay From where do we as the Sages taught “if a man delivers to his neighbor” is a generalization, “a donkey, or an ox, or a sheep” is a detail, “Or any animal to safeguard,” it then generalized a generalization, and a detail, and a generalization, up to Consecrated is written his neighbor.”
llm_translation: The one who hires does not pay. From where do we derive this? For the Rabbis taught: "When a man gives to his neighbor" - this is a general statement, "a donkey, an ox, a sheep" - this is a specification, "and any animal to watch over" - it repeats and includes. General, specification, and general, until "he sanctifies" - "his neighbor" is written.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: יֵשׁ דְּבָרִים שֶׁהֵן כְּקַרְקַע וְאֵינָן כְּקַרְקַע כּוּ׳. מִכְּלָל דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר: כׇּל הַמְחוּבָּר לַקַּרְקַע אֵינוֹ כְּקַרְקַע?! אַדְּמִיפַּלְגִי בִּטְעוּנוֹת, לִיפַּלְגִי בִּסְרוּקוֹת!
human_translation: Rabbi Meir says: There are items that are like land but are not like land By inference, does Rabbi Meir hold anything that is attached to the land is not like land? rather than disagreeing with regard to laden let them disagree with regard to fruitless
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir says: There are things that are like the ground and are not like the ground. From the principle that Rabbi Meir holds: Anyone attached to the ground is not like the ground?! Let them dispute about claims, let them dispute about tiles!

hebrew_text: (אֶלָּא) אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: הָכָא בַּעֲנָבִים עוֹמְדוֹת לְהִבָּצֵר קָמִיפַּלְגִי; דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר: כִּבְצוּרוֹת דָּמְיָין, וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: לָא כִּבְצוּרוֹת דָּמְיָין.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said they disagree here with regard to grapes that are ready to be harvested, as Rabbi Meir holds similar to harvested, and the Rabbis hold not similar to harvested,
llm_translation: (Instead) said Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina: Here, in the case of grapes, they are standing to be guarded, (as) Rabbi Meir holds: they are considered like fortified (objects), and the Rabbis hold: they are not considered like fortified (objects).

hebrew_text: אֵין נִשְׁבָּעִין אֶלָּא עַל דָּבָר שֶׁבְּמִדָּה וְשֶׁבְּמִשְׁקָל כּוּ׳. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ ״בַּיִת״ סְתָם, אֲבָל אֲמַר לֵיהּ ״בַּיִת זֶה מָלֵא״ – יְדִיעָא טַעַנְתֵּיהּ.
human_translation: one takes an oath only concerning an item that is by size, by weight, Abaye said: They taught only where said to him: a house without specification. But he said to him: this house full his claim is known
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Swearing is only on a matter of measure and weight. Abaye said: They only taught that if one says to him "a house" without specification, but if he says to him "this house is full" - his claim is known.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: אִי הָכִי, אַדְּתָנֵי סֵיפָא: זֶה אוֹמֵר ״עַד הַזִּיז״ וְזֶה אוֹמֵר ״עַד הַחַלּוֹן״ – חַיָּיב; לִיפְלוֹג וְלִיתְנֵי בְּדִידַהּ: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים – בְּ״בַיִת מָלֵא״, אֲבָל ״בַּיִת זֶה מָלֵא״ – חַיָּיב!
human_translation: Rava said to him: If so, rather than teaching the last clause this says up to the ledge, and that says up to the window, liable let distinguish and teach within itself, In what is this statement, said? in house full but this house full liable
llm_translation: He said to him, Rava: If so, let the latter clause teach: This one says "until the projecting beam," and this one says "until the window" - he is liable; to dispute and to establish it according to its own reasoning: when are these words said - in a "house full," but in a "this house full" - he is liable!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: לְעוֹלָם אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב עַד שֶׁיִּטְעָנֶנּוּ בְּדָבָר שֶׁבְּמִדָּה שֶׁבְּמִשְׁקָל וְשֶׁבְּמִנְיָן, וְיוֹדֶה לוֹ בְּדָבָר שֶׁבְּמִדָּה וְשֶׁבְּמִשְׁקָל וְשֶׁבְּמִנְיָן.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: is never liable unless claims from him an item that is by size, by weight, or by number, and admits to him with regard to an item that is by size, by weight, or by number.
llm_translation: Rava said: Rather, one is never liable until he loads it with a matter of measurement, weight, and count, and he admits to him in a matter of measurement, weight, and count.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּוָותֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: ״כּוֹר תְּבוּאָה לִי בְּיָדְךָ״, וְהַלָּה אוֹמֵר ״אֵין לְךָ בְּיָדִי״ – פָּטוּר. ״מְנוֹרָה גְּדוֹלָה יֵשׁ לִי בְּיָדְךָ״, ״אֵין לְךָ בְּיָדִי אֶלָּא מְנוֹרָה קְטַנָּה״ – פָּטוּר. ״אֲזוֹרָה גְּדוֹלָה יֵשׁ לִי בְּיָדְךָ״, ״אֵין לְךָ בְּיָדִי אֶלָּא אֲזוֹרָה קְטַנָּה״ – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: It is taught in accordance with of Rava: I have a kor of produce in your possession, and the other one says: Nothing of yours is in my possession, exempt I have a large candelabrum in your possession, You have only a small candelabrum in my possession, exempt I have a large belt in your possession, You have only a small belt in my possession, exempt
llm_translation: It was taught in accordance with the opinion of Rava: "A large beam is in your hand," and the other one says, "You do not have it in your hand" - exempt. "I have a large lampstand in your hand," "You do not have in your hand except a small lampstand" - exempt. "I have a large belt in your hand," "You do not have in your hand except a small belt" - exempt.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל אָמַר לוֹ: ״כּוֹר תְּבוּאָה יֵשׁ לִי בְּיָדְךָ״, וְהַלָּה אוֹמֵר: ״אֵין לְךָ בְּיָדִי אֶלָּא לֶתֶךְ״ – חַיָּיב. ״מְנוֹרָה בַּת עֶשֶׂר לִיטְרִין יֵשׁ לִי בְּיָדְךָ״, ״אֵין לְךָ בְּיָדִי אֶלָּא בַּת חָמֵשׁ לִיטְרִין״ – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: But said to him: I have a kor of produce in your possession, and the other one says: You have only a half- kor in my possession, liable I have a candelabrum ten litra in your possession, You have only a five- litra in my possession, liable
llm_translation: He said to him: "A storage pit of produce I have in your possession," and the other says: "You only have a pit in my possession" - liable. "A candelabrum of ten liters I have in your possession," "You only have in my possession a candelabrum of five liters" - liable.

hebrew_text: כְּלָלוֹ שֶׁל דָּבָר: לְעוֹלָם אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב עַד שֶׁיִּטְעָנֶנּוּ בְּדָבָר שֶׁבְּמִדָּה וְשֶׁבְּמִשְׁקָל וְשֶׁבְּמִנְיָן, וְיוֹדֶה לוֹ בְּדָבָר שֶׁבְּמִדָּה וְשֶׁבְּמִשְׁקָל וְשֶׁבְּמִנְיָן.
human_translation: principle of the matter is never liable unless claims from him an item that is by size, or by weight, or by number, and admits to him with regard to an item that is by size, by weight, or by number.
llm_translation: The principle of a matter: One is never liable until he loads it with a matter of measurement, weight, and count, and he admits to him with a matter of measurement, weight, and count.

hebrew_text: ״כְּלָלוֹ שֶׁל דָּבָר״ לְאֵתוֹיֵי מַאי? לָאו לְאֵתוֹיֵי ״בַּיִת זֶה מָלֵא״?
