human_translation: What add principle of the matter? Doesn’t to add this house full
llm_translation: "General principle of a matter" - to include what? Not to include "this house is full"?

hebrew_text: וּמַאי שְׁנָא מְנוֹרָה גְּדוֹלָה וּמְנוֹרָה קְטַנָּה? מַה שֶּׁטְּעָנוֹ לֹא הוֹדָה לוֹ, וּמַה שֶּׁהוֹדָה לוֹ לֹא טְעָנוֹ! אִי הָכִי, בַּת עֶשֶׂר בַּת חָמֵשׁ נָמֵי – מַה שֶּׁטְּעָנוֹ לֹא הוֹדָה לוֹ, וּמַה שֶּׁהוֹדָה לוֹ לֹא טְעָנוֹ!
human_translation: What is different a large candelabrum and a small candelabrum that which he claimed from him, he did not admit to and that which he admitted to, he had not claimed from him. If so, a ten and a five also as that which he claimed from him, he did not admit to and that which he admitted to, he had not claimed from him.
llm_translation: And what is the difference between a large menorah and a small menorah? Whatever they accused him of, he did not confess to, and whatever he confessed to, they did not accuse him of! If so, with regard to a daughter of nine or a daughter of five - whatever they accused her of, she did not confess to, and whatever she confessed to, they did not accuse her of!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר רַב יִצְחָק: הָכָא בִּמְנוֹרָה שֶׁל חֻלְיוֹת עָסְקִינַן, דְּקָא מוֹדֶה לֵיהּ מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Rav Yitzḥak said: Here we are dealing with a candelabrum of segments because he admits to him of
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Shmuel son of Rav Yitzchak: Here we are dealing with a menorah of hollowed-out gourds, for he concedes to him from it.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אֲזוֹרָה נָמֵי נִיתְנֵי – וְלוֹקְמֵי בִּדְלַיְיפִי! אֶלָּא דְּלַיְיפִי לָא קָתָנֵי; הָכָא נָמֵי – בְּשֶׁל חֻלְיוֹת לָא קָתָנֵי!
human_translation: If so, let teach a belt as well, and interpret to of connected Rather, is not teaching of connected Here too, is not teaching of segments
llm_translation: If so, the belt is placed on the right side - and the knots are on the left side! Rather, it is not taught on the left side; here it is taught - in the case of his illness, it is not taught!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר מֶמֶל: שָׁאנֵי מְנוֹרָה, הוֹאִיל וְיָכוֹל לְגוֹרְרָהּ וּלְהַעֲמִידָהּ עַל חָמֵשׁ לִיטְרִין.
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Abba bar Memel said a candelabrum is different because can scrape and reduce it to a five-litra
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Abba bar Memel said: "The case of a menorah is different, since it can be dragged and placed on five liters."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמַּלְוֶה אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ עַל הַמַּשְׁכּוֹן וְאָבַד הַמַּשְׁכּוֹן, אָמַר לוֹ: ״סֶלַע הִלְוִיתִיךָ עָלָיו וְשֶׁקֶל הָיָה שָׁוֶה״, וְהַלָּה אוֹמֵר: ״לֹא כִּי, אֶלָּא סֶלַע הִלְוִיתַנִי עָלָיו וְסֶלַע הָיָה שָׁוֶה״ – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: one who lends to another on collateral, and the collateral was lost and says to I lent you a sela on and was worth a shekel, And the other says That is not Rather, you lent me a sela on and was worth a sela ; exempt
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who lends money to his fellow with a mortgage, and the mortgage is lost, if he says to him, "I lent you a rock upon it, and a sela was worth," and the borrower says, "No, rather, you lent me a rock upon it, and a rock was worth," - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: ״סֶלַע הִלְוִיתִיךָ עָלָיו, וְשֶׁקֶל הָיָה שָׁוֶה״, וְהַלָּה אוֹמֵר: ״לֹא כִי, אֶלָּא סֶלַע הִלְוִיתַנִי עָלָיו, וּשְׁלֹשָׁה דִּינָרִים הָיָה שָׁוֶה״ – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: I lent you a sela on and it was worth a shekel. And the other says: That is not rather, you lent me a sela on and was worth three dinars, liable
llm_translation: "The verse states: 'I lent you a rock, and the weight was equal,' and the Halacha says: 'No, rather, I lent myself a rock, and it was worth three dinars' - liable."

hebrew_text: ״סֶלַע הִלְוִיתַנִי עָלָיו וּשְׁתַּיִם הָיָה שָׁוֶה״, וְהַלָּה אוֹמֵר: ״לֹא כִי, אֶלָּא סֶלַע הִלְוִיתִיךָ עָלָיו וְסֶלַע הָיָה שָׁוֶה״ – פָּטוּר. ״סֶלַע הִלְוִיתַנִי עָלָיו וּשְׁתַּיִם הָיָה שָׁוֶה״, וְהַלָּה אוֹמֵר: ״לֹא כִי, אֶלָּא סֶלַע הִלְוִיתִיךָ עָלָיו וַחֲמִשָּׁה דִּינָרִים הָיָה שָׁוֶה״ – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: You lent me a sela on and was worth two And the other said: That is not rather, I lent you a sela on and was worth a sela . exempt. You lent me a sela on and was worth two And the other said: That is not rather, I lent you a sela on and was worth five dinars. liable
llm_translation: The Talmudic text states: "If I lent you a rock and it was worth two," and the borrower says: "No, rather, I lent you a rock and it was worth the same" - he is exempt. "If I lent you a rock and it was worth two," and the borrower says: "No, rather, I lent you a rock and it was worth five dinars" - he is liable.

hebrew_text: וּמִי נִשְׁבָּע? מִי שֶׁהַפִּקָּדוֹן אֶצְלוֹ. שֶׁמָּא יִשָּׁבַע זֶה, וְיוֹצִיא הַלָּה אֶת הַפִּקָּדוֹן.
human_translation: And who takes oath? The one whose the deposit had been lest this take an oath and the other produce the deposit
llm_translation: "And who takes an oath? One who has the deposit with him. Perhaps this one will take an oath and cause the depositor to be exempt."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אַהֵיָיא? אִילֵּימָא אַסֵּיפָא – וְתִיפּוֹק לֵיהּ דִּשְׁבוּעָה גַּבֵּי מַלְוֶה!
human_translation: To which If we say to the latter clause derive that oath is by the creditor,
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the case of Ahaiya? If you say the latter part - and it emerges that a week is required for repayment!

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אַרֵישָׁא. וְכֵן אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר רַב: אַרֵישָׁא. וְכֵן אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אַרֵישָׁא.
human_translation: Shmuel says: to the first clause And Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Rav similarly says to the first clause. And Rabbi Yoḥanan similarly says to the first clause.
llm_translation: Samuel said: "First." And so said Rabbi Hiyya bar Rav: "First." And so said Rabbi Yohanan: "First."

hebrew_text: מַאי רֵישָׁא? סֵיפָא דְּרֵישָׁא: ״סֶלַע הִלְוִיתִיךָ עָלָיו וְשֶׁקֶל הָיָה שָׁוֶה״, וְהַלָּה אוֹמֵר: ״לֹא כִּי, אֶלָּא סֶלַע הִלְוִיתַנִי עָלָיו וּשְׁלֹשָׁה דִּינָרִין הָיָה שָׁוֶה״ – חַיָּיב. דִּשְׁבוּעָה גַּבֵּי לֹוֶה הִיא, וְשַׁקְלוּהָ רַבָּנַן מִלֹּוֶה וְשַׁדְיוּהָ אַמַּלְוֶה.
human_translation: What The first clause? the latter part of the first clause: I lent you a sela on and it was worth a shekel. And the other says: That is not rather, you lent me a sela on and was worth three dinars, liable As the oath by the debtor, but the Sages removed from the debtor and imposed it on the creditor,
llm_translation: What is the beginning? The end of the beginning: "If a borrowed item was damaged, and its value was a shekel," and the other one says: "No, rather, a borrowed item was damaged upon it, and it was worth three dinars" - he is liable. It is a dispute regarding a borrower, and the Rabbis evaluated it from the perspective of the borrower and concluded that he must pay.

hebrew_text: וְהַשְׁתָּא דְּאָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי דְּקַיְימָא לַן זֶה נִשְׁבָּע שֶׁאֵינָהּ בִּרְשׁוּתוֹ וְזֶה נִשְׁבָּע כַּמָּה שָׁוֶה – הָכִי קָאָמַר: מִי נִשְׁבָּע תְּחִלָּה? מִי שֶׁהַפִּקָּדוֹן אֶצְלוֹ. שֶׁמָּא יִשָּׁבַע זֶה, וְיוֹצִיא הַלָּה אֶת הַפִּקָּדוֹן.
human_translation: And now that Rav Ashi says that we maintain this takes an oath that is not in his possession, and that takes an oath how much was worth, this is saying: Who takes an oath first? The one in whose the deposit lest this take an oath and the other produce the deposit
llm_translation: At this time, as Rav Ashi said, that which we established for ourselves: this one swears that it is not in his possession, and this one swears how much it is worth - this is what he is saying: Who swears first? The one to whom the deposit was given. Perhaps this one will swear, and cause the depositor to lose his deposit.

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הַאי מַאן דְּאוֹזְפֵיהּ אַלְפָּא זוּזֵי לְחַבְרֵיהּ, וּמַשְׁכֵּן לֵיהּ קַתָּא דְּמַגָּלָא; אֲבַד קַתָּא דְּמַגָּלָא – אֲבַד אַלְפָּא זוּזֵי. אֲבָל תַּרְתֵּי קַתָּאתֵי – לָא.
human_translation: Shmuel says: one who lent one thousand dinars to another and took from him the handle of a sickle as collateral, the handle of the sickle is lost, lost the one thousand dinars, But two handles not
llm_translation: Samuel said: One who steals a thousand coins from his friend, and invests them in a field of wheat; if the field of wheat is lost - the thousand coins are lost. But if there are two fields of wheat - they are not lost.

hebrew_text: וְרַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תַּרְתֵּי קַתָּאתֵי: אֲבַד חֲדָא – אֲבַד חֲמֵשׁ מְאָה, אֲבַד אִידַּךְ – אֲבַד כּוּלֵּיהּ. אֲבָל קַתָּא וּנְסָכָא – לָא. נְהַרְדָּעֵי אָמְרִי: אֲפִילּוּ קַתָּא וּנְסָכָא: אֲבַד נְסָכָא – אֲבַד פַּלְגָא, אֲבַד קַתָּא – אֲבַד כּוּלֵּיהּ.
human_translation: And Rav Naḥman says: Even two handles one lost, lost five hundred the other lost, lost the entire But a handle and a piece of silver not of Neharde’a say: Even a handle and a piece of silver, the piece of silver was lost, lost half the handle lost, lost the entire
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: Even if two pitchers are lost, if one is lost - five hundred are lost, if the other is lost - all are lost. But a pitcher and a libation vessel - no. The Nehardeans say: Even if a pitcher and a libation vessel are lost, if the libation vessel is lost - half is lost, if the pitcher is lost - all are lost.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: ״סֶלַע הִלְוִיתִיךָ עָלָיו וְשֶׁקֶל הָיָה שָׁוֶה״, וְהַלָּה אוֹמֵר: ״לֹא כִי, אֶלָּא סֶלַע הִלְוִיתַנִי עָלָיו וּשְׁלֹשָׁה דִּינָרִין הָיָה שָׁוֶה״ – חַיָּיב. לֵימָא לֵיהּ: ״הָא קַבֵּילְתֵּיהּ״!
human_translation: We learned I lent you a sela on and it was worth a shekel. And the other says: That is not rather, you lent me a sela on and was worth three dinars, liable let say to him: You have received
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: "If one says, 'I borrowed your rock and it was worth a shekel,' and the borrower says, 'No, rather, you borrowed my rock and it was worth three dinars' - he is liable. Let him say to him: 'But you accepted it!'"

hebrew_text: מַתְנִיתִין בִּדְפָרֵישׁ, שְׁמוּאֵל בִּדְלָא פָּרֵישׁ.
human_translation: the mishna is with regard to where stated explicitly Shmuel, to where did not state explicitly
llm_translation: Mishnah in Defarash, Shmuel in Dala Parash.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא כְּתַנָּאֵי: הַמַּלְוֶה אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ עַל הַמַּשְׁכּוֹן וְאָבַד הַמַּשְׁכּוֹן – יִשָּׁבַע וְיִטּוֹל אֶת מְעוֹתָיו. דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר, יָכוֹל הוּא שֶׁיֹּאמַר לוֹ: כְּלוּם הִלְוִיתַנִי – אֶלָּא עַל הַמַּשְׁכּוֹן; אָבַד הַמַּשְׁכּוֹן, אָבְדוּ מְעוֹתֶיךָ.
human_translation: Let us say the subject of tanna’im , one who lends to another on collateral, and the collateral was lost, he must take an oath and take his money; the statement of Rabbi Eliezer. Rabbi Akiva says can say to Didn’t you lend me only on the collateral? the collateral was lost, your money is lost
llm_translation: Let us say like the Tannaim: One who lends to his fellow with a mortgage, and the mortgage is lost - he shall swear and take his money. These are the words of Rabbi Eliezer. Rabbi Akiva says, he can say to him: "You lent me nothing except on the mortgage; if the mortgage is lost, your money is lost."

hebrew_text: אֲבָל הַמַּלְוֶה אֶלֶף זוּז בִּשְׁטָר, וְהִנִּיחַ מַשְׁכּוֹן בְּיָדוֹ – דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל: אָבַד הַמַּשְׁכּוֹן אָבְדוּ מְעוֹתָיו.
human_translation: But one who lends one thousand dinars with note, and left collateral in possession, all agree the collateral was lost, his money is lost
llm_translation: But one who lends a thousand zuz on a promissory note, and leaves collateral in his hand - the words of all: if the collateral is lost, his coins are lost.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דְּשָׁוֵי שִׁיעוּר זוּזֵי –
human_translation: What are the circumstances If where worth the amount of money
llm_translation: "How are they similar? If they are of equal measure -"

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר? אֶלָּא לָאו בִּדְלָא שָׁוֵי שִׁיעוּר זוּזֵי – וּבְדִשְׁמוּאֵל קָא מִיפַּלְגִי?
human_translation: what is the reasoning of Rabbi Eliezer, Rather, is it not where not worth the amount of money And they disagree with regard to Shmuel.
llm_translation: What is the reason of Rabbi Eliezer? Rather, is it not because the measurement of coins is not equal - and in the opinion of Shmuel, is he dividing it?

hebrew_text: לָא; בִּדְלָא שָׁוֵי – כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לֵית לְהוּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל; וְהָכָא בִּדְשָׁוֵי שִׁיעוּר זוּזֵי, וּבִדְרַבִּי יִצְחָק קָא מִיפַּלְגִי – דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: מִנַּיִן לְבַעַל חוֹב שֶׁקּוֹנֶה מַשְׁכּוֹן? שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּלְךָ תִּהְיֶה צְדָקָה״.
human_translation: No, in where not worth everyone is of not of Shmuel. But here with regard to where worth the amount of money and they disagree with regard to of Rabbi Yitzḥak. As Rabbi Yitzḥak says: From where that a creditor acquires collateral As it is stated “And it shall be a righteousness for you”
llm_translation: Not; in that not equal - all the world does not have a name of Shmuel; and here in that equal the measure of coins, and in Rabbi Yitzchak they argue - for Rabbi Yitzchak said: From where does a creditor have the right to acquire collateral? As it is said: "And it shall be righteousness for you."

hebrew_text: אִם אֵינוֹ קוֹנֶה מַשְׁכּוֹן, צְדָקָה מִנַּיִן לוֹ? מִכָּאן לְבַעַל חוֹב שֶׁקּוֹנֶה מַשְׁכּוֹן.
human_translation: If does not acquire collateral, from where is his righteousness? From here that a creditor acquires collateral.
llm_translation: If he does not acquire a dwelling place, from where does he acquire charity? From here to a creditor who acquires a dwelling place.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא דְּרַבִּי יִצְחָק תַּנָּאֵי הִיא? וְתִיסְבְּרָא?! אֵימוֹר דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק – שֶׁמִּשְׁכְּנוֹ שֶׁלֹּא בִּשְׁעַת הַלְוָאָה; מִשְׁכְּנוֹ בִּשְׁעַת הַלְוָאָה מִי אָמַר?!
human_translation: shall we say of Rabbi Yitzḥak is tanna’im ? And you understand Say that Rabbi Yitzḥak says where he took the collateral from him not at the time of the loan, took the collateral from him at the time of the loan, does say
llm_translation: Let us say that Rabbi Yitzchak taught it? And should it be reasoned?! Say that Rabbi Yitzchak said - that His dwelling was not at the time of borrowing; His dwelling at the time of borrowing, who said it?!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מִשְׁכְּנוֹ שֶׁלֹּא בִּשְׁעַת הַלְוָאָתוֹ – כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּאִית לְהוּ דְּרַבִּי יִצְחָק. וְהָכָא – בְּמִשְׁכְּנוֹ בִּשְׁעַת הַלְוָאָתוֹ,
human_translation: Rather, he took the collateral from him not at the time of the loan, everyone agrees that of Rabbi Yitzḥak is accepted, and here, with regard to he took the collateral from him at the time of the loan.
llm_translation: Rather, his dwelling not at the time of his borrowing - everyone agrees that Rabbi Yitzchak has it. And here - in his dwelling at the time of his borrowing,

hebrew_text: וּבְשׁוֹמֵר אֲבֵדָה קָמִיפַּלְגִי; דְּאִיתְּמַר: שׁוֹמֵר אֲבֵדָה – רַבָּה אָמַר: כְּשׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם,
human_translation: And they disagree with regard to one who is safeguarding a lost item As it was stated: one who is safeguarding a lost item, Rabba says like an unpaid bailee,
llm_translation: In the case of a guardian of a lost object, there is a disagreement; for it was stated: "A guardian of a lost object" - Rabah said: like a gratuitous guardian,

hebrew_text: וְרַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: כְּשׁוֹמֵר שָׂכָר דָּמֵי.
human_translation: and Rav Yosef says like a paid bailee,
llm_translation: And Rav Yosef said: "When one guards the wages of the hired worker."

hebrew_text: לֵימָא דְּרַב יוֹסֵף תַּנָּאֵי הִיא? לָא; בְּשׁוֹמֵר אֲבֵידָה – דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אִית לְהוּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף; וְהָכָא בְּמַלְוֶה צָרִיךְ לְמַשְׁכּוֹן קָא מִיפַּלְגִי: מָר סָבַר מִצְוָה קָא עָבֵיד, וּמָר סָבַר לָאו מִצְוָה קָא עָבֵיד.
human_translation: shall we say of Rav Yosef is tanna’im ? No, with regard to one who is safeguarding a lost item, everyone accepts of Rav Yosef. And here they disagree with regard to the creditor needs the collateral Sage, holds he is performing a mitzva And Sage, holds is not performing a mitzva.
llm_translation: Let us say that Rav Yosef taught it? No; in the case of a lost item - everyone in the world has a Rav Yosef; and here, in the case of a loan, it requires collateral, they disagree: one Master holds that he is performing a mitzvah, and one Master holds that he is not performing a mitzvah.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא כְּתַנָּאֵי: הַמַּלְוֶה אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ עַל הַמַּשְׁכּוֹן וְנִכְנְסָה שְׁמִיטָּה, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינוֹ שָׁוֶה אֶלָּא פְּלַג – אֵינוֹ מְשַׁמֵּט. דִּבְרֵי רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הַנָּשִׂיא אוֹמֵר: אִם הָיָה מַשְׁכּוֹנוֹ כְּנֶגֶד חוֹבוֹ – אֵינוֹ מְשַׁמֵּט, וְאִם לָאו – מְשַׁמֵּט.
human_translation: Let us say the subject of tanna’im , one lends to another on collateral and the Sabbatical Year commences, even if is worth only half does not abrogate the statement of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel. Rabbi Yehuda HaNasi says: If collateral was commensurate with his debt, does not abrogate but if not abrogates
llm_translation: Let us say according to the Tannaim: One who lends to his fellow with a collateral, and the Sabbatical year arrives, even though it is only worth half - he does not release it. These are the words of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel. Rabbi Yehuda the Prince says: If his collateral is equal to his debt - he does not release it, but if not - he releases it.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״אֵינוֹ מְשַׁמֵּט״ דְּקָאָמַר תַּנָּא קַמָּא? אִילֵימָא כְּנֶגְדּוֹ – מִכְּלָל דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה הַנָּשִׂיא סָבַר: כְּנֶגְדּוֹ נָמֵי מְשַׁמֵּט?! אֶלָּא אַמַּאי תָּפֵיס מַשְׁכּוֹן?
human_translation: What does not abrogate which the first tanna , says? If we say commensurate with by inference that Rabbi Yehuda HaNasi holds abrogates commensurate with as well. But why did seize collateral
llm_translation: What is "he does not release" that the Tanna in the first clause is saying? If you say it means opposite him - does Rabbi Yehuda HaNasi hold that opposite him one should release?! Rather, why does he take collateral?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו כְּנֶגֶד כּוּלּוֹ – וּבְדִשְׁמוּאֵל קָא מִיפַּלְגִי?
human_translation: Rather, is it not commensurate with entire And they disagree with regard to Shmuel’s
llm_translation: Rather, is it not against all of it - and in the opinion of Shmuel, is he dividing?

hebrew_text: לָא; לְעוֹלָם כְּנֶגְדּוֹ, וּבְהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי – תַּנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר: כְּנֶגְדּוֹ; וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה הַנָּשִׂיא סָבַר: כְּנֶגְדּוֹ נָמֵי מְשַׁמֵּט. וּדְקָא אָמְרַתְּ: לְמַאי תָּפֵיס לֵיהּ מַשְׁכּוֹן? לְזִכְרוֹן דְּבָרִים בְּעָלְמָא.
human_translation: No, actually, commensurate with and they disagree with regard to that The first tanna , holds commensurate with and Rabbi Yehuda HaNasi holds abrogates commensurate with as well. And as for you said: For what did he seize collateral from him merely as a reminder,
llm_translation: Not; forever opposite him, and in this he argued - it was taught: the first one holds: opposite him; and Rabbi Yehuda the Prince holds: opposite him is also lending. And you said: for what does he take collateral? For the remembrance of matters in general.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ שְׁבוּעַת הַדַּיָּינִין
llm_translation: We will return to you, the oath of the judges.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כׇּל הַנִּשְׁבָּעִין שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה – נִשְׁבָּעִין וְלֹא מְשַׁלְּמִין. וְאֵלּוּ נִשְׁבָּעִין וְנוֹטְלִין: הַשָּׂכִיר, וְהַנִּגְזָל, וְהַנֶּחְבָּל, וְשֶׁכְּנֶגְדּוֹ חָשׁוּד עַל הַשְּׁבוּעָה, וְחֶנְוָנִי עַל פִּנְקָסוֹ.
human_translation: All who take an oath that by the Torah take an oath and do not pay. And these take oath and receive A hired worker and one who was robbed and one who was injured, and one whose opposing suspect with regard to the oath. And a storekeeper on his ledger
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: All those who take an oath in the Torah - they swear but do not pay. And these are those who swear and collect: the hired laborer, the victim of theft, the one who was damaged, and one against whom there is a claim of an oath, and the creditor for his bond.

hebrew_text: הַשָּׂכִיר – כֵּיצַד? אָמַר לוֹ: ״תֵּן לִי שְׂכָרִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לִי בְּיָדְךָ״; הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״נָתַתִּי״, וְהַלָּה אוֹמֵר: ״לֹא נָטַלְתִּי״ – הוּא נִשְׁבָּע וְנוֹטֵל. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: עַד שֶׁתְּהֵא שָׁם מִקְצָת הוֹדָאָה. כֵּיצַד? אָמַר לוֹ: ״תֵּן לִי שְׂכָרִי חֲמִשִּׁים דִּינָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ לִי בְּיָדְךָ״, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר: ״הִתְקַבַּלְתָּ דִּינַר זָהָב״.
human_translation: How the hired worker? says to Give me my wages that are in your possession. says: I gave And that says: I have not received takes an oath and he receives Rabbi Yehuda says: unless there is partial admission How so? said to him: Give me my wages, fifty dinars, which are in your possession. And says: You have received one golden dinar,
llm_translation: The hired worker - how so? He said to him: "Give me my wages that are in your possession"; he says: "I have given," and the other says: "I have not received" - he swears and takes. Rabbi Yehuda says: Until there is some admission there. How so? He said to him: "Give me my wages of fifty dinars that are in your possession," and he says: "You have received a gold dinar."

hebrew_text: נִגְזָל – כֵּיצַד? הָיוּ מְעִידִין אוֹתוֹ שֶׁנִּכְנַס לְבֵיתוֹ לְמַשְׁכְּנוֹ שֶׁלֹּא בִּרְשׁוּת; הוּא אוֹמֵר ״כֶּלְיִי נָטַלְתָּ״, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר ״לֹא נָטַלְתִּי״ – הוּא נִשְׁבָּע וְנוֹטֵל. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: עַד שֶׁתְּהֵא שָׁם מִקְצָת הוֹדָאָה. כֵּיצַד? אָמַר לוֹ ״שְׁנֵי כֵּלִים נָטַלְתָּ״, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר ״לֹא נָטַלְתִּי אֶלָּא אֶחָד״.
human_translation: How one who was robbed? testified about that he entered house to seize collateral from him without authority said: You took items belong to me. And said: I did not take takes an oath and receives Rabbi Yehuda says: unless there is partial admission How so? said to him: You took two items. And he says: I took only one.
llm_translation: Theft - how? They would testify about him that he entered his house to take his utensil without permission; he says, "You took my utensil," and he says, "I did not take it" - he swears and takes it. Rabbi Yehuda says: Until there is some admission there. How? He says to him, "You took two utensils," and he says, "I only took one."

hebrew_text: נֶחְבָּל – כֵּיצַד? הָיוּ מְעִידִים אוֹתוֹ שֶׁנִּכְנַס תַּחַת יָדוֹ שָׁלֵם וְיָצָא חָבוּל; וְאָמַר לוֹ: ״חָבַלְתָּ בִּי״, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר: ״לֹא חָבַלְתִּי״ – הֲרֵי זֶה נִשְׁבָּע וְנוֹטֵל. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: עַד שֶׁתְּהֵא שָׁם מִקְצָת הוֹדָאָה. כֵּיצַד? אָמַר לוֹ: ״חָבַלְתָּ בִּי שְׁתַּיִם״, וְהַלָּה אוֹמֵר: ״לֹא חָבַלְתִּי בְּךָ אֶלָּא אֶחָת״.
human_translation: How one who was injured? testified about that he entered into the domain of whole but left injured, and said to You injured me. And says: I did not injure takes an oath and receives Rabbi Yehuda says: unless there is partial admission. How so? said to You injured me twice. And the other says: I injured you only once.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Nechbal - keitzad? Hayu me'idim oto she'nichnas tachat yado shaleim ve'yatza chavul; ve'amar lo: "chavalta bi", ve'hu omer: "lo chavalti" - harei zeh nishba ve'noteil. Rabbi Yehuda omer: Ad she'tehi sham miktsat hodaa. Keitzad? Amar lo: "chavalta bi shetayim", ve'halah omer: "lo chavalti b'cha ela echad". English translation: Nechbal - how so? They would bring witnesses that he entered with a full hand and left with a diminished hand; and he would say to him: "You have harmed me", and he would say: "I did not harm you" - this one takes an oath and collects. Rabbi Yehuda says: Until there is some admission there. How so? He says to him: "You harmed me twice", and the other says: "I did not harm you except once".

hebrew_text: שֶׁכְּנֶגְדּוֹ חָשׁוּד עַל הַשְּׁבוּעָה – כֵּיצַד?
human_translation: How one whose opposing suspect with regard to the oath
llm_translation: Opposite him is concealed on the oath - how so?

hebrew_text: אַחַת שְׁבוּעַת הָעֵדוּת וְאַחַת שְׁבוּעַת הַפִּקָּדוֹן, וַאֲפִילּוּ שְׁבוּעַת שָׁוְא; הָיָה אֶחָד מֵהֶן מְשַׂחֵק בְּקוּבְיָא, וּמַלְוֶה בְּרִבִּית, וּמַפְרִיחֵי יוֹנִים, וְסוֹחֲרֵי שְׁבִיעִית – שֶׁכְּנֶגְדּוֹ נִשְׁבָּע וְנוֹטֵל.
human_translation: whether an oath of testimony, or whether an oath on a deposit, or even an oath in vain, one of was a dice player, or one who lends with interest, or those who fly pigeons, or the vendors of Sabbatical opposing him takes an oath and receives
llm_translation: One week of testimony and one week of deposit, and even a false week; if one of them was playing dice, and lending with interest, and raising doves, and dealing in the produce of the Sabbatical year - if he swore against him and took.

hebrew_text: הָיוּ שְׁנֵיהֶן חֲשׁוּדִין – חָזְרָה הַשְּׁבוּעָה לִמְקוֹמָהּ. דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי. רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: יַחְלוֹקוּ.
human_translation: both were suspect, the oath returned to its place. the statement of Rabbi Yosei, Rabbi Meir says: they divide
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "They both are suspected - the oath returns to its place. The words of Rabbi Yosei. Rabbi Meir says: Let them divide."

hebrew_text: וְהַחֶנְוָנִי עַל פִּנְקָסוֹ – כֵּיצַד? לֹא שֶׁיֹּאמַר לוֹ: ״כְּתוֹב עַל פִּנְקָסִי שֶׁאַתָּה חַיָּיב לִי מָאתַיִם זוּז״, אֶלָּא אוֹמֵר לוֹ: ״תֵּן לִבְנִי סָאתַיִם חִטִּין״, ״תֵּן לְפוֹעֲלַי (סלע) [בְּסֶלַע] מָעוֹת״. הוּא אוֹמֵר ״נָתַתִּי״, וְהֵן אוֹמְרִים ״לֹא נָטַלְנוּ״ – הוּא נִשְׁבָּע וְנוֹטֵל, וְהֵן נִשְׁבָּעִין וְנוֹטְלִין.
human_translation: And how the storekeeper on his ledger? not where says to It is written in my ledger that you owe me two hundred dinars. Rather, says to Give my son two se’a of wheat, Give my laborers a sela coins. says: I gave but they say: We did not receive takes an oath and he receives and take an oath and receive
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "And the Chanvani upon his pinks - how so? Not that he should say to him, 'Write on my pinks that you owe me two hundred zuz,' but rather he says to him, 'Give my son two se'ahs of wheat,' 'Give to my worker (in the rock) in the basket ma'ot.' He says, 'I have given,' and they say, 'We did not receive.' He swears and gives, and they swear and receive."

hebrew_text: אָמַר בֶּן נַנָּס: כֵּיצַד אֵלּוּ וְאֵלּוּ בָּאִין לִידֵי שְׁבוּעַת שָׁוְא? אֶלָּא הוּא נוֹטֵל שֶׁלֹּא בִּשְׁבוּעָה, וְהֵן נוֹטְלִין שֶׁלֹּא בִּשְׁבוּעָה.
human_translation: Ben Nannas said: How these and those come to an oath in vain? Rather, receives without an oath, and receive without an oath.
llm_translation: Ben Nanas said: How do both these and those come to be subject to an oath in vain? Rather, he takes not within a week, and they take not within a week.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לַחֶנְוָנִי: ״תֵּן לִי בְּדִינָר פֵּירוֹת״, וְנָתַן לוֹ; אָמַר לוֹ: ״תֵּן לִי אוֹתוֹ דִּינָר״, אָמַר לוֹ: ״נְתַתִּיו לָךְ וּנְתַתּוֹ בְּאוּנְפָּלִי״ – יִשָּׁבַע בַּעַל הַבַּיִת שֶׁנָּתַן לוֹ אֶת הַדִּינָר. אָמַר לוֹ: ״תֵּן לִי אֶת הַפֵּירוֹת״, אָמַר לוֹ: ״נְתַתִּים לָךְ וְהוֹלַכְתִּים לְתוֹךְ בֵּיתְךָ״ – יִשָּׁבַע חֶנְוָנִי. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כׇּל שֶׁהַפֵּירוֹת בְּיָדוֹ – יָדוֹ עַל הָעֶלְיוֹנָה.
human_translation: said to a storekeeper: Give me produce at a dinar, and he gave him said to him: Give me that dinar said to him: I gave it to you, and you put it in wallet [ be’unpali ], the customer shall take an oath that he gave him the dinar. said to him: Give me the produce, said to him: I gave it to you and you transported it to your house, the storekeeper shall take an oath Rabbi Yehuda says: Whoever has the produce in his possession has the advantage,
llm_translation: He said to the merchant: "Give me fruits for a dinar," and he gave him; he said to him: "Give me that dinar," he said to him: "I gave it to you and you placed it in your pocket" - the homeowner must swear that he gave him the dinar. He said to him: "Give me the fruits," he said to him: "I gave them to you and you took them into your house" - the merchant must swear. Rabbi Yehuda says: Whoever has the fruits in his possession - his hand is on the higher ground.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לַשּׁוּלְחָנִי: ״תֵּן לִי בְּדִינָר מָעוֹת״, וְנָתַן לוֹ; אָמַר לוֹ: ״תֵּן לִי אֶת הַדִּינָר״, אָמַר לוֹ: ״נָתַתִּי לְךָ וּנְתַתּוֹ בְּאוּנְפָּלִי״ – יִשָּׁבַע בַּעַל הַבַּיִת. נָתַן לוֹ אֶת הַדִּינָר; אָמַר לוֹ: ״תֵּן לִי אֶת הַמָּעוֹת״, אָמַר לוֹ: ״נְתַתִּים לָךְ וְהִשְׁלַכְתָּ לְתוֹךְ כִּיסְךָ״ – יִשָּׁבַע שׁוּלְחָנִי. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֵין דֶּרֶךְ שׁוּלְחָנִי לִיתֵּן אִיסָּר עַד שֶׁיִּטּוֹל דִּינָר.
human_translation: said to a money changer: Give me coins at a dinar, and he gave him said to him: Give me the dinar, said to him: I gave it to you, and you put it in your wallet; the customer shall take an oath gave the dinar, said to him: Give me the coins, said to him: I gave them to you and you cast them into your purse, the money changer shall take an oath. Rabbi Yehuda says: It is not a money changer’s way to give an issar until he receives a dinar.
llm_translation: He said to the money-changer: "Give me coins for a dinar," and he gave him; he said to him: "Give me the dinar," he said to him: "I gave it to you and you placed it in your pocket" - the homeowner swears. He gave him the dinar; he said to him: "Give me the coins," he said to him: "I gave them to you and you threw them into your pocket" - the money-changer swears. Rabbi Yehuda says: It is not the way of the money-changer to give change until he takes the dinar.

hebrew_text: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁאָמְרוּ: הַפּוֹגֶמֶת כְּתוּבָּתָהּ – לֹא תִּפָּרַע אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבוּעָה; וְעֵד אֶחָד מְעִידָהּ שֶׁהִיא פְּרוּעָה – לֹא תִּפָּרַע אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבוּעָה; מִנְּכָסִים מְשׁוּעְבָּדִים וּמִנִּכְסֵי יְתוֹמִים – לֹא תִּפָּרַע אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבוּעָה; וְהַנִּפְרַעַת שֶׁלֹּא בְּפָנָיו – לֹא תִּפָּרַע אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבוּעָה. וְכֵן הַיְּתוֹמִים – לֹא יִפָּרְעוּ אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבוּעָה:
human_translation: just like said who vitiates her marriage contract may collect only by an oath; or one witness testifies that has been paid, she may collect only by an oath. She may collect from liened property or from the property of orphans, only by an oath, and who collects when not in his presence may collect only by an oath. And likewise, orphans may collect with only by an oath.
llm_translation: As they said: "Its blemish is written - it shall only be redeemed within a week; and one witness testifies that it is blemished - it shall only be redeemed within a week; from encumbered properties and from the properties of orphans - it shall only be redeemed within a week; and the one who redeems who is not in his presence - it shall only be redeemed within a week. And so too with orphans - they shall only redeem within a week."

hebrew_text: ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁלֹּא פְּקָדַנוּ אַבָּא, וְלָא אָמַר לָנוּ אַבָּא, שֶׁלֹּא מָצִינוּ בֵּין שְׁטָרוֹתָיו שֶׁל אַבָּא שֶׁשְּׁטָר זֶה פָּרוּעַ״. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָה אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ נוֹלַד הַבֵּן לְאַחַר מִיתַת הָאָב – הֲרֵי זֶה נִשְׁבָּע וְנוֹטֵל. אָמַר רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: אִם יֵשׁ עֵדִים שֶׁאָמַר הָאָב בִּשְׁעַת מִיתָתוֹ: ״שְׁטָר זֶה אֵינוֹ פָּרוּעַ״ – הוּא נוֹטֵל שֶׁלֹּא בִּשְׁבוּעָה.
human_translation: oath our father did not direct us and our father did not say to us we did not find among our father’s documents that this note was paid. Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka says: Even the son was born after the father’s death, he take an oath receive Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: If there are witnesses that the father said at the time of his death: This note has not been paid, collects without an oath.
llm_translation: "An oath that Abba did not administer, and Abba did not say to us, that we did not find among the documents of Abba that this document is void." Rabbi Yochanan ben Broka says: Even if the son was born after the father's death - he takes an oath and collects. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: If there are witnesses that the father said at the time of his death: 'This document is not void' - he collects without an oath.

hebrew_text: וְאֵלּוּ נִשְׁבָּעִין שֶׁלֹּא בְּטַעֲנָה: הַשּׁוּתָּפִין, וְהָאֲרִיסִין, וְהָאַפּוֹטְרוֹפִּין, וְהָאִשָּׁה הַנּוֹשֵׂאת וְהַנּוֹתֶנֶת בְּתוֹךְ הַבַּיִת, וּבֶן הַבַּיִת. אָמַר לוֹ: ״מָה אַתָּה טוֹעֲנֵינִי?״ ״רְצוֹנִי שֶׁתִּשָּׁבַע לִי״ – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: And these take an oath when no claim Partners, sharecroppers, stewards [ apotropin ], a woman who does business from home, and the member of the household said to What is your claim against me? It is my wish that you take an oath to me liable
llm_translation: And these are the ones who take an oath not under duress: partners, tenants, appraisers, a woman who carries and brings within the house, and a household member. If he said to him, "What are you accusing me of?" "I want you to swear to me" - he is obligated.

hebrew_text: חָלְקוּ הַשּׁוּתָּפִין וְהָאֲרִיסִין – אֵין יָכוֹל לְהַשְׁבִּיעוֹ. (נתגלגל) [נִתְגַּלְגְּלָה] לוֹ שְׁבוּעָה מִמָּקוֹם אַחֵר – מְגַלְגְּלִין עָלָיו אֶת הַכֹּל. וְהַשְּׁבִיעִית מְשַׁמֶּטֶת אֶת הַשְּׁבוּעָה.
human_translation: the partners or the sharecroppers have divided may not require an oath of an oath was imposed upon him due to some other situation, that oath can be extended upon him any And the Sabbatical abrogates the an oath
llm_translation: The partners and the tenants divided - cannot satisfy him. (It rolled) It was rolled for him a week from another place - they roll everything on him. And the seventh wipes out the week.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ כׇּל הַנִּשְׁבָּעִין שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה נִשְׁבָּעִין וְלֹא מְשַׁלְּמִין. מְנָלַן? דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וְלָקַח בְּעָלָיו וְלֹא יְשַׁלֵּם״ – מִי שֶׁעָלָיו לְשַׁלֵּם, לוֹ שְׁבוּעָה.
human_translation: All who take an oath that by the Torah take an oath and do not pay. From where do we that the verse states: and its owner shall accept it, and he shall not make restitution” he who would need to pay, on him oath
llm_translation: Gemara: All who swear in the Torah swear and do not pay. From where do we derive this? As the verse states: "And the owner shall take it, and he shall not pay" - one who is obligated to pay, the oath is upon him.

hebrew_text: וְאֵלּוּ נִשְׁבָּעִין וְנוֹטְלִין כּוּ׳. מַאי שְׁנָא שָׂכִיר דְּתַקִּינוּ לֵיה רַבָּנַן דְּמִשְׁתְּבַע וְשָׁקֵיל? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכוֹת גְּדוֹלוֹת שָׁנוּ כָּאן. הֲלָכוֹת? הָנֵי הִלְכְתָא נִינְהוּ?! אֶלָּא אֵימָא: תַּקָּנוֹת גְּדוֹלוֹת שָׁנוּ כָּאן.
human_translation: And these take an oath and receive What is different a hired worker that the Sages instituted for him that he take an oath and receive Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: Great halakhot were taught here. Halakhot ? Are these halakhot Rather, say: Great ordinances were taught here.
llm_translation: And these are the ones who take an oath and collect. What is the difference between a hired laborer that the Rabbis instituted that he can take an oath and collect? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: Major enactments were made here. Enactments? Are those enactments?! Rather say: Major regulations were made here.

hebrew_text: גְּדוֹלוֹת – מִכְּלָל דְּאִיכָּא קְטַנּוֹת?!
human_translation: great, by inference that there are minor
llm_translation: Greatness - from the category of there is something smaller?!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: תַּקָּנוֹת קְבוּעוֹת שָׁנוּ כָּאן – עַקְרוּהָ רַבָּנַן לִשְׁבוּעָה מִבַּעַל הַבַּיִת, וְשַׁדְיוּהָ אַשָּׂכִיר; מִשּׁוּם כְּדֵי חַיָּיו. מִשּׁוּם כְּדֵי חַיָּיו דְּשָׂכִיר – קָנְסִינַן לֵיהּ לְבַעַל הַבַּיִת?! בַּעַל הַבַּיִת גּוּפֵיהּ נִיחָא לֵיהּ דְּמִשְׁתְּבַע שָׂכִיר וְשָׁקֵיל, כִּי הֵיכִי (דְּאִיתַּגְרוּן) [דְּלִיתַּגְרוּן] לֵיהּ פּוֹעֲלִין.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Naḥman says Shmuel says: Permanent ordinances were taught here; the Sages uprooted the oath from the employer and imposed it upon the hired worker due to his livelihood. Due to the hired worker’s livelihood, do we penalize the employer The employer himself is amenable to the hired worker taking an oath and collecting so that laborers will accept employment from him.
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Nachman said in the name of Shmuel: Fixed enactments were established here - the Rabbis uprooted the oath from the homeowner and placed it upon the tenant; for the sake of his livelihood. For the sake of the tenant's livelihood - do we impose a penalty on the homeowner?! The homeowner himself is pleased that the tenant should hire and take, so that there should be no contention between them.

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַבָּה, שָׂכִיר נִיחָא לֵיהּ דִּלְשְׁתְּבַע בַּעַל הַבַּיִת, וְנִפְקַע, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלֵיגְרֵיהּ בַּעַל הַבַּיִת! בַּעַל הַבַּיִת עַל כּוּרְחֵיהּ אָגַר. שָׂכִיר נָמֵי עַל כּוּרְחֵיהּ מִיתְּגַר! אֶלָּא בַּעַל הַבַּיִת טָרוּד בְּפוֹעֲלָיו הוּא.
human_translation: On the contrary, isn’t preferable for the hired worker that the employer takes the oath and is released in order which the employer will hire him. The employer perforce hires the hired worker also perforce accept employment, Rather, the employer is distracted with his laborers,
llm_translation: The great Rabbi said, it is preferable for the hired worker to be satisfied with the owner of the house, and he will be dismissed, so that the owner of the house can hire another in his place! The owner of the house is obligated to pay him his wages. The hired worker is also obligated to receive his wages! Rather, the owner of the house is troubled in his dealings.

hebrew_text: וְלִיתֵּב לֵיהּ בְּלָא שְׁבוּעָה!
human_translation: But let him give without an oath.
llm_translation: And let him sit without a week!

hebrew_text: כְּדֵי לְהָפִיס דַּעְתּוֹ שֶׁל בַּעַל הַבַּיִת. וְלִיתֵּב לֵיהּ בְּעֵדִים! טְרִיחָא לֵיהּ מִילְּתָא. וְלִיתֵּב לֵיהּ מֵעִיקָּרָא! שְׁנֵיהֶן רוֹצִין בְּהַקָּפָה.
human_translation: to alleviate the concerns of the employer, And should give in witnesses a burdensome matter for him. And should give him at the outset, They both want on credit,
llm_translation: In order to appease the mind of the homeowner. And to sit him with witnesses! He is troubled by the matter. And to sit him from the outset! Both of them want a compromise.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אֲפִילּוּ קָצַץ נָמֵי! אַלְּמָה תַּנְיָא: אוּמָּן אוֹמֵר ״שְׁתַּיִם קָצַצְתָּ לִי״, וְהַלָּה אוֹמֵר ״לֹא קָצַצְתִּי לְךָ אֶלָּא אַחַת״ – הַמּוֹצִיא מֵחֲבֵירוֹ עָלָיו הָרְאָיָה? קְצִיצָה וַדַּאי מִידְכָּר דְּכִיר לֵיהּ.
human_translation: If so, even fixed Why, is taught craftsman says: You fixed two as my and the other, says: I fixed only one as your the burden of proof rests upon the claimant? fixing he certainly remembers.
llm_translation: If so, even if he cut off a limb! Why is it taught: Uman says, "You cut two for me," and Hala says, "I did not cut for you except one" - does the one who brings proof against his fellow have the burden of proof? Cutting is certainly recognizable to him.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אֲפִילּוּ עָבַר זְמַנּוֹ נָמֵי! אַלְּמָה תַּנְיָא: עָבַר זְמַנּוֹ וְלֹא נָתַן לוֹ – הֲרֵי זֶה אֵינוֹ נִשְׁבָּע וְנוֹטֵל?
human_translation: If so, even the time had passed, Why, is taught the time had passed, and had not given he no take an oath and receive
llm_translation: Thus, even if he passed his designated time, it is still valid! Why is it taught: If he passed his designated time and did not give it - behold, this one does not swear and take?

hebrew_text: חֲזָקָה אֵין בַּעַל הַבַּיִת עוֹבֵר בְּ״בַל תָּלִין״. וְהָאָמְרַתְּ: בַּעַל הַבַּיִת טָרוּד בְּפוֹעֲלָיו הוּא! הָנֵי מִילֵּי – מִקַּמֵּי דְּלִימְטֵי זְמַן חִיּוּבָא הוּא; כִּי מָטֵי זְמַן חִיּוּבָא – רָמֵי אַנַּפְשֵׁיהּ וּמִידְּכַר.
human_translation: a presumption the employer will not violate the prohibition against delaying But didn’t you say employer is distracted with his laborers This statement, before the time arrives he liability When the time liability arrives, he takes it upon himself remember
llm_translation: Strong, the master of the house does not transgress with "Baal Taliin." And the saying: The master of the house is troubled in his actions! These matters - before the time of obligation, it is; when the time of obligation arrives - he elevates himself and remembers.

hebrew_text: וְכִי שָׂכִיר עוֹבֵר מִשּׁוּם ״בַּל תִּגְזוֹל״?! גַּבֵּי בַּעַל הַבַּיִת אִיכָּא תְּרֵי חֲזָקֵי: חֲדָא דְּאֵין בַּעַל הַבַּיִת עוֹבֵר בְּ״בַל תָּלִין״, וַחֲדָא דְּאֵין שָׂכִיר מְשַׁהֶא שְׂכָרוֹ.
human_translation: Is the hired violating against robbery With regard to the employer there are two presumptions One that the employer will not violate the prohibition of delaying and one that a hired worker will not defer his wages.
llm_translation: And when a hired laborer transgresses on account of "Do not steal"?! Regarding the homeowner, there are two presumptions: one that the homeowner does not transgress with "Do not delay payment," and one that the laborer does not delay his wage.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן, אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁשְּׂכָרוֹ בְּעֵדִים, אֲבָל שְׂכָרוֹ שֶׁלֹּא בְּעֵדִים – מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁיָּכוֹל לוֹמַר לוֹ: ״לֹא שְׂכַרְתִּיךָ מֵעוֹלָם״, יָכוֹל לוֹמַר לוֹ: ״שְׂכַרְתִּיךָ, וְנָתַתִּי לְךָ שְׂכָרְךָ״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יִצְחָק: יִישַׁר, וְכֵן אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says Shmuel says: taught only when hired him in witnesses. But he hired him not in witnesses, since he could have said to him: I never hired you, he can say to him: I hired you but gave you your wages, Rabbi Yitzḥak said to That is correct; and so said Rabbi Yoḥanan.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said, Shmuel said: They only taught this when his reward is given with witnesses, but his reward that is not given with witnesses - since he can say to him, "I never hired you," he can say to him, "I hired you, and I will give you your reward." Rabbi Yitzchak said to him: Right, and so said Rabbi Yochanan.

hebrew_text: מִכְּלָל דִּפְלִיג עֲלֵיהּ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ? אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי מִישְׁתָּא הֲוָה שָׁתֵי לֵיהּ וְשָׁתֵיק לֵיהּ, וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי מִישְׁהָא הֲוָה שָׁהֵי לֵיהּ וּשְׁתֵיק לֵיהּ.
human_translation: from the fact that Reish Lakish, disagrees with him, Some say was drinking and was silent, and some say he was waiting for him and was silent.
llm_translation: From the fact that Reish Lakish argued against it? There are some who say he would drink it and be silent, and there are some who say he would let it sit and be silent.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר נָמֵי: אָמַר רַב מְנַשְּׁיָא בַּר זְבִיד, אָמַר רַב: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁשְּׂכָרוֹ בְּעֵדִים, אֲבָל שְׂכָרוֹ שֶׁלֹּא בְּעֵדִים – מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁיָּכוֹל לוֹמַר לוֹ: ״לֹא שְׂכַרְתִּיךָ מֵעוֹלָם״, יָכוֹל לוֹמַר לוֹ: ״שְׂכַרְתִּיךָ, וְנָתַתִּי לְךָ שְׂכָרֶךָ״.
human_translation: It was also stated Rav Menashya bar Zevid says Rav says: taught only when hired him in witnesses. But he hired him not in witnesses, since he could have said to him: I never hired you, he can say to him: I hired you but gave you your wages,
llm_translation: It was stated similarly: Rav Menashya bar Zavid said, Rav said: They only taught this ruling when his reward is with witnesses, but if his reward is without witnesses - since he can say to him, "I never hired you," he can say to him, "I hired you, and I will give you your reward."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: כַּמָּה מְעַלְּיָא הָא שְׁמַעְתָּא! אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: מַאי מְעַלְּיוּתָא? אִם כֵּן, שְׁבוּעַת שׁוֹמְרִין דְּחַיֵּיב רַחֲמָנָא – הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ? מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁיָּכוֹל לוֹמַר לוֹ ״לֹא הָיוּ דְבָרִים מֵעוֹלָם״, יָכוֹל לוֹמַר לוֹ ״נֶאֶנְסוּ״!
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama said: How excellent is this halakha . Rava said to him: What excellence? If so, how can you find oath of the bailees that the Merciful One imposed? Since could say to These events never occurred, he can say to him: by accident.
llm_translation: Ramei bar Ḥama said: How exalted is this teaching! Rava said to him: What is the exaltedness? If so, in the oath of those who watch, which the Merciful One obligates – how can you forget it? Since he could have said to him, "They were never words," he could have said to him, "They were compelled!"

hebrew_text: דְּאַפְקֵיד לֵיהּ בְּעֵדִים. מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁיָּכוֹל לוֹמַר לוֹ ״הֶחְזַרְתִּיו לָךְ״, יָכוֹל לוֹמַר לוֹ ״נֶאֶנְסוּ״!
human_translation: where deposited with him in witnesses. since could say to him: I returned it to you, he can say to him: by accident,
llm_translation: He entrusted it with witnesses. Since he can say to him, "I have returned it to you," he can say to him, "It was lost!"

hebrew_text: דְּאַפְקֵיד לֵיהּ בִּשְׁטָרָא.
human_translation: where deposited with him, with a document
llm_translation: He entrusted it in a document.

hebrew_text: מִכְּלָל דְּתַרְוַיְיהוּ סְבִירָא לְהוּ: הַמַּפְקִיד אֵצֶל חֲבֵירוֹ בְּעֵדִים – אֵין צָרִיךְ לְהַחְזִיר לוֹ בְּעֵדִים; בִּשְׁטָר – צָרִיךְ לְהַחְזִיר לוֹ בְּעֵדִים.
human_translation: By inference that both hold one deposits with another in witnesses, does not need to return to him in witnesses, with a document he needs to return to him in witnesses,
llm_translation: From the principle of both of them, it seems to him: one who entrusts with his fellow with witnesses - does not need to return to him with witnesses; with a document - he needs to return to him with witnesses.

hebrew_text: קָרֵי רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַב שֵׁשֶׁת: ״וַיָּשֶׂם דָּוִד אֶת הַדְּבָרִים הָאֵלֶּה בְּלִבּוֹ״. דְּאַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ רַב שֵׁשֶׁת לְרַבָּה בַּר שְׁמוּאֵל, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: תָּנֵי מָר מִידֵּי בְּשָׂכִיר? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין, תְּנֵינָא: שָׂכִיר בִּזְמַנּוֹ – נִשְׁבָּע וְנוֹטֵל. כֵּיצַד – בִּזְמַן שֶׁאָמַר לוֹ: ״שְׂכַרְתַּנִי וְלֹא נָתַתָּ לִי שְׂכָרִי״, וְהַלָּה אוֹמֵר: ״שְׂכַרְתִּיךָ וְנָתַתִּי לְךָ שְׂכָרֶךָ״; אֲבָל אָמַר לוֹ: ״שְׁתַּיִם קָצַצְתָּ לִי״, וְהַלָּה אוֹמֵר: ״לֹא קָצַצְתִּי לְךָ אֶלָּא אֶחָת״ – הַמּוֹצִיא מֵחֲבֵירוֹ עָלָיו הָרְאָיָה.
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama would cite about Rav Sheshet: “And David laid up these words in his heart” As Rav Sheshet encountered Rabba bar Shmuel said to him: Does the Master teach any about a hired worker? said to him: Yes, I teach A hired worker within his time takes an oath and receives How so? when said to You hired me but did not give me my wages, and the other, says: I hired you and gave you your wages. But said to him: You fixed two as my and the other, says: I fixed only one as your the burden of proof rests upon the claimant,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Karei Ramei bar Ḥama aleih de-Rav Sheshet: 'And David placed these words in his heart.' Rav Sheshet found this teaching of Rabba bar Shmuel, he said to him: 'Does the Master teach this as a case of a hired laborer?' He said to him: 'No, we learned: A hired laborer in his time - he swears and takes. How so? At the time when he says to him: 'You hired me and did not pay me my wages,' and the other one says: 'I hired you and paid you your wages'; but if he says to him: 'You cut two for me,' and the other one says: 'I only cut one for you' - the burden of proof is upon the one who brings the claim against his fellow."

hebrew_text: הָא מִדְּסֵיפָא בִּרְאָיָה הָוֵי – רֵישָׁא בְּלֹא רְאָיָה.
human_translation: Since the latter clause in proof, is the first clause in proof not
llm_translation: This is the end of the matter: the beginning without seeing.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק:
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said:
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said:

hebrew_text: רֵישָׁא וְסֵיפָא בִּרְאָיָה; רְאָיָה דִּלְשַׁלֵּם קָתָנֵי, רְאָיָה דִּשְׁבוּעָה לָא קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: the first clause and the latter clause in proof teaches proof that to pay, does not teach proof that an oath
llm_translation: The beginning and the end in terms of seeing; the seeing of payment is taught, the seeing of the week is not taught.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה בַּר אַבָּא, שְׁלַחוּ לֵיהּ מִבֵּי רַב לִשְׁמוּאֵל: יְלַמְּדֵנוּ רַבֵּינוּ, אוּמָּן אוֹמֵר: ״שְׁתַּיִם קָצַצְתָּ לִי״, וְהַלָּה אוֹמֵר: ״לֹא קָצַצְתִּי לְךָ אֶלָּא אֶחָת״ – מִי נִשְׁבָּע? אָמַר לָהֶן: בְּזוֹ יִשָּׁבַע בַּעַל הַבַּיִת, וְיַפְסִיד אוּמָּן; קְצִיצָה וַדַּאי מִידְכָּר דְּכִירִי אִינָשֵׁי.
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya bar Abba said: sent to Shmuel from the study hall of Rav: Our teacher, instruct us craftsman says: You fixed two as my and the other, says: I fixed only one as your Who takes an oath? told them: In that the employer shall take an oath and the craftsman shall lose fixing people certainly remember.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya bar Abba said, they sent from the house of Rav to Shmuel: Our master should teach us, a craftsman says, "You have cut two for me," and the other says, "I have only cut one for you" - who should take an oath? He said to them: With this, the homeowner should take an oath, and the craftsman should lose; cutting is certainly recognizable by people.

hebrew_text: אִינִי?! וְהָא תָּנֵי רַבָּה בַּר שְׁמוּאֵל: קָצַץ – הַמּוֹצִיא מֵחֲבֵרוֹ עָלָיו הָרְאָיָה, וְאִי לָא מַיְיתֵי רְאָיָה – פָּקַע. אַמַּאי? יִשָּׁבַע בַּעַל הַבַּיִת, וְיַפְסִיד אוּמָּן! אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: לִצְדָדִין קָתָנֵי – אוֹ מֵבִיא רְאָיָה וְיִטּוֹל, אוֹ יִשָּׁבַע בַּעַל הַבַּיִת וְיַפְסִיד אוּמָּן.
human_translation: Is that so? But doesn’t Rabba bar Shmuel teach fixed the burden of proof rests upon the claimant, and if he does not bring proof, is dismissed. Why? Have the employer take an oath, and shall the craftsman lose Rav Naḥman said: teaches disjunctively: Either brings proof and receives or the employer takes an oath, and the craftsman loses
llm_translation: I?! But didn't Rabba bar Shmuel teach: "Katzatz - one who produces a proof against his fellow, if he does not bring the proof, he is liable to pay. Why? The homeowner should swear and cause the craftsman a loss!" Rav Nachman said: "The smaller scholars can either bring the proof and take it, or the homeowner should swear and cause the craftsman a loss."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: הַנּוֹתֵן טַלִּיתוֹ לְאוּמָּן, אוּמָּן אוֹמֵר: ״קָצַצְתָּ לִי שְׁתַּיִם״, וְהַלָּה אוֹמֵר: ״לֹא קָצַצְתִּי לְךָ אֶלָּא אֶחָת״; כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁטַּלִּית בְּיַד אוּמָּן – עַל בַּעַל הַבַּיִת לְהָבִיא רְאָיָה. נְתָנָהּ לוֹ בִּזְמַנּוֹ – נִשְׁבָּע וְנוֹטֵל. עָבַר זְמַנּוֹ – הַמּוֹצִיא מֵחֲבֵרוֹ עָלָיו הָרְאָיָה.
human_translation: raises an objection one who gives his cloak to a craftsman craftsman says: You fixed two my and that one, says: I fixed one your so long as that cloak is in possession of craftsman, upon owner to bring proof gave to him, in its time, takes an oath and receives But its time passed, the burden of proof rests upon the claimant,
llm_translation: Challenger: One who gives his cloak to a craftsman, the craftsman says, "You cut me two," and the other says, "I only cut you one"; as long as the cloak is in the craftsman's hand, it is the responsibility of the homeowner to bring proof. If he gave it to him on time, he swears and takes it. If the time has passed, the burden of proof is upon the one who brings the claim against his fellow.

hebrew_text: בִּזְמַנּוֹ מִיהָא נִשְׁבָּע וְנוֹטֵל; אַמַּאי? יִשָּׁבַע בַּעַל הַבַּיִת וְיַפְסִיד אוּמָּן!
human_translation: In any event, in its time, takes an oath and receives why The employer should take an oath, and the craftsman should lose
llm_translation: In its time, he may swear and take; why? The homeowner should swear and cause the craftsman a loss!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: הָא מַנִּי – רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא, דְּאָמַר: כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁשְּׁבוּעָה נוֹטָה אֵצֶל בַּעַל הַבַּיִת – שָׂכִיר נִשְׁבָּע וְנוֹטֵל.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said whose is this It is Rabbi Yehuda, who says: Any time that an oath is directed at the employer, hired worker takes an oath and receives
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: This is the teaching of Rabbi Yehuda, who said: "As long as the week is leaning towards the homeowner, the hired laborer swears and takes."

hebrew_text: הֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה? אִילֵימָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה דְּמַתְנִיתִין, אַחְמוֹרֵי קָא מַחְמַר – דִּתְנַן: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: עַד שֶׁתְּהֵא שָׁם מִקְצָת הוֹדָאָה!
human_translation: which Rabbi Yehuda If we say Rabbi Yehuda in the mishna he is being stringent, as we learned Rabbi Yehuda says: unless there is partial admission
llm_translation: Be Rabbi Yehuda? Perhaps Rabbi Yehuda of the Mishnah, the donkeys are being loaded - as we learned: Rabbi Yehuda says: Until there is some acknowledgment there!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה דְּבָרַיְיתָא – דְּתַנְיָא: שָׂכִיר, כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁלֹּא עָבַר עָלָיו זְמַנּוֹ – הֲרֵי זֶה נִשְׁבָּע וְנוֹטֵל, וְאִם לָאו – אֵינוֹ נִשְׁבָּע וְנוֹטֵל. וְאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: אֵימָתַי – בִּזְמַן שֶׁאָמַר לוֹ: ״תֵּן לִי שְׂכָרִי חֲמִשִּׁים דִּינָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ לִי בְּיָדֶךָ״; וְהוּא אוֹמֵר: ״הִתְקַבַּלְתְּ מֵהֶן דִּינַר זָהָב״, אוֹ שֶׁאָמַר לוֹ: ״שְׁתַּיִם קָצַצְתָּ״, וְהַלָּה אוֹמֵר: ״לֹא קָצַצְתִּי לְךָ אֶלָּא אֶחָת״;
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yehuda in a baraita ; as it is taught: A hired worker, as long as the time for him has not passed, takes an oath and receives and if not, he does not take an oath and receive And Rabbi Yehuda said: When when he said to Give me my wages fifty dinars, which are in your possession. And says: You have received a golden dinar, from them. Alternatively, said to him: You fixed two and the other, says: I fixed only one as your
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yehuda expounded: as it was taught: A hired laborer, as long as his time has not passed – he may take an oath and collect his wages, but if not – he may not take an oath and collect. And Rabbi Yehuda said: When is this? When he said to him, "Give me my wages of fifty dinars that I have in your possession," and he responds, "I received from them a golden dinar," or if he said to him, "You cut two," and the laborer says, "I only cut one for you."

hebrew_text: אֲבָל אָמַר לוֹ: ״לֹא שְׂכַרְתִּיךָ מֵעוֹלָם״, אוֹ שֶׁאָמַר לוֹ: ״שְׂכַרְתִּיךָ וְנָתַתִּי לְךָ שְׂכָרֶךָ״ – הַמּוֹצִיא מֵחֲבֵירוֹ עָלָיו הָרְאָיָה.
human_translation: But said to him: I never hired you, or he said to him: I hired you but gave you your wages, the burden of proof rests upon the claimant,
llm_translation: He said to him: "I did not hire you from the beginning," or if he said to him: "I hired you and I will give you your wages" - the burden of proof is upon the one who seeks to extract payment from his fellow.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב שִׁישָׁא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי: אֶלָּא קָצַץ – רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא וְלָא רַבָּנַן?! הַשְׁתָּא הֵיכִי דְּמַחְמִיר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה – מְקִילִּי רַבָּנַן, הֵיכָא דְּמֵקֵיל רַבִּי יְהוּדָה – מַחְמְרִי רַבָּנַן?!
human_translation: Rav Sheisha, son of Rav Idi, objects to this: But is fixed Rabbi Yehuda, and not the Rabbis? Now, where Rabbi Yehuda is stringent the Rabbis are lenient, where Rabbi Yehuda is lenient would the Rabbis be stringent
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rav Shisha, son of Rav Idi, objects to her: Rather, Rabbi Yehuda is the one who cut it, and not the Rabbis?! Now, how is it that when Rabbi Yehuda is stringent, the Rabbis are lenient, and when Rabbi Yehuda is lenient, the Rabbis are stringent?!

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא מַאי – רַבָּנַן? וְאֶלָּא הָא דְּתָנֵי רַבָּה בַּר שְׁמוּאֵל: קָצַץ – הַמּוֹצִיא מֵחֲבֵירוֹ עָלָיו הָרְאָיָה, מַנִּי? לָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְלָא רַבָּנַן!
human_translation: Rather, what the Rabbis? But that that Rabba bar Shmuel teaches, fixed the burden of proof rests upon the claimant, whose not Rabbi Yehuda, and not the Rabbis.
llm_translation: And rather what - sages? And rather this that Rabba bar Shmuel taught: Cut off - one who brings forth from his fellow upon him the proof, who is it? Not Rabbi Yehuda and not sages!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי – רַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: בִּדְאוֹרָיְיתָא – עֲבַדוּ לֵיהּ תַּקַּנְתָּא לְשָׂכִיר; וּבִדְרַבָּנַן – הֲוַאי תַּקַּנְתָּא, וְתַקַּנְתָּא לְתַקַּנְתָּא לָא עָבְדִינַן.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said they disagree about this: Rabbi Yehuda holds that in by Torah law institute an ordinance for the hired worker But with regard to by rabbinic law, is an ordinance, and we do not institute an ordinance to ordinance.
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: In this case where they disagree - Rabbi Yehuda holds: According to the Torah - they made it for a hired laborer; and according to the Rabbis - this enactment, and an enactment for an enactment, we do not make.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: בִּדְרַבָּנַן נָמֵי עָבְדִינַן תַּקַּנְתָּא לְשָׂכִיר, וּקְצִיצָה מִידְכָּר דְּכִיר.
human_translation: And the Rabbis hold with regard to by rabbinic law, we also institute an ordinance for the hired worker; but fixed will remember
llm_translation: The sages say: According to the sages, we establish a regulation for a hired laborer, and the cutting is from the side of the employer.

hebrew_text: נִגְזָל כֵּיצַד? הָיוּ מְעִידִין אוֹתוֹ שֶׁנִּכְנַס לְבֵיתוֹ לְמַשְׁכְּנוֹ כּוּ׳. וְדִלְמָא לֹא מִשְׁכְּנוֹ? מִי לָא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: הַאי מַאן דִּנְקִיט נַרְגָּא בִּידֵיהּ, וְאָמַר: ״אֵיזִיל וְאֶקְטְלֵיהּ לְדִקְלָא דִּפְלָנְיָא״, וְאִשְׁתְּכַח דִּקְטִיל וּשְׁדֵי – לָא אָמְרִינַן דְּהוּא קַטְלֵיהּ?
human_translation: How one who was robbed? testified about that he entered house to seize collateral from him Perhaps he did not seize collateral from him? Doesn’t Rav Naḥman say: one who takes an ax in his hand and says: I will go and chop so-and-so’s palm tree, and is found chopped down and tossed we do not say that he chopped it
llm_translation: Stolen how? They would testify that he entered his house to his dwelling. And perhaps he did not enter? Who said this? Rav Nachman said: The one who took a dagger in his hand and said, "I will go and kill so-and-so's palm tree," and it was found that he killed and threw - do we not say that he killed it?

hebrew_text: אַלְמָא עֲבִיד אִינִישׁ דְּגָזֵים וְלָא עָבֵיד, הָכָא נָמֵי – דְּגָזֵים וְלָא עָבֵיד! אֵימָא ״וּמִשְׁכְּנוֹ״. וְלִיחְזֵי מַאי מִשְׁכְּנוֹ? אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בְּטוֹעֲנוֹ כֵּלִים הַנִּיטָּלִין תַּחַת כְּנָפָיו.
human_translation: Evidently, a person is prone bluster without acting Here, also, that he was blustering but did not act Say and seized collateral from him. let us see what he seized as collateral from him, Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: where one claims items that can be carried beneath his garments,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "Perhaps a person is making gazim (arrows) and not making them, here it is stated - making gazim and not making them! Say, 'and his dwelling.' And let us see what is his dwelling? Rabba bar bar Ḥana said, Rabbi Yoḥanan said: When he is carrying utensils that are borrowed under his garment."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: רָאוּהוּ שֶׁהִטְמִין כֵּלִים תַּחַת כְּנָפָיו וְיָצָא,
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says, saw who concealed items beneath his garments, and left,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: If one sees that he hid vessels under his cloak and left.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר ״לְקוּחִין הֵן בְּיָדִי״ – אֵינוֹ נֶאֱמָן. וְלָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא בַּעַל הַבַּיִת שֶׁאֵינוֹ עָשׂוּי לִמְכּוֹר כֵּלָיו, אֲבָל בַּעַל הַבַּיִת הֶעָשׂוּי לִמְכּוֹר אֶת כֵּלָיו – נֶאֱמָן. וְשֶׁאֵין עָשׂוּי לִמְכּוֹר אֶת כֵּלָיו נָמֵי – לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּבָרִים שֶׁאֵין דַּרְכָּן לְהַטְמִין, אֲבָל דְּבָרִים שֶׁדַּרְכָּן לְהַטְמִין – נֶאֱמָן.
human_translation: and says: They were purchased in my possession, not deemed credible. And we said only a homeowner who is not apt to sell his items; but a homeowner who is apt to sell his items, deemed credible. And even who is not apt to sell his items, we said only items that are not typically concealed; but items that are typically concealed, deemed credible.
llm_translation: "And he said, 'They are in my possession' - he is not trusted. And we only said this regarding the homeowner who is not accustomed to selling his utensils, but the homeowner who is accustomed to selling his utensils - he is trusted. And regarding items that are not accustomed to being sold as well - we only said this regarding items that are not typically hidden away, but items that are typically hidden away - he is trusted."

hebrew_text: וְשֶׁאֵין דַּרְכָּן לְהַטְמִין נָמֵי – לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא אִינִישׁ דְּלָא צְנִיעַ, אֲבָל אִינִישׁ דִּצְנִיעַ – הַיְינוּ אוֹרְחֵיהּ. וְלָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא זֶה אוֹמֵר ״שְׁאוּלִין״ וְזֶה אוֹמֵר ״לְקוּחִין״, אֲבָל בִּגְנוּבִין – לָאו כֹּל כְּמִינֵּיהּ; לְאַחְזוֹקֵי אִינִישׁ בְּגַנָּבֵי לָא מַחְזְקִינַן.
human_translation: And even that are not typically concealed, we said only a person who is not secretive, but a person who is secretive, that is his manner, And we said only this says: borrowed, and that says: purchased, but in stolen, is not in his we do not presume a person to a thief.
llm_translation: "And their way is not to prepare drinks - we only said about someone who is not modest, but someone who is modest - that is his way. And we only said this when one says 'Shaulin' and the other says 'Lequchin,' but with thieves - not all are of the same kind; for to strengthen someone with thieves, we do not strengthen."

hebrew_text: וְלָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא בִּדְבָרִים הָעֲשׂוּיִן לְהַשְׁאִיל וּלְהַשְׂכִּיר, אֲבָל דְּבָרִים שֶׁאֵין עֲשׂוּיִן לְהַשְׁאִיל וּלְהַשְׂכִּיר – נֶאֱמָן. דִּשְׁלַח רַב הוּנָא בַּר אָבִין: דְּבָרִים הָעֲשׂוּיִן לְהַשְׁאִיל וּלְהַשְׂכִּיר, וְאָמַר ״לְקוּחִין הֵן בְּיָדִי״ – אֵינוֹ נֶאֱמָן. כִּי הָא דְּרָבָא אַפֵּיק זוּגָא דְּסַרְבָּלָא וְסִפְרָא דְּאַגַּדְתָּא מִיַּתְמֵי, בִּדְבָרִים הָעֲשׂוּיִן לְהַשְׁאִיל וּלְהַשְׂכִּיר.
human_translation: we said only with regard to items that are typically lent or rented, but items that are not typically lent or rented, deemed credible. As Rav Huna bar Avin sent items that are typically lent or rented and said: They were purchased in my possession, he is not deemed credible. like that where Rava expropriate fabric scissors and a book of aggada from orphans items that are typically lent or rented.
llm_translation: We did not say except in matters that are customary to lend and to rent, but in matters that are not customary to lend and to rent - he is trustworthy. Rav Huna son of Avin sent: In matters that are customary to lend and to rent, and he said, "They are in my possession" - he is not trustworthy. For this that Rava took a pair of shoes and a book of Aggadah from the innkeeper, in matters that are customary to lend and to rent.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: אֲפִילּוּ שׁוֹמֵר נִשְׁבָּע, אֲפִילּוּ אִשְׁתּוֹ שֶׁל שׁוֹמֵר נִשְׁבַּעַת. בָּעֵי רַב פָּפָּא: שְׂכִירוֹ וּלְקִיטוֹ מַאי? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Rava says: Even a watchman take oath, even the wife of the watchman take oath. Rav Pappa asks: hired worker or his harvester, what shall stand
llm_translation: Rava said: Even a watchman who takes an oath, even the wife of a watchman who takes an oath. Rav Pappa asked: What about his hired worker and his gatherer? This matter remains undecided.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב יֵימַר לְרַב אָשֵׁי: טְעָנוֹ בְּכָסָא דְּכַסְפָּא, מַאי? חֲזֵינָא: אִי אִינִישׁ דַּאֲמִיד הוּא, אוֹ אִינִישׁ דִּמְהֵימַן הוּא דְּמַפְקְדִי אִינָשֵׁי גַּבֵּיהּ – מִשְׁתְּבַע וְשָׁקֵיל. וְאִי לָא – לָא.
human_translation: Rav Yeimar said to Rav Ashi: states a claim against another with a silver cup what We see if is an affluent person, or he is a trustworthy person with whom people deposit he takes an oath and receives but if not, not
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Yeimar said to Rav Ashi: "Load it on a silver chair, what is it? We see: if he is a trustworthy person, or if he is one who is trusted by people - he will take and carry. And if not - he will not."

hebrew_text: נֶחְבָּל כֵּיצַד. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁיָּכוֹל לְחַבֵּל בְּעַצְמוֹ, אֲבָל בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁאֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לְחַבֵּל בְּעַצְמוֹ – נוֹטֵל שֶׁלֹּא בִּשְׁבוּעָה.
human_translation: How one who was injured? Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: taught only in a place where he is able to injure himself, but in a place where he is unable to injure himself, he receives without an oath.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Nechbal keitzad. Amar Rav Yehudah amar Shmuel: Lo shanu ela bimkom sheyachol lechabel be'atzmo, aval bimkom she'eino yachol lechabel be'atzmo - notel shelo bishvuah. English translation: He was embarrassed, how so? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: They only taught this in a place where he can embarrass himself, but in a place where he cannot embarrass himself - he takes it without an oath.

hebrew_text: וְנֵיחוּשׁ דִּלְמָא בְּכוֹתֶל נִתְחַכֵּךְ! תָּנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: שֶׁעָלְתָה לוֹ נְשִׁיכָה בְּגַבּוֹ וּבֵין אַצִּילֵי יָדָיו. וְדִלְמָא אַחֵר עָבֵיד לֵיהּ? דְּלֵיכָּא אַחֵר.
human_translation: And let us be concerned perhaps he scraped against a wall Rabbi Ḥiyya teaches where, he has a bite on his back or on his elbows, And perhaps a different did to him, where is no other
llm_translation: And perhaps there is a suspicion that he was leaning against a wall! Rabbi Chiya taught: If a woman approached him from behind, between his arms. And perhaps someone else did it? There is no one else.

hebrew_text: וּכְשֶׁנֶּגְדּוֹ חָשׁוּד [וְכוּ׳], וַאֲפִילּוּ שְׁבוּעַת שָׁוְא. מַאי ״אֲפִילּוּ שְׁבוּעַת שָׁוְא״?
human_translation: one whose opposing suspect or even an oath in vain. what Even an oath in vain?
llm_translation: And when he is confronted with a suspect etc., even an oath of falsehood. What is "even an oath of falsehood"?

hebrew_text: לָא מִיבַּעְיָא קָאָמַר: לָא מִיבַּעְיָא הָנָךְ, דְּאִית בְּהוּ כְּפִירַת מָמוֹן; אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ הָא נָמֵי, דִּכְפִירַת דְּבָרִים בְּעָלְמָא הוּא – לָא מְהֵימַן.
human_translation: is speaking It is not necessary. It is not necessary these as they entail the denial of a monetary but even that which merely the repudiation of one’s verbal not credible
llm_translation: He is not asking about a lion; rather, he is asking about one that has the appearance of money. But even if it is like a lion in general appearance - it is not trusted.

hebrew_text: וְלִיתְנֵי נָמֵי שְׁבוּעַת בִּטּוּי! כִּי קָתָנֵי, שְׁבוּעָה דְּכִי קָא מִשְׁתְּבַע – בְּשִׁקְרָא קָא מִשְׁתְּבַע; אֲבָל שְׁבוּעַת בִּטּוּי, דְּאִיכָּא לְמֵימַר דִּבְקוּשְׁטָא קָא מִשְׁתְּבַע – לָא קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: And let also teach an oath on an utterance, When teaches oaths which when one takes the oath, he is falsely taking the oath. But an oath on an utterance, where it can be said that he took the oath with true does not teach,
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: An oath of certainty is when one is swearing falsely, but an oath of doubt, where there is room to say that perhaps he is swearing truthfully, is not taught.

hebrew_text: תִּינַח ״אוֹכַל״ וְ״לֹא אוֹכַל״; ״אָכַלְתִּי״ וְ״לֹא אָכַלְתִּי״ מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? תָּנָא שְׁבוּעַת שָׁוְא
human_translation: works out well I will eat, or: I will not eat, I ate, or: I did not eat, what can be said, Teach An oath in vain
llm_translation: The word "eating" and "not eating"; "I ate" and "I did not eat" - what is there to say? It was taught: an oath of falsehood.

hebrew_text: וְכֹל דְּדָמֵי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: and any that is similar to it,
llm_translation: And all the blood of his.

hebrew_text: הָיָה אֶחָד מֵהֶן מְשַׂחֵק בְּקוּבְיָא. הָא תּוּ לְמָה לִי? תְּנָא פְּסוּלָא דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, וְקָתָנֵי פְּסוּלָא דְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: one of was a dice player, Why do I these additional teaches disqualified by Torah law, and teaches disqualified by rabbinic law.
llm_translation: One of them was playing with a ball. Why do I need it? A Tanna teaches a disqualification from the Torah, and it is taught a disqualification from the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: הָיוּ שְׁנֵיהֶן חֲשׁוּדִין. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב נַחְמָן: הֵיכִי תְּנַן? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא יָדַעְנָא. הִלְכְתָא מַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא יָדַעְנָא.
human_translation: both were suspect, Rava said to Rav Naḥman: How is it taught? said to him: I do not know. What is the halakha ? said to him: I do not know.
llm_translation: They both are suspected. Rava said to Rav Nachman: How should we teach it? He said to him: I do not know. What is the halakha? He said to him: I do not know.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף בַּר מִנְיוֹמֵי, אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: יַחְלוֹקוּ. וְכֵן תָּנֵי רַב זְבִיד בַּר אוֹשַׁעְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: יַחְלוֹקוּ. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: תָּנֵי רַב זְבִיד אָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: יַחְלוֹקוּ. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף בַּר מִנְיוֹמֵי: עֲבַד רַב נַחְמָן עוֹבָדָא – יַחְלוֹקוּ.
human_translation: was stated Rav Yosef bar Minyumi says Rav Naḥman says Rabbi Yosei says: They divide And similarly, Rav Zevid bar Oshaya teaches Rabbi Yosei says: They divide There are who say Rav Zevid teaches Rabbi Oshaya says Rabbi Yosei says: They divide Rav Yosef bar Minyumi said Rav Naḥman ruled case divide
llm_translation: It was stated: Rav Yosef bar Minyomei said, Rav Nachman said, Rabbi Yosei says: They should divide. And similarly, Rav Zebid bar Oshaya taught, Rabbi Yosei says: They should divide. Some say: Rav Zebid taught in the name of Rabbi Oshaya, Rabbi Yosei says: They should divide. Rav Yosef bar Minyomei said: Rav Nachman did the deed - they should divide.

hebrew_text: חָזְרָה שְׁבוּעָה לִמְקוֹמָהּ. לְהֵיכָן חָזְרָה? אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי, רַבּוֹתֵינוּ שֶׁבְּבָבֶל אָמְרוּ: חָזְרָה שְׁבוּעָה לְסִינַי, רַבּוֹתֵינוּ שֶׁבְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל אָמְרוּ: חָזְרָה שְׁבוּעָה לַמְחוּיָּב לָהּ.
human_translation: the oath returned to its place. To where did it return? Rabbi Ami said our Sages in Babylonia say: oath returned to Sinai, Our Sages in Eretz Yisrael said: The oath returned to who liable to it,
llm_translation: The week returned to its place. To where did it return? Rabbi Ammi said, our Rabbis in Babylonia said: the week returned to Sinai, our Rabbis in the Land of Israel said: the week returned to the one obligated by it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: רַבּוֹתֵינוּ שֶׁבְּבָבֶל – רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל, רַבּוֹתֵינוּ שֶׁבְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל – רַבִּי אַבָּא. רַבּוֹתֵינוּ שֶׁבְּבָבֶל רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל – דִּתְנַן: וְכֵן הַיְּתוֹמִין, לֹא יִפָּרְעוּ אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבוּעָה. וְהָוֵינַן בַּהּ: מִמַּאן? אִילֵּימָא מִלֹּוֶה – אֲבוּהוֹן שָׁקֵיל בְּלָא שְׁבוּעָה, וְאִינְהוּ בִּשְׁבוּעָה?! אֶלָּא הָכִי קָאָמַר: וְכֵן הַיְּתוֹמִין מִן הַיְּתוֹמִין – לֹא יִפָּרְעוּ אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבוּעָה.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said Our Sages in Babylonia, Rav and Shmuel; Our Sages in Eretz Yisrael, Rabbi Abba. Our Sages in Babylonia, Rav and Shmuel as we learned And likewise, orphans may collect with only by an oath; and we discussed it From whom If we say from the borrower, Their father would take without an oath, and they by means of an oath? Rather, this is saying: And even orphans do not collect from orphans, except by means of an oath.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Our Rabbis in Babylonia - Rav and Shmuel, our Rabbis in the Land of Israel - Rabbi Abba. Our Rabbis in Babylonia, Rav and Shmuel - as we learned: "And similarly with orphans, they should only collect after a week." And we asked: From whom? If from the lender - he takes without a week, and they with a week?! Rather, this is what he is saying: And similarly with orphans from other orphans - they should only collect after a week.

hebrew_text: וְרַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁמֵּת מַלְוֶה בְּחַיֵּי לֹוֶה; אֲבָל מֵת לֹוֶה בְּחַיֵּי מַלְוֶה – כְּבָר נִתְחַיֵּיב מַלְוֶה לִבְנֵי לֹוֶה שְׁבוּעָה, וְאֵין אָדָם מוֹרִישׁ שְׁבוּעָה לְבָנָיו.
human_translation: And Rav and Shmuel both say taught only when lender died during the lifetime of borrower, But borrower died during the lifetime of lender, lender has already become liable to an oath to the children of borrower, and a person cannot bequeath an oath, to his children,
llm_translation: Rav and Shmuel both say: They only taught that if the borrower dies during the lifetime of the lender, the lender is exempt from repaying the loan; but if the lender dies during the lifetime of the borrower, the borrower is already obligated to repay the loan to the heirs of the lender with an oath, and a person does not inherit an oath to his children.

hebrew_text: רַבּוֹתֵינוּ שֶׁבְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל רַבִּי אַבָּא – דְּהָהוּא גַּבְרָא דַּחֲטַף נְסָכָא מֵחַבְרֵיהּ; אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב אַמֵּי, יְתֵיב רַבִּי אַבָּא קַמֵּיהּ. אַיְיתִי חֲדָא סָהֲדָא דְּמִחְטָף חַטְפֵהּ מִינֵּיהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״אִין, חֲטַפִי – וְדִידִי חֲטַפִי״.
human_translation: Our Sages in Eretz Yisrael, Rabbi Abba As a certain man who snatched a piece of cast metal from another. came before Rav Ami Rabbi Abba was sitting before him, brought one witness that did, snatch it from him. said to him: Yes, I snatched but I snatched mine.
llm_translation: Our Rabbis in the Land of Israel, Rabbi Abba - concerning that man who snatched a libation offering from his colleagues; he came before Rav Ammi, Rabbi Abba sat before him. He brought a witness who saw him snatch it from him, he said to him: "No, you snatched - and I snatched."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי: הֵיכִי לִידַיְּינוּ דַּיָּינֵי לְהַאי דִּינָא? נֵימָא לֵיהּ ״זִיל שַׁלֵּים״ – לֵיכָּא תְּרֵי סָהֲדִי. נִפְטְרֵיהּ – אִיכָּא חַד סָהֲדָא. נֵימָא לֵיהּ ״זִיל אִישְׁתְּבַע״ – כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר ״מִיחְטָף חֲטַפִי״, הָוֵה לֵיהּ כְּגַזְלָן.
human_translation: Rabbi Ami said: How should judges rule in this case? say to Go pay there are not two witnesses to exempt him there is one witness say to him: Go take an oath, once he said snatch he is like a robber,
llm_translation: Rabbi Ammi said: How can we establish the judges for this case? Let us say to him, "Go pay" - there are not two witnesses. If he pays - there is one witness. Let us say to him, "Go claim" - since he said, "I will snatch, I will snatch," he is considered a robber.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי אַבָּא: הָוֵה מְחוּיָּב שְׁבוּעָה וְאֵין יָכוֹל לִישָּׁבַע, וְכׇל הַמְחוּיָּב שְׁבוּעָה וְאֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לִישָּׁבַע – מְשַׁלֵּם.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba said to him: He is liable an oath who is unable to take an oath, and anyone who is liable an oath who is unable to take an oath pay.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Abba: If one is obligated to take an oath and is unable to swear, and anyone who is obligated to take an oath and is unable to swear - he pays.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: כְּוָותֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַבָּא מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּתָנֵי רַבִּי אַמֵּי: ״שְׁבֻעַת ה׳ תִּהְיֶה בֵּין שְׁנֵיהֶם״ – וְלֹא בֵּין הַיּוֹרְשִׁין. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי?
human_translation: Rava said: It stands to reason in accordance with of Rabbi Abba; as Rabbi Ami teaches “the oath of the Lord shall be between them both” but not between their heirs. What are the circumstances
llm_translation: Rava said: The reasoning of Rabbi Abba seems plausible, as Rabbi Ammi teaches: "The oath of the Lord shall be between the two of them" - and not between the heirs. How so?

hebrew_text: אִילֵימָא דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ: ״מָנֶה לְאַבָּא בְּיַד אָבִיךָ״, וְאָמַר לֵיהּ: ״חַמְשִׁין אִית לֵיהּ וְחַמְשִׁין לֵית לֵיהּ״ – מָה לִי הוּא וּמָה לִי אֲבוּהָא?
human_translation: If we say where said to One hundred dinars to my father in the possession of your father, said to him: He had fifty, and fifty he did not have what to me he, or his father,
llm_translation: If one were to say to him, "Appoint for Abba with your father," and he said to him, "He has five and he does not have five" - what is it to me and what is it to my father?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ: ״מָנֶה לְאַבָּא בְּיַד אָבִיךָ״, אָמַר לֵיהּ: ״חַמְשִׁין יָדַעְנָא וְחַמְשִׁין לָא יָדַעְנָא״?
human_translation: Rather, is it not that said to One hundred dinars my father’s in the possession of your father, said to him: fifty I know but I do not know fifty
llm_translation: Rather, is it not that he said to him: "A portion for Abba in the hand of your father," he said to him: "We know five and we do not know five?"

hebrew_text: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא אָבִיו כִּי הַאי גַוְונָא מִיחַיַּיב, אִיצְטְרִיךְ קְרָא לְמִיפְטַר גַּבֵּי יוֹרְשִׁין; אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ אָבִיו כִּי הַאי גַוְונָא נָמֵי פָּטוּר, קְרָא גַּבֵּי יוֹרְשִׁין לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: Granted, if you say his father, a case like this, would be liable verse was necessary to exempt the heirs But if you say a case like this, his father is also exempt why do I a verse about heirs?
llm_translation: If you say "his father," for this type of case he is liable, a verse is necessary to exempt the heirs; but if you say "his father," for this type of case he is truly exempt, why do I need a verse for the heirs?

hebrew_text: וְרַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל – הַאי ״שְׁבֻעַת ה׳״ מַאי קָא דָּרְשִׁי בֵּיהּ?
human_translation: And Rav and Shmuel, what do they derive from this “The oath of the Lord
llm_translation: Rav and Shmuel - this "oath of the Lord," what did he expound in it?

hebrew_text: מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְתַנְיָא, שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן טַרְפוֹן אוֹמֵר: ״שְׁבֻעַת ה׳ תִּהְיֶה בֵּין שְׁנֵיהֶם״ – מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהַשְּׁבוּעָה חָלָה עַל שְׁנֵיהֶם.
human_translation: It is necessary for that which is taught Shimon ben Tarfon says: “The oath of the Lord shall be between them both,” teaches that the oath applies to them both,
llm_translation: He seeks according to the teaching, Shimon ben Tarfon says: "The oath of the Lord shall be between the two of them" - teaching that the oath applies to both of them.

hebrew_text: שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן טַרְפוֹן אוֹמֵר: אַזְהָרָה לָעוֹקֵב אַחֵר נוֹאֵף, מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לֹא תִּנְאָף״ – לֹא תַּנְאִיף.
human_translation: Shimon ben Tarfon says: prohibition of following after an adulterer, from where The verse states: “You shall not commit adultery [ lo tinaf ]” You shall not cause adultery [ lo tanif ].
llm_translation: Shimon ben Tarfon says: Warning to the one who follows after an adulterer, from where? Scripture teaches: "You shall not commit adultery" - you shall not cause to commit adultery.

hebrew_text: ״וַתֵּרָגְנוּ בְּאׇהֳלֵיכֶם״ – שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן טַרְפוֹן אוֹמֵר: תַּרְתֶּם וְגִינִּיתֶם בְּאׇהֳלוֹ שֶׁל מָקוֹם.
human_translation: “And you murmured [ vatteragenu ] in your tents Shimon ben Tarfon says: You explored [ tartem ] and: You disparaged [ ginnitem ] in the tent of the Omnipresent.
llm_translation: "And they shall be arranged in your tents" - Shimon ben Tarfon says: You have plowed and sown in the tent of a place.

hebrew_text: ״עַד הַנָּהָר הַגָּדוֹל נְהַר פְּרָת״ – שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן טַרְפוֹן אוֹמֵר: קְרַב לְגַבֵּי דְהִינָא, וְאִידְּהַן. דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל תָּנָא: עֶבֶד מֶלֶךְ – כְּמֶלֶךְ.
human_translation: “As far as the great river, the river Euphrates” Shimon ben Tarfon says: Draw close to the anointed with oil and become anointed school of Rabbi Yishmael taught The servant of a king is like a king.
llm_translation: "Until the great river, the Euphrates River" - Shimon ben Tarfon says: Approach the judgment, and they judged. The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: A servant of the king is like the king.

hebrew_text: וְהַחֶנְוָנִי עַל פִּינְקָסוֹ כּוּ׳. תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי: טוֹרַח שְׁבוּעָה זוֹ לָמָּה? אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי חִיָּיא (בַּר אַבָּא), תְּנֵינָא: שְׁנֵיהֶם נִשְׁבָּעִין וְנוֹטְלִין מִבַּעַל הַבַּיִת.
human_translation: the storekeeper on his ledger It is taught Rabbi said: Why bother this oath, Rabbi Ḥiyya said to him: We learn both of them take an oath and receive from the employer.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And the Chenvani on his pinkaso, etc." It was taught: Rabbi said: Why this Torach Shevuah? Rabbi Chiya (bar Abba) said to him: We learned: Both of them swear and take from the homeowner.

hebrew_text: קִיבְּלַהּ מִינֵּיהּ, אוֹ לָא קִיבְּלַהּ מִינֵּיהּ? תָּא שְׁמַע: דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: פּוֹעֲלִין נִשְׁבָּעִין לַחֶנְוָנִי. וְאִם אִיתָא, לְבַעַל הַבַּיִת מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: Did accept from him or did he not accept it from him? Come hear as it is taught Rabbi says: The laborers take an oath to the storekeeper And if it is so should have to the employer.
llm_translation: She received it from them, or did she not receive it from them? Come and hear: as it was taught, Rabbi says: workers are obligated to the innkeeper. And if it is available, the homeowner requires it!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: פּוֹעֲלִים נִשְׁבָּעִין לְבַעַל הַבַּיִת – בְּמַעֲמַד חֶנְוָנִי; כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלִיכַּסְפוּ מִינֵּיהּ.
