human_translation: Rava said: The laborers take an oath to the employer in the presence of the storekeeper, so that they will feel ashamed with him
llm_translation: Rava said: Workers are sworn to the homeowner - in the presence of a trustworthy person; so that they do not suspect him.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: שְׁתֵּי כִּיתֵּי עֵדִים הַמַּכְחִישׁוֹת זוֹ אֶת זוֹ – אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: זוֹ בָּאָה בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָהּ וּמְעִידָה, וְזוֹ בָּאָה בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָהּ וּמְעִידָה. רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר: בַּהֲדֵי סָהֲדֵי שַׁקָּרֵי לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: It was stated two sets of witnesses who contradict one another, Rav Huna says: This come by itself and testify and that come by itself and testify. Rav Ḥisda said: Why do I with lying witnesses?
llm_translation: It was stated: Two groups of witnesses who contradict each other - Rav Huna said: This one comes and testifies on its own, and this one comes and testifies on its own. Rav Hisda said: With false witnesses, what do I need witnesses for?

hebrew_text: שְׁנֵי מַלְוִין וּשְׁנֵי לוֹוִין וּשְׁנֵי שְׁטָרוֹת – הַיְינוּ פְּלוּגְתַּיְיהוּ; מַלְוֶה וְלֹוֶה וּשְׁנֵי שְׁטָרוֹת – יַד בַּעַל הַשְּׁטָר עַל הַתַּחְתּוֹנָה;
human_translation: two lenders, and two borrowers, and two notes, this is their dispute. lender, and borrower, and two notes, the holder of the note is at a disadvantage
llm_translation: Two malvin and two lovin and two shtarot - that is their dispute; malveh and loveh and two shtarot - the hand of the holder of the document is on the lower one.

hebrew_text: שְׁנֵי מַלְוִין וְלֹוֶה אֶחָד וּשְׁנֵי שְׁטָרוֹת – הַיְינוּ מַתְנִיתִין; שְׁנֵי לוֹוִין וּמַלְוֶה אֶחָד וּשְׁנֵי שְׁטָרוֹת – מַאי? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: two lenders, and a single borrower, and two notes, this is the mishna, two borrowers, and a single lender, and two notes, what shall stand
llm_translation: Two guarantors and one borrower, and two promissory notes - this is referring to a Mishnah; two borrowers and one guarantor, and two promissory notes - what is the ruling? This remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב הוּנָא בַּר יְהוּדָה:
human_translation: Rav Huna bar Yehuda raises an objection
llm_translation: Rav Huna son of Yehuda raises an objection:

hebrew_text: אֶחָד אוֹמֵר גָּבוֹהַּ שְׁתֵּי מַרְדְּעוֹת וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר שָׁלֹשׁ – עֵדוּתָן קַיֶּימֶת. אֶחָד אוֹמֵר שָׁלֹשׁ וְאֶחָד אוֹמֵר חָמֵשׁ – עֵדוּתָן בְּטֵלָה, וּמִצְטָרְפִין לְעֵדוּת אַחֶרֶת.
human_translation: one says two oxgoads high and one says three their testimony is valid, one says three and the one says five, their testimony is voided. But join in another testimony.
llm_translation: One says two legs high and one says three - their testimony stands. One says three and one says five - their testimony is nullified, and they join with another testimony.

hebrew_text: מַאי, לָאו לְעֵדוּת מָמוֹן? אָמַר רָבָא: הוּא וְאַחֵר מִצְטָרְפִין לְעֵדוּת אַחֶרֶת שֶׁל רֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ; דְּהָוֵי לְהוּ תְּרֵי וְחַד, וְאֵין דְּבָרָיו שֶׁל אֶחָד בִּמְקוֹם שְׁנַיִם.
human_translation: What, is it not for testimony monetary matters, Rava said, He, and another may combine for another testimony about new moon, as they become two one and the statement of one no in a place two
llm_translation: What, is it not for testimony of money? Rava said: He and another combine for the testimony of another new moon; for it will be two and one, and the words of one are not in the place of two.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לַחֶנְוָנִי ״תֵּן לִי בְּדִינָר פֵּירוֹת״ כּוּ׳. תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: אֵימָתַי – בִּזְמַן שֶׁהַפֵּירוֹת צְבוּרִין וּמוּנָּחִין, וּשְׁנֵיהֶן עוֹרְרִין עֲלֵיהֶן; אֲבָל הִפְשִׁילָן בְּקוּפָּתוֹ לַאֲחוֹרָיו – הַמּוֹצִיא מֵחֲבֵרוֹ עָלָיו הָרְאָיָה.
human_translation: said to a storekeeper: Give me produce at a dinar, It is taught Rabbi Yehuda says: When when the produce is collected and situated and the two of them are quarreling about it. But bundled in his basket on his back, the burden of proof rests upon the claimant,
llm_translation: He said to the merchant, "Give me fruits for a dinar." It was taught: Rabbi Yehuda said: When? When the fruits are gathered and placed, and both parties have agreed upon them; but if he turned them over in his basket behind him - the burden of proof is upon the one who brings a claim against his fellow.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לַשּׁוּלְחָנִי ״תֵּן לִי״ כּוּ׳. וּצְרִיכָא; דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן הָא קַמַּיְיתָא – בְּהָךְ קָא אָמְרִי רַבָּנַן, מִשּׁוּם דְּפֵירֵי עֲבִידִי דְּמַרְקְבִי, וְכֵיוָן דְּמַרְקְבִי לָא מְשַׁהוּ לֵיהּ; אֲבָל מָעוֹת דְּלָא מַרְקְבִי – אֵימָא מוֹדֵי לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: said to a money changer: Give me It is necessary as had it taught us this first in that do the Rabbis say because produce prone to spoiling, and since spoils do not retain it But money, which does not spoil, say they concede to Rabbi Yehuda
llm_translation: He said to the Shulchan, "Give me," etc. And it is necessary; for if we were to hear this in the presence of the first one - in that case the Rabbis say, because they are diligent in their work of markevi, and since they are diligent in markevi, they do not pay attention to him; but in cases where they are not diligent in markevi - say that they agree with Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אִיתְּמַר בְּהָא – בְּהָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, אֲבָל בְּהָךְ אֵימָא מוֹדֶה לְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן; צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And had been stated about that in that does Rabbi Yehuda say but in this say he concedes to the Rabbis. it is necessary
llm_translation: "And if it was stated in this case - in this case Rabbi Yehuda said, but in that case why not concede to the Rabbis; this is necessary."

hebrew_text: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁאָמְרוּ הַפּוֹגֶמֶת כְּתוּבָּתָהּ [וְכוּ׳], וְכֵן הַיְּתוֹמִין לֹא יִפָּרְעוּ. מִמַּאן? אִילֵימָא מִלֹּוֶה – אֲבוּהוֹן שָׁקֵיל בְּלָא שְׁבוּעָה, וְאִינְהוּ בִּשְׁבוּעָה?! הָכִי קָאָמַר: וְכֵן הַיְּתוֹמִים מִן הַיְּתוֹמִים, לֹא יִפָּרְעוּ אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבוּעָה.
human_translation: Just like said who vitiates her marriage contract, etc. And likewise, orphans may not collect From whom If we say from the borrower, Their father would take without an oath, and they by means of an oath? Rather, this is saying: And even orphans do not collect from orphans except by means of an oath.
llm_translation: As they said, "The borrower's document is written," and so too orphans should not collect. From whom? If you say from the lender - their father took without an oath, and they are with an oath?! This is what it means: And so orphans from orphans should only collect with an oath.

hebrew_text: רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁמֵּת מַלְוֶה בְּחַיֵּי לֹוֶה; אֲבָל מֵת לֹוֶה בְּחַיֵּי מַלְוֶה – כְּבָר נִתְחַיֵּיב מַלְוֶה לִבְנֵי לֹוֶה שְׁבוּעָה, וְאֵין אָדָם מוֹרִישׁ שְׁבוּעָה לְבָנָיו.
human_translation: Rav and Shmuel both say taught only when lender died during the lifetime of borrower, But borrower died during the lifetime of lender, lender has already become liable an oath to the children of borrower, and a person cannot bequeath an oath, to his children,
llm_translation: Rav and Shmuel both say: They only taught that the lender dies during the lifetime of the borrower; but if the borrower dies during the lifetime of the lender - the lender is already obligated to swear to the heirs of the borrower, and a person does not make his heirs swear.

hebrew_text: שַׁלְחוּהָ קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: שְׁבוּעָה זוֹ – מָה טִיבָהּ? שְׁלַח לְהוּ: יוֹרְשִׁין נִשְׁבָּעִין שְׁבוּעַת יוֹרְשִׁין, וְנוֹטְלִין. שַׁלְחוּהָ בִּימֵי רַבִּי אַמֵּי, אָמַר: כּוּלֵּי הַאי שָׁלְחִי לַהּ וְאָזְלִי? אִי אַשְׁכְּחִינַן בַּהּ טַעְמָא, מִי לָא שָׁלְחִינַן לְהוּ?! אֶלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי: הוֹאִיל וַאֲתָא לְיָדָן, נֵימָא בַּהּ מִילְּתָא:
human_translation: sent to Rabbi Elazar What is the nature of this oath sent to them: heirs take heirs’ oath, and collect They sent in the days of Rabbi Ami. He said: They continue to send this this extent? If we had found explanation, wouldn’t we have sent to them? Nevertheless, Rabbi Ami said: Since came to us, let us say something about it.
llm_translation: Send it before Rabbi Elazar: What is the nature of this oath? Send to him: Heirs take an oath of heirs, and they collect. They sent it in the days of Rabbi Ammi, he said: All these messengers I send to him and they go? If we do not remember the reason, who did we send to him?! Rather, Rabbi Ammi said: Since it has come into our hands, let us say the matter in it.

hebrew_text: עָמַד בַּדִּין וָמֵת – כְּבָר נִתְחַיֵּיב מַלְוֶה לִבְנֵי לֹוֶה שְׁבוּעָה, וְאֵין אָדָם מוֹרִישׁ שְׁבוּעָה לְבָנָיו. לֹא עָמַד בַּדִּין וָמֵת – יוֹרְשִׁין נִשְׁבָּעִין שְׁבוּעַת יוֹרְשִׁין, וְנוֹטְלִין.
human_translation: stood trial and died lender has already become liable an oath to the children of borrower and a person cannot bequeath an oath to his children, did not stand trial, and died, the heirs take the heirs’ oath, and collect
llm_translation: He stood in judgment and died - he is already obligated to swear to the sons of Levi, and no one makes his sons swear. He did not stand in judgment and died - his heirs swear the heirs' oath, and they collect.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב נַחְמָן: אַטּוּ בֵּי דִינָא קָא מְחַיְּיבִי לֵיהּ שְׁבוּעָה?! מֵעִידָּנָא דִּשְׁכֵיב לֹוֶה, אִיחַיַּיב לֵיהּ מַלְוֶה לִבְנֵי לֹוֶה שְׁבוּעָה!
human_translation: Rav Naḥman objects to this: Is that to say the court that renders liable an oath? At the moment borrower died, lender was liable an oath to the children of borrower.
llm_translation: Challenges to him Rav Nachman: Now in the courts they are obligating him to an oath?! We testify that if one lends to him, the lender is obligated to the borrower to swear!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: אִי אִיתַהּ לִדְרַב וְדִשְׁמוּאֵל, אִיתַהּ; אִי לֵיתַהּ, לֵיתַהּ. אַלְמָא מְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ; וְהָאָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף בַּר מִנְיוֹמֵי: עֲבַד רַב נַחְמָן עוֹבָדָא – יַחְלוֹקוּ! לִדְבָרָיו דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר קָאָמַר, וְלֵיהּ לָא סְבִירָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Naḥman said: If of Rav and Shmuel is it is if it is not it is not. Evidently, is uncertain But didn’t Rav Yosef bar Minyumi say Rav Naḥman ruled case they divide stated with the statement of Rabbi Meir but he himself does not hold accordingly,
llm_translation: Rather, said Rav Nachman: If she is for Rav and Shmuel, she is; if not, she is not. This implies that he is uncertain about it. But didn't Rav Yosef bar Minyomi say: If Rav Nachman did the matter - they should divide it! He was speaking in accordance with the words of Rabbi Meir, and he does not agree with him.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב אוֹשַׁעְיָא: מֵתָה – יוֹרְשֶׁיהָ מַזְכִּירִין אֶת כְּתוּבָּתָהּ עַד עֶשְׂרִים וְחָמֵשׁ שָׁנִים! הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן – שֶׁנִּשְׁבְּעָה וּמֵתָה.
human_translation: Rav Oshaya raises an objection died her heirs, may invoke her marriage contract up to twenty-five years Here we are dealing with where took an oath but died
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: If she died - her heirs mention her document for twenty-five years! Here, what are we dealing with - that she took an oath and then died.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: נָשָׂא רִאשׁוֹנָה וָמֵתָה, נָשָׂא שְׁנִיָּה וּמֵת הוּא – שְׁנִיָּה וְיוֹרְשֶׁיהָ קוֹדְמִין לְיוֹרְשֵׁי הָרִאשׁוֹנָה! הָכָא נָמֵי, שֶׁנִּשְׁבְּעָה וּמֵתָה.
human_translation: Come hear he married first and she died, he married second and he died, second and her heirs take precedence over the heirs of the first also where took an oath but died
llm_translation: Come and hear: If he married the first wife and she died, he married a second wife and he himself died - the second wife and her heirs precede the heirs of the first wife! Here it is stated, because she took an oath and died.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: אֲבָל יוֹרְשָׁיו מַשְׁבִּיעִין אוֹתָהּ, וְאֶת יוֹרְשֶׁיהָ, וְאֶת הַבָּאִין בִּרְשׁוּתָהּ!
human_translation: Come hear but his heirs can administer an oath to her, to her heirs, and to those who come on her authority
llm_translation: Come and hear: But his heirs make her swear, and her heirs, and those who come with her consent!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שְׁמַעְיָה, לִצְדָדִין קָתָנֵי: אוֹתָהּ – בְּאַלְמָנָה, וְיוֹרְשֶׁיהָ – בִּגְרוּשָׁה.
human_translation: Rav Shemaya said: teaches disjunctively. to her when a widow, or her heirs when a divorcée
llm_translation: Rav Shemaya said, the Tzidadin Sages taught: "That one - with a widow, and her heirs - with a divorcee."

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב נָתָן בַּר הוֹשַׁעְיָא: יָפֶה כֹּחַ הַבֵּן מִכֹּחַ הָאָב –
human_translation: Rav Natan bar Hoshaya raises an objection the power of the son is greater than the power of the father,
llm_translation: Rav Nathan bar Hoshaya raises an objection: "The strength of the son is greater than the strength of the father."

hebrew_text: שֶׁהַבֵּן גּוֹבֶה בֵּין בִּשְׁבוּעָה וּבֵין שֶׁלֹּא בִּשְׁבוּעָה, וְהָאָב אֵינוֹ גּוֹבֶה אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבוּעָה. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי – דְּמֵת לֹוֶה בְּחַיֵּי מַלְוֶה;
human_translation: as the son can collect both by an oath and without an oath, while the father can collect only by an oath. What are the circumstances when borrower died during the life of lender.
llm_translation: The son collects both during the week and not during the week, while the father only collects during the week. How so? It is comparable to one who lends with the life of the borrower.

hebrew_text: וְקָתָנֵי: שֶׁהַבֵּן גּוֹבֶה בֵּין בִּשְׁבוּעָה וּבֵין שֶׁלֹּא בִּשְׁבוּעָה; בִּשְׁבוּעָה – שְׁבוּעַת יוֹרְשִׁין, שֶׁלֹּא בִּשְׁבוּעָה – כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל!
human_translation: And it is taught: As the son can collect both by an oath and without an oath. by an oath the heirs’ oath, without an oath in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel
llm_translation: And it was taught: that the son collects the debt whether within a week or not within a week; within a week – the week of heirs, not within a week – like Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: הָא מַנִּי – בֵּית שַׁמַּאי הִיא, דְּאָמְרִי: שְׁטָר הָעוֹמֵד לִגְבּוֹת – כְּגָבוּי דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said whose is this It is Beit Shammai, who say note that stands to be collected as if is collected.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: This is the opinion of Beit Shammai, for they say: A promissory note that is ready to be collected is considered as if the money itself is collected.

hebrew_text: אִיקְּלַע רַב נַחְמָן לְסוּרָא; עוּל לְגַבֵּיהּ רַב חִסְדָּא וְרַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא, אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: לֵיתֵי מָר נֶעְקְרַהּ לְהָא דְּרַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל. אֲמַר לְהוּ: אִיכַּפְלִי וַאֲתַאי כֹּל הָנֵי פַּרְסֵי, לְמֶעְקְרַהּ לְהָא דְּרַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל?! אֶלָּא הַבוּ דְלָא לוֹסֵיף עֲלַהּ; כְּגוֹן מַאי דְּאָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: הַפּוֹגֵם אֶת שְׁטָרוֹ וָמֵת – יוֹרְשִׁין נִשְׁבָּעִין שְׁבוּעַת יוֹרְשִׁין, וְנוֹטְלִין.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman arrived in Sura. Rav Ḥisda and Rabba bar Rav Huna came to him. They said to him: Let Master come, we will overturn that of Rav and Shmuel. said to them: Did I exert and come all these parasangs to uproot that of Rav and Shmuel? Rather, let us not extend like what Rav Pappa says: vitiates his note, and dies, heirs take the heirs’ oath and collect
llm_translation: Rav Nachman arrived in Sura; Rav Chisda and Rabbah bar Rav Huna came before him, they said to him: Let the master come and uproot it for Rav and Shmuel. He said to them: Should I come and uproot all these Persians for the sake of Rav and Shmuel?! Rather, give it to me so that I do not add to it; like that which Rav Papa said: One who damages his document and dies - his heirs take an oath of the heirs and collect.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא דִּשְׁכֵיב, וּשְׁבַק עָרְבָא. סְבַר רַב פָּפָּא לְמֵימָר: הָא נָמֵי – דְּלָא לוֹסֵיף עֲלַהּ הוּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ לְרַב פָּפָּא: אַטּוּ עָרְבָא לָאו בָּתַר יַתְמֵי אָזֵיל?!
human_translation: a certain who died and left a guarantor Rav Pappa thought to say: This, too, is one should not extend Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said to Rav Pappa: Is that to say the guarantor will not pursue orphans
llm_translation: That one who lay down, and left the evening. Rav Papa thought to say: This is true - that he did not add to it. Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said to Rav Papa: Now, is the evening not after the day has passed?!

hebrew_text: הָהוּא דִּשְׁכֵיב, וּשְׁבַק אַחָא. סָבַר רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא לְמֵימַר: הָא נָמֵי – דְּלָא לוֹסֵיף עֲלַהּ הוּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: מָה לִי ״שֶׁלֹּא פְּקָדַנִי אַבָּא״, וּמָה לִי ״שֶׁלֹּא פְּקָדַנִי אָחִי״.
human_translation: a certain who died and left a brother Rami bar Ḥama thought to say this, too, is one should not extend Rava said to him: What to me father did not inform me and what to me My brother did not inform me?
llm_translation: That one who lay down, and left behind Acha. Ramei Bar Chama thought to say: This is a blemish - for he did not add upon it. Rava said to him: What do I have to do with "my father did not rebuke me," and what do I have to do with "my brother did not rebuke me."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חָמָא: הַשְׁתָּא דְּלָא אִיתְּמַר הִלְכְתָא לָא כְּרַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל וְלָא כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר; הַאי דַּיָּינָא דַּעֲבַד כְּרַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל – עֲבַד, דַּעֲבַד כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר – עֲבַד.
human_translation: Rav Ḥama says: Now that the halakha was not stated either in accordance with Rav and Shmuel or in accordance with Rabbi Elazar, a judge who rules in accordance with Rav and Shmuel has ruled, who rules in accordance with Rabbi Elazar has ruled,
llm_translation: Rav Hama said: This year, the halakha was not ruled like Rav and Shmuel, nor like Rabbi Elazar. This wine steward who acted like Rav and Shmuel - he acted; he who acted like Rabbi Elazar - he acted.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: הַאי שְׁטָרָא דְּיַתְמֵי – לָא מִקְרָע קָרְעִינַן לֵיהּ, וְלָא אַגְבּוֹיֵי מַגְבִּינַן בֵּיהּ. אַגְבּוֹיֵי לָא מַגְבִּינַן בֵּיהּ – דִּלְמָא סְבִירָא לַן כְּרַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל, וּמִקְרָע לָא קָרְעִינַן לֵיהּ – דְּהַאי דַּיָּינָא דַּעֲבַד כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, עֲבַד.
human_translation: Rav Pappa says: that note of orphans we do not tear it up, but we do not collect with it. We do not collect with it, perhaps we hold in accordance with Rav and Shmuel but we do not tear it up, since a judge who rules in accordance with Rabbi Elazar has ruled.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: This document of Yatmei - we do not tear it, and we do not store it away. If we do not store it away - perhaps we think like Rav and Shmuel, and if we do not tear it - because of this wine that Rabbi Elazar made, he did.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא דַּיָּינָא דַּעֲבַד כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר. הֲוָה צוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן בְּמָתֵיהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַיְיתִינָא אִיגַּרְתָּא מִמַּעְרְבָא, דְּלֵית הִלְכְתָא כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לְכִי תַּיְיתֵי. אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב חָמָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַאי דַּיָּינָא דַּעֲבַד כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר – עֲבַד.
human_translation: a certain judge who ruled in accordance with Rabbi Elazar. There was a Torah scholar in his city. He said to I will bring a letter from the West, that the halakha is not in accordance with Rabbi Elazar. said to him: When you bring came before Rav Ḥama, said to him: A judge who rules in accordance with Rabbi Elazar has ruled,
llm_translation: That one, the wine merchant who acted like Rabbi Elazar. He was sitting among the sages in his city, he said to them: I brought a letter from the west, where the halakha is not like Rabbi Elazar. They said to him: Go bring it. He came before Rav Hama, he said to him: This wine merchant who acted like Rabbi Elazar - he did.

hebrew_text: וְאֵלּוּ נִשְׁבָּעִין. אַטּוּ בְּשׁוּפְטָנֵי עָסְקִינַן?! הָכִי קָאָמַר: וְאֵלּוּ נִשְׁבָּעִין שֶׁלֹּא בְּטַעֲנַת בָּרִי אֶלָּא בְּטַעֲנַת שֶׁמָּא – הַשּׁוּתָּפִין וְהָאֲרִיסִין.
human_translation: And these take an oath Is that to say we are dealing with fools This is saying: And these take an oath without to a definite claim but to an uncertain claim, Partners, sharecroppers,
llm_translation: And these are the ones who take an oath. Are we dealing with judges here?! This is what it means: And these are the ones who take an oath not in a claim of a healthy person, but in a claim of perhaps - partners and tenants.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: בֶּן בַּיִת שֶׁאָמְרוּ – לֹא שֶׁנִּכְנָס וְיוֹצֵא בְּרַגְלָיו; אֶלָּא מַכְנִיס לוֹ פּוֹעֲלִין וּמוֹצִיא לוֹ פּוֹעֲלִין, מַכְנִיס לוֹ פֵּירוֹת וּמוֹצִיא לוֹ פֵּירוֹת.
human_translation: taught member of the household whom they mentioned not who enters and exits on foot rather engages laborers, and dismisses laborers, gathers produce, and sends out produce
llm_translation: It was taught: Regarding a homeowner - not that he enters and exits with his feet; rather, they bring in workers for him and take out workers for him, they bring in fruits for him and take out fruits for him.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי שְׁנָא הָנֵי? מִשּׁוּם דְּמוֹרוּ בֵּהּ הֶתֵּירָא.
human_translation: And what is different these because they grant permission from
llm_translation: And what is different about these? Because they are taught with fear.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף בַּר מִנְיוֹמֵי, אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: וְהוּא שֶׁיֵּשׁ טַעֲנָה בֵּינַיְיהוּ שְׁתֵּי כֶּסֶף.
human_translation: Rav Yosef bar Minyumi said Rav Naḥman said: when there is a claim between them two silver
llm_translation: Rav Yosef bar Minyomei said, Rav Nachman said: And this is when there is a claim between them of two silver coins.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן – כִּשְׁמוּאֵל?! וְהָתָנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא לְסַיּוֹעֵיהּ לְרַב! אֵימָא כְּפִירַת טַעֲנָה, כְּרַב.
human_translation: In accordance with whose in accordance with Shmuel? But didn’t Rabbi Ḥiyya teach in support of Rav? Say the denial of a claim in accordance with Rav.
llm_translation: As whom - as Shmuel?! And it was taught: Rabbi Chiya said to his assistants to Rav! Say it is like the horn of a claim, like Rav.

hebrew_text: חָלְקוּ הַשּׁוּתָּפִין וְהָאֲרִיסִין. אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: מַהוּ לְגַלְגֵּל בִּדְרַבָּנַן?
human_translation: the partners or the sharecroppers have divided A question was raised before What is about extending by rabbinic law?
llm_translation: The partners and the tenants divided. They asked: What about rolling on the Sabbath?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: לָוָה הֵימֶנּוּ עֶרֶב שְׁבִיעִית, וּלְמוֹצָאֵי שְׁבִיעִית נַעֲשָׂה לוֹ שׁוּתָּף אוֹ אָרִיס – אֵין מְגַלְגְּלִין. טַעְמָא דְּלָוָה הֵימֶנּוּ עֶרֶב שְׁבִיעִית – דַּאֲתַאי שְׁבִיעִית אַפְקַעְתֵּיהּ; הָא שְׁאָר שְׁנֵי שָׁבוּעַ – מְגַלְגְּלִין!
human_translation: Come hear one borrowed from eve of, Sabbatical and upon the conclusion of the Sabbatical became his partner or sharecropper, may not extend reason that he borrowed from him eve of the Sabbatical so that Sabbatical came and abrogated Therefore, the other years of the Sabbatical may be extended
llm_translation: Come and hear: If one borrowed from him on the eve of the seventh year, and on the conclusion of the seventh year a partnership or lease was made with him - we do not roll the debt over. The reason for borrowing from him on the eve of the seventh year is that the seventh year comes and cancels it; but for the rest of the two weeks - we roll the debt over!

hebrew_text: לָא תֵּימָא: הָא שְׁאָר שְׁנֵי שָׁבוּעַ – מְגַלְגְּלִין; אֶלָּא אֵימָא: נַעֲשָׂה לוֹ שׁוּתָּף אוֹ אָרִיס עֶרֶב שְׁבִיעִית, וּלְמוֹצָאֵי שְׁבִיעִית לָוָה הֵימֶנּוּ – מְגַלְגְּלִין.
human_translation: Do not say: Therefore, the other years of the Sabbatical may be extended. Rather, say he became his partner or sharecropper eve of the Sabbatical and upon the conclusion of the Sabbatical he borrowed from him may be extended.
llm_translation: Do not say: the leftover of the two weeks - we roll; rather say: if he made a partnership or rented out for the seventh year, and the produce of the seventh year was lent to him - we roll.

hebrew_text: הָא בְּהֶדְיָא קָתָנֵי לַהּ: נַעֲשָׂה לוֹ שׁוּתָּף אוֹ אָרִיס עֶרֶב שְׁבִיעִית, וּלְמוֹצָאֵי שְׁבִיעִית לָוָה הֵימֶנּוּ – מְגַלְגְּלִין! שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: מְגַלְגְּלִין בִּדְרַבָּנַן! שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: that taught explicitly If he became his partner or sharecropper on the eve of the Sabbatical and upon the conclusion of the Sabbatical he borrowed from him, may be extended. Conclude from it by rabbinic law may be extended. Conclude from it
llm_translation: Here is the English translation of the Talmudic text: In truth, it was taught in a Baraita: If one made a partnership or lease agreement for the seventh year, and at the conclusion of the seventh year, he lent it to him – we roll the produce! Learn from this: we roll the produce according to the Rabbis! Learn from this.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא:
human_translation: Rav Huna says:
llm_translation: Rav Huna said:

hebrew_text: לַכֹּל מְגַלְגְּלִין, חוּץ מִשָּׂכִיר – שֶׁאֵין מְגַלְגְּלִין. רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר: לַכֹּל אֵין מְקִילִּין, חוּץ מִשָּׂכִיר – דִּמְקִילִּין. מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ לִפְתּוֹחַ לוֹ.
human_translation: Any may be extended except for a hired worker, which may not be extended, Rav Ḥisda says: everyone, are not lenient, except for a hired worker, whom they are lenient. What between There is between them initiates for him,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "To all we roll, except for a hired laborer - for we do not roll. Rav Ḥisdah said: To all we do not untie, except for a hired laborer - for we untie. What is the difference between them? There is a difference between them to open for him."

hebrew_text: וְהַשְּׁבִיעִית מְשַׁמֶּטֶת כּוּ׳. מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַב גִּידֵּל אָמַר רַב, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וְזֶה דְּבַר הַשְּׁמִטָּה״ – וַאֲפִילּוּ דִּיבּוּר מְשַׁמֶּטֶת.
human_translation: The Sabbatical abrogates From where is this matter Rav Giddel says Rav says: that the verse states: “And this is the matter [ devar ] of the release: this teaches that the Sabbatical Year releases, even a statement,
llm_translation: Seventh she releases. From where these words? Said Rav Giddel said Rav, as said Scripture: "And this is the matter of the release" - even mere speech releases.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ כׇּל הַנִּשְׁבָּעִין
llm_translation: We will return to you, all who have taken an oath.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אַרְבָּעָה שׁוֹמְרִין הֵן: שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם וְהַשּׁוֹאֵל, נוֹשֵׂא שָׂכָר וְהַשּׂוֹכֵר.
human_translation: There are four bailees, An unpaid bailee, and a borrower, a paid bailee, and a renter,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: There are four types of guardians: a gratuitous guardian, a borrower, a paid guardian, and a renter.

hebrew_text: שׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם נִשְׁבָּע עַל הַכֹּל, וְהַשּׁוֹאֵל מְשַׁלֵּם אֶת הַכֹּל.
human_translation: An unpaid bailee takes an oath for everything, a borrower pays for everything,
llm_translation: Guardian gratuitously swears on everything, and the inquirer pays for everything.

hebrew_text: נוֹשֵׂא שָׂכָר וְהַשּׂוֹכֵר – נִשְׁבָּעִין עַל הַשְּׁבוּרָה וְעַל הַשְּׁבוּיָה וְעַל הַמֵּתָה, וּמְשַׁלְּמִין אֶת הָאֲבֵדָה וְאֶת הַגְּנֵיבָה.
human_translation: a paid bailee and a renter take an oath concerning an injured and concerning a captured and concerning a dead But they must pay loss or theft,
llm_translation: The one who hires and the one who is hired - they swear regarding damage, theft, and death, and they pay for loss and theft.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְשׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם: ״הֵיכָן שׁוֹרִי?״ אָמַר לוֹ: ״מֵת״ – וְהוּא שֶׁנִּשְׁבַּר אוֹ נִשְׁבָּה אוֹ נִגְנַב אוֹ אָבַד; ״נִשְׁבַּר״ – וְהוּא שֶׁמֵּת אוֹ נִשְׁבָּה אוֹ נִגְנַב אוֹ אָבַד. ״נִשְׁבָּה״ – וְהוּא שֶׁמֵּת אוֹ נִשְׁבַּר אוֹ נִגְנַב אוֹ אָבַד; ״נִגְנַב״ – וְהוּא שֶׁמֵּת אוֹ נִשְׁבַּר אוֹ נִשְׁבָּה אוֹ אָבַד; ״אָבַד״ – וְהוּא שֶׁמֵּת אוֹ נִשְׁבַּר אוֹ נִשְׁבָּה אוֹ נִגְנַב; ״מַשְׁבִּיעֲךָ אֲנִי״, וְאָמַר ״אָמֵן״ – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: said to an unpaid bailee: Where is my ox? said to him: It died, but that it was injured or captured or stolen or lost; It was injured, but that it died or was captured or stolen or lost; It was captured, but that it died or was injured or stolen or lost; It was stolen, but that it died or was injured or captured or lost; It was lost, but that it died or was injured or captured or stolen, I administer an oath to you and said: Amen, exempt
llm_translation: He said to the watchman for free: "Where is my ox?" He said to him: "It died" - and this is whether it was broken, or torn, or stolen, or lost; "broken" - and this is whether it died, or was torn, or stolen, or lost. "torn" - and this is whether it died, or was broken, or stolen, or lost; "stolen" - and this is whether it died, or was broken, or torn, or lost; "lost" - and this is whether it died, or was broken, or torn, or stolen; "I put you under oath," and he said "Amen" - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: ״הֵיכָן שׁוֹרִי?״ אָמַר לוֹ: ״אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ מָה אַתָּה סָח״ – וְהוּא שֶׁמֵּת אוֹ נִשְׁבַּר אוֹ נִשְׁבָּה אוֹ נִגְנַב אוֹ אָבַד; ״מַשְׁבִּיעֲךָ אֲנִי״, וְאָמַר ״אָמֵן״ – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: Where is my ox? said to him: I do not know what you are talking about, but that it died or was injured or captured or stolen or lost, I administer an oath to you and said: Amen, exempt
llm_translation: "Where is my ox?" He said to him: "I do not know what you are talking about" - and it is because it died, or was broken, or was stolen, or was lost; "I adjure you," and he said "Amen" - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: ״הֵיכָן שׁוֹרִי?״ אָמַר לוֹ: ״אָבַד״; ״מַשְׁבִּיעֲךָ אֲנִי״, וְאָמַר ״אָמֵן״; וְהָעֵדִים מְעִידִים אוֹתוֹ שֶׁאֲכָלוֹ – מְשַׁלֵּם אֶת הַקֶּרֶן. הוֹדָה מֵעַצְמוֹ – מְשַׁלֵּם קֶרֶן וָחוֹמֶשׁ וְאָשָׁם.
human_translation: Where is my ox? said to him: It is lost, I administer an oath to you and said: Amen, and witnesses testify that consumed it, pays the principal, he admitted of his own pays principal and one-fifth and a guilt-offering
llm_translation: "Where is my ox?" he said to him: "It is lost"; "I adjure you," and he said "Amen"; and the witnesses testify that he ate it - he pays the principal. If he confesses by himself - he pays the principal, and a fifth, and a guilt offering.

hebrew_text: ״הֵיכָן שׁוֹרִי?״ וְאָמַר לוֹ: ״נִגְנַב״; ״מַשְׁבִּיעֲךָ אֲנִי״, וְאָמַר ״אָמֵן״; וְהָעֵדִים מְעִידִים אוֹתוֹ שֶׁגְּנָבוֹ – מְשַׁלֵּם תַּשְׁלוּמֵי כֶפֶל. הוֹדָה מֵעַצְמוֹ – מְשַׁלֵּם קֶרֶן וָחוֹמֶשׁ וְאָשָׁם.
human_translation: Where is my ox? And said to him: It was stolen, I administer an oath to you and said: Amen, and witnesses testify that stole it, pays double If he admitted of his own pays principal and one-fifth and a guilt-offering
llm_translation: "Where is my ox?" And he said to him, "It was stolen." "I adjure you," and he said, "Amen." And the witnesses testify that he stole it - he pays double restitution. If he confesses on his own - he pays principal, one-fifth, and guilt offering.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְאֶחָד בַּשּׁוּק: ״הֵיכָן שׁוֹרִי שֶׁגָּנַבְתָּ?״ הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״לֹא גָּנַבְתִּי״, וְהָעֵדִים מְעִידִים אוֹתוֹ שֶׁגְּנָבוֹ – מְשַׁלֵּם תַּשְׁלוּמֵי כֶפֶל. טָבַח וּמָכַר – מְשַׁלֵּם תַּשְׁלוּמֵי אַרְבָּעָה וַחֲמִשָּׁה. רָאָה עֵדִים שֶׁמְּמַשְׁמְשִׁין וּבָאִין, אָמַר: ״גָּנַבְתִּי, אֲבָל לֹא טָבַחְתִּי וְלֹא מָכַרְתִּי״ – אֵינוֹ מְשַׁלֵּם אֶלָּא קֶרֶן.
human_translation: said to someone in the marketplace, Where is my ox that you stole? says: I did not steal and witnesses testify that did steal it, pays the double payment. he slaughtered or sold pays the fourfold or fivefold payment. saw witnesses that were approaching he said: I stole but I did not slaughter or sell he pays only principal.
llm_translation: He said to one in the market: "Where is my ox that you stole?" He says: "I did not steal it," and the witnesses testify against him that he stole it - he pays double restitution. If he slaughtered it and sold it - he pays four or fivefold restitution. If witnesses who are known to be false come and testify, and he says: "I stole it, but I did not slaughter it or sell it" - he only pays the principal.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְשׁוֹאֵל: ״הֵיכָן שׁוֹרִי?״ אָמַר לוֹ:
human_translation: said to a borrower: Where is my ox? said to him:
llm_translation: He said to the inquirer: "Where is my ox?" He said to him:

hebrew_text: ״מֵת״ – וְהוּא שֶׁנִּשְׁבַּר אוֹ נִשְׁבָּה אוֹ נִגְנַב אוֹ אָבַד; ״נִשְׁבַּר״ – וְהוּא שֶׁמֵּת אוֹ נִשְׁבָּה אוֹ נִגְנַב אוֹ אָבַד; ״נִשְׁבָּה״ – וְהוּא שֶׁמֵּת אוֹ נִשְׁבַּר אוֹ נִגְנַב אוֹ אָבַד; ״נִגְנַב״ – וְהוּא שֶׁמֵּת אוֹ נִשְׁבַּר אוֹ נִשְׁבָּה אוֹ אָבַד; ״אָבַד״ – וְהוּא שֶׁמֵּת אוֹ נִשְׁבַּר אוֹ נִשְׁבָּה אוֹ נִגְנַב; ״מַשְׁבִּיעֲךָ אֲנִי״, וְאָמַר ״אָמֵן״ – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: It died, but it was injured or captured or stolen or lost; It was injured, but that it died or was captured or stolen or lost; It was captured, but that it died or was injured or stolen or lost; It was stolen, but that it died or was injured or captured or lost; It was lost, but that it died or was injured or captured or stolen, I administer an oath to you and said: Amen, exempt
llm_translation: "Talmudic text: 'Dead' - and he who was broken or was captured or was stolen or was lost; 'Broken' - and he who died or was captured or was stolen or was lost; 'Captured' - and he who died or was broken or was stolen or was lost; 'Stolen' - and he who died or was broken or was captured or was lost; 'Lost' - and he who died or was broken or was captured or was stolen; 'I adjure you,' and he said 'Amen' - he is exempt."

hebrew_text: ״הֵיכָן שׁוֹרִי?״ אָמַר לוֹ: ״אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ מָה אַתָּה סָח״ – וְהוּא שֶׁמֵּת אוֹ נִשְׁבַּר אוֹ נִשְׁבָּה אוֹ נִגְנַב אוֹ נֶאֱבָד; ״מַשְׁבִּיעֲךָ אֲנִי״, וְאָמַר ״אָמֵן״ – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: Where is my ox? said to him: I do not know what you are talking about, but that it died or was injured or captured or stolen or lost, I administer an oath to you and said: Amen, liable
llm_translation: "Where is my ox?" He said to him: "I do not know what you are talking about" - and it died or was broken or was stolen or was lost; "I adjure you," and he said "Amen" - he is liable.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְנוֹשֵׂא שָׂכָר וְהַשּׂוֹכֵר: ״הֵיכָן שׁוֹרִי?״ אָמַר לוֹ: ״מֵת״ – וְהוּא שֶׁנִּשְׁבַּר אוֹ נִשְׁבָּה; ״נִשְׁבַּר״ – וְהוּא שֶׁמֵּת אוֹ נִשְׁבָּה; ״נִשְׁבָּה״ – וְהוּא שֶׁמֵּת אוֹ נִשְׁבַּר; ״נִגְנַב״ – וְהוּא שֶׁאָבַד; ״אָבַד״ – וְהוּא שֶׁנִּגְנַב; ״מַשְׁבִּיעֲךָ אֲנִי״, וְאָמַר ״אָמֵן״ – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: said to a paid bailee or a renter: Where is my ox? said to him: It died, but that it was injured or captured; It was injured, but that it died or was captured; or if he said: It was captured, but that it died or was injured; It was stolen, but that it was lost; It was lost, but that it was stolen, I administer an oath to you and he said: Amen, exempt
llm_translation: He said to the one who carries the reward and the one who hires: "Where is my ox?" He said to him: "It died" - and it was either broken or torn; "it was broken" - and it either died or was torn; "it was torn" - and it either died or was broken; "it was stolen" - and it was lost; "it was lost" - and it was stolen; "I adjure you" and he said "Amen" - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: ״מֵת״ אוֹ ״נִשְׁבַּר״ אוֹ ״נִשְׁבָּה״ – וְהוּא שֶׁנִּגְנַב אוֹ אָבַד; ״מַשְׁבִּיעֲךָ אֲנִי״, וְאָמַר ״אָמֵן״ – חַיָּיב. ״אָבַד״ אוֹ ״נִגְנַב״ – וְהוּא שֶׁמֵּת אוֹ נִשְׁבַּר אוֹ נִשְׁבָּה; ״מַשְׁבִּיעֲךָ אֲנִי״, וְאָמַר ״אָמֵן״ – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: It died or was injured or captured, but that it was stolen or lost, I administer an oath to you and he said: Amen, liable It was lost or stolen, but that it died or was injured or captured, I administer an oath to you and he said: Amen, exempt
llm_translation: "Dead" or "broken" or "lost" - and this is when it was stolen or lost; "I adjure you" and he said "Amen" - liable. "Lost" or "stolen" - and this is when he died or it was broken or lost; "I adjure you" and he said "Amen" - exempt.

hebrew_text: זֶה הַכְּלָל: כׇּל הַמְשַׁנֶּה מֵחוֹבָה לְחוֹבָה, וּמִפְּטוּר לִפְטוּר, וּמִפְּטוּר לְחוֹבָה – פָּטוּר. מֵחוֹבָה לִפְטוּר – חַיָּיב. זֶה הַכְּלָל: כׇּל הַנִּשְׁבָּע לְהָקֵל עַל עַצְמוֹ – חַיָּיב. לְהַחְמִיר עַל עַצְמוֹ – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: This is the principle: Anyone who changes from liability to liability or from exemption to exemption or from exemption to liability exempt from liability to exemption, liable. This is the principle: Anyone who takes an oath to be lenient with himself liable; to be stringent with himself, exempt.
llm_translation: This is the principle: Anyone who changes from an obligation to another obligation, and from an exemption to an exemption, and from an exemption to an obligation - is exempt. From an obligation to an exemption - is liable. This is the principle: Anyone who swears to lighten his own burden - is liable. To increase his own burden - is exempt.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאן תְּנָא אַרְבָּעָה שׁוֹמְרִין? אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב נַחְמָן: מִי אִיכָּא תַּנָּא דְּלֵית לֵיהּ אַרְבָּעָה שׁוֹמְרִין?! אֲמַר לֵיהּ, הָכִי קָאָמֵינָא לָךְ: מַאן תַּנָּא דְּאָמַר שׂוֹכֵר כְּנוֹשֵׂא שָׂכָר דָּמֵי? אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא.
human_translation: Who is taught four bailees? Rav Naḥman said Rabba bar Avuh said: It is Rabbi Meir. Rava said to Rav Naḥman: is there a tanna who does not accept four bailees, said to him: This I am saying to you: Who is the tanna who says a renter has the same as a paid bailee? Rav Naḥman said Rabba bar Avuh said: It is Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Who is the Tanna that says four are guardians? Rav Nachman said, Rabba bar Avuh said: It is Rabbi Meir. Rava said to Rav Nachman: Is there a Tanna who does not hold four are guardians?! He said to him, this is what I am saying to you: Who is the Tanna that says a renter is like a hirer of wages? Rav Nachman said, Rabba bar Avuh said: It is Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: וְהָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר אִיפְּכָא שָׁמְעִינַן לֵיהּ – דִּתְנַן: שׂוֹכֵר כֵּיצַד מְשַׁלֵּם? רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: כְּשׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כְּנוֹשֵׂא שָׂכָר! רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ אִיפְּכָא תָּנֵי.
human_translation: But we heard Rabbi Meir said the opposite, as it is taught How does a renter pay? Rabbi Meir says: like an unpaid bailee. Rabbi Yehuda says: like a paid bailee. Rabba bar Avuh taught reversing
llm_translation: The text reads: "And this, Rabbi Meir, the opposite we heard from him - for it was taught: 'One who rents, how does he pay?' Rabbi Meir says: 'Like one who watches for free,' Rabbi Yehuda says: 'Like one who carries a wage!' Rabba bar Avuh, the opposite, teaches."

hebrew_text: הָנֵי אַרְבָּעָה הָווּ?! שְׁלֹשָׁה הָווּ! אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: אַרְבָּעָה שׁוֹמְרִין, וְדִינֵיהֶן שְׁלֹשָׁה.
human_translation: Are these four There are three, Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: four bailees but three halakhot them.
llm_translation: These are four? They are three! Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: There are four guardians, yet their laws are three.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְשׁוֹמֵר חִנָּם כּוּ׳, ״הֵיכָן שׁוֹרִי״ כּוּ׳, אָמַר לְאֶחָד בַּשּׁוּק כּוּ׳, אָמַר לְשׁוֹמֵר כּוּ׳, ״הֵיכָן שׁוֹרִי?״ אָמַר לוֹ: ״אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ מָה אַתָּה סָח״ כּוּ׳. אָמַר רַב: וְכוּלָּן פְּטוּרִין מִשְּׁבוּעַת שׁוֹמְרִין, וְחַיָּיבִין מִשּׁוּם שְׁבוּעַת בִּיטּוּי. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אַף פְּטוּרִין מִשּׁוּם שְׁבוּעַת בִּיטּוּי.
human_translation: said to an unpaid bailee: Where is my ox; said to someone in the marketplace: he said to a bailee: Where is my ox, said to him: I do not know what you are talking about. Rav says: All of them are exempt from an oath of bailees, but they are liable for an oath on an utterance. And Shmuel says: They are exempt for an oath on an utterance as well.
llm_translation: He said to the free watchman, "Where is my ox?" He said to one in the market, "Where is my ox?" He said to the watchman, "Where is my ox?" He said to him, "I do not know what you are talking about." Rav said: All of them are exempt from the oath of watchmen, and liable for the oath of inquiry. And Samuel said: They are also exempt from the oath of inquiry.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָמִפַּלְגִי? שְׁמוּאֵל סָבַר: לֵיתַהּ בִּלְהַבָּא. וְרַב סָבַר: אִיתֵיהּ בְּלָאו וָהֵן.
human_translation: With regard to what do they disagree? Shmuel holds there is no with regard to the future, And Rav holds there is a negative and a positive
llm_translation: In what do they differ? Samuel holds: it is not with a flame. And Rav holds: it is with a flame and they.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אִיפְּלִיגוּ בַהּ חֲדָא זִימְנָא – דְּאִתְּמַר: ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁזָּרַק פְּלוֹנִי צְרוֹר לַיָּם״, ״שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁלֹּא זָרַק״ – רַב אָמַר: חַיָּיב, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: פָּטוּר. רַב אָמַר חַיָּיב – דְּאִיתַהּ בְּלָאו וְהֵן, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר פָּטוּר – דְּלֵיתַהּ בִּלְהַבָּא!
human_translation: But they disputed this another occasion as it was stated: oath so-and-so threw a stone into the sea, or: oath he did not throw Rav says: liable And Shmuel says: exempt. Rav says liable, as can be positive or negative. And Shmuel says exempt because cannot be with regard to the future,
llm_translation: And this, they argued about it one time - as it was stated: "A week that so-and-so threw a bundle into the sea," "a week that he did not throw" - Rav said: liable, and Shmuel said: exempt. Rav said liable - because it involves a prohibition and benefit, and Shmuel said exempt - because it does not involve a direct action!

hebrew_text: צְרִיכָא; דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן בְּהָא – בְּהָא קָאָמַר רַב, מִשּׁוּם דְּמִנַּפְשֵׁיהּ קָמִישְׁתְּבַע; אֲבָל בְּהָךְ, דְּבֵי דִינָא מַשְׁבְּעִי לֵיהּ – אֵימָא מוֹדֵי לֵיהּ לִשְׁמוּאֵל, כִּדְרַבִּי אַמֵּי; דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי: כׇּל שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁהַדַּיָּינִים מַשְׁבִּיעִין אוֹתָהּ – אֵין חַיָּיבִין עָלֶיהָ מִשּׁוּם שְׁבוּעַת בִּיטּוּי.
human_translation: It was necessary as if they would teach to us in in this Rav says since he is taking oath of his own accord, but in where the court is administering to him, say concedes to Shmuel in accordance with of Rabbi Ami. As Rabbi Ami says: any oath that administered by the judges, one is not liable for an oath on an utterance.
llm_translation: The matter is necessary; for if we were to hear in this case - in this case Rav is saying, because he is satisfied with himself; but in that case, where the court administers an oath to him - say that Shmuel agrees with him, as Rabbi Ammi said; for Rabbi Ammi said: Any oath that the judges administer and he swears to it - he is not liable for a false oath.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אִיתְּמַר בְּהָא – בְּהָא קָאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל, אֲבָל בְּהָךְ אֵימָא מוֹדֶה לֵיהּ לְרַב; צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And if had been stated in this in this Shmuel says but in say concedes to Rav necessary
llm_translation: "And if it was stated in this one - in this one, Shmuel is saying, but in that one, why not say that Rav agrees with him; it is necessary."

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא – אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי: כׇּל שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁהַדַּיָּינִין מַשְׁבִּיעִין אוֹתָהּ, אֵין בָּהּ מִשּׁוּם שְׁבוּעַת בִּיטּוּי; שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אוֹ נֶפֶשׁ כִּי תִשָּׁבַע לְבַטֵּא בִשְׂפָתַיִם״ – מֵעַצְמוֹ. כִּדְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ – דְּאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: ״כִּי״ מִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בְּאַרְבַּע לְשׁוֹנוֹת: אִי, דִּלְמָא, אֶלָּא, דְּהָא.
human_translation: the itself: Rabbi Ami says: any oath that administered by the judges, not for an oath on an utterance, as it is stated “Or if [ ki ] anyone swears clearly with his lips of his own in accordance with Reish Lakish. As Reish Lakish says: ki has four meanings: If, perhaps, rather, as.
llm_translation: Body - Rabbi Ammi said: Every week that the judges administer an oath, it does not have the status of an oath of clarification; as it is stated: "Or a soul when it swears with its lips" - from itself. As Reish Lakish expounded: "Ki" is used in four languages: if, perhaps, but, because.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: כּוּלָּן פְּטוּרִין מִשְּׁבוּעַת שׁוֹמְרִין וְחַיָּיבִין מִשּׁוּם שְׁבוּעַת בִּיטּוּי; חוּץ מֵ״אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ מָה אַתָּה סָח״ דְּשׁוֹאֵל, וּגְנֵיבָה וַאֲבֵידָה דְּנוֹשֵׂא שָׂכָר וְשֶׁבְּשׂוֹכֵר – שֶׁהוּא חַיָּיב, שֶׁהֲרֵי כְּפָרוֹ מָמוֹן.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: All of them, are exempt for taking an oath of bailees, but they are liable for an oath on an utterance, except for a borrower I do not know what you are talking about, and a paid bailee or a renter stolen or lost. liable as he denied a monetary
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: All are exempt from the oath of a watchman and liable due to the oath of a depositor; except for "I do not know what you are talking about," and theft and loss that the one who carries receives payment, and the one who rents - he is liable, for he has denied money.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ אַרְבָּעָה שׁוֹמְרִין, וּסְלִיקָא לַהּ מַסֶּכֶת שְׁבוּעוֹת
llm_translation: We will return to you with four guardians, and go up to her the tractate of Shevuot.
